Veter podiral drevesa

V noči na nedeljo je težave povzročal predvsem močan veter, ki je ponekod podiral drevesa. Regijski centri Uprave RS za zaščito in reševanje so našteli 26 dogodkov, največ na območju Celja, Kranja, Maribora, Murske Sobote in Slovenj Gradca.

Močan veter je podiral drevesa na cestišča, v treh primerih pa so padla na stanovanjska objekta in hlev. Posredovalo je 21 gasilskih enot ter druge službe, ki so podrta drevesa odstranjevale in občanom nudile pomoč pri zaščiti poškodovanega ostrešja, so navedli.

O vetrolomu so poročali na območjih občin Dobrna, Gornji Grad, Laško, Luče, Mozirje, Solčava in Velenje ter na območju Podgorja. Zgodil se je tudi na regionalni cesti v Podklancu ter na regionalni cesti na Tolstem Vrhu.



Sirena za splošno nevarnost v Topolšici

Na območju Topolšice so dopoldne sprožili sireno za splošno nevarnost. PGD Topolšica je na družbenem omrežju na strani Krajevne skupnosti Topolšica sporočil, da močan veter podira drevje in lahko odkriva strehe. Veter je podrl več dreves na cesti proti Slemenu in Banku, zato so v PGD Topolšica krajane pozvali, naj raje ostanejo doma. 

Vremenska napoved

Po podatkih agencije za okolje bo do večera pod Karavankami, Kamniško-savinjskimi Alpami in na severovzhodu države pihal okrepljen veter severnih smeri, ki bo v sunkih presegal hitrost 70 kilometrov na uro. Za severozahod in severovzhod države danes velja oranžno opozorilo. Zvečer in ponoči bo veter postopno oslabel.

The wind knocked down trees

On Sunday night, the problem was mainly caused by strong winds, which sometimes knocked down trees. The Regional Protection and Rescue Centres of the RS Administration have recorded 26 events, the most in the area of Celja, Kranja, Maribor, Murska Sobota and Sloveni Gradca.

Strong winds knocked down trees on the roads, and in three cases, they fell on residential buildings and slums. It was facilitated by 21 fire departments and other services that removed the fallen trees and offered help to the citizens to protect the damaged bark, they said.

Wind power was reported in the municipalities of Dobrna, Gornji Grad, Lasko, Luce, Mozirje, Solčava and Velenje and in the Podgorje area. It also happened on the regional road in Podklánc and on the regional road on Tolst vrh.



Siren for general danger in Topolšice

A general emergency siren was sounded in the area of Topolšice this morning. PGD Topolšica reported on a social network on the part of the Topolšica Local Government Area that a strong wind is knocking down trees and can detect roofs. Winds have knocked down several trees on the road to Slemens and Bank, so the PGD in Topolšice has asked the residents to stay home.

Weather forecast

According to the Environmental Protection Agency, the northern winds will blow more than 70 kilometers per hour in the sun, in the evening, beneath the Caravans, the Stony Alps and the northeast. The northwest and northeast of the country are now under an orange warning. In the evening and at night, the wind will gradually weaken.

2024-09-15.content:
Pirc Musar: "Imeti svojo državo ni samoumevno"

Dan vrnitve Primorske matični domovini

Praznik vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini simbolizira zmago slovenskega naroda nad tujim zatiranjem, je v poslanici zapisala predsednica republike Nataša Pirc Musar. Osrednja slovesnost bo zvečer v Vipavi.

V spomin na današnji dan pred 77 leti, ko je začela veljati pariška mirovna pogodba, po kateri so Zgornje Posočje, Vipavska dolina, večji del Krasa in manjši del Istre postali del Slovenije, danes praznujemo obletnico vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini. Osrednja slovesnost bo zvečer v Vipavi, kjer bo zbrane nagovoril predsednik vlade Robert Golob. Na prireditvi v Vipavi bo tudi predsednica republike Nataša Pirc Musar.

"Slovenija in zlasti Primorska danes praznujeta," je v poslanici ob prazniku zapisala predsednica. "Primorci niso in ne bodo pozabili, kaj pomeni ostati zunaj domovine proti svoji volji. Občutili so neizprosno roko tujca, ki je želel nasilno izbrisati njihov narodni pečat," je poudarila.

Po prvi svetovni vojni so ljudje s tega območja po njenih besedah skoraj 25 let doživljali hudo italijanizacijo. Italijanski fašistični režim je ukinil vse slovenske organizacije, ustanove, zveze in združenja, ki so delovali na kulturnem, političnem, prosvetnem, šolskem, gospodarskem, športnem, socialnem in verskem področju, prisilno jim je spremenil slovenska imena, je spomnila.

Slovenci, ki so bili takrat italijanski državljani, so se začeli upirati režimu, pripadniki tajnih organizacij Borba in TIGR pa so bili med prvimi antifašisti v Evropi. "Dajali so zgled in pogum odločnim primorskim upornikom tudi med drugo svetovno vojno, saj so se z vsemi močmi vključili v narodnoosvobodilni boj z jasnim ciljem osvoboditi Primorsko in jo priključiti k matični domovini," je nadaljevala Pirc Musar.

Po kapitulaciji Italije leta 1943 so partizanske sile osvobodile nekatera območja, a končna rešitev statusa Primorske je prišla šele po vojni. 15. septembra 1947 je bila s Pariško mirovno pogodbo določena nova meja, ki je večino Primorske vrnila Jugoslaviji in s tem tudi Sloveniji, a vsa slovenska ozemlja vendarle niso bila priključena Sloveniji in je del Slovencev ostal v Italiji, je povzela takratno dogajanje.

"Naj bo današnji dan spomin na vse pogumne ljudi, ki so se borili za slovensko ozemlje, in hkrati opomnik vsem nam, da imeti državo ni samoumevno, temveč zapuščina, s katero moramo ravnati z vso skrbnostjo," je sklenila predsednica.

Praznik še zadnjič zaznamujemo pod tem imenom

Predsednica DZ-ja Urška Klakočar Zupančič je v poslanici ob dnevu vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini poudarila, da je lahko danes slovenska Primorska vzor celotni skupnosti evropskih držav, kako skrbeti za sožitje ljudi na narodnostno mešanih območjih. S tem Slovenija kaže pravo pot reševanja odprtih vprašanj na nemirnih mejnih področjih, meni.

Poudarila je, da so prvi zapisi o prihodu Slovanov na to ozemlje stari že več kot 1300 let. Zgodovinsko je bilo to območje pogosto nemirno, saj je bilo torišče različnih interesov številnih držav. To še posebej velja za 20. stoletje, v katerem so bili Slovenci deležni velikih pritiskov, še posebej po tem, ko so v Italiji prevzeli oblast fašisti. A upornega duha Primorcev pritiski niso zlomili, je prepričana Klakočar Zupančič.

"Prav v teh dneh se je državni zbor odločil preimenovati današnji praznik tako, da je upošteval besede, ki jih za ta zgodovinski trenutek uporabljajo domačini," je še zapisala. Po izglasovani spremembi zakona o praznikih in dela prostih dnevih bo tako 15. september od zdaj praznik priključitve, in ne več vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini.

Leta 2005 je Slovenija razglasila 15. september, dan uveljavitve pariške mirovne pogodbe, za praznik vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini. Ta ni dela prost dan, državno proslavo v počastitev prazniku pa organizirajo vsakih pet let.

Kot kaže, bomo praznik pod tem imenom letos zaznamovali zadnjič, saj je državni zbor prav ta teden na predlog skupine primorskih koalicijskih poslancev izglasoval spremembo zakona o praznikih in dela prostih dnevih, po kateri bo 15. september od zdaj praznik priključitve, in ne več vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini.

Spomin na poitalijančevanje in upor

Sicer pa slovesnosti ob prazniku ta konec tedna potekajo tudi po drugih primorskih krajih, ena takih je bila v soboto v izolskem parku Pietro Coppo, ki so jo skupaj pripravili Združenje borcev za vrednote NOB-ja Izola, Občina Izola in Center za kulturo, šport in prireditve Izola.

Zbrane je med drugim nagovorila zgodovinarka Vlasta Beltram.Fašistični režim je več kot 20 let izvajal nasilno poitalijančevanje Slovencev in Hrvatov. To je med drugo svetovno vojno spodbudilo množičen upor prebivalstva, ki se je nadaljeval po kapitulaciji Italije in nemški okupaciji od septembra 1943 do maja 1945.

Po vojni se je morala poraženka Italija v skladu z mirovnim sporazumom z zavezniškimi silami, zmagovalkami v drugi svetovni vojni, odpovedati nekaterim ozemljem. Šlo je za ozemlja, ki jih je zasedla po razpadu Avstro-Ogrske ob koncu prve svetovne vojne in si jih zatem priključila na podlagi Rapalske pogodbe, ki jo je sklenila s Kraljevino Srbov, Hrvatov in Slovencev.

Dokončno je bila meja med Italijo in Jugoslavijo potrjena z osimskimi sporazumi, podpisanimi 10. novembra 1975 v italijanskem mestu Osimo, samostojna Slovenija pa je nato leta 1992 prevzela pravno nasledstvo podpisnice sporazuma.

Po ocenah zgodovinarjev je na koncu zunaj matične države ostalo približno 140.000 Slovencev. Z ozemlja, ki je pripadlo Jugoslaviji, se je v Italijo izselilo od 200.000 do 300.000 ljudi, od tega 27.000 iz Slovenije, je leta 2000 ocenila mešana slovensko-italijanska komisija zgodovinarjev.

Pirc Musar: "It's not self-evident to have your own country".

Date of return to the Primorican homeland

The celebration of Primorsk's return to her homeland symbolizes the victory of the Slovenian people over foreign oppression, wrote the President of the Republic Nataša Pirc Musar in her parliamentary letter. The ceremony will be held in Vipava tonight.

In memory of today, 77 years ago, when the Paris Peace Treaty came into force, making Upper Posoce, the Vipava Valley, most of Krasa and a smaller part of Istria part of Slovenia, we celebrate today the anniversary of Primorsk's return to her homeland. The ceremony will be held in Vipava tonight, where the Prime Minister Robert Golob will address the gathering. The event in Vipava will also be attended by the President of the Republic, Natasha Pirc Musar.

"Slovenia, and Primorsk in particular, is celebrating today", the President wrote in the holiday letter. "The deceased have not and will not forget what it means to stay outside their homeland against their will. They felt the unwilling hand of a foreigner who wanted to violently erase their national seal", she said.

After World War I, she said, the people of this area experienced a severe Italianisation for nearly 25 years. The Italian fascist regime abolished all Slovenian organizations, institutions, associations and associations operating in the cultural, political, educational, educational, economic, sports, social and religious fields, forcing them to change their Slovenian names, she recalled.

The Slovenians, who were then Italian citizens, began to resist the regime, and the members of the secret organizations Borba and TIGR were among the first anti-fascists in Europe. "They gave an example and courage to the decisive rebel forces in the Primoor during World War II, as they joined the national liberation struggle with all their might with the clear goal of liberating Primoor and linking it to the motherland", continued Pirc Musar.

After the capitulation of Italy in 1943, partisan forces liberated some areas, but the final resolution of Primorsky status did not come until after the war. On 15 September 1947, the Paris Peace Treaty established a new border which returned most of Primorsk to Yugoslavia and thus Slovenia, but not all Slovenian territories were annexed to Slovenia and part of the Slovenes remained in Italy.

"May this day be a day of remembrance for all the brave people who fought for Slovenian territory, and at the same time a reminder to all of us that having a country is not a matter of course, but a legacy that we must treat with all care", the president concluded.

This is the last time we celebrate this holiday under this name.

In a speech on the day Primorska returned to her homeland, the President of the Slovene Primorsk Region, Urška Klakočar Zupančić, stressed that today the Slovene Primorsk model can be used by the entire community of European countries to ensure that people in ethnically mixed areas live together. Slovenia is thus showing the right way to resolve the open issues in the troubled border areas, I believe.

She said that the first records of the arrival of the Slavs in this territory date back over 1,300 years. Historically, this area has often been unstable, as it has been a hub of various interests in many countries. This is especially true of the 20th century, when Slovenes were under great pressure, especially after the Fascists took power in Italy. But the spirit of the Rebel Force was not broken by pressure, the Sniper is sure.

"Just these days, the National Assembly decided to rename today's holiday in keeping with the words used by the locals for this historic moment", it wrote. The amendment to the holiday and work day law will be passed on 15 September, which will be the anniversary of the accession of Primorsk and not her return to her homeland.

In 2005, Slovenia declared 15 September, the date of entry into force of the Paris Peace Treaty, as the anniversary of the return of Primorsk to her motherland. This is not a day off work, and they hold a national holiday every five years.

As it turns out, this is the last time we will celebrate a holiday under this name this year, as the National Assembly, on the proposal of a group of Coalition Members of Parliament, voted this week to amend the holiday and work law, which will now be the date of accession on 15 September, and no longer the return of Primorsky to his homeland.

Remembrance of the Italian uprising and rebellion

The celebrations of the holiday this weekend are also held in other coastal areas, such as the Pietro Coppo Island Park on Saturday, jointly organized by the Association of Fighters for the Values of the NOB of Izola, the Municipality of Izola and the Centre for Culture, Sports and Events of Izola.

The collection was persuaded, among other things, by historian Vlasta Beltram. For more than 20 years, the fascist regime has been violently unifying the Slovenes and Croats. This sparked a mass uprising of the population during World War II, which continued after the surrender of Italy and the German occupation from September 1943 to May 1945.

After the war, Italy's defeat was forced to abandon certain territories, under a peace treaty with the Allied victorious World War II powers. It was the territory it occupied after the dissolution of Austria-Hungary at the end of World War I and then annexed by it under the Treaty of Raphael with the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes.

Finally, the border between Italy and Yugoslavia was confirmed by the Omis agreements signed on 10 November 1975 in the Italian city of Osimo, and the independent Slovenia then took over as signatory in 1992.

According to historians, about 140,000 Slovenes eventually left their homeland. Between 200,000 and 300,000 people emigrated to Italy from the territory that was part of Yugoslavia, including 27,000 from Slovenia, according to a 2000 assessment by the joint Slovenian-Italian Commission of Historians.

Pred zgodovinsko sejo Feda cene zlata rekordno visoko

Nvidia spet dobila zalet, saj je povpraševanje po njenih čipih nenormalno visoko

Potem ko je bil vstop v september zelo slab, se je na delniške trge presenetljivo hitro spet vrnil optimizem, nadaljuje pa se tudi rast cen zlata, ki so v zadnjih 12 mesecih poskočile za izjemnih 35 odstotkov. V naslednjem tednu bodo oči uprte v Fed.

Vrednost delniškega indeksa S & P 500 je zadnji teden poskočila za štiri odstotke, tako da je kljub nekaterim turbulencam, ki so trg zajele v zadnjem mesecu in pol, le še za en odstotek oddaljen od julijske rekordne vrednosti. "Na borzah smo zadnji teden spet spremljali stabilno rast, predvsem zaradi močnega povpraševanja po tehnoloških delnicah. Nasprotno se soočamo s težavami v proizvodnem sektorju, kot kaže stavka pri Boeingu, ki moti proizvodnjo in lahko povzroči širše motnje v dobavnih verigah. Poleg tega so velika podjetja, kot je Adobe, kljub dobrim rezultatom previdna glede prihodnjih napovedi, kar nakazuje, da podjetja tudi v tehnološkem sektorju ne želijo preveč tvegati," nam je povedal Mihajlo Todurov iz družbe SmartMoney Solutions.

25 ali 50, to je zdaj vprašanjeSredi naslednjega tedna se bo sestala ameriška centralna banka, ki bo po štirih letih začela nov cikel rahljanja monetarne politike. Razlika med donosnostjo dveletne vladne obveznice (3,65 %) in obrestno mero Fed funds (5,25–5,50 %) je precejšnja, zato se nekateri bojijo, da Fed zamuja za pričakovanji trga. "Fed se pripravlja na znižanje obrestnih mer, kjer so pričakovanja usmerjena v 25 bazičnih točk, čeprav nekateri namigujejo na možnost večjega, 50-točkovnega znižanja. To bo olajšalo finančne pogoje za podjetja, vendar bi lahko hkrati sprožilo dvome o resnosti gospodarskih izzivov. Inflacija sicer kaže znake ohlajanja, vendar so zadnji podatki o delovnih mestih in plačah mešani. Pomembno je, da podjetja, zlasti tista v fazi rasti ali širjenja, izkoristijo nižje stroške zadolževanja, a se hkrati pripravijo na morebitne prihodnje turbulence."

V sredo od krepkega minusa do lepega plusaCene življenjskih potrebščin, merjene z indeksom CPI, so se v ZDA avgusta na letni ravni zvišale za 2,5 odstotka (najmanj po februarju 2021), na mesečni ravni pa je bila inflacija 0,2-odstotna. Brez presenečenj, je pa zato rahlo razočaral jedrni indeks CPI (ta ne upošteva cen hrane in energentov), ki je bil s 3,6-odstotno rastjo na letni ravni malce višji od pričakovanj. Indeks S & P je v sredo med trgovanjem zdrsnil za 1,5 odstotka, toda še isti dan občutno obrnil navzgor in pridobil odstotek. Razveseljivo je, da so se v ZDA znižala tudi inflacijska pričakovanja, kar je v petek pokazala raziskava univerze v Michiganu. Američani zdaj v naslednjem letu pričakujejo 2,7-odstotno inflacijo, kar je najmanj po decembru 2020.

Pričakovana poteza ECB-ja: obresti nižje za dodatnih 25 bazičnih točkV četrtek je Evropska centralna banka ključne obrestne mere pričakovano drugič zapored znižala za četrtino odstotne točke. Depozitna obrestna mera je zdaj 3,5-odstotna. "Ta poteza je del prizadevanj za obvladovanje inflacijskih pritiskov v evrskem območju, kjer so cene počasi začele popuščati. Kljub temu so pri ECB-ju previdni glede prihodnje politike, saj niso jasno nakazali smeri za naslednje obdobje, kar ohranja vlagatelje v negotovosti. Za podjetja in vlagatelje to pomeni lažji dostop do kapitala in cenejšega financiranja, vendar morajo ostati pozorni na dolgotrajne učinke tovrstnih ukrepov. Nemško gospodarstvo že nekaj časa stagnira. Njihova odvisnost od izvoza, predvsem na Kitajsko, jih zdaj močno tepe, saj svetovna rast upada. Ker je Nemčija tudi pomemben trgovinski partner Slovenije, se težave čutijo tudi pri nas," dodaja Mihajlo Todurov.

Nvidia spet dobila zaletKot smo že omenili, so pretekli teden pridobivale predvsem tehnološke delnice. Tečaj Nvidie po kar precejšnjem popravku (cena delnice se je po objavi četrtletnih poslovnih rezultatov 28. avgusta znižala za več kot 20 odstotkov) spet leti navzgor (zadnji teden +16 %, 119,1 USD), spet se vse bolj zdi, da imajo visoka pričakovanja vendarle zdravo podlago, vsaj če sodimo po besedah prvega moža Nvidie Jensena Huanga, ki je na konferenci v San Franciscu poudaril, da je povpraševanje po njihovih čipih nenormalno visoko in da vsi partnerji, med katerimi so tehnološki velikani, kot sta Google in Meta, močno upajo, da jih Nvidia s svojimi nepogrešljivimi čipi za storitve umetne inteligence (predvsem novi čip Blackwell je izjemno zmogljiv) ne bo pustila na cedilu. Vsaj še nekaj četrtletij bodo proizvodne kapacitete TSMC-ja, ki proizvaja Nvidijine čipe, očitno popolnoma zasedene. Huang je zelo pohvalil to tajvansko podjetja in ga označil za daleč najboljše na svetu.

Zlato rekordno visokoNadaljuje se tiha rast cen zlata. Za 31,1-gramsko unčo je bilo treba v petek plačati že 2.582 dolarjev, kar je nov rekord. Optimistična pričakovanja segajo do cene 3.000 dolarjev. Razmere so namreč ugodne: velike centralne banke večinoma znižujejo obrestne mere (Fed naj bi ključno obrestno mero do konca leta znižal za okrog 100 bazičnih točk), dolar drsi navzdol (v primerjavi z jenom je najnižje letos), nenehne geopolitične napetosti ne usahnejo, prav tako ne prilivi v ETF-sklade, ki vlagajo v fizično zlato (avgusta četrti zaporedni mesec neto prilivov). S tehničnega vidika je sicer pričakovati popravek navzdol, saj je indeks relativne moči (RSI) trenutno pri 69 in s tem le korak od prenakupljenega območja (70). Močno se je popravilo tudi razpoloženje na kriptotržišču. Bitcoin je bil v soboto spet pri 60 tisoč dolarjih, pri čemer je bilo v zadnjih dneh opaziti nakupe večjih imetnikov bitcoinov, tako imenovanih kitov.

25 or 50, that's the question now. The U.S. Central Bank will meet next week's midday to begin a new four-year cycle of monetary policy. On Wednesday, from a strong downside to a nice plus, the US CPI-measured cost of living increased by 2.5% annually in August (at least since February 2021), and monthly inflation was 0.2%. ECB's expected move: lower interest rates by an additional 25 basis pointsThe European Central Bank lowered the expected key interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Thursday for the second consecutive year. Nekdanji lastnik iz Avstrije od podjetja BIA Separations zahteva 82 milijonov evrov odškodnine

Leta 2020 je podjetje za 360 milijonov evrov kupil nemški Sartorius

Ajdovsko biofarmacevtsko podjetje Sartorius BIA Separations toži nekdanji lastnik. Podjetje iz Avstrije s tožbo zahteva kar 82 milijonov evrov odškodnine. Kot pravijo, naj bi bili izigrani pri prodaji podjetja. V Ajdovščini obtožbe v celoti zavračajo.

Sodni postopek se za zdaj ni premaknil z mrtve točke, eden izmed treh narokov je bil celo odpovedan zaradi grožnje z bombo na sodišču. Eksplozivna naj bi bila tudi sama vsebina tožbe.

"Z našega vidika je tožba popolnoma neutemeljena," pravi Jana Krapež, sodirektorica podjetja Sartorius BIA Separations.

Nekdanji lastnik naj bi se vseskozi poskušal zgolj polastiti intelektualne lastnine podjetja BIA Separations, s svojimi mahinacijami naj bi ga namreč potisnil na rob stečaja, je za TV Slovenija že leta 2019 ocenjeval soustanovitelj ajdovskega podjetja Matej Penca: "Težava je ta, da nam je bila avstrijska družba dolžna 3,5 milijona evrov, ki jih ne bomo nikoli dobili, zato smo morali prijaviti prisilno poravnavo tudi v Sloveniji."

Ker svojemu podjetju ni želel zagotoviti potrebnega dodatnega kapitala, je avstrijski lastnik v prisilni poravnavi izgubil lastniški delež. "Novi lastniki so pa tisti, ki so v prisilni poravnavi dokapitalizirali družbo," poudarja Penca.

Prestrukturirano podjetje se je nato hitro prebilo v svetovni vrh s patentiranimi izdelki in postopki, ki se uporabljajo tako rekoč po vsem svetu za čiščenje in analitiko naprednih bioloških zdravil.

Pred leti je BIA Separations sodelovala pri razvoju zdravila, ki je do prvih korakov pomagalo malemu Krisu. Pred dnevi pa je zlato priznanje Gospodarske zveze Slovenije za inovativnost prejela zdaj že Sartorius BIA Separations. Leta 2020 jo je namreč za kar 360 milijonov evrov kupil nemški Sartorius.

Nekdanji avstrijski lastnik zdaj zahteva skoraj tretjino te kupnine, 82 milijonov evrov. Vztraja namreč, da bi leta 2018 sodeloval pri dokapitalizaciji, če bi vedel, za koliko bo podjetje pozneje prodano.

V Ajdovščini to vidijo zgolj kot poučno prigodo na trnovi poti zdaj uspešnega podjetja.
2024-09-14.title: Nekdanji lastnik iz Avstrije od podjetja BIA Separations zahteva 82 milijonov evrov odškodnine

Former Austrian owner claims EUR 82 million in compensation from BIA Separations

In 2020, the company was bought by German Sartorius for €360 million.

The Ajd biopharmaceutical company Sartorius BIA Separations is suing the former owner. A company from Austria is suing for up to 82 million euros in damages. Like they say, they're supposed to be playing around with the sale of the company. In Ajdovščina, the charges are completely dismissed.

The trial has not moved from a dead end so far, one of the three prescriptions was even canceled over the bomb threat in court. The content of the lawsuit itself is also supposed to be explosive.

"The lawsuit is completely unfounded from our point of view", says Jana Krapež, co-director of Sartorius BIA Separations.

The former owner was alleged to have tried to merely take over the intellectual property of BIA Separations, and with his machinations he was supposed to have pushed it to the brink of bankruptcy, as early as 2019 the co-founder of the aid company, Matej Penca, told TV Slovenia: "The problem is that the Austrian company owed us EUR 3,5 million, which we will not receive, so we never had to report forced settlement in Slovenia".

The Austrian owner lost his ownership interest in the forced settlement because he did not wish to provide the necessary additional capital to his company. "The new owners are those who have recapitalized the company in forced settlement", emphasises Penca.

The restructured company then quickly broke into the world's top with patented products and processes, which are used, so to speak, worldwide for the purification and analysis of advanced biological drugs.

Years ago, BIA Separations was involved in the development of a drug that helped little Kris to his first steps. The Slovenian Economic Union has recently awarded Sartorius BIA Separations the gold award for innovation. In fact, in 2020, it was bought by German Sartorius for €360 million.

The former Austrian owner now claims almost a third of that purchase, 82 million euros. The Commission therefore concludes that the Commission is not in a position to take any further steps to ensure that the Commission is able to assess the compatibility of the measures.

In Ajdovščina, they see this as a mere educational opportunity on the thorny path of a now-successful business.
2024-09-14.english_title: Former Austrian owner claims EUR 82 million in compensation from BIA Separations

Po združitvi v banko OTP vse težave še niso odpravljene

V OTP-ju pojasnjujejo, da zadeve rešujejo individualno ali s ponovnim pošiljanjem dopolnjenih navodil

Skoraj dva tedna po združitvi in preimenovanju Nove kreditne banke Maribor in SKB-ja v banko OTP imajo komitenti SKB-ja še vedno težave z dostopom do svojih računov. Teh je skupno več kot 200 tisoč. Številna podjetja ne morejo do svojega denarja.

Večino težav za račune fizičnih oseb so pri banki OTP sicer odpravili, pri podjetjih pa je drugače. Težave z dostopom do spletne banke, zapletena navodila, nedosegljivi skrbniki, preobremenjene telefonske linije. To je le nekaj težav komitentov nekdanjega SKB-ja, ki že več dni ne morejo razpolagati s svojim denarjem. Ob tem podjetjem nastaja poslovna škoda. 

"Tisto, kar je grozno, je to, da je očitno ekipa nekdanjega SKB-ja slabo pripravljena oziroma niso ljudje inštruirani tako, da bi bila vsa stvar operativna. In posledica je, da vse skupaj zamuja, ves poslovni promet, vsaj kar se nas tiče. Najbrž nas je takšnih vsaj nekaj tisoč," je povedal podjetnik Andrej B. Pengov.

"Mi na neki način lahko preživimo tudi z zamudami. Hvala bogu naše terjatve oziroma terjatve naših dobaviteljev niso tako grozne, da bi bili zneski z zamudami in obrestmi zelo veliki. Drugi imajo verjetno s tem veliko večje težave," je dodal.

Iz OTP-ja, kjer pred kamero še vedno ne želijo, pa čisto druga zgodba. Pravijo, da je bila migracija strank nekdanje banke SKB uspešna in da so tistim redkim posameznikom, ki so imeli težave pri prehodu na nove digitalne rešitve, na voljo okrepljene ekipe v kontaktnih centrih in poslovalnicah.

Priznavajo, da se je v manjšem številu primerov res zapletlo, a da zadeve rešujejo individualno ali s ponovnim pošiljanjem dopolnjenih navodil. Koliko je teh primerov, nam ni uspelo izvedeti.

Kristjan Verbič iz Vseslovenskega združenja malih deležnikov opozarja: "Apeliramo, da je komunikacija pri tem kar se da odprta in natančna, da se zagotovi, v kakšnem času bodo zadeve rešene, in da se seveda tudi zelo jasno pove, da se bodo potrudili oziroma da bodo sanirali nastalo škodo iz naslova nemotenega poslovanja."

Jih bo k temu prisilil nadzornik, torej Banka Slovenije? Od tam so sporočili le, da potek združevanja spremljajo in po potrebi ukrepajo, a da morebitnih odprtih nadzorniških postopkov ne smejo komentirati.
2024-09-14.title: Po združitvi v banko OTP vse težave še niso odpravljene
2024-09-14.english_content:
The Bank of Greece has not yet resolved all the problems following the merger into OTP Bank.

The OTP explains that they resolve cases individually or by re-submitting supplementary instructions

Almost two weeks after the merger and renaming of Nova Kreditbank Maribor and SKB into OTP Bank, SKB committees are still having difficulties accessing their accounts. The total is over 200,000. Many companies can't afford their money.

Most of the problems with the accounts of natural persons have been resolved at OTP, but the situation is different with the companies. Problems with accessing the online bank, complicated instructions, inaccessible administrators, overwhelmed phone lines. These are just a few of the problems faced by the former CBI's committees who have been unable to dispose of their money for several days. This company is doing business damage.

"What's terrible is that the team of the former C.S.B. is obviously ill-equipped or uninstructed so that everything is operational. And the result is that it's all behind schedule, all the business traffic, at least as far as we're concerned. There must be at least a few thousand of us", said entrepreneur Andrei B. Pengov.

"We can somehow survive the delays. Thank God our claims or those of our suppliers are not so terrible that the amounts with delays and interest rates would be too high. Others are likely to have much greater problems with this", he added.

From the OTP, where they still don't want to be on camera, that's a whole different story. They say that the migration of former SKB customers has been successful and that the few individuals who have had difficulty switching to new digital solutions have reinforced teams at contact centres and branch offices.

They acknowledge that in a smaller number of cases, it is indeed complicated, but that they resolve matters individually or by re-submitting supplementary instructions. We haven't been able to find out how many of these cases are.

Christian Verbić of the Vseslovenska Small Shareholders Association warns: "We appeal that communication be as open and accurate as possible to ensure when matters will be resolved and that, of course, it is also very clear that efforts will be made to recover from the damage caused by the smooth running of the business".

Will the supervisor, the Bank of Slovenia, force them to do this? From there, they only reported that they were monitoring the process of merger and taking action as appropriate, but that they were not allowed to comment on any open supervisory procedures.
2024-09-14.english_title: The Bank of Greece has not yet resolved all the problems following the merger into OTP Bank.

Kaj prinašata zakon o pravici do pozabe in zakon o kakovosti v zdravstvu?

Ekonomsko-socialni svet je predloga podprl brez zadržkov

Na petkovi seji Ekonomsko-socialnega sveta sta dva zakonska predloga iz zdravstvenega resorja dobila zeleno luč socialnih partnerjev. Najbližje sprejemu sta zakona o upravljanju kakovosti v zdravstvu in o pravici bolnikov po prebolelem raku do pozabe.

Predloga zakona o kakovosti v zdravstvu in zakona o pravici bolnikov po prebolelem raku in določenih drugih boleznih do enakega dostopa do zavarovalnih in kreditnih produktov je ministrica za zdravje Valentina Prevolnik Rupel v petek predstavila Ekonomsko-socialnemu svetu. Dodala je, da strani delodajalcev in sindikatov predloge vsebinsko podpirata.

Minister za delo Luka Mesec je sicer na novinarski konferenci po seji dejal, da je bilo doseženo soglasje vseh treh strani glede zakonskega predloga o pravici bolnikov do pozabe, medtem ko se je glede zakona o kakovosti delodajalska stran vzdržala, vendar mu ni nasprotovala.

Zakon o pravici do pozabe ljudem po prebolelem raku, hepatitisu C in HIV-u, po desetih oziroma petih letih od ozdravitve omogoča enak dostop do zavarovalnih in kreditnih produktov kot vsem drugim. 

Kaj prinaša zakon o kakovosti v zdravstvu?

Predlog zakona o kakovosti določa pogoje za zagotovitev sistema kakovosti v zdravstvu z nenehnim izboljševanjem kakovosti in varnosti pacientov v Sloveniji, odgovornosti izvajalcev zdravstvene dejavnosti in drugih deležnikov v zdravstvu, pogoje za prostovoljno akreditacijo in certificiranje, naloge in pristojnosti Javne agencije RS za kakovost v zdravstvu, vrednotenje zdravstvenih tehnologij ter nadzor sistema kakovosti s ciljem doseganja najvišje stopnje varnosti pacientov in zmanjšanje tveganja za njihova življenja in zdravje, izhaja iz predloga.

Med nalogami države zakon med drugim določa pripravo nacionalne strategije kakovosti, zagotavljanje strukturnih, organizacijskih, kadrovskih in finančnih pogojev pri izvajalcih zdravstvene dejavnosti ter zagotavljanje finančnih virov.

Izvajalci zdravstvene dejavnosti pa med drugim spremljajo kazalnike kakovosti in izide zdravljenja in o njih poročajo, izvajajo (tudi psihološko) podporo pacientom ali ožjim družinskim članom, ki so doživeli škodljiv dogodek, in drugim vpletenim, pa tudi merijo uspešnosti zdravstvenih delavcev in sodelavcev na področju kakovosti in varnosti ter določijo odgovornosti posameznikov, timov, oddelkov, posameznih dejavnosti in na ravni celotnega izvajalca zdravstvene dejavnosti. Pacienti bodo imeli pravico dostopa do javno objavljenih podatkov o uspešnosti, kakovosti in varnosti za posamezne izvajalce zdravstvenih dejavnosti in storitev.

V javni razpravi je bil deležen kar precejšnjih sprememb. "Predvsem smo zakon nekoliko poenostavili, poenotili definicije in dodelali postopke, tako da so zdaj stvari jasnejše," je povedala. Poenostavili so tudi strukturo poročanja o varnostnih incidentih pri izvajalcih, in sicer bo to manj obsežno, kot so načrtovali sprva.

Upravni in sistemski nadzor pa je prenesen na agencijo za kakovost v zdravstvu. Agencija bo izvajalcem pomagala pri pripravi metodologije, obdelovala podatke in jih primerjala ter izvajala nadzor nad sistemom kakovosti. "Na agencijo smo prenesli upravne in sistemske nadzore, redne strokovne nadzore smo pustili na zbornicah, izrednih strokovnih nadzorov pa ni več predvidenih, ker menimo, da je ob varnostnem incidentu, pri katerem se odločimo za nadzor, treba izvesti sistemski nadzor," je dejala Prevolnik Rupel.

"Razlika je v tem, da se je dosedanji izredni strokovni nadzor lahko osredotočil samo na enega zaposlenega, medtem ko vemo, da do incidentov prihaja zaradi napak v procesu ali pa v celotnem sistemu, kar pa lahko preverja samo sistemski nadzor," je še pojasnila ministrica.
2024-09-14.title: Kaj prinašata zakon o pravici do pozabe in zakon o kakovosti v zdravstvu?
2024-09-14.english_content:
What do the Right to Forget and Health Care Quality Act bring?

The Economic and Social Council supported the proposal without reservation

At the Economic and Social Council meeting on Friday, two healthcare legislation proposals received the green light from social partners. The closest to adoption are the Health Care Quality Management and Patient Rights Act after a cancer diagnosis.

The proposal for a law on quality of health and the law on the right of patients with cancer and certain other diseases to equal access to insurance and credit products was presented to the Economic and Social Council on Friday by Minister of Health Valentina Prevolnik Rupel. It added that the employers and trade unions were substantially supportive of the proposals.

Minister of Labour Luka Mesec told a press conference after the meeting that a consensus had been reached on the legislative proposal on the right of patients to be forgotten, while the employer party abstained but did not oppose it on the law on quality.

The Right to Forget Act allows people with terminal cancer, hepatitis C and HIV to have the same access to insurance and credit products as everyone else, ten years after their recovery and five years after their recovery.

What does the law on quality in health bring?

The quality bill provides for the conditions for ensuring the quality system in healthcare by continuously improving the quality and safety of patients in Slovenia, the responsibilities of healthcare providers and other healthcare stakeholders, the conditions for voluntary accreditation and certification, the tasks and competencies of the RS Public Health Agency, the evaluation of health technologies and the control of the quality system with a view to achieving the highest level of patient safety and reducing the risk to their lives and health.

The law provides, among other tasks, for the preparation of a national quality strategy, the provision of structural, organisational, human and financial conditions for healthcare providers and the provision of financial resources.

Healthcare practitioners shall monitor and report on quality indicators and outcomes of treatment, provide (including psychological) support to patients or close family members who have experienced a harmful event and others involved, and measure the performance of healthcare professionals and co-workers in the field of quality and safety, and determine the responsibilities of individuals, teams, departments, individual activities and at the level of the healthcare practitioner as a whole. Patients will have the right to access publicly published data on performance, quality and safety for individual healthcare providers and service providers.

The public debate has seen quite a few changes. "First of all, we have simplified the law a little bit, simplified the definitions and refined the procedures, so things are clearer now", she said. The structure of reporting on security incidents for operators has also been simplified, which will be less extensive than originally planned.

The administrative and systemic controls are transferred to the Agency for Healthcare Quality. The Agency will assist operators in developing the methodology, processing and comparing data and carrying out quality system controls. "We have transferred administrative and systemic controls to the Agency, we have left regular professional controls in the chambers and no more specialised controls are planned, because we believe that in the event of a security incident where we decide to control, systemic controls should be carried out", said Rev. Rupel.

"The difference is that until now, the specialised supervision has been able to focus only on one employee, while we know that incidents occur because of errors in the process or in the whole system, which can only be verified by systemic supervision", the minister explained.
2024-09-14.english_title: What do the Right to Forget and Health Care Quality Act bring?

Zaradi vetra oranžno opozorilo za sever države. Na Štajerskem in v Prekmurju bo najmočnejši ponoči.

Odsvetujeta se obisk gora in spravilo lesa

Arso je zaradi močnega vetra izdal oranžno opozorilo za sever države, ki velja do nedelje do 12. ure. Na Kredarici so ponoči sunki vetra dosegli do 140, na Ratitovcu, Uršlji gori in Krvavcu pa do 100 kilometrov na uro.

Kot so napovedali na Agenciji RS za okolje (Arso), je pod Karavankami in Kamniško-Savinjskimi Alpami okrepljen severni veter, ki je začel pihati že ponoči, pričakovati do nedelje popoldne, ko lahko občasno v sunkih dosega hitrost od 70 do 85 kilometrov na uro. Od danes popoldne do nedelje popoldne lahko takšno hitrost dosežejo tudi sunki severnega vetra na Štajerskem in v Prekmurju. Za ta območja tako velja oranžno opozorilo Arsa.

"Ker so drevesa še vedno olistana, so možni vetrolomi. Večja nevarnost bo zlasti v nekoliko višjih legah. V gorah bodo najmočnejši sunki lahko krepko presegli 100 km/h, zato obisk gora ali spravilo lesa ob koncu tedna odsvetujemo," so v petek sporočili z Arsa.

In res so na Kredarici ponoči sunki vetra dosegli do 140 kilometrov na uro, na Ratitovcu, Uršlji gori in Krvavcu pa do 100 kilometrov na uro.  

V soboto so v Lescah izmerili sunke do 66, na Brniku pa do 65 kilometrov na uro. Na Štajerskem in v Prekmurju se je veter začel krepiti šele v drugi polovici popoldneva, trenutno sunki dosegajo okoli 50 kilometrov na uro. Tam bo veter najmočnejši ponoči.

Kot je za STA povedal vremenoslovec Urban Žagar z Arsa, so sunki vetra na Kredarici čez dan še vedno dosegli do okoli 110, 120 kilometrov na uro. Popoldne je veter v višjih legah nekoliko oslabel.

Oranžni alarm za severozahod in severovzhod države zaradi vetra velja do nedelje do 12. ure, nato ga bo do konca dne zamenjalo rumeno vremensko opozorilo.

V osrednji Sloveniji in delu Dolenjske oziroma jugovzhodne Slovenije lahko sunki vetra občasno dosegajo hitrosti do okoli 50 kilometrov na uro. "Nekaj previdnosti, zlasti v nekoliko višjih legah, tudi tam ne bo odveč," je opozoril Žagar. Arso je sicer za osrednjo Slovenijo in jugovzhod izdal rumeno vremensko opozorilo.

Uprava RS za zaščito in reševanje je sporočila, da so zaradi močnega vetra na območjih Regijskih centrov Brežice, Celje, Kranj, Koper, Maribor, Murska Sobota, Nova Gorica in Slovenj Gradec opravili 11 intervencij.

Po njihovih navedbah je močan veter podiral drevesa na cestišče, na enem večstanovanjskem objektu je odkril streho. Posredovalo je devet gasilskih enot, sodelovale so tudi druge službe, ki so odstranjevale podrta drevesa in občanom nudile pomoč pri zaščiti poškodovanega ostrešja.

Vodnatost rek počasi upada

Vodnatost večine rek po državi po preteklem obilnem deževju počasi upada. Reka Krka se razliva vzdolž celotnega toka, vendar se njen pretok počasi že zmanjšuje. Obseg poplavljenih površin v spodnjem toku se bo danes še ohranjal, zvečer in v noči na nedeljo pa se bo začel zmanjševati.

Vodostaj Ljubljanice na Barju se znižuje. Danes se bo Ljubljanica še razlivala v manjšem obsegu.

Na severozahodu so reke srednje vodnate, v večjem delu države pa še ohranjajo veliko vodnatost.

Danes in v prihodnjih dneh se bo upadanje večine rek nadaljevalo, pri čemer bo vse več rek srednje vodnatih. Mura bo počasi še upadala, v nedeljo pa bo začela naraščati. Na vtoku v državo bo naraščala predvidoma še do ponedeljka. V nedeljo popoldne, ponoči in v ponedeljek bo možno razlivanje Mure znotraj protipoplavnih nasipov, še opozarja Arso.

Tudi v prihodnjih dneh pod 20 stopinjami Celzija

Zvečer bo pretežno oblačno. Občasno bodo še rahle padavine, ki bodo ponoči prehodno večinoma ponehale. Najnižje jutranje temperature bodo od 6 do 12, v Gornjesavski dolini okoli 3 stopinje Celzija.

V nedeljo bo sprva večinoma oblačno, tu in tam bo občasno rahlo deževalo, pogosteje v vzhodnih krajih. Popoldne bo večinoma suho, proti večeru se bodo oblaki od severa trgali. V notranjosti bo pihal šibak do zmeren veter severnih smeri, ki bo popoldne postopno slabel. Najvišje dnevne temperature bodo od 12 do 17, na Primorskem do 20 stopinj Celzija.

V ponedeljek se bo dopoldne ponovno pooblačilo, rahel dež bo od severovzhoda prehodno zajel večji del Slovenije.

V torek bodo sprva še manjše padavine. Popoldne se bo delno razjasnilo, nastalo bo še nekaj ploh. Na Primorskem bo pihala šibka burja.

V sredo bo sprva delno jasno, čez dan bo oblačnost od juga naraščala. Popoldne bo začelo rahlo deževati. Na Primorskem bo še pihala burja.

Winds are a little orange for the north. Styer and Overmural will be the strongest night.

Visiting the mountain and gathering wood is recommended.

Arso has issued an orange warning for the north of the country due to strong winds, which is in effect until noon Sunday. At night, winds reached 140 on the Kradar, and at night, on Ratitovca, Urszlje hills and Blowavec, 100 km/h.

As reported by the RS Environment Agency (Arso), the northern winds, which began to blow at night, are expected to rise to 70 to 85 km/h on Sunday afternoon, when the sun can occasionally reach speeds of 70 to 85 km/h. From this afternoon to Sunday afternoon, the north winds of Styria and Prekmurja can reach the same speed. The orange warning of Ars applies to these areas.

"Because the trees are still oak, windmills are possible. The risk will be higher, especially in slightly higher beds. In the mountains, the strongest suns will be able to exceed 100 km/h, so visiting the mountain or gathering wood at the end of the week is advised", the Arsa news agency reported on Friday.

And it's true that at night, on the Cretaceous, the winds reached 140 kilometers per hour, and on the Ratitovce, the Urshli Mountains and the Bloody Mountain, they reached 100 kilometers per hour.

On Saturday, the sun was measured at 66 in Lesca and at Brno at 65 kilometers per hour. In Styria and Prekmurz, the winds did not begin to strengthen until the second half of the afternoon, at which time the sun is reaching about 50 kilometers per hour. It's the strongest wind there at night.

As weatherman Urban Zagar of Arsa told STA, winds on the Kradarca were still reaching about 110 or 120 miles per hour during the day. The wind in the upper reaches of the lake was a little weaker this afternoon.

The orange wind warning for the northwest and northeast of the country is in effect until 12 noon on Sunday, and will be replaced by a yellow weather warning by the end of the day.

In central Slovenia and parts of the Dolenja region, or in south-eastern Slovenia, sunny winds can occasionally reach speeds of up to about 50 kilometres per hour. "Some caution, especially in slightly higher altitudes, will not be lacking there too", warned Zagar. Arso issued a yellow weather warning for central and southeastern Slovenia.

The RS Protection and Rescue Administration has reported that 11 interventions have been carried out in the regions of the Regional Centres of Brežica, Celje, Kranj, Koper, Maribor, Murska Sobota, Nova Gorica and Slovenj Gradec due to strong winds.

They said that a strong wind knocked down trees on the side of the road, and that a roof was found on one of the apartment buildings. Nine fire departments were involved, and other services were involved in the removal of the cut tree and in providing citizens with assistance in protecting the damaged bark.

The water level of rivers is slowly falling

The water level of most rivers across the country is slowly falling after a recent heavy rainfall. The Krka River flows along the entire river, but its flow is slowly decreasing. Flooded areas in the lower course will continue to be maintained today and will begin to decline in the evening and on Sunday nights.

The water level of Ljubljana on the Bar is decreasing. Today, Ljubljana will explode on a smaller scale.

In the northwest, rivers are moderately watery, while in most parts of the country they still maintain high water levels.

Today and in the days ahead, most rivers will continue to decline, with more and more rivers of medium water. The wall will slowly fall, and Sunday will begin to rise. The flow into the country is expected to increase until Monday. On Sunday afternoon, at night and Monday, the Wall will be able to spill into the flood control buffers, Arso warns.

In the coming days below 20 degrees Celsius

It's going to be mostly cloudy tonight. There will be occasional rainfall, which will mostly leave the night passing. The lowest morning temperatures will be between 6 and 12 in the Upper Valley at about 3 degrees Celsius.

On Sunday, it will be mostly cloudy at first, with occasional rainfall here and there, more often in the eastern regions. It's mostly dry in the afternoon, and by evening, the northern clouds will be breaking. Inside, a mild to moderate north wind will blow, gradually weakening this afternoon. The maximum daily temperatures will be 12 to 17 degrees Celsius in Primorsky.

The mandate will be renewed on Monday morning, with a slight rainfall from the north-east covering most of Slovenia.

There'll be even less rain on Tuesday. It'll be partially cleared up this afternoon, and there'll be a few more. There's going to be a weak storm on Primorsky.

It's gonna be partially clear on Wednesday, and clouds will rise from the south during the day. It's going to start raining a little this afternoon. There's still going to be a storm in Primorsky.

"Nenaden srčni zastoj je lahko posledica različnih stanj"

Svetovni dan prve pomoči

"Natančen razlog, zakaj neki športnik doživi srčni zastoj, medtem ko drugi ne, tudi če sodeluje v istem športu ali fizični aktivnosti, ni vedno jasen," pravijo v Slovenskem reanimacijskem svetu. Letošnji svetovni dan prve pomoči je namreč posvečen športu.

Drugo septembrsko soboto zaznamujemo svetovni dan prve pomoči, v Sloveniji pa začnemo z mesecem prve pomoči, ki se bo sklenil 16. oktobra, na svetovni dan oživljanja. Osrednja tema letošnjega svetovnega dneva prve pomoči je Prva pomoč in šport, ki pa ne izpostavlja le športne poškodbe, temveč tudi življenjsko ogrožajoča stanja.

"Šport pogosto zaznamujejo tudi športne poškodbe pri tekmovalcih. Med olimpijskimi igrami se je žal zgodil tudi tragičen dogodek – zastoj srca boksarskega trenerja s Samoe gospoda Lionela Elika Fatupaita. Navedeni dogodki poudarjajo, da morajo biti znanja in veščine prve pomoči dostopni vsakomur, je v poslanici poudarila predsednica Rdečega križa Slovenije Ana Žerjal.

Morda najbolj odmeven primer srčnega zastoja med športniki se je zgodil na evropskem nogometnem prvenstvu junija 2011, ko se je na tekmi zgrudil danski nogometaš Christian Eriksen in so ga rešili z oživljanjem.

Srčni zastoji pri športnikih so redki

V slovenskem reanimacijskem svetu in slovenskem združenju za urgentno medicino sicer navajajo, da je srčni zastoj pri športnikih, čeprav je razmeroma redek (manj kot 1 na 100.000 športnikov na leto), resen in pogosto dogodek z veliko medijsko pozornostjo, ko se zgodi.

"Nenaden srčni zastoj je lahko posledica različnih stanj, nekatera od njih so morda prirojena (prisotna ob rojstvu) ali pa so pridobljena s časom. Natančen razlog, zakaj neki športnik doživi srčni zastoj, medtem ko drugi ne, tudi če sodeluje v istem športu ali fizični aktivnosti, ni vedno jasen. Vendar so pogosti vzroki med drugim hipertrofična kardiomiopatija, prirojene anomalije koronarnih arterij in aritmogena kardiomiopatija," so navedli.

"Kar zadeva športe z najvišjo incidenco nenadnega srčnega zastoja, je treba opozoriti, da se dejansko tveganje lahko razlikuje glede na različne dejavnike, kot so starost športnika, spol, genetska predispozicija in osnovna zdravstvena stanja," so pojasnili.

Glede na dostopne podatke do leta 2021 pa se, kot so zapisali, zdi, da je pri košarkarjih incidenca višja zlasti med moškimi afriškega porekla, kar je bilo deloma pripisano prevalenci hipertrofične kardiomiopatije v tej skupini. Pri maratonskem teku so bili srčni dogodki zlasti pri tistih z že prisotnimi srčnimi boleznimi. Več primerov srčnih zastojev so zaznali tudi pri nogometu, ameriškem nogometu in hokeju na ledu.

"Šport in fizična aktivnost sta na splošno koristna za zdravje. Vendar pa je za tiste, ki sodelujejo v tekmovalnih športih ali intenzivnih fizičnih aktivnostih, pomembno, da se zavedajo možnih tveganj in opravijo ustrezne zdravstvene preglede. Možnost srčnega zastoja med športniki je zelo težko predvideti. Dobra novica pa je, da je možnost preživetja v primerjavi s splošno statistiko zelo dobra – preživetje je okrog 89-odstotno, a je zelo pomembno, da nekdo takoj začne prave postopke oživljanja in je na voljo avtomatski zunanji defibrilator (AED)(9). Sicer je preživetje bistveno slabše, dejanska preživetja v splošni populaciji so precej nižja," so še navedli.

Športniki pomoč pri učenju

Pri Rdečem križu poudarjajo, da je prva pomoč, vključno z oživljanjem, je ključno dejanje za učinkovito in hitro oskrbo poškodb in bolezni, s čimer se poveča možnost preživetja. Ob tem napovedujejo, da bodo v obdobju meseca prve pomoči v njihovi organizaciji potekali številni brezplačni dogodki, predstavitve in delavnice, tudi letos pa želijo opozoriti na pomen vseživljenjskega učenja prve pomoči.

"K sodelovanju smo tako povabili tudi športnike, ki bodo zgled našim najmlajšim pri učenju tako pomembne veščine, kot je prva pomoč. Vsako človeško življenje je pomembno, zato moramo svoja znanja in veščine prve pomoči redno obnavljati in nadgrajevati," so še navedli pri Rdečem križu.
2024-09-14.title: Nenaden srčni zastoj je lahko posledica različnih stanj
2024-09-14.english_content:
& quot; A single cardiac arrest can be caused by different conditions & quot;

World Day of First Aid

"The exact reason why some athletes experience cardiac arrest while others do not, even if they participate in the same sport or physical activity, is not always clear", says the Slovak Reanimation Council. This year's World First Aid Day is dedicated to sport.

The second Saturday of September marks World First Aid Day, and in Slovenia we start the month of First Aid, which will end on 16 October, with World Revival Day. The theme of this year's World First Aid Day is First Aid and Sport, which not only highlights sport injuries but also life-threatening conditions.

"Sports often involve sports injuries to competitors. The tragic event also happened during the Olympics. The heartbeat of a boxing trainer with the Samoan Mr. Lionel Elika Fatupaita. The events underlined the need to make first aid knowledge and skills accessible to everyone, said the President of the Slovenian Red Cross, Ana Žerjal, in her address.

Perhaps the most notable case of cardiac arrest among athletes occurred at the European Football Championship in June 2011, when Danish footballer Christian Eriksen was stabbed in the match and rescued by a resuscitation.

Heart failure in athletes is rare

The Slovenian Resuscitation Council and the Slovenian Emergency Medicine Association state that cardiac arrest in athletes, although relatively rare (less than 1 in 100,000 athletes per year), is a serious and frequent event with a lot of media attention when it occurs.

"A single heart attack can be caused by a variety of conditions, some of which may be congenital (present at birth) or acquired over time. The exact reason why some athletes experience cardiac arrest while others do not, even if they participate in the same sport or physical activity, is not always clear. However, the common causes include hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, congenital coronary artery abnormalities and arrhythmic cardiomyopathy,' they noted.

"As regards sports with the highest incidence of sudden cardiac arrest, it should be noted that the actual risk may vary depending on different factors such as the age of the athlete, gender, genetic predisposition and underlying health conditions", they explained.

However, based on the data available up to 2021, as recorded, the incidence of basketball players appears to be higher, particularly among men of African descent, which was partly attributed to the prevalence of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in this group. The marathon was particularly heart-related for those with pre-existing heart conditions. More cases of cardiac arrest have also been reported in football, soccer, and ice hockey.

"Sport and physical activity are generally beneficial to health. However, it is important for those who participate in competitive sports or intensive physical activity to be aware of the potential risks and to have appropriate health checks. The possibility of cardiac arrest among athletes is very difficult to predict. The good news is that the survival rate is very good compared to the general statistics  ⁇  Survival is around 89%, but it is very important that someone immediately starts the proper recovery procedures and an automatic external defibrillator (AED) is available. Otherwise survival is significantly worse, while overall overall survival is much lower,' they added.

Athletes with learning aids

The Red Cross stresses that first aid, including rehabilitation, is a key step in effective and rapid treatment of injuries and diseases, thereby increasing the chances of survival. They also announced that they will be organising a number of free events, presentations and workshops during the first aid month and also this year they want to highlight the importance of lifelong learning in first aid.

"We have also invited athletes to participate, who will be an example to our youngest in learning a skill as important as first aid. Every human life is important, and we need to regularly renew and upgrade our first aid knowledge and skills", the Red Cross said.
2024-09-14.english_title: Sudden cardiac arrest can be caused by a variety of conditions

Kako rešiti prostorsko stisko v zaporih

Zakon DZ-ja obravnava po nujnem postopku

Odbor DZ-ja za pravosodje je prižgal zeleno luč predlogu novele zakona o izvrševanju kazenskih sankcij, ki naj bi z začasnimi ukrepi reševal prostorsko in kadrovsko stisko v zaporih.

Ministrica za pravosodje Andreja Katič je poudarila, da je stanje v slovenskem sistemu zaporov alarmantno. "Zasedenost zaporov presega 130 odstotkov kapacitet, tako polnih zaporov v Sloveniji še nismo imeli," je dejala ministrica in dodala, da ob taki prezasedenosti nastajajo težave z zagotavljanjem prostora, vzdrževanjem reda in discipline, izvajanjem programov in zagotavljanjem zdravstvenega varstva. Dodaten izziv pa so tudi kadrovske težave, saj upravi za izvrševanje kazenskih sankcij kljub vsem naporom ne uspe zaposliti ustreznega števila pravosodnih policistov.

Rešitev vseh teh težav zahteva svoj čas, v vmesnem času pa po njenih besedah potrebujemo tudi začasne ukrepe, ki jih prinaša omenjena novela. Ta določa začasne ukrepe, s katerimi bo zaporski sistem lahko vsaj nekoliko omejil tveganja zaradi prezasedenosti zavodov in pomanjkanja pravosodnih policistov. V predlogu zakona so določene okoliščine za nastanek zaostrenih varnostnih razmer.

V primeru zaostrenih varnostnih razmer bi vlada z odlokom določila začasne ukrepe. Med začasnimi ukrepi je možnost, da bi naloge pravosodnega policista opravljali tudi drugi zaposleni v upravi, ki so bili v preteklosti že zaposleni na delovnem mestu pravosodnega policista. Poleg tega sta predvideni možnost prekinitve prestajanja kazni zapora in možnost odloga nastopa kazni zapora ali nadomestnega zapora.

Policija vozi pripornike kot po tekočem traku

Tudi generalni direktor Uprave za izvrševanje kazenskih sankcij Bojan Majcen je poudaril, da v Sloveniji še nismo imeli takšnega izziva kot zdaj. "Dejansko policija vozi pripornike kot po tekočem traku," je dejal Majcen in pojasnil, da so to v pretežni meri kazniva dejanja prepovedanega prehoda čez državno mejo. Struktura zaprtih se je zato popolnoma spremenila, praktično polovica je tujcev. To je posledica zaostritve kazni za omenjeno kaznivo dejanje v času prejšnje vlade. Poleg prezasedenosti zaporov je Majcen izpostavil tudi neustrezne razmere za delo pravosodnih policistov.

Na vse to so v razpravi opozarjali tako koalicijski kot opozicijski poslanci, a se niso strinjali glede načina reševanja te problematike. V Svobodi so prepričani, da je zakonsko novelo nujno sprejeti, da se delno omilijo izredne razmere v zaporih, v SDS-u in NSi-ju pa po drugi strani menijo, da so to parcialne rešitve, ki v praksi ne bodo prinesle želenih učinkov.

Kazni se tujcem ne morejo prekiniti

Precej pozornosti je bilo v razpravi namenjene vprašanju možnosti prekinitve prestajanja kazni zapora. Poslance SDS-a in NSi-ja skrbi, da bi bila zaporna kazen prekinjena tujcem, kar naj bi predstavljalo varnostno grožnjo za državo. A je Majcen pojasnil, da se kazni tujcem ne morejo prekiniti. Dodal je, da bo izpuščeno le majhno število zapornikov, vsakega posebej pa bodo temeljito varnostno preverili.

V SDS-u so želeli med izjeme, za katere se začasni ukrep prekinitve prestajanja kazni zapora in odloga nastopa kazni zapora ne bi mogel uporabiti, poleg nekaterih drugih kaznivih dejanj dodati še zapornike, obsojene zaradi prepovedanega prehajanja meje. Po besedah poslanca SDS-a Andreja Hoivika namreč ne morejo privoliti v to, da bi izpustili "trgovce z belim blagom", saj gre za enega najbolj zavržnih kaznivih dejanj.

V koaliciji se s tem niso strinjali. Po besedah Darka Krajnca (Svoboda) so namreč ravno obsojenci zaradi teh kaznivih dejanj vzrok, "da imamo takšno situacijo v zaporih". Dopolnilo SDS-a tako ni dobilo zadostne podpore, je pa odbor z dopolnilom v predlog vnesel določbo, da se pri teh ukrepih upoštevata sorazmernost in teža kaznivega dejanja.

Odbor je sprejel še vrsto koalicijskih dopolnil, ki so jih pripravili na podlagi pripomb zakonodajnopravne službe. Med drugim so določili, da smejo ukrepi trajati toliko časa, kolikor trajajo zaostrene varnostne razmere zaradi kadrovskih ali prostorskih težav v zavodih, vendar najdlje tri mesece. Vlada sme z odlokom trajanje ukrepov podaljšati, vsakič največ za tri mesece.

2024-09-13.english_content:
How to Resolve the Space Shortage in Prisons

The law of the ZT is dealt with in an emergency procedure

The ZJ Committee for Justice has given a green light to a new draft criminal sanctions law that aims to temporarily relieve the space and staff constraints in prisons.

Minister of Justice Andreja Katić stressed that the situation in the Slovenian prison system is alarming. "The capacity of prisons exceeds 130 percent, so full prisons in Slovenia we have not had yet", the minister said, adding that such overcrowding causes problems with providing space, maintaining order and discipline, implementing programmes and providing health care. The Commission has also taken note of the fact that the Commission has not yet adopted a decision on the application of the rules on the application of the rules of procedure.

The solution to all these problems takes time, and in the meantime, she says, we also need the temporary measures brought about by the novel. It provides for provisional measures to allow the prison system to reduce at least somewhat the risks of overcrowding and a lack of judicial officers. The draft law sets out the circumstances for the creation of increased security conditions.

In the event of a heightened security situation, the Government would decide to provide for provisional measures. The provisional measures include the possibility of other administrative staff who have previously been employed in the job of a judicial officer also carrying out the duties of a judicial officer. In addition, the possibility of suspending the sentence of imprisonment and the possibility of postponing the commencement of a prison sentence or a substitute prison sentence are provided for.

The police are driving the prisoners like a live band.

The Director-General of the Criminal Sanctions Executive, Bojan Majcen, also stressed that we have not had a challenge like this in Slovenia. "The police are actually carrying prisoners like a live band", Majcen said, explaining that these are largely crimes of prohibited crossings of the state border. The structure of the prisoners has therefore changed completely, with almost half of them foreign. This is the result of the intensification of the penalties for that offence under the previous government. In addition to the overcrowding of the prisons, Majcen also exposed the inadequate conditions for the work of the judicial police.

All this was pointed out in the debate by both the Coalition and Opposition Members but they did not agree on how to resolve this issue. The Liberdá are convinced that the new law must be adopted to partially justify the emergency situation in prisons, while the SDS and the NSi, on the other hand, consider that these are partial solutions that will not produce the desired effects in practice.

The penalties for foreigners cannot be suspended

Much attention was paid to the question of whether to suspend the sentence. SDS and NSi MPs are concerned that the prison sentence would be suspended by foreigners, which would pose a security threat to the country. But Majcen explained that the penalties for foreigners cannot be lifted. He added that only a small number of prisoners would be released, and each would be carefully inspected individually.

The SDS wanted to include, among the exceptions for which the temporary measure to suspend the sentence and postpone the start of the sentence could not be applied, in addition to certain other offences, prisoners convicted of illegal border crossing. According to SDS MP Andrey Hoivik, they cannot allow the release of "white goods traders" as one of the most reprehensible crimes.

The coalition didn't agree with that. According to Darko Krajnc (Freedom), it is the convicts of these crimes who "caused us to have this situation in prisons". The SDS supplement thus did not receive sufficient support, but the Committee, by supplementing the proposal, made provision that the proportionality and gravity of the offence should be taken into account in these measures.

The Committee adopted a number of coalition amendments drawn up on the basis of comments from the legislative service. Among other things, they stipulated that measures may last as long as the intensified safety conditions due to staff or space problems in the installations, but no longer than three months. The Government may, by decision, extend the duration of the measures, at most every three months.
2024-09-13.english_title: How to Resolve the Space Shortage in Prisons

2024-09-13.content:
Zdravniška zbornica: Golob naj prekliče svoje izjave ali pa javno dokaže resničnost teh trditev

Nezadovoljstvo v zdravstvu

Zdravniška zbornica premierja Roberta Goloba poziva, naj prekliče neresnično izjavo o nedelu zdravnikov. Mladi zdravniki Slovenije pa menijo, da bo posledica novega zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti vzpostavitev dveh zdravstvenih sistemov.

"Odhod strokovnjakov, sploh z določenih področij, ki so že zdaj delno v zasebnih vodah, bo gotovo pospešen, predvsem govorim o maksilofacialni kirurgiji, ortopediji, okulistiki, plastični kirurgiji, dermatologiji, radiologiji," je dejala Larisa Kragelj iz skupine Mladi zdravniki Slovenije.

Papir prenese vse, predlagane spremembe so pesek v oči javnosti in daleč od realnosti, tako slovenskega zdravstva ne bomo rešili, poudarja Fides. "Nalaga več dela tistim, ki so v sistemu, in to bo še dodatno odvračalo zdravnike, ki bodo iskali boljše delovne razmere drugje," poudarja predsednik sindikata Fides Damjan Polh. "Če kdaj, je zdaj čas, da stopimo skupaj in nekaj naredimo," je dodal.

"V pripravo te novele smo šli zato, ker zdravniki delajo drugje, ker zdravniki odhajajo v zasebni sektor, delajo po različnih pogodbah, ki so davčno ugodnejše, zato zmanjkuje zdravstvenega osebja v javnih zdravstvenih zavodih," se je na kritike odzvala ministrica Valentina Prevolnik Rupel.

Medtem Zdravniška zbornica Slovenije ostro zavrača izjavo predsednika vlade Roberta Goloba, v kateri je obtožil zaposlene v javnih bolnišnicah, češ da "nekateri tam delajo malo, lahko celo nič," in "vozijo paciente v svoja zasebna podjetja ter umetno ustvarjajo čakalne vrste."

"To so obtožbe, ki ne temeljijo na preverjenih podatkih in ki ustvarjajo nevarno in lažno sliko o zdravstvenem sistemu ter zdravnikih. Zdravniki so že predolgo tarča neutemeljenih napadov in prav takšne izjave najvišjih predstavnikov oblasti prispevajo k naraščanju sovražnega govora, nestrpnosti ter celo fizičnega nasilja nad tistimi, ki v teh neznosnih razmerah še vedno vztrajajo v javnem zdravstvu. Če vlada ni sposobna urediti razmer v zdravstvenem sistemu, naj se vsaj vzdrži škodljivih izjav, ki spodbujajo mestoma prav javni linč nad zdravniki in drugimi zdravstvenimi delavci, ki vsakodnevno, pogosto prek svojih zmožnosti, skrbijo za paciente," še opozarjajo v Zdravniški zbornici in pozivajo premierja Goloba, da prekliče svoje izjave ali pa javno dokaže resničnost teh trditev. 

Kersnič: Ne smemo pozabiti, da imamo na razpolago tudi tujino

V oddaji Odmevi je gostoval Boštjan Kersnič, strokovni direktor novomeške bolnišnice, član zdravniške zbornice in v njej predsednik odbora za bolnišnično in specialistično zdravstvo. Pojasnil je, da v Sloveniji pri zdravniških storitvah samo 2,7 odstotka bruto prometa opravijo zasebniki, vse drugo se opravi v javnih bolnišnicah.

"Zdravniki smo vedno prikazani kot dežurni krivci. Če bomo prisilili ljudi, da se bodo morali odločiti med zasebnim in javnim, bodo lahko zelo kritične posledice. Mladi zdravniki so pred dvema letoma naredili raziskavo, v kateri so ugotovili, da se bo več kot 48 odstotkov ljudi, ki delajo v javnem zdravstvenem sistemu, odločilo za vstop v zasebni sektor. Ne smemo pozabiti, da imamo na razpolago tudi tujino," je poudaril Kersnič.

Tudi Tadej Peter Dovšak, predstojnik oddelka za maksilofacialno in oralno kirurgijo v UKC-ju Ljubljana, opozarja na negativne posledice: "Na naši kliniki nas je bilo pred letom dni zaposlenih 14, trenutno nas je 11. Če bo novela sprejeta, lahko predvidevam, da bolnikom ne bomo mogli več nuditi oskrbe tako, kot jim jo nudimo zdaj oziroma bo to morda konec maksilofacialne kirurgije v Sloveniji. V javnem sektorju maksilofacialni kirurgi večinoma delujemo na področju oralne kirurgije. Te operacije se ne izvajajo v zasebnem sektorju, saj so podplačane in ekonomsko nezanimive. Po drugi strani pa vse te operacije in vsaka obravnava teh bolnikov zahteva multidisciplinarni pristop, od zobozdravnikov do specialistov plastične kirurgije. Zato lahko to deluje samo znotraj vrhunskega terciarnega centra, kar UKC po mojem mnenju še vedno je."

Celoten pogovor si lahko ogledate v spodnjem videu!
2024-09-13.title: Zdravniška zbornica: Golob naj prekliče svoje izjave ali pa javno dokaže resničnost teh trditev

The medical board: The defendant must either withdraw his statement or prove it publicly.

Discontent with health care

Prime Minister Robert Goble's medical room is calling for him to cancel an untrue statement about the doctors' Sunday. The new health legislation will lead to the creation of two health systems.

"The departure of specialists, especially from certain fields, which are already partly in private waters, will certainly be accelerated, especially in maxillofacial surgery, orthopaedics, ophthalmology, plastic surgery, dermatology, radiology", said Larisa Kragelj of the group Young Doctors of Slovenia.

The paper will carry everything, the proposed changes are sand in the public eye and far from reality, so we will not save Slovenian health, Fides stresses. "It will require more work for those in the system, and this will further deter doctors looking for better working conditions elsewhere", stresses Fides union president Damjan Polh. "If ever, now is the time to step up and do something together", he added.

"We started this novel because doctors work elsewhere, because doctors go to the private sector, they work under different contracts that are more tax-efficient, and so there is a shortage of healthcare staff in public health institutions", Minister Valentina Prevolnik Rupel said.

Meanwhile, the Slovenian Medical Chamber sharply rejects Prime Minister Robert Gobal's statement accusing public hospitals of "some people working little, maybe nothing" and "carrying patients to their private businesses and artificially creating waiting lines".

"These are allegations that are not based on verified data and create a dangerous and false image of the health system and doctors. Doctors have long been the target of unwarranted attacks, and the very statements of the highest officials contribute to the growing hate speech, intolerance, and even physical violence against those who continue to persevere in public health in these intolerable circumstances. If the government is unable to regulate the health system, at least it should refrain from harmful statements that encourage public outcry against doctors and other health workers who care for patients every day, often beyond their means", the Health Chamber warns, urging Prime Minister Gobola to either withdraw his statements or prove them publicly.

Kersnič: We must not forget that we also have foreigners at our disposal

The programme was hosted by Boštjan Kersnič, the professional director of the New York Hospital, a member of the medical room and chairman of the committee for hospital and specialist health. He explained that in Slovenia only 2.7 per cent of the gross medical traffic is carried out by private individuals, the rest being carried out in public hospitals.

"We doctors are always portrayed as the watchmen. If we force people to choose between private and public, it can have very critical consequences. Two years ago, a survey by young doctors found that more than 48 percent of people working in public health will choose to enter the private sector. We must not forget that we also have a foreign presence at our disposal", stressed Kersnič.

Tadej Peter Dovšak, Head of the Maxillofacial and Oral Surgery Department at UKC Ljubljana, also points out the negative consequences: "We had 14 working days a year ago at our clinic, and now we are 11. If the novel is accepted, I can predict that we will no longer be able to provide patients with the care we are providing them with now or that this may be the end of maxillofacial surgery in Slovenia. In the public sector maxillofacial surgeons are mainly in the field of oral surgery. These operations are not carried out in the private sector as they are subsidised and economically uninteresting. On the other hand, all these operations and every treatment of these patients requires a multidisciplinary approach, from dentists to plastic surgeons. Therefore, it can only operate within a top tertiary centre, which UKC still is in my opinion.'

Na obisku v Ljubljani Nobelov nagrajenec, ki je odkril zdravilo za revmatoidni artritis

Poudarja pomembnost sodelovanja med akademsko sfero, industrijo in zagonskimi podjetji

Slovenijo je obiskal eden najbolj uglednih in hkrati tudi finančno uspešnih znanstvenikov na svetu Gregory Winter, Nobelov nagrajenec za kemijo iz leta 2018. Z zdravili, ki jim je odprl pot, se zdravi več deset milijonov bolnikov.

Molekularni biolog, čigar znanje je za človeštvo neprecenljivo, je v četrtek popoldne svojo zgodbo o uspehu predstavil v polni predavalnici fakultete za farmacijo v Ljubljani.

Winter je eden izmed vodilnih znanstvenikov na področju razvoja terapevtskih monoklonskih protiteles in je bistveno prispeval k revoluciji zdravljenja bolezni, kot so rak in nekatere avtoimunske bolezni, so sporočili s fakultete za farmacijo. Med drugim je odkril zdravilo za revmatoidni artritis.

Svoje najprelomnejše delo je opravil z razvojem tehnik za pridobitev človeških monoklonskih protiteles, kar je bilo ključnega pomena za razvoj bioloških zdravil, ki omogočajo imunsko terapijo.

Njegova tehnologija fagnega prikaza protiteles je omogočila ustvarjanje povsem človeških protiteles, ki so danes osnova za številna inovativna biološka zdravila, ki zelo ciljno in učinkovito zdravijo kompleksne bolezni. Za to izjemno odkritje je leta 2018 prejel Nobelovo nagrado za kemijo skupaj s Frances Arnold in Georgeem Smithom.

Na predavanju je Winter poudaril pomembnost sodelovanja med akademsko sfero, industrijo in zagonskimi podjetji za prenos inovacij iz laboratorijev v rutinsko uporabo, o čemer priča tudi njegova kariera. S pomočjo zagonskih podjetij, kot je Cambridge Antibody Technology, je svoja odkritja uspešno prenesel v komercialno uporabo in tako omogočil širšo dostopnost teh terapij.

Med organizatorji predavanja je bilo britansko veleposlaništvo pod vodstvom nove veleposlanice v Sloveniji Victorie Harrison, za katero je bil to prvi dogodek v tej funkciji.

Po predavanju je Winterja pred mikrofon Radia Prvi ujel novinar Iztok Konc, pogovor lahko poslušate spodaj.
2024-09-13.title: Na obisku v Ljubljani Nobelov nagrajenec, ki je odkril zdravilo za revmatoidni artritis
2024-09-13.english_content:
Nobel Prize winner who discovered a cure for rheumatoid arthritis

Stresses the importance of cooperation between academia, industry and start-ups

Slovenia was visited by one of the most prestigious and at the same time financially successful scientists in the world, Gregory Winter, Nobel laureate for chemistry in 2018. The drugs he gave them have been used to treat tens of millions of patients.

A molecular biologist whose knowledge is invaluable to humanity presented his success story on Thursday afternoon in a full lecture at the Faculty of Pharmacy in Ljubljana.

Winter is one of the leading scientists in the development of therapeutic monoclonal antibodies and has made a significant contribution to the revolution in the treatment of diseases such as cancer and some autoimmune diseases, the Faculty of Pharmacy reported. Among other things, he discovered a cure for rheumatoid arthritis.

His most groundbreaking work was developing techniques for the production of human monoclonal antibodies, which was crucial to the development of biological drugs that enable immune therapy.

His antibody-flagging technology has enabled the creation of entirely human antibodies, which today form the basis of many innovative biological drugs that treat complex diseases very effectively and targeted. For this remarkable discovery, he received the 2018 Nobel Prize in Chemistry along with Frances Arnold and George Smith.

In his lecture, Winter stressed the importance of cooperation between academia, industry and start-ups to transfer innovation from laboratories to routine use, as evidenced by his career. With the help of start-ups such as Cambridge Antibody Technology, he has successfully translated his findings into commercial use, thus making these therapies more widely available.

Among the organisers of the lecture was the British Embassy, headed by the new Embassy in Slovenia, Victorie Harrison, for whom this was the first event in this capacity.

After Winter's speech in front of the radio microphone, the first reporter caught the East End, you can listen to the conversation below.
