Socialni partnerji so se spet sešli. Mesec: Socialni dialog je v dobri kondiciji in mu dobro kaže.

Seja ESS-ja

Socialni partnerji so se po poletnem premoru spet sešli na seji ESS-ja. Kot je po seji povedal minister za delo Luka Mesec, so dosegli soglasje pri zakonu o zagotavljanju kakovosti v zdravstvu in t. i. zakonu o pozabi.

Predsednik Ekonomsko-socialnega sveta ESS-ja in minister za delo Luka Mesec je po seji ESS-ja pojasnil, da so tokrat najprej obravnavali letno poročilo o bralni pismenosti, nato predlog davčnih sprememb, sočasno pa je ministrstvo za finance predstavilo predlog glede uskladitve lestvice za odmero dohodnine in olajšav v letu 2025.

Socialni partnerji so razpravljali tudi o načinu prenosa direktive o minimalni plači, o zakonu o dolgotrajni oskrbi, predstavljeno je bilo tudi poročilo ministrice za zdravje o prihajajočih spremembah v zdravstvenem sistemu. Na ESS-ju so obravnavali predvsem zakon o zagotavljanju kakovosti v zdravstvu in t. i. zakon o pozabi.

Mesec je po seji povedal, da so pri nekaterih točkah dosegli soglasje. "Tukaj bi posebej izpostavil oba zakona v zdravstvu. Pri zakonu o pravici do pozabe je bilo doseženo soglasje vseh treh partnerjev, pri drugem smo se strinjali vlada in sindikalna stran, delodajalska se je vzdržala, ampak ni nasprotovala, kar je dobra popotnica tudi na drugih področjih," je dejal.

ESS so tudi seznanili s prenosom evropske direktive o minimalni plači. "Zelo pozitivno je, da direktiva pravi, da je ustrezna višina minimalne plače 60 odstotkov povprečne plače. Slovenija je država, ki je praktično edina v Evropi tam nekje na 60 odstotkih povprečne plače. Toliko znaša pri nas minimalna plača v bruto znesku," je povedal Mesec.

"Če pogledamo samo zadnja tri leta, včeraj je UMAR v svojem poročilu poudaril, da je minimalna plača v zadnjih treh letih zrasla za 22 odstotkov in pol, povprečna plača pa za 18 odstotkov in pol. Plače sledijo rasti minimalne plače in to je pozitivno ob tem prenosu direktive. Zato nam ni treba spreminjati zakonodaje, moramo pa imeti posvetovalno telo za ustrezno višino minimalne plače. Skupaj smo se odločili, da bo to ostal ekonomsko-socialni svet v celoti in ne bomo postavljali novega strokovnega odbora," je dodal.

ESS se je dogovoril tudi za ustanovitev strokovnega odbora, ki bo spremljal implementacijo zakona o dolgotrajni oskrbi. V 30 dneh pričakujejo analizo ministrstva za solidarno prihodnost, na podlagi katere bodo nato lahko delojemalci in delodajalci pripravili priporočila, je povedal generalni sekretar Združenja delodajalcev Slovenije Miro Smrekar.

Kaj bo s socialnim mirom po 13. septembru?

Na vprašanje, kaj bo v prihodnje s t. i. socialnim mirom, ki je bil z vlado dogovorjen do 13. septembra, je Mesec dejal, da je "socialni dialog v dobri kondiciji in da mu kaže dobro."

Predsednik konfederacije sindikatov javnega sektorja Slovenije Branimir Štrukelj je dejal, da se je večina sindikatov v javnem sektorju na prošnjo vlade na neki način odrekla kakršnim koli stavkovnim dejavnostim v času do 13. septembra, ko tečejo pogajanja o novem plačnem sistemu. "Vsi, ki smo ta dogovor podpisali, smo se tega tudi dosledno držali. Datum je zdaj izčrpan in po moji presoji bo to otežilo pogajanja, jih naredilo bolj kompleksna in zahtevna. To seveda cilja večine sindikatov, da bi prišli do konca, ne spreminja," je dejal.

Vodja ene od pogajalskih skupin sindikatov javnega sektorja Jakob Počivavšek pa je menil, da bo v nadaljnjih dneh ali tednih 13. september "neki Damoklejev meč, ki bo visel nad temi pogajanji." "Dokler pogajanja potekajo v taki dinamiki in s to intenzivnostjo in z nekim iskrenim namenom na obeh straneh, da se pripelje do zaključka, verjetno to ne bo zelo bistveno vplivalo na sama pogajanja, vsaj pri večini sindikatov," je dejal in opozoril, da če bi se odnos do pogajanj spremenil, bi to lahko sprožilo določene dejavnosti.

"V tem trenutku imamo dogovorjenih kar nekaj terminov za različna srečanja, na katerih bomo skušali zbližati stališča. Dejstvo je, da dogovora ni, dokler ni podpisa na vseh dokumentih, ki so za to potrebni. Kaj kmalu bo napočil datum, ko bo jasno, ali je prehod na novi plačni sistem mogoč s 1. januarjem ali ne," je dodal.

Delodajalci niso zadovoljni z davčnim paketom

Mitja Gorenšček iz Gospodarske zbornice Slovenije (GZS) je glede obravnave davčnega paketa v okviru ESS-ja opozoril na kršitve pravil ESS-ja, saj ga socialni partnerji niso obravnavali pred potrditvijo na vladi, ter pozval, naj se v prihodnje kršitvam izognejo.

Gorenšček je povedal, da je davčni paket nesistematičen in nedomišljen, da ne prinaša gospodarstvu skoraj nič novega. Poskus razvojne kapice pozdravljajo, a opozarjajo, da ta velja samo za tuje rezidente. "Izrazili smo pomislek, da bi lahko s tem zakonom spodbudili več domačih strokovnjakov, da se ti najprej zaposlijo v tujini in se potem kot tuji rezidenti vrnejo k nam," je pojasnil Gorenšček.  Njihov predlog, da vlada umakne davčni predlog iz zakonodajne procedure, pa ni sprejet.

Sindikalisti na drugi strani predlog davčnih sprememb vidijo kot zelo pomemben korak pri urejanju trga dela, zmanjševanju prekarnosti in zagotavljanju večje pravičnosti. Andrej Zorko iz Zveze svobodnih sindikatov Slovenije (ZSSS) je omenil spremembe sistema normirancev. "Ni pravično, da zaposleni plačujejo od svojih plač višje prispevke kot nekdo, čigar prihodek je na primer 100.000 evrov," je dejal in izrazil pričakovanje, da bo kmalu prišlo tudi do tega, da bodo vsi samostojni podjetniki plačevali prispevke od dejanskih prihodkov.

ESS je obravnaval tudi predlog ministrstva za finance glede uskladitve dohodninskih razredov in olajšav, čemur sta nasprotovali tako delodajalska kot sindikalna stran, saj sta prepričani, da predvideni znesek olajšav ne bi pokril niti minimalnih življenjskih stroškov na letni ravni. "Če so minimalni življenjski stroški na letni ravni nekaj čez 8300 evrov, bi v tem primeru davčna olajšava znašala približno 5100 evrov, kar pomeni, da bi še vedno ostala razlika med minimalnimi življenjskimi stroški in tem, kolikor bi država priznala olajšavo," je dejal Zorko.
2024-09-13.title: Socialni partnerji so se spet sešli. Mesec: Socialni dialog je v dobri kondiciji in mu dobro kaže.
2024-09-13.english_content:
The social partners are back together. Month: Social dialogue is in good shape and doing well.

The ESS session

The social partners have met again at the ESS meeting after the summer break. As Minister of Labour Luka Mesec said after the meeting, they reached agreement on the Health Quality Assurance and Forgetting Act.

The President of the ESS Economic and Social Council and the Minister for Labour, Luka Mesec, explained after the ESS session that this time they were first considering the annual literacy report, then the proposal for tax changes, and at the same time the Ministry of Finance presented a proposal for the alignment of the scale for the 2025 income and benefits measure.

The social partners also discussed the way in which the Minimum Wage Directive, the Long-Term Care Act, and the Health Minister's report on the upcoming changes in the health system were to be transposed. The ESS mainly dealt with the law on healthcare quality assurance and the so-called law on forgetfulness.

The month after the meeting, he said that they had reached a consensus on some points. "I would like to specify both health laws here. The right to be forgotten law was agreed by all three partners, the government and the trade union party agreed on the other, the Labour Party abstained but did not oppose, which is a good journey in other areas as well,' he said.

The ESC was also informed of the transposition of the European Minimum Wage Directive. 'It is very positive that the Directive states that the minimum wage is 60% of the average wage. Slovenia is practically the only country in Europe with somewhere in the middle 60% of the salary. That's the minimum wage in gross terms for us", said Moon.

"If we look at the last three years alone, yesterday, in its report, UMAR highlighted that the minimum wage has increased by 22 and a half percent over the last three years, and the average wage by 18 and a half percent. Wages are being followed by a rise in the minimum wage, which is a positive thing with this transposition of the directive. We therefore do not need to change the legislation, but we need to have an advisory body for an appropriate minimum wage. Together we have decided that this will remain the full Economic and Social Council and that we will not set up a new expert committee.'

The ESC also agreed to set up an expert committee to monitor the implementation of the Long-term Care Act. In 30 days, they expect the Ministry for a Solidarity Future to analyse the results, which will then allow employers and employers to prepare recommendations, said Secretary General of the Association of Employers of Slovenia Miro Smrekar.

What about social peace after September 13th?

Asked what the future holds for the so-called social peace agreed with the government until September 13, Moon said that "social dialogue is in good shape and showing good".

The President of the Confederation of Public Sector Unions of Slovenia, Branimir Štrukelj, said that at the request of the Government, most public sector unions had somehow renounced any strike activities in the period up to 13 September, when negotiations on a new wage system were underway. "All of us who have signed this agreement have consistently abided by it. The date is now exhausted and in my judgment it will make negotiations more difficult, more complex and demanding. This, of course, does not change the aim of most unions to get to the end", he said.

The head of one of the public sector trade union negotiating groups, Jakob Počivavšek, said that in the days or weeks following 13 September, "some Damokle's sword will hang over these negotiations". "As long as negotiations are going on in such a dynamic and with this intensity and some sincere intention on both sides to bring about a conclusion, this is unlikely to have a very significant impact on the negotiations themselves, at least for most trade unions", he said, noting that if the attitude to the negotiations changes, this could trigger certain activities.

"We have agreed on a number of dates for various meetings at which we will try to reconcile our views. The fact is, a deal doesn't exist until you sign all the documents that are needed to do so. What will soon be the date when it will be clear whether or not the transition to the new wage system is possible by 1 January?' he added.

Employers are not satisfied with the tax package

Mitja Gorenšček from the Economic Chamber of Slovenia (ECE) warned of the violations of the ESS rules regarding the treatment of the tax package under the ESS, as the social partners did not address it before the government approved it, and called for future violations to be avoided.

Mr. Gorenšček said the tax package was unsystematic and unthinkable, bringing almost nothing new to the economy. The developmental drops are welcome, but they warn that they are only for foreign residents. "We expressed concern that this law could encourage more local professionals to first work abroad and then return to us as foreign residents", explained Gorenšček. Their proposal to withdraw the tax proposal from the legislative procedure was not accepted.

Trade unionists, on the other hand, see the proposed tax reforms as a very important step in regulating the labour market, reducing inequality and ensuring greater equity. Andrej Zorko of the Union of Free Trade Unions of Slovenia (UFSS) mentioned changes to the Normirans system. "It is not fair for employees to pay more than their salaries than someone with an income of, say, €100,000", he said, expressing the expectation that all self-employed entrepreneurs will soon pay contributions from real income.

The ESS also considered the proposal of the Ministry of Finance to harmonise income grades and benefits, which was opposed by both the employers and the trade union parties, who were convinced that the envisaged amount of benefits would not cover even the minimum living costs at the annual level. "If the minimum cost of living is slightly over EUR 8,300 per year, the tax relief in this case would be around EUR 5,100, which means that the difference between the minimum cost of living and the extent to which the state would recognise the relief would still remain", said Zorko.
2024-09-13.english_title: The social partners are back together. Month: Social dialogue is in good shape and doing well.

2024-09-13.content:
Očitki nepravilnosti na ministrstvu za kulturo: SDS zahteva nujno sejo odbora DZ-ja

Ob zahtevi za sklic seje v SDS-u predlagajo v sprejem tudi več sklepov

SDS-ova poslanska skupina zahteva sklic nujne seje odbora državnega zbora za kulturo, v ospredju katere bi bil domnevni mobing in nezakonito delovanje na ministrstvu za kulturo, kjer naj bi po njihovem vladala svojevrstna diktatura nevladnikov.

Poslanska skupina opozicijske Slovenske demokratske stranke (SDS) je svojo zahtevo naslovila na predsednico odbora državnega zbora (DZ) za kulturo Saro Žibrat, ki prihaja iz vrst Svobode.

Zahtevo za sklic nujne seje so med drugim podprli s podatki, da se je na ministrstvu za kulturo v slabih dveh letih na novo zaposlilo 74 posameznikov, hkrati pa je 44 javnim uslužbencem prenehalo delovno razmerje. Po navedbah SDS-a pa naj bi na ministrstvu tudi vladala svojevrstna diktatura nevladnikov, ena ključnih figur v tej zgodbi naj bi po njihovem bil vodja sektorja za umetnost Rok Avbar.

Opozicijska poslanska skupina se v svoji zahtevi za sklic nujne seje sklicuje tudi na nedavno objavo računskega sodišča. To je namreč ugotovilo, da je ministrstvo za kulturo denarni del Prešernove nagrade v znesku 8346 evrov Svetlani Makarovič izplačalo v nasprotju s tretjim odstavkom 2. člena zakona o javnih financah. Računsko sodišče je ugotovilo tudi, da ministrstvo pred izplačilom ni dovolj skrbno preverilo vseh pravnih dejstev in okoliščin primera v zvezi s prenehanjem obveznosti iz podeljene nagrade.

V SDS-u predlagajo v sprejem tudi naslednje sklepe: odbor DZ-ja za kulturo naj pozove ministrico za kulturo Asto Vrečko in vodstvo ministrstva, da naj prepreči in ustavi nezakonite pritiske na zaposlene, da zagotovi zaposlenim pravice, ki izhajajo iz zakona o delovnih razmerjih, ter da ustrezno ukrepa proti vodji sektorja za umetnost Avbarju. Predlagajo tudi sklep, da odbor DZ-ja na Asto Vrečko naslovi poziv za sprejetje odgovornosti za ugotovljene nepravilnosti iz revizijskega poročila računskega sodišča in da naj razmisli o odstopu z ministrskega mesta.
2024-09-13.title: Očitki nepravilnosti na ministrstvu za kulturo: SDS zahteva nujno sejo odbora DZ-ja
2024-09-13.english_content:
Signs of irregularities at the Ministry of Culture: SDS requests an emergency meeting of the ZO Committee

They also propose to adopt several resolutions following the request for a meeting of the SDS

The SDS parliamentary group is calling for an emergency meeting of the State Council Committee on Culture, which would be led by alleged mobbing and illegal activity at the Ministry of Culture, where they are supposed to be ruled by a kind of non-governmental dictatorship.

The opposition Slovenian Democratic Party (SDS) parliamentary group has addressed its request to the chairperson of the State Council's (DZ) Culture Committee, Sara Žibrat, who comes from the Svoboda group.

The request for the summons of the emergency meeting was supported, inter alia, by the fact that 74 persons were recruited at the Ministry of Culture in the past two years and 44 civil servants were laid off. According to SDS, the ministry is also supposed to be ruled by a kind of non-governmental dictatorship, one of the key figures in this story is said to be the head of the art sector Rok Avbar.

The opposition group also refers to a recent publication by the Court of Auditors in its request to convene an emergency meeting. It found that the Ministry of Culture paid the financial part of the Prešern Prize of EUR 8346 to Svetlana Makarović, contrary to the third paragraph of Article 2 of the Public Finance Act. The Court also found that the Ministry had not sufficiently carefully verified all the legal facts and circumstances of the case concerning the termination of the obligation under the award before the payment.

The SDS also proposes the following decisions: the Culture Committee of the DZ should call on the Ministry of Culture, Asto Bagčko and the Ministry's leadership to prevent and stop unlawful pressures on employees, to ensure that employees enjoy the rights under the Employment Relations Act, and to take appropriate action against the head of the arts sector, Avbar. They also propose that the Asto Bagek Committee of the SA should be called upon to accept responsibility for the findings of irregularities in the Court's audit report and to consider resigning.

2024-09-13.author: G. K.
2024-09-13.content:
Evropski teden mobilnosti: "Spremenimo svoj odnos do avtomobila"

Agencija za varnost prometa: Zaščitimo najranljivejše udeležence

Čeprav se vse bolj zavedamo posledic naraščajočega prometa za okolje in zdravje, čezmeren avtomobilski promet ostaja eden ključnih razvojnih izzivov, ob Evropskem tednu mobilnosti opozarja ministrstvo za okolje, podnebje in energijo.

Kot so pred začetkom Evropskega tedna mobilnosti poudarili na ministrstvu, bodo s ponedeljkom vsaj v tretjini slovenskih občin za sedem dni zaprli ulice, trge in parkirišča. Namesto avtomobilom bodo ti prostori na voljo otroški igri, kolesarjenju, pešačenju, poležavanju ob branju knjig, kolesarskim servisom, delavnicam, kulturnim dogodkom, so našteli.

V okviru lokalnih programov, ki jih občine vsako leto pripravijo za svoje občane, bodo izvedeni različni ukrepi umirjanja prometa, še posebej v okolicah šol in vrtcev, v šole in vrtce bodo otroci hodili s pešbusom ali se vključili v igre, kot sta kokoška Rozi ali beli zajček.

Za starejše bodo vzpostavljeni programi za ohranjanje vitalnosti, delavnice in dogodki, na katerih spoznavajo različne oblike javnega prevoza, prevoza na klic, sisteme za izposojo koles in druge brezplačne možnosti javnega prevoza, ki jih ponujajo posamezne občine.

Vrhunec kampanje tedna mobilnosti je 22. september - dan brez avtomobila.

Vabljeni na kolesarske zajtrke

Po mestih in naseljih bodo postavljene postaje s kolesarskimi zajtrki za tiste, ki se na delo odpravijo trajnostno, spodbude za tovrstni prihod na delo bodo vsaj v tednu mobilnosti zaznamovali v večini slovenskih občin in drugih javnih zavodih, so dejavnosti nanizali na ministrstvu.

Kot so pojasnili, bodo v okviru letošnjega Evropskega tedna mobilnosti sofinancirali akcije v 52 občinah, povprečna višina sofinanciranja pa bo znašala 9500 evrov. Skupno bodo v treh letih do konca leta 2026 iz sklada za podnebne spremembe za sofinanciranje s tem tednom povezanih aktivnosti namenili 1,2 milijona evrov.

"Avtomobilski promet ostaja velik izziv naše družbe, in če si želimo uspešne, varne in zadovoljne prihodnosti za nas in naše otroke, moramo ta izziv čim prej nagovoriti. Evropski teden mobilnosti je vsakoletna priložnost, da spremenimo svoj odnos do avtomobila," je ob tej priložnosti poudaril minister za okolje, podnebje in energijo Bojan Kumer.

Stroški prometa

Vrednost zunanjih stroškov prometa v Sloveniji je v letu 2021 po podatkih Agencije RS za okolje znašala približno 4,6 odstotka bruto domačega proizvoda (BDP), kar 99 odstotkov teh stroškov pa je povzročil cestni promet. Tretjina stroškov je povezanih s prometnimi nesrečami, petina stroškov z zastoji, dodatnih 18 odstotkov s podnebnimi spremembami, 15 odstotkov z onesnaženjem zraka, sedem odstotkov pa s škodo na habitatih in šest odstotkov s hrupom.

"Čeprav v zadnjih letih število umrlih rahlo pada, so prometne nesreče v preteklem desetletju v povprečju zahtevale nesprejemljivih 110 življenj na leto," so še navedli na ministrstvu.V Agenciji za varnost prometa, ki sodeluje pri dejavnostih Evropskega tedna mobilnosti, pa so ob tej priložnosti pozvali k izboljšanju varnosti ranljivih udeležencev v prometu.
2024-09-13.title: Evropskitedenmobilnosti:spremenimo svoj odnos do avtomobila
2024-09-13.english_content:
European Mobility Week: 'Change our attitude to the car'

The Agency for Transport Safety: Protecting the most vulnerable participants

Although we are increasingly aware of the environmental and health implications of increasing traffic, overcrowding remains one of the key development challenges, the Ministry of Environment, Climate and Energy warns at European Mobility Week.

As the Ministry stressed before the start of the European Mobility Week, at least one third of Slovenian municipalities will close streets, markets and parking lots for seven days from Monday. Instead of cars, these spaces will be available for children to play, bike, walk, lie down while reading books, bike service, workshops, cultural events, they said.

The local programmes that municipalities prepare for their citizens each year will include various measures to reduce traffic, especially in the vicinity of schools and kindergartens, children walking on foot or participating in games such as the Roza chicken or the White Rabbit.

The elderly will be provided with life-support programmes, workshops and events to learn about the different forms of public transport, on-call transport, bicycle-lending systems and other free public transport options offered by individual municipalities.

The highlight of the mobility week is September 22nd - car-free day.

Invited to a bicycle breakfast

The Ministry has announced that bicycle breakfasts will be set up in towns and villages for those who go to work sustainably, and that incentives for such a return to work will be noted in most Slovenian municipalities and other public institutions for at least one week.

As explained, this year's European Mobility Week will see co-financing of actions in 52 municipalities, with an average co-financing amount of EUR 9500. Over the three years to the end of 2026, a total of EUR 1.2 million will be allocated from the Climate Change Fund to co-finance activities related to this week.

"The automotive sector remains a major challenge for our society, and if we want a successful, safe and satisfying future for ourselves and our children, we must address this challenge as soon as possible. European Mobility Week is an annual opportunity to change our attitude to the car,' stressed Minister for Environment, Climate and Energy Bojan Kumer on this occasion.

Transport costs

The value of external transport costs in Slovenia in 2021 was estimated by the Environment Agency of the RS at around 4,6% of gross domestic product (GDP), 99% of which were caused by road traffic. One third of the costs are related to road accidents, one fifth to traffic jams, an additional 18 percent to climate change, 15 percent to air pollution, seven percent to habitat damage and six percent to noise.

"Although the death toll has fallen slightly in recent years, traffic accidents have claimed an average of 110 unacceptable deaths per year in the past decade", the ministry said. The Agency for Transport Safety, which participates in the activities of the European Mobility Week, called on the Commission to improve the safety of vulnerable transport participants.
2024-09-13.english_title: European mobility: changing our attitude to the car

2024-09-13.author: G. K.
2024-09-13.content:
Marta Kos na očitek Romane Tomc: Nisem sodelovala z jugoslovansko Udbo

Evroposlanka Romana Tomc: Marta Kos je neprimerna za komisarko

Na račun slovenske kandidatke za evropsko komisarko Marte Kos je evroposlanka Romana Tomc nanizala številne očitke in ji med drugim v izjavi za portal Euronews očitala sodelovanje z jugoslovansko tajno službo Udbo. Marta Kos je vse navedbe zanikala.

Evroposlanka Romana Tomc (EPP/SDS) je že v sredo v izjavi na omrežju X izrazila nezadovoljstvo z izbiro slovenske vlade za kandidatko za evropsko komisarko, češ da nima ustreznih kompetenc za zasedbo najvišjih izvršilnih funkcij, da ima prebivališče v Švici in ne v EU-ju ter da je nekdanja sodelavka tajne službe, mandat veleposlanice pa naj bi predčasno končala zaradi mobinga.

Očitke je danes ponovila za spletni portal Euronews, na katerem je Marto Kos opisala kot "popolnoma nesprejemljivo" in "problematično" za Evropsko ljudsko stranko (EPP). Znova je izpostavila njeno pomanjkanje izkušenj na izvršnih položajih ter domnevne povezave z Udbo.

"Si lahko predstavljate, da bi nekdo na primer v Nemčiji imenoval kandidata, obremenjenega s sodelovanjem s Stasijem v preteklosti?" je njene besede navedel portal.

Kos: Nisem sodelovala z Udbo

Kandidatka za komisarko Marta Kos je za STA zatrdila, da nikoli ni bila sodelavka ali informatorka Udbe. Dodala je, da so se te obtožbe z namenom diskreditacije prvič pojavile, ko je leta 2022 napovedala kandidaturo za predsednico.

"Preden sem postala veleposlanica v Nemčiji in Švici, so me varnostne službe v obeh državah preverile. (...) Če bi kadar koli škodovala interesom Slovenije, ne bi mogla delati v slovenski vladi ali biti veleposlanica," je zapisala.

Zavrača tudi očitke Romane Tomc, da nima vodstvenih ali političnih izkušenj. Navaja, da je bila dve leti direktorica urada vlade za komuniciranje in tiskovna predstavnica vlade, tri leta podpredsednica Gospodarske zbornice Slovenije. "V tem času sem bila nadrejena gospe Tomc, ki je to očitno pozabila. Dobro se je spominjam, saj je kot vodja službe za javna naročila dobro opravljala svoje delo," je dodala.

Domnevni mobing na veleposlaništvu

Očitke, da naj bi z veleposlaniškega mesta v Švici odstopila zaradi mobinga, je označila za izmišljene. "Kot veleposlanica sem za svoje delo vsako leto dobila najvišjo oceno delovne uspešnosti – odlično," je zapisala.

Marta Kos je junija 2020 predčasno odstopila s položaja veleposlanice v Švici, kot razlog pa je navedla drugačne poglede na vodenje veleposlaništva in zunanje politike. Potrdila je, da je bil njen odstop povezan tudi z izrednim nadzorom vodenja veleposlaništva v Bernu, podrobnosti pa niso znane.

Zunanja ministrica Tanja Fajon je v četrtek v oddaji Tarča na TV Slovenija o tem dejala, da je kot ministrica seznanjena tudi s preteklostjo veleposlanikov in tudi s poročili o nadzoru. "To so v glavnem postopki interne narave," je dodala.

Spletni portal Politico je pred tem v četrtek pisal o svetovalni karieri Marte Kos v lobističnem podjetju Kreab. Kos je za portal dejala, da se ne vidi kot lobistka, bo pa iz podjetja izstopila, ko bo predsednica Evropske komisije objavila seznam svojih komisarskih kandidatov in bo tudi sama na njem.
2024-09-13.title: Marta Kos na očitek Romane Tomc: Nisem sodelovala z jugoslovansko Udbo
2024-09-13.english_content:
Marta Kos to the father of Roma Tomc: I did not cooperate with the Yugoslav Udbo

European Commissioner Romano Tomc: Marta Kos is unsuitable for Commissioner

The European Commissioner Romano Tomc made a number of complaints against the Slovenian candidate for European Commissioner Marte Kos, accusing her of working with the Yugoslav secret service Udbo in a statement to Euronews. Marta Kos has denied all the allegations.

MEP Romana Tomc (EPP/SDS) expressed dissatisfaction with the Slovenian government's choice as a candidate for the European Commissioner on Wednesday in a statement on Network X, saying that she lacked the appropriate powers to hold senior executive positions, that she resided in Switzerland and not in the EU, and that she was a former secret service employee and that the ambassador's term of office was due to be ended prematurely by mobbing.

She repeated her remarks today for the Euronews website, in which she described Marta Kos as "completely unacceptable" and "problematic" for the European People's Party (EPP). It also revealed her lack of experience in executive positions and alleged links to Udbo.

"Can you imagine someone in Germany, for example, nominating a candidate who has been burdened with working with the Stasi in the past?" the portal quoted her as saying.

I didn't work with Udbo.

Commissioner candidate Marta Kos has claimed for STA that she was never an associate or informant of Udba. She added that the allegations of discreditation first emerged when she announced her candidacy for president in 2022.

"Before I became ambassador to Germany and Switzerland, I was examined by security services in both countries. (...) If it ever damaged Slovenia's interests, she could not work for the Slovenian government or be an ambassador,' she wrote.

He also denies Romane Tomc's claims that he has no leadership or political experience. She states that she was Director of the Government Communications Office and Government Press Secretary for two years, and Vice-President of the Chamber of Commerce of Slovenia for three years. "At that time I was the superior of Mrs. Tomc, who had obviously forgotten. I remember her well because as head of public procurement, she did her job well", she added.

Suspected mobbing at the embassy

She called the allegations that she was to resign from her Swiss embassy city over the mobbing a fabrication. "As ambassador, I received the highest work performance rating every year for my work,  ⁇  excellent", she wrote.

In June 2020, Marta Kos resigned from her position as Ambassador to Switzerland prematurely, citing differences of views on the conduct of the Embassy and foreign policy. It confirmed that its resignation was also linked to the emergency control of the management of the Embassy in Bern, details of which are not known.

Foreign Minister Tanja Fajon said on Thursday in a programme on TV Slovenia's Tarča that she was also aware of the ambassadors' past and of the surveillance reports as a minister. "These are mainly internal processes", she added.

The online portal Politico previously posted on Thursday about Marta Kos' consulting career at lobbying firm Kreab. Kos told the portal that she did not see herself as a lobbyist but would leave the company when the European Commission president publishes her list of Commissioner candidates and will be on it herself.
2024-09-13.english_title: Marta Kos to the father of Roma Tomc: I did not cooperate with the Yugoslav Udbo

2024-09-13.content:
Interpelacija Stojmenove Duh na redni septembrski seji DZ-ja

Ministrica za digitalno preobrazbo Emilija Stojmenova Duh se bo pred poslanci zagovarjala na redni seji, ki se bo začela 23. septembra, je sklenil kolegij predsednice DZ-ja, ki je določil dnevni red seje.

Na njej DZ čaka tudi vrsta zakonskih predlogov, za katere bodo poslanci odločali, ali so primerni za nadaljnjo obravnavo.

Ministrica za digitalno preobrazbo se bo že drugič v pol leta v DZ-ju zagovarjala zaradi nakupa 13.000 računalnikov. Tudi tokrat so interpelacijo vložili poslanci SDS-a, ki so se sklicevali na mnenje Računskega sodišča, da nakup ni bil opravljen v skladu z načeli učinkovitosti in gospodarnosti. SDS ministrici med drugim očita nevestno opravljanje dela in zavajanje javnosti, Stojmenova Duh pa odgovarja, da delo opravlja transparentno in z gospodarnim upravljanjem javnih sredstev.

Stojmenovo Duh sicer podpira tako premier Robert Golob kot poslanska skupina Svobode, so sporočili pretekli teden. Glede izrekanja podpore ministrici za digitalno preobrazbo pa so zadržani v obeh manjših strankah koalicije, SD-ju in Levici. Javno je sicer niso pozvali k odstopu, čeprav naj bi o tem prejšnji teden razmišljali v SD-ju, oboji pa pričakujejo dodatna pojasnila Stojmenove Duh.

Poleg interpelacije ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo so na septembrsko sejo predstavniki poslanskih skupin uvrstili tudi nekaj zakonskih besedil. Med njimi je predlog novega zakona o letalstvu, ki bo sedanjega nadgradil tako, da bo civilno letalstvo prilagojeno sodobnim pristopom pri zagotavljanju letalske varnosti, tehnologiji, sistemom in postopkom v civilnem letalstvu. Hkrati bo urejal vojaško in policijsko letalstvo.

Na septembrski seji bodo poslanci opravili tudi splošno razpravo o številnih zakonskih predlogih. Med njimi je predlog vladne novele zakona o lokalnih volitvah. Predlog novele sledi odločbi ustavnega sodišča, z njo pa želijo urediti volilni spor. Obenem vlada predlaga še nekatere spremembe, vezane na volilne postopke in opravila.

Prav tako bodo odločili, ali je predlog novele zakona o varstvu javnega reda in miru primeren za nadaljnjo obravnavo. Gre za predlog poslanskih skupin Svobode, SD-ja in Levice, s katerim želijo prepovedati poveličevanja nacizma in fašizma.

Tudi o vladnem predlogu novele zakona o gospodarskih družbah, s katerim se v slovenski pravni red prenašajo štiri evropske direktive, bodo poslanci opravili prvo branje. Z novelo želijo pristojni zagotoviti večjo preglednost poslovanja in večjo družbeno odgovornost gospodarskih družb.

DZ bo prav tako opravil prvo obravnavo svežnja zakonskih predlogov NSi-ja, povezanih z romsko tematiko. S predlogom sprememb zakona o osnovni šoli naj bi zaščititi žrtve, nasilnemu otroku pa bi bilo mogoče odrediti začasno šolanje na daljavo, ga vključiti v vzgojni program za socializacijo ali pa ga celo izključiti iz šole.

V poslanski skupini NSi-ja so tudi nadgradili sveženj zakonov, ki jih je v DZ vložila že skupina županov občin jugovzhodne Slovenije in Posavja, a jih je DZ zavrnil. Tako dodatno predlagajo spremembe zakona o starševskem varstvu in družinskih prejemkih, o socialnovarstvenih prejemkih, o urejanju trga dela in o voznikih.

Kolegij predsednice DZ-ja je na današnji seji potrdil tudi terminski program dela DZ-ja za oktober in okviren terminski program za november.

Poleg tega so predstavniki poslanskih skupin sklenili, da se predlogi novel zakona o spodbujanju rabe obnovljivih virov energije, zakona o dedovanju ter zakona o sodnem svetu obravnavajo po skrajšanem postopku.

Interpretation of the Spirit of Styman at the September regular meeting of the DZ

Minister of Digital Transformation Emilia Stömenova Spirit will speak to MEPs at the regular session starting on 23 September, the ZD Presidency College has decided on the agenda.

The DZ also awaits a number of legislative proposals for the Members to decide on whether they are suitable for further consideration.

The Ministry of Digital Transformation will be defending the purchase of 13,000 computers for the second time in six months in the DZ. The SDS members also lodged an appeal, citing the opinion of the Court of Auditors that the purchase was not made in accordance with the principles of efficiency and economy. The SDS ministers are accused of involuntary work and public deceit, and the Spirit of Stojmen is responsible for conducting the work in a transparent and economic manner.

While Stämen's Spirit supports both Prime Minister Robert Golob and the Freedom Party, they announced last week. According to the statement of support, the ministers for digital transformation are being held in the two smaller coalition parties, the SD and the Left. They've obviously not called for a resignation, although they were supposed to discuss it last week in the SD, and they're both expecting further explanations from the Styman Spirit.

In addition to the interpellation of the Minister for Digital Transformation, several legislative texts were also included by the representatives of the parliamentary groups at the September meeting. The Commission has also proposed a new aviation law to upgrade the existing one by adapting civil aviation to modern approaches to aviation safety, technology, systems and procedures in civil aviation. He'll be in charge of the military and police aviation at the same time.

At its September meeting, MEPs will also have a general debate on a number of legislative proposals. Among them is the proposal for a government novel law on local elections. The draft news follows a decision by the Constitutional Court, and they want to settle the electoral dispute. At the same time, the government is proposing some changes to the electoral procedures and procedures.

They will also decide whether the draft new law on the protection of public order and peace is appropriate for further consideration. It's a proposal by the Freedom, SD and Left groups to ban the expansion of Nazism and fascism.

Parliament also has a first reading on the government proposal for a new law on companies transposing four European directives into the Slovenian legal order. The new approach aims to ensure greater transparency of business and greater social responsibility of companies.

The JRC will also conduct the first examination of a series of draft legislation of the NSI relating to Roma issues. The proposed amendments to the Basic School Act are intended to protect victims and the child who is abused could be ordered to attend distance education on a temporary basis, be included in a socialisation programme or even expelled from school.

The NSi parliamentary group also updated the package of laws already submitted to the DZ by a group of mayors of the municipalities of south-east Slovenia and Posavia, but rejected by the DZ. They also propose amendments to the Parental and Family Welfare, Social Security, Labour Market Regulation and Driver's Act.

The College of the President of the ZO also approved the October work programme and the November framework programme at today's meeting.

In addition, the representatives of the parliamentary groups concluded that the draft new laws on the promotion of the use of renewable energy, the inheritance law and the judiciary law were to be dealt with in a shortened procedure.

2024-09-13.content:
SD po reviziji sredstva tujih državljanov nakazal v humanitarne namene

V stranki SD so popravili nepravilnost, ki jo je ob reviziji poročila o pravilnosti poslovanja stranke v letu 2022 odkrilo Računsko sodišče.

Slabe tri tisočake, ki jih je stranka dobila od tujih državljanov, so nakazali v humanitarne namene, izhaja iz porevizijskega poročila.

Računsko sodišče je v osnovni reviziji julija ugotovilo, da je stranka SD v letu 2022 na redni transakcijski račun prejela denarna prispevka v znesku 2900 evrov od fizičnih oseb, ki nista bila državljana Slovenije, kar ni bilo v skladu z zakonom o političnih strankah.

Ta namreč določa, da je prepovedano pridobivanje sredstev stranke iz prispevkov tujih fizičnih oseb. Prispevke, ki so ji dani v nasprotju z zakonom, pa mora stranka najpozneje v 30 dneh od prejema nakazati v humanitarne namene, česar SD ni storil.

Je pa to storil po reviziji Računskega sodišča in v odzivnem poročilu tudi izkazal, da je 12. avgusta nakazal denar v navedenem znesku v humanitarne namene. Zato so revizorji popravljalni ukrep ocenili kot zadovoljiv.

V osnovnem revizijskem poročilu o poslovanju SD-ja je Računsko sodišče sicer stranki izreklo pozitivno mnenje.
2024-09-13.title: SD po reviziji sredstva tujih državljanov nakazal v humanitarne namene
2024-09-13.english_content:
The SD after the audit of the funds of foreign nationals transferred for humanitarian purposes

The Court of Auditors has also examined the compatibility of the measures with the internal market.

The three thousand dollars received by the client from foreign nationals were charged for humanitarian purposes, according to the tax report.

The Court of Auditors found in its basic audit in July that the SD party received a monetary contribution of EUR 2900 to the ordinary transaction account in 2022 from natural persons who were not citizens of Slovenia, which was not in accordance with the Political Parties Act.

It provides that it is prohibited to obtain the assets of a customer from contributions of foreign natural persons. The parties shall submit to the Court of Justice a request for a declaration of compliance with the provisions of this Regulation.

However, he did so after the Court of Auditors' audit and in the reply he also indicated that he had transferred the money in that amount on 12 August for humanitarian purposes. Therefore, the auditors considered the corrective action satisfactory.

However, in the basic audit report on the operation of SD, the Court of Auditors gave a positive opinion to the client.

2024-09-13.content:
Brezplačno cepljenje nosečnic za zaščito novorojenčkov pred RSV-jem

Cepljenje bo na voljo tudi za starejše od 60 let, a zanje ne bo brezplačno

S prihodnjim tednom se bodo lahko nosečnice v UKC-ju Ljubljana brezplačno cepile proti respiratornemu sincicijskemu virusu, ki je zelo nevaren za novorojenčke oziroma dojenčke. Cepljenje je priporočeno tudi za starejše od 60 let s pridruženimi boleznimi.

Respiratorni sincicijski virus (RSV) je v svetovnem merilu najpogostejši vzrok hospitalizacije majhnih otrok. Najbolj ogroža otroke, mlajše od enega leta, nedonošenčke, otroke z bronhopulmonalno displazijo, otroke s srčno-žilnimi boleznimi in Downovim sindromom. Pri večjem otroku in odraslem okužba z RSV-jem običajno poteka s prehladnimi znaki. Za novorojenčke in dojenčke pa je RSV nevaren in lahko povzroči okužbo spodnjih dihal, pljučnico in bronhiolitis, v nekaterih primerih pa zahteva intenzivno terapijo.

Pa svetu zaradi okužbe z respiratornim sincicijskim virusom zboli okoli 30 milijonov ljudi, približno 10 odstotkov jih potrebuje hospitalizacijo, po nekaterih podatkih pa letno zaradi posledic RSV-ja na svetu umre do 100 tisoč otrok, je v izjavi za javnost povedala vodja cepilnega centra s klinike za infekcijske bolezni UKC-ja Ljubljana Nina Grasselli Kmet. 

V UKC Ljubljana bodo proti RSV-ju začeli cepiti prihodnji teden oziroma v torek, 17. septembra. Namenjeno je nosečnicam med 24. in 36. tednom, zanje je cepljenje brezplačno. Proti RSV-ju pa se lahko samoplačniško cepijo tudi starejši od 60 let, pri katerih prav tako lahko nastanejo zapleti ali se pojavi hujši potek bolezni ob okužbi. Cepljenje priporočajo predvsem starejšim s pridruženimi boleznimi.

Nosečnice lahko s cepljenjem proti RSV-ju zaščitijo novorojenčke in dojenčke do  dopolnjenega šestega meseca starosti in tako preprečijo najhujše oblike te okužbe, je za medije pojasnil Miha Lučovnik iz ginekološke klinike UKC-ja Ljubljana.

Po cepljenju namreč telo nosečnice ustvari protitelesa, ki delujejo kot zaščita pred okužbo, ta nato skozi posteljico pridejo v kri ploda. "Ko se otrok rodi, ima dovolj protiteles, da ne zboli. Poleg tega gredo protitelesa tudi v materino mleko, zato so otroci, ki so dojeni, še dodatno zaščiteni," je dejal Lučovnik.

Poudaril je tudi, da je cepivo varno. "Imamo zelo veliko dokazov, da pri novorojenčkih nima neželenih učinkov," je dodal. Gre namreč za mrtvo cepivo in ne za cepivo, ki bi vsebovalo živi virus in bi teoretično lahko okužilo plod. Vsebuje le beljakovine, na katere reagira imunski sistem nosečnice in ustvari protitelesa, ki otroka zaščitijo. 

Naročanje na cepljenje proti RSV-ju ni nujno, je pa zaradi lažje organizacije priporočljivo, zato v UKC-ju Ljubljana vseeno pozivajo k naročanju po elektronskem naslovu: cepljenje.info@kclj.si.
2024-09-13.title: Brezplačno cepljenje nosečnic za zaščito novorojenčkov pred RSV-jem
2024-09-13.english_content:
Free vaccination of pregnant women to protect newborns from RSV

Vaccination will also be available for people over 60 years of age, but not free

From next week, pregnant women will be able to receive free vaccinations against respiratory sync disease, which is very dangerous for newborns or infants. Vaccination is also recommended for those over 60 years of age with associated diseases.

Respiratory sync virus (RSV) is the most common cause of hospitalization of young children worldwide. It is most at risk of developing children under one year of age, infants, children with bronchopulmonary dysplasia, children with cardiovascular disease and Down syndrome. In older children and adults, RSV infection usually presents with cold symptoms. For newborns and infants, RSV is dangerous and can cause lower respiratory infections, pneumonia and bronchiolitis, and in some cases requires intensive therapy.

Globally, about 30 million people are infected with respiratory sync virus, about 10 percent of whom need hospitalization, and some estimates put up to 100,000 children dying each year from the effects of RSV worldwide, said Nina Grasselli Kmet, head of the vaccination centre at Ljubljana's UKC infectious disease clinic, in a statement.

Vaccinations against the RSV will start next week or on Tuesday 17 September at UKC Ljubljana. It is intended for pregnant women between 24 and 36 weeks, for whom the vaccination is free. Self-immunization against RSV can also be carried out on persons over 60 years of age, who may also develop complications or develop a worse course of infection. Vaccination is recommended especially for older people with associated diseases.

Pregnant women can protect newborns and infants up to the age of six months by vaccinating against RSV, thus preventing the worst forms of this infection, Miha Lučovnik of the UKC Gynecological Clinic in Ljubljana explained to the media.

After vaccination, the body produces antibodies that protect against infection and then enter the fetal bloodstream through the uterus. "When a baby is born, it has enough antibodies to keep it from getting sick. In addition, antibodies also enter the breast milk, so infants are further protected", said Lučovnik.

He also stressed that the vaccine is safe. "We have a very large body of evidence that it has no side effects in newborns", he added. This is a dead vaccine, not a vaccine that contains a living virus and could theoretically infect the fetus. It contains only proteins that the immune system of the pregnant woman reacts to and creates antibodies to protect the baby.

The Commission has also concluded that the Commission's decision to grant the aid to the Ljubljana Region is not necessary.
2024-09-13.english_title: Free vaccination of pregnant women to protect newborns from RSV

2024-09-13.author: Metka Pirc, Jolanda Lebar
2024-09-13.content:
Sebastijan Seme: Zaprtje Teša bi moralo zanimati vse

Nova epizoda oddaje Ob osmih

Z zaprtjem Teša bomo čez noč ostali brez pomembnega energetskega vira, opozarja dekan Fakultete za energetiko Univerze v Mariboru Sebastijan Seme.

Ključno vprašanje, s katerim bi se morali kot država in družba po zaprtju Teša ukvarjati, je, ali želimo energetsko samooskrbo, je v oddaji Ob osmih dejal Sebastijan Seme. "Tako energetsko kot z drugih vidikov. In če je ta odgovor pozitiven, potem se moramo dogovoriti, kako bomo to samooskrbo zagotavljali. Ali bodo to samo obnovljivi viri? Tu bi prišle v poštev hidroelektrarne. Torej bi morali začeti projekcije graditve hidroelektrarne na zgornji Savi, dokončati Mokrice. Potem vključitev drugega bloka jedrske elektrarne. Naprej soproizvodnja toplotne električne energije in tako dalje. Vse to je treba ustrezno umestiti in začeti graditi, da bo vse pravočasno zgrajeno. Odgovoriti si moramo tudi na vprašanje, ali želimo energetsko varnost, da ne bomo odvisni od drugih držav."

Plavajoča elektrarna v obliki srca

Bi na Družmirskem jezeru pri Šoštanju, ki ji nastalo kot posledica izkopavanja premoga, lahko nastala največja plavajoča sončna elektrarna v Evropi? Lahko, a ne le to, pravi Seme. "Lahko bi bila zelo dober zgled ali pa priložnost za več dejavnikov v sami dolini. Z raziskovalnega ali turističnega vidika. Na področju raziskovanja vidim zelo velike priložnosti raziskovanja jezera pod sončno elektrarno; kaj se z okoljskega vidika dogaja z vodnim ekosistemom pod elektrarno. Kar se tiče turizma, mora biti predstavljeno kot turistična zanimivost, v obliki nekega srca, na primer, ali v kakšni drugi obliki, ki bi bila zanimiva s pogleda z višine, ne vem, na primer iz letala ali helikopterja. Morali bi zgraditi sprehajalne poti v okolici ali napraviti mostičke med samimi moduli. Če bi bilo tako, bi verjetno okoliški prebivalci to sprejeli, saj takšna elektrarna ne bi bila tujek v okolju."

Proizvodnja zelenega vodika

Kar 40, 50 let je trajalo, da je uporaba sončne energije postala množična, da se uporablja komercialno, pravi Seme. Prelomne so bile zlasti gospodarske krize. "Enako se bo dogajalo tudi z vodikom. Če bodo razne spodbude Evropske unije dovolj dobre in bo želja politike, da se to vpelje, velika, potem bo uporaba zelenega vodika mogoča v naslednjih petih do desetih letih. Vodik bi se uporabljal za shranjevanje odvečne električne energije, proizvedene iz sončnih elektrarn. Pretvoril bi se v vodik, potem pa spet v električno energijo. Uporabljal bi se lahko za mestne avtobuse ali druga vozila v prevozu."

Lokacija Teša mora ostati namenjena energetiki

"Kot energetik bi bil zelo razočaran, če se ta lokacija, ki je tudi zgodovinsko strateška za Slovenijo, ukine in se ne nazadnje izgubi vse to znanje, ki je bilo v 50 in več letih pridobljeno z razvojem novih tehnologij na tem področju. V Šoštanju, na tej lokaciji, je treba narediti nekaj novega." Možnosti je več, pravi Seme, energetski plin, sosežig ali sežig odpadkov, tudi mali moduralni jedrski reaktorji.

Pogovor v celoti v novi epizodi oddaje Ob osmih.
2024-09-13.title: Sebastijan Seme: Zaprtje Teša bi moralo zanimati vse
2024-09-13.english_content:
The closure of the Tessa should be of interest to everyone

New episode of the show At eight

With the closure of Tessa, we will be without a significant source of energy overnight, warns the dean of the Faculty of Energy at Maribor University, Sebastián Sema.

The key question that we as a country and society should address after the closure of Tessa is whether we want energy self-sufficiency, said Sebastian Seme on the programme Ob osmy. "As energetic as in other aspects. And if that answer is positive, then we need to agree on how we're going to provide that self-sufficiency. Will it be only renewable resources? This would be a hydroelectric plant. So we should start projecting for a hydroelectric plant on the upper Sava, finish the wetlands. Then we'll start the second block of nuclear power plants. Forward co-generation of thermal electricity and so on. All this needs to be properly placed and started to build in order to get everything built in time. We must also answer the question of whether we want energy security so that we do not depend on other countries.'

Floating heart-shaped power plant

Could the largest floating solar power plant in Europe be built on Lake Djurmyr near Shostanje, which was created by coal mining? Yes, but not only that, says the Seed. "It could be a very good example or an opportunity for multiple factors in the valley itself. From a research or tourist point of view. In the field of research, I see very great opportunities to explore the lake under the solar power plant; what is happening to the aquatic ecosystem under the power plant from an environmental point of view. As far as tourism is concerned, it has to be presented as a tourist attraction, in the form of a heart, for example, or in some other form that would be interesting from a height, I don't know, from an airplane or a helicopter. We should build walkways around the area or build bridges between the modules themselves. If so, the surrounding population would likely accept it, since such a power plant would not be a stranger to the environment".

Production of green hydrogen

It took 40, 50 years for solar energy to become mass-produced for commercial use, says Seeme. The economic crisis was particularly pivotal. "The same thing will happen with hydrogen. If the various incentives of the European Union are good enough and the policy will be keen to implement them, then the use of green hydrogen will be possible within the next five to 10 years. Hydrogen would be used to store excess electricity generated from solar power plants. It would turn into hydrogen, then back into electricity. It could be used for city buses or other vehicles in transport.'

Location of Tesha must remain for energy

"As an energy company, it would be very disappointing if this location, which is also historically strategic for Slovenia, were to be abolished and not least all the knowledge gained over 50 years or more by the development of new technologies in this field was lost. In Shoshita, at this location, something new needs to be done. "I'm not There are more options, says Seema, for energy gas, co-incineration or waste incineration, even small modular nuclear reactors.

The interview is complete in the new episode of the show, "At Eight".
2024-09-13.english_title: The closure of the Tessa should be of interest to everyone

Ali bodo onkološki bolniki sami zbrali denar za pospešitev gradnje mariborske onkologije?

Spor glede odkupne cene stanovanj

Država in stanovalci na Masarykovi ulici v Mariboru še niso dosegli dogovora o odkupni ceni njihovih stanovanj. Onkološki bolnici pa sta pozvali onkološke bolnike, da skupaj zberejo razliko v ceni in pospešijo gradnjo nove onkologije.

Gradnja nove mariborske urgence bi morala biti po poročanju medijev končana junija 2025, vendar v ozadju potekajo neuspešni pogovori med državo in stanovalci za izselitev trinajstih okoliških stanovanj.

Onkološki bolnici, ki sta pred mesecem dni opozorili na nevzdržne razmere na mariborski onkologiji, sta onkološke bolnike in tiste, ki so preboleli raka, vseh je več kot 110 tisoč, pozvali, da skupaj zberejo manjkajoči denar, približno 300 tisoč evrov, ki se ga državi ne zdi vredno iztrgati za odkup stanovanj.

"Če da vsak en evro, je to 110 tisoč evrov. Vsak ima, upam, vsaj enega podpornega sorodnika, če da še ta po evro, je to že 220 tisoč evrov," je dejala onkološka bolnica Polona Selič Zupančič.Pomoč pričakujejo tudi od županov severovzhodne Slovenije, saj so to ne nazadnje prebivalci njihovih krajev, ki so ali bodo zboleli za rakom.

"Vladajoči v politiki se obnašajo, kot da jih oblast in moč ščitita pred boleznijo, kot da gre za težavo dveh histeričnih babnic in revežev iz severovzhodne Slovenije, ki so si sami krivi, če se bodo morali z rešilnim avtomobilom voziti v Ljubljano," je dodala Polona Selič Zupančič.

Žalosti nas, da se to dogaja, pa pravijo pri Društvu za boj proti raku Štajerske iz Maribora. "Dobili smo potrditev, da bomo 15. novembra imeli ponovno modno revijo, in vsa sredstva z modne revije gredo za onkološki inštitut oziroma onkološki oddelek v Mariboru," je pojasnila Zvezdana Maurič Vražič, predsednica Društva za boj proti raku Štajerske, pri katerem bodo že v naslednjem tednu odprli račun za zbiranje potrebnega denarja. Potrebni znesek bodo skušali zbrati še z dobrodelnim koncertom.

Bolnici pa pozivata odvetnika in stanovalce, naj ne spreminjajo več svojih zahtev. Hkrati pa upata, da ministrstvo za zdravje ne bo našlo novega razloga za upočasnitev gradnje.
2024-09-26.title: Ali bodo onkološki bolniki sami zbrali denar za pospešitev gradnje mariborske onkologije?

Will cancer patients raise the money themselves to speed up the construction of Maribor oncology?

Dispute over the purchase price of the apartments

The State and the residents of Masaryk Street in Maribor have not yet reached an agreement on the purchase price of their apartments. Cancer hospitals have invited cancer patients to work together to collect the difference in price and accelerate the construction of a new oncology.

The construction of the new maritime emergency centre should be completed by June 2025, according to media reports, but in the background, there are unsuccessful talks between the state and residents to move the 13 surrounding dwellings.

Cancer hospitals, which a month ago warned of the intolerable situation in marine oncology, have called on cancer patients and those who have survived cancer, more than 110,000 of them, to raise the money they need, about 300,000 euros, which the country does not think is worth spending to buy housing.

"If every euro is one, it's 110,000 euros. Everyone has, I hope, at least one supportive relative, and if he gives away the euro, that's already 220,000 euros", said Polona Selic Zupančić, a cancer hospital. They also expect help from the mayors of northeastern Slovenia, as they are not least of all the people in their areas who are or will be affected by cancer.

"The political rulers act as if power and power protect them from disease, as if it were the problem of two hysterical grandmothers and poor people from northeastern Slovenia who blame themselves if they have to drive an ambulance to Ljubljana", added Polona Selič Zupančić.

We're saddened that this is happening, but the Maribor Styrian Cancer Society says. "We have received confirmation that we will have a fashion magazine again on November 15, and all funds from the fashion magazine will go to the Maribor Cancer Institute or Cancer Department", explained Zvezdana Maurič Vražič, president of the Styers Cancer Society, which will open an account to raise the necessary money next week. They're gonna try to raise the money they need by giving a charity concert.

The hospitals are urging the lawyers and the tenants to stay on their demands. At the same time, they hope that the Ministry of Health will not find another reason to slow down construction.
2024-09-26.english_title: Will cancer patients raise the money themselves to speed up the construction of Maribor oncology?

2024-09-26.content:
Tarča: Jesenski kadrovski in vsebinski izzivi politike

Kaj menijo politiki o pojasnilih ministrice o vožnji z modrimi lučmi po Avstriji? Kako odhodi ministrov in iskanje novih kandidatov vplivajo na vsebinsko delo vlade? Kaj bo z zdravstveno in plačno reformo?

Nocoj bodo v Tarči govorili o jesenskih kadrovskih in vsebinskih izzivih politike. Iz prvotne ministrske zasedbe stranke Gibanje Svoboda je ostala le še peterica ministrov. Po Tatjani Bobnar je odšel Danijel Bešič Loredan, potem Sanja Ajanović Hovnik, Irena Šinko, Uroš Brežan, Darjo Felda, Marjan Šarec se je preselil v Bruselj, danes se je umaknila še Emilija Stojmenova Duh. Odšla je dan oziroma le nekaj ur pred drugo interpelacijo, potem ko se je zapletla v še eno afero, poskušala je namreč doseči umik postopka zaradi prehitre vožnje v Avstriji.

V studio Tarče po odhodu ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo, ki se ni odzvala na povabilo v oddajo, prihajajo Luka Mesec (Levica), Lenart Žavbi (Svoboda), Jani Prednik (SD), neodvisna poslanka Mojca Šetinc Pašek, Jernej Vrtovec (NSi) in Rado Gladek (SDS). Pogovarjali se bodo tudi o tem, kako pogoste menjave vplivajo na delo vlade, in o napovedanih reformah.

Kot je v prispevku za Tarčo poročala novinarka Anja Šter je ministrica Emilija Stojmenova Duh še 15 ur pred začetkom Svetovnega vrha o informacijski družbi, da bi ujela let z dunajskega letališča proti Ženevi, v službenem vozilom Audi A6 drvela po avstrijski avtocesti z modrimi lučmi zato, da bi obšla kolono. Vozilo pa je ujel radar.

Namesto, da bi ministrstvo avstrijski policiji plačalo globo, se je ministrica raje poskušala kazni izogniti, je prvi objavil N1. V dopisu z dne prvega avgusta je prosila slovenskega veleposlanika na Dunaju,da obvesti pristojni organ, da odstopijo od morebitnega pregona oziroma kaznovanja voznika.

"Z vidika ugleda Republike Slovenije svetujemo, da se za oprostitev plačila kazni ne zaprosi ter da se kazen poravna.« In še, da "Uporaba modrih luči v takih primerih ni dovoljena niti v Sloveniji, na ozemlju tuje države pa jih slovenska vozila sploh ne bi smela uporabljati," jim je veleposlaništvo odgovorilo v usklajenem odgovoru z zunanjim ministrom 6 dni kasneje.

Zaradi nasprotujočih se informacij je Televizija Slovenija po telefonu govorila tudi z voznikom Emilije Stojmenove Duh, a je pred oddajo prepovedal objavo vsebine pogovora. Prav tako tudi policija ni posredovala dokumentacije o dogodku.

Zakaj politika podpira Stojmenovo Duh?

Kljub vsemu pa nič ne spremeni dejstva, da je ministrica sploh pomislila na to, da globe ne bi poravnali? Ali jo je tako kot nekatere druge politike zaslepil prestiž in moč, ki ga prinaša ministrska funkcija: osebni vozniki, rdeče preproge, povabila na visoke dogodke … in se spozabijo pri banalnih stvareh, kot je vožnja z modrimi lučmi ali pa brezplačno bivanje v hotelu, je še poročala novinarka Anja Šter.

Kljub temu, da so ministri že zaradi podobnih ali celo manjših obtožb morali odstopiti –denimo Sanja Ajanović Hovnik, Irena Šinko in Uroš Brežan – jo strankarski kolegi od oktobra lani, ko je prvič v javnosti izbruhnila afera z nakupom prenosnih računalnikov na spletnem portalu Preiskovalno, vztrajno podpirajo.

Kot je dejal Lenart Žavbi (Svoboda) januarja o aferi računalniki, se mu zdi, da je problem pri zakonu nastal v medresorskem razumevanju same zakonske materije. "Torej ni ministrstvo za digitalno preobrazbo tisto, ki je po zakonu, ki smo ga sprejeli, odgovorno za to, da deli te računalnike."

"V bistvu ne vem, kje sploh je afera. Da so še zmeraj v skladišču. Kaj, to, da so v skladišču in da je 2500 evrov najemnina za skladišče?" pa se je spraševal minister za finance Klemen Boštjančič.

Na vprašanje ali ministrica Stojmenova Duh uživa podporo premierja pa je ta odgovoril, da "V tem trenutku ni nobenega razloga, da bi dvomil v karkoli ali kogarkoli."

"Upam si trditi, da je bil nakup računalnikov bistveno boljši kot kakršenkoli projekt vaše vlade. Še enkrat vas bom spomnil, ker sem vas že, ne bom pozabil, kako so bili moji otroci zadovoljni, ko so si vsi kupili digitalne slušalke," pa je še v ponedeljek Boštjančič branil Stojmenovo Duh.

Ministrici očitajo vrsto nepravilnosti

Ne le 6,5-milijonski sporni nakup računalnikov, ki povzroča vsak dan vse višje stroške, garancija pa jim poteče čez mesec dni, ministrici očitajo vrsto nepravilnosti. Prirejanje razpisov, tukaj je še negospodarno izvajanje večmilijonskega projekta Digi točke – več kot četrtino informacijskih točk so sredi projekta ukinili; sporno kampanjo o medvrstniškem nasilju na spletu – nasprotovali so ji psihologi; številne odhode zaposlenih z ministrstva in slabe rezultate pri krepitvi digitalnih kompetenc prebivalstva ter podjetij. 

"Izpostavil bi nedokončane digitalne javne storitve, kot je naprimer elektronska osebna izkaznica, ki po 2 letih še vedno ne deluje na računalnikih z nameščenih z Linux operacijskim sistemom. Oo drugi strani pa ministrstvo tovrstne računalnike sposoja socialno najšibkejšim…" je kritičen Simon Delakorda, ki se ukvarja s področjem demokracije v digitalni družbi.

Stanje v državni upravi je zastarelo

Medtem ko se ministrica hvali z ukrepi za večjo digitalno vključenost, pa je stanje marsikje v državni upravi zastarelo. Nemalo težav imajo zaposleni na centrih za socialno delo. Marko Fogadič, zaposlen na centru za socialno delo, se pri urejanju vloge za otroški dodatek srečuje s številnimi težavami.

"Procentualno je to ogromen delež delovnega časa, ko sistem ne deluje ali deluje upočasnjeno. Če vzamem primer upočasnjenega delovanja, lahko traja 5 min, da sprovede neko posamezno fazo, ki sicer traja par sekund. Takrat ko je veliko vlog, recimo septembra, se to zelo pozna," je pojasnil Fogadič.

V ljubljanskem zaporu na Povšetovi uporabljajo programe celo še iz prejšnjega stoletja, kot je denimo računalnik z operacijskim sistemom MS DOS iz leta 1992. Z njim uslužbenci ljubljanskega zapora na Povšetovi obračunavajo nagrade za delo obsojencev. Ker je za to potreben poseben računalnik, podatke težko povežejo z drugimi bazami. 

»Na splošno nekorektno komuniciranje z javnostmi, mediji, deležniki, kar spravlja pod vprašanje, koliko je še zaupanje javnosti v delovanje ministrstva za digitalno preobrazbo,« je še zaključil Delakorda.
2024-09-26.title: Tarča: Jesenski kadrovski in vsebinski izzivi politike

Target: Autumn staff and content policy challenges

What do politicians think of the minister's explanations about driving with blue lights in Austria? How do the departures of ministers and the search for new candidates affect the substantive work of the government? What about health and wage reform?

Tonight, the Target will be talking about the fall's personnel and content policy challenges. Only five ministers remain from the original cabinet of the Movement for Freedom. After Tatjana Bobnar, Danijel Bešič Loredan left, then Sanja Ajanović Hovnik, Irena Shinko, Uroš Brežan, Darja Felda, Marjan Sharek moved to Brussels, today Emilia Stojmenova Duh also withdrew. She left the day or just a few hours before her second interpellation after being involved in another affair, in an attempt to get the proceedings withdrawn because of speeding in Austria.

After the departure of the Minister for Digital Transformation, who did not respond to the invitation to broadcast, the studio of Tarča is attended by Luka Mesec (left), Lenart Žavbi (Svoboda), Jani Prednik (SD), the independent MP Mojc Šetinc Pašek, Jernej Vrtovec (NSi) and Rado Gladek (SDS). They will also discuss how frequent changes affect the work of the government and the reforms announced.

As reported in a report for Target by journalist Anja Schter, 15 hours before the World Summit on the Information Society began, Minister Emilia Steinmeier Spirit, in order to catch a flight from Vienna airport to Geneva, was riding an Audi A6 bus on a blue-lighted Austrian highway to pass the column. The vehicle was caught by radar.

Instead of paying the Ministry a fine to the Austrian police, the Minister tried to avoid punishment, N1 first announced. In a letter dated 1 August, she asked the Slovenian Ambassador in Vienna to inform the competent authority that they had waived any prosecution or penalty for the driver.

'In the light of the reputation of the Republic of Slovenia, we advise that no penalty payment is requested and that the penalty is settled. ⁇  Furthermore, that 'The use of blue lights in such cases is not permitted even in Slovenia and on the territory of a foreign country Slovenian vehicles should not use them at all,' the embassy replied to them in a coordinated reply with the Foreign Minister 6 days later.

Due to conflicting information, Televizija Slovenija also spoke by telephone with Emilija Stojmenova Duh, but banned the publication of the content of the conversation before broadcast. Neither did the police provide any documentation of the incident.

Why does politics support the Styman Spirit?

And yet, does the fact that the Minister even thought about not settling the fines change anything? Whether, like some other policies, she was blinded by the prestige and power of the ministerial function: personal drivers, the red carpet, invitations to high-profile events... and forgetting about mundane things like driving with blue lights or staying in a hotel for free, reported journalist Anja Steer.

Although ministers have already had to resign on similar or even smaller charges, including Sanja Ajanović Hovnik, Irena Shinko and Uroš Brežan, her party colleagues have been steadfastly supporting her since October last year, when the laptop-buying affair on the Investigative website first broke out in public.

As Lenart Frog (Freedom) said in January about the computer affair, he seems to think the problem with marriage was the inter-agency understanding of the marriage issue itself. "So the Department of Digital Transformation is not the one that is responsible for sharing these computers under the law we passed".

"I don't know where the affair is. That they're still in the warehouse. What, that they are in a warehouse and that there is a 2,500 euro rent for the warehouse?" asked Finance Minister Klemen Boštjančić.

When asked whether Minister Spirit enjoys the Prime Minister's support, he replied that "at this time there is no reason to doubt anything or anyone".

"I hope to argue that the purchase of computers was significantly better than any project of your government. I will remind you again, because I have already told you, I will not forget how happy my children were when everyone bought their digital headphones", said Boštjančić, defending Stymen's Spirit on Monday.

Ministers are reading the type of irregularity

Not only is the 6.5 million-dollar dispute over the purchase of computers, which is costing more and more every day and guarantees for them are expiring in a month's time, ministers are blaming a number of irregularities. The tendering process, including the economically unsuccessful implementation of the multi-million-dollar project Digi points  ⁇  over a quarter of information points were cancelled during the project; the controversial campaign on gender-based violence online  ⁇  was opposed by psychologists; numerous departures of government employees and poor results in strengthening the digital skills of the population and businesses.

'It would identify unfinished digital public services such as an electronic ID card that still doesn't work on Linux-installed computers after two years. On the other hand, the Ministry of Information loans computers to the most socially vulnerable"... criticised Simon Delacord, who deals with the area of democracy in the digital society.

The State Administration is outdated

While the Minister boasts of measures to increase digital inclusion, the situation of many in the public administration has become obsolete. There's a lot of trouble for social work workers. Marko Fogadić, employed by the Social Work Centre, faces many difficulties in adjusting the child support application.

'This percentage is a huge proportion of working time when the system is not working or is slowing down. If I take a case of slowing down, it can take five minutes to complete a single phase, which takes a couple of seconds. When there is a lot of activity, say in September, this is very well known", explained Fogadič.

The prison in Lublin, Poland, uses programs from the last century, such as the MS DOS computer from 1992. With him, the officers of the prison of Ljubljana in Vashtev count the rewards for the work of the prisoners. Because it requires a special computer, it's difficult to connect data to other databases.

 ⁇ Generally, incorrect communication with the public, the media, stakeholders, which raises questions about the public's confidence in the work of the Ministry of Digital Transformation ⁇  concluded Delakorda.

Opozicija meni, da je odstop ministrice prepozen, Levica ga pozdravlja, SD še molči

Odzivi na odstop ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo Emilije Stojmenove Duh

Odstop ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo Emilije Stojmenove Duh za parlamentarne stranke ni presenečenje. V Levici ministričin odstop ocenjujejo kot pravilno potezo, v SD-ju ga ne komentirajo. V opozicijskih SDS-u in NSi-ju menijo, da je odstop prepozen.

Vodja poslancev Levice Matej Tašner Vatovec je ocenil, da so vsi očitki na račun ministrice vendarle postali pretežka zgodba za celotno koalicijo, zato menijo, da je bila njena odločitev pravilna. "To kaže tudi na neko stopnjo politične higiene. Zdaj pričakujemo, da bo predsednik vlade čim prej tudi našel novega ministra oziroma ministrico," je dejal. Obenem je poudaril, da na ministrstvu poteka kar nekaj pomembnih projektov, tudi zgodba z računalniki je po njegovih besedah pozitivna, zato bi bilo prav, da se naprej vodi na učinkovitejši način.

V  SD-ju, kjer so še danes (četrtek) javno ocenjevali, da je nastopil čas, da ministrica prevzame osebno in objektivno odgovornost, po ponujenem odstopu molčijo in odločitve Stojmenove Duh ne komentirajo.

Za opozicijska SDS in NSi, ki sta v preteklih mesecih nizala ostre kritike na račun ministričinega dela, pa odstop prihaja prepozno. Že ob prvi interpelaciji pred pol leta so bili očitki dovolj veliki, da bi ministrica morala zapustiti svoje delovno mesto, pa je v tem času govorila, kako dela, je poudaril poslanec SDS-a Tomaž Lisec. Po njegovih besedah so upali, da druge interpelacije ne bo. Zgodba tega tedna, afera modre luči, je samo še pika na i, ki kaže, da ministrica ne pozna dela v okviru zakonske materije in javnih naročil, pa tudi ne bontona, je dejal.

Z besedami "skrajni čas" je ponujeni odstop komentirala podpredsednica in poslanka NSi-ja Vida Čadonič Špelič. "Namesto da bi dobili digitalizacijo Slovenije, smo dobili računalnike, ki jim je potekel rok uporabe in se na njih nabira prah, po drugi strani pa tudi 6,5 milijona evrov luknje v državni proračun," je dejala in presodila, da Stojmenova Duh ne bi smela postati ministrica, saj da ni izkazala ustreznih kompetenc. "Pravzaprav se je na koncu pokazalo, da ni razumela, kakšna odgovornost je biti minister in kako je treba čuvati ugled države," je sklenila.

Svoboda se ministrici zahvaljuje

V poslanski skupini Svoboda so se z ministrico pogovarjali še danes. "Menimo, da je njen odstop odraz odgovorne odločitve, razmisleka pri sebi, sicer pa se ji lahko le zahvalimo," je odstop komentirala namestnica vodje poslancev Svobode Nataša Avšič Bogovič. Po njenih besedah je ministrica pri svojem delu "orala ledino", nakup računalnikov za najranljivejše skupine pa danes že dobiva epilog, rezultati bodo kmalu vidni, je prepričana.

Četudi so v preteklih dneh iz vrst poslancev Svobode prihajale neuradne informacije, da tudi njeni strankarski kolegi pričakujejo odstop Stojmenove Duh, saj da jo ob vseh očitkih še težko branijo, pa je Avšič Bogovič zatrdila, da se na današnjem srečanju niso "preštevali", temveč so prisluhnili ministričinim pojasnilom. "Potem pa se je zgodilo, kar se je," je dejala. Na ocene, tudi iz političnih vrst, da bi ministrica morala odstopiti že prej, je odvrnila, da je težko komentirati, kaj bi bilo, če bi bilo, vsaka poslanska skupina pa da ima pravico do svojega mnenja.

Deveta ministrska menjava

Ministrsko ekipo Roberta Goloba je do zdaj zapustilo osem ministrov, z izjemo nekdanje pravosodne ministrice Dominike Švarc Pipan vsi iz kvote Gibanja Svoboda. Prva je odšla notranja ministrica Tatjana Bobnar, po danes ponujenem odstopu, ki ga je premier sprejel, jo bo kot deveta zapustila ministrica za digitalno preobrazbo Emilija Stojmenova Duh.

The Commission has also adopted a number of measures to combat the spread of the virus.

The departure of the Minister of Digital Transformation, Emilia Stämen, Spirit for parliamentary parties is no surprise. The left sees the resignation of the ministers as the right move, and the SD does not comment on it. The opposition SDS and the NSi believe that the resignation is too late.

The Leader of the Left, Matej Tasner Vatovec, said that all the allegations against the minister had become too much of a story for the entire coalition and that the decision was correct. He also stressed that the Ministry was carrying out several important projects, and that the computer story was positive, so it would be good to move forward in a more efficient way.

In the SD, where they publicly assessed that it was time for the Minister to take personal and objective responsibility, they remain silent after the proposed resignation and do not comment on the decisions of the Spirit of Stymen.

For the opposition SDS and NSi, who have been sharply criticized for their work in the past few months, the resignation is too late. At the first interpelation six months ago, the complaints were large enough that the minister had to leave her job, and she was speaking about her work, SDS MP Tomaž Lisec stressed. According to him, they were hoping there would be no further interpelations. The story this week, the affair of the blue light, is just another point on the i showing that the minister does not know the work of the legal matter and public procurement, nor does the bonoton, he said.

The Commission's proposal for a directive on the protection of workers' rights and the protection of workers' rights and the right to freedom of expression was adopted in the light of the 'European Union's common position on the protection of workers' rights and the rights of workers' rights and the right to freedom of expression. "Instead of getting Slovenia digitalised, we got computers that are out of date and are getting dusted and on the other hand, 6.5 million euros in holes in the state budget", she said and judged that Spirit should not become a minister because she did not demonstrate the appropriate competencies. The Ninth Ministerial Exchange

Robert Gobol's cabinet has so far left eight ministers, except for former Justice Minister Dominica Schwartz Pipan, all of whom are from the Freedom Movement quota. Zdravstvenega doma za študente ne bodo pridružili Zdravstvenemu domu Ljubljana

ZD za študente zagotavlja ključne preventivne zdravstvene storitve

Na pobudo treh koalicijskih strank, Svobode, SD-ja in Levice, ministrstvo za zdravje v novelo zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti po končani javni obravnavi ne bo vključilo sprememb, ki bi določile pripojitev ZD-ja za študente k ZD-ju Ljubljana, so sporočili.

"Z ministrstvom za zdravje se strinjamo, da študentski zdravstveni dom Univerze v Ljubljani predstavlja odstop od siceršnje ureditve, po kateri je primarna raven zdravstvenega varstva dolžnost samoupravnih lokalnih skupnosti," so v skupnem sporočilu za javnost poudarili pri Svobodi, SD-ju in Levici.

ZD za študente v Ljubljani po njihovih navedbah že vrsto let zagotavlja ključne preventivne zdravstvene storitve, prilagojene specifičnim potrebam študentske populacije, ki so tako bolj dostopne in bolje urejene kot v drugih slovenskih univerzitetnih središčih.

Te storitve vključujejo sistematske preglede, cepljenja, zobozdravstvene storitve, psihiatrijo in druge preventivne programe, ki so bistvenega pomena za zdravje študentov in študentk, so poudarili. "Veseli nas, da tako študentski zdravstveni dom Univerze v Ljubljani ostaja samostojna institucija. Bolj sistematični način zagotavljanja zdravstvenega varstva študentske populacije, tudi v drugih univerzitetnih mestih in njihovi okolici, pa je izziv, ki nas čaka v prihodnje," so še sporočili.

Pripojitvi ZD-ja za študente k ZD-ju Ljubljana so v sredo nasprotovali na Univerzi v Ljubljani ter v Študentski organizaciji Slovenije in Študentski organizaciji Univerze v Ljubljani. 

Pripojitev je predvidel 42. člen predloga novele zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti, ki je v javni razpravi do 16. oktobra. Kot predvideva predlog, bi ZD za študente s 1. julijem 2025 nehal delovati kot samostojni javni zdravstveni zavod, mandati direktorja in članov sveta zavoda pa bi prenehali. Njegovi zaposleni bi se zaposlili v Zdravstvenem domu Ljubljana.
