The student health centre will not be affiliated with the Ljubljana Health Centre

ZD provides key preventive health services for students

At the initiative of the three coalition parties, Svoboda, SD and Left, the Ministry of Health will not include changes to the new law on health activities after a final public hearing that would provide for the linking of the Student Union to the Ljubljana Union, they said.

"We agree with the Ministry of Health that the student health centre at the University of Ljubljana is a derogation from the ordinary system, whereby the primary level of healthcare is the responsibility of local self-governing communities", the Svoboda, SD and Left emphasized in a joint public message.

The ZD has been providing key preventive health services for students in Ljubljana for many years, adapted to the specific needs of the student population, which are both more accessible and better regulated than in other Slovenian university centres.

These services include systematic examinations, vaccinations, dental services, psychiatry and other preventive programmes, which are essential for the health of students, they stressed. "We are pleased that the student health centre at Ljubljana University remains an independent institution. A more systematic approach to providing healthcare to the student population, including in and around other university towns, is a challenge ahead", they said.

The application of the ZD for students to the Ljubljana ZD was opposed on Wednesday by the University of Ljubljana and the Student Organization of Slovenia and the Student Organization of the University of Ljubljana.

The accession was provided for in Article 42 of the draft new Health Activities Act, which is open to public debate until 16 October. As envisaged by the proposal, the Student Union would cease to function as an independent public health institution on 1 July 2025, and the terms of office of the Director and the members of the Board of the institution would cease. His staff would be employed at the Ljubljana Health Home.
2024-09-26.english_title: The student health centre will not be affiliated with the Ljubljana Health Centre

Vlada na mestih nekdanjih prehodov na meji s Hrvaško določa strateške mejne točke

Občine morajo ministrstvu za notranje zadeve zahtevek za nadomestilo poslati do 15. novembra

Vlada je za obravnavo v DZ-ju po skrajšanem postopku pripravila predlog novele zakona o nadzoru državne meje. Določila je strateške mejne točke na meji s Hrvaško in obseg strateških mejnih območij.

Slovenija z vstopom Hrvaške v schengensko območje s 1. januarjem 2023 ne izvaja mejnega nadzora nekdanje zunanje schengenske kopenske meje. S tem so se zaprli vsi mejni prehodi, katerih območje meji na Hrvaško. Vse kopenske meje države Slovenije so postale notranje meje, mejni prehodi pa so nehali delovati.

Zaradi ukinitve mejnih prehodov, razen treh mejnih prehodov za zračni promet in dveh morskih mejnih prehodov, je vlada v predlogu novele zakona uvedla izraz strateška mejna točka. Poleg strateških mejnih točk in obsega strateških mejnih območij je določila tudi njihovo gradnjo ter upravljanje nepremičnega premoženja na njihovem območju in na nekdanjih mejnih prehodih na kopenskih mejah.

Strateške mejne točke, ki so glede na lego in gospodarski položaj državnega pomena za Slovenijo, in njihova območja bo na predlog ministrstva za notranje zadeve določila vlada z uredbo.

Predlog novele tudi o gradnji objektov na mejnih prehodih

Predlog novele zakona določa tudi prenehanje veljavnosti zakona o graditvi objektov na mejnih prehodih, saj se s predlaganimi dopolnitvami ureja vsa vsebina, ki se nanaša na upravljanje objektov in naprav na strateških mejnih točkah in njihovih območjih ter na območjih mejnih prehodov.

Strateške mejne točke so ključne za ohranjanje državne pripravljenosti – ne le na morebitne varnostne izzive, ampak tudi na druge izredne okoliščine, med katerimi bi bilo treba hitro in učinkovito vzpostaviti nadzor na določenih delih državne meje, so zapisali. Določili jih bodo na območjih nekdanjih mejnih prehodov, na katerih so nepremičnine in infrastruktura.

Hkrati določajo merila za izračun višine finančnega nadomestila občinam zaradi vzpostavitve začasnega vnovičnega nadzora na notranjih mejah. Za ta namen letos načrtujejo dva milijona evrov. Nabor občin, upravičenih do finančnega nadomestila, s sklepom določi vlada do konca februarja tekočega koledarskega leta za preteklo koledarsko leto.

Občine morajo ministrstvu za notranje zadeve zahtevek poslati do 15. novembra tekočega koledarskega leta. Zahtevki morajo vsebovati račune in dokazila o plačilih z utemeljitvijo namenske porabe ter listinsko dokumentacijo.

2024-09-26.english_content:
The Government at the former border crossing points with Croatia sets strategic border points

Municipalities must submit a request for compensation to the Ministry of the Interior by 15 November

The Government has prepared a draft new border control law for the examination in the GZ after a shortened procedure. It defined strategic border points on the border with Croatia and the extent of the strategic border areas.

Slovenia does not exercise border controls at the former external Schengen land border with Croatia's entry into the Schengen area from 1 January 2023. This closed all border crossings with Croatia. All land borders of Slovenia became internal borders and border crossings ceased to function.

With the abolition of border crossings, except for three air and two sea border crossings, the government introduced the term strategic border point in the draft law. In addition to the strategic border points and the extent of the strategic border areas, it also laid down their construction and the management of real estate in their area and at former land border crossings.

The strategic boundary points which are of national importance for Slovenia in view of the location and economic situation and their areas will be determined by regulation by the Government on a proposal from the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

Proposal for a regulation on the construction of facilities at border crossings

The new draft law also provides for the termination of the Border Crossing Facilities Act, as the proposed amendments govern all content relating to the management of facilities at strategic border points and their areas and border crossing areas.

They noted that the strategic border points are key to maintaining national readiness  ⁇  not only for potential security challenges but also for other emergency situations where controls on certain parts of the national border should be established quickly and effectively. They will be set at areas of former border crossings where real estate and infrastructure are located.

At the same time, they lay down criteria for calculating the amount of financial compensation to municipalities for the establishment of temporary reintroduction controls at internal borders. This year, two million euros are planned for this purpose. The selection of municipalities eligible for financial compensation shall be decided by the Government by the end of February of the current calendar year for the previous calendar year.

Municipalities must submit an application to the Ministry of the Interior by 15 November of the current calendar year. Requests shall include invoices and proof of payments justifying the intended expenditure and documentary documentation.
2024-09-26.english_title: The Government at the former border crossing points with Croatia sets strategic border points

Juvan: Izpostavljanje priseljenskega izvora zamegli pravi vzrok za nasilje v razmerjih

V Sloveniji je letno od pet do sedem femicidov

Novi primer umora partnerke je znova opozorilo, da je treba pravi čas storiti vse za zaščito žrtve in umik povzročitelja, je v odzivu na tragični dogodek na Koroškem zapisal državni sekretar na ministrstvu za delo Dan Juvan.

"Pretresen sem ob novici o novem primeru femicida, ki se je zgodil v Slovenj Gradcu. Pred nami je november, v katerem tradicionalno potekajo dnevi boja proti nasilju nad ženskami. Še en primer umora partnerke je znova opozorilo, da je treba pravi čas storiti vse za zaščito žrtve in umik povzročitelja, namesto da se vsakič znova šele ob femicidu sprašujemo, kje se je zalomilo tokrat," je v današnjem odzivu na torkov tragični dogodek zapisal državni sekretar na ministrstvu za delo, družino, socialne zadeve in enake možnosti Dan Juvan.

Ob tem je dodal, da morajo pristojni ukrep prepovedi približevanja v tovrstnih primerih izreči takoj ne glede na okoliščine.

Po dosedanjih podatkih policije je v torek popoldne na območju slovenjgraške občine 30-letnik, državljan Severne Makedonije, 40-letnico, s katero sta bila nekaj časa v razmerju, pričakal v njenem avtomobilu. Ko je s parkirišča zapeljala na dovozno cesto, je ustrelil najprej njo, nato pa še sebe. Moški je umrl na kraju dogodka, ženska pa v bolnišnici.

Moškega so že pred dogodkom obravnavali na policiji

Kot so v sredo v izjavi pojasnili na Policijski upravi (PU) Celje, so policisti moškega že pred tem dogodkom obravnavali, in sicer avgusta letos za kaznivi dejanji grožnje in neupravičenega slikovnega snemanja, za kar je policija že podala kazensko ovadbo.

Niso pa policisti pri takratni obravnavi zaznali takšne intenzivnosti in okoliščin, da bi moškemu izrekli ukrep prepovedi približevanja. "Dejanje je bilo storjeno prek družbenih omrežij, komunikacijskih sredstev. In storilec se je nahajal v tujini," je povedal pomočnik vodje sektorja kriminalistične policije na PU Celje Boštjan Debelak.

Priseljenski izvor zamegli pravi vzrok za nasilje v razmerjih

Državni sekretar Juvan je v današnjem odzivu na dogajanje navedel še, da se v medijih poudarja informacija o priseljenskem izvoru povzročitelja, kar po njegovih besedah zamegli pravi vzrok za nasilje v partnerskem razmerju, saj vzrok ni etnični izvor, ampak so to patriarhalna razmerja. "Če že, bi bilo treba izpostaviti, da so ravno priseljenke tiste, ki so še dodatno ranljive in stigmatizirane zaradi migrantskega ozadja in prikrajšanosti za družbene priložnosti," je dodal Juvan.

Spomnil je, da so na ministrstvu za delo nedavno pripravili in sprejeli resolucijo za boj proti nasilju v družini in nad ženskami, v kateri poleg številnih drugih konkretnih ukrepov opozarjajo na manko pravic priseljenk, ki so žrtve intimnopartnerskega nasilja. "Pozivam vse pristojne resorje, kot sta ministrstvi za pravosodje in za notranje zadeve, k čim hitrejši implementaciji ukrepov," je dodal Juvan.

Organizacije opozarjajo na problematiko povečanja število femicidov

Na problematiko femicidov, torej umore žensk, ki so z morilcem v partnerskem odnosu, opozarjajo tudi druge institucije in nevladne organizacije. Med drugim so na Inštitutu za proučevanje enakosti spolov marca letos ob mednarodnem dnevu žensk opozorili na problematiko povečanja števila femicidov v državi.

Varuh človekovih pravic Peter Svetina pa je takrat dejal, da pri Varuhu že leta opozarjajo pristojne, da je za preprečevanje nasilja ključna podpora žrtvam po prijavi nasilja in v nadaljnjih postopkih. Še posebej bi po njegovem mnenju pristojne institucije morale preučiti vsak primer femicida v Sloveniji, in sicer z namenom sprejetja posebnih ukrepov za njegovo preprečevanje.

Po podatkih Vrhovnega državnega tožilstva iz leta 2022 je v Sloveniji letno v povprečju od pet do sedem umorov žensk, ki so posledica partnerskega nasilja oziroma nasilja v družini. Kot so takrat ocenili na državnem tožilstvu, bi bilo glede na njihove izkušnje treba v primeru nasilja nad ženskami izboljšati predvsem preventivo in sodelovanje vseh pristojnih institucij.

Juvan: The evidence of immigrant origin has obscured the real cause of relationship violence

In Slovenia, there are five to seven femicides per year

The new case of the murder of a partner once again warned that everything needed to be done in time to protect the victim and to remove the perpetrator, Dan Juvan, the Secretary of State at the Ministry of Labour, wrote in response to the tragic event in Koroška.

"I am shocked to hear of a new femicide case that took place in Slovensk Gradc. We are in November, traditionally the day of the fight against violence against women. Another example of the murder of a partner once again warned that everything must be done in a timely manner to protect the victim and remove the perpetrator, instead of asking ourselves every time, only during the femicide, where the crime happened this time", said Dan Juvan, Secretary of State at the Ministry of Labour, Family, Social Affairs and Equality, in today's response to the tragic event of Tuesday.

It added that the competent measure prohibiting the approach in such cases must be issued immediately, whatever the circumstances.

According to police reports, a 30-year-old woman from North Macedonia, a 40-year-old woman with whom they had been in a relationship for some time, was waiting in her car on Tuesday afternoon in the area of the Slovene municipality. As she was driving off the parking lot to the driveway, he shot her first, then himself. The man died at the scene and the woman died in hospital.

The man was being processed by the police before the incident.

As explained in a statement to the Police Authority (PU) of the whole on Wednesday, the police had already been dealing with the man before this incident, in August this year, for criminal threats and unjustified filming, for which the police had already filed a criminal complaint.

But the police did not see the intensity and circumstances of the trial at the time to order a man to be banned from approaching. "The action was carried out through social networks, means of communication. And the perpetrator was abroad", said the assistant to the head of the criminal police sector at PU Celje, Boštjan Debelak.

The source of the migration blurred the true cause of relationship violence

In his response to the incident, Secretary of State Juvan also said that the media highlighted information about the immigrant origin of the perpetrator, which he said blurred the real cause of the violence in the partnership relationship, since the cause is not ethnic origin but patriarchal relationships. "If so, it should be pointed out that it is migrants who are further vulnerable and stigmatized by their migrant background and lack of social opportunities", Juvan added.

He recalled that the Ministry of Labour had recently prepared and adopted a resolution to combat domestic and women's violence, which, in addition to numerous other concrete measures, highlighted the lack of rights of migrants who are victims of intimate partner violence. "I call on all relevant bodies, such as the Ministries of Justice and Home Affairs, to implement measures as quickly as possible", Juvan added.

The organisations are warning of the problem of increasing the number of femicides

Other institutions and NGOs have also raised the issue of femicides, the killing of women who have a partnered relationship with a murderer. The Institute for the Study of Gender Equality in March, for example, drew attention to the problem of increasing the number of femicides in the country on International Women's Day.

Human rights defender Peter Svetina said that the War Office had been warning authorities for years that support for victims after the violence was reported and in subsequent proceedings is essential to preventing violence. In particular, he considered that the competent institutions should examine every case of femicide in Slovenia with a view to adopting specific measures to prevent it.

According to the Supreme Public Prosecutor's Office, in 2022 there are on average five to seven female murders per year in Slovenia as a result of partner violence or domestic violence. As the Prosecutor's Office assessed at the time, in the light of their experience in the case of violence against women, prevention and cooperation of all competent institutions should be improved in particular.

DZ: Zakonodajni referendum o noveli zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi je nedopusten

Opozicija vztraja, da je cilj sklepa branjenje premierja

DZ je z 49 glasovi za in 27 proti sprejel sklep o nedopustnosti razpisa zakonodajnega referenduma o noveli zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi. Sklep so predlagali poslanci koalicije, ki so ga ob današnjem glasovanju tudi podprli.

Proti sklepu so bili v opoziciji in nepovezana poslanka Mojca Šetinc Pašek. Poslanec Levice Miha Kordiš je bil vzdržan.

Predlog novele zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi je v postopek vložila predsednica DZ-ja Urška Klakočar Zupančič, DZ pa jo je potrdil kar dvakrat, prvič sredi julija, po vetu v državnem svetu pa vnovič na začetku septembra. Pobudo za začetek postopka za razpis naknadnega zakonodajnega referenduma o noveli, podprto z več kot 3000 podpisi, pa so v DZ prejšnji teden vložili v SDS-u.

Predsednica DZ-ja je nato določila 35-dnevni rok za zbiranje podpisov volivcev v podporo zahtevi za razpis referenduma, ki bi potekalo od 1. oktobra do 4. novembra. Večina poslancev koalicije je v DZ vložila predlog sklepa o nedopustnosti zakonodajnega referenduma.

Klakočar Zupančič kot prvopodpisana je danes dejala, da naknadnega zakonodajnega referenduma ni mogoče razpisati o zakonih, ki odpravljajo protiustavnost, ki jo je predhodno ugotovilo ustavno sodišče. "In neizpodbitno dejstvo je, da gre v primeru novele zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi – po cilju, namenu in rešitvah – za zakon, ki v treh členih odpravlja z odločbami ustavnega sodišča ugotovljeno protiustavnost, v enem členu pa zapolnjuje pravno praznino," je dejala.

Z drugima dvema odločbama iz leta 2021 pa po njenih navedbah ustavno sodišče opozarja, da DZ oziroma poslanci v preiskovalnih komisijah ne smejo segati na področje drugih vej oblasti, prva odločba se nanaša na sodno, druga pa na državnotožilsko neodvisnost.

Novela zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi med drugim predvideva uvedbo mehanizma, po katerem lahko v 30 dneh po objavi v uradnem listu več predlagateljev zahteva, da o skladnosti parlamentarne preiskave z ustavo in zakonom odloči ustavno sodišče. Ustavno sodišče mora o zahtevi odločiti absolutno prednostno, najpozneje v 60 dneh. Pred odločitvijo ustavnega sodišča o zahtevi državni zbor ne more imenovati preiskovalne komisije. Če ustavno sodišče ugotovi, da je akt v nasprotju z ustavo ali zakonom, pa ga razveljavi. S tem je postopek odreditve parlamentarne preiskave končan.

Državni svet in opozicija koaliciji očitata, da želi s tem preprečiti parlamentarno preiskavo, s katero bi pod drobnogled vzeli slovensko energetiko. V opozicijskih SDS-u in NSi-ju so policiji in Okrožnemu državnemu tožilstvu v Ljubljani celo naznanili sum storitve kaznivega dejanja zlorabe uradnega položaja ali uradnih pravic in nevestnega dela v službi zoper Klakočar Zupančič. Očitajo ji, da krši poslovnik, zakonodajo in ustavo, ker ni sklicala izredne seje DZ-ja, na kateri bi ustanovili omenjeno preiskovalno komisijo.

SDS: Namen sklepa je zaščititi delo premierja 

Sklep so v predstavitvi stališč poslanskih skupin podprli v koalicijskih Gibanju Svoboda, SD-ju in Levici. Opozicijska SDS in NSi pa sta mu nasprotovala. Kot je dejal Andrej Poglajen iz vrst SDS-a, je bil sklep predlagan pod pretvezo, da gre za dosledno uveljavitev odločb ustavnega sodišča, a je njegov edini namen "zaščititi lik in delo predsednika vlade Roberta Goloba ter preprečitev razkritja vseh rabot in malverzacij znotraj slovenske energetike".

Da trditev predlagateljev, da predlagani referendum ni ustavno dopusten, ker zakon odpravlja protiustavnost na področju človekovih pravic in temeljnih svoboščin, "ne pije vode", je presodil tudi Franc Medic iz NSi-ja. Sklep pa je označil za še enega "od instrumentov za blokiranje preiskave ravnanja krogov okoli stranke Gibanja Svoboda".

Lena Grgurevič (Svoboda) je opozicijske poslance spraševala, kakšne dokaze imajo za svoje trditve. Če bi zadevo prijavili policiji, je ta sploh ne bi obravnavala, državno tožilstvo pa bi jo ovrglo, saj nima "enega dokaza proti predsedniku vlade", je ocenila.

Klakočar Zupančič: Da novela opravlja protiustavnost, je ustavno sodišče ugotovilo z odločbami, ki so nastale na pobudo sedanje opozicije

"Vse tri odločbe so pravzaprav nastale po direktni ali pa indirektni iniciativi zdajšnje opozicije," je poudarila predsednica DZ-ja. Kot je pojasnila, je prvo zahtevo na ustavno sodišče podala sedanja opozicija, konkretno stranka SDS s prvopodpisanim Jožetom Tankom. Drugi dve odločitvi ustavnega sodišča pa sta po njenih besedah "odgovor na zlorabe, ki so se dogajale v zelo neslavni zadevi Kangler, ko se je želelo v parlamentarni preiskavi posegati na področje sodne veje oblasti in državnotožilskih pristojnosti".

"Novela zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi parlamentarno preiskavo postavlja na mesto, kjer bi morala biti že od vsega začetka, postavlja jo v ustavne okvire, spoštuje ustavna načela in preprečuje zlorabe, in sicer tako postopkovne zlorabe kot pa zlorabe, do katerih bi utegnilo priti v primeru političnih preigravanj, diskreditacij političnih nasprotnikov in pa tudi morebitnih kršenj človekovih pravic posameznikov, ki se lahko znajdejo v parlamentarni preiskavi," je prepričana predsednica DZ-ja. Novela po njenih besedah tudi varuje osebe, ki se znajdejo v parlamentarni preiskavi predvsem kot preiskovanci.

Novela kot branjenje Gibanja Svoboda?

Na očitke, da gre pri predlogu sklepa o nedopustnosti razpisa referenduma v tem primeru za politično ravnanje in branjenje Gibanja Svobode, je odgovorila, da tu ne gre za politični, ampak za pravni vidik. "Kakršno koli vpletanje politike je nekorektno in ni prav. Tukaj gre za varstvo ustavnih načel in pa za to, da parlamentarna preiskava resnično postane tisto, čemur je bila že od začetka namenjena, da se ugotavlja politična odgovornost nosilcev javnih funkcij," je pojasnila.

"Tukaj delujem kot recimo temu, karikiram, varuh ustave in varuh pravne države, pa tudi kot nekdo, ki se je prvi lotil izvršitve odločb ustavnega sodišča, od katerih je ena neizvršena, neupoštevana že več kot deset let," je še dodala.

DZ: A legislative referendum on a new parliamentary inquiry law is inadmissible

The opposition insists the aim of the decision is to defend the Prime Minister

The DZ adopted a resolution by 49 votes to 27 against, rejecting the legislative referendum on the new law on parliamentary inquiry. The resolution was proposed by members of the coalition, who voted in favour of it today.

The decision was opposed by opposition and unrelated MP Mojc Šetinc Pašek. The leftist MP, Micah Kordiš, was held back.

The draft new law on parliamentary investigation was submitted to the proceedings by the President of the DZ Urška Klakočar Zupančić, who confirmed it twice, first in mid-July and again in early September, after a veto by the State Council. The initiative to open the procedure for the invitation to a subsequent legislative referendum on the novel, supported by more than 3000 signatures, was submitted to the DZ last week by the SDS.

The President of the ZD then set a 35-day deadline for the collection of voter signatures in support of the call for a referendum, which would run from 1 October to 4 November. The majority of the Coalition deputies have submitted a motion to the GZ for a decision on the admissibility of a legislative referendum.

Klakočar Zupančić, the first signatory, said today that a subsequent legislative referendum cannot be held on laws that eliminate the unconstitutionality previously found by the Constitutional Court. "And the undeniable fact is that in the case of the new Parliamentary Inquiry Act, the purpose, purpose and solutions are for a law that eliminates the unconstitutionality found in three articles by the Constitutional Court decisions and fills a legal vacuum in one article", she said.

In its other two decisions of 2021, the Constitutional Court notes that the JHA and the members of the committees of inquiry must not interfere with the other branches of the authorities, the first of which concerns the judiciary and the second the independence of the state.

The new Parliamentary Inquiry Act provides, inter alia, for the introduction of a mechanism whereby, within 30 days of publication in the Official Journal, several candidates may request that a Constitutional Court decide on the constitutionality of a parliamentary inquiry. The Constitutional Court shall give absolute priority to the application, no later than 60 days. Before the Constitutional Court decides on the request, the National Assembly may not appoint a commission of inquiry. If the Constitutional Court finds that an act is contrary to the Constitution or the law, it shall annul it. The procedure for dismissing the parliamentary inquiry is hereby terminated.

The State Council and the opposition have indicated that they are trying to prevent a parliamentary inquiry that would take Slovenian energy under its wing. In opposition to the SDS and the NSi, the police and the Ljubljana District Prosecutor's Office were even informed of the alleged abuse of official position or official rights and brothel work by Klakočar Zupančić. She is accused of violating the rules, the law and the constitution by not convening an extraordinary meeting of the DZ to set up the said commission of inquiry.

SDS: The purpose of the decision is to protect the work of the Prime Minister

The decision was supported by the positions of the parliamentary groups in the coalition Freedom Movement, the SD and the Left. The opposition SDS and the NSI opposed him. According to Andrej Poglajen of the SDS, the decision was proposed on the pretext that it is a consistent enforcement of the Constitutional Court's decisions, but its sole purpose is "to protect the character and work of Prime Minister Robert Gobal and to prevent the disclosure of all the work and corruption within the Slovenian energy sector".

The claim by the proponents that the proposed referendum is not constitutionally permissible because the law abolishes the human rights and fundamental freedoms violations, "no water drinking", also ruled Franc Medic of the NSi. He called the decision "one of the instruments to block the investigation into the conduct of the circles around the Freedom Movement".

Lena Grgurević (Freedom) asked the opposition MPs what evidence they had for their claims. If the case were reported to the police, they would not even consider it and the prosecution would dismiss it because it "has no evidence against the prime minister", she said.

Klakočar Zupančič: That the novel is unconstitutional, the Constitutional Court has found by decisions made on the initiative of the current opposition

"All three decisions were in fact made on the direct or indirect initiative of the current opposition", the DZ President stressed. As she explained, the first application to the Constitutional Court was made by the current opposition, specifically the SDS party with the original signatory Jozet Tank. The other two decisions of the Constitutional Court were, according to the Court, 'a response to the abuses committed in the infamous Kangler case, which sought to interfere with the judicial branch and the national authorities in the parliamentary investigation'.

"The new Parliamentary Inquiry Act puts the parliamentary investigation in a place where it should be from the beginning, places it in a constitutional framework, respects constitutional principles and prevents abuse, both procedural and abusive, which would be likely in the event of political overreach, discreditation of political opponents and even possible violations of the human rights of individuals who may be involved in a parliamentary inquiry", the DZ's president is convinced. The novel also protects those who are involved in a parliamentary inquiry, especially as investigators.

A novel as a defense of the Freedom Movement?

On the allegations that the proposal for a decision on the admissibility of the referendum in this case was a political exercise and defence of the Freedom Movement, she replied that it was not a political but a legal aspect. "Any political interference is incorrect and wrong. It is a matter of protecting constitutional principles and making the parliamentary inquiry truly what it was intended to be from the beginning, to identify the political responsibility of public officials,' she explained.

"I am here as a cartoonist, a custodian of the Constitution and the rule of law, and also as the first to address the implementation of Constitutional Court decisions, one of which has been unenforceable, ignored for more than a decade", she added.

Ambasada Rog: Položaj prosilcev za azil ni urejen. Lani je od 7000 prošenj azil dobilo le 74 ljudi.

Prosilci za azil lahko začnejo delati po treh mesecih bivanja v državi

Kljub sprejeti integracijski strategiji za prosilce za azil še ni sistemskih rešitev. "Tudi če si zaposlen ali si ustvariš družino, se lahko znajdeš na seznamu za deportacijo," opozarjajo. Podprla jih je predstavnica Amnesty International Taja Premk.

Ambasada Rog je spet opomnila na vprašanje vladnih izgonov prosilcev za azil. Predstavniki Roga so poudarili, da je ministrstvo lani izdalo 4389 azilnih odločb, od teh je bilo 4096 odločb o vrnitvi. Azil so na ministrstvu podelili le 74 prosilcem, 55 prosilcev pa je dobilo subsidiarno zaščito.

Na problematičnost izgonov prosilcev za azil je Ambasada Rog opozorila že marca lani. Že takrat so opozorili, da so se vsi, razen ministrstva za notranje zadeve, strinjali z zakonsko ureditvijo vračanja prosilcev za azil. Prav tako so lanskega maja priredili mednarodno strokovno konferenco na omenjeno temo, kjer so se zvrstili pozivi vladi, so danes spomnili v Ambasadi Rog.

Položaj prosilcev za azil še vedno ni urejen

Opozarjajo, da kljub pobudam položaj prosilcev za azil še vedno ni urejen. Po njihovih navedbah se je lani vlada zavezala k zakonski ureditvi položaja zavrnjenih prosilcev za azil, vendar tega člena niso uvrstili v novelo zakona o tujcih. Na pobudo drugih ministrstev se je člen, ki prosilcem za azil omogoča zaprositi za dovoljenje za bivanje na podlagi dela, vstavil v interventni zakon o upravnih enotah, vendar pa je ministrstvo za notranje zadeve ukrep spremenilo v začasnega in ga omejilo.

Govorec prosilcev za azil Ambasade Rog Doudou Karhabandwa Bigagura je povedal, da prosilci za azil lahko začnejo delati po treh mesecih bivanja v državi, do takrat pa dobijo le 18 evrov žepnine mesečno.

"Želimo vašo pozornost, da spregovorimo o težkih situacijah, skozi katere smo primorani iti. Večini prosilcev za azil, ki živimo in delamo tukaj v Sloveniji, grozi deportacija. To je zelo resna zadeva. Je grožnja našemu preživetju, zdravju, duševnemu zdravju, našim družinam, skupnostim, našemu dostojanstvu in našim življenjem," je na dogodku dejal eden izmed prosilcev za azil Issa Mohamed.

Na novinarski konferenci je spregovorila tudi predstavnica nevladne organizacije Amnesty International Taja Premk, ki je poudarila, da je Amnesty International na problematiko izgona začel opozarjati že leta 2018 na Hrvaškem. "Tukaj ne govorimo le o postopkovnih neustreznostih, ampak tudi o mučenju, zmerjanju, poniževanju in protipravnih vračanjih," je dejala. Dodala je, da se z organizacijo ponovno zavzemajo za ustavitev izgona tujcev, ki so v Sloveniji začeli novo življenje, in proti kršenju osnovnih človekovih pravic.

MNZ: To so predaje in ne deportacije

Na ministrstvu za notranje zadeve so za STA pojasnili, da so to predaje (in ne deportacije) prosilcev za mednarodno zaščito v skladu z veljavno zakonodajo EU-ja, vsak primer pa obravnavajo individualno.

Dublinska uredba določa, da mora prošnjo za mednarodno zaščito obravnavati ena sama država članica EU-ja, in sicer tista, ki je za to odgovorna skladno s kriteriji iz uredbe. Za namen ugotavljanja države članice, ki je odgovorna za obravnavo posamične prošnje za mednarodno zaščito, Dublinska uredba določa merila in hierarhijo, po kateri se merila uporabljajo za ugotavljanje odgovornosti. Koncept mednarodne zaščite prosilcu zagotavlja pravico do zaščite v varni državi, ne pa možnosti izbire države članice, ki naj obravnava njegovo prošnjo in v kateri želi to zaščito uporabiti, so zapisali.

Skladno z Dublinsko uredbo se predaja izvede najpozneje v šestih mesecih po odobritvi zahteve, da bo druga država članica sprejela ali vnovič sprejela osebo ali končno odločitev o pritožbi ali ponovnem pregledu, če obstaja odložilni učinek. Ta rok se lahko podaljša na 18 mesecev, če oseba pobegne. Prosilec o podaljšanju roka za predajo ni posebej obveščen, saj tega ne predvideva niti Dublinska uredba niti zakon o mednarodni zaščiti.

"Glede določbe, da se status prebivanja tujcev, ki jim je bila prošnja za mednarodno zaščito zavrnjena, uredi na podlagi zaposlitve, ki je vključena v zakon o ukrepih za optimizacijo določenih postopkov na upravnih enotah, zavračamo navedbe, da bi ministrstvo za notranje zadeve zahtevalo omejitev oziroma začasnost te določbe. Končno oceno o učinkovitosti in smotrnosti ukrepa bomo lahko podali po izteku veljavnosti zakona in na podlagi tega razmislili o vključitvi take določbe tudi v prihodnjo novelo zakona o tujcih," so še pojasnili na ministrstvu.
2024-09-26.title: Ambasada Rog: Položaj prosilcev za azil ni urejen. Lani je od 7000 prošenj azil dobilo le 74 ljudi.

Embassy Horn: The status of asylum seekers is not regulated. Last year, only 74 people received 7,000 asylum applications.

Asylum seekers can start working after three months in the country

Despite the adoption of an integration strategy for asylum seekers, there are still no systemic solutions. "Even if you are employed or have a family, you may be on the deportation list", they warn. They were supported by Amnesty International's representative, Taja Premk.

The Embassy Rogue has again raised the issue of government expulsions of asylum seekers. The representatives of the Crown pointed out that the Ministry issued 4389 asylum decisions last year, of which 4096 were decisions on return. Only 74 applicants were granted asylum at the Ministry and 55 were granted subsidiary protection.

The problem of expulsions of asylum seekers was raised by the Horn Embassy in March last year. At that time, they warned that all but the Ministry of the Interior had agreed to the legal arrangements for returning asylum seekers. They also held an international expert conference on the subject last May, where they addressed the government's calls, they recalled today at the Embassy of the Horn.

The situation of asylum seekers remains unresolved

They warn that despite my initiatives, the situation of asylum seekers remains unregulated. According to them, last year the Government committed itself to legal arrangements for the status of rejected asylum seekers, but this article was not included in the new law on foreigners. At the initiative of other ministries, the provision allowing asylum seekers to apply for a work-based residence permit was incorporated into the Administrative Units Act, but the Ministry of the Interior changed the measure to a temporary one and restricted it.

Asylum-seekers spokesman Rog Doudou Karhabandwa Bigagura said that asylum-seekers can start working after three months in the country and only receive €18 a month in pocket.

"We want your attention to talk about the difficult situations we have been forced to go through. Most asylum seekers living and working here in Slovenia are at risk of deportation. This is a very serious matter. It is a threat to our survival, health, mental health, our families, communities, our dignity and our lives", said one of the asylum seekers, Issa Mohamed, at the event.

The press conference was also addressed by Amnesty International NGO spokeswoman Taja Premk, who stressed that Amnesty International had already started to raise awareness of the issue of expulsion in Croatia in 2018. "We are not just talking about procedural inadequacies here, but also torture, repression, humiliation and wrongful return", she said. She added that the organisation was re-engaging to stop the expulsion of foreigners starting a new life in Slovenia and to combat violations of fundamental human rights.

These are surrendering, not deportations.

The Ministry of the Interior explained to the STA that these are extraditions (and not deportations) of applicants for international protection in accordance with the applicable EU law and are dealt with on a case-by-case basis.

The Dublin Regulation provides that an application for international protection must be dealt with by a single EU Member State, namely the one responsible for it in accordance with the criteria laid down in the Regulation. For the purpose of determining the Member State responsible for the processing of an individual application for international protection, the Dublin Regulation lays down the criteria and the hierarchy by which the criteria are used to determine liability. The concept of international protection guarantees the applicant the right to protection in a safe country, rather than the possibility of choosing the Member State to consider his application and in which he wishes to apply that protection, they wrote.

In accordance with the Dublin Regulation, the surrender shall be made no later than six months after the approval of the request for the other Member State to accept or re-adopt the person or the final decision on the appeal or review, if there is a deferral effect. This period may be extended to 18 months if the person escapes. The applicant is not specifically informed of the extension of the time limit for surrender, as neither the Dublin Regulation nor the International Protection Act provides for this.

'Given the provision that the residence status of foreigners whose application for international protection has been refused is to be managed on the basis of employment included in the Act on measures to optimise certain procedures in administrative units, we reject the claim that the Ministry of the Interior would have requested a limitation or a temporary extension of that provision. The final assessment of the effectiveness and efficiency of the measure will be made after the expiry of the law and on this basis considering the inclusion of such a provision in the future draft law on foreigners", the ministry explained.

KPK zaznal korupcijska tveganja pri imenovanju članov nadzornega sveta Borzena

Komisija je spomnila, da zakon o integriteti in preprečevanju korupcije funkcionarjem ne prepoveduje lastništva v podjetjih

KPK je vladi, potem ko je v povezavi z imenovanjem članov nadzornega sveta državne družbe Borzen zaznal korupcijska tveganja, izdal več priporočil. Ni pa potrdil kršitev pri poslovanju Borzena z družbo Star Solar v lasti premierja Roberta Goloba.

Komisija za preprečevanje korupcije (KPK) je postopek uvedla, potem ko je v začetku letošnjega leta prejela dve prijavi. V njih so bili navedeni očitki, da takratna direktorica družbe Star Solar, Golobova hči Luna Golob, to funkcijo opravlja zgolj formalno ter da naj bi bila Mojca Kert na mesto direktorice Borzena imenovana po zaslugi premierja Roberta Goloba.

Kot so sporočili s KPK-ja, so v predhodnem preizkusu pridobili informacije in pojasnila od Borzena, Gibanja Svoboda, generalnega sekretariata vlade, ministrstva za infrastrukturo ter ministrstva za okolje, podnebje in energijo, pregledali pa so tudi različne baze podatkov in opravili razgovore.

KPK zaznal korupcijska tveganja v zvezi z imenovanjem članov nadzornega sveta Borzena

Glede na razpoložljivo dokumentacijo in informacije KPK ni potrdil kršitev iz svojih pristojnosti, je pa zaznal korupcijska tveganja v povezavi z imenovanjem članov nadzornega sveta družbe Borzen.

KPK je spomnil, da zakon o integriteti in preprečevanju korupcije funkcionarjem ne prepoveduje lastništva v podjetjih. V postopku so na komisiji ugotovili, da je Golob izpolnil vse formalne obveznosti, ki jih zakon določa funkcionarjem, ter kršitev omejitev poslovanja niso potrdili. "V konkretnem primeru to pomeni, da je prepovedano poslovanje družbe Star Solar z vlado, ne pa tudi z drugimi subjekti javnega sektorja, kot je Borzen," so pojasnili na KPK-ju.

KPK tudi ni potrdil očitkov, da je predsednik vlade vodenje družbe zgolj formalno prenesel na hčer in da družbo še naprej upravlja sam.

Prav tako ni ugotovil kršitev pri imenovanju direktorice Borzena, ki jo je v skladu s pristojnostmi izbral nadzorni svet družbe, niti ni potrdil, da je pri imenovanju takratnega člana nadzornega sveta Žige Fišerja, ki je bil poslovno povezan z Gibanjem Svoboda, "med predsednikom vlade in Žigo Fišerjem obstajal osebni ali poslovni stik takšne narave, zaradi katerega bi lahko prišlo do (videza) nasprotja interesov, in bi se moral Robert Golob iz odločanja izločiti".

Je pa torej KPK korupcijska tveganja zaznal pri imenovanju članov nadzornega sveta Borzena, ki jih je imenovala vlada na predlog ministrstva za infrastrukturo. Vlada oziroma pristojno ministrstvo nimata posebnega pravilnika ali vzpostavljenega postopka izbire in presoje kandidatov za imenovanje v nadzorne svete družb, izbor nadzornikov pa je bil izveden na podlagi neposrednega povabila, so pojasnili.

"Tak način izbora članov sveta družbe predstavlja korupcijsko tveganje v povezavi z merili in kriteriji izbire kandidatov, zagotavljanjem objektivnosti in nepristranskosti predlagatelja ter zagotavljanjem strokovnosti izbranih kandidatov za opravljanje dela članov nadzornih svetov družb v lasti Republike Slovenije," so zapisali.

KPK je zato vladi priporočil, naj predpiše ustrezne transparentne izbirne postopke pri predlaganju oziroma imenovanju članov organov nadzora v družbah, kjer je v vlogi delničarke oziroma družbenice.

The CCP has recognised the risks of corruption in appointing members of the Board of Supervisors of Borzen

The Commission recalled that the Law on Integrity and Prevention of Corruption does not prohibit ownership of companies by officials

The CCP issued several recommendations to the Government after it discovered the risks of corruption in connection with the appointment of members of the Supervisory Board of Borzen. But he has not confirmed a breach in Borzen's business with Star Solar, owned by Prime Minister Robert Goble.

The Commission for the Prevention of Corruption (CPC) launched the procedure after receiving two notifications earlier this year. They alleged that the then director of Star Solar, Golob's daughter Luna Golob, was only in the formal capacity and that Mojsa Kert was to be appointed as Borzen's director after Prime Minister Robert Golob.

As reported by the CCP, in the previous test they obtained information and clarifications from Borzen, Libyan Freedom Movement, the Government's General Secretariat, the Ministry of Infrastructure and the Ministry of Environment, Climate and Energy, and also reviewed various databases and conducted interviews.

The CCP recognised the corruption risks associated with the appointment of members of the Borzen Supervisory Board

In view of the available documentation and information, the KPK did not confirm any breach of its competence but acknowledged the corruption risks associated with the appointment of Borzen's supervisory board members.

The KPK recalled that the Law on Integrity and Prevention of Corruption does not prohibit ownership of companies by officials. In the proceedings, the Commission found that Golob had fulfilled all the formal obligations imposed on officials by law and did not confirm the breach of the operating restrictions. 'In the specific case, this means that Star Solar is prohibited from doing business with the government and not with other public sector entities such as Borzen,' they explained to KPK.

The CCP also did not confirm the allegations that the Prime Minister merely formally transferred the management of the company to his daughter and that the company continues to operate alone.

Nor did it find any breach in the appointment of Borzen as a director, which was chosen by the Board of Supervisors of the company in accordance with its powers, nor did it confirm that the appointment of Ziggy Fisher, then a member of the Board of Supervisors, who was associated with the Freedom Movement, 'exists between the Prime Minister and Ziggy Fisher a personal or business relationship of such a nature that there may be (a) a conflict of interest and Robert Golob should be excluded from the decision'.

The CCP has therefore recognised the risks of corruption in appointing members of the Borzen Supervisory Board appointed by the government on a proposal from the Ministry of Infrastructure. The government or the competent ministry has no specific rules or procedures for selecting and assessing candidates for appointment to the supervisory board, and the selection of supervisors was made on a direct invitation, they explained.

'This method of selecting the members of the company's board poses a corrupt risk in relation to the criteria and criteria for selecting candidates, ensuring the objectivity and impartiality of the candidate and ensuring the expertise of the selected candidates to carry out the work of the members of the supervisory boards of companies owned by the Republic of Slovenia,' they wrote.

The CCP therefore recommended that the Government should establish appropriate transparent selection procedures for the nomination or appointment of members of supervisory authorities in companies where it is a shareholder or a member.
2024-09-26.english_title: The CCP has recognised the risks of corruption in appointing members of the Board of Supervisors of Borzen

Dobra letina žit, slabša letina marelic, češenj, višenj

Setvi nekaterih tradicionalnih žit je bilo namenjenih manj površin kot v preteklih letih

Letošnja letina žit je bila v primerjavi z lanskim letom boljša, medtem ko so češnje, višnje in marelice obrodile podpovprečno. Dobra naj bi bila tudi letina krompirja in skupni pridelek soje za zrnje in pridelek sončničnega zrnja.

Pšenici je bilo letos namenjenih za dva odstotka manj površin kot lani, a je obrodila boljše. Obseg pridelave je znašal okoli 152.000 ton pšenice, kar pomeni 7,7 odstotka več kot lani in za štiri odstotke več od povprečja zadnjih desetih let. V povprečju je bilo na hektar pridelane 5,5 tone pšenice.

Setvi ječmena je bilo letos namenjeno najmanj površin po letu 2017 ali pet odstotkov manj kot lani. Na 20.800 hektarjih so kmetje pridelali za 4,8 odstotka več pridelka oz. okoli 100.400 ton ječmenovega zrnja, kar pomeni povprečni pridelek 4,8 tone na hektar.

Dobro je obrodila tudi oljna ogrščica, kjer je bil povprečni pridelek s 3,2 tone na hektar za četrtino večji od lanskega in za skoraj petino večji od povprečja zadnjih desetih let.

Po podatkih o pričakovanih pridelkih po stanju na dan 31. julija bodo slovenski pridelovalci koruze na pet odstotkov manjši površini kot lani letos pospravili 9,2 tone koruznega zrnja, pri čemer naj bi bil povprečni pridelek s 43,8 tone na hektar glede na lani večji za pet odstotkov, glede na povprečja zadnjih desetih let pa za pet odstotkov manjši.

Statistiki napovedujejo, da bo pridelek silažne koruze, ki so ji pridelovalci letos namenili približno enak obseg pridelovalnih površin kot lani, obsegal 1,181 milijona ton oziroma za 5,2 odstotka več kot lani.

Po pričakovanjih naj bi poznega krompirja letos pridelali 72.560 ton oz. v povprečju 28,3 tone na hektar, kar je za petino več kot lani in za desetino več v primerjavi s povprečnim pridelkom v zadnjem desetletju.

Več površin namenjenih pridelavi soje za zrnje

Statistiki pričakujejo največji skupni pridelek soje za zrnje in sončnic. Pričakovani povprečni pridelek za sončnice znaša 2,6 tone na hektar je za skoraj tretjino večji kot lani in za 13 odstotkov večji v primerjavi s povprečjem v zadnjem desetletnem obdobju.

Površina, namenjena pridelavi soje za zrnje, se je v letošnjem letu povečala za 40 odstotkov in je največja od začetka spremljanja tega podatka leta 1991. Za slabo desetino večji naj bi bil tudi povprečni pridelek, in sicer 2,8 tone na hektar. Statistiki na podlagi povečanj površine in povprečnega pridelka pričakujejo največji skupni pridelek te poljščine od leta 1991 dalje, in sicer okoli 11.800 ton.

Podpovprečen pridelek zgodnjih sadnih vrst

Pridelki zgodnjih sadnih vrst v intenzivnih in ekstenzivnih sadovnjakih so bili medtem podpovprečni. V intenzivnih sadovnjakih so češnje obrodile bolje kot lani, povprečni pridelek s 3,5 tone na hektar je za več kot tretjino večji, a hkrati za podoben delež manjši od povprečja zadnjih desetih let.

Povprečni pridelek marelic je bil s 3,2 tone na hektar za približno petino manjši od lanskega in za več kot polovico od povprečja zadnjih desetih let.

Površina, namenjena gojenju jagod, se je v primerjavi z lani zmanjšala za več kot pet odstotkov. Povprečni pridelek tega sadja je znašal 15,5 tone na hektar oz. za sedem odstotkov več kot lani, a obenem za podoben odstotek manj od povprečja zadnjih desetih let.

V ekstenzivnih nasadih je bilo po navedbah statistikov podobno. Z enega drevesa češenj so nabrali 15,9 kilograma tega sadja, kar je za četrtino manj od povprečnega pridelka v zadnjih desetih letih. Povprečni pridelek marelic je znašal 9,8 kilograma na drevo, kar je sicer trikratnik lanske slabe letine, a za petino manj od povprečja zadnjih desetih let.

Po napovedih statistikov bosta letošnji letini breskev in nektarin večji od lanskih. Povprečni pridelek naj bi znašal 11,3 tone na hektar, kar je primerljivo z desetletnim povprečjem.

A good year of cereals, a bad year of peas, cherries, cherries

The seeds of some traditional cereals have been used for less land than in previous years

This year's cereal yield was better than last year, while cherries, cherries and peas produced below average. The annual potatoes and the common crop of soybeans and the sunflower crop are also expected to be good.

This year, wheat was given two percent less land than last year, but it yielded better. The production volume was around 152,000 tonnes of wheat, which is 7.7 per cent higher than last year and four per cent higher than the average over the last ten years. On average, 5.5 tons of wheat were produced per hectare.

The total area of the planting of barley was at least 5% less than last year. On 20,800 hectares, farmers produced 4.8 percent more crops, or about 100,400 tonnes of barley, an average of 4.8 tonnes per hectare.

The oil crop also produced well, with an average yield of 3.2 tonnes per hectare, a quarter of last year's and almost a fifth of the average of the last ten years.

According to the data on the expected yields as at 31 July, Slovenian maize growers will harvest 9,2 tonnes of maize grain on an area 5% smaller than last year, with an average yield of 43,8 tonnes per hectare, 5% higher than last year and 5% lower than the average of the last 10 years.

Statistics predict that the production of mustard, which farmers have set aside for this year, will be about the same as last year, at 1,181 million tonnes, or 5.2 percent more than last year.

Late potatoes are expected to produce 72,560 tonnes this year, or an average of 28,3 tonnes per hectare, a fifth more than last year and a tenth more than the average yield in the previous decade.

More areas for the cultivation of soybeans

Statistics expect the largest combined yield of soybeans for grains and sunflowers. The expected average yield for sunflowers of 2.6 tonnes per hectare is almost a third higher than last year and 13 percent higher than the average over the last decade.

The area used for soybean production increased by 40% this year, the highest level since the data were first monitored in 1991. The average yield, at 2.8 tonnes per hectare, is also expected to be higher for a small tenth. Statistics on the basis of area increases and average yields expect the greatest total yield of this crop since 1991 to be around 11,800 tonnes.

Sub-section of the early fruit crop

The yields of early fruit varieties in intensive and extensive orchards were, meanwhile, sub-sequential. In intensive orchards cherry yields have been better than last year, with an average yield of 3,5 tonnes per hectare more than a third higher but a similar proportion lower than the average of the last 10 years.

The average crop of mares was 3,2 tonnes per hectare, about a fifth less than last year and more than half the average of the last 10 years.

The area used for strawberry cultivation has decreased by more than 5% compared to last year. The average yield of this fruit was 15,5 tonnes per hectare, or seven per cent more than last year, but at the same time a similar percentage lower than the average of the last ten years.

Statistics show that extensive deployments were similar. They collected 15.9 kilograms of this fruit from one cherry tree, a quarter of the average yield over the past ten years. The average crop of maple trees was 9.8 kilograms per tree, three times the average of last year's poor year but one fifth less than the average of the past decade.

Statistics predict that peaches and nectarine will be higher this year than last year. The average yield is expected to be 11,3 tonnes per hectare, which is comparable to the decennial average.

Podpisana pogodba za nadgradnjo ljubljanske železniške postaje, ta naj bi bila končana čez dve leti

Dela bo izvedel konzorcij podjetij z družbo SŽ-Železniško gradbeno podjetje na čelu

Direkcija RS za infrastrukturo je s konzorcijem podjetij podpisala pogodbo za izvedbo gradbenih del pri nadgradnji ljubljanske železniške postaje. Postaja bo zgrajena v 22 mesecih od uvedbe v delo, načrtovane že prihodnji teden.

"Po več kot 20 letih raznih pravnih in drugih zapletov je podpisana pogodba za gradnjo železniške postaje Ljubljana, ki jo naša prestolnica potrebuje in si jo tudi zasluži," so ob podpisu pogodbe, vredne 199,9 milijona evrov brez davka oz. 243,9 milijona evrov z DDV-jem, navedli v direkciji za infrastrukturo. Pogodbo so podpisali s konzorcijem podjetij SŽ-Železniško gradbeno podjetje, Kolektor Igin, CGP in GH holding.

Nadgradnja železniške postaje Ljubljana obsega nadgradnjo tirov z optimizacijo tirne sheme ter izvedbo šestih novih peronov na območju postaje (dva bočna in štirje otočni peroni) z nadstreški in s prilagoditvami za gibalno ovirane osebe. Za varen in lažji dostop potnikov do peronske infrastrukture bo zgrajen nov nadhod s postajno dvorano z dvigali, tekočimi stopnicami ter tekočimi trakovi za hitrejši prehod čez nadhod. Nadhod bo pešcem omogočal povezavo med središčem mesta in Bežigradom (z Masarykove do Vilharjeve ceste).

V postajni dvorani so predvideni prostori za prodajo kart, čakalnica za potnike, sanitarije in podobno. Predvideni sta rekonstrukcija in razširitev obstoječega podhoda z ločenim podvozom za kolesarje ter ločenimi površinami za pešce pod vsemi postajnimi tiri, vključno z izvedbo dvigal za dostope na perone.

Izvedene bodo nadgradnja in prilagoditev signalnovarnostnih, telekomunikacijskih in elektroenergetskih naprav ter nova vozna mreža. Železniška postaja bo povezana tudi z novo avtobusno postajo Ljubljana, so novosti napovedali na direkciji.

Medtem že poteka prva faza nadgradnje največje železniške postaje v državi, ki je tudi nepogrešljiv člen železniškega omrežja v državi. Gre za gradnjo nadomestnega in razširjenega železniškega nadvoza nad Dunajsko cesto s spremljajočimi deli na tirni infrastrukturi. Ta projekt naj bi bil končan do konca leta.

Obenem so na območju železniške postaje stekla tudi dela v okviru na 350 milijonov evrov ocenjenega komercialnega projekta Emonika, kjer je prek družbe Mendota investitor madžarska bančna skupina OTP. Sledila bo tudi gradnja nove avtobusne postaje, kjer so investitor Slovenske železnice, prihodnjih nekaj let pa bo območje tudi veliko gradbišče, ko gre za obnovo komunalne in cestne infrastrukture.

A prav nadgradnja osrednjega dela železniške postaje je bistveni del tega sklopa projektov.

Direkcija je zaradi preseganja ocenjene vrednosti dveh ponudb izvedla postopek s pogajanji

Na javno naročilo za izvedbo gradbenih del pri nadgradnji ljubljanske železniške postaje, objavljeno v začetku marca, sta prispeli ponudbi konzorcija z družbo SŽ-Železniško gradbeno podjetje na čelu, ki je ponudil, da bi dela izvedel za nekaj manj kot 247 milijonov evrov z davkom, in družbe VOC Objekti, ki bi dela opravila za 259,6 milijona evrov.

Ker sta ponudbi presegali ocenjeno vrednost, so na direkciji konec pomladi sprejeli odločitev o neoddaji naročila, nato pa so s ponudnikoma izvedli konkurenčni postopek s pogajanji.

Izbrani konzorcij je poleg ponujene končne izpogajane cene po pojasnilih direkcije predlagal tudi skrajšanje roka dokončanja del in pridobitve potrdila o prevzemu s 24 na 22 mesecev od uvedbe v delo, tako da bodo lahko izpolnjeni pogoji za črpanje sredstev iz mehanizma za okrevanje EU-ja po koronski krizi v okviru izvajanja načrta za okrevanje in odpornost.

Marčni razpis za osrednji del prenove ljubljanske železniške postaje je bil že drugi. Prvega je direkcija objavila novembra lani. Že takrat sta ponudbi oddala konzorcij pod vodstvom SŽ-Železniškega gradbenega podjetja in VOC-a Celje. Ponudba konzorcija je znašala 260,8 milijona evrov z davkom, ponudba VOC-a Celje pa 295,2 milijona evrov. Direkcija je obe ponudbi na prvem razpisu zavrnila kot previsoki, saj sta še bolj očitno presegali ocenjeno vrednost.
2024-09-26.title: Podpisana pogodba za nadgradnjo ljubljanske železniške postaje, ta naj bi bila končana čez dve leti

Signed contract for the upgrade of Ljubljana railway station, to be completed in two years

The work will be carried out by a consortium of companies headed by SŽ-Železnický stavebnictví

The RS Infrastructure Directorate has signed a contract with a consortium of companies to carry out the construction works for the upgrade of the Ljubljana Railway Station. The station will be built within 22 months of commissioning, as planned for next week.

'After more than 20 years of various legal and other complications, the contract for the construction of the Ljubljana railway station has been signed, which our capital needs and deserves,' the Directorate for Infrastructure stated at the time of signing the contract, worth EUR 199.9 million tax-free or EUR 243.9 million VAT. The contract was signed by a consortium of companies SŽ-Železničko stavebnictvo, Kolektor Igin, CGP and GH holding.

The upgrade of Ljubljana Railway Station involves the upgrading of the tracks by optimising the track scheme and the implementation of six new platforms (two side platforms and four island platforms) with overpassage and with adaptations for people with disabilities. To ensure safe and easier access for passengers to the platform infrastructure, a new platform with a station hall will be built with lifts, running stairs and running lanes for a faster crossing of the platform. The overpass will provide a pedestrian connection between the city centre and Bezhigrad (from Masaryk to Vilhar Road).

The station hall has rooms for ticket sales, a passenger waiting room, toilets and the like. The construction and extension of the existing underpass with separate bicycle chassis and separate pedestrian areas under all the station tracks are envisaged, including the implementation of platform access lifts.

The upgrades and adaptations of signal, telecommunications and electrical power facilities and the new transport network will be carried out. The railway station will also be connected to the new Ljubljana bus station, the news was announced at the management.

Meanwhile, the first phase of the upgrading of the country's largest railway station, which is also an integral part of the country's railway network, is already underway. The construction of a replacement and extended railway over the Vienna road with accompanying parts on the track infrastructure. This project is supposed to be finished by the end of the year.

The railway station also includes works under the EUR 350 million commercial project Emonik, where the Hungarian banking group OTP is an investor through Mendota. The construction of a new bus station will also follow, where the Slovenian Railway is an investor, and the area will also be a major construction site for the next few years when it comes to the renovation of the municipal and road infrastructure.

But the very upgrading of the central part of the railway station is an essential part of this set of projects.

The Board of Directors has opened a negotiating procedure for the overestimation of the value of two tenders

The public tender for the construction works for the Ljubljana Railway Station, which was announced in early March, was submitted by a consortium led by SŽ-Železnická Construction Company, which offered to carry out the works for a little less than EUR 247 million with tax, and VOC Objekti, which would carry out the works for EUR 259,6 million.

Since the bids exceeded the estimated value, the management decided not to award the contract at the end of the spring and then negotiated a competitive procedure with the tenderers.

In addition to the final price offered, the consortia selected proposed a reduction in the deadline for completion of the works and the acquisition of the takeover certificate from 24 to 22 months from the date of entry into service, so that the conditions for the withdrawal of funds from the EU Recovery Mechanism after the crisis could be fulfilled as part of the implementation of the recovery and resilience plan.

The tender for the main part of the renovation of the Ljubljana railway station was already the second. The first one was released by the board last November. The tender was already submitted by consortia led by the SŽ-Jelznický staveb firms and VOC Celje. The consortium's offer amounted to EUR 260,8 million in tax terms and the VOC's offer to the whole amounted to EUR 295,2 million. The Commission also found that the Commission had not yet established the existence of a market economy investor in the Union.
2024-09-26.english_title: Signed contract for the upgrade of Ljubljana railway station, to be completed in two years

2024-09-26.content:
Jaka Strel: Dvoživke so živali, ne pa ljudje

Nova epizoda oddaje Ob osmih

"V Sloveniji imamo ta trenutek vrhunsko medicino, ki pa ni samoumevna in jo lahko izgubimo," opozarja družinski zdravnik Jaka Strel.

Oznaka dvoživke za nekatere zdravnike je skrajno žaljiva, je v oddaji Ob osmih dejal družinski zdravnik s koncesijo iz Žirov in direktor zavoda Fitlab Jaka Strel. "Gre dobesedno za dehumanizacijo določene poklicne in strokovne skupine. Nikoli nisem pomislil, da bi kogarkoli od javnih uslužbencev, kot so na primer učitelji, policisti, uradniki, poimenoval z živalskimi prispodobami. O kolegih, ki opravljajo delo tudi zunaj svojih matičnih javnih zavodov, bi rekel, da je to načelno delo, po katerem je veliko povpraševanje. Večina svoje delo opravi v matičnih službah, kot je pač zahtevano od njih. Seveda obstajajo tudi sporne prakse. Ampak to bi morali odpraviti z različnimi nadzori, ki naj odpravijo te nepravilnosti. Zato sploh ne vidim razloga, da bi se o tem pretirano pogovarjali. Tudi v drugih poklicnih skupinah verjetno posamezniki opravljajo svoje delo v službah, kdo pa še popoldne kaj naredi."

Kot pravi Strel, ima sam v okviru rednega delovnega časa čisto dovolj dela, celo želel bi si kakšno dežurstvo manj. V njegovi ordinaciji sicer pri delu v domu starejših občanov pomaga kolegica zdravnica, ki pa ne prihaja iz javnega zdravstvenega zavoda. Opozorila, da bodo ob prepovedi dela zunaj javnih zavodov nekateri zdravniki odšli v popolnoma zasebni sektor in opravljali zgolj samoplačniško dejavnost, se mu zdijo povsem realna. "Predvsem je to problem tam, kjer je zdravnikov malo. Če se osredotočim na bolnišnice, imajo tak problem tiste na obrobju države, ki imajo manjše oddelke in v katere prihajajo na pomoč kolegi iz drugih ustanov. Pri družinskih zdravnikih je nekoliko drugače, poznam pa kolegico, ki je trenutno zaposlena delno v javnem zavodu delno pri zasebniku in verjetno se bo odločila za delo pri zasebniku. Tako se bo lahko zgodilo, da določene storitve, ki jih trenutno dobimo prek zavarovanja, ne bodo več na voljo, ne bodo več samoumevne in bodo postale samoplačniške. Potem pa vemo, kateremu delu populacije bodo na voljo."

Še bolj kot to pa ga skrbi, da bi na ta način lahko izgubili nekatere strokovnjake, ki zdaj v javnih zavodih opravljajo zelo zahtevno delo, pa zanj niso plačani toliko, kot bi lahko bili. "Lahko, da bodo šli med zasebne izvajalce, kjer bodo sicer bolje zaslužili, ampak verjetno z manj zahtevnim strokovnim delom. Na ta način bomo vsi izgubili. Oni bodo izgubili rutino pri najzahtevnejšem delu s pacienti, ti pa ne bodo dobili ustrezne storitve, ki jo bodo morali verjetno iskati v tujini. Zato me zelo skrbi. Čim prej se bo treba odločiti, kako naprej. Vedeti je treba, da v Sloveniji trenutno imamo zelo vrhunsko medicino, ki pa ni samoumevna, in lahko, da jo bomo izgubili." Pri izboljšanju delovanja javnega zdravstva ima po besedah Jake Strela ključno vlogo menedžment v javnih zavodih.

Pacient na prvem mestu

Pacientov v zadnjem času skoraj ni slišati, je nekoliko začuden Strel, čeprav se po njegovem mnenju napovedane spremembe najbolj dotikajo prav njih. "Problem ni od danes ali včeraj, traja že 20 ali celo 30 let. Lahko rečem samo, da je sistem za zdaj še v tako dobri kondiciji, da prave krize še niti pacienti niso začutili." Nekatere stvari v zdravstvu delujejo zelo dobro, pri določenih zadevah je dostopnost zelo dobra. Ob tem Strel dodaja, da so nekatere stvari tudi regijsko pogojene. V osrednji Sloveniji je bolje kot pa recimo na vzhodu države.

Prednosti koncesije

Jaka Strel je družinski zdravnik s koncesijo. Pravi, da mu to omogoča malo več svobode pri organiziranju dela, nakupu opreme, uresničevanju vizije. "Javni zavodi so vseeno večji, organizacija je bolj stabilna, za spremembe je treba imeti več energije." Kot pravi, težav s pridobivanjem kadrov nima. Je pa res, da jih lahko tudi bolje plača oziroma nagradi kot javne ustanove.

Central Slovenia is better than, say, the east of the country.

Benefits of the concession
