2024-09-26.content:
Premier Golob je sprejel odstop ministrice Stojmenove Duh

Predsednik KPK-ja: "Če je vplivala, da se prekrškovni postopek ne izpelje, je to nesprejemljivo"

"V to zgodbo sem šla zato, ker sem bila prepričana, da je politika lahko drugačna, da so spremembe mogoče in da so odnosi med partnerji tudi lahko iskreni, žal ni tako. Zato sem ponudila svoj odstop," je dejala ministrica Emilija Stojmenova Duh.

Vlada je na omrežju X potrdila, da je predsednik vlade Robert Golob sprejel ponujeni odstop ministrice Emilije Stojmenove Duh. Premier Golob bo moral zdaj najprej o odstopu obvestiti DZ, ki se bo nato moral seznaniti z ministričinim odstopom.

Za petek je sicer na dnevnem redu še vedno razprava ob interpelaciji zoper Stojmenovo Duh, ki jo je že drugič vložil SDS. Kako bo potekala petkova seja DZ-ja, pa za zdaj še ni jasno. Predsednik vlade sicer lahko do začetka seje še obvesti DZ o ministričinem odstopu in se poslanci tedaj z njim seznanijo, lahko pa tudi ministrica v okviru predvidenega nastopa pove, da odstopa z ministrske funkcije.

Obvestilo o odstopu se mora sicer uvrstiti na dnevni red seje DZ-ja najpozneje v sedmih dneh po prejemu obvestila. Ministrici bo funkcija s tem prenehala.

Predsednik vlade mora nato v desetih dneh po prenehanju funkcije ministra predlagati novega ministra ali obvestiti državni zbor, da bo funkcijo tega ministra začasno opravljal sam ali jo poveril drugemu ministru.

Ko bo predlagan, se bo kandidat za novega ministra oz. ministrico najprej tri dni in najpozneje sedem dni po vložitvi predloga predstavil pristojnemu delovnemu telesu državnega zbora.

Ministrica deležna številnih kritik

Nekdanja ministrica za digitalno preobrazbo Emilija Stojmenova Duh je bila že več mesecev na udaru kritik zaradi spornega nakupa 13 tisoč prenosnih računalnikov. V sredo pa se je v središču pozornosti znašla še po razkritju portala N1, da je službeno vozilo, s katerim so jo vozili, na avstrijski avtocesti uporabilo modre luči, pozneje pa je ministrica želela doseči, da avstrijski organi ne bi končali prekrškovnega postopka zaradi prehitre vožnje.

Ministrica je v izjavi, kjer je pojasnila, da je ponudila premierju Robertu Golobu svoj odstop, zavrnila vse očitke glede dogodka na avstrijskih cestah. "To, da se izogibamo plačilu kazni, je popolna neresnica. Še enkrat poudarjam, do današnjega dne globe na ministrstvu sploh nismo prejeli. Ne glede na to, da je bilo povsod, da bi globo plačali, pa bi bilo vse v redu, mi nimamo česa plačati, ker kazni še sploh nismo prejeli," je dejala. "V članku, ki je bil objavljen včeraj, ne gre za primer skrbnega obveščanja javnosti, ampak zelo dobro načrtovan poskus diskreditacije mene," je še navedla.

"Na interpelaciji sem želela predstaviti tudi dosežke in se pohvaliti, da Slovenija postaja del skupine devet plus, ki vključuje najuspešnejše države na področju digitalizacije v EU-ju. Na tej poti ni bilo enostavno in bi že zdavnaj obupala, če ne bi imela ob sebi najboljše mogoče ekipe," je dejala.

"V to zgodbo sem šla izključno zato, ker sem bila prepričana, da je politika lahko drugačna, da so spremembe mogoče in da so odnosi med partnerji tudi lahko iskreni. Žal ni tako, zato danes s čisto vestjo in dvignjeno glavo sprejemam objektivno odgovornost in sem predsedniku vlade ponudila svoj odstop," je dodala.  

"Ravnali smo po ustaljenem protokolu in navodilih, ki smo jih prejeli od centra za varovanje in zaščito ob poti na letališče na Dunaj. Delegacija ministrstva je obtičala v daljšem zastoju zaradi dela na cesti in prometne nesreče, ko smo ugotovili, da zaradi tega ne bomo pravočasno prišli na letališče. Voznik je po ustaljenem protokolu poklical višjega inšpektorja na center za varovanje in zaščito, ki je odgovoren tudi za moje varovanje. Voznik je nama s sodelavko sporočil, da mu je v telefonskem pogovoru inšpektor povedal, da mora poklicati avstrijske kolege in jih prositi za spremstvo. V tem času smo čakali v koloni. Čez nekaj minut je poklical nazaj inšpektor in po besedah voznika mu je povedal, da ne more priklicati avstrijskih kolegov in da naj vklopi luč. Če pa bo kar koli narobe, bodo pozneje ukrepali, ko mi je voznik to povedal, nisem podvomila o njegovih besedah ali besedah višjega inšpektorja. Med njunim telefonskim pogovorom sem slišala samo voznikovo stran, tako da ne morem trditi, kaj točno je povedal inšpektor."

KPK uvedel predhodni preizkus

Komisija za preprečevanje korupcije (KPK) je potrdila, da je v povezavi s to zadevo že uvedla predhodni preizkus, v katerem bo preverila morebitne kršitve zakona o integriteti in preprečevanju korupcije.

V SD-ju in Levici bi bili v primeru interpelacije vzdržani

V koalicijskih partnericah, SD-ju in Levici, so po rednih koalicijskih usklajevanjih napovedali, da se bodo, če Stojmenova Duh ne bo odstopila in bo v petek interpelacija v DZ-ju, pri glasovanju vzdržali.

Namestnica vodje poslanske skupine stranke SD Meira Hot je sicer na vprašanje, ali pričakujejo ministričin odstop, odgovorila: "Pričakovala bi, ampak kaj bo, pa bomo videli." Da zgodba o nakupu računalnikov in najnovejša afera kažeta na odnos Stojmenove Duh, pa je ocenil vodja poslancev Levice Matej Tašner Vatovec. Kot je dodal, ministrice ne bodo aktivno rušili.

Predsednica DZ-ja, sicer tudi ustanovna članica Svobode in njena nekdanja podpredsednica, Urška Klakočar Zupančič je medtem ob robu seje DZ-ja dejala, da bo sama počakala na pojasnila ministrice, zatem pa si bo tudi lahko ustvarila mnenje, saj do zdaj s Stojmenovo Duh še ni govorila in ve samo to, kar je prebrala v medijih.

O prometnem prekršku službenega vozila ministrice Emilije Stojmenove Duh in poskusih izogibanja globi bodo govorili tudi v nocojšnji oddaji Tarča, ki bo na 1. programu Televizije Slovenija na sporedu ob 20. uri.

Razprava v studiu bo potekala tudi o tem, kako različne politične afere vplivajo na delo vlade, ki jo je sicer do zdaj zapustilo šest ministric in ministrov.

Dogodek se je zgodil konec maja

Prekršek se je po navedbah N1 zgodil konec maja, ko se je ministrica Emilija Stojmenova Duh odpravila na službeno pot v Ženevo. Radar je službeno vozilo ministrstva pri prehitri vožnji ujel na poti proti dunajskemu letališču. Ministrstvo je zato julija dobilo poziv avstrijske policije, naj ji posreduje informacijo, kdo je vozil vozilo in torej storil prometni prekršek, a je ministrstvo namesto informacije avstrijski policiji poslalo dopis slovenskemu veleposlaništvu na Dunaju, v katerem ga je pozvalo, naj pristojne avstrijske organe zaprosi, da odstopijo od morebitnega pregona oziroma kaznovanja voznika.

Kot razlog je navedlo, da je bil na avstrijski avtocesti zastoj, zato je službeno vozilo obtičalo v koloni. Da ministrica z delegacijo, v kateri je bila le ena zaposlena, ne bi zamudila poleta, je bil voznik službenega avtomobila "primoran prižgati modre luči". Na policiji so za portal N1 potrdili, da se je ministričin voznik pred uporabo modrih luči o tem posvetoval z inšpektorjem policijskega centra za varovanje in zaščito. "Ne glede na vsebino komunikacije zgoraj omenjenih ljudi pa gre v konkretnem primeru za ugotavljanje individualne odgovornosti voznika za prekršek. Tudi slovenska policija postopa enako, če je pri nas ugotovljen prekršek in je lastnik vozila tuja pravna oseba ali državni organ," so sporočili s policije.

Po neuradnih informacijah portala pa naj bi inšpektor vozniku povedal, da v tujini ne sme uporabiti modrih luči, če pa se bo za to vendarle odločil, je odgovornost njegova. Na ministrstvu za digitalno preobrazbo so pojasnili, da je voznik avgusta avstrijskim organom vendarle posredoval vse potrebne informacije, na podlagi katerih pa do zdaj niso ugotovili nepravilnosti.

Komisija pri nakupu prenosnikov zaznala sum kršitve

KPK je sicer v povezavi z ministrico pred kratkim zaznal tudi sum kršitve zakona o javnem naročanju pri nakupu omenjenih računalnikov. Tudi iz pred kratkim objavljenega končnega revizijskega poročila Računskega sodišča o realizaciji lanskega proračuna izhaja, da ministrstvo za digitalno preobrazbo pri nakupu računalnikov ni ravnalo skladno z načeloma učinkovitosti in gospodarnosti.
2024-09-26.title: Premier Golob je sprejel odstop ministrice Stojmenove Duh
2024-09-26.english_content:
Prime Minister Golob has accepted the resignation of Minister Spirit Stymen

CCP President: 'If it has prevented criminal proceedings from being carried out, it is unacceptable'

"I went into this story because I was convinced that politics can be different, that change is possible, and that relationships between partners can be honest, but unfortunately they're not. So I offered my resignation", said Minister Emilia Stymenova Duh.

The government has confirmed on Network X that Prime Minister Robert Golob has accepted the resignation of Minister Emilia-Stoymane Duchamp. Prime Minister Golob will now have to notify the DZ of his resignation first, which will then have to learn about the minister's resignation.

The debate on the appeal against Stämen's Spirit, which the SDS has already filed for the second time, is still on the agenda for Friday. How the DZ's meeting will take place on Friday is still unclear. The Prime Minister may, however, notify the DZ of the Minister's resignation before the start of the session and the Members may then consult him, or the Minister may, within the framework of the planned meeting, inform the Minister that she is resigning her ministerial post.

However, the notice of withdrawal must be placed on the agenda of the meeting of the ZO no later than seven days after receipt of the notice. The ministers will be out of office.

The Prime Minister shall then, within 10 days of the termination of his ministerial post, propose a new minister or inform the National Assembly that he will act on his own or delegate the function of that minister to another minister.

When a proposal is made, the candidate for a new minister or minister shall first submit himself to the competent working body of the National Assembly within three days and no later than seven days after the proposal is submitted.

Minister subject to many criticisms

Former Minister of Digital Transformation Emilia Stömenova Spirit has been under fire for months for the controversial purchase of 13,000 laptops. However, on Wednesday, she came to the limelight after the N1 portal was revealed that the official vehicle she was driving had used blue lights on the Austrian highway, and later the minister wanted to ensure that the Austrian authorities would not terminate the infringement proceedings due to speeding.

The Minister in a statement explaining that she had offered her resignation to Prime Minister Robert Golob, rejected all complaints about the event on the Austrian roads. "The fact that we avoid paying fines is a complete lie. I would like to reiterate that to date, we have not received any payment from the Ministry. Despite the fact that there was a fine to be paid everywhere, it would be fine, we have nothing to pay because we haven't even received the fines yet", she said. "The article published yesterday is not about a case of careful public disclosure, but a very well-planned attempt to discredit me", she added.

'I also wanted to present my achievements at the interpelation and to boast that Slovenia is becoming part of the Group of Nine Plus, which includes the most successful countries in the EU in the field of digitalisation. It was not an easy road and I would have been desperate long ago if I didn't have the best teams around me", she said.

"I went into this story solely because I was convinced that politics can be different, that change is possible, and that relationships between partners can also be honest. Unfortunately, this is not the case, so today, with a clear conscience and a head held high, I accept my objective responsibility and offer my resignation to the Prime Minister.'

"We have been following the established protocol and instructions received from the safety and security centre on the way to the airport in the Danube. The Ministry's delegation was stuck in a long-term deadlock due to road work and traffic accidents when we realized that we would not be able to get to the airport in time. The driver, according to the protocol, called a senior inspector at the security and safety center, who is also responsible for my security. The driver and his coworker told us that in a telephone conversation, the inspector told him that he had to call his Austrian colleagues and ask them to escort him. We were waiting in the colony at the time. A few minutes later, he called the inspector back and, according to the driver, told him that he couldn't call his Austrian colleagues and that he should turn on the lights. But if anything goes wrong, they'll act later when the driver tells me that, I never doubted his words or the words of the senior inspector. During their telephone conversation, I heard only the driver's side, so I cannot say exactly what the inspector said".

The CCP introduced a preliminary test

The Commission for the Prevention of Corruption (CPK) confirmed that it had already introduced a preliminary examination in this case to check for possible breaches of the Integrity and Prevention of Corruption Act.

In the case of an interpelation, the SD and the Left would be held liable.

The coalition partners, the SD and the Left, have announced after regular coalition coordination that they will abstain from voting unless the Spirit of Styman resigns and the Interpelation in the DZ on Friday.

When asked whether they expect the minister to resign, Deputy Leader of the SD Meira Hot said: "I would have waited, but we'll see what happens". But the story of the purchase of computers and the latest affair suggested the attitude of Stämen Geist, as assessed by the leader of the Left MPs, Matej Tasner Vatovec. As he added, the ministers will not be actively dismantled.

The President of the DZ, who is also a founding member of Svoboda and its former Vice-President, Urška Klakočar Zupančić, said on the sidelines of the DZ meeting that she would wait for the Minister's explanation and then be able to generate an opinion, since she had not yet spoken to Spirit of Stojmen and knew only what she had read in the media.

The traffic violation of Minister Emilia Stojmenova Duh's service vehicle and attempts to avoid fines will also be discussed in the tonight's programme Target, which will be broadcast on Slovenian Television's 1st programme at 8pm.

The study will also discuss how different political issues affect the work of the government, which has been left by six ministers and ministers so far.

The incident happened at the end of May.

The offence, according to N1, occurred at the end of May when Minister Emilia-Stoymenova Duh set off on her official journey to Geneva. Radar caught a Ministry of Transport's official vehicle speeding towards the airport in Vienna. The Ministry therefore received a call from the Austrian police in July to provide information on who was driving the vehicle and thus committed a traffic offence, but instead of providing information to the Austrian police, the Ministry sent a letter to the Slovenian Embassy in Vienna asking the competent Austrian authorities to waive any prosecution or penalty for the driver.

The reason given was that there was a traffic jam on the Austrian motorway, so the official vehicle was stuck in the colony. To ensure that a minister with a delegation of only one employee would not miss the flight, the driver of a commercial car was "forced to turn on the blue lights". Police confirmed to portal N1 that the driver of the minister's vehicle consulted the inspector of the police protection and safety centre before using the blue lights. 'Regardless of the content of the communication of the above mentioned persons, the determination of the individual liability of the driver for the offence is in the particular case. The Slovenian police also act the same if an offence is detected in our country and the owner of the vehicle is a foreign legal person or a state authority", the police said.

According to the informal information provided by the portal, the inspector is supposed to tell the driver that he must not use the blue lights abroad, but if he decides to do so, it is his responsibility. The Ministry of Digital Transformation explained that the driver had nevertheless provided the Austrian authorities with all the necessary information in August, on the basis of which no irregularities had been established.

The Commission identified a suspected infringement in the purchase of the laptops

The CCP also recently identified a suspicion of a breach of the public procurement law in connection with the purchase of those computers, in conjunction with the Ministry. The Court of Auditors' final audit report on the implementation of last year's budget, which was recently published, also shows that the Ministry of Digital Transformation did not act in accordance with the principles of efficiency and economy when buying computers.

Politični vrvež z modrimi lučkami

Umetnost možnega: gosta 84. epizode podkasta o politiki sta Gašper Lubej (Siol) in Jernej Šmajdek (STA)

V domači politiki so strasti pregrete. Novinarjema Jerneju Šmajdku in Gašperju Lubeju se zdi nenavadno, da premier Golob vztraja pri branjenju ministrice Emilije Stojmenove Duh, ki je zaradi vrste razlogov že nekaj časa politično na izhodnih vratih.

V drugi epizodi te sezone podkasta Umetnost možnega se v uvodu na kratko še spotaknemo ob komisarsko zgodbo, ki je se medtem že nekoliko umaknila v ozadje. Zato najina sogovornika Jernej Šmajdek (STA) in Gašper Lubej (Siol) napovedujeta, da je do zaslišanja na odboru evropskega parlamenta še dovolj časa, da se Marti Kos ne ponovi zgodba Alenke Bratušek. Zdi se tudi, da je predsednica Evropske komisije Ursula von der Leyen tokrat politično bolj spretno postavila figure na šahovnico prihodnje komisije. Nobenega dvoma ni – resor za širitev je strateško izjemno pomemben za celotno Unijo in s tem tudi za Slovenijo, tudi če domača opozicija trdi drugače, poudari novinarski kolega s Slovenske tiskovne agencije. Sploh zato, ker sta vanj vključena tudi povojna obnova in pozneje tudi priključevanje Ukrajine povezavi.

Ministrica brez rezultatov

V domači politiki pa so strasti, kot po navadi, pregrete. Zdi se nenavadno, da premier Robert Golob vztraja pri branjenju ministrice Emilije Stojmenova Duh. Njen položaj na predvečer interpelacije je dodatno zaostrilo razkritje N1 Slovenija, da je na avstrijski avtocesti uporabljala modre luči, nato pa se je še poskušala izogniti kazni za prehitro vožnjo. Iz vrst koalicije se že vrstijo pričakovanja, da bi morala ministrica sama odstopiti. Ali bo sploh potekala interpelacija v petek ali bo Stojmenova Duh v vlogi ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo pred koncem razprave o njeni interpelaciji že preteklost?

Jernej Šmajdek pove, da je vztrajanje premierja Goloba pri obrambi ministrice za digitalno preobrazbo presenetljivo ne le zaradi zgodbe z računalniki, ki je morda nekoliko prenapihnjena, pač pa tudi zato, ker ima ministrica Stojmenova Duh kopico drugih težav in predvsem premalo ali nič vidnih rezultatov. "O njenem delu, sodelovanju s sodelavci in o dosežkih ministrstva za digitalno preobrazbo ne slišimo praktično nič. Slišimo pa, da je delo na ministrstvu slabo organizirano, da je vzdušje slabo, fluktuacija sodelavcev je bila izjemno velika. Vidimo tudi, da je ministrica veliko na službenih poteh, veliko je hvalisanja, a konkretnih rezultatov pa, denimo pri širjenju široko pasovnega omrežja, ne vidimo. Računalniška zgodba je bila seveda slabo načrtovana in še slabše izpeljana," razmišlja Šmajdek.

"Globoka" birokratska država

Lubej pa meni, da je to tipičen primer tragične zgodbe Slovenije kot birokratske države. "Ali res potrebujemo zakon, da razdelimo računalnike socialno ogroženim? Ali nimamo centrov za socialno delo, ki bi s svojimi evidencami in znanjem lahko pomagali? Je treba celoten postopek izpeljati – potrditi zakon na vladi, ga peljati čez državni zbor, kjer lahko državni svet izglasuje veto? Ne bi bilo tega mogoče izpeljati z eno vladno uredbo?" niza retorična vprašanja eno za drugim in doda: "Vse to generira nezadovoljstvo med ljudmi, ker je za vsak ukrep potrebnega toliko časa. Pri nas odločevalci včasih preveč radi komplicirajo tudi zato, da zaščitijo sebe. Na logično vprašanje, zakaj premier Golob še vztraja pri ministrici, pa tudi jaz nisem dobil odgovorov, ko sem se pogovarjal z ljudmi v vladnih krogih."

Gospodarstvo ne potrebuje svoje politične stranke

V tokratni epizodi tudi o gneči gospodarstvenikov pred političnimi vrati in o tem, da se zdi, da bomo dobili še kakšno stranko, ki bo zagovarjala interese gospodarstva. "Da nobena od strank ne ščiti dovolj gospodarstva, je 'larifari'. V opoziciji dve stranki dobesedno tekmujeta, katera bo bolj prisluhnila interesom gospodarstva," meni Šmajdek. "Razumem, da želijo gospodarstveniki bolj spodbudno in bolj konkurenčno okolje, davčno optimizacijo in predvsem stabilno gospodarsko okolje, a dejstvo je, da SDS in NSi dobesedno tekmujeta, kdo bo večja ekspozitura gospodarskih združenj v parlamentu. Vse preostale stranke z izjemo Levice pa so tako ali tako stranke kapitala ali vsaj kapitalsko močnih ljudi."

Ali se pripravlja teren za Anžeta Logarja, da končno bolj odločno zažene nov politični projekt, se osamosvoji od SDS-a in stopi na politično prizorišče z novo stranko? "Ne vem natančno, kaj je ozadje gospodarskih krogov, ko razmišljajo o svojih strankah, a zdi se mi, da so razmisleki v tej smeri neresni," pa doda Lubej, "Posebej se temu čudim, ker smo imeli kar nekaj neuspešnih vstopov gospodarstvenikov v politiko, začenši z Jankovićem. Še vedno obstaja iluzija, da je država nekaj takega kot podjetje. A to je zelo ozko zastavljena miselnost. Mislim, da s tem le izgubljamo čas."
2024-09-26.title: Politični vrvež z modrimi lučkami

Political rope with blue lights

The art of the possible: guest of the 84th episode of the political podcast are Gasper Lubey (Siol) and Jernej Smajdek (STA)

Passions are overheated in domestic politics. It seems strange to journalists Jerne Šmayd and Gasper Lube that Prime Minister Golob is insisting on defending Minister Emilia Steinmeier Spirit, who for various reasons has been politically on the doorstep for some time.

In the second episode of this season of the podcast, the art of the possible, we briefly stumble upon the commissioner's story, which has since moved a bit behind the scenes. Therefore, our interlocutors Jernej Šmajdek (STA) and Gasper Lubej (Siol) predict that there is still enough time to hear the case before the European Parliament committee to prevent Martí Kos from repeating the story of Alenka Bratushek. It also seems that the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, has this time more politically skilledly put figures on the chessboard of the future Commission. There is no doubt that the 'enlargement resort' is strategically of great importance for the whole Union and therefore for Slovenia, even if the domestic opposition claims otherwise, points out a journalist colleague from the Slovenian press agency. This is because it also includes post-war reconstruction and later the annexation of Ukraine to the Union.

Minister without results

But in domestic politics, the passions, as usual, are overheated. It seems strange that Prime Minister Robert Golob is insisting on defending the spirit of Minister Emilia Steinman. The Commission also notes that the Commission has not yet established a clear and objective assessment of the situation of the applicant. The coalition has already raised expectations that the minister should step down herself. Will there be any interpelation on Friday, or will Stokesman Spirit's role as Minister of Digital Transformation be a thing of the past before the debate on her interpelation ends?

Jernej Šmajdek says that Prime Minister Gobal's persistence in defending the digital transformation minister is surprising not only because of the computer story, which may be a little overloaded, but also because Minister Stojmenova Duh has a host of other problems and, above all, little or no visible results. "We hear virtually nothing about her work, her collaboration with her colleagues and the achievements of the Ministry of Digital Transformation. But we hear that the work at the ministry is poorly organized, that the atmosphere is bad, that the fluctuation of staff has been extremely high. We also see that the Minister is on the job track, there is a lot of praise, but we don't see any concrete results, such as the expansion of the broadband network. The computer story was of course poorly planned and even worse executed", thinks Smayjdek.

A "deep" bureaucratic state

But Lubej believes that this is a typical example of Slovenia's tragic history as a bureaucratic country. "Do we really need a law to distribute computers to socially vulnerable people? Don't we have social work centers that can help with their records and knowledge? Does the whole process have to be carried out?  ⁇  Pass the law on the government, take it through the state assembly, where the state council can veto it? Could this not be accomplished by a single governmental decree?' he asked a series of rhetorical questions, adding: "All this is generating discontent among the people because every action takes so much time. In our country, sometimes the decision makers like to complicate things too much to protect themselves. To the logical question of why Prime Minister Golob still persists in the cabinet, I too have not received answers when I have spoken to people in government circles".

The economy doesn't need its political parties

This time around, it's about the economic crowd at the political door and how we're looking to get another client to stand up for the economy. "That neither of the parties is protecting the economy enough is 'larifari'. In opposition, two parties are literally competing for the best interest of the economy", he said. 'I understand that the economists want a more stimulating and competitive environment, tax optimisation and above all a stable economic environment, but the fact is that the SDS and the NSi are literally competing over who will have the greatest exposure to economic associations in Parliament. All other clients, except the Left, are either clients of capital or at least of capital-powered people.'

Is the ground being set for Annette Logar to finally launch a new political project more decisively, break away from the SDS and enter the political scene with a new party? "I don't know exactly what the background of economic circles is when they think about their customers, but I think the thinking in this direction is untrue", adds Lubej. "I am particularly surprised because we have had quite a few unsuccessful economic entries into politics, starting with Jankovic. There's still the illusion that the state is something like a corporation. But that's a very tightly-knit mindset. I think we're wasting our time".

83-letna voznica zapeljala s ceste in trčila v drevo – zaradi hudih poškodb umrla v bolnišnici

Policisti še preverjajo okoliščine nesreče

V sredo okoli 13. ure se je na cesti med Velikim Slatnikom in Hrušico pri Novem mestu hudo ponesrečila 83-letnica, ki je izgubila nadzor nad svojim avtomobilom in trčila v drevo. Nekaj ur po nesreči je umrla v bolnišnici.

S Policijske uprave Novo mesto so sporočili, da so hudo poškodovano 83-letno voznico oskrbeli reševalci in jo nato odpeljali v bolnišnico, od koder pa so nekaj po 16. uri sporočili, da je zaradi hudih poškodb umrla.

Policisti okoliščine nesreče še preverjajo, so še navedli na novomeški policijski upravi.

Predlog novele, ki prinaša prepoved poveličevanja nacizma in fašizma, prestal prvo sito

Redna seja DZ-ja

Poslanci so na redni seji izvolili članici sodnega sveta. Ocenili so, da je predlog novele, ki prinaša prepoved poveličevanja nacizma in fašizma, primeren za nadaljnjo obravnavo, prav tako predlog novele zakona o gospodarskih družbah.



DZ je na redni seji med drugim obravnaval koalicijski predlog novele zakona o varstvu javnega reda in miru, ki prepoveduje poveličevanja nacizma in fašizma. Pobude za spremembo zakonodaje so prišle po neprijavljenem javnem shodu zamaskiranih pripadnikov samooklicane Slovenske obrambne straže, ki je v središču Ljubljane potekal junija letos in se ga je po podatkih Policijske uprave Ljubljana udeležilo 70 ljudi.Poslanci so s 47 glasovi za in 8 glasovi proti ocenili, da je predlog novele primeren za nadaljnjo obravnavo.
								
									
										
									
									
										Sorodna novica
										Klakočar Zupančič vztraja, da novela o parlamentarni preiskavi odpravlja protiustavnost
									
								
							Posameznika, ki bi na javnem mestu denimo obešal nacistične in fašistične zastave, razkazoval simbole, vzklikal pozdrave, parole, pel himne in pesmi z namenom poveličevanja, odobravanja, opravičevanja, zagovarjanja ali spodbujanja teh skrajnih ideologij, bi se glede na predlog novele kaznovalo z globo od 1000 do 2500 evrov.Dovoljeno pa bi bilo, da se nacistični, fašistični in simboli okupatorskih organizacij ter z njimi povezana slikovna in avdiovizualna gradiva uporabljajo za namene izobraževanja ali denimo v muzejih, filmih ali gledaliških predstavah, še izhaja iz predloga novele.Predlog novele natančno opredeljuje tudi organizacije, katerih simbole je prepovedano širiti. In sicer gre za organizacije, ki so v času druge svetovne vojne z Nemčijo, Kraljevino Italijo, Kraljevino Madžarsko in Neodvisno državo Hrvaško sodelovale pri okupaciji območja današnje Republike Slovenije v Kraljevini Jugoslaviji.Pobude za spremembo zakonodaje so prišle po neprijavljenem javnem shodu zamaskiranih pripadnikov samooklicane Slovenske obrambne straže, ki je bil junija v središču Ljubljane in se ga je po podatkih Policijske uprave Ljubljana udeležilo 70 oseb.Z novelo želijo v koaliciji preprečiti širjenje sovražnosti in zlorabo zgodovine v politične namene, je na seji v imenu predlagatelja predstavil poslanec Svobode Martin Premk. Podobno ureditev imajo v sosednji Avstriji, po drugi strani pa nemoteno deluje komunistična partija Avstrije, je izpostavil.Ravno to, da v predlogu novele zakona ni omenjen tudi komunizem, koaliciji očita opozicija, zato predloga novele niso podprli. Predlog novele je zato po mnenju poslanca SDS Jožeta Tanka pristranski in diskriminatoren "saj zavestno izpušča prepoved komunistične ideologije in simbolov, izpušča grozodejstva partizanske strani". Poslanci SDS so zapustili sejo in niso sodelovali v razpravi."Treba bi bilo obsoditi vse tri totalitarne režime, kot je to naredila Evropa," je izpostavila tudi poslanka NSi Vida Čadonič Špelič. Med razpravo so sejo zapustili tudi poslanci NSi.V koaliciji, ki je predlog novele podprla, menijo da je prav, da si kot demokratična družba zastavimo vprašanje o sprejemljivosti nošenja, razkazovanja simbolov zavržnih ideologij prejšnjega stoletja, ki so temeljile na nestrpnosti in sovraštvu, ksenofobiji, rasizmu, antisemitizmu in ki so odgovorne za drugo svetovno vojno ter za najhujše kršitve človekovih pravic v sodobnejši zgodovini. Obsojanje nacizma in fašizma z zakonskim predlogom vidijo kot temeljni civilizacijski napredek. Predstavniki vlade na seji niso bili prisotni.
								Za članici Sodnega sveta izvoljeni Tanja Bohl in Ana Kerševan

Poslanci so na tajnem glasovanju z 52 glasovi za članico Sodnega sveta izvolili odvetnico Tanjo Bohl, generalno državno odvetnico Ano Kerševan pa z 48 glasovi. Članici Sodnega sveta je poslancem v izvolitev predlagala predsednica republike Nataša Pirc Musar, potem ko je maja DZ izvolil le enega člana Sodnega sveta.

Odvetnico Tanjo Bohl je za kandidatko predsednici republike predlagala Odvetniška zbornica Slovenije. Je strokovnjakinja na področju delovnega prava in prava socialne varnosti ter že več kot 10 let vodi svojo odvetniško pisarno, dejavna je tudi na področju pogajanj s sindikati in je avtorica številnih strokovnih člankov ter predavateljica, je v predstavitvi kandidatke dejal generalni sekretar predsednice Jan Kovačič. 

Predsednica republike je Bohl za članico Sodnega sveta sicer predlagala že v prvem poskusu, a tedaj ni bila izvoljena.  

Generalna državna odvetnica Ana Kerševan, ki to funkcijo opravlja od septembra 2022, je predsednici predlagala Zveza društev pravnikov Slovenije. Pred tem je bila višja državna odvetnica, aktivna na področju svetovanja investicijskih arbitraž ter zastopanja države v civilnih in gospodarskih sporih, še prej pa deset let strokovna sodelavka na oddelku za gospodarsko sodstvo okrožnega sodišča v Ljubljani. Magistrski študij je opravljala v Nemčiji in ZDA, njena doktorska disertacija pa je obravnavala vlogo nacionalnih sodišč v postopku izdaje in izvršitve začasnih ukrepov v arbitraži, je nanizal Kovačič.

Poslanci so dve manjkajoči članici Sodnega sveta izvolili izmed štirih predlaganih kandidatov. Predsednica republika je DZ poleg izvoljenih kandidatk predlagala še strokovno sodelavko okrožnega sodišča na Ptuju Sandro Marčič, ki je na tajnem glasovanju prejela dva glasova in profesorja z mariborske pravne fakultete Miho Šepca, ki je prejel 27 glasov.

Kandidate je predsednica republike predlagala potem, ko je DZ maja letos izvolil le enega člana Sodnega sveta, profesorja prava Marka Novaka.

Kovačič je ob predstavitvi kandidatov v DZ dejal, da so za člane Sodnega sveta prejeli deset predlogov. Z vsemi so v uradu predsednice opravili pogovor, Pirc Musar pa je nato omenjene štiri izbrala tudi na podlagi pogovora z vodji poslanskih skupin.

Sodni svet sestavlja 11 članov. Pet jih na predlog predsednika republike DZ izvoli izmed univerzitetnih profesorjev prava, odvetnikov in drugih pravnikov, šest članov pa iz svojih vrst izvolijo sodniki, ki trajno opravljajo sodniško funkcijo.

Člani se izvolijo za dobo šestih let. Vsaka tri leta se izvolijo dva ali trije člani Sodnega sveta, ki jih izvoli DZ, ter trije člani, ki jih izvolijo sodniki. Kandidat je izvoljen, če zanj glasuje večina poslancev, ki so oddali veljavne glasovnice. Na tokratnem glasovanju je glasovnice oddalo 77 poslancev, le dve sta bili neveljavni.

Poslanci zavrnili zakonski paket NSi-ja, ki naj bi naslavljal problematike v romski skupnosti

DZ je zavrnil paket zakonskih predlogov NSi-ja, povezanih s težavami znotraj romskih skupnosti. Z več novelami oziroma dopolnitvijo zakonov so v NSi želeli preprečiti nasilje v šolah in omejiti zlorabe socialnih transferjev, med drugim tako, da bi socialne transferje vezali na otrokovo obiskovanje šole. V koaliciji menijo, da bi predlagani ukrepi zgrešili bistvo.

Poslanci so z 28 glasovi za in 46 glasovi proti zavrnili predlog novele zakona o osnovni šoli, ki je predvideval, da bi bilo mogoče nasilnemu otroku odrediti začasno šolanje na daljavo, ga vključiti v vzgojni program za socializacijo ali pa ga celo izključiti iz šole.

Predlog so podprli v opozicijski SDS, saj je smisel osnovnošolskega izobraževanja, da se takemu otroku pomaga in se ga vključi v program, ki mu bo omogočil, da bo osnovno šolo tudi uspešno končal.

Proti pa so bili v koalicijskih strankah Svoboda, SD in Levica, kjer so izpostavili, da je osnovnošolsko izobraževanje za vse otroke obvezno in zagotovljeno z ustavo. Poseg v posamezne določbe zakona, četudi z namenom vzgojnega ukrepanja, bi tako pomenil kršitev otrokovih pravic. Posploševanje za posamezno skupino ljudi zaradi nasilnega vedenja enega posameznika pa vodi samo še v dodatno marginalizacijo ranljivih skupin, so izpostavili.

Z več novelami oziroma dopolnitvijo zakonov so v NSi želeli preprečevati oz. omejiti tudi zlorabe socialnih transferjev.

DZ je tako z 28 glasovi za in 46 glasovi proti zavrnil tudi novelo zakona o urejanju trga dela, ki je predvidevala, da bi zavodu za zaposlovanje omogočili, da po šestih mesecih brezposelno osebo napoti na delovno mesto, za katero se zahteva do dve stopnji nižja izobrazba, in da bi osebo, ki krši obveznosti do zavoda, prenehali voditi v evidenci brezposelnih oseb na dan izdaje odločbe.

Minister za delo Luka Mesec je izpostavil, da pri predlogu novele zakona o urejanju trga dela "zgrešimo tarčo", saj romska populacija izobrazbe ponavadi sploh nima. V SDS so predlog novele podprli, saj zagovarjajo stališče, da je zaposlitev najpomembnejši način zagotavljanja socialne varnosti. V koaliciji pa so izpostavili, da predlog ni ustrezen in ne bi dosegel svojega namena, opozorili so tudi, da je predlagana ureditev v nasprotju z ustavo.

Z 28 glasovi za in 47 glasovi proti so poslanci zavrnili tudi predlog novele zakona o socialno varstvenih prejemkih, s katero so v NSi-ju predlagali, da se denarna socialna pomoč tri mesece izplačuje v naravi, če otrok neupravičeno ne obiskuje pouka osnovne šole. V SDS-u so predlog podprli, saj pravice romske skupnosti po njihovem prepričanju ne pomenijo, da za starše, ki svojih otrok ne pošiljajo v šolo, ni posledic.

V koaliciji so opozorili, da denarna socialna pomoč ni namenjena spodbujanju izobraževanja, ampak zagotavljanju materialnih pogojev za zadovoljevanje minimalnih življenjskih potrebščin socialno ogroženega posameznika ali družine.

Neposreden prenos seje lahko spremljate na 3. programu Televizije Slovenija. Prenos izredne seje sledi 15 minut po zaključku redne.

Predlog dopolnitev zakona o starševskem varstvu in družinskih prejemkih pa so poslanci zavrnili z 28 glasovi za in 47 glasovi proti. Predlog je predvideval, da bi se tudi otroški dodatek izplačeval v materialni obliki, če učenec ne obiskuje pouka. Če otrok ne nadaljuje izobraževanja v srednji šoli, pa bi se znesek otroškega dodatka znižal za 33 odstotkov oz. za tisti del, ki je namenjen izobraževanju. Tudi ta predlog so v SDS podprli, v koaliciji pa so izpostavili, da je trenutno odločitev za izplačevanje socialnih transferjev pomoči v naravi prepuščena strokovni presoji socialnih delavcev.

NSi je predlagala paket zakonskih predlogov, povezanih z romskimi vprašanji in temelji na svežnju zakonov, ki jih je v DZ vložila že skupina županov občin jugovzhodne Slovenije in Posavja, a jih je tudi takrat DZ zavrnil. V tem sklopu so v NSi predlagali tudi novelo zakona o voznikih, ki je kot pogoj za opravljanje vozniškega izpita predvideval končan sedmi razred osnovne šole, a jo je že v torek ustavila rdeča luč DZ. Vsi predlogi so tako končali zakonodajno pot.

Predlog novele zakona o gospodarskih družbah čez prvo obravnavo v DZ

DZ je po prvem branju vladnega predloga novele zakona o gospodarskih družbah z 49 glasovi za in sedmimi proti odločil, da je ta primeren za nadaljnjo obravnavo. Predlog novele, s katerim se v slovenski pravni red prenaša štiri evropske direktive, prinaša večjo preglednost poslovanja in družbeno odgovornosti gospodarskih družb.

Po predlogu se v slovenski pravni red prenaša direktiva o razkritju davčnih informacij, ki določa, da morajo družbe, ki imajo več kot 750 milijonov evrov letne realizacije, poročati o davčnih podatkih svojih družb v tretjih državah, torej izven EU. "Ta direktiva bo v Sloveniji predvidoma zajela 14 velikih gospodarskih družb," je pojasnil državni sekretar na ministrstvu za gospodarstvo, tehnologijo in šport Dejan Židan.

Prenaša se direktiva glede poročanja podjetij o trajnosti. EU se je odločila, da za največje družbe, ki imajo več kot 50 milijonov evrov letnega prometa in 250 zaposlenih, takšnih je v Sloveniji nekaj čez 270, predpiše obveznost, da se trajnostno poročilo prelije v letno poročilo in da se revidira tudi ta del.

V zakon se prenaša direktiva o uravnoteženi spolni zastopanosti med direktorji. "Po osnovni direktivi pade v sistem obvezne spolne zastopanosti 11 družb, ki kotirajo na borzi, vendar smo v to vključili še velike družbe, v katerih so država ali občine večinski lastnik. Tako je v to vključenih približno 141 družb," je povedal Židan.

Prenaša se še direktivo o prilagoditvi meril velikosti družb. Prag za veliko družbo se spreminja s 40 milijonov letne realizacije na 50 milijonov evrov in z 20 milijonov aktive na 25 milijonov evrov. V Sloveniji je sedaj približno 530 velikih podjetij, po spremembi jih bo okoli 270, 

V okviru glasovanj so poslanci izmed štirih predlaganih kandidatov izbirali dva manjkajoča člana Sodnega sveta. Kandidate, odvetnico Tanjo Bohl, generalno državno odvetnico Ano Kerševan, strokovno sodelavko okrožnega sodišča na Ptuju Sandro Marčič in profesorja z mariborske pravne fakultete Miho Šepca je predsednica republike Nataša Pirc Musar predlagala, potem ko je DZ maja letos izvolil le enega člana Sodnega sveta.

15 minut po končani redni seji se bodo poslanci sestali še na izredni seji, na kateri bodo odločali o nedopustnosti zakonodajnega referenduma o noveli zakona o parlamentarni preiskavi.

The proposal for a novel banning the exaltation of Nazism and fascism passed the first reading

Regular meeting of the DZ

Members of the Judicial Council shall be elected by the Members at their regular meeting. They considered that the draft of the novel, which provides for a ban on the expansion of Nazism and fascism, was appropriate for further consideration as well as the draft of the new Law on Economic Societies.



The DZ was meeting at a regular meeting to discuss, among other things, the coalition proposal for a new law on the protection of public order and peace, which prohibits the expansion of Nazism and fascism. The initiative to amend the legislation came after an unannounced public meeting of masked members of the self-proclaimed Slovenian Defence Guard, which took place in central Ljubljana in June this year and was attended by 70 people, according to the Ljubljana Police Administration. The Members voted 47 in favour and 8 against to consider the novel's proposal fit for further consideration. Klakočar Zupančič insists that the novella about parliamentary investigation eliminates the unconstitutionality A person who, in a public place, for example, hangs Nazi and Fascist flags, displays symbols, shouts greetings, slogans, sings hymns and songs in order to magnify, approve, excuse, defend or promote these extreme ideologies would be fined, according to the novel's proposal, between €1,000 and €2,500. The proposal also suggests that Nazi, fascist and symbolist occupation organisations and related visual and audiovisual material should be allowed to be used for educational purposes, for example in museums, films or theatrical performances. The proposal also specifies the specific organisations whose symbols are prohibited from being disseminated. These are organisations which, during the Second World War, with Germany, the Kingdom of Italy, the Kingdom of Hungary and the Independent State of Croatia participated in the occupation of the territory of the present-day Republic of Slovenia in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia. The initiative to amend the legislation came after an unannounced public meeting of masked members of the self-proclaimed Slovenian Defence Guard, which took place in June in central Ljubljana and was attended by 70 people, according to the Ljubljana Police Administration. The new proposal aims to prevent the spread of hostility and the abuse of history for political purposes in the coalition, said Martin Premk, a member of the Freedom Party, on behalf of the proposer. A similar arrangement is in place in neighbouring Austria, whereas the Communist Party of Austria, on the other hand, operates smoothly, he said. Just because the draft law does not mention communism, the coalition is the father of the opposition, so the draft law was not supported. According to SDS member Jozet Tank, the novel's proposal is therefore biased and discriminatory "at least deliberately omits the prohibition of communist ideology and symbols, omits the atrocities of the partisan party". The SDS deputies left the session and did not participate in the debate. "All three totalitarian regimes should be condemned, as Europe has done", said NSI Member Vida Chadonič Špelic. During the debate, the members of the NS also left the session. The coalition that supported the proposal for the novel believes it is right for us as a democratic society to question whether it is acceptable to wear, display, symbolise the disgusting ideologies of the last century based on intolerance and hatred, xenophobia, racism, anti-Semitism and responsible for the Second World War and the worst human rights violations in modern history. They see the condemnation of Nazism and fascism by a bill as a fundamental advance in civilization. Government officials were not present at the meeting. Members of the Court of Justice, Tanja Bohl and Ana Kerševan, elected

The members of the Court of Justice elected by secret ballot 52 members, including Tanja Bohl, and General Counsel Ano Kerševan, 48 members. Members of the Judicial Council were nominated for Members of Parliament by the President of the Republic, Natasha Pirc Musar, after the DZ elected only one member of the Judicial Council in May.

The Advocate General's Office of Slovenia has nominated Ms Tanja Bohl as a candidate for President of the Republic. She is an expert in labour law and social security law and has been running her own law firm for more than 10 years, she is also active in trade union negotiations and is the author of numerous professional articles and a lecturer, said Jan Kovačič, Secretary-General of the Presidency, in the presentation of the candidate.

The President of the Republic had already proposed Bohl as a member of the Judicial Council at the first attempt, but she was not elected at that time.

The Commission has also examined the situation of the Slovenian State and the situation of the Slovak Republic in the context of the current situation. Prior to that, she was a senior public defender, active in the field of investment arbitration and representing the State in civil and economic disputes, and for ten years previously worked as a professional associate in the economic justice department of the Ljubljana District Court. She has completed her master's studies in Germany and the USA and her doctoral dissertation deals with the role of national courts in the process of extradition and the enforcement of interim measures in arbitration, Kovacic said.

The Members elected two missing members of the Council of Justice from among the four proposed candidates. In addition to the elected candidates, the President of the Republic proposed a professional associate of the Ptu district court, Sandro Marčić, who received two votes in a secret ballot and Professor Miho Šepc, of the Maribor Law School, who received 27 votes.

The candidates were nominated by the President of the Republic after the DZ elected only one member of the Judicial Council in May this year, Professor of Law Mark Novak.

Kovacic said at the presentation of the candidates to the DZ that they had received ten proposals for the members of the Council of Justice. The President's office held a discussion with all four of them, and Pirc Musar then selected the four following discussions with the heads of the parliamentary groups.

The Judicial Council shall consist of 11 members. Five of them are elected by the President of the Republic of the Czech Republic from among university professors of law, lawyers and other lawyers, and six members are elected from among their peers by permanent judges.

Members shall be elected for a term of six years. Every three years two or three members of the Judicial Council shall be elected, appointed by the General Court, and three members shall be elected by the judges. The candidate shall be elected by a majority of the Members who have delivered the valid ballots. In this vote, the ballot was defeated by 77 deputies, only two of whom were invalid.

MEPs rejected the NSI's legislative package, which was supposed to address issues in the Roma community

The DZ rejected a package of legislation proposals from the NSI related to problems within Roma communities. With more new or supplementary laws, the NS wanted to prevent violence in schools and limit the abuse of social transfers, including by linking social transfers to a child's attendance at school. The Coalition believes the proposed measures would be in error of substance.

MEPs voted 28 in favour and 46 against a new primary school bill that would have allowed a violent child to be temporarily placed in distance education, included in a socialisation programme or even expelled from school.

The proposal was supported by the opposition SDS, as the purpose of primary education is to help such a child and to integrate him into a programme that will enable him to complete his primary school successfully.

Opponents were in the coalition parties Freedom, SD and Left, which declared that primary education was compulsory for all children and guaranteed by the constitution. Interference in certain provisions of the law, even for the purpose of educational action, would thus constitute a violation of the rights of the child. The Commission's report also highlights the importance of the 'relevant' approach to the protection of the environment.

The NSI wanted to prevent or limit the abuse of social transfers by introducing new or supplementing laws.

The DZ also rejected a new Labour Market Regulation Act by 28 votes to 46 against, which provided that the employment institution should be able to refer the unemployed person to a job which requires up to two degrees of lower education after six months and that the person who breaches his obligations to the establishment should cease to be registered as unemployed on the date of the decision.

Minister of Labour Luka Mesec stated that when proposing a new law on labour market regulation, we "mistake the target", since the Roma population usually does not have any education at all. The SDS supported the novel's proposal, arguing that employment is the most important way of ensuring social security. The Coalition, however, found that the proposal was inappropriate and would not achieve its purpose, and warned that the proposed regulation was unconstitutional.

MEPs also rejected a new Social Security Benefits Bill, which proposed that the NSI pay out three months' cash social assistance in kind if the child does not attend primary school unfairly. The SDS supported the proposal, as the rights of the Roma community do not, in their view, mean that there are no consequences for parents who do not send their children to school.

The Coalition warned that the purpose of the financial social assistance was not to promote education but to provide material conditions to meet the minimum living needs of a socially disadvantaged individual or family.

You can watch the live broadcast of the session on TV Slovenia's programme 3. The transmission of the emergency session shall be followed by 15 minutes after the end of the regular session.

The proposal to amend the Parental Welfare and Family Allowances Act was rejected by 28 votes to 47. The proposal provided that the child benefit should also be paid in material form if the pupil does not attend the class. If the child does not continue his/her education in secondary school, the child allowance amount would be reduced by 33%, or for the part intended for education. The proposal was also supported by the SDS, and the coalition stated that the decision to pay social transfers of aid is currently in the hands of social workers.

The NSi proposed a package of legislative proposals related to Roma issues based on a set of laws already submitted to the GZ by a group of mayors of the municipalities of south-eastern Slovenia and Posavia, but which were also rejected by the GZ. In this context, the NS proposed a new driver law, which required the completion of the seventh grade of primary school as a condition for passing the driving test, but was already stopped by the red light on Tuesday. All the proposals thus ended the legislative process.

Proposal for a new Law on corporations at first reading in the OJ

DZ, after first reading the Government's proposal for a new Law on corporations, decided by 49 votes in favour and 7 against that it was appropriate for further consideration. The proposal for a new regulation transposing the four European Directives into the Slovenian legal order brings greater transparency of business and corporate social responsibility.

The proposal transposes into Slovenian law the Directive on the disclosure of tax information, which provides that companies with an annual turnover of more than EUR 750 million must report the tax data of their companies in third countries, i.e. outside the EU. "This Directive is expected to cover 14 large economic companies in Slovenia", explained State Secretary at the Ministry of Economy, Technology and Sport Dejan Židan.

The Directive on the reporting of enterprises on sustainability is hereby transposed. The EU has decided to impose an obligation on the largest companies with annual turnover of more than EUR 50 million and 250 employees, some 270 in Slovenia, to transpose the sustainability report into the annual report and to review this part as well.

The Directive on gender balance among directors is transposed into law. 'The basic directive includes 11 companies listed on the stock exchange under the compulsory sex representation scheme, but we have included large companies in which the State or the municipality is the majority owner. So there are about 141 companies involved", said the Jew.

The Directive on the adjustment of corporate size criteria is also transposed. The threshold for a large company varies from 40 million to 50 million euros per annum and from 20 million to 25 million euros per annum. There are now around 530 large enterprises in Slovenia, and after the changeover there will be around 270,

In the context of the voting, MEPs elected two missing members of the Council of Justice from among the four proposed candidates. The candidates, Advocate General Tanjo Bohl, Advocate General Ano Kerševan, Specialist in the Ptu District Court Sandro Marčić and Professor at the Maribor Law School Miho Šepc, were nominated by the President of the Republic, Natasha Pirc Musar, after the DZ elected only one member of the Judicial Council in May this year.

15 minutes after the end of the regular session, MEPs will meet again in an extraordinary session to decide whether to vote on the inadmissibility of a legislative referendum on a new parliamentary inquiry law.

Vlada potrdila predloga proračunov za leti 2025 in 2026

V ospredju krepitev gospodarstva, zdravstva, znanja, inovacij in stanovanjske ter podnebne politike

Po dolgotrajnih usklajevanjih je vlada na seji potrdila predloga sprememb državnih proračunov za prihodnji dve leti in ju poslala v DZ. Finančni minister je sporočil, da je vlada zagotovila tudi sredstva za prenovo sistema plač v javnem sektorju.

Postopke za pripravo predlogov proračunov za leti 2025 in 2026 je vlada začela v drugem tednu maja. Sprejela je okvirni razrez proračunskih odhodkov po posameznih področjih, nato je steklo usklajevanje odhodkov s proračunskimi porabniki. Po tokratni redni seji vlade je finančni minister Klemen Boštjančič sporočil, da je vlada predloga sprememb državnega proračuna za leto 2025 in 2026 potrdila.

"Za leto 2025 je tako načrtovanih prihodkov za 15,2 milijarde evrov, odhodkov pa za 17,1 milijarde evrov. Prihodki so v primerjavi z lani sprejetim proračunom za leto 2025 višji za 4,6 odstotka, odhodki pa za osem odstotkov," je povedal minister. Proračunski primanjkljaj je tako načrtovan za 1,9 milijarde evrov oziroma 2,6 odstotka BDP-ja. Za leto 2026 pa naj bi se proračunski primanjkljaj po načrtih vlade v primerjavi z letom 2025 znižal, in sicer naj bi znašal 1,2 milijarde evrov oziroma 1,6 odstotka BDP-ja.

V ospredju proračuna za leti 2025 in 2026 bodo po besedah finančnega ministra ukrepi za krepitev slovenskega gospodarstva, zdravstva, znanja, inovacij in stanovanjske ter podnebne politike, podprti tudi z evropskimi viri.

Za popoplavno obnovo do vključno leta 2026 tudi sredstva EU-ja

Vlada bo glede na proračunski načrt z javnimi sredstvi prihodnje leto še vedno podpirala tudi ukrepe za odpravo posledic poplav. "Ta so zagotovljena v skladu za obnovo Slovenije, t. i. SOS-skladu. V njem je trenutno na voljo 168 milijonov evrov," je pojasnil Boštjančič. Poudaril je, da so poleg sredstev iz državnega proračuna do vključno leta 2026 na voljo tudi sredstva iz načrta za okrevanje in odpornost

A kot je spomnil minister, si je treba ta sredstva "zaslužiti s predhodno izvedenimi reformami". Slovenija sicer trenutno čaka na nakazilo sredstev iz Bruslja na podlagi tretjega zahtevka – to naj bi se zgodilo konec oktobra oziroma na začetku novembra. "Gre za okvirno 258 milijonov evrov. Po tem izplačilu bo Slovenija prejela že 41-odstotni priliv vseh razpoložljivih sredstev oziroma 1,1 milijarde evrov," je dejal finančni minister.

Potrditev dogovorjene uskladitve olajšav in lestvice za odmero dohodnine

Vlada je ob tem potrdila tudi predlog zakona o izvrševanju proračunov za leti 2025 in 2026, ki vključuje tudi 5,2-odstotno uskladitev olajšav in lestvice za odmero dohodnine za leto 2025, kot je bilo dogovorjeno s socialnimi partnerji v okviru Ekonomsko-socialnega sveta. Boštjančič je pojasnil, da se bodo na podlagi uskladitve prihodnje leto zvišale neto plače zaposlenih.

"Predlog zakona določa tudi letni dodatek za upokojence in pa povprečnino za občine za leti 2025 in 2026, ki pa bo zato, ker dogovor z občinskimi združenji še ni sklenjen, spremenjena z amandmajem v državnem zboru," je napovedal minister za finance.

Boštjančič: Slovenija je po višini državnih naložb povsem v vrhu EU-ja

Na redni seji se je ministrska ekipa prav tako seznanila z osnutkom srednjeročnega fiskalnostrukturnega načrta Republike Slovenije za obdobje med letoma 2025 in 2028, ki je pripravljen na podlagi novih fiskalnih pravil EU-ja. "Načrt predvideva štiriletno obdobje konsolidacije, ki bo zagotovila zmanjševanje dolga sektorja država in srednjeročno ohranjanje primanjkljaja sektorja država pod tremi odstotki BDP-ja," je dejal Boštjančič.

Ob tem je poudaril, da Slovenija ohranja eno najvišjih ravni naložb med državami EU-ja, ki znaša približno pet odstotkov BDP-ja. "Slovenija je povsem v vrhu držav EU-ja po višini državnih naložb in prav te državne naložbe so v večini tudi motor gospodarstva in BDP-ja," je dejal.

Potrditev zakonske podlage za prenovo plačnega sistema v javnem sektorju

Vlada je potrdila tudi predlog zakona o skupnih temeljih sistema plač v javnem sektorju, ki predstavlja podlago za največjo prenovo plačnega sistema v javnem sektorju v zadnjih 15 letih. Finančni minister se je vsem socialnim partnerjem ob tem zahvalil za konstruktivno sodelovanje v dolgotrajnem procesu in hkrati opozoril, da delo s potrditvijo predloga na vladi še ni končano.

"Čaka nas namreč še zaključek pogajanj na stebrih, kjer bomo določili končne zneske, in takrat bo čas za konkretne številke," je poudaril. Povedal je, da so zadeve dogovorjene v 95 odstotkih, a vseeno opozoril, da so do uradnega konca pogajanj kakršne koli ocene, ki že krožijo v javnosti, prezgodnje. 

"Kar je jasno, in to z veseljem ponovno povem, pa je, da noben javni uslužbenec v novem plačnem sistemu ne bo imel osnovne plače nižje od minimalne ter da se bodo plače na letni ravni usklajevale z inflacijo, in to prvič v zgodovini," je poudaril Boštjančič. Sistemsko zvišanje plač bodo prvi dočakali najslabše plačani javni uslužbenci. Sklenjen je tudi že dogovor o povišanju regresa za javne uslužbence. Prihodnje leto bo tako znašal pet odstotkov več od minimalne plače, leta 2026 pa 10 odstotkov več. Obe leti bo regres javnim uslužbencem izplačan predčasno – marca ob izplačilu plače za februar.

Kot je v izjavi povedal Boštjančič, vlada predlaga, da do povišanja plač vladnim funkcionarjem – torej ministrom, državnim sekretarjem, funkcionarjem generalnega sekretariata vlade ter tudi poslancem in funkcionarjem državnega sveta – pride z zamikom, šele ob sklicu novega državnega zbora. Plače pravosodnih funkcionarjev in preostalih funkcionarjev, kot so predsednica države, župani, predsednik protikorupcijske komisije in varuh človekovih pravic, pa naj bi se usklajevale postopno, podobno kot plače javnih uslužbencev.

"Čaka nas še sklenitev kolektivne pogodbe za javni sektor in kolektivnih pogodb dejavnosti ter poklicev v javnem sektorju, ki ju morata obe strani parafirati v oktobru, temu pa bo nato sledil še podpis vlade in reprezentativnih sindikatov javnega sektorja v novembru," je časovnico uveljavljanja plačne reforme povzel Boštjančič. Skupni učinek celotne plačne reforme je ocenjen na 1,4 milijarde evrov. Ta znesek se bo v prihodnjih štirih letih porazdelil na po približno 350 milijonov evrov vsako leto, je še povedal finančni minister.

Poleg omenjenega je vlada, kot je objavil STA, sprejela še več drugih zakonov.

Sprejet predlog novele zakona o sistemu jamstva za vloge

Vlada je določila besedilo predloga novele zakona o sistemu jamstva za vloge. Z njim se zvišuje ciljna raven sklada, ki mora biti dosežena do konca leta 2030, s sedanjih 0,8 odstotka na 1,5 odstotka vsote vseh zajamčenih vlog v Sloveniji.

Znesek kritja za vloge posameznega vlagatelja pri eni banki je do 100.000 evrov, izjemoma pa je izplačilo jamstva lahko tudi višje od navedenega zneska. Sredstva za izplačilo jamstva za vloge ob propadu banke ali hranilnice se zagotovijo iz sklada za jamstvo vlog, ki ga upravlja Banka Slovenije.

Za zagotovitev sredstev za izplačilo jamstva za vloge bo v primeru stečaja banke ali hranilnice mogoče uporabiti tudi sredstva sklada, ustanovljenega na podlagi zakona o organu in skladu za reševanje bank, katerega nadaljnje delovanje bo urejeno v predlogu novele zakona o reševanju in prisilnem prenehanju bank, ki ga je vlada potrdila prejšnji teden.

Vlada potrdila predloge  zakonov za pristop Slovenije k Evropski vesoljski agenciji

Vlada je potrdila tudi več predlogov zakonov, potrebnih za pristop Slovenije k Evropski vesoljski agenciji (Esa), med njimi o ratifikaciji konvencije o ustanovitvi Ese in ratifikacije sporazuma med vlado in Eso o pristopu Slovenije h konvenciji, so sporočili z vladnega urada za komuniciranje (Ukom).

Sporazum vodi k polnopravnemu članstvu Slovenije v Esi, ki prinaša enakopravno sodelovanje z drugimi članicami pri sprejemanju bistvenih odločitev, povečanje prepoznavnosti Slovenije v svetu kot čedalje pomembnejšega akterja v mednarodnem vesoljskem sektorju, možnosti za sodelovanje v programih, v katerih slovenski vesoljski sektor do zdaj ni mogel sodelovati, ter dodatno odprta vrata za sodelovanje s podjetji držav članic Ese in drugih držav, tudi za komercialne projekte, so našteli na ministrstvu.

Ob pristopu h konvenciji bo Slovenija po njihovih navedbah izplačala posebno plačilo v vrednosti 1,7 milijona evrov, in sicer v enem obroku v letu 2025. Letni prispevek Slovenije k obveznim dejavnostim za leto uveljavitve sporazuma bo določen s pravili, ki veljajo za članice.

Slovenija bo sodelovala v tožbi proti Mjanmaru zaradi genocida

Slovenija je večkrat izrazila zaskrbljenost zaradi usode Rohingov in je v povezavi s tem podprla izjave Evropske unije, pa tudi več resolucij mednarodnih organov, vključno z Generalno skupščino ZN-a, so sporočili po seji vlade. Vlada je tako odločila, da bo Slovenija vložila intervencijo v tožbi Gambije proti Mjanmaru pred Meddržavnim sodiščem (ICJ) v Haagu glede domnevnih kršitev konvencije ZN-a o preprečevanju in kaznovanju zločina genocida. Gre za primere zatiranja manjšine Rohingov leta 2017.

Ministrstvo za zunanje in evropske zadeve je sodelovanje v postopku pred ICJ-jem predlagalo, ker Slovenija med temeljne usmeritve svoje zunanje politike med drugim postavlja krepitev spoštovanja človekovih pravic ter zagotavljanje odgovornosti za storjene najhujše zločine.

MZEZ, ki bo glede na sklep vlade usklajeval zastopanje Slovenije, je za potrebe postopka zagotovil finančna sredstva v okvirnem znesku 20.000 evrov, med drugim za kritje stroškov službenih poti.

Podaljšani ukrepi za poenostavljeno zaposlovanje tujcev do konca leta

Vlada je tudi podaljšala ukrepe za poenostavljeno zaposlovanje tujcev, in sicer do konca leta. Podaljšanje se nanaša na vloge, ki bodo za področje izdaje in podaljšanja enotnih dovoljenj za prebivanje in delo za tujce na upravne enote vložene od 1. oktobra do vključno 31. decembra, so sporočilo ministrstva za javno upravo povzeli na Ukomu.

"V prvem obdobju izvajanja zakona so bili zaznani in ugotovljeni določeni pozitivni učinki delujočih ukrepov, ki bodo v nadaljevanju še dodatno prispevali k izboljšanemu reševanju zadev v zakonitem roku, kar pa seveda varuje tako človekove pravice kot povečuje konkurenčnost gospodarstva oziroma veča ponudbo dela na trgu dela," so odločitev za podaljšanje pojasnili na ministrstvu.

Opozorili so tudi na potrebo po nadaljnji razbremenitvi poslovnih procesov upravnih enot in omogočanju hitrejšega vstopa tujcev na trg dela.

Vlada je hkrati za obravnavo v DZ-ju po skrajšanem postopku pripravila predlog novele zakona o nadzoru državne meje. Določila je strateške mejne točke na meji s Hrvaško in obseg strateških mejnih območij. Strateške mejne točke so ključne za ohranjanje državne pripravljenosti na morebitne varnostne izzive, je sporočil urad vlade za komuniciranje.

Na dnevnem redu vlade je bilo tudi imenovanje nove direktorice Zavoda RS za šolstvo. To je postala Jasna Rojc, predtem državna sekretarka na ministrstvu za vzgojo in izobraževanje. Nasledila je Vinka Logaja, ki bo zasedel položaj ministra za vzgojo in izobraževanje, kjer bo nasledil Darja Feldo, ki je pred kratkim odstopil.

2024-09-26.english_content:
The Government has approved the draft budgets for 2025 and 2026

Strengthening the economy, health, knowledge, innovation and housing and climate policy

Following long-term coordination, the Government approved at its meeting the proposed amendments to the national budgets for the next two years and sent them to the ZO. The Minister of Finance stated that the Government had also provided funds for the reform of the public sector wage system.

The Government has started the procedures for preparing the proposals for the budgets for 2025 and 2026 in the second week of May. It adopted a framework breakdown of budgetary expenditure by area and then coordinated expenditure with budgetary users. The Commission has also taken note of the fact that the Commission has not yet approved the amendments to the national budget for 2025 and 2026.

'In 2025 revenue is projected to be EUR 15,2 billion and expenditure EUR 17,1 billion. The revenue is 4.6% higher than the budget adopted for 2025 last year and the expenditure is 8% higher", the Minister said. The budget deficit is thus projected at EUR 1.9 billion or 2.6 per cent of GDP. The government's budget deficit is projected to decrease by EUR 1.2 billion, or 1.6 percent of GDP, compared with 2025, for 2026.

The Minister of Finance said that the budget for 2025 and 2026 will focus on measures to strengthen the Slovenian economy, health, knowledge, innovation and housing and climate policy, supported by European resources.

EU funds for flood restoration up to and including 2026

The government will continue to support flood mitigation measures, in line with the public budget plan for next year. 'These are provided under the Slovenia Recovery Fund, i.e. the SOS Fund. It currently has 168 million euros available", explained Boštjančić. It stressed that, in addition to the State budget, the recovery and resilience plan also provides funding until 2026 inclusive.

But as the minister recalled, these funds "must be earned through previous reforms". Slovenia is currently awaiting a transfer of funds from Brussels on the basis of the third request  ⁇  this is expected to take place in late October or early November. "This is an estimated 258 million euros. After this payment, Slovenia will already receive 41% of all available funds, or EUR 1.1 billion", the Finance Minister said.

Confirmation of the agreed alignment of the allowances and the income scale

The Government also approved the draft Budget Implementation Bill for 2025 and 2026, which also includes a 5,2% harmonisation of the benefits and income-measurement scales for 2025, as agreed with the social partners within the Economic and Social Council. Boštjančić explained that the net wages of employees would increase following the harmonisation next year.

"The draft law also sets out an annual pension supplement and a municipal average for 2025 and 2026, which, because the agreement with the municipal associations has not yet been concluded, will be amended by an amendment in the National Assembly", announced the Minister of Finance.

Boštjančić: Slovenia is at the top of the EU in terms of public investment

At the regular meeting, the Ministerial Team also took note of the draft medium-term fiscal structural plan of the Republic of Slovenia for the period 2025-2028, drawn up on the basis of the new EU fiscal rules. "The plan envisages a four-year consolidation period which will ensure the reduction of the debt to the public sector and the medium-term maintenance of the public sector deficit below 3 percent of GDP", said Boštjančić.

At the same time, he stressed that Slovenia maintains one of the highest levels of investment among EU countries, representing around 5% of GDP. "Slovenia is completely at the top of the EU in terms of state investment and it is this state investment that is also the engine of the economy and GDP for the most part", he said.

Confirmation of the legal basis for the public sector wage system renewal

The Government also approved the draft law on the common basis of the public sector wage system, which forms the basis for the largest public sector wage system reform in the last 15 years. The Minister thanked all the social partners for their constructive cooperation in the long-term process, while stressing that the work on the approval of the proposal by the Government was not yet complete.

'We are still waiting for the conclusion of the negotiations on the pillars, where we will set the final amounts, and then it will be time for concrete figures,' he stressed. He said that 95 per cent of the cases had been settled, but he cautioned that any assessment already circulating in the public was premature by the end of the formal negotiations.

"What is clear, and I am happy to repeat this, is that no civil servant in the new wage system will have basic wages below the minimum wage and that wages at the annual level will be in line with inflation, for the first time in history", emphasised Boštjančič. The systematic increase in wages will be the first to be met by the lowest paid civil servants. An agreement has also been reached to increase the regression for civil servants. This will increase the minimum wage by 5% next year and 10% by 2026. The two-year regress will be paid to civil servants in advance of the month of March, when the February salary is paid.

As Boštjančić said in a statement, the government proposes that the increase in salaries of government officials  ⁇  the ministers, secretaries of state, the general secretariat of the government, as well as the MPs and the state council  ⁇  come with a lock, only at the invitation of a new state assembly. The salaries of judicial and other officials, such as the President of the State, the mayors, the President of the Anti-Corruption Commission and the Ombudsman, should be aligned gradually, similar to the salaries of public servants.

"We are still waiting for the conclusion of a collective agreement for the public sector and collective agreements for public sector activities and professions, which both parties must sign in October, followed by the signature of the government and representative unions of the public sector in November", said Boštjančić, the timekeeper of the implementation of the wage reform. The total impact of the overall wage reform is estimated at EUR 1.4 billion. The amount will be distributed over the next four years to around €350 million a year, the Finance Minister said.

In addition to the above, the government, as published by the STA, has adopted several other laws.

Adoption of a new draft law on the deposit guarantee scheme

The Government has laid down the text of the draft new law on the deposit guarantee scheme. It increases the target level of the Fund to be achieved by the end of 2030 from the current 0,8% to 1,5% of the total guaranteed deposits in Slovenia.

The amount of cover for individual deposits by an investor in a bank is up to EUR 100,000 and the guarantee payment may exceptionally be higher than that amount. The funds for the payment of the deposit guarantee in the event of the bankruptcy of the bank or depository shall be provided from the deposit guarantee fund managed by the Bank of Slovenia.

The funds of the Fund established by the Banking Authority Act and the Bank Rescue Fund will also be used to provide the funds for the payment of the deposit guarantee in the event of a bank or depository default, the further operation of which will be governed by the draft new Bank Rescue and Forced Closure Act, which was approved by the Government last week.

The Government has approved the draft laws for Slovenia's accession to the European Space Agency

The Government has also approved several draft laws necessary for Slovenia's accession to the European Space Agency (ESA), including on ratification of the ESA Convention and ratification of the agreement between the Government and the ESA on Slovenia's accession to the Convention, the Government Communications Office (Ukom) reported.

The agreement leads to Slovenia's full membership in Essen, which brings equal cooperation with other Member States in making key decisions, increasing Slovenia's visibility in the world as an increasingly important player in the international space sector, the possibility of participating in programmes in which the Slovenian space sector has not been able to participate until now, and further opening the door to cooperation with companies from Member States and other countries, including for commercial projects, said the ministry.

The Commission notes that the Commission has not yet concluded any formal investigation into the existence of a specific measure in favour of Slovenia. Slovenia's annual contribution to the mandatory activities for the year of entry into force of the Agreement will be determined by the rules applicable to the Member States.

Slovenia to participate in the prosecution of Myanmar for genocide

Slovenia has repeatedly expressed concern about the fate of the Rohingya and supported the European Union's statements in this regard, as well as several resolutions of international bodies, including the UN General Assembly, the Government said at its meeting. The Government thus decided that Slovenia would intervene in the Gambia v. Myanmar action before the International Criminal Court (ICJ) in The Hague on alleged violations of the UN Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide. These are examples of the Rohingya's repression in 2017.

The Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs proposed to participate in the proceedings before the ICJ because Slovenia, among the fundamental guidelines of its foreign policy, places, inter alia, the strengthening of respect for human rights and ensuring accountability for the worst crimes committed.

The EGTC, which will coordinate the representation of Slovenia, in accordance with the Government's decision, has provided financial resources for the procedure in the amount of EUR 20,000, including to cover the cost of the journey.

Extended measures for simplified employment of foreigners by the end of the year

The government has also extended the measures to simplify the employment of foreigners until the end of the year. The extension refers to applications for the issue and extension of single residence and work permits for foreigners to administrative units lodged from 1 October to 31 December inclusive, the Ministry of Public Administration summarised in the Official Journal.

'In the first period of implementation of the law, certain positive effects of the measures in force were observed and identified, which will further contribute to an improved resolution of the cases within the legal time limit, while of course protecting human rights as well as increasing the competitiveness of the economy or increasing the supply of labour in the labour market,' the decision to extend was explained at the Ministry.

They also stressed the need to further reduce the burden on administrative units' business processes and to facilitate faster entry of foreigners into the labour market.

The Government also prepared a draft new law on national border controls for the examination in the GZ in the abbreviated procedure. It defined strategic border points on the border with Croatia and the extent of the strategic border areas. The strategic boundary points are key to maintaining the state's readiness for potential security challenges, the government's Communications Office said.

The appointment of the new Director of the RS Institute of Education was also on the agenda of the Cabinet. This became Jasna Rojc, formerly Secretary of State at the Ministry of Education. She succeeded Vinka Logja as Minister of Education and Training, succeeding the recently resigned Darje Feldo.
