Steroidi v rekreativnem športu: "Vsak pozna nekoga, ki jih prodaja"

Zagrožena kazen za uporabo, predelavo in prodajo steroidov je od tri do 15 let

"Uporaba steroidov je veliko pogostejša, kot bi si mislili," pove osebni trener Blaž Radonjić. Čeprav so anabolični steroidi v Sloveniji prepovedani, so, kot smo izvedeli, na črnem trgu lahko dostopni, po njih posegajo že srednješolci.

Število rekreativnih športnikov se je "po razcvetu družbenih omrežij povečalo, sploh po epidemiji covida-19 in karanteni", pojasni osebni trener Blaž Radonjić. Zaradi želje po hitro opaznih rezultatih v enem ali dveh mesecih tudi nekateri rekreativni športniki posegajo po anabolnih androgenih steroidih (AAS) ali pogovorno kar steroidih, ki so sicer prepovedani, a omogočajo povečanje mišične mase, izgubo telesne maščobe, "in to celo brez redne vadbe", nadaljuje Radonjić.

Brez steroidov preprosto nisi več konkurenčen.

"Če vidiš nekoga in veš, da hodi v fitnes komaj kakšno leto in ima že dobre rezultate, je velika verjetnost, da uporablja steroide, saj v tako kratkem obdobju tako drastična sprememba ni mogoča," pove osebni trener, ki se zaradi šikaniranja ne želi izpostaviti, zato ga bomo imenovali Nejc.

Doda, da se steroidi danes uporabljajo tako v vrhunskem kot rekreativnem športu. Dostop do njih pa je presenetljivo lahek. "Dobijo jih kar od posrednikov v svojem fitnesu, vsak pozna nekoga, ki jih prodaja," pove Nejc in nadaljuje, da so steroidi, ki se prodajajo na črnem trgu, "pogosto neprečiščeni, kar pomeni, da imajo lahko dodatne primesi, ki so lahko nevarne za zdravje" ali pa celo sploh ne vplivajo na povečanje mišične mase, "kljub temu pa imajo enake stranske učinke kot steroidi".

Nakup po spletu s kriptovalutami

Cene steroidov na črnem trgu se gibljejo od 33 evrov dalje (36 ameriških dolarjev). Sogovorniki so nam zaupali, da so ob dobavljivih poteh v fitnesih dostopni tudi na spletnih straneh. Prodajajo jih tako v kapsulah, gelih kot v tekočini, ki si jo uporabniki vbrizgajo v telo. Ker steroidi delujejo na vse organske sisteme, se lahko vbrizgajo kamor koli.

Zasledili smo, da je edina plačilna metoda, ki jo omogočajo spletne strani, kriptovaluta.

Nekateri si steroide na dom naročijo pod lažnim imenom, sicer pa se redni uporabniki zavedajo, da je naročanje steroidov po spletu igra na srečo. "Paket ti lahko zasežejo na carini, vprašljiva je kakovost, lahko pa v pošiljki sploh ne dobiš steroidov," so naštevali uporabniki foruma Steroids Source Talk.

Najbolj dovzetna starostna skupina med 18. in 25. letom

Trener Radonjić meni, da je največ uporabnikov steroidov starih "med 18. in 25. letom, zagotovo pa tam do 30. leta. Ta starostna skupina je najbolj dovzetna, bi rekel."

Da bi se moški, ki redno uporabljajo steroide, s čimer se poleg testosterona v telesu poviša tudi raven estrogena, lahko izognili neželenim stranskim učinkom, kot so na primer povečane prsi ali t. i. ženske prsi, uporabo steroidov kombinirajo tudi z inhibitorji estrogena, ki raven estrogena znižujejo. Ti so na spletu dostopni tudi v Sloveniji.

To potrdi tudi Bojan Knap, specialist internist na centru za dializo iz UKC-ja Ljubljana: "Gre za mlade in zdrave ljudi, njihovo telo pa lahko takrat prenese marsikaj.” Vnašanje steroidov velja za hud poseg v telo, njihovi glavni učinki pa so sprva dobri in pozitivni – zelo so učinkoviti pri rasti mišic in izgubljanju telesne maščobe, telo pa je bolj zmogljivo na vseh področjih, saj se pripravlja na večji napor, pojasnjuje. 

Povišanemu libidu lahko sledi impotenca

A steroidi imajo tudi negativne stranske učinke. Med najpomembnejši so težave s psiho in spolno funkcijo moškega, pri ženskah se pojavi večja poraščenost, povečan klitoris in nižji glas. Sprva se pri moških sicer pojavi povišan libido, prenehanje uporabe pa lahko povzroči njegovo pomanjkanje in celo impotenco.

Pri ženskah se lahko pojavi motnja s hormonsko sliko, zagotovo pa so težave z rednim menstrualnim ciklom.

“Večina zapletov, kot so endokrinološki, nevrološki in kardiološki, se pokaže pozneje v življenju, ko se lahko zamegli njihova škodljivost za telo, zagotovo pa se s steroidi ni igrati,” opozori Knap.

Steroidi torej delujejo na vse organske sisteme v telesu, k našemu zdravju pa prinašajo vrsto neželenih stranskih učinkov – od izpada las, neplodnosti, aken, različnih tumorjev, ki se v zrelem življenjskem obdobju pojavijo kjer koli, predvsem pa na prostati, ledvicah in jetrih. Zelo pogoste so tudi možganske in srčne kapi, za katere posamezniki niso imeli simptomov. Učinki uporabe steroidov se poznajo tudi v motnjah razpoloženja, kot sta depresija ali agresivnost, lahko se pojavi tudi psihološka odvisnost obsedenosti z videzom, še pove profesor s fakultete za farmacijo Lovro Žiberna.

Stik s steroidi že v srednji šoli

Kot povedo sogovorniki, pridejo fantje v stik s steroidi že v srednji šoli, njihova uporaba pa naj bi bila pogostejša med moškimi kot med ženskami, one naj bi jih uporabljale predvsem v tekmovalnih kategorijah bodibildinga. "Brez steroidov preprosto nisi več konkurenčen," pove Nejc.

Radonjić ob tem opozori na skrb vzbujajoče dejstvo, da je uporaba steroidov na družbenih omrežjih postala celo meme, smešnica, v smislu, "liftaš, pa ne uporabljaš steroidov, poglej, kaj zamujaš". Prikaz steroidov kot zabava, ki ni več družbeno stigmatizirana, "pogovor o njihovi uporabi in dostopnosti odprto poteka v slačilnicah fitnesov. Če si želiš poskusiti, boš stopil zraven, zagotovo pa je težje ne priti v stik z njimi," pove Radonjić.

Ni podatkov o uporabi

O stranskih učinkih uporabe steroidov se v javnosti premalo govori, saj (razumljivo) podatkov o uporabi med profesionalnimi ali rekreativnimi športniki ni. V Sloveniji si za ozaveščanje o stranskih učinkih dopingiranja med profesionalnimi športniki prizadeva Slovenska antidoping organizacija (SLOADO), "saj morajo vsi športniki pred tekmovanjem izvesti izobraževanje, da sploh lahko tekmujejo," razloži profesor Žiberna.

Steroidi so bili, preden so jih v 20. stoletju sintetično pridobivali z namenom zlorabe, zdravila. Predpisovali so jih posameznikom s premalo testosterona.

A kot pojasni Bojan Knap, jih danes v medicinske namene redko uporabljajo, predvsem v majhnih količinah v sklopu terapije, recimo v primeru hude poškodbe in pri krhkih kosteh, pri ostarelih kroničnih bolnikih. Vse več študij namreč kaže, da bi lahko anabolni steroidi pod nadzorom imeli tudi terapevtsko vlogo za ohranitev in regeneracijo mišic.

V Sloveniji za uporabo in prodajo zagrožena zaporna kazen

Anabolne androgene steroide se skladno z Mednarodno konvencijo proti uporabi nedovoljenih snovi v športu obravnavajo kot nedovoljene snovi v športu.

Kot so pojasnili z generalne policijske uprave v Sloveniji, je nedovoljene snovi v rekreativnem in profesionalnem športu kaznivo "uporabljati, predelovati, prodajati in posredovati pri prodaji ali nakupu ali jih kako drugače spravljati v promet, če je dejanje storjeno proti mladoletni osebi, v hudodelski združbi in povzroča hude posledice za zdravje, se kaznuje z zaporno kaznijo od treh do petnajst let".

Omogočanje uživanja v športu in omogočanje izvajanja nedovoljenih postopkov v športu pa se kaznujeta z od enega do deset let. Policija je leta 2023 na območju Slovenije zasegla 41 gramov, 753 mililitrov in 477 tablet anabolnih androgenih steroidov.

Steroids in recreational sports: "Everybody knows someone who sells them".

The maximum penalty for the use, processing and sale of steroids is 3 to 15 years.

"Steroid use is much more common than you might think", says personal trainer Blaž Radonjić. Although anabolic steroids are banned in Slovenia, as we learned, they are available on the black market, and they are already being used by high school students.

The number of recreational athletes "increased after the flourishing of social networks, especially after the COVID-19 epidemic and quarantine", explains personal trainer Blaž Radonjić. In an effort to achieve rapid results within a month or two, some recreational athletes also resort to anabolic androgenic steroids (AAS) or colloquially steroids, which are banned but allow for increased muscle mass, fat loss, "even without regular exercise", continues Radonjić.

Without steroids, you're just not competitive anymore.

"If you see someone and you know they've been in the gym for a year and they're already doing well, they're more likely to be using steroids because in such a short period of time, such drastic change is not possible", says a personal trainer who doesn't want to expose himself to bullying, so we'll call him a "Naz".

He adds that steroids are now used in both high-end and recreational sports. And access to them is surprisingly easy. "They get them from the middlemen in their gym, everyone knows someone who sells them", says Najc, adding that steroids sold on the black market "are often unpolluted, meaning they may have additional side effects that can be dangerous to health" or even not affect muscle mass gain at all, "but they do have the same side effects as steroids".

Online purchases with cryptocurrencies

The black market price of steroids is now at 33 euros ($36). Our interlocutors trusted us that, while fitness trails were available, they were also available on the Internet. They are sold in capsules, gels, and fluids that users inject into their bodies. Since steroids work on all organ systems, they can be injected anywhere.

We've learned that the only payment method that the website allows is cryptocurrency.

Some buy steroids at home under a false name, but regular users realize that ordering steroids online is a gamble. "You can get packages at customs, the quality is questionable, but you can't get steroids in the shipment at all", wrote users of the Steroids Source Talk forum.

Most vulnerable age group between 18 and 25 years

Coach Radonjić believes that the majority of steroid users are "between 18 and 25 years old, and certainly there until age 30. This age group is the most sensitive, I would say".

In order to avoid unwanted side effects such as enlarged breasts or female breasts, men who regularly use steroids that increase estrogen levels in addition to testosterone in the body also combine steroid use with estrogen inhibitors that lower estrogen levels. These are also available online in Slovenia.

This is confirmed by Bojan Knap, specialist internist at the UKC dialysis centre in Ljubljana: "These are young and healthy people, but their bodies can carry a lot. ⁇  The introduction of steroids is considered a serious interference in the body, but their main effects are initially good and positive  ⁇  they are very effective in muscle growth and body fat loss, and the body is more capable in all areas as it prepares for more effort, he explains.

Increased libido may be followed by impotence

But steroids also have negative side effects. The most important are problems with the psyche and sexual function of men, with women experiencing greater dizziness, increased clitoris and lower voice. Although increased libido may occur in men at first, discontinuation of use may result in its lack and even impotence.

Hormonal imbalances may occur in women, but there are certainly problems with regular menstrual cycles.

 ⁇ Most complications, such as endocrinological, neurological and cardiological, occur later in life when their harmfulness to the body may be blurred, but steroids are certainly not to be played with, ⁇  warns Knap.

So steroids work on all the organ systems in the body, and they cause a variety of side effects to our health -- from hair loss, infertility, acne, various tumors that occur anywhere in our adult life, especially on the prostate, kidneys, and liver. Very common are also strokes and heart attacks for which individuals had no symptoms. The effects of steroid use are also known in mood disorders such as depression or aggression, and a psychological addiction to looks can also occur, says professor of pharmacy Laura Zibierna.

Steroid contact in high school.

According to the interviewees, boys come into contact with steroids in high school, and their use is expected to be more common among men than women, and they are expected to use them primarily in competitive bodybuilding categories. "Without steroids, you're just not competitive anymore", says Najc.

Radonjić also points to the worrying fact that the use of steroids on social networks has become even a meme, a joke, in the sense that "you lift, but you don't use steroids, look what you miss". The display of steroids as a social entertainment no longer stigmatized, "the discussion of their use and availability is openly held in fitness stores. If you want to try it, you'll step up, but it's definitely harder not to get in touch with them", says Radonjić.

No data on use

There is little public discussion about the side effects of steroid use as there is no (reasonable) data on use among professional or recreational athletes. In Slovenia, the Slovenian Anti-Doping Organization (SLOADO) is working to raise awareness of the side effects of doping among professional athletes, "at least all athletes must be educated before competing in order to compete at all", explains Professor Žiberna.

Steroids were drugs before they were synthetically obtained for abuse in the 20th century. They were prescribed to individuals with low testosterone.

But as Bojan Knap explains, they are rarely used for medical purposes today, especially in small amounts as part of therapy, such as in cases of severe injury and frail bones, in chronically aging patients. A growing body of studies suggests that controlled anabolic steroids may also have therapeutic roles in maintaining and regenerating muscle.

Imprisonment for use and sale in Slovenia

Anabolic androgenic steroids are treated as illicit substances in sport in accordance with the International Convention against the Use of Illicit Substances in Sport.

As explained by the General Police Administration in Slovenia, it is a crime to 'use, process, sell and distribute illicit substances in recreational and professional sports or to put them on the market in any other way, if the act is committed against a minor, in a criminal organisation and has serious health consequences, punishable by imprisonment from three to 15 years'.

The penalties for facilitating the enjoyment of sport and facilitating the conduct of illegal activities in sport shall be from one to ten years. In 2023, police seized 41 grams, 753 milliliters and 477 tablets of anabolic androgenic steroids in the territory of Slovenia.

Ali bodo morali dijaki in študentje sami plačevati udeležbo na šolskih tekmovanjih?

Zveza za tehnično kulturo ni izpolnila pogojev razpisa

Učenci in dijaki nekaterih šol bodo morali udeležbo na številnih šolskih tekmovanjih plačati. Zveza za tehnično kulturo je bila namreč na razpisu za sofinanciranje nekaterih tekmovanj neuspešna.

Ministrstvo za vzgojo in izobraževanje je pred meseci objavilo javni razpis za sofinanciranje selekcijskih in interesnih šolskih tekmovanj za šolsko leto 2024/2025. Nekateri prijavitelji, med drugim Zveza za tehnično kulturo Slovenije, niso izpolnili pogojev razpisa za sofinanciranje številnih tekmovanj, so poročali mediji. Med drugim gre za tekmovanja iz logike, kemije, biologije, psihologije in programiranja.

Glavni tajnik zveze Jožef Školč je navedel, da vsako šolsko leto organizirajo skoraj 20 tekmovanj za več kot 45.000 učencev in dijakov. Medtem ko so lani za izvedbo tekmovanj od ministrstva prejeli več kot 100.000 evrov, so letos prejeli le 6000 evrov. To ne zadošča za pokritje stroškov tekmovanj, je dejal Školč, zato so se odločili, da bodo za skoraj vsa od tekmovanj, ki jih organizirajo, pobirali kotizacijo štiri evre. Ravnatelji šol se sicer lahko odločijo, ali bo stroške poravnala šola ali udeleženci tekmovanj.

"Naredili smo napako, ker smo pripeli stare pravilnike namesto veljavnih," je zagato na razpisu pojasnil Školč. Stari pravilnik, ki so ga oddali na razpis in je bil objavljen na strani zveze, je namreč navajal, da mora zveza rezultate tekmovanj objaviti v 14 delovnih dneh po tekmovanju namesto zgolj v 14 dneh. Poleg tega so v pravilnik zapisali, da lahko zveza pobira vstopnino za tekmovanja, kar pa po besedah Školča ne pomeni, da bi jo tudi pobrali.

Ministrstvo bi zvezo lahko po Školčevem mnenju pozvalo k odpravi napake, namesto tega pa so "z birokratsko pametjo odločili, da ne izpolnjujemo enega pogoja".

Ministrstvo: Ob formalno popolnih vlogah ni mogoče pozivati k dopolnitvam

Kot so pojasnili na ministrstvu, je zveza oddala popolno vlogo, zato je niso pozvali k dopolnitvi, kot lahko to storijo pri vlagateljih nepopolnih vlog. "Ko so vloge enkrat popolne, razpisna komisija začne ugotavljati izpolnjevanje pogojev, nadalje pa s postopkom točkovanja glede na razpisna merila. Če formalno popolna vloga ne izpolnjuje pogojev, je v postopku javnega razpisa ni mogoče pozivati k dopolnitvam," so poudarili.

Dodali so, da so vsebino pravilnika ob prejemu prijave preverili tudi na spletni strani zavoda, kjer pa je bil prav tako objavljen pravilnik, s kakršnim so se prijavili na javni razpis. "Razpisna komisija v postopku javnega razpisa razpolaga in sme upoštevati zgolj dokumentacijo, ki jo prijavitelj priloži," so navedli. "Postopek javnega razpisa je z zakoni in pravilniki opredeljen postopek, zunaj katerega ni mogoče delovati," so poudarili.

Školč je še opozoril, da jih je ministrstvo o rezultatih razpisa obvestilo šele na začetku septembra, čeprav bi to moralo storiti že konec julija. Če bi jih ministrstvo o tem obvestilo v roku, bi lahko iskali druge načine financiranja, meni Školč.

Ministrstvo je pri tem pojasnilo, da odločb res niso poslali v roku, in sicer zaradi kadrovskega pomanjkanja. Kljub temu so poudarili, da "časovni vidik nima finančnih posledic in ne spreminja tega, da je bila zveza z nekaterimi tekmovanji na razpisu neuspešna".
2024-09-25.title: Ali bodo morali dijaki in študentje sami plačevati udeležbo na šolskih tekmovanjih?

Will students and pupils have to pay for their participation in school competitions?

The Technical Culture Union did not fulfil the conditions for the tender

Students and pupils of some schools will have to pay to participate in numerous school competitions. The Technical Culture Union has failed to tender for the co-financing of certain competitions.

The Ministry of Education and Training announced a public tender a month ago for the co-financing of selective and interest school competitions for the 2024/2025 school year. Some applicants, including the Technical Culture Association of Slovenia, have not fulfilled the conditions for the tender to co-finance numerous competitions, the media reported. These are competitions in logic, chemistry, biology, psychology, and programming.

The association's general secretary, Jožef Školč, said that nearly 20 competitions are organized each school year for more than 45,000 students. While they received more than €100,000 from the Ministry last year to run competitions, this year they received only €6000. This was not enough to cover the costs of the competitions, Školč said, so they decided to charge a fee of EUR 4 for almost all the competitions they organised. However, the school managers can decide whether the costs will be settled by the school or the contest participants.

"We made a mistake by replacing the old rules with the current ones", explained Školč in the submission. The old rules, which were submitted to the tender and published on the association's website, stated that the association had to publish the results of the competitions within 14 working days of the competition instead of only 14 days. In addition, the rules state that the association may collect a ticket for competitions, which does not mean that it should also be collected, according to Školc.

The Ministry could have called for the correction of the error, but instead, "they have decided in bureaucratic wisdom not to meet one condition".

Ministry: No appeal for supplementary funding is possible with formal full posts

As explained to the Ministry, the association gave full effect and therefore did not invite them to complete the procedure as they can do for investors with incomplete contributions. 'Once the applications are complete, the tendering committee shall begin to assess the fulfilment of the conditions and shall proceed to the scoring procedure according to the tender criteria. If the formally complete application does not meet the conditions, it is not possible to call for supplements in the tendering procedure,' they pointed out.

They added that they also checked the content of the Regulation on the website of the Authority when they received the application, and that the Regulation with which they applied for the tender was also published. 'The Commission shall, in the course of the public tendering procedure, only take into account the documentation submitted by the applicant.' 'The procedure for the public tender is defined by the laws and regulations and cannot be operated outside it,' they stressed.

The coach also pointed out that the Ministry had not notified them of the results of the tender until early September, although it should have done so by the end of July. If the Ministry had informed them within the deadline, they could have looked for other ways to finance, I think.

The Ministry explained that the decisions were not sent within the deadline, due to a lack of staff. However, they stressed that "the timing aspect has no financial implications and does not alter the fact that the association with some competitors in the tender was unsuccessful".
2024-09-25.english_title: Will students and pupils have to pay for their participation in school competitions?

RTV Slovenija v prvih osmih mesecih z 1,1 milijona evrov več odhodkov kot prihodkov

Seja sveta RTV Slovenija

RTV Slovenija je od januarja do avgusta imela nekaj nad 97,7 milijona evrov prihodkov in nekaj nad 98,9 milijona evrov odhodkov. Odhodkov je bilo tako nekaj nad 1,1 milijona več kot prihodkov.

Predsednica uprave RTV Slovenija Natalija Gorščak je na seji sveta RTV Slovenija predstavila poročilo o poslovanju v omenjenem obdobju. Leto želijo po besedah Gorščak skleniti z izravnanimi prihodki in odhodki, zavod pa konec avgusta ni bil zadolžen, izhaja iz poročila, s katerim se je svet seznanil na seji.

V nadaljevanju so se seznanili s poročilom o realizaciji programsko-produkcijskega načrta v prvih osmih mesecih letos. Iz njega izhaja, da so v programu Televizije Slovenija najširši krog gledalcev pritegnili večji in odmevnejši športni in razvedrilni dogodki, pa tudi nekatere redne informativne in razvedrilne oddaje. Med štirimi zadnjimi poletnimi olimpijskimi igrami so najvišjo povprečno gledanost dosegle letošnje v Parizu.

Uprava naj bi predlog programsko-produkcijskega načrta za leto 2025 svetu zavoda posredovala oktobra, je pojasnila Gorščak.

Člani sveta so obravnavali tudi analizo vzrokov za padec gledanosti programov Televizije Slovenija v prvem polletju letos v primerjavi z enakim obdobjem lani. Prvim trem programom se je v analiziranem obdobju gledanost znižala za 0,1 odstotne točke.

Na RTV Slovenija vidijo enega od pomembnejših vzrokov za padec v tem, da je bilo v prvem polletju predvajanih približno 344 ur manj premiernega programa v primerjavi z enakim obdobjem lani.

Premierne oddaje informativnega programa so ob zmanjšanih sredstvih v analiziranem obdobju povečale povprečno gledanost, gledanost osrednjega informativnega bloka pa se je nekoliko zvišala. Padla pa je gledanost zunanjepolitične oddaje Globus, izhaja iz analize.

Nekateri člani sveta so razmišljali, kako bi gledanost Globusa lahko zvišali. Predsednik sveta Goran Forbici je dejal, da po ugotovitvah iz analize zahtevne teme ne pritegnejo gledalcev. "A po drugi strani potrebujemo resno zunanjepolitično oddajo, ki odpira najtežje teme," je dejal. "Meja je tanka," je posvaril.

Direktorica TV Slovenija Ksenija Horvat je poudarila, da je oddaja pomembna in da je obravnava zahtevnih tem na mestu. Vendar jih zaradi omejenih sredstev ne raziskujejo novinarji na terenu, ampak uporabljajo evrovizijske posnetke. Tako je po njenem pojasnilu težje predstaviti vsebine tako, da bi gledalci lahko podoživeli dogajanje.
2024-09-25.title: RTV Slovenija v prvih osmih mesecih z 1,1 milijona evrov več odhodkov kot prihodkov

RTV Slovenia spent EUR 1,1 million more than revenue in the first eight months

RTV Slovenia Council meeting

RTV Slovenia had a revenue of slightly over EUR 97,7 million and a expenditure of slightly over EUR 98,9 million from January to August. The expenditure was thus slightly over 1.1 million more than the revenue.

The Chairman of the Board of RTV Slovenia, Natalija Gorščak, presented a report on the operation of RTV Slovenia during the period considered at the meeting of the Board of RTV Slovenia. According to Gorščak, they want to end the year with a balance of revenue and expenditure, but the company was not charged at the end of August, according to a report that the world learned at a meeting.

They also reviewed the report on the implementation of the programme-production plan in the first eight months of this year. It follows that the broadest spectrum of viewers have been attracted to the programme of Televizija Slovenija by the larger and more distinguished sporting and entertainment events, as well as by some regular informational and entertainment programmes. Of the last four Summer Olympics, the highest average attendance was this year's in Paris.

The management is expected to forward the proposal for a 2025 programme-production plan to the Institute in October, Gorščak explained.

The members of the Council also considered the analysis of the reasons for the drop in the number of Slovenian TV programmes in the first half of this year compared to the same period last year. The first three programmes saw a decrease of 0.1% in viewership during the period analysed.

RTV Slovenia sees one of the main reasons for the drop in the number of hours spent on the programme in the first half of the year as about 344 hours less than in the same period last year.

The average viewership of the first edition of the information programme increased during the period analysed, while the viewership of the central information block increased slightly, with the reduction of funds. But the foreign policy ratings of the Globe show have dropped, based on analysis.

Some members of the world have been thinking about how to increase the viewership of the Globe. Council President Goran Forbici said that the findings of the analysis of the challenging subject did not attract viewers. "On the other hand, we need a serious foreign policy broadcast that opens up the most difficult topics", he said. "My border is thin", he warned.

TV Slovenia's director Ksenija Horvat stressed that the broadcast is important and that the difficult issues are addressed. However, due to limited resources, they are not investigated by journalists in the field but are used by Eurovision footage. Thus, she makes it harder to present the content in a way that allows viewers to relive the event.
2024-09-25.english_title: RTV Slovenia spent EUR 1,1 million more than revenue in the first eight months

Kitajska ukinja vizume za slovenske državljane

Srečanje Fajon-Ji

Slovenija je na seznamu držav, ki za Kitajsko ne potrebujejo vizuma, so sporočili z zunanjega ministrstva po srečanju ministrice Tanje Fajon s kitajskim kolegom Vang Jijem ob robu zasedanja Generalne skupščine Združenih narodov.

"Dobre odnose med Slovenijo in Kitajsko nadgrajujemo z različnimi dejavnostmi, še posebej ko gre za gospodarsko sodelovanje. Pozdravljam tudi odločitev glede odprave vizumov za slovenske državljane, za kar smo se v preteklosti vztrajno zavzemali. V globoko polariziranem svetu z visokim številom oboroženih konfliktov je sodelovanje absolutno nujno. Pomembno je, da se pogovarjamo, četudi ni nujno, da se vedno strinjamo," je dejala ministrica za zunanje in evropske zadeve.

Ministra sta govorila o dvostranskih odnosih, zaostritvi razmer na Bližnjem vzhodu in naporih mednarodne skupnosti za iskanje miru v Ukrajini.

Ji je pohvalil aktivno vlogo in konstruktivno držo Slovenije v Varnostnem svetu ZN-a, medtem ko je Fajon poudarila, da si Slovenija prizadeva za premoščanje razlik, preprečevanje konfliktov z dialogom in po mirni poti ter zaščito civilistov. Ob tem je izrazila zaskrbljenost tudi glede stopnjevanja nasilja na Zahodnem bregu.

Ministra sta se strinjala, da je za preprečitev humanitarne katastrofe nujno takojšnje premirje v Gazi. "Slovenija si bo še naprej prizadevala, da Palestino prizna še več držav, prizadevala si bo za dogovor za izpustitev talcev in večjo humanitarno pomoč civilistom ter za uresničitev dveh držav, vključno s podporo opolnomočenju palestinske vlade," je dodala Fajon.

Kitajska se glede ruske agresije v Ukrajini med drugim zavzema za preprečevanje nadaljnjega širjenja spopadov in za mirovno konferenco, na kateri bi sodelovale vse vpletene strani, saj v nasprotnem primeru ne moremo govoriti o trajnem miru, je povedal kitajski zunanji minister. Fajon je ob tem opozorila, da mora vsaka mirovna pobuda temeljiti na ozemeljski celovitosti in suverenosti Ukrajine.

Srečanje med ministroma je bilo tretje po vrsti, potem ko je bila Fajon na uradnem obisku na Kitajskem aprila letos. Na MZEZ-u so ob tem napovedali, da bosta novembra Kitajsko obiskala ministra za gospodarstvo in kmetijstvo Matjaž Han in Mateja Čalušić skupaj s poslovno delegacijo.
2024-09-25.title: Kitajska ukinja vizume za slovenske državljane
2024-09-25.english_content:
China to cancel visas for Slovenian nationals

The meeting of Fajon-ji

Slovenia is on the list of countries that do not require a visa for China, the Foreign Ministry said after Minister Tanja Fajon met with Chinese colleague Vang Ji on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly.

'We are strengthening good relations between Slovenia and China through various activities, especially in the area of economic cooperation. I also welcome the decision to withdraw visas for Slovenian citizens, for which we have been steadfastly committed in the past. In a deeply polarized world with a high number of armed conflicts, cooperation is absolutely essential. It is important to talk, even if we do not necessarily always agree,' said the Minister for Foreign and European Affairs.

The ministers spoke about bilateral relations, the escalation of the situation in the Middle East and the efforts of the international community to find peace in Ukraine.

He praised the active role and constructive stance of Slovenia in the UN Security Council, while Fajon stressed that Slovenia strives to bridge differences, prevent conflicts through dialogue and peaceful means and protect civilians. She also expressed concern about the escalation of violence in the West Bank.

The ministers agreed that an immediate ceasefire in Gaza was necessary to prevent a humanitarian disaster. "Slovenia will continue to work to recognize more Palestinian states, to work for an agreement to release hostages and more humanitarian aid to civilians, and to realize two states, including supporting the empowerment of the Palestinian government", Fajon added.

China is taking steps to prevent further spread of the conflict and to hold a peace conference involving all parties involved, as otherwise we cannot talk about lasting peace, the Chinese Foreign Minister said. The Commission's decision to initiate the procedure for the conclusion of the Agreement on the conclusion of the Agreement on the European Economic Area (EEA) was adopted on 1 January 2014.

The meeting between the ministers was the third in a row after Fajon made an official visit to China in April this year. At the MFAO, it was announced that the Minister of Economy and Agriculture Matjaz Han and Matej Čalušić together with a business delegation would visit China in November.
2024-09-25.english_title: China to cancel visas for Slovenian nationals

NPU preverja nakup prostorov za študentski dom v Kopru

Oškodovanje javnih sredstev z dvojno preprodajo?

Nacionalni preiskovalni urad (NPU) v povezavi z očitki Univerzi na Primorskem, da naj bi prostore za nov študentski dom v Kopru preplačala za tri milijone evrov, preverja, ali so podani razlogi za sum, da je bilo storjeno kaznivo dejanje.

Univerza na Primorskem v objektu Barka ureja študentski dom. Prostore je pridobila od več lastnikov. Tako je julija letos odkupila tudi del stavbe, v katerem je bil dolgo sedež koprske enote Fursa. Plačala je 6,1 milijona evrov oziroma 3000 evrov za kvadratni meter.

Kot navaja portal Necenzurirano, pa prostorov niso odkupili neposredno od njihovega dolgoletnega lastnika, družbe Monetic, nekoč bolj znane pod imenom Hypo Leasing, ampak od v javnosti neznanega podjetja Ideal Invest. To je pred slabim letom za iste prostore odštelo tri milijone evrov, torej 1500 metrov za kvadratni meter.

Podjetje naj bi tako zgolj s preprodajo prostorov v desetih mesecih ustvarilo več kot tri milijone evrov dobička, in to na račun države, ki bo Univerzi na Primorskem financirala nakup.

Zaradi teh navedb je poslanska skupina SDS-a predlagala sklic skupne nujne seje odbora DZ-ja za izobraževanje, znanost in mladino ter odbora DZ-ja za finance, na kateri naj bi ministra za visoko šolstvo Igor Papič in za finance Klemen Boštjančič predložila dokumente in podala pojasnila.

Na Univerzi na Primorskem pa so pojasnili, da kupujejo nepremičnino, ki bo v celoti urejena za potrebe študentskih namestitev, in ne praznih prostorov, ki bi jim bilo treba naknadno še spremeniti namembnost in jih ustrezno obnoviti.
2024-09-25.title: NPU preverja nakup prostorov za študentski dom v Kopru
2024-09-25.english_content:
NPU checks the purchase of premises for a student home in Copenhagen

Damage to public funds by double-selling?

The National Investigative Office (NPU) is examining whether there are grounds for suspecting that a crime has been committed in connection with the complaints made by the University of Primorsk that the premises for a new student home in Copenhagen should be paid a fine of three million euros.

The Primorsky University in the Bark facility operates a student home. She's gotten the space from multiple owners. In July this year, she also bought part of the building that was the long-time headquarters of the FURS Corps. She paid 6.1 million euros, or 3,000 euros per square meter.

According to the Uncensored portal, the premises were not purchased directly from their long-time owner, Monetic, formerly known as Hypo Leasing, but from the publicly unknown Ideal Invest. That's three million euros for the same space a bad year ago, or 1,500 square meters.

The company is thus expected to generate more than EUR 3 million in profits from the sale of premises in 10 months alone, at the expense of the State which will finance the purchase of the University of Primorsk.

In response to these comments, the SDS Parliamentary Group proposed to convene an emergency joint meeting of the Education, Science and Youth Committee of the SDC and the Finance Committee of the SDC, at which Minister for Higher Education Igor Papič and Minister for Finance Klemen Boštjančić were to present documents and provide explanations.

The University of Primorsk explained that they were buying a property that would be fully furnished for student accommodation purposes, not empty spaces that would need to be altered and renovated accordingly.
2024-09-25.english_title: NPU checks the purchase of premises for a student home in Copenhagen

Obnovljene tri zmagovalke akcije Naj planinska pot

Akcija Naj planinska pot

V sklopu akcije Naj planinska pot so markacisti konec poletja obnovili lansko zmagovalko, to je pot s Kamniškega sedla do Brane in Planjave, ter letošnji naj planinski poti Koželjeva pot ob Kamniški Bistrici in pot Jama Topla–Mala Peca na Koroškem.

Pot s Kamniškega sedla do Brane in Planjave so markacisti zaradi vremenskih razmer obnovili (šele) letos poleti. Lani so obnovo namreč onemogočale ujme, ki so močno prizadele večji del Slovenije, tudi planinske poti, so sporočili iz Zavarovalnice Triglav, ki sodeluje s sredstvi za obnovo. 

Planjava in Brana sta razgledna skalna vrhova Kamniško-Savinjskih Alp, ki ju povezuje planinska pot čez Kamniško sedlo. Čeprav je pot iz Kamniške Bistrice na Kamniško sedlo lahka planinska pot, pa je njeno nadaljevanje do Brane na vzhodu in Planjave na zahodu bolj zahtevno in primerno za izkušene planince.

Zanimiva in slikovita Koželjeva pot ob Kamniški Bistrici je priljubljena lahka planinska pot, primerna za vse starosti, ki vodi po desnem bregu Kamniške Bistrice v zatrep doline do izvira reke.

Kot so pojasnili v zavarovalnici, je bilo treba na zmagovalki letošnjega izbora obnoviti skoraj celotno pot s krajšimi presledki, požagati in odstraniti podrto drevje, odstraniti nanose lesa in drugega materiala ter izdelati stopnice in bočne zaščite.

Sredstva tudi za drugouvrščeno pot

Letos so v Zavarovalnici Triglav, ki glasovanje izvaja s Planinsko zvezo Slovenije (PZS), naredili izjemo in sredstva za obnovo podarili tudi drugouvrščeni poti, to je poti od jame Topla do Male Pece na Koroškem, za katero skrbi Planinsko društvo Mežica.

Pot, ki se od jame Topla najprej bolj ali manj drži rudarske ceste, nato preči travnik in pod strmimi skalami hudournik Zajčja peč, je zdaj urejena, zaradi obsežnega vetroloma, ki je pred dobrim tednom dni podrl žičnico in ohromil cesto za oskrbovanje, pa je trenutno zaprt Dom na Peci. Zato planincem svetujejo, naj pred obiskom preverijo aktualne razmere glede odprtosti planinske koče.

Zavarovalnica Triglav in PZS sta izbor najbolj priljubljene planinske poti prvič izvedla leta 2017, od takrat so skupaj z omenjenimi tremi obnovili osem različno zahtevnih poti.

Kot prva je bila v akciji Naj planinska pot obnovljena krožna pot Planina Blato–Planina pri Jezeru–Planina Dedno polje–Vrata–Prehodavci–Dvojno jezero–Štapce–Ovčarija–Planina pri Jezeru–Planina Blato. Sledile so Rečiška planinska krožna pot, zelo zahtevna Bambergova planinska pot na Triglav z Luknje čez Plemenice, zelo zahtevna pot s Kranjske koče na Ledinah na Koroško Rinko ter zelo zahtevna Hanzeva pot, ki vodi od Koče na Gozdu na Prisojnik.
2024-09-25.title: Obnovljene tri zmagovalke akcije Naj planinska pot
2024-09-25.english_content:
Renewed three winning streams Let the Mountain Path

Action Let the Mountain Path

As part of the action, the Marcacci have restored the last winner at the end of the summer, the route from Kamnický sedl to Brana and Planjave, and this year's Koželovo mountain route to Kamnická Bistrica and the Jam Topla ⁇ Mala Peca route to Koroška.

The route from Kamnický sedla to Brana and Planjave was restored by the Marcacists this summer due to weather conditions. Last year, the reconstruction was hampered by the landslides that severely affected most of Slovenia, including mountain roads, said the Triglav Insurance Company, which cooperates with the reconstruction funds.

Planning and Brana are the scenic rocky peaks of the Stony-Savin Alps, linked by a mountain pass over the Stony Sedge. Although the route from Kamnička Bistrica to Kamnička Sedla is an easy mountain route, its continuation to Brana in the east and Planja in the west is more challenging and suitable for experienced mountaineers.

The interesting and picturesque Kożol's Trail along the Stony Bistrica is a popular light mountain trail suitable for all ages that leads along the right bank of the Stony Bistrica into the valley's watershed to the source of the river.

As explained by the insurer, the winners of this year's election had to rebuild almost the entire route with shorter tracks, burn and remove the fallen trees, remove the wood and other material deposits, and build stairs and side protections.

Funds also for the secondary route

This year, the Triglav Conservancy, which is voting with the Slovenian Mountain Association (SPA), made an exception and donated the funds for the reconstruction of a secondary route, the route from the cave of Topla to the small cave in Krakow, which is run by the Mežica Mountain Society.

The path that follows the cave of Topla, which is a mining road, then a grassland and the rocky rocks of the Rabbit's furnace, is now paved, because of the massive windfall that broke the wire and paralyzed the supply road a week ago. Therefore, it is recommended that mountain climbers check the current conditions regarding the opening of the mountain hut before visiting.

The insurance company Triglav and PZS first carried out the selection of the most popular mountain routes in 2017, since then they have rebuilt eight differently challenging routes together with the three mentioned.

The first was the renewal of the Mountain Road Circular of the Plateau Planin at Lake Plateau. The following were the Racha Mountain Circular Path, the very difficult Bamberg Mountain Path to Triglav from the Hole through the Plemenice, the very difficult path from the Kranjska Cottage on the Idyna to the Koroška Rinko and the very difficult Hanzeva Path leading from the Cottage on the Forest to the Prasarónik.

84 odstotkov ukrajinskih beguncev si želi ostati v Sloveniji. Zaposlenih je precej malo.

Izsledki raziskave o ukrajinskih beguncih v Sloveniji, ki sta jo izvedla ZRC SAZU in Agencija ZN-a za begunce

Večina ukrajinskih beguncev v Sloveniji živi že dalj časa, več kot 80 odstotkov si jih želi tu tudi ostati. Počutijo se varno, hujših sovražnosti ne občutijo. Več kot tretjina je otrok, ki so vključeni v slovenske šole, slabša je zaposlenost odraslih.

Skoraj tri leta po začetku konflikta je Inštitut za slovensko izseljenstvo in migracije ZRC SAZU predstavil rezultate raziskave o položaju ukrajinskih beguncev v Sloveniji, ki jo je naročila Agencija ZN-a za begunce (UNHCR).

Natančnega podatka o tem, koliko ukrajinskih beguncev je trenutno nastanjenih v Sloveniji, pravzaprav ni. Vemo le, da jih je od začetka vojne v Ukrajini februarja 2022 začasno zaščito pri nas prejelo skoraj deset tisoč. 

Nekoliko zgovornejši je podatek, da naj bi nekaj manj kot 4000 odraslih Ukrajincev prejemalo denarno socialno pomoč in okoli 3300 dodatek za zasebno nastanitev, pri čemer večina prejemnikov najverjetneje dobiva obe vrsti pomoči naenkrat. Glede na izsledke raziskave naj bi finančno pomoč države prejemalo 75 odstotkov vseh ukrajinskih beguncev v Sloveniji, a hkrati moramo upoštevati, da je kar 37 odstotkov ukrajinskih beguncev otrok oziroma mladostnikov, mlajših od 18 let.

"V Sloveniji je več kot 8000 ljudi s povprečno zelo visoko izobrazbo, z visoko stopnjo znanja in izkušenj. Odkrili so, da jim zaposlitev pri nas predstavlja zelo veliko težavo. Na njihovo srečo se je Slovenija kot država odzvala z veliko pomoči, od socialne pomoči do subvencije za namestitev, kar jim močno olajša življenje. So pa hkrati izrazili željo, da želijo ostati v Sloveniji in tudi svoj poklic opravljati tu," je poudarila Špela Kastelic z Inštituta za slovensko izseljenstvo in migracije.

Večina ukrajinskih beguncev je pri nas nastanjenih že več kot dve leti. V zadnjem času pa država mesečno obravnava okoli 170 prošenj za zaščito. Begunci prihajajo predvsem iz Kijeva ter iz Doneške, Harkovske in Hersonske oblasti, pa je v predstavitvi raziskave pojasnil Lorenzzo Leonelli iz pisarne UNCHR-ja v Budimpešti.

Povprečno gospodinjstvo ukrajinskih beguncev ima dva člana, najpogosteje mater in otroka. Kar 68 odstotkov gospodinjstev vodijo ženske same, v kar 57 odstotkih gospodinjstev so otroci.

Večina beguncev (93 odstotkov) se pri nas počuti varne in jih ne poroča o skrbeh (86 odstotkov), prav tako v miru sobivajo z večinskim prebivalstvom. Vseeno jih je okoli 17 odstotkov izkusilo različne sovražnosti, med katerimi prednjačijo verbalno nasilje in sovražni komentarji na družbenih omrežjih. Le zelo majhen delež jih poroča o neenaki obravnavi pri pridobivanju nastanitve ali iskanju dela.

Negativnih izkušenj imajo tako ukrajinski begunci pri nas v povprečju manj kot v drugih državah (v Bolgariji, Romuniji, na Slovaškem, Poljskem in Češkem). Tudi zato jih velika večina, kar 84 odstotkov, namerava ostati v Sloveniji. Le osem odstotkov jih razmišlja o vrnitvi domov in le en odstotek o selitvi v drugo državo.

Kar 54 odstotkov delovno aktivnih Ukrajincev ni zaposlenih

Manj spodbudni so podatki o ekonomski vključenosti ukrajinskih beguncev. Kar 54 odstotkov delovno aktivnih Ukrajincev ni zaposlenih. Povedano drugače, kar 71 odstotkov od tistih, ki so imeli zaposlitev v svoji državi, je pri nas brezposelnih. Zanimivo je, da je v drugih evropskih državah njihova stopnja zaposlenosti precej višja kot pri nas, celo na Madžarskem, kjer je jezikovna bariera zanje precej težje premostljiva.

Razloge za nizko stopnjo zaposlenosti so načeli tudi udeleženci okrogle mize, ki je sledila predstavitvi skupne raziskave UNCHR-ja in ZRC SAZU. Med glavnimi razlogi so se izrisali zelo visoka izobraženost, nezadostno znanje jezika za visoko kvalificirane poklice in izguba socialnih transferjev v primeru zaposlitve.

Ukrajinski begunci v Sloveniji so zelo visoko izobraženi, kar tri četrtine jih ima vsaj univerzitetno izobrazbo. Kot je izpostavil Lorenzzo Leonelli, jih ima kar nekaj občutek, da njihove kvalifikacije v Sloveniji niso ustrezno prepoznane, hkrati pa se jim zdi administrativni proces priznavanja izobrazbe in kvalificiranosti preveč zamuden.

V primeru zaposlitve begunka z otroki izgubi socialno pomoč

Mariya Ardyukova iz Slovenske filantropije je ob tem izpostavila, da si visoko izobraženi begunci in begunke, ki so imeli v svoji državi določen poklic, status in način življenja, ne želijo končati na delovnih mestih, za katera so po izobrazbi prekvalificirani, ne želijo delati v proizvodnji, fizičnega ali izmenskega dela. Kar je glede na povprečno gospodinjstvo, ki ga vodi mati samohranilka, tudi razumljivo. Opozorila je še na to, da mati, ki v Slovenji živi sama z otroki, v primeru zaposlitve izgubi tako socialno pomoč kot nadomestilo za nastanitev. Zaposlitev se tako finančno skoraj ne izplača, obenem pa ima manj časa za otroke.

Če je od februarja 2022 kar 10.000 Ukrajincev vseh starostnih skupin pri nas prejelo začasno zaščito, pa jih je na Zavod RS za zaposlovanje prijavljenih le 500, je povedala Nina Marin z ZRSZ-ja, na leto jih okoli 100 uspešno najde zaposlitev. "Matere z otroki, ki začenjajo primerjati plačo in prejemke, ugotavljajo, da so na slabšem, če začnejo delati. Tu bi bile treba sistemske spremembe, a ne da se ukine pomoč," je dejala Marin. Predlogi so šli tako v smeri, da bi begunci ob zaposlitvi ohranili vsaj nadomestilo za nastanitev. Zaposlitev je namreč tudi pomemben del integracije odraslih v družbo, podobno kot šola za otroke. Dalj časa brezposelni odrasli se lahko ujamejo v zanko, da hodijo le še na tečaje. Diskrepanca med tem, kar bi si želeli delati in kar je na voljo, je namreč kar precej velika, je opozorila Marin.

Na okrogli mizi so sogovorniki izpostavili tudi jezikovne ovire za zaposlovanje v poklicih s področij zdravstva, šolstva, prava in podobno. Ukrajinski begunci zelo hitro dosežejo raven  slovenščine A1, precej težje pa raven C1. Zato so pozvali tudi k državnemu subvencioniranju nadaljevalnih tečajev slovenščine, ki bi lahko pospešili integracijo visoko kvalificirane delovne sile v slovensko družbo. Včasih pa morajo begunci tudi predolgo čakati na začetni tečaj slovenščine, je dodala Ardyukova, za tiste, ki bi si danes želeli začeti učiti slovenščine, bo prvi tečaj s potrdilom upravne enote na voljo šele februarja 2025, je opozorila.

Otroci vse lažje sledijo pouku

Zelo visoka je vključenost otrok v šole. Kar 93 odstotkov je vpisanih v osnovne in srednje šole. Kar 79 odstotkov pa se jih poleg šolanja v Sloveniji na daljavo udeležuje tudi šolanja v Ukrajini. Kot je pojasnil Leonelli, si begunci želijo ohraniti stik s svojo državo, obenem pa jih skrbi, da bi imeli težavo z veljavnostjo spričeval ob morebitni vrnitvi domov. Vsekakor pa dvojno šolanje pomeni, da otroci in njihovi starši za izobraževanje namenijo več časa.  

"Ker otroci govorijo slovanske jezike, torej ukrajinsko in/ali rusko, je jezikovna prilagoditev v šolah zanje lažja. Vseeno se pojavljajo primeri, ko imajo težavo s sledenjem snovi, nekaj je bilo tudi primerov medvrstniškega nasilja, a načeloma se dobro počutijo v šolah in vse lažje sledijo pouku, saj bo od začetka vojne kmalu minilo tri leta, kar pomeni, da so imeli dovolj časa za prilagajanje v učno okolje," je dejala Kastelec.

Dostopnost zdravstva

71 odstotkov ukrajinskih beguncev je v času raziskave poročalo o potrebah po zdravstvenih storitvah. 15 odstotkov jih je poročalo o  nezmožnosti dostopanja do zdravstvenega sistema. Med razlogi so navedli jezikovne ovire in pomanjkanje denarja za plačilo zdravstvenih storitev.

Kar 38 odstotkov jih je poročalo tudi o težavah z duševnim zdravjem in bi potrebovali podporo. Za številne to predstavlja tabu, zato se pogosto odločijo za pomoč na daljavo, v izvorni državi.

Kastelic je namreč pojasnila, da begunci večinoma prejemajo le osnovno zdravstveno pomoč, nimajo pa dostopa do sekundarne in terciarne ravni zdravstvenega sistema. "Kar pomeni, da osebe s kroničnimi boleznimi in daljšimi terapijami, ki so jih prejemali v Ukrajini, zdaj teh ne morejo prejemati ali pa se srečujejo z visokimi stroški terapij v zasebni zdravstveni sferi," je opozorila.

Jure Gombač z Inštituta za slovensko izseljenstvo in migracije na ZRC SAZU je ob tem še poudaril, da se begunci spopadajo s težavami na področjih, kjer se z njimi srečuje tudi večinska populacija, torej predvsem z dostopnostjo stanovanj in zdravstvene oskrbe.

Pojasnil je še, da so intervjuje za namen raziskave izvajale ukrajinske kulturne mediatorke, brez katerih bi se težko povezali s tukaj živečimi begunci in nanje naslovili zelo osebna vprašanja o financah, duševnem zdravju, morebitnih sovražnostih ... Hkrati so ukrajinski begunci razpršeni po vsej Sloveniji od Ljubljane, Maribora, Obale do Gorenjske, in "če nisi povezan s populacijo, je intervjuje zelo težko izpeljati", je poudaril Gombač in se mediatorkam zahvalil za njihovo pomoč.

2024-09-25.english_content:
84 percent of Ukrainian refugees want to stay in Slovenia. There's a fairly small staff.

Results of the survey on Ukrainian refugees in Slovenia by ZRC SAZU and the UN Refugee Agency

Most Ukrainian refugees have been living in Slovenia for a long time, and more than 80 percent want to stay. They feel safe, they don't feel any more hostile. More than a third of children enrolled in schools in Slovenia are older than the average.

Almost three years after the start of the conflict, the Slovenian Institute for Migration and Emigration ZRC SAZU presented the results of a survey on the situation of Ukrainian refugees in Slovenia commissioned by the UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR).

There is no precise information on the number of Ukrainian refugees currently residing in Slovenia. We only know that since the beginning of the war in Ukraine in February 2022, we have received almost 10,000 temporary protection.

A slightly more prominent figure is that slightly less than 4000 Ukrainian adults are expected to receive cash social assistance and about 3300 additional private housing, with most likely both types of assistance being received at the same time. The results of the survey suggest that 75 per cent of all Ukrainian refugees in Slovenia receive state financial assistance, but at the same time we must take into account that 37 per cent of Ukrainian refugees are children or adolescents under the age of 18.

"There are more than 8000 people in Slovenia with a very high level of education, on average, with a high level of knowledge and experience. They discovered that their employment with us was a very serious problem. Fortunately for them, Slovenia as a country has responded with a lot of help, from social assistance to accommodation subsidies, which greatly facilitates their lives. They also expressed a desire to stay in Slovenia and to pursue their career here", said Spela Kastellic from the Slovenian Institute for Emigration and Migration.

Most Ukrainian refugees have been living with us for more than two years. More recently, the state has been dealing with about 170 protection requests per month. The refugees come mainly from Kiev and the Donetsk, Harkov and Herzegovina governments, explained Lorenzzo Leonelli of the UNCHR Budapest office in a presentation of the research.

The average household of Ukrainian refugees has two members, most often a mother and child. 68 percent of households are run by women alone, and 57 percent are children.

Most refugees (93 percent) feel safe and unconcerned (86 percent) and live peacefully with the majority of the population. Yet, about 17 percent experienced various forms of hostility, including verbal violence and hateful comments on social media. Only a very small proportion report being treated differently in finding housing or finding work.

On average, Ukrainian refugees have fewer negative experiences here than in other countries (Bulgaria, Romania, Slovakia, Poland and the Czech Republic). The vast majority of them, 84%, therefore intend to remain in Slovenia. Only eight percent of them are thinking about returning home and only one percent are thinking about moving to another country.

54% of the Ukrainians who are active are not employed

Data on the economic inclusion of Ukrainian refugees are less encouraging. 54% of the Ukrainians who are working are unemployed. In other words, 71 percent of those who had jobs in their own country are unemployed. Interestingly, in other European countries their employment rates are much higher than ours, even in Hungary, where the language barrier is much more difficult to overcome.

The reasons for the low employment rate were also the principles of the participants in the round table following the presentation of the joint UNCHR and ZRC SAZU survey. The main reasons were high levels of education, insufficient language skills for highly qualified occupations and the loss of social transfers in the event of employment.

Ukrainian refugees in Slovenia are highly educated, with at least three quarters of them having at least a university education. As Lorenzzo Leonelli has pointed out, some feel that their qualifications are not properly recognised in Slovenia, while they feel that the administrative process of recognising education and qualifications is too late.

In the event of employment, a refugee with children loses social assistance

Mariya Ardyukova, from the Slovenian Philanthropy, said that highly educated refugees and refugees who had a certain profession, status and lifestyle in their country do not want to end up in jobs where they are re-qualified by education, do not want to work in production, physical or shift work. That is understandable, considering the average household run by a single mother. It also pointed out that a single mother living with her children in Slovenia loses both social assistance and accommodation allowance in the event of employment. This means that the employee is almost financially unpaid and has less time for children.

As of February 2022, 10,000 Ukrainians of all ages have received temporary protection in our country, while only 500 have applied to the RS Institute for Employment, said Nina Marin of the USSR, about 100 of them are successfully employed per year. "Mothers with children who start comparing wages and salaries find that they are worse off when they start working. Systemic changes should be made here, but not aid abolished,' said Marin. The proposals were aimed at ensuring that refugees retain at least accommodation allowance when they are employed. Employment is also an important part of integrating adults into society, much like a school for children. For a long time, unemployed adults may be trapped in the trap of just going to school. Marin warned that the gap between what we want to do and what is available is quite large.

The roundtable also set up language barriers to employment in the fields of health, education, law and the like. Ukrainian refugees reach the level of Slovenian A1 very quickly, and the level of C1 is much more difficult. The Commission therefore called for State subsidisation of further courses in Slovenian which could accelerate the integration of highly skilled labour into Slovenian society. But sometimes refugees also have to wait too long for the initial course in Slovenian, Ardyukova added, warning that for those who want to start learning Slovenian today, the first course with an administrative unit certificate will not be available until February 2025.

Children are becoming more and more likely to follow the lessons

The involvement of children in school is very high. 93% are enrolled in primary and secondary schools. 79% of students attend distance education in Ukraine in addition to Slovenia. As Leonelli explained, refugees want to maintain contact with their country, but they are also concerned that they may have a problem with the validity of their certificates when they return home. Doubling education, however, certainly means that children and their parents spend more time in education.

"Because children speak Slavic languages, i.e. Ukrainian and/or Russian, language adaptation in schools is easier for them. However, there are cases of substance tracking problems, some of which have been cases of class-based violence, but they generally feel good in schools and are more likely to follow the lessons because three years from the start of the war will soon pass, which means they have had enough time to adapt to the learning environment", said Kastlec.

Access to healthcare

71 percent of Ukrainian refugees reported their needs for healthcare at the time of the survey. Fifteen percent reported having no access to health care. The reasons for this were language barriers and lack of money to pay for health services.

38 percent also reported mental health problems and would need support. For many, this is taboo, and they often choose to seek help from a distance, in their home country.

Kastellic explained that refugees receive mostly only basic healthcare and do not have access to secondary and tertiary levels of the health system. "This means that people with chronic diseases and long-term therapies who received them in Ukraine are now unable to receive them or face high costs of private healthcare", it warned.

Jure Gombač from the Slovenian Institute for Migration and Emigration at ZRC SAZU also stressed that refugees face problems in areas where they are also faced by the majority of the population, namely in terms of access to housing and healthcare.

He also explained that the interviews for the purpose of the research were conducted by Ukrainian cultural mediators, without whom it would be difficult to connect with the refugees living here and address them with very personal questions about finances, mental health, possible hostilities ... At the same time, Ukrainian refugees are scattered throughout Slovenia from Ljubljana, Maribor, Obala to Gorenja, and "if you are not connected to the population, interviews are very difficult to conduct", Gombač stressed, thanking the media workers for their help.
2024-09-25.english_title: 84 percent of Ukrainian refugees want to stay in Slovenia. There's a fairly small staff.

Nevladniki Gen energiji očitajo kršitev referendumske zakonodaje

Referendum o podpori JEK-u 2 naj bi izvedli novembra, a ga mora DZ še razpisati

V nevladni organizaciji Pravni center za varstvo človekovih pravic in okolja so na Računsko sodišče podali predlog za uvedbo prekrškovnega postopka proti podjetju Gen energija. Podjetju očitajo skoraj 1,5 milijona evrov vredno propagando za JEK 2.

Gen energija kot trenutno edini investitor v morebitno novo jedrsko elektrarno v Krškem (JEK 2) v zadnjih mesecih intenzivno organizira in financira oglaševanje v medijskem prostoru za projekt Jek 2, so opozorili v pravnem centru. Pri tem so med drugim našteli spletno stran o projektu, objave na družbenih omrežjih in spletne oddaje. Vsebine vključujejo enostranske in propagandne informacije, so opozorili na novinarski konferenci v Ljubljani.

"Zakon o volilni in referendumski kampanji podjetjem prepoveduje financiranje referendumske kampanje. Pri propagandnih dejavnostih o projektu JEK 2 državno podjetje Gen energija v nasprotju z referendumsko zakonodajo intenzivno organizira in financira propagando ter tako vpliva na odločanje volivcev na referendumu, ki ga državni zbor niti še ni uradno razpisal," je dejal Aljoša Petek s pravnega centra.

Pri pozivu Računskemu sodišču so se jim pridružili tudi v nevladnih organizacijah Greenpeace Slovenija in Umanotera. Vodja kampanj pri organizaciji Greenpeace Slovenija Sara Kosirnik je poudarila, da je predsednica države Nataša Pirc Musar pozvala k podrobnemu, poštenemu in nepristranskemu obveščanju o gradnji JEK-a 2. "Posameznim skupinam zagovornikov, tudi če so finančno bistveno močnejše od preostalih, je treba preprečiti, da svojo premoč zlorabljajo v medijskem prostoru," je povzela predsedničin poziv.

Opozorila je, da gre pri ravnanju Gena za prav to zlorabo premoči. "Demokratična in vključujoča razprava, ki je ključna za odgovorno in objektivno odločanje na referendumu, se v takem ozračju, torej ob milijonski propagandi investitorja, ki pove le tisto, kar ustreza njemu, ne more zgoditi," je prepričana.

Direktorica Umanotere Gaja Brecelj je opozorila, da se obeta "izsiljeni referendum" brez ključnih informacij za odločanje. "Da bi zamaskirali ta dejstva, investitor intenzivno izvaja propagando v podporo JEK-u 2. In ker so sredstva za to propagando ogromna, nas lahko upravičeno skrbi, da bo zmagal argument moči in denarja, ne pa moč argumentov – podobno, kot smo lahko videli v primeru Teša 6 in Magne," je dejala.

Tudi okoljski ekonomist iz Umanotere Jonas Sonnenschein je poudaril, da je lahko posvetovalni referendum koristen samo, če je na voljo dovolj neodvisnih informacij. "Oglasi investitorja projekta ne bi smeli biti podlaga za sprejemanje političnih odločitev," je dodal.Referendum o podpori JEK-u 2 naj bi izvedli novembra, a ga mora DZ še razpisati.

Za reklamiranje jedrske energije Gen porabil 235.000 evrov

Iz Gen energije so sporočili, da je skupina Gen za utrjevanje zaupanja javnosti v jedrsko energijo od začetka letošnjega leta do 10. septembra porabila 235.000 evrov, za oglaševanje vlaganj v sončne elektrarne pa je porabila višji znesek. "O izdatkih, povezanih z informiranjem o projektu JEK 2, transparentno obveščamo na spletni strani JEK 2, kot družba v državni lasti pa smo zavezani javnemu naročanju," so navedli in dodali, da imajo v skupini Gen z jedrsko energijo, upravljanjem in obratovanjem jedrske elektrarne ter varno, zanesljivo oskrbo odjemalcev več desetletne pozitivne izkušnje.

"Ker v javnosti o jedrski energiji kroži vrsta negativnih mitov in napačnih informacij, se ob našem osnovnem poslanstvu v družbi Gen energija že skoraj 15 let posvečamo tudi ozaveščanju o energetiki in jedrski energiji," so dodali.

Pomemben mejnik za začetek programa ozaveščanja je bila po njihovih navedbah vzpostavitev multimedijskega centra Svet energije, ki ga je od odprtja leta 2011 do danes obiskalo več kot 90.000 obiskovalcev. Zaradi razvoja projekta gradnje JEK 2 je bila lani sprejeta odločitev, da bo družba z različnimi javnostmi komunicirala pogosteje in intenzivneje, so zapisali.

Kot so še navedli v Gen energiji, si bodo v skladu s poslanstvom podjetja prizadevali predstavljati strokovne podlage in celovite informacije o projektu JEK 2, vse s ciljem, da bodo imeli državljani na voljo celovite informacije o tem projektu.
2024-09-25.title: Nevladniki Gen energiji očitajo kršitev referendumske zakonodaje
2024-09-25.english_content:
The governments of the non-governmental organizations have accused energy companies of violating the referendum legislation.

A referendum on support for JEK 2 is due to be held in November, but it is still to be called by the DZ

The Legal Centre for Human Rights and the Environment, a non-governmental organisation, has submitted a proposal to the Court of Auditors to bring an infringement proceedings against Gen Energia. The company is being paid almost 1.5 million euros worth of advertising for JEK 2.

Gen Energia, as the only investor in a potential new nuclear power plant in Krakow (JEK 2) has been organising and financing media advertising for the project in recent months, the legal centre warned. The Commission also concluded that the Commission's comments on the project were not sufficient to justify the imposition of measures. The content includes unilateral and propaganda information, they warned at a press conference in Ljubljana.

"The election and referendum campaign law prohibits businesses from financing a referendum campaign. In its propaganda activities on the JEK 2 project, the state-owned company Gen Energia, contrary to the referendum legislation, intensively organizes and finances propaganda and thus influences the decision of voters in a referendum that has not yet been officially called by the National Assembly", said Aljoša Petek from the Legal Centre.

The Court of Auditors also joined them in the NGO Greenpeace Slovenia and Umanotera. Greenpeace Slovenia's campaign manager Sara Kosirnik stressed that President Nataša Pirc Musar called for detailed, fair and impartial information on the construction of JEK 2. "The individual groups of advocates, even if they are substantially stronger than the rest financially, must be prevented from abusing their power in the media space", the President's appeal summed up.

She warned that the way Gene was treated was the abuse of overcoming. 'A democratic and inclusive debate, which is key to responsible and objective decision-making in a referendum, cannot take place in such an environment, i.e. with the millions of investor propaganda that says only what is right for him,' she believes.

Director of Umanotere, Gaja Brecelj, warned that a "harassment referendum" was being promised without key information to decide. "To mask these facts, the investor is intensively promoting propaganda in support of JEK 2. And because the resources for this propaganda are enormous, we can rightly worry that the argument of power and money will win, not the power of arguments  ⁇  similar to what we saw in the case of Tessa 6 and Magne", she said.

The environmental economist from Umanotere Jonas Sonnenschein also stressed that a consultative referendum can only be useful if enough independent information is available. 'The announcements by the project investor should not be a basis for political decisions,' he added. A referendum on support for JEK 2 is due to take place in November, but it is yet to be called by the DZ.

Gen spent 235,000 euros advertising nuclear power

Gen Energy reported that the Gen group for building public confidence in nuclear power has spent EUR 235,000 between the beginning of this year and 10 September, with a higher amount to be spent on advertising investments in solar power plants. 'We are making transparent information on the costs of informing about the JEK 2 project on the JEK 2 website and as a publicly owned company we are committed to public procurement', they said, adding that the Gen group has decades of positive experience in nuclear power, nuclear power plant operation and supply and customer safety.

"As a result of a number of negative myths and misinformation about nuclear energy in the public, we have been engaged in the education and awareness of nuclear energy for almost 15 years in our core mission at Gen Energia", they added.

The Commission also notes that the Commission has not yet taken any further steps to improve the quality of the information provided by the Commission. As a result of the development of the JEK 2 construction project, a decision was taken last year to communicate more frequently and intensively with the different public, they wrote.

As stated in Gen Energia, they will strive to provide the professional basis and complete information on JEK 2 in line with the company's mission, all with the aim of making complete information on the project available to citizens.

Predlog pripojitve študentskega zdravstvenega doma razburil študentski organizaciji in univerzo

Neuradno naj bi ministrstvo člen črtalo iz predloga zakona

Univerza v Ljubljani in študentski organizaciji nasprotujejo pripojitvi zdravstvenega doma za študente k ZD-ju Ljubljana, kot predvideva predlog novele zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti. Po neuradnih informacijah naj bi na ministrstvu člen črtali.

Pripojitev predvideva del 42. člena predloga novele zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti, ki je v javni razpravi do 16. oktobra. Po predlogu bi zdravstveni dom za študente s 1. julijem 2025 nehal delovati kot samostojni javni zdravstveni zavod, mandati direktorja in članov sveta zavoda pa bi prenehali. Njegovi zaposleni bi se zaposlili v ZD-ju Ljubljana.

Pri Študentski organizaciji Slovenije (ŠOS) so v sporočilu za javnost opozorili, da bi s to potezo ob pomanjkanju zdravnikov družinske medicine v Ljubljani študenti ostali brez primarne zdravstvene oskrbe. Ob tem ZD za študente Univerze v Ljubljani izvaja tudi podporne storitve, kot so zagotavljanje sistematskih pregledov in cepljenja, specializirane za populacijo študentov, so poudarili.

ŠOS: Omenjeni zdravstveni dom primer dobre prakse

Delovanje omenjenega zdravstvenega je po mnenju ŠOS-a primer dobre prakse, ki ga je treba širiti tudi na druga študijska središča, še posebej v Maribor in slovensko Istro. To problematiko na ŠOS-u poudarjajo tudi v okviru zakona za urejanje položaja študentov, o čemer se pogovarjajo z ministrico za zdravje Valentino Prevolnik Rupel. Ta je bila po navedbah ŠOS-a širjenju zdravstvenih dejavnosti v druga študijska središča doslej naklonjena, zato jih še toliko bolj preseneča napoved pripojitve študentskega ZD-ja k ZD-ju Ljubljana.

Podobno so opozorili tudi pri Študentski organizaciji Univerze (ŠOU) v Ljubljani (ŠOU), pri kateri omenjenemu členu predloga novele ostro nasprotujejo. Predlagana sprememba bi, kot so navedli v sporočilu za javnost, še dodatno obremenila že tako dolge čakalne vrste in ogrozila zdravstveno oskrbo študentk in študentov, ki prihajajo iz vseh delov Slovenije študirat v Ljubljano ter so ena najbolj socialno ranljivih skupin.

V obeh študentskih organizacijah so ob tem opozorili, da so se tovrstni poskusi priključitve študentskega zdravstvenega doma k ZD-ju Ljubljana pojavljali že v preteklosti.

Proti tudi Univerza v Ljubljani

"Glede na dosedanje uspešno delo zdravstvenega doma za študente menimo, da argumentov v prid njegovi morebitni priključitvi k ZD-ju Ljubljana ni," so sporočili z Univerze v Ljubljani. Zavzemajo se, da bi ZD za študente prešel pod okrilje ljubljanske univerze. Tak način delovanja študentskih zdravstvenih domov je po njihovih navedbah običajen v drugih državah EU-ja.

Hkrati bi bil ob takšni spremembi položaja ZD-ja za študente ta tudi odlična učna baza za študente ljubljanske medicinske fakultete, so poudarili na Univerzi v Ljubljani. Po njihovih navedbah je Prevolnik Rupel na spomladanskem sestanku tej ideji izrazila naklonjenost, zato na univerzi že pripravljajo izhodišča, kako bi lahko ZD za študente pripojili k univerzi.

Po neuradnih informacijah STA-ja naj bi na ministrstvu za zdravje sporni del 42. člena umaknili iz predloga novele zakona.

Ministrstvo za zdravje je 16. septembra v javno razpravo poslalo predlog novele zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti, katere cilj je regulacija javne in zasebne zdravstvene mreže. "Novela zakona o zdravstveni dejavnosti je v javni razpravi, ki je namenjena temu, da vsi deležniki podajo pripombe, mnenja in predloge. Odprti smo za vse predloge in izboljšave, saj želimo pripraviti čim bolj kakovosten zakon. Vse v javni obravnavi prejete pripombe bomo skrbno preučili in smiselno vključili v osnutek novele, ki jo bomo nato posredovali v nadaljnji postopek," so sporočili z ministrstva za zdravje.

The proposal to join the student health home upset the student organization and the university

The Ministry is supposed to unofficially remove the article from the bill.

The University of Ljubljana and the student organisation oppose the addition of a student health centre to the Ljubljana School of Medicine, as envisaged by the proposal for a new law on healthcare activities. The Ministry is supposed to delete the article after unofficial information.

The accession is provided for in Part 42 of the draft new Health Activities Act, which is open to public debate until 16 October. The proposal would mean that the Student Health Home would cease to function as an independent public health institution on 1 July 2025 and that the terms of office of the Director and the members of the Board of the institution would cease. His employees would be employed at ZD Ljubljana.

The Slovenian Student Organization (ŠOS) warned in a public message that this move would leave students without primary health care due to the lack of family medicine doctors in Ljubljana. In addition, the ZD also provides support services for students of the University of Ljubljana, such as systematic checks and vaccinations, specialised for the student population, they stressed.

SHO: A well-known example of good practice

The work of the said healthcare provider is an example of good practice, which should be extended to other centres of study, in particular in Maribor and Istra, Slovenia. This issue is also highlighted at the SCO in the context of the Law on Student Status, which is being discussed with Minister of Health Valentino Prevolnik Rupel. According to the SCO, the extension of healthcare activities to other study centres has thus far been favourable, and they are all the more surprised by the announcement of the attachment of the student ZD to the Ljubljana ZD.

The same was also warned by the Student Organization of the University of Ljubljana (SHOU), which strongly opposes the proposal of the novel. The proposed amendment would, as they stated in the public notice, further burden the long waiting lists and jeopardise the healthcare of students and students coming from all parts of Slovenia to study in Ljubljana and are one of the most socially vulnerable groups.

Both student organisations warned that such attempts to connect a student health centre to the Ljubljana School of Medicine had already occurred in the past.

Also against the University of Ljubljana

"Given the successful work of the student health centre so far, we believe that there are no arguments in favour of its possible accession to the Ljubljana State University", the University of Ljubljana reported. They are committed to making the student loan available to the University of Ljubljana. This is the way student health centres operate, they said, as is common in other EU countries.

At the same time, the change in the position of the ZD for students would also be an excellent learning base for students of the Ljubljana Medical School, the University of Ljubljana stressed. According to them, the Reverend Rupel expressed his favour of this idea at the spring meeting, so the university is already preparing a starting point for how to connect the students to the university.

According to the informal information of the STA, the Ministry of Health is supposed to remove the contested part of Article 42 from the draft new law.

On 16 September, the Ministry of Health sent a proposal for a new law on health activities aimed at regulating public and private health networks to a public debate. 'The Health Activities Act is currently being debated in public, with the aim of getting all stakeholders to submit their comments, opinions and proposals. We're open to any suggestions and improvements, as we want to make the best possible marriage. All comments received at the public hearing will be carefully examined and appropriately incorporated into the draft novel, which will then be forwarded to the next proceedings", the Ministry of Health said.

Izvršilni odbor SLS-a Gregorčiča po sporu znova povabil v stranko: "Odločitev je na njegovi strani"

Balažic na sobotni klavzuri pričakuje "pomiritev strasti"

Izvršilni odbor SLS-a je sklenil, da stranka do prihodnjih parlamentarnih volitev vso energijo vloži v konsolidacijo in krepitev lokalne mreže, je dejal predsednik Marko Balažic. Nosilca liste na evropskih volitvah Petra Gregorčiča so povabili v stranko.

"V preteklosti se je prevečkrat zgodilo, da so notranji spori in pritiski od zunaj stranko slabili. Pričakujem, da bomo na klavzuri temu naredili konec," je v izjavi za STA dejal Balažic. Pričakuje tudi, da bo izplen sobotne klavzure SLS-a sledil priporočilom izvršilnega odbora.

Ta je, kot omenjeno, sklenil, da stranka v slabih dveh letih do naslednjih parlamentarnih volitev vse sile uperi v krepitev lokalne mreže in oblikovanje jasnih smernic za nadaljnje delovanje. "Navsezadnje je tudi konsolidirana in močna ljudska stranka naša osebna dolžnost do Slovenije," je prepričan prvi mož SLS-a.

Balažic pričakuje "pomiritev strasti"

Tudi v soboto tako pričakuje "malo pomiritev strasti", da lahko SLS v prihodnje kredibilno sodeluje na volitvah in je tudi kredibilni partner.

Člani izvršilnega odbora pa so se na torkovi seji pogovorili tudi z nosilcem liste SLS-a na junijskih evropskih volitvah Gregorčičem. V stranki je namreč po volitvah ob analizi volilnega rezultata zavrelo, ostre besede naj bi tedaj padale predvsem med Gregorčičem in Balažicem. Ob burni razpravi je na mizo padel tudi predlog za sklic izrednega volilnega kongresa, na katerem bi lahko sledila menjava vodstva, a je glavni odbor na glasovanju tak predlog zavrnil.

Tokrat je izvršilni odbor Gregorčiča vnovič povabil, da se vključi v stranko in aktivno pripomore k njeni rasti. "Zdaj je odločitev na njegovi strani," je navedel Balažic, ki pa Gregorčičevega odziva na povabilo ni želel javno komentirati.

Gregorčič: SLS ima dva obraza

Gregorčič je v odzivu navedel, da se je odzval povabilu na sejo izvršilnega odbora, ker se pogovarja z vsemi. Kot je dodal, pa predsednik SLS-a ni predstavil svoje vizije potencialnega sodelovanja, temveč izrazil pričakovanje, da svoje videnje predstavi Gregorčič. Po njegovih besedah so tudi člani izvršilnega odbora, namesto da bi predstavili svojo vizijo stranke v prihodnje, raje izvedli osebne napade nanj.

Hkrati je poudaril, da mu je med kampanjo pred evropskimi volitvami SLS prirasel k srcu, a ima dva obraza – tistega, ki je zares ljudski po njegovem mnenju predstavljajo lokalni odbori, drugi pa sedi na tajništvu stranke in se zavzema za status quo.

"Na izvršilnem odboru SLS-a sem tudi povedal, da bo moje nadaljnje sodelovanje s stranko odvisno predvsem od tega, kako se bosta vodstvo in stranka SLS odzvala na zavajanja svojega predsednika," je navedel Gregorič in dodal, verjame le v politiko in politike z integriteto, zato bodo vse njegove odločitve o sodelovanju s SLS-om odvisne od tega, ali bodo kot stranka sposobni dokazati enako.
