"The most aggressive policies against big beasts are in northern Europe, the most tolerant in the south".

The number of large animals has been on the rise in Europe in recent decades. How do you live with them?

In Europe, the wolf is the main cause of damage to domestic animals, second only to the bear. Considering the number of individuals in the species, the largest damage is caused by rosemary, as high compensation is paid for the deer in Scandinavia, says Miha Krofel.

Krofel is a research scientist at the Department of Forestry and Renewable Forest Resources at the Faculty of Biotechnology of the University of Ljubljana and is considered one of the greatest connoisseurs of large animals, especially cats, in both Europe and Africa. It also deals with ecology and management of large animals and studies how to minimize conflicts between animals and humans.

Occasionally, the media has reported on bear attacks on humans in the wild, planned wolf or bear shootings in various European countries, and on how the European Union is legislatively involved in regulating the coexistence between large animals and humans. Krofel believes that most Europeans like animals such as brown bears, deer and wolves and want them to be kept in their countries, but they can also benefit from them.

The following discussion will explain why bears are special among animals, what happens to the animals that are removed and what differences there are in relation to large animals in individual European countries.

What species of animals do you count among the great beasts that live in Europe? According to some, these are brown bears, wolves, rhino and rosemary, while others include highly endangered Iberian rhino and the golden jackal. What are the main features of an animal being among the great beasts? The group of large animals is not as precisely defined as it is for biological taxonomic groups (e.g. cats, bears, etc.). This group usually includes animals (one of the taxonomic groups at the level of the order within mammals) weighing more than 15 kilograms. Around this body size, the predator's diet is usually upside down. Animals weighing less than 15 kilograms [15 kg] mostly prey on prey smaller than themselves, while heavier animals mostly prey on prey similar in size or larger than themselves. Based on this, we could rank the first four species you've listed among the European species of big beasts. The Iberian rhino and the golden jackal are already under 15 kilograms and actually mostly hunt smaller prey (dwarfs, rodents, and other small mammals), although they both sometimes hunt larger prey. However, the management aspects associated with the Iberian rhinoceros and the jackal are often similar to those considered to be large animals, and therefore they are sometimes treated together with larger species.

After World War II, large animals were on the brink of extinction in Europe, but in recent decades they have made a significant recovery. Today, at least one species of large beast lives in every continental member state of the European Union or in one third of Europe's territory. What kind of examples are the most? Yes, all kinds of big animals in Europe have been severely depredated over the past two centuries. But as a result of the change in our attitude toward natural predators in recent decades, which has led to major changes in their management and conservation, the trend has reversed and now species are returning to many areas where they were once completely exterminated. In addition, many changes in the use of space have contributed to this, in particular the weathering and abandonment of agricultural areas in less productive environments. If we ignore the jackals, the latest estimates show that Europe's largest big animals are wolves, which are also the most widespread. They're followed by bears, and there's less of them than the red-haired and the red-haired.

Finland, Sweden, and Norway are home to all four of the world's largest species of animals. Today, there are also 21 countries where three species of animals live (Eurasian rhino, wolf and brown bear), so Slovenia is no longer as special as it was at the end of the 20th century, for example.

Are there areas in Europe where all the big beasts can fit? Yes, Finland, Sweden, and Norway are home to all four of the world's largest species of animals. Today, there are also 21 countries where three species of animals live (Eurasian rhino, wolf and brown bear), so Slovenia is no longer as special as it was at the end of the 20th century, for example.

What are the relationships between the giant beasts you mention? Which species is dominant? Do bears, wolves and wolves have any contact with each other, do they ever meet, and in exceptional cases, may even attack each other? Inter-breeding relationships between large animals can be quite complex, but fortunately, in Slovenia alone, we have paid considerable attention to this issue in recent years. To summarize, these species are regularly found in our forests, as their prevalence is largely completely overshadowed. However, they seem to be able to share space without much difficulty and aggressive clashes are extremely rare, which is expected on the one hand, considering that they have been living in this space for more than 100,000 years. The bear and the wolf share a similar prey, but telemetry studies have not shown that they avoid each other in space, nor have we detected that they attack each other yet. We've seen even the strongest interactions between the cartoon and the bear, and to some extent between the wolf and the bear, at the prey's location. Bears are very efficient scavengers, often finding fresh remains of carnivorous or wolf prey and are mostly easy to pick up because of their size. However, both of the smaller predators have adapted to this, for example, experienced wild boars avoid artificial feeding grounds for bears when hunting in the forest, since they have obviously learned that there is the greatest danger of being stolen by bears. At least we've confirmed with the rice that the losses from the bears are compensated by more frequent hunting.

Which of these animals are Europe's most dangerous to humans by attack or by causing them the most material damage? Only the brown bear, which in certain cases defends itself by attacking humans, poses a serious potential danger to humans. Other species attack humans only in very exceptional cases (such as if they are venereal, trapped, or long-term captive), so they are not considered dangerous to humans in principle. Wolves are the most harmful to domestic animals, while bears are the most harmful to other holdings (for example, beehives, farms and feeding grounds). In this respect, given the number of individuals of the species, the greatest damage to an individual animal is caused by rosomas, which is linked to the high compensation paid in Scandinavia for the domesticated northern deer that this predator often preys.

Experts have always pointed out the need to live with large animals in Europe, which must be possible despite our densely populated continent. This is a so-called European strategy, which differs from North American or African strategies, where large animals are often preserved by the establishment of large national parks and reserves. What can people do to make this room as problematic as possible? Can it even be useful to the population? That's right, Europe no longer has large areas of pristine wilderness, nor will we go here to displacing people to establish large reserves. So the only way to keep the big beasts alive is to live with them. This can take considerable effort, both from the point of view of managing animals and habitats and working with people. But if we compare population trends in Europe with the populations of large animals in North America and Africa, we can see that the European model is even more successful in many ways. The key is, of course, that most Europeans like this species and want it to remain in their own countries.

There has been considerable research on the effectiveness of various measures to facilitate (or not) coexistence both abroad and at home. The vast majority of them show that the protection of domestic animals or the restriction of access to food of human origin is the key and most effective measure. In certain cases, such as problem bears that have lost their fear of humans or have been frequently fed by humans, removal from nature, which is usually done by shooting, is also an important measure.

The benefits of large animals for the local population can be divided into three groups. The first is the direct economic benefit that can result from ecotourism (e.g. watching and photographing bears), trophy hunting or marketing products originating from natural areas with conserved populations of these species, or that have been produced in a wild-like manner, leading to higher selling prices. The second set of benefits is indirect and related to the ecosystem services that nature offers us, where large animals can play an important ecological role. This includes, for example, assistance in regulating the number and health benefits of their prey  ⁇  wild parkeys (grasses, deer and wild pigs), the seed distribution of important plant species, the regulation of the number of medium-sized animals, the removal of scabies or the provision of food to endangered species of scavengers in the form of prey remnants, and the like. The third group could include all the benefits associated with improving the quality of life of people who like big animals. For example, many people find it important to know that a charismatic species such as the red rose lives in their environment. They feel satisfaction when they find the footsteps of a great predator in the forest or hear wolves roar. This group could include national pride and the rich cultural heritage associated with these species in many countries.

In late August, the media received a lot of attention when it learned that the Swedish government had issued a permit to drive out 486 bears, which accounted for 20 percent of the wild population there. As always with news like this  ⁇  in Slovenia  ⁇  opinions have begun to circulate: is this a senseless killing or a balance between people and big predators? What's your view? Brown bears are a special breed because they are not a territorial species. This means that each bear has no territory from which to drive its own peers, which is the main mechanism for self-regulation of populations, for example in wolves or rhinoceroses. The maximum number of bears depends primarily on the food available in the room. As long as there's enough food, the population will grow. This may be a problem if the numbers of bears are more than the number that the local population is still willing to accept, which is mainly due to the number of conflicts caused by bears.

One of the measures to reduce these conflicts may also be to reduce bear density by shooting, which we have been doing for a long time in Slovenia on a scale similar to that now in Sweden. We and the Scandinavian population can certainly carry such projectiles, and we have good data for that. The extent to which and for how long this will be supported by the wider public depends primarily on the values and emotional responses of people to such shootings in individual countries. In any case, I think it is essential that other conflict prevention measures which have been shown to be effective in research, in addition to the removal, are implemented in parallel. In the case of bears, these are mainly the protection of crustaceans and bees, the prevention of direct feeding of bears and the loss of fear of humans, and the raising of public awareness of appropriate behaviour on the margins of natural habitats and in them.

Most hunters who successfully fend off one species legally keep body parts as trophies, usually the skin and skull. I think there's no big difference between a local hunter or a hunting guest who came hunting from somewhere else. The bear also retains the meat, which is mostly sold. The bodies are mostly thrown away by people who have illegally intercepted the animals.

What happens to animals that are meant to be hunted, thrown away, or sold? Can only hunters shoot these animals, or is this also a hunting tourism? The rarity and charisma of large animals is certainly very interesting as well as hunting trophies. Most hunters who successfully fleece one of these species legally keep body parts as trophies, usually the skin and skull. I think there's no big difference between a local hunter or a hunting guest who came hunting from somewhere else. The bear also retains the meat, which is mostly sold. The bodies are mainly discarded by people who have illegally intercepted animals, reducing the likelihood of detection and prosecution, although the bodies of illegally shot animals are often found to lack heads, scales, or skins. However, in most of these cases illegal disposal is not primarily related to trophy-winning, but more often to species hostility, non-compliance with biodiversity conservation policies, or misconceptions about predators' influence on parkland game species.

The brown bear is a protected species. It is protected by international, European and Slovenian law and therefore interference with their population is only possible if such conduct does not prejudice the maintenance of the population's favourable status and if it is intended to prevent serious harm or to ensure human health and safety. Why, in the opinion of experts, did the most appropriate method of population settlement be removed rather than, for example, relocation or sterilization? Sterilising large numbers of bears in the wild would be logistically very demanding and would be associated with many undesirable side effects. Internal migrations, such as those in Slovenia, are not effective because bears have a very good sense of orientation and usually manage to return quickly to the place where they were caught. However, migration between countries is politically very demanding and even when we do it, for example for resettlement purposes, only a small number of animals are involved. As already mentioned, the effective method of reducing or regulating the population in bears can be eliminated mainly because they are not a territorial species and because their density, in addition to human intervention in the population, is primarily determined by the food. But I think it would be wise to try to regulate bear density in addition to the off-shoot by limiting the feeding of bears, especially in Slovenia, where maize and other feed from wildlife feed are the most important food source for our bears.

A few words about wolves. A month ago, there was a lot of talk about the European Commission proposing to change the status of wolf protection under the Berne Convention from strictly protected to protected species. This is also expected to be supported by the past and future President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen. Is this change in effect, and if so, what does it bring? This procedure to try to reduce the general protection status of wolves in the European Union is still ongoing. Even if the change is confirmed, I do not think it will bring any significant differences in wolf management in Europe, as the maintenance of the favourable conservation status of the species will still be in force and a relatively high interference in wolf populations is already being implemented in large numbers. Even if we compare areas where wolves are classified as a strictly protected species or protected species today, we don't see any major differences in impacts in populations. This will still depend mainly on local policy and public support for implementing such a measure.

Wolves have become widespread in Europe over the past two decades, with more than 20,000 now believed to live in EU countries alone. In the EU, about 65,000 head offspring and other domestic animals are said to be attacked by wolves each year, which is a lot to hear, but on the other hand, there are only around 60 million sheep in the EU. In Europe, in addition, not a single fatal wolf attack on humans has been detected in the past 40 years. But farmers who are being slaughtered by wolves, statistics, of course, do not help. Does the battle to (non) protect wolves have a political premise, or is it that farmers think the urban elite doesn't understand them? Thus, at European level or at the level of individual Member States, the impact of wolves on livestock mortality is not significant. But it can be a big influence from the perspective of the individual rider. Therefore, effective protection of domestic animals, especially small animals in pastures where wolf attacks occur every year, is essential. Our research also showed that most of the damage occurs on a very small proportion of grassland within the wolf area and that with improved protective measures, this damage is significantly reduced by more than 90%. On the other hand, we know that the disposal of individual wolves or trout does not significantly affect these damage, and sometimes even increases the loss of livestock after disposal. So I would agree that the political overstatements are often the backdrop of the wolf-shooting controversy.

Does the EU offer farmers compensation for the deaths of domestic animals or is this within the scope of each Member State? The compensation for damage caused to farmers by large animals and other protected species shall be covered by the individual Member State from the taxpayer's money. Individual States shall also lay down rules on the cases in which compensation is paid and the amount of compensation. In our case, it is subject to minimum safeguards, which are often insufficient to ensure effective protection, and the value paid is slightly higher than the market value, which also covers part of the indirect costs to the farmer.

Among the great European beasts, the least known is certainly the rosoma, a species of cone that lives in northern Europe. Has this species ever settled in the southern regions, specifically Slovenia? Rosomah is the largest member of the family Kun, which includes, for example, the lizard, the owl and the sub-race. During the Ice Age, especially in the last glacial period, rosomaches also lived on the territory of Slovenia, which shows fossil remains found in several of our caves (for example, in the Križna Cave in Notranjska and in Potočka Zijalka in Karavanka), and they have also been found, say, in the south of Istria.

During the Ice Age, especially in the last glacial period, rosomaches also lived on the territory of Slovenia, which shows fossil remains found in several of our caves (for example, in the Križna Cave in Notranjska and in Potočka Zijalka in Karavanka), and they have also been found, say, in the south of Istria.

How do climate change and warming affect the lifestyles of large animals in Europe? They're moving to colder areas, do you notice any changes in their behavior patterns? Relatively little research has been done on this subject in major European publications. Perhaps the greatest impact can be expected at the moment in relation to food, especially in the case of bears, which feed mostly on plant sources. The increased temperatures can also have a certain effect on winter breeding bears, as several studies have shown that the time the bears spend in the nest is influenced by temperatures in addition to the food available in winter. If I speculate a little, we can expect some impact on the success of the wolf and the fox, as they are known to be more successful in hunting wild parklanders in deep snow.

The conservation of wolves, brown bears and Eurasian ravens is subject to the same legal basis in the European Union, while the political practices in the management of conservation itself vary between countries. What European country is leading the way in protecting the big beasts and is considered a role model, and what is the "black sheep" in this regard? Yes, the differences between countries are very large. In general, we can see a marked gradient from north to south. The most aggressive animal policies are seen in the northern countries, including Norway's leading ones, which is interesting on the one hand, as the least density of humans and the greatest amount of wildlife are found right in northern Europe. On the other hand, they are apparently more tolerant of the beast in southern Europe, perhaps the most extreme example being Italy. In this country, the public is strongly opposed to any shooting of large beasts, including when a certain bear harms or even kills a person.

Interestingly, the northern European region is the least tolerant of big beasts, as the societies there are considered the richest, most prosperous, and with a strong emphasis on community. Why do you attribute this relationship to them? Was it like that in the past? That would probably be more a question for a sociologist than a biologist. This may be partly explained by the fact that the north is more utilitarian to nature than the south, and the desire to control natural processes or wildlife is more pronounced. This is especially true in Germanic cultures, including Austria. The local attitude to large animals also depends in part on whether the species in the area have been extinct in the past or have been present all along. If they are absent for a long time, traditional knowledge of how to live with them is often lost, and fear can also increase. We see this also in Slovenia, where, say, fear of wolves is increasingly high where wolves reappear. When people realize after a few years or decades that wolves are not so scary and do not eat all the children, the fear subsides and the relationship improves.

You're interested in the kingdom of the beast in general. By spring 2025, you'll be on the field in Africa. What project are you studying? In Africa, we deal with very similar research issues as in Slovenia, so we try to better understand the effectiveness of different management measures to prevent conflicts between local people and large animals, explore the role of predators in ecosystems and monitor their conservation status. We are currently devoting our greatest efforts to preventing conflicts between leopards and herds of cattle, identifying the importance of cheetahs and their prey remains to hawks, investigating the impact of raw hyena on soil fertility in desert ecosystems, and monitoring the status of the lion population in the last few areas of Namibia where they have managed to survive.

Trump napoveduje množične deportacije iz mesta, kjer "migranti jedo pse"

V Springfieldu zaradi neosnovanih govoric grožnje in evakuacije

Donald Trump je napovedal, da bo kot predsednik množično deportiral migrante iz mesta Springfield v Ohiu, o katerem je Trump razširil neutemeljene govorice, da tamkajšnji migranti s Haitija jedo pse.

"Začeli bomo s Springfieldom, ki je popolnoma uničen od priseljevanja," je dejal Trump.

Mestne oblasti v Springfieldu, mestecu z 58.000 prebivalci, so dejale, da so večkrat ovržene govorice o uživanju štirinožnih ljubljenčkov pretresle njihovo malo skupnost in privedle do nasilnih groženj, zaradi katerih so morali zapreti šole.

Predsednik Joe Biden je v petek pozval k umirjanju strasti in označil kritike Haitijcev v Springfieldu za "preprosto zgrešene". "To se mora nehati, kar dela. Mora se nehati," je dejal Biden o Trumpovih izjavah.

Trumpove napovedi o množičnih deportacijah so se začele po skoraj tednu dni natolcevanj o tem, kako migranti pobijajo hišne ljubljenčke v Springfieldu. Trditve o uživanju psov, ki jih je republikanski kandidat ponovil na torkovem soočenju s Kamalo Harris, sta zanikala tako policijski načelnik in župan Springfielda kot tudi guverner Ohia Mike DeWine.

V petek so morali v Springfieldu zaradi groženj z bombo evakuirati tri šole. Najmanj eno od groženj so pospremile zaničljive izjave glede Haitijcev, je povedal župan Springfielda Bob Rue. Že v četrtek so morali zaradi groženj evakuirati mestno hišo in več drugih stavb.

"Nazaj v Venezuelo"

Trumpa so na tiskovni konferenci na njegovem  igrišču za golf v Los Angelesu novinarji v petek vprašali, ali razmišlja o obisku Springfielda.

"Lahko rečem to – v Springfieldu bomo izvedli množične deportacije. Množične. Te ljudi bomo spravili ven. In jih poslali nazaj v Venezuelo," je odgovoril. Migranti v Springfieldu večinoma prihajajo s Haitija, dovoljenje za bivanje v ZDA pa so dobili po zveznem programu za Haitijce.

Zakaj je Trump omenil Venezuelo, ni jasno. Je pa večkrat opozoril na porast venezuelskih pribežnikov v mestu Aurora v Koloradu in dejal, da se bodo v primeru njegove zmage na novembrskih volitvah deportacije začele tudi tam.

Na torkovem soočenju je Trump poudaril tudi, da je venezuelska tolpa zasedla stanovanjski kompleks v Aurori. Policija v Aurori je v sredo aretirala osem ljudi, ki jih sumijo, da so člani kriminalne združbe Tren de Aragua. Policija je ob tem priznala, da so člani tolpe "znatno posegli" v neidentificirane stanovanjske komplekse v mestu, je pa policijski načelnik zanikal, da bi kriminalci zasedli kakšno stavbo v Aurori.

Trump announces mass deportations from a city where "migrants eat dogs".

In Springfield for unfounded threats and evacuation rumors

Donald Trump has announced that as president he will mass deport migrants from Springfield, Ohio, who have been spreading unfounded rumors that Haitian migrants there eat dogs.

"We're going to start with Springfield, which is completely devastated by immigration", Trump said.

The city of Springfield, a town of 58,000, has been reported to have repeatedly shaken up its small community by rumors of four-legged pets, leading to violent threats to close schools.

President Joe Biden called for a calm on Friday, calling the criticism of the Haitian people in Springfield "simply wrong". "It has to stop what it does. It has to stop", Biden said of Trump's statements.

Trump's predictions of mass deportations began after nearly a week of rumors about migrants killing pets in Springfield. The dog-eating claims made by the Republican candidate in the Torquay showdown with Kamalo Harris were denied by both the police chief and the mayor of Springfield and Ohio Governor Mike DeWine.

Three schools in Springfield were evacuated Friday because of the bomb threat. At least one of the threats was accompanied by disparaging statements about Haitians, said Springfield Mayor Bob Rue. Threats had already forced the evacuation of the town hall and several other buildings on Thursday.

"Back to Venezuela"

Trump was asked by reporters at a press conference at his golf course in Los Angeles Friday if he was considering a visit to Springfield.

"I can tell you this. We're going to have mass deportations in Springfield. - In large numbers. We're gonna get these people out. And send them back to Venezuela", he replied. The migrants in Springfield are mostly Haitian, and they were granted residence permits in the United States under a federal program for Haitians.

Why Trump mentioned Venezuela is not clear. But he has repeatedly pointed out the increase in Venezuelan refugees in Aurora, Colorado, and said that if he wins the November election, deportations would begin there as well.

In his address to Torque, Trump also stressed that a Venezuelan gang had occupied a housing complex in Aurora. Aurora police arrested eight people on Wednesday on suspicion of being members of the Tren de Aragua criminal organization. Police admitted that gang members had "significantly affected" unidentified apartment complexes in the city, but the police chief denied that the criminals occupied any building in Aurora.

Nizozemski premier z razglasitvijo "azilne krize" napovedal najstrožjo protipriseljensko politiko

"Ne moremo še naprej prenašati velikega prihoda migrantov v našo državo"

Nizozemska vlada bo uvedla "najstrožjo azilno politiko doslej", da bi zajezila nezakonite migracije, je napovedal nizozemski premier Dick Schoof, ki bo z razglasitvijo izrednih razmer vladi omogočil sprejem ukrepov proti priseljevanju brez parlamenta.

Schoof je napovedal, bo vlada Evropski komisiji prihodnji teden poslala prošnjo za izvzetje Nizozemske iz skupne evropske azilne in migracijske politike.

"Ne moremo še naprej prenašati velikega prihoda migrantov v našo državo," je izjavil na novinarski konferenci v Haagu.

"Ljudje doživljajo azilno krizo. Zato bomo kmalu uvedli izredni ukrep, sestavljen iz več postopkov, da bi poostrili politiko na področju migracij in azila," je dodal ob predstavitvi načrtov vladne koalicije štirih strank, v kateri je najmočnejša skrajno desna Stranka za svobodo (PVV) Geerta Wildersa.

Načrti, ki jih je v petek objavila nizozemska vladna koalicija, vključujejo strožji mejni nadzor, omejitve združevanja družin ter osredotočenost na prisilna vračanja.

"Osredotočili se bomo na hiter odhod tistih, ki ne morejo ostati, in pospešen postopek za prošnje za azil, ki nimajo možnosti za uspeh," je še dejal Schoof, ki bo z razglasitvijo izrednih razmer oziroma "azilne krize" vladi omogočil sprejetje ukrepov proti priseljevanju brez odobritve v parlamentu.

Doslej najbolj desna nizozemska vlada je nastopila v začetku julija, potem ko je bila na novembrskih parlamentarnih volitvah relativna zmagovalka skrajno desna stranka PVV, ki je izrazito nastrojena proti priseljevanju.
2024-09-14.title: Nizozemskipremierzrazglasitvijoazilne krize napovedal najstrožjo protipriseljensko politiko
2024-09-14.english_content:
The Dutch Prime Minister announced the toughest anti-immigration policy in the country with the declaration of an " asylum crisis "

"We cannot continue to tolerate the large influx of migrants into our country"

The Dutch government will implement "the strictest asylum policy yet" to curb illegal migration, announced Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof, who will allow the government to adopt measures against immigration without parliament by declaring a state of emergency.

Schoof predicted that the government would send a request to the European Commission next week for the Netherlands to be excluded from the Common European Asylum and Migration Policy.

"We cannot continue to tolerate the large influx of migrants into our country", he said at a press conference in The Hague.

"People are experiencing an asylum crisis. We will therefore soon implement an emergency multi-procedure measure to tighten migration and asylum policy", he added, presenting plans for a four-party coalition government, with the far-right Freedom Party (FDP) as its strongest.

The plans announced by the Dutch government coalition on Friday include tougher border controls, restrictions on family reunification and a focus on forced returns.

"We will focus on the rapid departure of those who cannot stay and on the accelerated process for asylum applications for those who have no chance of success", said Schoof, who will allow the government to adopt measures against immigration without parliamentary approval by declaring a state of emergency or 'refuge crisis'.

The far-right Dutch government took office in early July after the November parliamentary elections were won by the far-right PVV, a strong anti-immigrant party.
2024-09-14.english_title: The Dutch Prime Minister announced the strongest anti-immigration policy in the wake of the crisis

2024-09-14.author: K. S.
2024-09-14.content:
Papež pozval katoličane, naj med Trumpom in Harris izberejo "manjše zlo"

Kandidatov ni omenjal po imenu, je pa Američane pozval na volitve

Papež Frančišek je prvič posredno komentiral predsedniške volitve v ZDA, pri čemer je oba kandidata označil za "proti življenju", ameriškim katoliškim volivcem pa položil na srce, naj ob oddaji glasovnic novembra voljo za "manjše zlo".

Papež je poudaril, da je nesprejemanje migrantov, s čimer se je obregnil ob Donalda Trumpa, "hud greh", stališče Kamale Harris do splava pa primerjal z "umorom", pri čemer sicer nobenega od kandidatov ni eksplicitno omenjal po imenu.

"Oba sta proti življenju, pa naj bo to tisti, ki izganja migrante, ali pa tisti, ki ubija dojenčke," je izjavil papež Frančišek med letom v Rim po koncu 12-dnevne turneje po Aziji, potem ko so ga novinarji vprašali, koga naj na predsedniških volitvah v ZDA po njegovem volijo katoličani, ki tam sestavljajo 52-milijonsko občestvo.

Papež je opozoril, da ni Američan in da na volitvah ne bo glasoval, vendar pa je Američane spodbudil, naj se jih udeležijo. "Če ne volimo, je grdo. Ni dobro. Morate voliti," je pozval. "Izbrati morate manjše zlo. Kdo je manjše zlo? Ta gospa ali ta gospod? Ne vem. Vsakdo mora razmisliti po svoji vesti in to storiti," je dodal.

Trump v svojih nastopih med predvolilno kampanjo ves čas napada migrante in obljublja množične deportacije priseljencev, Harris pa obljublja, da bo razširila zaščito dostopa do splava po vsej državi, potem ko je konservativno vrhovno sodišče leta 2022 ukinilo pravico do splava v ZDA.

Papež sicer pogosto in ostro kritizira splav, ki je po katoliškem nauku prepovedan. "Izsiliti otroka iz materine maternice je umor, ker govorimo o življenju tam notri," je dejal papež.

Ni pa tudi prvič, da je bil sveti oče kritičen do Trumpa, ki ga je med predvolilno kampanjo leta 2016 označil za slabega kristjana zaradi njegove protipriseljenske retorike. "Izgon migrantov, jim odrekati razvoj, jim odrekati življenje, je grda stvar. Zlobno je," je dejal v petek.
2024-09-14.title: Papežpozvalkatoličane,najmedtrumpominharrisizberejomanjše zlo
2024-09-14.english_content:
Pope Francis has urged Catholics to choose between Trump and Harris as "less evil".

He didn't name the candidates, but he called the Americans to the polls.

Pope Francis first made an indirect comment on the U.S. presidential election, calling both candidates "anti-life", and urging American Catholic voters to "take a little bit of evil" at the November ballot.

The pope stressed that the refusal to accept migrants, which he condemned at the time of Donald Trump, was a "serious sin" and compared Kamala Harris's position on abortion to "death", although he did not explicitly mention any of the candidates by name.

"They are both against life, whether it be the one who expels migrants or the one who kills babies", Pope Francis said during a flight to Rome after a 12-day tour of Asia, after reporters asked him who he would vote for in the U.S. presidential election for the 52-million Catholic congregation.

The pope warned that he was not an American and would not vote in the election, but encouraged Americans to attend. "If we don't like it, it's ugly. It's not good. You must vote", he called. "You must choose the lesser evil. Who's the lesser evil? This lady or this gentleman? I don't know. I'm not sure. Each one must think through his conscience and do so", he added.

Trump, in his election campaign appearances, has been constantly attacking migrants and promising mass deportations of immigrants, and Harris has promised to expand abortion protection across the country after the Conservative Supreme Court abolished the right to abortion in the United States in 2022.

The pope has often and fiercely criticized abortion, which is prohibited by Catholic teaching. "To force a child out of the womb is murder, because we're talking about life in there", the pope said.

It is not the first time the Holy Father has criticized Trump, who during his 2016 election campaign called him a bad Christian for his anti-immigrant rhetoric. "Expulsion of migrants, denial of development, denial of life is a bad thing. It's evil", he said Friday.
2024-09-14.english_title: The Pope, Catholic, the most powerful man in the world, has the least evil to gain.

2024-09-14.author: K. S.
2024-09-14.content:
Vučić podpisal soglasje za ponovno uvedbo obveznega služenja vojaškega roka

Ponovno služenje vojaškega roka uvaja tudi Hrvaška

Srbski predsednik Aleksandar Vučić je podpisal soglasje za uvedbo obveznega služenja vojaškega roka, ki bi trajal 75 dni. Srbija po njegovih besedah namreč potrebuje močno vojsko, "da bi lahko odvrnila tiste, ki ji grozijo".

Sklep o ukinitvi obveznega služenja vojaškega roka so v Srbiji sprejeli pred 13 leti. Odločitev o njegovi ponovni uvedbi mora sprejeti vlada. Vučić je danes izrazil prepričanje, da bo to odločitev sprejela.

"Želim verjeti, da vsi razumete, kako zelo potrebujemo močno vojsko, koliko bomo še morali kupiti orožja, ga izdelati," je izjavil na slovesnosti podelitve diplom na vojaški akademiji.

Pri tem je poudaril, da Srbija ne želi nikogar napasti, niti tega ne bo storila, da pa je njihova želja "odvrniti vse tiste, ki jim vsak dan grozijo".

Vučić je že pred časom dejal, da država razmišlja o uvedbi obveznega vojaškega roka, ki bi trajal 60 dni, dodatnih 15 dni pa bi potekale vaje. Takrat je še pojasnil, da bi bilo obvezno za moške, ženske pa bi lahko služile prostovoljno.

Ponovno uvedbo obveznega služenja vojaškega roka bo s 1. januarjem po napovedih uvedla tudi Hrvaška.
2024-09-14.title: Vučić podpisal soglasje za ponovno uvedbo obveznega služenja vojaškega roka
2024-09-14.english_content:
Vučić has signed a consent to the reinstatement of mandatory military service

Re-commissioning of the military arm is also being introduced by Croatia

Serbian President Aleksandar Vučić has signed a consent to the introduction of mandatory military service for 75 days. He said Serbia needed a strong army "to repel those who threaten it".

The decision to abolish the mandatory military service was adopted in Serbia 13 years ago. The decision to reintroduce it must be taken by the government. Vucic expressed his confidence that he would make this decision today.

"I want to believe that you all understand how much we need a strong army, how much more we have to buy weapons to make", he said at the graduation ceremony at the military academy.

He stressed that Serbia does not want to attack anyone and will not do so, but that it is their desire to "reverse all those who threaten them every day".

Vucic has said that the country is considering a mandatory military stay of 60 days, with an additional 15 days of exercises. At that time, he also explained that it would be mandatory for men and women to serve voluntarily.

The reintroduction of mandatory military service is expected to be introduced by Croatia as of 1 January.
2024-09-14.english_title: Vučić has signed a consent to the reinstatement of mandatory military service

2024-09-14.author: K. S.
2024-09-14.content:
Kanadska vojska nabavila spalne vreče, ki niso primerne za kanadske zime

Obrambno ministrstvo za vreče zapravilo 34,8 milijona kanadskih dolarjev

Kanadska vojska je priznala, da nove spalne vreče, ki so jih lani dobavili vojakom, niso primerne za "tipične kanadske zimske razmere".

Vojska je vojake z novimi spalnimi vrečami oskrbela lansko jesen v Alberti, kjer se je več sto pripadnikov kanadskih oboroženih enot pripravljalo na vojaške vaje z ameriškimi vojaki na Aljaski.

Vojaki, ki so uporabljali omenjene spalne vreče, so poročali o več "kritičnih težavah", povezanih s "pomanjkanjem toplote", razkriva okrožnica, ki jo je objavil CBC. Ker so se temperature v tistem času v Alberti ponoči spustile tudi do -20 stopinj Celzija, je vojake v novih spalnih vrečah zeblo, čeprav so si šotore ogrevali s pečicami.

Uradnik, podpisan pod okrožnico, je v njej še sklenil, da so vreče "primernejše za uporabo v vremenskih razmerah med pozno pomladjo in zgodnjo jesenjo". Ob tem je priporočil, da se vojakom posodi nekaj prvotnih vojaških arktičnih spalnih vreč, ki so jih prvič nabavili leta 1965.

Obrambno ministrstvo je za menjavo izvirnih arktičnih vreč porabilo več kot 34,8 milijona kanadskih dolarjev (23 milijonov evrov).

"Bolje, če bi šli v supermarket"

Vojska v izjavi za CBC ni želela komentirati, ali so vreče pred nakupom preizkusili v hladnem vremenu, so pa pojasnili, da so omenjene spalne vreče "izbrali po temeljitem konkurenčnem postopku" in da so pri izboru med drugim upoštevali vrednost izolacijskega materiala, težo spalnih vreč in volumen pakiranja.

Ob tem so dodali, da se jim še vedno zdi, da so nove spalne vreče primerne za večino uporabnikov – da pa bodo zdaj nabavili nove vreče, prilagojene za zimske razmere na skrajnem severu in na Arktiki.

"Sprašujem se, ali ne bi bilo bolje, da bi preprosto šli v Canadian Tire (priljubljen kanadski supermarket, op. a.)," je pikro pripomnil Rob Huebert z Univerze v Calgaryju, strokovnjak za arktične vojaške zadeve.
2024-09-14.title: Kanadska vojska nabavila spalne vreče, ki niso primerne za kanadske zime
2024-09-14.english_content:
The Canadian Army has procured sleeping bags that are not suitable for the Canadian winter.

The Department of Defense spent 34.8 million Canadian dollars on bags.

The Canadian military acknowledged that the new sleeping bags supplied to soldiers last year were not suitable for "typical Canadian winter conditions".

The military provided soldiers with new sleeping bags last fall in Alberta, where hundreds of Canadian armed forces were preparing for military drills with U.S. troops in Alaska.

Soldiers who used the sleeping bags mentioned reported several "critical problems" associated with "lack of heat", reveals a Circuit Court published by CBC. Because temperatures in Alberta at that time dropped to -20 degrees Celsius at night, soldiers were kept in new sleeping bags, even though they were heating their tents with bakeries.

The official, signed under the circular, also concluded that the bags were "more suitable for use in weather conditions between late spring and early autumn". He recommended that soldiers be given some original military Arctic sleeping bags, which were first purchased in 1965.

The Ministry of Defence spent more than C$34.8 million (€23 million) on the replacement of the original Arctic bags.

"We'd better go to the supermarket".

The military declined to comment on whether the bags were tested in cold weather before purchase, but explained that the said sleeping bags were "selected according to a thorough competitive process" and that the selection took into account, inter alia, the value of the insulation material, the weight of the sleeping bags and the packaging volume.

They added that they still believe that the new sleeping bags are suitable for most users  ⁇  but will now purchase new bags adapted to winter conditions in the far north and the Arctic.

"I wonder if it would be better if we just went to Canadian Tire", noted Rob Huebert of the University of Calgary, an expert on Arctic military affairs.
2024-09-14.english_title: The Canadian Army has procured sleeping bags that are not suitable for the Canadian winter.

2024-09-14.author: La. Da., K. S.
2024-09-14.content:
V izraelskem napadu na mesto Gaza umrli tudi štirje otroci

Izraelska vojska nadaljuje napade na območju Gaze

V izraelskem zračnem napadu na mesto Gaza je bilo zjutraj po navedbah palestinskih zdravstvenih virov ubitih najmanj 11 ljudi. Vsi so bili člani iste družine, med žrtvami pa so tudi štirje otroci in tri ženske, poročajo tuje tiskovne agencije.

Izraelske sile so v zračnem napadu zadele hišo v mestu Gaza, pri čemer je bilo ubitih 11 članov ene družine. Tiskovni predstavnik agencije za civilno zaščito v Gazi je sporočil, da reševalci še nadaljujejo iskanje pogrešanih.

Izraelska vojska teh informacij še ni komentirala.

V izraelskem zračnem napadu na poslopje šole v Gazi, kamor se je zateklo na tisoče razseljenih Palestincev, je bilo danes ubitih pet ljudi, je sporočila tamkajšnja civilna zaščita. Iz ruševin naj bi potegnili trupla petih ljudi, med njimi dveh otrok.

Izraelska vojska je navedla, da so bili tarča borci Hamasa. "Teroristi Hamasa so šolsko območje uporabljali za načrtovanje in izvajanje terorističnih napadov na enote izraelske vojske in državo Izrael," je sporočila vojska.

Izraelske sile so ponoči izvedle napade tudi v drugih delih palestinske enklave, pri tem je bilo ubitih najmanj 10 ljudi. O žrtvah napadov med drugim poročajo iz mesta Han Junis na jugu države.

Izraelska vojska danes nadaljuje napade na območju Gaze. 

Po navedbah zdravstvenega ministrstva v Gazi, ki ga vodi Hamas, je bilo od 7. oktobra lani v Gazi ubitih več kot 41.000 ljudi, ranjenih pa najmanj 95.000. Urad ZN-a za človekove pravice poudarja, da je večina mrtvih žensk ali otrok.
2024-09-14.title: V izraelskem napadu na mesto Gaza umrli tudi štirje otroci
2024-09-14.english_content:
Four children were also killed in the Israeli attack on Gaza City.

Israeli forces continue their attacks in the Gaza Strip

According to Palestinian health sources, at least 11 people were killed in an Israeli airstrike on Gaza this morning. All were members of the same family, and the victims included four children and three women, foreign news agencies reported.

Israeli forces hit a house in Gaza City in an airstrike that killed 11 members of one family. A press release from the Civil Protection Agency in Gaza said rescuers were still searching for missing persons.

The Israeli military has not commented on this information.

In an Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza, where thousands of displaced Palestinians have fled, five people were killed today, civilian security officials said. Five bodies were recovered from the ruins, including two children.

The Israeli military has indicated that the target was Hamas fighters. "Hamas terrorists have used the school area to plan and carry out terrorist attacks on Israeli army units and the state of Israel", the military said.

Israeli forces carried out attacks in other parts of the Palestinian enclave at night, killing at least 10 people. The victims of the attacks were reported from Han Junis, a city in the south of the country.

The Israeli army continues its assaults on the Gaza Strip today.

According to the Hamas-led Gaza Health Ministry, more than 41,000 people have been killed and at least 95,000 injured in Gaza since 7 October last year. The UN Human Rights Office stresses that the majority of the dead are women or children.
2024-09-14.english_title: Four children were also killed in the Israeli attack on Gaza City.

2024-09-14.author: La. Da., K. S.
2024-09-14.content:
V Avstriji pričakujejo, da bo Donava dosegla vodostaj, kakršen se pojavi enkrat na 30 let

Na Poljskem in Češkem zaradi poplav evakuacije

Na Češkem se zaradi obilnih padavin spopadajo s poplavami, brez elektrike je zaradi neurij ostalo več deset tisoč ljudi. O poplavah poročajo tudi iz Poljske, kjer ponekod na jugu države evakuirajo. V Romuniji so zaradi poplav umrli najmanj štirje ljudje.

Močno deževje v srednji Evropi je poplave povzročilo tudi v Romuniji. Pripadniki reševalnih služb so štiri mrtve našli na območju jugovzhodne regije Galati, ki so jo poplave tudi najbolj prizadele.

Reševalci so na 19 območjih v vzhodnem delu države z njihovih domov rešili več deset ljudi. 

V vasi Slobozia Conachi v regiji Galati je poplavljenih 700 hiš, po besedah tamkajšnjega župana Emila Dragomirja pa gre za "katastrofo izrednih razsežnosti". "Pred 11 leti smo že imeli poplave, a ni bilo tako hudo," je dodal.

Žrtve so večinoma starejši ljudje, med njimi ženski, stari 96 in 86 let. Gladina vode je v prizadetih vaseh dosegla do 1,7 metra, ljudje pa so plezali na strehe, da bi se izognili poplavam.

Prizadeto območje je danes obiskal romunski premier Marcel Ciolacu, ki je odpovedal načrtovane obveznosti, da bi si ogledal posledice poplav. Predsednik države Klaus Iohannis pa je izrazil svoje sožalje družinam žrtev poplav. "Znova se soočamo z učinki podnebnih sprememb, ki so vse bolj prisotne na evropski celini," je dejal.

Na Češkem brez elektrike več deset tisoč gospodinjstev

Zaradi podrtih dreves, razmočenih tal in močnega vetra je na Češkem brez elektrike ostalo več kot 60.000 gospodinjstev. Najbolj prizadeto je območje okoli mesta Usti nad Labo na severozahodu države na meji s Saško, kjer je brez elektrike ostalo več kot 20.000 gospodinjstev.

Močno deževje je povzročilo naraščanje vodostaja Labe, ene od največjih čeških rek, oblasti pa so za približno 20 rek in potokov razglasile tretjo stopnjo poplavne ogroženosti.

Zaradi narasle Vltave se na poplave pripravljajo tudi v Pragi, kjer so začasno ustavili ladijski promet in dvignili protipoplavne ograde. Za javnost so zaprli nasipe in živalski vrt.

Po napovedih vremenoslovcev naj bi se vodostaji rek na Češkem še dvignili, v Pragi pa da bodo vrhunec predvidoma dosegli v nedeljo zjutraj. Na nekaterih območjih je od petka padlo od 50 do 110 litrov padavin na kvadratni meter.

Na Poljskem zaradi poplav evakuirali več ljudi

Evakuacije so se začele tudi na Poljskem, saj so reke narasle do nevarnih vrednosti. V regiji Opole na jugozahodu Poljske so začele tudi prestopati bregove. Reka Odra, ki ima običajen vodostaj okoli štiri metre, bi do ponedeljka lahko narasla na največ šest metrov.

Oblasti so sporočile, da je količina padavin v tem delu države že presegla rekordno količino padavin iz t. i. tisočletnih poplav leta 1997, ki so povzročile veliko škodo.

V poljski vasi Jarnoltowek blizu čeških Mikulovic so vremenoslovci izmerili 161,5 milimetra padavin, zaradi česar je župan odredil evakuacijo vasi in še dveh občin ob eni od tamkajšnjih rek.

V bližnji vasi Glucholazy so že pred tem evakuirali približno 400 prebivalcev. Območje je obiskal tudi poljski notranji minister Tomasz Siemoniak, ki je sporočil, da so v vas poslali približno 100 gasilcev in 60 policistov.

Razmere so najtežje v okrožju okoli Prudnika na meji s Češko in v sosednjem okrožju Nysa. "Prihodnje ure bodo težke. Pričakovati je treba veliko novih incidentov in nevarnosti. Ponovno pozivam prebivalce in občane, da poslušajo navodila pristojnih, predvsem pri evakuaciji," je dejal Siemoniak.

Premier Donald Tusk pa je sporočil, da se bo udeležil sestanka s pristojnimi službami v Nysi. "Pred nami je kritična noč, potrebna je popolna mobilizacija," je zapisal na družbenih omrežjih.

Poljska televizija TVP je objavila posnetke vasi Laka Prudnica, kjer je reka Zloty Potok prestopila bregove in poplavila ulice, vrtove in hiše. Lokalna policija je odsvetovala potovanje v regijo. Zaradi visokega vodostaja reke Opave na meji s Češko so začasno zaprli tri tamkajšnje mejne prehode.

Meteorološke postaje ocenjujejo, da bi lahko v 72 urah v gorovju na poljsko-češki meji padlo do 400 litrov dežja na kvadratni meter. V nedeljo bi lahko postale kritične tudi razmere na vzhodu sosednje Nemčije.

Avstrija se pripravlja na stoletne poplave

Obilne padavine, ki jih ponekod spremljajo neurja in sneg, so zajele tudi večji del Avstrije. Na jugu države piha močan veter s sunki do 146 kilometrov na uro, na severu pa je zapadlo do 170 litrov padavin na kvadratni meter. Močno deževje je najbolj prizadelo Spodnjo Avstrijo, kjer pričakujejo stoletne poplave.

Avstrijski kancler Karl Nehammer je sporočil, da je obilno deževje, ponekod pa tudi sneženje, prizadelo skoraj vse zvezne dežele. "Razmere se poslabšujejo, zlasti v Spodnji Avstriji. Najhuje še prihaja, prihodnji dnevi pa bodo za prizadeto prebivalstvo in reševalne službe še težji," je opozoril Nehammer po sestanku državnega urada za upravljanja kriz in katastrof (SKKM). Dodal je, da so gasilci, pripadniki civilne zaščite, policije in vojske "v visoki pripravljenosti, da pomagajo povsod, kjer je njihova pomoč nujno potrebna".

V Spodnji Avstriji so reševalci že ponoči prejeli 160 klicev na pomoč.

Oblasti pričakujejo, da bo reka Donava dosegla vodostaj, kakršen se pojavi enkrat na 30 let, medtem ko bi njen pritok, reka Kamp, lahko povzročil stoletne poplave.

Avstrijski center za opozarjanje pred nevihtami (UWZ) je po poročanju britanske mreže BBC medtem opozoril, da bi bili dosedanji rekordi padavin za mesec september na nekaterih območjih lahko preseženi že v nekaj dneh.

Napovedujejo, da bo v številnih regijah v nekaj dneh padla velika količina padavin, zlasti v goratih predelih v Zgornji in Spodnji Avstriji ter na severu avstrijske Štajerske. Na Tirolskem je do sobote zapadlo do meter snega, reševalci pa iščejo pohodnika, ki ga je zasul snežni plaz.

Avstrijske državne železnice ÖBB so vsem potnikom svetovale, naj preložijo nenujna potovanja, del železniške proge v deželi Salzburg pa so zaradi močnega sneženja zaprli.

V avstrijski prestolnici so gasilci v zadnjih 24 urah zaradi obilnih padavin posredovali približno 150-krat, da bi očistili jaške ali izčrpali vodo, ki je vdrla v kleti. Pričakujejo tudi orkanski veter, poročanje lokalnih medijev povzemajo agencije.
2024-09-14.title: V Avstriji pričakujejo, da bo Donava dosegla vodostaj, kakršen se pojavi enkrat na 30 let

In Austria, the Danube is expected to reach a waterfall that occurs once every 30 years

In Poland and the Czech Republic due to flooding evacuation

In the Czech Republic, heavy rainfall has caused flooding, and electricity has been cut off by the unrest. Flooding is also reported from Poland, where some in the south of the country are evacuated. At least four people have died in the floods in Romania.

Heavy rainfall in central Europe has also caused flooding in Romania. Rescue workers found four dead in the southeastern region of Galati, which was also hit hardest by the flooding.

Rescuers have rescued dozens of people from their homes in 19 areas in the eastern part of the country.

In the village of Slobozia Conachi in Galati, 700 houses were flooded, and according to local mayor Emile Dragomir, it was a "catastrophe of extraordinary magnitude". "We had floods 11 years ago, but it wasn't that bad", he added.

The victims are mostly elderly people, including women, aged 96 and 86. Water levels in the affected villages reached up to 1.7 meters, and people climbed the rooftops to avoid flooding.

The affected area was visited today by the Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu, who cancelled his planned commitments to view the effects of the floods. President Klaus Iohannis expressed his condolences to the families of the flood victims. "We are once again facing the effects of climate change, which are increasingly present on the European continent", he said.

Tens of thousands of households without electricity in the Czech Republic

With trees down, soil torn, and strong winds, more than 60,000 households in the Czech Republic were without power. The worst affected area is the town of Usti nad Labo in the northwest of the country on the border with Saxony, where more than 20,000 households have been left without power.

Heavy rainfall has caused the uplift of the Labe watershed, one of the largest rivers in the Czech Republic, and authorities have declared about 20 rivers and streams to be at third-level flood risk.

The rise of the Volga has also led to flooding preparations in Prague, where shipping has been temporarily suspended and flood-fence barriers have been raised. The public has closed the waterfalls and the zoo.

Weather forecasts say that the waterfalls in the Czech Republic will continue to rise, and in Prague that they are expected to peak on Sunday morning. In some areas, between 50 and 110 litres [50 to 110 litres] of rain per square meter fell on Friday.

Flooding in Poland has evacuated more people

Evacuations have also begun in Poland as rivers have risen to dangerous levels. In the Opole region of south-western Poland, the shores have also begun to cross. The Odra River, which has a normal watershed of about four metres, could rise to a maximum of six metres by Monday.

Authorities reported that the amount of rainfall in this part of the country has already exceeded the record amount of rainfall from the so-called thousand-year floods of 1997, which caused great damage.

In the Polish village of Jarnoltowek near the Czech city of Mikulovic, meteorologists measured 161.5 millimeters of rainfall, which led the mayor to order the evacuation of the village and two other municipalities along one of the rivers there.

In the nearby village of Glucholazy, about 400 residents had already been evacuated. The area was also visited by Polish Interior Minister Tomasz Siemoniak, who reported that about 100 firefighters and 60 police were sent to the village.

The dimensions are most difficult in the district around Prudnik on the Czech border and in the neighbouring district of Nysa. "The hours ahead will be hard. There are many new incidents and dangers to be expected. I call on residents and citizens to follow the instructions of the authorities, especially in the evacuation", said Siemoniak.

And Prime Minister Donald Tusk has announced that he will attend a meeting with the relevant authorities in Nysa. "We have a critical night ahead of us, we need full mobilization", he wrote on social media.

Polish TVP broadcast footage of the village of Laka Prudnica where the Zloty Stream crossed the banks and flooded streets, gardens and houses. Local police have banned travel to the region. Due to the high water flow of the Opava River on the border with the Czech Republic, three border crossings there have been temporarily closed.

The National Weather Service estimates that up to 400 litres of rain per square meter could fall in 72 hours in the mountains on the Polish-Czech border. On Sunday, the situation in the east of neighbouring Germany could also become critical.

Austria Preparing for the Centennial Flood

Heavy rainfall, sometimes accompanied by storms and snow, also covered much of Austria. Winds of up to 200 miles per hour [146 km/ h] were blowing in the south, and up to 170 litres [170 lb] of rain per square foot [170 lb] in the north. Heavy rainfall has hit the most in Lower Austria, where a century of flooding is expected.

Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer reported that heavy rainfall and sometimes snowfall affected almost all federal states. "The situation is getting worse, especially in Lower Austria. The worst is yet to come, and the coming days will be even more difficult for the affected population and the rescue services", said Nehammer after a meeting of the State Office for Crisis and Disaster Management (SKKM). He added that firefighters, civil protection, police, and military personnel were "highly prepared to assist wherever their assistance was urgently needed".

In Lower Austria, rescue workers received 160 calls for help in the middle of the night.

Authorities expect the Danube to reach a watershed that occurs once every 30 years, while its tributary, the Kamp River, could cause centuries of flooding.

The Austrian Storm Warning Centre (UWZ) warned, according to a BBC report, that the previous rainfall record for September in some areas could be exceeded in a few days.

They predict heavy rainfall in many regions in a few days, especially in the mountainous regions of Upper and Lower Austria and in the north of the Austrian state of Styria. In Tyrol, a metre of snow fell by Saturday, and rescue workers are searching for a hiker who was swept away by the snow.

The Austrian State Railways ÖBB advised all passengers to postpone non-essential travel and part of the railway line in the Salzburg region was closed due to heavy snowfall.

In the Austrian capital, firefighters have intervened about 150 times in the past 24 hours to clean the sinks or drain the water that had entered the basement. Hurricane winds are also expected, local media reports are summarizing the agency's findings.

Po tajfunu Mjanmar prizadele še hude poplave. Hunta zaprosila za pomoč iz tujine.

Po tajfunu Jagi so Mjanmar prizadele še hude poplave, zaradi katerih je moralo domove zapustiti več kot 230 tisoč ljudi. Umrlo je najmanj 33 ljudi, med najbolj prizadetimi območji pa je glavno mesto Nepjido. Vladajoča hunta je zaprosila za tujo pomoč.

Za ljudi, ki so ostali brez strehe nad glavo, so, po poročanju državnega časopisa, postavili nekaj začasnih taborišč. Državni mediji še poročajo, da so vodja hunte, general Min Aung Hlaing in drugi mjanmarski uradniki obiskali območja hudih poplav ter pregledali prizadevanja za reševanje in pomoč.

Uradno število mrtvih je 33, a naj bi bilo ta število veliko večje. Po poročanju medijev, ki jih podpira tujina, naj bi bilo smrtnih žrtev najmanj 160, saj naj bi veliko ljudi umrlo pod zemeljskimi plazovi, ki jih je sprožilo močno deževje. 

Reševalec iz Taunguja je za BBC Burmese povedal, da je več kot 300 ljudi ujetih v poplavah na vzhodnem bregu reke Sitaung in dodal, da nimajo dovolj čolnov za reševanje.

Pomoč potrebuje 18,6 milijona ljudi

Zaradi tri leta trajajoče državljanske vojne je bilo v Mjanmaru sicer ubitih tisoče ljudi, več kot 2,6 milijona pa je razseljenih. Po podatkih Urada ZN-a za koordinacijo humanitarnih potreb (OCHA) humanitarno pomoč potrebuje približno 18,6 milijona ljudi. Mednarodni Rdeči križ (ICRC) je v posodobljenih podatkih o trenutnih humanitarnih razmerah na začetku tega tedna navedel, da imajo številne družine v Mjanmaru omejen dostop do čiste vode in sanitarij ter da so brez osnovnih zdravil in zdravstvene oskrbe.

Tajfuni bodo vse bolj pogosti in močnejši

Tajfun Jagi je najmočnejše neurje, ki je letos zajelo Azijo. Preden je zadel Mjanmar, je razdejanje povzročil v Vietnamu, na kitajskem otoku Hainan in na Filipinih. Znanstveniki opozarjajo, da so tajfuni in orkani zaradi podnebnih sprememb vse močnejši in pogostejši. Toplejše vode oceanov pomenijo, da nevihte zberejo več energije, kar povzroči večjo hitrost vetra. V toplejšem ozračju je tudi več vlage, kar lahko povzroči močnejše padavine.
2024-09-14.title: Po tajfunu Mjanmar prizadele še hude poplave. Hunta zaprosila za pomoč iz tujine.

After typhoon, Myanmar was hit by more severe flooding. Hunta asked for help from abroad.

After Typhoon Jagi, severe flooding in Myanmar forced more than 230,000 people to leave their homes. At least 33 people were killed, and the capital Neppido is among the worst affected areas. The ruling junta has asked for foreign help.

For those left without a roof over their heads, a state newspaper reported, a number of temporary camps were set up. State media also reported that the Hunt leaders, General Min Aung Hlaing and other Myanmar officials visited the areas of severe flooding and reviewed rescue and relief efforts.

The official death toll is 33, but it's supposed to be much higher. According to foreign-sponsored media reports, at least 160 people were killed, as many people were reported to have died under the earthquakes caused by heavy rain.

A Taung rescue worker told BBC Burmese that more than 300 people were trapped in floods on the east bank of the Sitaung River, adding that they did not have enough rescue boats.

18.6 million people need help

Thousands of people have been killed and more than 2.6 million displaced in Myanmar's three-year civil war. According to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Needs (OCHA), some 18.6 million people need humanitarian assistance. The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) said earlier this week in an updated report on the current humanitarian situation that many families in Myanmar have limited access to clean water and sanitation and lack basic medicines and healthcare.

Typhoons will become more frequent and stronger

Typhoon Jagi is the strongest storm to hit Asia this year. Before attacking Myanmar, he caused division in Vietnam, the Chinese island of Hainan, and the Philippines. Scientists warn that typhoons and hurricanes are becoming stronger and more frequent due to climate change. Warmer ocean waters mean that storms gather more energy, causing wind speeds to increase. Warmer climates also have higher humidity, which can cause more heavy rainfall.
2024-09-14.english_title: After typhoon, Myanmar was hit by more severe flooding. Hunta asked for help from abroad.
