Od uboja v dvoboju do posredovanja vrhovnega sodišča: zgodovina najbolj norih volitev v ZDA

Letošnje predsedniške volitve niso prve nepredvidljive v ZDA

Ob vseh preobratih in dramatičnih dogodkih se zdi, da so letošnje predsedniške volitve v ZDA daleč najbolj nepredvidljive – a Američani so imeli tudi v preteklosti že precej drame.

Še sredi julija se je zdelo, da so volitve praktično odločene – Joe Biden, z že tako nizko podporo, je po poraznem soočenju zdrsel tako globoko, da je bila Donaldu Trumpu na široko odprta pot do Bele hiše.

In to vsem sodnim procesom navkljub. Ko je preživel poskus atentata, se je zdel za trenutek dejansko neuničljiv.

A po pritiskih donatorjev in veljakov demokratske stranke se je začelo kolesje na demokratski strani vrteti hitreje, kot s(m)o mediji lahko spremljali.

21. julija je Biden, ki je še nekaj dni pred tem zagotavljal, da ne gre nikamor, sporočil, da izstopa iz tekme, in še preden bi lahko demokrati začeli razpravo o novem kandidatu, je Biden že podprl svojo podpredsednico Kamalo Harris za svojo zamenjavo.

Harrisova, do tedaj ena manj priljubljenih podpredsednikov v nedavni zgodovini, je nemudoma zbrala rekordno vsoto sredstev za kampanjo in prevzela prednost pred Trumpom. A nič še ni odločeno in do 5. novembra se zdi, da se lahko zgodi še kar koli.

A to niso prve dramatične volitve v ZDA. Zbrali smo nekaj bolj nenavadnih in nepredvidljivih.

 (Viri: MMC RTV SLO; CNN; FairVote; History.com; The Week)

1800: Volitve, ki so se končale z usodnim dvobojem

Leta 1800 so se v ZDA stranke še oblikovale, "volilnega dne", kot ga poznamo danes, ni bilo, prav tako je bil elektorski sistem precej drugačen in (še precej) bolj konfuzen od današnjega. Vsak elektor je glasoval za dva kandidata in tisti z največ glasovi je postal predsednik, drugouvrščeni pa podpredsednik. Po tem sistemu sta si zaradi komunikacijske napake med republikansko-demokratskimi elektorji prvo mesto razdelila Thomas Jefferson in njegov podpredsedniški kandidat Aaron Burr, na tretje mesto pa se je uvrstil takrat aktualni predsednik John Adams, član rivalske Federalistične stranke.

To je bil prvi od samo dveh primerov v zgodovini ameriških volitev, da se je o predsedniku odločalo v predstavniškem domu. Ključna oseba je bil Alexander Hamilton, prvi finančni minister ZDA, ki je pri svojih Federalistih lobiral, naj podprejo Jeffersona. Čeprav sta se Hamilton in Jefferson prezirala, pa se je Hamiltonu zdel "manjše od treh zel" in varnejša izbira od Burra, za katerega je trdil, da je zaljubljen sam vase in mu je mar samo zase. V Belo hišo se je po tesnem glasovanju v predstavniškem domu tako vselil Jefferson, Burr je postal podpredsednik, ustavi pa so dodali 12. člen, ki izrecno navaja, da elektorji volijo ločeno za predsednika in podpredsednika.

A rivalstvo med Burrom in Hamiltonom se je nadaljevalo še dobra tri leta po volitvah, dokler ni Burr, še vedno aktualni podpredsednik, 11. julija 1804 izzval Hamiltona na dvoboj in ga ustrelil v trebuh. Umrl je naslednji dan, v starosti 48 let.

1824: Brez predsedniškega položaja kljub večini glasov volivcev in elektorjev

Do leta 1824 se je Federalistična stranka praktično razpustila in vsi štirje predsedniški kandidati so bili demokratsko-republikanski. Senator Andrew Jackson, vojni junak vojne ZDA z Veliko Britanijo leta 1812, je za le 39.000 glasov osvojil glas ljudstva in s tem 99 elektorskih glasov. Državni sekretar John Quincy Adams je prejel 84 elektorskih glasov, finančni minister William Crawford 41, predsednik predstavniškega doma Henry Clay pa 37.

Ker nobeden izmed kandidatov ni dobil večine elektorskih glasov, je o zmagovalcu ponovno odločal predstavniški dom in Jackson je bil prepričan, da ima zmago v žepu. Ker je predstavniški dom lahko izbiral samo med tremi kandidati, je Clay izpadel, po mesecu dni pogajanj za zaprtimi vrati pa je večina Clayevih podpornikov podprla Adamsa, ki mu je tako uspelo osvojiti večino glasov v predstavniškem domu. Čeprav je izgubil tako glas ljudstva kot elektorjev, je Adams tako postal šesti predsednik ZDA.

Ko je Adams izbral Claya za svojega državnega sekretarja, je razjarjeni Jackson dogovor označil za "skorumpirano kupčijo", se odrekel svojemu senatnemu stolčku in se zaklel, da se bo leta 1828 vrnil in zmagal, kar je tudi storil, na čelu nove demokratske stranke, pri čemer je gladko premagal Adamsa, takrat vodjo republikancev. A Adams v resnici nikdar ni užival v položaju predsednika in je svoj mandat v Beli hiši označil za "štiri najbolj bedna leta svojega življenja". Razlog? Na vsakem koraku so ga nadlegovali Jackson in njegovi privrženci. Po odhodu iz Bele hiše je Adams kot edini nekdanji predsednik preživel nadaljnjih 17 let v kongresu.

1860: Volitve, ki so razklale narod na pol

Predsedniške volitve 1860 niso bile samo izjemno sporne, ampak so tudi popolnoma razklale ZDA. V središču je bilo vprašanje suženjstva – republikanci so suženjstvu večinoma nasprotovali, a niso bili najbolj zagreti za uveljavitev prepovedi suženjstva v zveznih državah, ki so ga že imele. Demokratom pa se po drugi strani ni uspelo poenotiti glede te teme. Abraham Lincoln, kandidat republikancev in nasprotnik suženjstva, v večini južnih zveznih držav na glasovnicah sploh ni bil.

Demokrati so za svojega kandidata izbrali Lincolnovega tekmeca iz Illinoisa, senatorja Stephena Douglasa, a se je južni del stranke v znak upora odcepil in se odločil za takratnega podpredsednika Johna Breckenridgea, nazadnje sta oba trdila, da sta uradna kandidata demokratov. Tu je bil še senator John Bell iz Tennesseeja, kandidat nove Ustavne sindikalne stranke, ki pa je temo suženjstva popolnoma ignorirala. Lincoln je prejel le 40 odstotkov glasov volivcev, a večino elektorskih glasov na severu, v Kaliforniji in Oregonu – dovolj za precej gladko zmago. Breckenridge je osvojil večino elektorjev na jugu, v Marylandu in Delawaru, Bell je osvojil Tennessee, Kentucky in Virginio, Douglas pa le Misuri, čeprav je bil drugi po številu glasov volivcev.

Volitve, ki jih je zaznamovala tudi rekordna volilna udeležba, in Lincolnova zmaga so spremenile podobo ZDA ter razklale do tedaj dominantno demokratsko stranko – in z njo državo – na pol. Le nekaj tednov po Lincolnovi zmagi je Južna Karolina glasovala za odcepitev. Sledilo je še šest južnih držav, ki so leta 1861 oblikovale Konfederacijo ameriških držav z Jeffersonom Davisom kot predsednikom.

1872: Smrt kandidata

Leto 1872 je postreglo z nekaj prelomnimi kandidaturami: Sufražetka Victoria Woodhull iz Ljudske stranke je postala prva ženska, ki je kandidirala za predsednico, njen podpredsedniški kandidat, pisatelj in abolicionist Frederick Douglass pa prvi afroameriški podpredsedniški kandidat. A volitve tistega leta je zares zaznamovala smrt enega izmed kandidatov – Horacea Greeleyja. Greeleyju sicer niso pripisovali kaj dosti možnosti v boju s takratnim predsednikom, republikancem Ulyssesom S. Grantom, a razkol v republikanski stranki je zadeve popestril. Grant, ki je vodil (Union) vojsko, ki je premagala konfederacijsko, kot predsednik ni bil ravno najbolj prepričljiv.

Nekateri republikanci so zato prestopili med liberalne republikance in oddali svoj glas za Greeleyja, demokrata in ustanovitelja časopisa New York Tribune, ki je nazadnje prejel 44 odstotkov glasov volivcev, čeprav je prekinil svojo kampanjo, da bi skrbel za svojo bolno ženo, ki je umrla teden dni pred volitvami. A preden bi elektorji lahko oddali svoje glasove, je Greeley umrl, 63 od njegovih 66 elektorskih glasov pa se je razdelilo med Thomasa Hendricksa, ki je kasneje postal podpredsednik, in druge demokrate, Grant pa se je tekmecu poklonil z udeležbo na pogrebu.

1876: Volitve, razrešene v "zadimljeni sobi"

Na volitvah leta 1876 je demokratski guverner New Yorka Samuel Tilden prejel 250.000 glasov volivcev več od svojega republikanskega nasprotnika Rutherforda B. Hayesa in 19 elektorskih glasov več. A je Tildnu še vedno manjkal en elektorski glas za potrebno večino (185), 20 elektorskih glasov pa je ostalo nedodeljenih – izid na Floridi, v Louisiani in Južni Karolini je bil pretesen, stranki pa sta druga drugo obtoževali prevar, podkupovanj in ustrahovanja volivcev, medtem ko so v Oregonu enega izmed elektorjev razglasili za nezakonitega in ga zamenjali.

Kriza se je poglabljala in pretila je grožnja nove državljanske vojne. V precedenčni potezi je kongres za končno odločitev vzpostavil 15-člansko komisijo senatorjev, kongresnikov in vrhovnih sodnikov (s sedmimi republikanci, sedmimi demokrati in enim neodvisnim). Tehtnica se je nagnila na Hayesovo stran, ki je prejel 20 elektorskih glasov, s čimer je prišel do potrebnih 185. Potem ko so demokrati zagrozili z blokado uradnega štetja glasov, so kolobocijo razrešili na pogajanjih v hotelu Wormley v Washingtonu februarja 1877, skratka, za zaprtimi vrati, kar je rodilo izraz "zadimljene sobe".

Demokrati so sprejeli Hayesovo zmago pod pogojem, da umakne vse zvezne vojake z juga. Kompromis je utrdil demokratski nadzor nad jugom in s tem de facto naredil konec rekonstrukciji in izničil vse, kar so temnopolti Američani pridobili po državljanski vojni. In desetletja so minila, preden so v kongresu spet razpravljali o državljanskih pravicah.

1912: Kjer se prepirata dva …

Potem ko je zapustil Belo hišo in se odpravil za slabo leto dni na safari v Afriko, je Theodora Roosevelta leta 1912 ponovno potegnilo v predsedniški boj. Njegov tesni prijatelj in naslednik, ki ga je sam izbral, William Howard Taft, je razburil Roosevelta in druge napredne člane republikancev s prestopom v konservativnejšo smer republikancev, je Roosevelt izzval Tafta na strankarskih volitvah. Ker ni prejel nominacije, je s svojimi privrženci ustanovil Napredno stranko.

A drama se je še stopnjevala, ko je med shodom v Wisconsinu blodnjavi fanatik John Schrank ustrelil Roosevelta v prsni koš – a je neuničljivemu Rooseveltu s kroglo v sebi vseeno uspelo dokončati svoj govor. Na koncu sta si Roosevelt in Taft razdelila glasove republikancev ter tako z internim pričkanjem tlakovala pot demokratu Woodrowu Wilsonu v Belo hišo, čeprav v večini držav ni osvojil 50 odstotkov glasov. Roosevelt je pristal na drugem mestu, Taft pa na tretjem, kar je bilo tudi zadnjič na ameriških predsedniških volitvah, da kandidat ene od večjih strank ne bi zmagal ali pristal na drugem mestu.

1920: Kampanja iz zapora

Volitve leta 1920 so bile spopad dveh časopisnih založnikov, a niso bile ravno vznemirljive. Republikanec Warren G. Harding je gladko premagal demokrata Jamesa Coxa in prejel več kot 60 odstotkov glasov volivcev ter 37 od 48 zveznih držav. Bolj zanimivo je bilo, kdo je pristal na tretjem mestu. Slabih sto let pred Berniejem Sandersom je Socialistična stranka Amerike dejansko uživala zmerno podporo, sindikalist Eugene Debs pa se je za predsednika potegoval kar petkrat (1900, 1904, 1908, 1912 in 1920), pri čemer je bil svojo zadnjo kampanjo primoran voditi iz zapora. Za Debsa zapor sicer ni bil nekaj novega – zaporno kazen je služil že leta 1894 v povezavi s stavko železničarjev.

A leta 1918 je ponovno stopil na žulj vladi s svojim protivojnim govorom v Ohiu, v katerem je obsodil "vladajoči razred", ki je poslal delavski razred v vojno. Debs je bil zaradi govora po zakonu o espionaži obsojen na deset let zapora. Protesti zaradi njegove obsodbe so se maja 1919 sprevrgli v izgrede, Debsa pa so premestili v zvezno kaznilnico v Atlanti, kjer je vodil svojo predsedniško kampanjo. Na volitvah mu je uspelo zbrati impresivnih 6 odstotkov glasov, kar pa seveda ni bilo dovolj, da bi resno ogrozil Hardinga. Ta je na božični dan naslednje leto Debsa pomilostil.

1948: Zmagoslavje predsednika, prepričanega o porazu

Izid volitev leta 1948 se je zdel jasen: predsedniku Harryju S. Trumanu je odklenkalo. Na vmesnih volitvah leta 1946 so republikanci prvič v 20 letih osvojili tako predstavniški dom kot senat, po javnomnenjskih anketah pa je Trumana podpirala le še tretjina Američanov. Čeprav je bil republikanski izzivalec, newyorški guverner Thomas Dewey, močen kandidat, je bila Trumanova največja težava opozicija znotraj lastne stranke.

Zaradi zunanje politike administracije do Sovjetske zveze je odstopil njegov minister za trgovino Henry Wallace in kandidiral proti Trumanu kot kandidat napredne stranke, medtem ko je Truman zaradi podpore državljanskih pravic za temnopolte izgubil glasove južnih, konservativnih demokratov, ki so v znak protesta odkorakali s konvencije in oblikovali svojo stranko (t. i. Dixikrati) pod vodstvom guvernerja Južne Karoline Stroma Thurmonda.

Truman je sicer vodil močno in angažirano kampanjo s številnimi predvolilnimi shodi, po zadnji javnomnenjski raziskavi, ki je bila objavljena na volilni dan, a opravljena mesec dni prej, pa je Dewey vodil pred Trumanom za 5 odstotnih točk, zato je šel predsednik zvečer v posteljo, prepričan, da je izgubil, dokler ga niso ob 4.00 zjutraj agentje tajne službe zbudili in mu sporočili, da je dejansko zmagal. Znamenita je fotografija, na kateri radostni Truman drži v rokah jutranjo izdajo časopisa Chicago Tribune, ki je šla zaradi stavke tiskarjev v tisk prej kot običajno. Naslov? Dewey premagal Trumana.

1960: Prva televizijska soočenja

John F. Kennedy je s svojo zmago leta 1960 postavil veliko precedensov. Najmlajši predsednik ZDA, prvi rojen v 20. stoletju in prvi rimskokatoliški predsednik. Spopad med Kennedyjem, relativno neznanim senatorjem, in predsednikom Richardom Nixonom pa je bil tudi prvi s televizijskim soočenjem. Televizija je v ameriških gospodinjstvih postala nepogrešljiva – v primerjavi z letom 1950, ko jo je imelo le 11 odstotkov Američanov, je ta delež narastel na 88 odstotkov. In prav to je pripomoglo mlademu, karizmatičnemu Kennedyju do zmage.

Nixon je še vedno okreval po bolniškem dopustu in je zavračal ličila, zato je bil na kameri videti še toliko bolj bolehen in šibek, prav tako je bil neobrit in v sivi obleki, ki se je zlila z ozadjem. Kennedy je bil po drugi strani zagorel ter je z modro obleko izstopal iz studijskega ozadja. V nasprotju z Nixonom je gledal naravnost v kamero, ko je govoril. Okoli 70 milijonov Američanov, ki so spremljali prvo od štirih televizijskih soočenj, je za zmagovalca proglasilo Kennedyja, precej manjši delež tistih, ki so soočenje spremljali po radijskih sprejemnikih, pa je menilo, da se je bolje odrezal Nixon.

Na dan volitev 8. novembra je Kennedy ugnal Nixona za pičlih 119.000 glasov (od skoraj 69 milijonov). Zgodovinarji sicer ne morejo z gotovostjo trditi, da je bilo prav soočenje odločilno za Kennedyjevo zmago, priznavajo pa, da je spremenilo podobo kampanj. Zaradi televizijskih soočenj sta podoba in videz postala ključnega pomena, kar je za nekatere kandidate predstavljalo tako veliko stisko, da je trajalo nadaljnjih 16 let, preden je kak predsedniški kandidat vnovič privolil vanjo.

1964: Ko je rasa stopila v ospredje volitev

Volitve leta 1964 so se med drugim vpisale v zgodovino tudi po zloglasnem oglasu z marjetico, poskusom prikazati republikanca Barryja Goldwaterja preveč lahkomiselnega, da bi bil lahko zadolžen za upravljanje jedrskega orožja. Tisto poletje je tudi prineslo zakon o državljanskih pravicah, kar je nastrojene belce na jugu pognalo na ulice, zaradi policijskega nasilja pa so v New Yorku, Philadelphii in Chicagu protestirali temnopolti.

Na koncu za izid volitev ni odločalo vprašanje, kdo je bolj sposoben za predsedniški položaj, Goldwater ali takratni predsednik Lyndon Johnson, ampak rasa. Johnson, ki je bil za zmago prisiljen sprejeti vrsto kompromisov, je razburil številne na jugu, ko je za svojega podpredsednika izbral Huberta Humphreyja, gorečega borca za državljanske pravice. Ampak nazadnje je zmagal gladko, Goldwater pa je osvojil le peščico držav, ostaja pa jug do danes v veliki večini republikanska trdnjava.

1972: Podpredsedniški kandidat s terapijo elektrošokov

Potem ko si je senator iz Južne Dakote George McGovern zagotovil nominacijo demokratske stranke za predsednika, se je moral naglo odločiti za podpredsednika. Vrsta bolj zvenečih demokratskih imen je položaj zavrnila, zato je McGovern v dve minuti dolgem telefonskem klicu izbral senatorja iz Misurija Thomasa Eagletona, za katerega je upal, da mu bo prinesel glasove katoličanov. A zaradi naglice Eagleton nikdar ni bil ustrezno preverjen, sicer bi McGovern vedel, da je bil trikrat hospitaliziran zaradi depresije in dvakrat prestal terapijo z elektrošoki.

Ko je zadeva prišla na dan, je McGovern sprva stal ob strani svojemu kandidatu, a je nazadnje uvidel, da mu predstavlja preveliko tveganje. Med novinarsko konferenco v narodnem parku v Južni Dakoti, kjer naj bi bil McGovern na oddihu, ne pa na kampanji, je Eagleton novinarjem razkril svoje zdravstvene težave. 1. avgusta, le 18 dni potem, ko je bil izbran za podpredsedniškega kandidata, je izstopil iz tekme, McGoverna pa je gladko povozil Richard Nixon z zmagami v 49 državah in za 18 milijonov glasov, zato se še danes kandidati bojijo, koga izbrati za svojega podpredsednika.

2000: Ko je o zmagi odločala Florida – in vrhovno sodišče

Vsi se še spomnimo volitev leta 2000, ki so se vlekle v neskončnost ter na katerih sta se za zmago udarila takratni podpredsednik Al Gore in republikanski izzivalec, teksaški guverner George W. Bush. Izid je bil tako tesen, da je nazadnje o njem odločala Florida, katere guverner je bil takrat Bushev brat Jeb Bush. TV-postaje so to zvezno državo sprva pripisale Goru, nato poročale, da je izid pretesen, nazadnje pa jo dodelile Bushu. Gore je poklical Busha in mu čestital, a nato poklical nazaj in predajo preklical. Kandidata je ločevalo le 327 glasov (od 6 milijonov), zato so se začele tožbe, razgreto pričkanje o volilnih nepravilnostih, napačno preluknjanih glasovnicah in ponovno štetje glasov. 21. novembra je floridsko vrhovno sodišče odredilo ročno ponovno štetje glasov v štirih okrožjih, vključno z najbolj poseljenim Miami-Dadom.

Protestniki, ki jih je časopis The Wall Street Journal opisal kot "50-letne bele odvetnike z mobilnimi telefoni in Hermesovimi kravatami", so se zgrnili nad volilne urade Miamija in zahtevali ustavitev ponovnega štetja, kar se je nazadnje tudi zgodilo.

Po petih mukotrpnih tednih je nazadnje o predsedniku odločalo vrhovno sodišče, ki je s tesno večino (5 proti 4, pri čemer je bilo vseh pet sodnikov republikanskih) ustavilo ponovno štetje več 10.000 glasovnic na Floridi. Bush, ki je osvojil 30 zveznih držav (vključno s Florido) in vodil za le pet elektorskih glasov, je postal prvi kandidat v 112 letih, ki je osvojil Belo hišo, ne da bi dobil tudi večino glasov volivcev.

Vrhovni sodnik John Paul Stevens je takole podal svoje ločeno mnenje: "Čeprav morda nikoli ne bomo s popolno gotovostjo vedeli identitete zmagovalca letošnjih predsedniških volitev, pa je identiteta poraženca popolnoma jasna. To je zaupanje državljanov v sodnike kot nepristranske varuhe zakona prava.”

2016: Trump Clintonovi preprečil pisanje zgodovine

Volilni obračun med Bushem in Gorom je bil prvi v moderni zgodovini, da je kandidat zmagal, čeprav ni osvojil večine glasov volivcev, ne pa tudi zadnjič. Zgodba se je ponovila leta 2016, ko je nepremičninski magnat in voditelj resničnostnega šova Donald Trump brez vsakršnih izkušenj na izvoljenem političnem položaju ugnal nekdanjo prvo damo, senatorko in državno sekretarko Hillary Rodham Clinton, o zmagi katere so bili prepričani vsi in je tudi prejela tri milijone več glasov od Trumpa. Trump je kampanjo vodil na populizmu in postregel z vrsto precej nezaslišanih in spornih izjav, pri čemer je bil še posebej radikalen, ko je šlo za priseljevanje.

Med drugim je pozval k popolni prepovedi vstopa muslimanov v ZDA, mehiške priseljence pa označil za tiste, ki prinašajo v državo kriminal, mamila in posilstva. Čeprav je Trump zaostajal za Clintonovo po vseh anketah, mu je uspelo osvojiti dovolj ključnih zveznih držav na krilih glasov delavskega razreda in tako osvojiti dovolj elektorskih glasov. Prisegel je 20. januarja 2017, že naslednji dan pa je proti novi administraciji protestiralo pet milijonov ljudi po vsej državi.

From the fight to the Supreme Court's intervention: The history of the craziest election in the United States

This year's presidential election isn't the first unpredictable in the United States.

With all the ups and downs and dramatic events, it seems that this year's US presidential election is by far the most unpredictable, but Americans have had quite a bit of drama in the past.

As early as mid-July, the election seemed to be virtually decided  ⁇  Joe Biden, with already low support, had collapsed so deeply after a defeated confrontation that the road to the White House was wide open to Donald Trump.

And that's despite all the legal proceedings. After surviving the assassination attempt, he seemed for a moment actually indestructible.

But under pressure from donors and Democratic Party giants, the wheels on the Democratic side began to spin faster than most media could have ever watched.

On July 21, Biden, who had assured himself a few days earlier that he was not going anywhere, announced his withdrawal from the race, and even before Democrats could begin the debate on a new candidate, Biden had already backed his vice president Kamala Harris for his replacement.

Harris, by then one of the least popular vice presidents in recent history, immediately raised a record amount of campaign funds and took the lead over Trump. But nothing has been decided yet, and by November 5th, anything else seems to be possible.

But these aren't the first dramatic elections in the United States. We've collected something more unusual and unpredictable.

The Commission has also examined the possible implications of the measures in the case of the newly created companies.

1800: Elections that ended in a fateful duel

In the 1800s, parties were still being formed in the United States, there was no "election day" as we know it today, and the electoral system was quite different and (still) much more confusing than today. Each electorate voted for two candidates, and the one with the most votes became the President and the second-ranked Vice-President. Under this system, due to a communication error between Republican and Democratic voters, the first place was split between Thomas Jefferson and his vice presidential candidate Aaron Burr, and the third place was taken by then-President John Adams, a member of the rival Federalist Party.

This was the first of only two instances in the history of the American elections that a president was chosen by the House of Representatives. The key figure was Alexander Hamilton, the first U.S. Treasury Secretary to lobby his Federalists to support Jefferson. Although Hamilton and Jefferson despised each other, Hamilton felt "less than three cells" and a safer choice than Burr, who he claimed was in love with himself and cared only for himself. After a close vote in the White House, Jefferson moved in, Burr became vice president, and the Constitution added Article 12, which explicitly states that voters vote separately for president and vice president.

But the rivalry between Burr and Hamilton continued for three years after the election until Burr, still the current vice president, challenged Hamilton to a duel on July 11, 1804 and shot him in the stomach. He died the next day, at the age of 48.

1824: No presidency despite a majority of votes cast by the electorate

By 1824, the Federalist Party had virtually dissolved and all four presidential candidates were Democratic-Republican. Senator Andrew Jackson, a war hero of the U.S.-British War of 1812, won the popular vote by just 39,000 votes, 99 electoral votes. Secretary of State John Quincy Adams received 84 electoral votes, Treasury Secretary William Crawford 41, and Speaker of the House Henry Clay 37.

Since none of the candidates received a majority of the votes, the winner was re-elected by the House of Representatives, and Jackson was convinced he had a win in his pocket. Since the House of Representatives could only choose from three candidates, Clay was defeated, and after a month of negotiations behind closed doors, most of Clay's supporters supported Adams, who won a majority of the House of Representatives. Although he lost both the popular vote and the electorate, Adams became the sixth president of the United States.

When Adams elected Clay as his secretary of state, an angry Jackson called the deal a "corrupt deal", gave up his Senate seat, and vowed to return in 1828 and win, which he did, the leadership of the new Democratic Party, defeating Adams, then the leader of the Republicans, by a landslide. But Adams never really enjoyed his presidency, and he called his tenure in the White House "the four most miserable years of his life". - What's the reason? Every step of the way, Jackson and his followers were harassing him. After leaving the White House, Adams served as the only former president to serve another 17 years in Congress.

1860: Elections that split the nation in half

The presidential election of 1860 was not only extremely controversial, but it also completely disrupted the United States. At the heart of the issue was slavery. Republicans were largely opposed to slavery, but were not the most inclined to enforce prohibitions on slavery in the federal states that already had it. The Democrats, on the other hand, have failed to agree on this issue. Abraham Lincoln, the Republican nominee and anti-slavery man, was not on the ballot in most Southern states.

The Democrats chose Lincoln's Illinois running mate, Senator Stephen Douglas, as their candidate, but the southern party split in protest and chose then-Vice President John Breckenridge, eventually claiming to be the official Democratic candidate. And here was Senator John Bell of Tennessee, a candidate for the new Constitutional Union Party, who ignored the issue of slavery completely. Lincoln received only 40 percent of the vote, but the majority of the electorate in the North, California and Oregon, was enough for a fairly smooth victory. Breckenridge won the majority of the electorate in the South, in Maryland and Delaware, Bell won Tennessee, Kentucky and Virginia, and Douglas won only Missouri, although he was second in votes.

Elections, also marked by record turnout and Lincoln's victory, changed the face of the United States, splitting the then dominant Democratic Party and the country in half. Just weeks after Lincoln won, South Carolina voted to secede. Six other Southern states followed, forming the Confederate States of America in 1861 with Jefferson Davis as president.

1872: Death of the candidate

The year 1872 was marked by several breakthrough candidates: Suffragette Victoria Woodhull of the People's Party became the first woman to run for president, and her vice presidential candidate, writer and abolitionist Frederick Douglass, the first African American vice presidential candidate. But the election that year really marked the death of one of the candidates, Horace Greeley. Although Greeley was not credited with much potential in the fight against then-Republican President Ulysses S. Grant, the split in the Republican Party has shrouded matters in secrecy. Grant, who led the Union army that defeated the Confederacy, as president was not exactly the most persuasive.

Some Republicans therefore switched between liberal Republicans and cast their vote for Greeley, a Democrat and founder of the New York Tribune, who ultimately received 44 percent of the vote, despite interrupting his campaign to care for his sick wife, who died a week before the election. But before the voters could cast their ballots, Greeley died, and 63 of his 66 electoral votes were divided between Thomas Hendricks, who later became vice president, and other Democrats, and Grant bowed to the contest by attending the funeral.

1876: Elections resolved in a "closed room"

In the election of 1876, New York's Democratic governor Samuel Tilden received 250,000 more votes than his Republican opponent, Rutherford B. Hayes, and 19 more electoral votes. But Tildna still lacked one electoral vote for the required majority (185), and 20 electoral votes remained unshared. The result was overwhelming in Florida, Louisiana and South Carolina, and parties accused each other of fraud, bribery, and intimidation of voters, while Oregon declared one of the voters illegal and replaced him.

The crisis was deepening and the threat of a new civil war loomed. In a previous move, Congress established a 15-member committee of senators, congressmen and supreme judges (with seven Republicans, seven Democrats, and one independent) to make a final decision. The balance sheet leaned to Hayes' side, receiving 20 electoral votes, bringing the required 185 to the table. After the Democrats threatened to block the official vote count, the collapse was resolved in negotiations at the Wormley Hotel in Washington in February 1877, briefly behind closed doors, giving rise to the term "closed rooms".

The Democrats accepted Hayes' victory on the condition that he withdraw all federal troops from the South. The compromise consolidated democratic control over the South, effectively ending reconstruction and destroying all that black Americans gained after the Civil War. And decades passed before Congress debated civil rights again.

1912: Where two...

After leaving the White House and embarking on a year-long safari to Africa, Theodore Roosevelt was drawn back into the presidential race in 1912. His close friend and successor, his own-elected William Howard Taft, upset Roosevelt and other advanced members of the Republican Party by moving in a more conservative direction toward the Republicans, Roosevelt challenged Taft in the party election. Since he did not receive the nomination, he and his followers formed the Progressive Party.

But the drama was heightened when, during a meeting in Wisconsin, the rogue fanatic John Schrank shot Roosevelt in the chest. But the indestructible Roosevelt with a bullet in his pocket still managed to finish his speech. In the end, Roosevelt and Taft split the Republican vote, and internally, they pushed Democratic Woodrow Wilson into the White House, although he did not win 50 percent of the vote in most states. Roosevelt came in second, and Taft came in third, which was also the last time in the U.S. presidential election that a candidate from one of the major parties would not win or run for second.

1920: Prison campaign

The 1920 election was a clash between two newspaper publishers, but it wasn't exactly exciting. Republican Warren G. Harding defeated Democrat James Cox by a landslide, receiving more than 60 percent of the vote and 37 of the 48 federal states. It was more interesting to see who landed third. In the few hundred years before Bernie Sanders, the Socialist Party of America actually enjoyed moderate support, and unionist Eugene Debs ran for president only five times (1900, 1904, 1908, 1912 and 1920), forcing his last campaign out of prison. Debs's prison was nothing new. He was serving a prison sentence in 1894 in connection with a railroad strike.

But in 1918 he again stepped on the government's shoulders with his antiwar speech in Ohio, condemning the "ruling class" that sent the working class to war. Debs was sentenced to 10 years in prison for spying. In May 1919, protests over his conviction turned to a scandal, and Debs was transferred to the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary, where he led his presidential campaign. He managed to collect an impressive 6 percent of the vote in the election, which, of course, was not enough to seriously threaten Harding. This one, on Christmas Day next year, he spared Debs.

1948: The vote of the president, convinced of defeat

The outcome of the 1948 election seemed clear: President Harry S. Truman was unlocked. In the midterm elections of 1946, Republicans won both the House and Senate for the first time in 20 years, and in public opinion polls, only a third of Americans supported Truman. Although a Republican challenger, New York Governor Thomas Dewey, was a strong candidate, Truman's biggest problem was opposition within his own party.

Because of the administration's foreign policy toward the Soviet Union, its Secretary of Commerce, Henry Wallace, resigned and ran against Truman as a candidate of the Progressive Party, while Truman lost the votes of Southern, conservative Democrats who protested by withdrawing from the convention and forming their party (the Dictators) under South Carolina Governor Wood Thurmond.

Truman led a strong and engaged campaign with numerous elections, after the last public opinion poll published on election day but conducted a month earlier, and Dewey led Truman by 5 percentage points, so the president went to bed that evening convinced he had lost until he was awakened at 4 a.m. by secret service agents and told he had actually won. A famous photograph of Truman holding the morning edition of the Chicago Tribune, which went to press earlier than usual because of the press strike. What's the address? Dewey beat Truman.

1960: First televised confrontations

John F. Kennedy set a great precedent with his victory in 1960. The youngest president of the United States, the first born in the 20th century and the first Roman Catholic president. The confrontation between Kennedy, a relatively unknown senator, and President Richard Nixon was also the first televised confrontation. Television has become indispensable in American households  ⁇  Compared with only 11 percent of Americans in 1950, this figure has risen to 88 percent. And that's what helped the young, charismatic Kennedy win.

Nixon was still recovering from his hospital leave and refusing to wear makeup, so he was even more painful and weak on camera, and he was also uncluttered and in a gray suit that was wrapped around the back. Kennedy, on the other hand, was burned and came out of the studio in a blue suit. Unlike Nixon, he was looking straight at the camera when he was speaking. About 70 million Americans who watched the first of the four televised confrontations voted Kennedy the winner, while a much smaller proportion of those who watched the confrontations on radio thought Nixon had done better.

On November 8, Kennedy defeated Nixon by a staggering 119,000 votes (out of nearly 69 million). While historians cannot say with certainty that the confrontation was decisive for Kennedy's victory, they do acknowledge that it changed the face of the campaign. The television confrontations have made appearance a key issue, and some candidates have been so pressured that it took another 16 years for a presidential candidate to reappoint them.

1964: When race came to the fore in the election

The 1964 election also made history after the infamous majority vote, an attempt to portray Republican Barry Goldwater as too easy-going to be charged with nuclear weapons management. That summer, the Civil Rights Act was passed, driving white Southerners into the streets, and police violence led to black protest in New York, Philadelphia, and Chicago.

In the end, the outcome of the election was not decided by who was more qualified for the presidency, Goldwater or then-President Lyndon Johnson, but by race. Johnson, forced to make a series of compromises to win, upset many in the South by choosing Hubert Humphrey, a passionate civil rights fighter, as his vice president. But in the end, he won smoothly, and Goldwater conquered only a handful of states, and it remains south to this day in the vast majority of Republican fortresses.

1972: Vice-President candidate with electroconvulsive therapy

After South Dakota Senator George McGovern secured the Democratic nomination for president, he had to make an urgent decision to run for vice president. A kind of more vocal Democratic name turned down the position, so McGovern in a two-minute long phone call elected Missouri Senator Thomas Eagleton, who he hoped would bring him the votes of Catholics. But because of the urgency, Eagleton was never properly checked, otherwise McGovern would know that he had been hospitalized three times for depression and had been given two electroconvulsive treatments.

When the matter came to light, McGovern initially sided with his candidate, but he eventually realized that he posed too much of a risk. During a news conference at South Dakota National Park, where McGovern was supposed to be on vacation, not on the campaign trail, Eagleton revealed his health problems to reporters. On August 1, just 18 days after being elected vice presidential candidate, he dropped out of the race, and McGovern was easily defeated by Richard Nixon with 49 states and 18 million votes, making candidates still afraid to choose who their vice president.

2000: When Florida won the case  ⁇  and the Supreme Court

We all remember the election of 2000, which dragged on indefinitely, and was won by then-Vice President Al Gore and the Republican challenger, Texas Governor George W. Bush. The outcome was so close that it was ultimately decided by Florida, whose governor at the time was Bush's brother Jeb Bush. TV stations first attributed this federal state to Gore, then reported the outcome was overwhelming, and finally assigned it to Bush. Mountain called Bush and congratulated him, but then called back and called off the surrender. The candidate received only 327 votes (out of 6 million), so lawsuits were launched, allegations of electoral irregularities were made, ballots were misplaced and the vote was counted again. On November 21, the Florida Supreme Court ordered a manual recount of votes in four counties, including the most populous of Miami-Dade counties.

Protesters, described by The Wall Street Journal as "50-year-old white lawyers with cell phones and Hermes ties", turned up at the Miami polls and demanded a halt to the recount, which was the last thing that happened.

After five painful weeks, the Supreme Court finally decided on the president, who by a narrow majority (5 to 4, with all five judges being Republicans) stopped the recount of more than 10,000 votes in Florida. Bush, who won 30 states (including Florida) and led by only five electoral votes, became the first candidate in 112 years to win the White House without a majority of the vote.

Chief Justice John Paul Stevens expressed his distinct opinion: "While we may never know with complete certainty the identity of the winner of this year's presidential election, the identity of the loser is perfectly clear. This is the citizens' trust in judges as impartial guardians of the rule of law. ⁇ 

2016: Trump blocks the Clintons from writing history

The Bush-Gore election was the first in modern history that a candidate won, even though he didn't win a majority of the votes, not even the last time. The story repeated in 2016, when real estate mogul and reality show host Donald Trump, with no experience in elected political office, defamed former First Lady Senator and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, who was convinced of a win and also received three million more votes than Trump. Trump has led the campaign on populism and has responded with a series of rather unheard and controversial statements, especially radical when it comes to immigration.

Among other things, he called for a complete ban on Muslims entering the United States and labeled Mexican immigrants as those who bring crime, drugs and rape into the country. Although Trump lagged behind Clinton in all polls, he managed to win enough key states on the working class ballot and thus enough electoral votes. He was sworn in on January 20, 2017, and the next day, five million people across the country protested against the new administration.

Starmer in Biden Ukrajini nista prižgala zelene luči za uporabo raket dolgega dosega

Biden je dejal, da ne razmišlja veliko o Putinu

Ameriški predsednik Joe Biden in britanski premier Keir Starmer po petkovem srečanju v Beli hiši Ukrajini nista odobrila uporabe zahodnega orožja dolgega dosega za napade na cilje v notranjosti Rusije.

Voditelja ZDA in Velike Britanije sta se srečala v času, ko si Kijev močno prizadeva za dovoljenje za uporabo orožja dolgega dosega. Ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin je sicer v četrtek dejal, da bi dovoljenje Ukrajini pomenilo, da je Nato sprožil vojno proti Rusiji.

Britanski premier Keir Starmer po pogovorih z ameriškim predsednikom Joejem Bidnom v Washingtonu ni sporočil nobene odločitve glede dovoljenja Ukrajini, da z raketami dolgega dosega napade cilje v Rusiji.

Na vprašanje, ali je prepričal Bidna, naj Ukrajini dovoli izstreljevanje britanskih raket dolgega dosega storm shadow v Rusijo, je Keir odgovoril le, da sta imela z ameriškim predsednikom "dolgo in produktivno razpravo na številnih področjih, vključno z Ukrajino, Bližnjim vzhodom in indijsko-pacifiško regijo", navaja BBC. 

Ameriški mediji namreč ugibajo, da je Biden pripravljen Ukrajini dovoliti uporabo britanskih raket storm shadow in podobnega francoskega streliva z uporabo ameriške tehnologije, ne pa tudi samih raket ATACMS ameriške izdelave.

"Najprej Ukrajina – rad bi se vam zahvalil za vodilno vlogo na tem področju. ZDA so zavezane, da bodo skupaj z vami pomagale Ukrajini pri obrambi pred rusko agresijo. Jasno je, da Putin v tej vojni ne bo zmagal. Prevladalo bo ukrajinsko ljudstvo," je Starmerju povedal Biden.

Bela hiša je po sestanku sporočila, da sta voditelja znova potrdila svojo neomajno podporo Ukrajini, izrazila globoko zaskrbljenost zaradi oskrbe Rusije z orožjem iz Irana in Severne Koreje ter zaradi podpore Kitajske ruski obrambni industrijski bazi.

Starmer je dejal, da bodo naslednji tedni in meseci ključni za podporo Ukrajini v njenem boju za svobodo, veseli pa se tudi pogovorov o Bližnjem vzhodu in drugih delih sveta. "Pri teh globalnih vprašanjih imamo skupne cilje, zato je za nas zelo pomembno, da se pogovorimo tudi o širši strategiji," je dejal.

Poudarila sta trdno zavezo varnosti Izraela, nujnost dogovora o prekinitvi ognja v Gazi, ki bo osvobodil talce in omogočil večjo pomoč, ter da mora Izrael storiti več za zaščito civilistov in reševanje težkih humanitarnih razmer v palestinski enklavi.

Obsodila sta napade hutijevcev, ki jih podpira Iran, na ladje v Rdečem morju in razpravljala o sodelovanju na področju čiste energije in naprednih tehnologij, o programu AUKUS ter priložnostih za poglobitev gospodarskih vezi.

Rusija in Ukrajina izmenjali 206 vojnih ujetnikov

Rusija in Ukrajina sta izmenjali vsaka po 103 vojne ujetnike, so sporočile oblasti v Moskvi. Med njimi so tudi ruski vojaki, zajeti med ukrajinsko ofenzivo v ruski obmejni Kurski oblasti.

Po navedbah ruskega obrambnega ministrstva so v pogajanjih posredovali Združeni arabski emirati.

"Ob koncu pogajalskega procesa so z ozemlja, ki ga nadzoruje kijevski režim, vrnili 103 ruske vojake, ki so bili ujeti v Kurski oblasti. V zameno so bili izročeni 103 vojni ujetniki ukrajinskih oboroženih sil," je sporočilo rusko obrambno ministrstvo.

Vsi izmenjani ruski vojaki so trenutno v Belorusiji, kjer jim je zagotovljena psihološka in medicinsko pomoč, so sporočili v Moskvi.
2024-09-14.title: Starmer in Biden Ukrajini nista prižgala zelene luči za uporabo raket dolgega dosega
2024-09-14.english_content:
Starmer and Biden have not turned on the green light for long-range missiles in Ukraine.

Biden said he doesn't think much of Putin.

US President Joe Biden and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer have not approved the use of Western long-range weapons to attack targets inside Russia after a meeting in the White House in Ukraine on Friday.

The leaders of the United States and the United Kingdom met at a time when Kiev is struggling to get a long-range weapons permit. Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that allowing Ukraine would mean that NATO had launched war on Russia.

UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, after talks with US President Joe Biden in Washington, did not announce any decision on allowing Ukraine to launch long-range missiles against targets in Russia.

Asked if he persuaded Bidny to allow Ukraine to launch British long-range storm shadow missiles into Russia, Keir said they had "long and productive discussions with the US president on a number of areas, including Ukraine, the Middle East and the Indo-Pacific region", reports the BBC.

The US media speculates that Biden is willing to allow Ukraine to use British storm shadow missiles and similar French missiles using US technology, not even US-made ATACMS missiles.

"First of all, Ukraine  ⁇  would like to thank you for your leading role in this area. The United States is committed to helping Ukraine with you in defending against Russian aggression. It's clear that Putin will not win this war. The Ukrainian people will prevail", Biden told the Starmer.

The White House said after the meeting that the leaders reaffirmed their unwavering support for Ukraine, expressed deep concern over Russia's supply of Iranian and North Korean weapons and support for China's Russian defense industrial base.

Starmer said the coming weeks and months will be crucial to supporting Ukraine in its fight for freedom, but he also looked forward to talks on the Middle East and other parts of the world. "We have common goals on these global issues, so it is very important for us to also discuss a broader strategy", he said.

They stressed Israel's strong security commitment, the need for a ceasefire in Gaza that would free hostages and provide more assistance, and that Israel must do more to protect civilians and resolve the dire humanitarian situation in the Palestinian enclave.

They condemned the attacks by the Iranian-backed Houthis on ships in the Red Sea and discussed cooperation in the field of clean energy and advanced technologies, the AUKUS programme and opportunities for deepening economic ties.

Russia and Ukraine exchanged 206 prisoners of war

Russia and Ukraine exchanged 103 prisoners of war each, Moscow authorities said. Among them are Russian soldiers captured during the Ukrainian offensive on the Russian border with the Kursk authorities.

According to the Russian Ministry of Defence, the United Arab Emirates was the mediator in the negotiations.

"At the end of the negotiation process, 103 Russian troops captured by the Kursk authorities were returned from the territory controlled by the Kiev regime. In return, 103 prisoners of war of the Ukrainian armed forces were handed over", the Russian Defense Ministry said.

All Russian troops exchanged are currently in Belarus, where they are being provided psychological and medical assistance, Moscow said.
2024-09-14.english_title: Starmer and Biden have not turned on the green light for long-range missiles in Ukraine.

Vučić: Zahtevamo vrnitev v stanje pred enostranskimi potezami kosovskih oblasti

Vučić zahteva svobodne volitve, vrnitev srbskih funkcionarjev na položaje ter oblikovanje zveze srbskih občin na Kosovu

Srbski predsednik Aleksandar Vučić je predstavil ukrepe zaradi nedavnih napetosti na severu Kosova. Napovedal je, da bodo Kosovo v naslednjih 45 dneh razglasili za območje s "posebno socialno zaščito".

Vučić se je zavzel za svobodne in pravične volitve, vrnitev srbskih policistov, sodnikov in tožilcev na položaje in oblikovanje zveze srbskih občin na Kosovu.

"Srbija je trenutno v težkem pravnem in političnem položaju glede Kosova. Gospodarsko napredujemo zelo hitro, zelo dobro, morda celo odlično, kar pa ostaja naša najbolj boleča in najtežja točka, je nedvomno Kosovo," je v petkovem nagovoru javnosti dejal Vučić, poroča srbski portal N1.

"Ni rešitve za kosovsko vprašanje, ki bi zadovoljila Srbe," je dodal, pri tem pa se je zavzel za "vrnitev v stanje pred enostranskimi potezami kosovskih oblasti".

Med ukrepi je med drugim naštel zahtevo po razpisu svobodnih volitev v kosovske institucije, upoštevanje 9. člena Bruseljskega sporazuma in vrnitev Srbov v policijo ter vrnitev srbskih sodnikov in tožilcev na položaje na Kosovu.

Vučić je ob tem napovedal, da bo "v naslednjih 45 dneh sprejet zakon, ki bo avtonomno pokrajino Kosovo in Metohija razglasil za območje s posebno socialno zaščito", s čimer bo med drugim zagotovljena finančna podpora Srbom na Kosovu, ki so izgubili službe. Po njegovih besedah bodo približno 5000 brezposelnim zagotovili približno 20.000 dinarjev (170 evrov) na mesec ter brezplačne učbenike za otroke v osnovnih in srednjih šolah.

O dialogu s Prištino je srbski predsednik dejal, da je pripravljen na pogovore v Bruslju, vendar "ne bo privolil v pregon srbskega prebivalstva", kar je po njegovem mnenju cilj kosovskih oblasti pod vodstvom premierja Albina Kurtija.

Vodja kosovske pogajalske skupine Prištine Besnik Bislimi je danes na družbenem omrežju X sporočil, da bo naslednji krog dialoga med Beogradom in Prištino na tehnični ravni potekal prihodnji torek v Bruslju.
2024-09-13.title: Vučić: Zahtevamo vrnitev v stanje pred enostranskimi potezami kosovskih oblasti
2024-09-13.english_content:
Vučić: We demand a return to the status quo before the unilateral moves of the Kosovo authorities

Vucic calls for free elections, return of Serb officials to office and formation of a union of Serb municipalities in Kosovo

Serbian President Aleksandar Vučić has presented measures to address recent tensions in northern Kosovo. He predicted that Kosovo would be declared a "special social protection" area within the next 45 days.

Vucic was committed to free and fair elections, the return of Serbian police, judges and prosecutors to office, and the formation of a union of Serbian municipalities in Kosovo.

"Serbia is currently in a difficult legal and political situation regarding Kosovo. We are progressing very quickly, very well, perhaps even very well, but what remains our most painful and difficult point is undoubtedly Kosovo", Vučić said in a public address on Friday, reports the Serbian N1 portal.

"There is no solution to the Kosovo issue that would satisfy Serbs", he added, while promoting a "return to the status quo before the unilateral moves of the Kosovo authorities".

The measures included the request for free elections to Kosovo institutions, the compliance with Article 9 of the Brussels Agreement and the return of Serbs to the police and the return of Serbian judges and prosecutors to Kosovo.

Vučić announced that "a law will be adopted in the next 45 days to declare the autonomous province of Kosovo and Metohija a special social protection area", which would provide financial support amongst others to the Serbs in Kosovo who have lost their jobs. According to him, about 5,000 unemployed people will be provided with about 20,000 dinars (€170) a month and free textbooks for primary and secondary school children.

Regarding the dialogue with Pristina, the Serbian President said that he was ready for talks in Brussels but would "not allow the persecution of the Serb population", which he considered the objective of the Kosovo authorities under Prime Minister Albin Kurti.

Besnik Bislimi, head of the Kosovo Pristina negotiating group, announced on social network X today that the next round of dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina at the technical level will take place next Tuesday in Brussels.
2024-09-13.english_title: Vučić: We demand a return to the status quo before the unilateral moves of the Kosovo authorities

Na Hrvaškem odprli drugo cev predora Učka

Vrednost gradbenih del v 5630 metrov dolgi cevi je ocenjena na okoli 200 milijonov evrov

Na Hrvaškem so odprli drugo cev predora Učka. Tretji najdaljši predor v državi povezuje Kvarner in Istro ter je del istrskega ipsilona, ki ga bodo predvidoma končali do konca leta 2026.

Odprtja druge cevi predora se je udeležil državni vrh s predsednikom vlade Andrejem Plenkovićem na čelu. Plenković je današnji dan označil kot velik dan za Istro, Kvarner in Hrvaško, predor pa je blagoslovil tudi puljski in poreški škof Ivan Štironja.

Predor upravlja avtocestno podjetje Bina Istra. Direktor Dario Silić je ob odprtju povedal, da so za prebijanje cevi uporabili več kot 1000 ton tekočega eksploziva in izkopali za 1,3 milijona ton materiala, pri gradnji pa porabili 6000 ton jekla, kar je podobno količini jekla, vgrajenega v Eifflov stolp v Parizu.

"Nova cev predora Učka, dolga 5,6 kilometra, bo ena najmodernejših v Evropi," je dejal Silić. Doslej je dvosmerni promet potekal skozi eno cev tega predora, ki so jo za promet odprli leta 1981. Kot je dejal Silić, bodo to cev čez približno deset dni zaprli zaradi obnove. Dela bodo potekala od konca septembra do maja prihodnje leto, je pojasnil in dodal, da cestnine zaradi nove cevi ne bodo zviševali.

Damir Antić, gasilski poveljnik pri avtocestnem podjetju Bina Istra, je dejal, da bo med obema cevema 24 prečnih predorov za evakuacijo potnikov. Tretji najdaljši predor na Hrvaškem je opremljen z videonadzorom, ko pa bosta prihodnje poletje odprti obe cevi, bo po njima bistveno hitreje stekel promet.

Predor Učka je eden  najpomembnejših infrastrukturnih objektov na Hrvaškem. Je tretji najdaljši predor v državi, daljša sta Mala Kapela s 5821 metri in Sv. Rok s 5679 metri dolžine.Na istrskem ipsilonu se odvija približno tretjina turističnega prometa. Skozi predor Učka vsak dan zapelje okoli 14.000 vozil, v poletnih mesecih pa približno 18.000.

Dela v drugi cevi predora Učka so stala 200 milijonov evrov.

Projekt dograditve vzhodnega kraka istrskega ipsilona ima tri faze – avtocesto od Pazina do predora Učka, ureditev avtoceste od predora do Matuljev ter drugo cev predora. Dela so se začela leta 2016, projekt pa je skupno ocenjen na 570 milijonov evrov. Vsi posegi bodo predvidoma končani do konca leta 2026.

Z avtocesto do Matuljev bo pot od Zagreba do Pulja skrajšana na le dve uri in pol.
2024-09-13.title: Na Hrvaškem odprli drugo cev predora Učka

In Croatia, they opened the second tunnel of the Wolf

The value of the construction of the 5,630-meter-long pipeline is estimated at about 200 million euros

They've opened the second tunnel of the Woolf tunnel in Croatia. The third longest tunnel in the country connects Kvarner and Istra and is part of the Istrian Ipsilon projected to be completed by the end of 2026.

The opening of the second tunnel was attended by the State Summit, headed by Prime Minister Andrey Plenkovic. Plenković declared today a big day for Istra, Kvarner and Croatia, and the tunnel was also blessed by the Polish and the tax bishop Ivan Štironja.

The tunnel is operated by the motorway company Bina Istra. Director Dario Silić said at the opening that more than 1,000 tons of liquid explosives were used to drill the pipes and 1.3 million tons of material were excavated, and 6,000 tons of steel were used to build the pipes, which is similar to the amount of steel built in the Eiffel Tower in Paris.

"The new Učka tunnel, 5.6 kilometres long, will be one of the most modern in Europe", said Silić. Up to now, two-way traffic has been flowing through one of the tunnels, which opened to traffic in 1981. As Silić said, the pipeline will be closed in about 10 days for renovation. The work will take place from the end of September to May next year, he explained, adding that tariffs will not be raised because of the new pipeline.

Damir Antić, fire chief at the Bin Istra motorway company, said that 24 passenger evacuation tunnels will be built between the two pipes. The third longest tunnel in Croatia is equipped with video surveillance, but when both pipes open next summer, traffic will be significantly faster.

The Učka Tunnel is one of the most important infrastructure projects in Croatia. It is the third longest tunnel in the country, the longest being the Little Chapel at 5,821 meters and the St. Rock at 5,679 meters. The Ipsilon is the main source of tourist traffic. The Wolf is carrying about 14,000 vehicles a day through the tunnel, and about 18,000 during the summer months.

Work on the second tunnel of the Utica tunnel cost 200 million euros.

The project to repair the eastern branch of the Ipsilon Istrskaya has three phases: the highway from Pazin to Učka tunnel, the highway from the tunnel to Matuljev and the second tunnel pipe. The project was launched in 2016 and is estimated to cost a total of EUR 570 million. All interventions are expected to be completed by the end of 2026.

The highway to Matulje will shorten the journey from Zagreb to Pulj to just two and a half hours.
2024-09-13.english_title: In Croatia, they opened the second tunnel of the Wolf

Papež Frančišek se po 12-dnevni turneji po Aziji vrača v Vatikan: "To delo ni lahko"

Z okoli 32.000 prepotovanimi kilometri je bilo to njegovo najdaljše potovanje

Papež Frančišek je sklenil svojo 12-dnevno turnejo po Aziji, v okviru katere je obiskal Indonezijo, Papuo Novo Gvinejo, Vzhodni Timor in Singapur. Po kratki slovesnosti na singapurskem letališču Changi se je vkrcal na več kot 12 ur dolg polet proti Rimu.

Pred odhodom je 87-letni papež spregovoril na medverskem srečanju mladih Singapurcev. Svetoval jim je, naj bodo kritični, vendar konstruktivni, obenem pa pogumni in sposobni gledati naprej. "Naj se vam ne debeli trebuh, ampak glava," je dejal in sprožil smeh med poslušalci.

Kritičen je bil do tistih, ki se bojijo delati napake in ki se raje zadržujejo v območju udobja. "Pravim, tvegajte, pojdite ven," je pozval in dodal, da je mlad človek, ki se boji in ne tvega, pravzaprav star. Po kratki slovesnosti na letališču Changi se je vkrcal na več kot 12 ur dolg polet proti Rimu.

Pred obiskom v Singapurju je bil Frančišek v Indoneziji, najštevilčnejši muslimanski državi na svetu, kjer je z državnim imamom pozval k ukrepanju proti podnebnim spremembam. Obiskal je Papuo Novo Gvinejo in v odmaknjeno naselje na robu džungle pripeljal več sto kilogramov pomoči. Na Vzhodnem Timorju je vodil mašo, ki jo je obiskalo več kot 600.000 ljudi, v Singapurju pa se je zavzel za pošteno plačilo migrantskim delavcem.

Z okoli 32.000 prepotovanimi kilometri je bilo to njegovo najdaljše potovanje v vlogi poglavarja Katoliške cerkve in precejšen izziv za njegovo dokaj krhko zdravje. Kljub temu je bil na potovanju v dobri formi, saj je imel natrpan urnik in vodil več kot 40 dogodkov. 

Čeprav nekateri menijo, da bi se moral izogibati daljših potovanj, Frančišek vztraja, da so potovanja pri opravljanju misijonarske službe ključna. "Papež se regenerira z naklonjenostjo ljudstva," je dejal eden izmed članov vatikanske delegacije in dodal, da moč svetemu očetu dajejo množice ljudi, s katerimi se sreča na svojih potovanjih.

V Papui Novi Gvineji je sveti oče ponudil majhen vpogled v to, kako razmišlja o vodenju cerkve z 1,4 milijarde članov. Skupino mladih je kot običajno prosil, naj molijo zanj, ter pozneje dodal: "To delo ni lahko."

Pope Francis returns to the Vatican after a 12-day tour of Asia: "This is not an easy job".

With some 20,000 miles of traveled, it was his longest journey

Pope Francis has completed a 12-day tour of Asia, including visits to Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, East Timor and Singapore. After a brief ceremony at Singapore's Changi Airport, he boarded a 12-hour flight to Rome.

Before leaving, the 87-year-old pope spoke at a mid-term meeting of Singaporean youth. He advised them to be critical but constructive while being courageous and able to look ahead. "Let your stomach not be fat, but your head", he said, and caused laughter among the audience.

He was critical of those who were afraid to make mistakes and preferred to stay in a comfort zone. "I do, take risks, go out", he called, adding that a young man who is afraid and not risking is actually old. After a brief ceremony at Changi Airport, he boarded a 12-hour flight to Rome.

Prior to his visit to Singapore, Francis was in Indonesia, the world's most populous Muslim country, where he called for action against climate change with the state imam. He visited Papua New Guinea and brought hundreds of pounds of aid to a remote settlement on the edge of the jungle. In East Timor, he led a mass attended by more than 600,000 people, and in Singapore, he advocated fair pay for migrant workers.

With some 32,000 miles [3,000 km] traveled, this was his longest journey as head of the Catholic Church and a considerable challenge to his rather fragile health. Yet, he was in good shape on the trip, having a busy schedule and conducting more than 40 events.

Although some feel that longer travels should be avoided, Francis insists that travel is essential in carrying out missionary service. "The pope regenerates with the favor of the people", said one member of the Vatican delegation, adding that the power of the Holy Father is given to the multitudes he meets on his journeys.

In Papua New Guinea, the Holy Father offered a small insight into how he thinks of leading a church of 1.4 billion members. As usual, he asked the group of young people to pray for him, and later he added: "This is not an easy task".
2024-09-13.english_title: Pope Francis' 12-day postponement of the work is not easy
