Zunanji ministri v Madridu pozvali k rešitvi dveh držav. Albares: Pot je jasna.

Fajon: Obstaja velika in resna bojazen, da konflikt dobi razsežnosti vojne v regiji

Španija, ki je v petek gostila zunanje ministre več evropskih in arabskih držav, je mednarodno skupnost pozvala k oblikovanju jasnega časovnega načrta, kako pristopiti k reševanju palestinsko-izraelskega spora in izpeljati rešitev dveh držav.

"Sestali smo se, da bi ponovno pozvali h koncu vojne v Gazi in našli izhod iz neskončne spirale nasilja med Palestinci in Izraelci," je dejal španski zunanji minister Jose Manuel Albares. "Ta pot je jasna. Rešitev dveh držav je edini način."

Sestanka so se udeležili zunanji ministri iz Slovenije, Španije, Irske in Norveške, visoki zunanjepolitični predstavnik Evropske unije Josep Borrell, palestinski premier Mohamed Mustafa in predstavniki Lige arabskih držav, Organizacije islamskih držav ter zunanji ministri Katarja, Egipta, Savdske Arabije, Jordanije in Turčije.

Strinjali so se, da je zavezanost uresničitvi rešitve dveh držav edini način za vzpostavitev trajnega miru in varnosti na Bližnjem vzhodu, kot tudi da mora mednarodna skupnost prevzeti bolj dejavno vlogo pri reševanju konflikta.

Albares je dejal, da so udeleženci, med katerimi ni Izraela, "očitno pripravljeni", da "od besed preidejo k dejanjem in naredijo korake" k izvedbi rešitve z dvema državama, začenši z vstopom Palestine v Združene narode.

Izrael ni bil povabljen, ker ni del kontaktne skupine, je dejal Albares in dodal, da "bomo z veseljem videli Izrael za vsako mizo, za katero se bo razpravljalo o miru in rešitvi dveh držav".

Norveški zunanji minister Espen Barth Eide je za agencijo Reuters dejal, da je treba na srečanju razpravljati tudi o demobilizaciji Hamasa, ki je pred vojno nadzoroval Gazo, ter o normalizaciji odnosov med Izraelom in nekaterimi drugimi državami, zlasti Savdsko Arabijo.

Ob koncu so udeleženci sprejeli skupno izjavo, v kateri so se zavezali skupnemu delovanju v smeri rešitve dveh držav, zaščite civilistov, doseganja premirja, zagotavljanja dodatne humanitarne pomoči Palestincem in podpore palestinskim oblastem v Ramali. Zavezali so se tudi k čimprejšnjemu sklicu mednarodne mirovne konference.

Fajon: Treba je obuditi zaupanje v rešitev dveh držav

"Potrebno je več diplomacije, treba je nekako spet obuditi zaupanje v samo izvajanje rešitve dveh držav," je glede možnosti za rešitev bližnjevzhodnega konflikta dejala zunanja ministrica Tanja Fajon. Po njeni oceni je ključno, da čim več držav prizna Palestino, obenem pa je pomembno tudi spoštovanje že sprejetih mednarodnih pravnih okvirov.

"Imamo štiri resolucije Varnostnega sveta, niso spoštovane, imamo razsodbo sodišča, ki prav tako zavezuje države članice ZN-a k spoštovanju, imamo dogovore iz Osla," je naštela ministrica, ki je na srečanju poudarila potrebo po spoštovanju teh zavez, saj so osnova, na kateri je treba graditi.

Ob tem je razkrila, da so sicer "z enim ali pa korakom in pol" na poti do priznanja Palestine med drugim Francija, Belgija in Velika Britanija.

Na srečanju so ministri govorili tudi o tem, kako vplivati na javno mnenje, tako v državah članicah EU-ja kot v arabskem svetu, saj je videti, da enotnega mnenja glede bližnjevzhodne krize ni.

"Štiri evropske države, ki smo danes tukaj prisotne, se z arabskimi državami usklajujemo za skupen nastop v Generalni skupščini in Varnostnem svetu ZN-a. Ko gre za uresničitev rešitve dveh držav, je pomembno, da smo enotni in da govorimo z istim glasom," je poudarila Fajon.

"Izzivi so izjemno kompleksni, obstaja velika in resna bojazen, da konflikt dobi razsežnosti vojne v regiji, in to je seveda velika grožnja tudi za varnost na evropskih tleh," je opozorila. Omenila je tudi izraelsko nezakonito okupacijo Zahodnega brega in nasilje tamkajšnjih izraelskih naseljencev nad Palestinci, ki je izjemno skrb vzbujajoče.

Naslednje tovrstno srečanje bo potekalo prihodnji teden ob robu zasedanja Generalne skupščine ZN-a v New Yorku, so še sporočili s slovenskega zunanjega ministrstva.
2024-09-13.title: Zunanji ministri v Madridu pozvali k rešitvi dveh držav. Albares: Pot je jasna.
2024-09-13.english_content:
Foreign ministers in Madrid have called for a two-state solution. The path is clear.

There is a great and serious fear that the conflict will escalate to war in the region

Spain, which hosted foreign ministers from several European and Arab countries on Friday, called on the international community to draw up a clear timetable for how to approach the settlement of the Palestinian-Israeli dispute and bring about a two-state solution.

"We have come together to call for an end to the Gaza war and to find a way out of the endless spiral of violence between Palestinians and Israelis", said Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares. "This road is clear. The two-state solution is the only way".

The meeting was attended by the Foreign Ministers of Slovenia, Spain, Ireland and Norway, the High Foreign Minister of the European Union Josep Borrell, the Palestinian Prime Minister Mohamed Mustafa and representatives of the League of Arab States, the Organisation of Islamic States and the Foreign Ministers of Qatar, Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Jordan and Turkey.

They agreed that a commitment to a two-state solution is the only way to establish lasting peace and security in the Middle East and that the international community must play a more active role in conflict resolution.

Albares said that participants outside Israel were "obviously ready" to "go from word to word and take steps" to implement a two-state solution, starting with Palestine's accession to the United Nations.

Israel was not invited because it is not part of the contact group, Albares said, adding that "we will be happy to see Israel at any table at which the peace and the two-state solution will be discussed".

Norwegian Foreign Minister Espen Barth Eide told Reuters that the meeting should also discuss the demobilization of Hamas, which controlled Gaza before the war, and the normalization of relations between Israel and some other countries, especially Saudi Arabia.

The participants concluded by adopting a joint statement committing to joint action towards a two-state solution, the protection of civilians, the achievement of a ceasefire, the provision of additional humanitarian assistance to the Palestinians and support to the Palestinian Authority in Ramallah. They also committed to the earliest possible call for an international peace conference.

Fajon: We need to build trust in the two-state solution

"More diplomacy is needed, somehow we need to rebuild confidence in the implementation of a two-state solution", Foreign Minister Tanja Fajon said of the possibility of a Middle East conflict solution. It considered that the recognition of Palestine by as many countries as possible was essential, while respecting the international legal framework already adopted was also important.

"We have four Security Council resolutions, they are not respected, we have a court ruling that also obliges the UN member states to respect, we have Oslo agreements", the minister said, stressing the need to respect these commitments as they are the basis on which to build.

She said that "one or two and a half steps" were being taken to recognize Palestine, including France, Belgium and Britain.

The ministers also discussed how to influence public opinion in both EU Member States and the Arab world, as there appears to be no consensus on the Middle East crisis.

"The four European countries that we are here today are coordinating with the Arab countries for a joint appearance at the UN General Assembly and the UN Security Council. When it comes to achieving a two-state solution, it is important that we are united and speak with the same voice", Fajon stressed.

"The issues are extremely complex, there is a great and serious fear that the conflict will escalate to the level of war in the region, and this is of course a major threat to security on European soil as well", she said. She also mentioned the illegal Israeli occupation of the West Bank and the violence of Israeli settlers there against the Palestinians, which is of great concern.

The next meeting of this kind will take place next week on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly in New York, the Slovenian Foreign Ministry said.
2024-09-13.english_title: Foreign ministers in Madrid have called for a two-state solution. The path is clear.

2024-09-13.author: Ž. N.
2024-09-13.content:
Na Bavarskem zaradi načrtovanja napada na vojake pridržali Sirca

Nemške oblasti so v četrtek pridržale sirskega državljana, ki naj bi načrtoval napad na vojake v mestu Hof na severovzhodu Bavarske. 27-letnik naj bi islamistično motivirani napad nameraval izvesti z mačeto.

Tožilci so sporočili, da je moški pred kratkim kupil dve približno 40 centimetrov dolgi mačeti in vojake nemške vojske nameraval napasti med odmorom za kosilo, pri čemer naj bi bil njegov cilj, da jih ubije toliko, kolikor bi bilo mogoče.

Osumljenec naj bi bil privržen islamistični ideologiji, v četrtek pa so ga prijeli na podlagi obtožb načrtovanja hudega nasilnega dejanja, ki ogroža državo. "Želel je pritegniti pozornost in med prebivalci ustvariti občutek negotovosti," so dodali.

V Nemčiji v zadnjem času opažajo močno povečanje števila napadov s hladnim orožjem, zlasti z noži, zaradi česar se je vlada v Berlinu odločila zaostriti zakonodajo o orožju in priseljevanju.
2024-09-13.title: Na Bavarskem zaradi načrtovanja napada na vojake pridržali Sirca
2024-09-13.english_content:
Sirc was arrested in Bavaria for planning an attack on soldiers.

German authorities arrested a Syrian citizen on Thursday for planning an attack on troops in the town of Hof in northeastern Bavaria. The 27-year-old suspect was planning an Islamist-motivated attack with a machete.

Prosecutors reported that a man recently bought two knives about 40 centimeters long and planned to attack German army soldiers during lunch break, purporting to kill as many as possible.

The suspect was said to be an Islamist ideologue, and was arrested on Thursday on charges of planning a serious act of violence that threatens the state. "He wanted to draw attention and create a sense of insecurity among the residents", they added.

Germany has recently seen a sharp increase in cold-armed attacks, particularly knives, which has led the Berlin government to tighten its arms and immigration legislation.
2024-09-13.english_title: Sirc was arrested in Bavaria for planning an attack on soldiers.

2024-09-26.author: Ž. N.
2024-09-26.content:
Palestinski predsednik Mahmud Abas v ZN-u: To je domovina naših prednikov

Abas je zahteval tudi odškodnino za Palestince za vso škodo med nezakonito okupacijo

Palestinski predsednik Mahmud Abas je v četrtkovem govoru na 79. zasedanju Generalne skupščine ZN-a pozval mednarodno skupnost, naj ustavi zločin, ki ga izvaja Izrael nad Palestinci in Libanonci. Naštel je tudi predloge za čas po koncu spopadov.

Abas je v uvodu poudaril, da Palestinci ne bodo šli nikamor, ker je to domovina njihovih prednikov. "Odšli bodo okupatorji. Palestinci so podvrženi genocidu okupacijske sile, ki je doslej v Gazi pobila več kot 40.000 mučenikov, več tisoč jih je pod ruševinami, več 100.000 ranjenih," je dejal.

Opisal je katastrofalne razmere v Gazi, kjer ljudje umirajo zaradi pomanjkanja osnovnih potrebščin, dva milijona jih nenehno beži pred izraelsko vojsko, nasilje nad njimi se izvaja tudi na Zahodnem bregu in v Vzhodnem Jeruzalemu.

"Izrael trdi, da ne pobija nedolžnih civilistov. Pri Bogu vas zdaj vprašam – kdo je pobil več kot 15.000 otrok? Ustavite ta zločin. Nehajte pošiljati orožje Izraelu. Ta norost se mora končati," je pozval.

Abas je zatrdil, da vse od 7. oktobra lani zahteva konec vojne, obsoja pobijanje civilistov ne glede na to, na kateri strani so, in zahteva izpustitev vseh talcev. Izraelsko vlado je obtožil, da je napad Hamasa izkoristila za vsesplošno vojno.

Zahteval je sankcije proti Izraelu zaradi zločinov praktično od ustanovitve države leta 1948 in izrazil obžalovanje, da največja demokracija na svetu (ZDA) onemogoča sprejetje Palestine v ZN in ob tem Izrael zalaga z orožjem za pobijanje civilistov.

Dejal je, da bi morali Izrael izključiti iz ZN-a, saj je njegov veleposlanik izjavil, da je treba palačo narodov izbrisati z obličja zemlje. Američanom se je zahvalil za proteste na ulicah, zahteval uresničitev več kot 1000 resolucij ZN-a in odškodnino za Palestince za vso škodo med nezakonito okupacijo.

Na koncu je podal seznam predlogov za čas po koncu spopadov. Najprej je po njegovih besedah nujno celovito premirje v Gazi in konec agresije nad naseljenci na Zahodnem bregu in v Vzhodnem Jeruzalemu. Nato je treba zagotoviti dostop humanitarne pomoči, popoln umik Izraela iz Gaze, pri čemer Palestinci ne sprejemajo nobenih tamponskih območij. Nadalje je še treba zagotoviti stanovanja za razseljene, zaščito delavcev agencij ZN-a in nadzor palestinske vlade nad Gazo, Zahodnim bregom in Vzhodnim Jeruzalemom.

Predlagal je pomoč pri oživitvi gospodarstva, obnovi uničenega in izvedbi volitev ter sprejetjem Palestine v ZN. Predlagal je tudi namestitev mednarodnih mirovnih sil med Izraelom in Palestino, ki bodo jamčile za varnost obeh držav.

Na koncu je povabil vse države, ki si tega želijo, da se mu pridružijo pri načrtovanem obisku Gaze, Združene narode pa pozval, naj prisilijo Izrael, da obiska ne ovira. Iz dvorane je odšel ob ploskanju prisotnih in vzklikih: "Svobodna Palestina!"
2024-09-26.title: Palestinski predsednik Mahmud Abas v ZN-u: To je domovina naših prednikov
2024-09-26.english_content:
Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas at the UN: This is the home of our ancestors

Abbas also demanded compensation for all damage to the Palestinians during the illegal occupation.

Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas called on the international community to stop Israel's crimes against Palestinians and Lebanese people in a speech to the 79th session of the UN General Assembly on Thursday. He also counted the time after the fighting.

Abbas stressed in the introduction that the Palestinians will not go anywhere because this is the home of their ancestors. "The occupiers will leave. Palestinians are subject to the genocide of the occupying forces, which has so far killed more than 40,000 martyrs in Gaza, thousands of them are in ruins, more than 100,000 wounded", he said.

He described the disastrous situation in Gaza, where people are dying from a lack of basic necessities, two million are constantly fleeing Israeli forces, and violence is also being carried out on the West Bank and East Jerusalem.

"Israel claims not to kill innocent civilians. I'm asking you now, by God, who killed more than 15,000 children? Stop this crime. Stop sending weapons to Israel. This madness must end", he called.

Abbas has insisted that since October 7 last year, he has called for an end to the war, condemned the killing of civilians on all sides, and demanded the release of all hostages. The Israeli government accused Hamas of using the attack to wage a full-scale war.

He called for sanctions against Israel for crimes committed virtually since the country was founded in 1948, and regretted that the world's largest democracy (the United States) was preventing the admission of Palestine to the UN and that Israel was arming itself with weapons to kill civilians.

He said that Israel should be excluded from the UN because his ambassador said that the Palace of Nations should be wiped off the face of the earth. He thanked the Americans for the protests on the streets, demanding the implementation of more than 1,000 UN resolutions and compensation for all damage to the Palestinians during the illegal occupation.

Finally, he gave a list of proposals for the post-clash era. First, he says, there is a need for a comprehensive truce in Gaza and an end to aggression against the West Bank and East Jerusalem. The Palestinians are not allowed to accept any buffer zones. Furthermore, housing for displaced persons, protection of UN agency workers and the Palestinian government's control over Gaza, the West Bank and East Jerusalem are to be ensured.

He proposed aid to revive the economy, restore the ruined and hold elections and accept Palestine into the UN. He also proposed the deployment of international peacekeeping forces between Israel and Palestine to ensure the security of both countries.

He finally invited all countries willing to join him in his planned visit to Gaza and called on the United Nations to force Israel to not interfere with the visit. He left the hall with applause from the audience, shouting: "Free Palestine!"
2024-09-26.english_title: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas at the UN: This is the home of our ancestors

2024-09-26.author: Ž. N.
2024-09-26.content:
Talibanom zaradi diskriminacije žensk grozi tožba v Haagu

Od vrnitve na oblast leta 2021 so postopoma izrinili ženske iz javnih prostorov

Avstralija, Kanada, Nemčija in Nizozemska so v New Yorku napovedale začetek postopka proti talibanom, ki bi lahko privedel do sodbe pred Meddržavnim sodiščem v Haagu. Države talibanom očitajo kršenje pravic žensk in deklet. V Kabulu očitke zavračajo.

"Talibani so dokazali, da prezirajo človekove pravice in temeljne svoboščine žensk in deklet," je v sredo dejala avstralska zunanja ministrica Penny Wong ob robu Generalne skupščine ZN-a. "Izvajajo kampanjo trajnega in sistematičnega zatiranja," je dodala.

Štiri države nameravajo dokazati, da talibani kršijo konvencijo ZN-a o odpravi vseh oblik diskriminacije žensk, katere pogodbenica je tudi država Afganistan, je pojasnila.

V prvem koraku nameravajo s Kabulom voditi pogajanja, če bodo ta in nato arbitraža neuspešni, pa lahko na koncu primer pristane tudi pred sodiščem ZN-a.

Talibanska vlada v Kabulu je že zavrnila očitke glede obravnave žensk. "Obtožbe nekaterih držav in strank, da Afganistan krši človekove pravice in diskriminira zaradi spola, so neutemeljene," je za AFP povedal tiskovni predstavnik vlade.

"Človekove pravice so v Afganistanu zaščitene in nihče ni diskriminiran. Žal se poskuša širiti propaganda proti Afganistanu na podlagi izjav nekaj pobeglih žensk," so dodali.

Talibani so od vrnitve na oblast avgusta 2021 postopoma izrinili ženske iz javnih prostorov. Ženske se ne smejo več učiti po osnovni šoli, obiskovati parkov, telovadnic ali kozmetičnih salonov, domove pa naj bi zapuščale le v spremstvu moškega. Nedavni zakon o morali je ženskam prepovedal tudi glasno govorjenje v javnosti.

Združeni narodi so stroga pravila označili za spolni apartheid. Prejšnji teden pa je večina članic Varnostnega sveta na zasedanju o Afganistanu obsodila odnos talibanov do žensk.
2024-09-26.title: Talibanom zaradi diskriminacije žensk grozi tožba v Haagu
2024-09-26.english_content:
Taliban threatened with prosecution in The Hague for discrimination against women

Since returning to power in 2021, women have been gradually removed from public spaces.

Australia, Canada, Germany and the Netherlands announced in New York that they would launch a lawsuit against the Taliban that could lead to a judgment before the International Court of Justice in The Hague. The Taliban are accused of violating the rights of women and girls. In Kabul, the complaints are being denied.

"The Taliban have proven their disregard for human rights and fundamental freedoms of women and girls", Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong said on Wednesday at the UN General Assembly. "They are waging a campaign of permanent and systematic repression", she added.

The four countries intend to prove that the Taliban are violating the UN Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women, to which Afghanistan is a party, she explained.

They intend to negotiate with Kabul first if this and then the arbitration fail, and eventually the case may also go to the UN court.

The Taliban government in Kabul has already rejected complaints about the treatment of women. "The allegations by some countries and parties that Afghanistan violates human rights and discriminates on grounds of gender are unfounded", a government spokesman told AFP.

"Human rights are protected in Afghanistan and no one is discriminated against. Unfortunately, there is an attempt to spread propaganda against Afghanistan based on the statements of some female refugees", they added.

The Taliban have been steadily removing women from public spaces since they returned to power in August 2021. Women are no longer allowed to attend primary school, to go to parks, gyms, or beauty salons, and to leave their homes only with a man. A recent moral law also forbade women to speak out in public.

The United Nations has declared strict rules as sex apartheid. But last week, most members of the Security Council condemned the Taliban's treatment of women at a meeting on Afghanistan.
2024-09-26.english_title: Taliban threatened with prosecution in The Hague for discrimination against women

2024-09-26.author: P. G.
2024-09-26.content:
Prizadevanja za rešitev kulturne dediščine Gaze tudi s pomočjo švicarskega sklada

Približno 900 tisoč evrov vreden sklad švicarske fundacije Aliph

Palestinci so začeli varovati svojo kulturno dediščino, zahvaljujoč skladu za nujne primere, ki ga je namenila švicarska fundacija Aliph. Podpora vključuje preselitev artefaktov, preglede škode na objektih in usposabljanje za krepitev varovanja dediščine.

Po podatkih palestinskega ministrstva za zdravje je bilo od začetka spopadov oktobra lani ubitih več kot 40.000 Palestincev, večina prebivalstva Gaze pa je bila pregnana s svojih domov. Svetovna banka je marca letos v vmesnem poročilu o oceni škode navedla, da je "pomembna dediščina Gaze" utrpela za dobrih 286 milijonov evrov škode. Glede na poročilo, sestavljeno v sodelovanju z Združenimi narodi in Evropsko unijo, je bilo med 7. oktobrom lani in 26. januarjem letos poškodovanih 63 odstotkov vseh območij dediščine, 31 odstotkov pa uničenih. A te številke naj bi od marca bistveno poskočile, navaja Art News.

Približno 900 tisoč evrov vreden švicarski skladStrokovnjaki ob omenjeni finančni podpori v vrednosti približno 900 tisoč evrov na terenu v Gazi preseljujejo dragocene artefakte, dokumentirajo škodo na zgodovinskih lokacijah in nudijo usposabljanje zainteresiranim posameznikom, da bi pomagali pri prizadevanjih za zaščito kulturne in zgodovinske dediščine. Fundacija Aliph se na splošno osredotoča na zaščito kulturne dediščine na konfliktnih in pokonfliktnih območjih.

Med izraelskim obstreljevanjem je bil med drugim poškodovan muzej kulture v mestu Al Karara v Gazi. Njegov ustanovitelj Mohamad Abu Lehia je dejal, da je zanje skrb za tamkajšnjo kulturno dediščino "tako nacionalna kot humanitarna naloga. Zgodovina in dediščina Gaze sta dediščina človeštva in sveta. Vsak trenutek razmišljamo o svoji dediščini." Več kot 2000 predmetov iz muzejske zbirke je bilo premeščenih med nedavnimi reševalnimi prizadevanji združenja za kulturo in umetnost Mayasem v sodelovanju s Palestinskim muzejem na Zahodnem bregu. Med njimi so bile arheološke najdbe, kot so raznolika keramika, nagrobniki in kipi ter tudi izdelki palestinske tradicionalne obrti. Združenju Mayasem je sicer leta 2021 ustanovila njegova žena Najla Abulehia. 

A reševalna prizadevanja so zaradi nečloveških razmer v Gazi izjemno zahtevna. Po besedah direktorja muzeja so morali sodelavci združenja med drugim na veliko iskati vsakdanje predmete, kot so škatle in drugi nujni pripomočki za selitev in shranjevanje dragocenosti. Rešeni predmeti so "strokovno in primerno" zapakirani in pripravljeni "za preselitev v primeru vdora okupacijske vojske na to območje", so navedli v združenju, ki to delo izvaja tudi na drugih nerazkritih lokacijah v Gazi.

Pod motom Varovanje dediščine za izgradnjo miruFundacija Aliph je za Art Newspaper potrdila, da se nujna dokumentacija za oceno škode izvaja na trojici pomembnih kulturnih lokacij v mestu Gaza: Veliki mošeji v Gazi, znani tudi kot Velika mošeja Omari, iz sedmega stoletja, ki so jo uničili izraelski letalski napadi decembra lani, palača Al Saka in zgodovinsko dvorišče Dar-Farah. Delo poteka v sodelovanju s centrom Rivak za arhitekturno ohranjanje na Zahodnem bregu in v sodelovanju z mednarodnimi organizacijami, kot je Unesco.

"Glede na izjemen odziv strokovnjakov za dediščino, ki delujejo v Gazi, na Zahodnem bregu in na mednarodni ravni ter mednarodno in palestinsko skrb za zaščito kulturne dediščine, je to nekaj, kar je treba storiti zdaj. To je pomembna prednostna naloga za številne ljudi v regiji in tukaj smo, da jih podpremo pri tem prizadevanju," je sporočila Sandra Bialystok iz fundacije Aliph.

Poudarila je še, da ta prizadevanja niso ovira za prizadevanja za humanitarno pomoč. Po njenih besedah je zaščita kulturne dediščine ključni del "sestavljanke za vzpostavitev miru (...) To je naš moto, varovanje dediščine za izgradnjo miru; je sestavni del izgradnje miru. Še naprej bomo tukaj, dokler se nas bo potrebovalo, tudi ko se bo vojna končala – upam, da kmalu – in v prihodnje."

Ključno usposabljanje ljudi na terenuVodja projektov pri Aliphu Gala-Alexa Amagat je dejala, da je ključni poudarek na usposabljanju ljudi na terenu. Po njenih besedah je spletno usposabljanje, namenjeno predvsem posameznikom na Zahodnem bregu, pritegnilo 20 udeležencev iz Gaze. "Nekateri so prehodili kilometre, da bi dostopali do spletne povezave in se pridružili seji," je še dejala in dodala, da jo je njihova predanost "prevzela".

Arheolog iz Gaze Fadel Al Utol, ki pomaga združenju Mayasem pri usposabljanjih, je sporočil, da najmanj 15 ljudi sodeluje pri osebnih srečanjih kljub zahtevnim okoliščinam. "To je življenje v Gazi; premagamo težave. Vse podpornike pozivam, da še naprej podpirate mlade pri ohranjanju kulturne dediščine, da se bosta upanje in ljubezen do življenja nadaljevala, skupaj z ohranjanjem starin," je pozval.
2024-09-26.title: Prizadevanja za rešitev kulturne dediščine Gaze tudi s pomočjo švicarskega sklada
2024-09-26.english_content:
Rescue activities for the cultural heritage of Gaza, including through the Swiss Fund

The Swiss Aliph Foundation fund, worth approximately 900,000 euros

The Palestinians have begun to protect their cultural heritage thanks to the Emergency Fund set up by the Swiss Aliph Foundation. Support shall include the relocation of artefacts, the examination of damage to the premises and training to strengthen the protection of heritage.

According to the Palestinian Health Ministry, more than 40,000 Palestinians have been killed since the conflict began in October last year, and most of Gaza's population has been displaced from their homes. The World Bank said in its interim damage assessment report in March that the "significant heritage of Gaza" suffered a good 286 million euros in damage. According to a report prepared in cooperation with the United Nations and the European Union, 63 percent of all heritage sites were damaged and 31 percent destroyed between October 7 and January 26 this year. But these numbers are expected to jump significantly from March, reports Art News.

The Swiss Fund, worth approximately EUR 900,000, provides the financial support of approximately EUR 900,000 to experts in the field in Gaza, documenting damage to historic sites and providing training to interested individuals to assist in the efforts to protect cultural and historic heritage. The Aliph Foundation is generally focused on the protection of cultural heritage in conflict and post-conflict areas.

The Israeli shelling damaged the cultural museum in the Gaza city of Al Karara. Its founder, Mohamad Abu Lehia, said that their care for the cultural heritage of the region is "as national as it is humanitarian. The history and heritage of Gaza are the heritage of humanity and the world. Every moment we think about our heritage. "More than 2,000 items from the museum's collection were moved during the recent rescue efforts of the Mayan Association for Culture and the Arts in collaboration with the Palestinian Museum in the West Bank. Among them were archaeological finds such as various pottery, tombs and statues, as well as products of traditional Palestinian crafts. The association mayasem was founded in 2021 by his wife, Naila Abulehia.

But rescue efforts are extremely demanding because of the inhuman situation in Gaza. According to the director, the association's staff had to search extensively for everyday items, such as boxes and other essential items for moving and storing valuables. The rescued items are 'professionally and appropriately' packed and prepared 'for relocation in the event of an invasion by the occupying forces into the area,' the association said, adding that the work is also being carried out at other undisclosed locations in Gaza.

Under the theme of Protecting Heritage for Peacebuilding, the Aliph Foundation confirmed to Art Newspaper that the necessary documentation for damage assessment is being carried out at three important cultural sites in Gaza City: the Great Mosque in Gaza, also known as the Great Mosque of Omari, from the seventh century, which was destroyed by Israeli airstrikes in December last year, the Al-Sak Palace and the historic Dar-Farah Palace. The work is being carried out in cooperation with the Rivak Centre for Architectural Conservation on the West Bank and in cooperation with international organisations such as UNESCO.

"Given the outstanding response of heritage experts working in Gaza, the West Bank and internationally, and international and Palestinian concern for the protection of cultural heritage, this is something that needs to be done now. This is an important priority for many people in the region and we are here to support them in this endeavour", said Sandra Bialystok of the Aliph Foundation.

It also stressed that these efforts did not hamper efforts to provide humanitarian assistance. She said that protecting cultural heritage is a key part of "the establishment of peace (...) That's our motto, preserving our heritage for peacebuilding; it's an integral part of peacebuilding. We will continue here as long as we are needed, even after the war is over, I hope soon, and in the future".

Key training of people in the fieldThe project manager at Aliphu Gala-Alexa Amagat said that training of people in the field was a key focus. According to her, the online training, aimed primarily at individuals in the West Bank, attracted 20 participants from Gaza. "Some have walked miles to get online and join the sessions", she said, adding that their dedication "has taken over".

The Gaza archaeologist Fadel Al Utol, who helps the Mayan Association train, reported that at least 15 people were attending the meetings in person despite the difficult circumstances. "This is life in Gaza; we are overcoming the problems. I call on all supporters to continue to support young people in preserving their cultural heritage, so that hope and love of life will continue, along with preserving the old ones,' he called on.
2024-09-26.english_title: Rescue activities for the cultural heritage of Gaza, including through the Swiss Fund

Papež Frančišek v Luksemburgu: Bogastvo vključuje tudi odgovornost

Papež se bo kmalu odpravil tudi v Belgijo

Papež Frančišek je ob obisku v Luksemburgu obžaloval vnovične razkole in sovražnosti v Evropi. Pri tem je politike pozval k ukrepanju za mir in končanju vojn v svetu ter k temu, da naj namenijo več pomoči državam v razvoju.

Frančišek se je v okviru enodnevnega obiska v Luksemburgu srečal z velikim vojvodo Henrijem in premierjem Lucom Friednom.

Papež je po pogovorih obžaloval "ponovni pojav, celo na evropski celini, razkolov in sovražnosti" z uničujočimi in smrtonosnimi posledicami. "Ne smemo pozabiti, da je vojna vedno neuspeh," je dejal Frančišek in politike pozval k ukrepanju.

"Obstaja nujna potreba, da se tisti na oblasti odločno in potrpežljivo vključijo v poštena pogajanja, da bi razrešili razlike," je opozoril. Po njegovem mnenju so potrebni "pošteni kompromisi, ki ničesar ne spodkopavajo in lahko namesto tega zgradijo varnost in mir za vse", poroča francoska tiskovna agencija AFP.

Luksemburg, kjer je sedež več evropskih institucij, lahko pokaže, "kakšne prednosti ima mir pred grozotami vojne in kakšne prednosti imata integracija ter spodbujanje prebežnikov pred njihovo izključitvijo", je še dejal Frančišek. 

Papež je imel na programu tudi srečanje s predstavniki civilne družbe in diplomatskim zborom, v katedrali Notre-Dame v Luxembourgu pa tudi druženje s tamkajšnjo katoliško skupnostjo. V Luksemburgu po podatkih Vatikana živi približno 271.000 katoličanov.Frančišek je drugi papež, ki je obiskal Luksemburg, po Janezu Pavlu II. leta 1985.

Papež: Bogastvo vključuje tudi odgovornost

Sveti oče je pozval voditelje Luksemburga, naj namenijo več sredstev za pomoč državam v razvoju. Sveti oče, ki je bil na obisku v državi z največjim številom milijonarjev na prebivalca na svetu, je predlagal, da bi povečanje tuje pomoči lahko pomagalo ustaviti tok beguncev in prebežnikov, ki želijo vstopiti v Evropo.

"Ne pozabimo, da bogastvo vključuje tudi odgovornost," je papež dejal zbranim voditeljem v palači Cercle Cite v Luksemburgu. "Prosim za stalno pozornost, da bi najbolj prikrajšanim narodom pomagali, da se dvignejo iz obubožanosti."

Papež Frančišek se bo odpravil tudi v Belgijo, kjer se bo srečal s 15 žrtvami zlorab duhovnikov. V Belgiji je bilo od leta 2012 vloženih več kot 700 pritožb in prijav o zlorabah, povezanih s Cerkvijo. Marca je papež iz duhovništva izključil nekdanjega belgijskega škofa, ki je priznal spolno zlorabo dveh nečakov.
2024-09-26.title: Papež Frančišek v Luksemburgu: Bogastvo vključuje tudi odgovornost

Pope Francis in Luxembourg: Wealth includes responsibility

The Pope will soon be traveling to Belgium.

Pope Francis, on his visit to Luxembourg, deplored the renewed divisions and hostilities in Europe. He called on the political establishment to take action for peace and an end to world wars and to allocate more aid to developing countries.

During a one-day visit to Luxembourg, Francis met with Grand Duke Henry and Prime Minister Luc Friedn.

The pope said he regretted "a re-emergence, even on the European continent, of divisions and hostilities" with devastating and deadly consequences. "We must not forget that war is always a failure", Francis said, calling on politicians to act.

"There is an urgent need for those in power to be firmly and patiently involved in fair negotiations to resolve differences", he warned. He said "honest compromises that undermine nothing and can build security and peace for all are needed", reports AFP.

Luxembourg, where several European institutions are based, can show 'what advantages peace has over the horrors of war and what advantages integration and the promotion of refugees before their exclusion have,' Francis said.

The pope also had meetings with representatives of civil society and a diplomatic conference, and a meeting with the Catholic community at Notre-Dame Cathedral in Luxembourg. According to the Vatican, there are about 271,000 Catholics living in Luxembourg. Francis is the second pope to visit Luxembourg, after John Paul II in 1985.

Pope: Wealth includes responsibility

The Holy Father called on the leaders of Luxembourg to allocate more funds to help developing countries. The Holy Father, who was visiting the country with the highest number of millionaires per capita in the world, suggested that increasing foreign aid could help stop the flow of refugees and migrants seeking to enter Europe.

"Let us not forget that wealth includes responsibility", the pope told leaders gathered at the Palace of the Cercle Cite in Luxembourg. "I ask for constant attention to help the most deprived nations rise from poverty".

Pope Francis will also travel to Belgium where he will meet 15 victims of clerical abuse. Since 2012, more than 700 complaints and reports of Church-related abuse have been filed in Belgium. The pope expelled a former Belgian bishop who confessed to the sexual abuse of his two nieces.
2024-09-26.english_title: Pope Francis in Luxembourg: Wealth includes responsibility

Med praznovanjem hindujskega praznika v Indiji več deset mrtvih

Med praznovanjem hindujskega praznika džitija je v indijski zvezni državi Bihar od torka utonilo najmanj 46 ljudi, med njimi 37 otrok. Utopili so se med kopanjem v rekah in ribnikih, ki so narasli po nedavnem monsunskem deževju.

Utopitve so se zgodile od torka v 15 okrožjih zvezne države Bihar med praznovanjem hindujskega praznika džitija, med katerim se matere postijo za blaginjo svojih otrok, poroča francoska tiskovna agencija AFP. "Ljudje med praznovanjem niso bili pozorni na naraslo vodo v rekah in ribnikih," je povedal predstavnik lokalnih oblasti.

Nesreče med praznovanjem verskih praznikov v Indiji niso redke. Julija je v stampedu med hindujskim verskim zborovanjem na severu Indije umrlo več kot 100 ljudi.
2024-09-26.title: Med praznovanjem hindujskega praznika v Indiji več deset mrtvih

During the Hindu festival celebration in India, dozens of dead

At least 46 people, including 37 children, drowned on Tuesday in the Indian state of Bihar during the Hindu festival of Jiji. They drowned while diving in rivers and ponds that grew up after the recent monsoon rains.

The drownings occurred on Tuesday in 15 districts of Bihar state during the Hindu festival of Jiji, during which mothers fast for the welfare of their children, AFP news agency reports. "People did not notice the rising water in rivers and ponds during the celebration", said a local official.

Accidents during religious holidays in India are not uncommon. In July, more than 100 people died in a stampede during a Hindu religious gathering in northern India.

Ruske sile naj bi zavzele Ukrajinsk. Biden Ukrajini obljubil osem milijard dolarjev pomoči.

Rusija izvedla obsežen napad na ukrajinski energetski sistem

Ruske sile so po lastnih navedbah zavzele mesto Ukrajinsk 30 kilometrov zahodno od mesta Doneck. Ukrajinske letalske sile so sporočile, da so sestrelile več deset ruskih brezpilotnih letalnikov in štiri vodene rakete.

O zavzetju Ukrajinska, v katerem je pred vojno živelo več kot 10.000 ljudi, je na Telegramu poročalo rusko obrambno ministrstvo. Kot piše francoska tiskovna agencija AFP, je to ena od pomembnejših ozemeljskih pridobitev ruskih sil v zadnjih tednih med napredovanjem v Doneški oblasti, v kateri so prevzeli nadzor nad vrsto manjših vasi in naselij.

Rusija je znova izvedla tudi niz zračnih napadov nad več deli države. Nad Kijevom so ukrajinske sile danes sestrelile približno deset ruskih bojnih brezpilotnih letal. Ti so poškodovali avtomobile in povzročili požare, ki so jih po navedbah ukrajinske civilne zaščite pogasili, poroča nemška tiskovna agencija DPA.

Tarča napadov sta bili med drugim tudi oblasti Mikolajiv na jugu in Ivano-Frankivsk na zahodu države.

Rusija je po besedah ukrajinskega premierja Denisa Šmihala izvedla še en obsežni napad na ukrajinski energetski sistem. Tarča so bili zlasti trije objekti za prenos električne energije, je sporočil na družbenem omrežju Telegram ter dodal, da napadi niso dosegli svojega cilja.

Po navedbi ukrajinskih letalskih sil so sestrelili 66 od 78 ruskih brezpilotnih letal in štiri vodene rakete.

V raketnem napadu na Odeso je bil ubit en človek, v napadu z vodeno bombo na Zaporožje pa je bilo ranjenih najmanj osem ljudi, na spletni strani poroča ukrajinska tiskovna agencija Ukrinform. Dodaja, da so na enem od letališč v Rusiji zaznali tudi vzlet letala, ki nosi hipersonične balistične rakete kinžal.

Biden napovedal osem milijard dolarjev vredno vojaško pomoč Ukrajini

Ameriški predsednik Joe Biden je napovedal skoraj osem milijard vojaške pomoči za Ukrajino.

"Danes napovedujem povečanje varnostne pomoči Ukrajini in vrsto dodatnih ukrepov za pomoč Ukrajini pri zmagi v tej vojni," je v izjavi pred srečanjem z Zelenskim dejal Biden.

Obljubil je 7,9 milijarde dolarjev vojaške pomoči. Za okrepitev ukrajinskih sposobnosti napadov dolgega dosega bodo ZDA zagotovile Kijevu tudi bombe, ki imajo daljši doseg, ter dodatni sistem zračne obrambe patriot z raketami. Napovedal je še dodatno urjenje ukrajinskih sil za uporabo lovskih letal F-16 in za naslednje leto podprl usposabljanje dodatnih 18 pilotov.

Večji del nove pomoči, 5,5 milijarde dolarjev, bo dodeljen pred ponedeljkovim koncem ameriškega proračunskega leta, ko se iztečejo pooblastila za financiranje. Še 2,4 milijarde dolarjev je namenjenih v okviru pobude za varnostno pomoč Ukrajini, ki administraciji omogoča, da orožje za Ukrajino kupi od podjetij in ga ne vzame iz ameriških vojaških zalog.

Pomoč vključuje tudi prvo pošiljko natančno vodene drsne bombe, imenovane joint standoff weapon, z dosegom do 81 milj (130 km). Rakete srednjega dosega so za Ukrajino pomembna nadgradnja arzenala, ki ga uporablja za napade na ruske sile, saj lahko s tem orožjem to počne na varnejših razdaljah. Natančna bomba se odvrže z bojnih letal.

Bidnova izjava ne omenja možnosti, da bi Kijev lahko v prihodnje uporabljal ameriško orožje dolgega dosega tudi za napade v Rusiji.

Zelenski skuša prepričati Washington o tem, o tej temi pa bodo predvidoma govorili tudi danes na srečanju predsednikov. Ukrajinski predsednik pa je že pred srečanjem pozdravil novi paket pomoči.

"To pomoč bomo uporabili na najučinkovitejši in najbolj pregledni način za dosego našega glavnega skupnega cilja: zmage Ukrajine, pravičnega in trajnega miru ter čezatlantske varnosti," je Zelenski sporočil na družbenih omrežjih.

Ameriški predsednik je napovedal še srečanje več kot 50 ukrajinskih zaveznic v Nemčiji v oktobru. Na ravni voditeljev bodo skušali uskladiti prizadevanja za podporo Ukrajini pri njeni obrambi pred rusko agresijo.
2024-09-26.title: Ruske sile naj bi zavzele Ukrajinsk. Biden Ukrajini obljubil osem milijard dolarjev pomoči.

Russian forces are supposed to take over Ukrainian. Biden has promised Ukraine $8 billion in aid.

Russia has launched a massive attack on Ukraine's energy system.

Russian forces claimed to have captured the Ukrainian city 30 kilometers west of Donetsk. The Ukrainian Air Force reported that it had shot down dozens of Russian drones and four surface-to-air missiles.

The occupation of Ukraine, which had more than 10,000 inhabitants before the war, was reported by the Russian Ministry of Defense on the Telegram. According to the French news agency AFP, this is one of the most important territorial gains made by Russian forces in recent weeks as the Donetsk authorities take control of a number of smaller villages and settlements.

Russia has also carried out a series of airstrikes on several parts of the country. Over Kiev today, Ukrainian forces shot down about 10 Russian drones. They damaged cars and caused fires that Ukrainian civil protection officials said were extinguished, reports the German press agency DPA.

The target of the attacks was the authorities of Mikolajev in the south and Ivano-Frankivsk in the west.

According to the Ukrainian Prime Minister Denis Smihal, Russia has carried out another major attack on the Ukrainian energy system. The three electricity transmission facilities were targeted in particular, he said on Telegram, adding that the attacks failed to reach their target.

According to the Ukrainian Air Force, 66 of the 78 Russian drones and four surface-to-air missiles were shot down.

One person was killed in a rocket attack on Odessa and at least eight people were wounded in a water bomb attack on Zaporozhye, reports the Ukrainian news agency Ukrinform. He added that a plane carrying hypersonic kinzel ballistic missiles was also spotted taking off at one of Russia's airports.

Biden announced $8 billion in military aid to Ukraine

US President Joe Biden has announced nearly $8 billion in military aid to Ukraine.

"Today I announce an increase in security assistance to Ukraine and a series of additional measures to help Ukraine win this war", Biden said in a statement ahead of his meeting with Zelensky.

He promised $7.9 billion in military aid. To strengthen Ukraine's long-range attack capabilities, the United States will also provide Kiev with longer-range bombs and an additional Patriot missile air defense system. It also announced further training of the Ukrainian forces for the use of F-16 fighter jets and supported the training of 18 additional pilots for the following year.

The bulk of the new aid, $5.5 billion, will be awarded before the end of the US fiscal year on Monday, when the funding mandate expires. Another $2.4 billion is being allocated as part of the Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative, which allows the administration to buy weapons for Ukraine from companies and not take them out of US military stockpiles.

The aid also includes the first shipment of a precision guided rocket bomb, called a joint standoff weapon, with a range of up to 81 miles (130 km). The Ukrainian Armed Forces have been able to use the medium-range missiles to launch attacks against Russian forces. The precision bomb is dropped from the fighter jets.

Biden's statement does not mention the possibility that Kiev could use US long-range weapons in the future for attacks in Russia.

Green is trying to convince Washington of this, and this is a topic that is expected to be discussed at the Presidents' Meeting today. The Ukrainian President welcomed the new aid package ahead of the meeting.

"We will use this assistance in the most effective and transparent way to achieve our main common goal: the victory of Ukraine, a just and lasting peace and transatlantic security", Zelenskiy said in a social media post.

The US president has announced a meeting of more than 50 Ukrainian allies in Germany in October. At the level of the leaders, they will seek to coordinate efforts to support Ukraine in its defence against Russian aggression.

Sodišče EU-ja zavrnilo pritožbo Puigdemonta na odločitev Evropskega parlamenta

Sodišče EU-ja je dokončno zavrnilo pritožbo Carlesa Puigdemonta in katalonskega politika Tonija Comina na odločitev predsednika Evropskega parlamenta, da junija 2019 ne prizna njunega statusa poslanca Evropskega parlamenta.

Po mnenju Sodišča EU-ja predsednik Evropskega parlamenta ne more odstopati od seznama izvoljenih poslancev, o katerem so ga uradno obvestile španske oblasti. Prav tako nima pristojnosti preverjati točnosti seznama, ali pa bi s tem kršil delitev pristojnosti med EU-jem in državami članicami, je v današnji razsodbi zapisalo sodišče.

S tem ko je predsednik Evropskega parlamenta Puigdemontu zavrnil prevzem poslanske funkcije, je storil zgolj to, kar je moral storiti, namreč da se je seznanil s seznamom izvoljenih poslancev, ki ga je posredoval Madrid, je še pojasnilo sodišče v Luxembourgu.

Takratni predsednik Evropskega parlamenta Antonio Tajani se je po evropskih volitvah maja 2019 odločil, da Puigdemontu in Cominu, ki sta bila izvoljena v Evropski parlament, zavrne prevzem poslanskega sedeža.

Poslanca, ki sta se po neuspelem poskusu odcepitve Katalonije leta 2017 zatekla v Belgijo, namreč nista hotela odpotovati v Madrid, da bi izpričala zvestobo španski ustavi, kot se zahteva od vseh novoizvoljenih evropskih poslancev v Španiji.

Zaradi tega je Madrid njuni imeni izpustil z uradnega seznama poslancev, predloženega Bruslju. Posledično jima je Tajani onemogočil vstop v zgradbo parlamenta, pojasnjuje bruseljski portal Politico.

Tajanijev naslednik David Sassoli je Kataloncema decembra 2019 vendarle odobril dodelitev poslanskega sedeža in pisarne. Kljub temu sta se Puigdemont in Comin obrnila na Splošno sodišče EU-ja s pritožbo v zvezi s prvotno odločitvijo predsednika Evropskega parlamenta.

Splošno sodišče je pritožbo zavrnilo, zaradi česar sta se pritožila na Sodišče EU-ja, najvišje sodišče 27-članske povezave. To pa je danes sporočilo, da "dokončno zavrača" njuno pritožbo.

Comin je bil na letošnjih evropskih volitvah ponovno izvoljen v Evropski parlament in je vnovič zavrnil zahtevano prisego ustavi v Madridu. Predsednica Evropskega parlamenta Roberta Metsola je čakala na današnjo razsodbo Sodišča EU-ja, preden bi odločila o nadaljnjem ravnanju v zvezi s Cominovo poslansko funkcijo, še navaja Politico.

Puigdemont je bil v začetku avgusta deležen medijske pozornosti, ko se je kljub grožnji z aretacijo za nekaj ur pojavil v Barceloni ob glasovanju katalonskega parlamenta o novi vladi, nato pa je za njim izginila vsakršna sled. Pozneje je sporočil, da se je vrnil v Belgijo.
2024-09-26.title: Sodišče EU-ja zavrnilo pritožbo Puigdemonta na odločitev Evropskega parlamenta
2024-09-26.english_content:
The Court of Justice of the EU rejected Mr Puigdemont's appeal against the European Parliament decision

The Court of Justice of the EU has finally rejected the appeal by Carles Puigdemont and Catalan politician Toni Comin against the decision of the President of the European Parliament not to recognise their Member of the European Parliament status in June 2019.

The Court of Justice of the EU considers that the President of the European Parliament cannot withdraw from the list of elected Members notified to him by the Spanish authorities. Nor does it have the power to verify the accuracy of the list, or it would violate the division of powers between the EU and the Member States, the court noted in today's judgment.

By refusing to accept the post of President of the European Parliament, Mr Puigdemont did only what he had to do, which was to read the list of elected Members forwarded by Madrid, the Luxembourg court explained.

The President of the European Parliament at the time, Antonio Tajani, decided after the European elections in May 2019 to refuse Puigdemont and Comino, who had been elected to the European Parliament, the seat.

MEPs who fled to Belgium after the failed attempt to secede from Catalonia in 2017 did not want to travel to Madrid to testify to the Spanish Constitution, as required of all newly elected MEPs in Spain.

As a result, Madrid removed their names from the official list of Members submitted to Brussels. As a result, the Thai government has prevented them from entering the parliament building, explains the Brussels-based portal Politico.

The Commission has also taken the view that the Commission should be able to take the necessary measures to ensure that the measures are implemented in a manner that is consistent with the objectives of the Union's internal market. Nevertheless, Puigdemont and Comin appealed to the EU General Court against the original decision of the President of the European Parliament.

The General Court rejected the appeal, which led them to appeal to the Court of Justice of the EU, the highest court of the 27-member association. And that's the message today that he's "finally rejecting" their complaint.

Comin was re-elected to the European Parliament in this year's European elections and once again refused to take the oath of office in Madrid. European Parliament President Robert Metzla waited for the EU Court of Justice to rule on the next steps in Comin's parliamentary function, Politico reports.

Puigdemont received media attention in early August when, despite the threat of arrest, he appeared for a few hours in Barcelona during the Catalan Parliament's vote on a new government, and then all trace of him disappeared. Later he reported that he had returned to Belgium.
2024-09-26.english_title: The Court of Justice of the EU rejected Mr Puigdemont's appeal against the European Parliament decision

2024-09-26.content:
Slovenskega ribiča v hrvaškem morju napadla barakuda

Podvodnega ribiča iz Slovenije je v torek blizu dalmatinskega otoka Žirje napadla barakuda.

Riba je slovenskega ribiča po pisanju hrvaškega časnika Jutarnji list napadla, potem ko jo je ustrelil s podvodno puško. Po napadu so ga zaradi poškodb glave prepeljali v eno od splitskih bolnišnic in ni v smrtni nevarnosti.

Napad barakude na slovenskega ribiča so za Jutarnji list v sredo potrdili na policijski upravi šibeniško-kninske županije.

Pojasnili so, da je riba napadla ribiča tako, da ga je večkrat udarila v masko. Ta se je pri tem zlomila in povzročila poškodbe glave. Poškodovanega potapljača so sprva odpeljali v šibeniško bolnišnico, pozneje pa v eno od bolnišnic v Splitu.

Morski biolog Petar Kružić je za Jutarnji list dejal, se mu napad ribe v tem primeru ne zdi nenavaden. Kot pojasnil, je barakuda napadla ribiča, ki je nanjo streljal s puško, ker se je poskušala braniti.

"Gre za ribo, ki ima precej močne zobe in čeljust, ki jih uporablja za lov plena. Lahko vas poškoduje, če jo napadete. To, kar vemo zagotovo, pa je, da vas ne bo napadla iz ljubega miru, morda samo, če ščiti mladiče," je dodal.

Barakude so v tropskih morjih lahko daljše od dveh metrov, jadranska barakuda pa doseže do metra in pol.
2024-09-26.title: Slovenskega ribiča v hrvaškem morju napadla barakuda
2024-09-26.english_content:
Slovenian fisherman in the Croatian Sea attacked by barracuda

A Slovenian underwater fisherman was attacked by a barracuda near the Dalmatian island of Žira on Tuesday.

A Slovenian fisherman was attacked by a fish after he shot her with an underwater rifle, according to a report in the Croatian newspaper Jutarnja. After the attack, he was transferred to a Split hospital with head injuries and is not in danger of death.

The barracks attack on a Slovenian fisherman was confirmed by the police department of the Shibenik-Kenin county on Wednesday.

They explained that the fish attacked the fisherman by striking him in the mask several times. This one broke and caused head injuries. The injured diver was taken first to the Sibenik hospital and later to one of the hospitals in Split.

The marine biologist Petar Kružić told the Morning Post that he did not find the attack of fish unusual in this case. He explained that the barracks was attacked by a fisherman who shot her with a rifle because she was trying to defend herself.

"It's a fish with fairly strong teeth and jaws that it uses to hunt prey. She could hurt you if you attack her. What we know for sure is that she will not attack you out of love, perhaps only if she protects the puppy", he added.

In the tropical seas, the barracuda can be more than two metres [2.5 ft] long, and the sailing barracuda can reach up to a metre [1.5 ft].
2024-09-26.english_title: Slovenian fisherman in the Croatian Sea attacked by barracuda
