UN Security Council pigeon: world needs leadership urgently

Slovenia has held a special session of the UN Security Council, chaired by the President of the Council of Europe.

The UN Security Council unanimously endorsed the Presidential Declaration, before a special session prepared by the Slovenian Presidency, recognising, inter alia, the importance of multilateralism and recognising the responsibilities it has under the UN Charter.

A special Security Council meeting entitled "Leadership for Peace" held during the September Presidency during the General Debate of World Leaders at 79. Slovenia was prepared for the UN General Assembly, chaired by Slovenian Prime Minister Robert Golob. The President read the Presidency's statement at the beginning of the session, which is the second most important instrument of the UN Security Council resolution and must be adopted unanimously.

"The Security Council stresses the importance of maintaining multilateralism and the central role of the UN, stresses its support for coordination within the UN, ensuring change for the most vulnerable, such as the Sustainable Development Goals and conflict prevention, and commends humanitarian workers", the statement said.

The Declaration reaffirms the principles of the UN Charter and stresses the need to strengthen resolve to maintain international peace and security in accordance with the Charter more urgent than ever.

The Security Council therefore reaffirms its primary responsibility for the maintenance of international peace and security, its commitment to international law, stresses the need to respect its resolutions and to promote equal participation of women at all levels of decision-making.

The Presidency's statement also states that the Security Council is aware of the complexity of the challenges and threats to international peace and security and stresses the importance of a comprehensive approach to peace-keeping. The Reports express strong support for the protection of civilians in armed conflict, call on all parties to armed conflict to fully respect their obligations under international humanitarian law, and reiterate their commitment to liability for violations.

"The Security Council is fully aware of the responsibilities imposed upon it by the Charter of the United Nations and the joint efforts of the nations of the world which compel it to take effective action to maintain international peace and security. He expresses his commitment to fulfill his responsibilities in the most effective manner. It also recognizes that the spirit that led to the establishment of the United Nations must prevail and inspire humanity to persevere on the path of peace", the statement says.

The UN Security Council has called for a renewed confidence in the UN.

Golob called for a restoration of confidence in the United Nations, especially the Security Council, and called it unacceptable that a record number of civilians, humanitarian workers and journalists were killed worldwide last year.

Slovenia has seen a steady decline in the strength of the rules drawn up after World War II and its inability to respond to major conflicts such as those in Ukraine, Gaza and Sudan since its membership in the Security Council, Golob stressed. "That's why we've prepared this event. The world urgently needs leadership", he said.

He called the war in Ukraine a clear violation of the UN Charter, which could open the door to similar wars around the world. He is unacceptable that the Security Council is not able to act more decisively despite the atrocities against the Palestinians and that a new genocide is being announced in Sudan, including in Darfur.

'Slovenia strives to be an honest mediator, a bridge and a builder of consensus. Our policies are based on values and principles. What we committed to in our campaign for a seat on the Security Council, we are also trying to achieve. We are committed to applying the same standards to all conflicts,' he stressed.

Golob called for greater consideration of the common rather than national interests and cited some past success stories of the Security Council, such as Liberia, Sierra Leone and East Timor, where he acted with the tools available. In the former Yugoslavia, he succeeded in establishing an international criminal court, which today seems unimaginable, Golob said.

He said the Security Council had a share of responsibility for the record number of civilian casualties worldwide and urged countries to think about it. "We need to rebuild confidence in the United Nations", he said, calling for efforts to increase efficiency and reforms, with permanent members having a particular responsibility.

"Let me conclude in words that the principles of multilateralism  ⁇  the idea that nations must work together to maintain peace  ⁇  are as important today as they were 79 years ago. Today we were able to gather around the presidential statement. Let us build on this foundation and re-encourage our joint work for a better, more peaceful and more humane world,' concluded Golob.

The meeting, which is attended by around 90 countries, will continue until the evening when the Security Council meets at the request of France for an extraordinary meeting on Lebanon.
2024-09-25.english_title: UN Security Council pigeon: world needs leadership urgently

Kijev: Ne bomo sprejeli vsiljenega mirovnega sporazuma. Moskva: Rusije ni mogoče prisiliti v mir.

Putin sklical sestanek ruskega varnostnega sveta na temo jedrskega odvračanja

Ukrajinski predsednik Volodimir Zelenski je v Združenih narodih podvomil o motivih Kitajske in Brazilije pri spodbujanju mirovnih pogovorov z Rusijo ter dejal, da bo Moskvo k miru treba prisiliti. Kremelj je njegov poziv označil za usodno napako.

Ukrajinski predsednik Volodimir Zelenski je v sredo zavrnil prizadevanja Kitajske in Brazilije za končanje ruske vojne v Ukrajini ter se vprašal, zakaj dvojica predlaga alternativo njegovemu lastnemu mirovnemu načrtu.

Rusija je Ukrajino napadla februarja 2022, devet mesecev pozneje je Zelenski objavil mirovni načrt za pravičen konec vojne v desetih točkah, na podlagi ustanovne listine ZN-a in mednarodnega prava. Moskva je načrt zavrnila.

"Mirovni načrt obstaja že dve leti in morda si kdo za svojo politično biografijo želi Nobelovo nagrado, zamrznjeno premirje namesto pravega miru, vendar bo edina nagrada, ki jo bo dal Putin v zameno, več trpljenja in nesreč," je Zelenski dejal Generalni skupščini ZN-a.

Zelenski je dejal, da bi predlaganje "alternativ, medlih dogovorov, tako imenovanih sklopov načel", Putinu odprlo politični prostor za nadaljevanje vojne.

Kitajska si prizadeva, da bi se mirovnemu načrtu v šestih točkah, ki ga je maja izdala skupaj z Brazilijo, priključile države v razvoju. Njun predlog poziva k mednarodni mirovni konferenci, ki bi "potekala ob primernem času, ki ga priznavata tako Rusija kot Ukrajina, z enakopravnim sodelovanjem obeh strani in pošteno razpravo o vseh mirovnih načrtih".

"Ko skuša kitajsko-brazilski duet prerasti v zbor glasov – z nekom v Evropi, z nekom v Afriki – in govori o čem drugem kot popolnemu in pravičnemu miru, se pojavi vprašanje, kaj je resnični interes? Vsi morajo razumeti – ne boste povečali svoje moči na račun Ukrajine," je dejal Zelenski.

Ukrajinski predsednik namerava v četrtek v Beli hiši ameriškemu predsedniku Joeju Bidnu predstaviti svoj "načrt zmage".

Moskva: Rusije ni mogoče prisiliti v mir

Tiskovni predstavnik Kremlja Dmitrij Peskov je medtem posvaril pred siljenjem Rusije v mir, češ da bi to bila usodna napaka.

Peskov se je odzval na govor Zelenskega, ki je v torek Varnostnemu svetu Združenih narodov dejal, da vojne med Rusijo in Ukrajino ni mogoče umiriti samo s pogovori. "Rusijo je mogoče v mir le prisiliti," je dejal ukrajinski predsednik, ki zaveznice že dolgo prosi za sprostitev omejitev glede uporabe zahodnega orožja dolgega dosega za napade na cilje globoko na ozemlju Rusije.

"Stališče, ki temelji na poskusu, da bi Rusijo prisilili k miru, je usodna, sistemska napaka," je dejal Peskov in napovedal, da bo imelo takšno "zmotno razumevanje" neizogibne posledice za Kijev.

Po njegovih besedah je Rusija sicer naklonjena miru, vendar pod pogojem, da se ji zagotovi stabilnost in da so cilji posebne vojaške operacije, kakor v Moskvi imenujejo vojno v Ukrajini, izpolnjeni. "Brez uresničitve teh ciljev je Rusijo nemogoče prisiliti," je poudaril.

Putin sklical sestanek ruskega varnostnega sveta

Ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin je zagrozil z uporabo jedrskega orožja v primeru obsežnega zračnega napada na državo. Izjavo je podal na ruskem varnostnem svetu o spremembi ruske jedrske doktrine.

Tiskovni predstavnik Kremlja Dmitrij Peskov je pred tem poudaril, da je sestanek varnostnega sveta, ki ga sestavljajo Putinovi najmočnejši in najbližnji sodelavci, "pomemben dogodek", in dodal, da bo vsebina označena z oznako "strogo zaupno".

Moskva namreč razmišlja o odgovoru na ponavljajoče se zahteve Ukrajine, saj Zelenski že več mesecev poziva zaveznike, naj Ukrajini uporabo zahodnih raketnih sistemov, vključno z ameriškimi raketami dolgega dosega ATACMS in britanskimi Storm Shadows, za napade globoko v rusko ozemlje, s čimer želijo Rusiji omejiti ali preprečiti možnost napadov na ukrajinsko ozemlje. Putin je dejal, da bi se v tem primeru Zahod neposredno spopadel z Rusijo in da bi bila Rusija prisiljena sprejeti "ustrezne odločitve".

V primeru napada na Rusijo od države brez jedrskega orožja ob sodelovanju ali podpori jedrske sile bi napad obravnavali kot njihov skupni napad na Rusijo, je Putin orisal predlog posodobitve doktrine. Dodal je, da vključuje tudi položaj, v katerem druga država z uporabo konvencionalnega orožja pomembno ogrozi rusko suverenost.

Pri tem je očitno meril na Ukrajino, ki nima jedrskega orožja, vendar prejema vojaško podporo držav z jedrskim orožjem, poroča AFP. Sprememba doktrine bi veljala tudi v primeru napada na Belorusijo, tesno zaveznico Rusije, je povedal Putin.

"O takšni možnosti bomo razmislili, ko bomo prejeli zanesljive informacije o množični izstrelitvi orožja za napad iz zraka in vesolja ter o njegovem prečkanju naše državne meje," je dejal Putin.

Rusija je največja svetovna jedrska sila. Skupaj z ZDA nadzorujejo 88 odstotkov vseh jedrskih bojnih glav na svetu. Moskva trenutno prenavlja svojo jedrsko doktrino, ki določa okoliščine, v katerih Rusija lahko uporabi jedrsko orožje.

S krhanjem svetovnega soglasja o jedrskem orožju, ki se je načelo po padcu Sovjetske zveze, so se omajale tudi pogodbe o nadzoru, ki so skušale omiliti takratno jedrsko oboroževalno tekmo.

Kremelj je že dejal, da bi ob vseh razpravah o obnovitvi ameriško-ruske pogodbe o nadzoru o jedrskem orožju Novi začetek (New Start), ki se izteče leta 2026, upoštevati tudi evropski jedrski potencial, s čimer je mislil arzenale Velike Britanije in Francije.

"Od Američanov še nismo prejeli odgovora na to vprašanje, seveda pa je potreben dogovor in pogajanja bi se morala začeti čim prej," je dejal Peskov na vprašanje o morebitni zamenjavi nove pogodbe Start.
2024-09-25.title: Kijev: Ne bomo sprejeli vsiljenega mirovnega sporazuma. Moskva: Rusije ni mogoče prisiliti v mir.
2024-09-25.english_content:
We will not accept a forced peace agreement. Moscow: Russia cannot be forced into peace.

Putin has convened a meeting of the Russian Security Council on nuclear deterrence

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has called into question the motives of China and Brazil in promoting peace talks with Russia at the United Nations, saying Moscow will have to be forced into peace. The Kremlin called his call a fatal mistake.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday rejected China and Brazil's efforts to end Russia's war in Ukraine and questioned why the two were proposing an alternative to his own peace plan.

Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, nine months later Zelensky published a ten-point peace plan for a just end to the war, based on the UN Charter and international law. Moscow rejected the plan.

"The peace plan has been in place for two years and perhaps someone wants the Nobel Prize for his political biography, a frozen truce instead of real peace, but the only prize Putin will give in return will be more suffering and misfortune", Zelensky told the UN General Assembly.

Zelensky said that proposing "alternatives, intermediate agreements, so-called sets of principles", would open up political space for Putin to continue the war.

China is working to bring the developing countries into the six-point peace plan it released in May with Brazil. Their proposal calls for an international peace conference to "take place at an appropriate time, recognized by both Russia and Ukraine, with equal cooperation from both sides and a fair discussion of all peace plans".

"When a Chinese-Brazilian duo tries to grow into a choir of voices with someone in Europe, with someone in Africa, and talk about something other than perfect and just peace, the question arises, what is the real interest? Everyone must understand that you will not increase your power at the expense of Ukraine", Zelensky said.

The Ukrainian president plans to present his "win plan" to US President Joe Biden at the White House on Thursday.

Moscow: Russia cannot be forced into peace

Meanwhile, the Kremlin's press secretary Dmitry Peskov warned that forcing Russia into peace would be a fatal mistake.

Peskov responded to Zelensky's speech to the UN Security Council on Tuesday saying that wars between Russia and Ukraine cannot be settled by just talks. "Russia can only be forced into peace", said the Ukrainian president, who has long called on the Allies to relax restrictions on the use of Western long-range weapons to attack targets deep within Russia's territory.

"The stance based on an attempt to force Russia into peace is a fateful, systemic mistake", Peskov said, predicting that such a "misunderstanding" would have inevitable consequences for Kiev.

According to him, Russia is peace-loving, but only if it is ensured stability and the objectives of the special military operation, as Moscow calls the war in Ukraine, are met. "Without achieving these objectives, it is impossible to force Russia", he stressed.

Putin has called a meeting of the Russian Security Council

Russian President Vladimir Putin has threatened to use nuclear weapons in the event of a major air strike on the country. He made a statement to the Russian Security Council about changing Russia's nuclear doctrine.

The Kremlin press spokesman Dmitry Peskov previously stressed that the meeting of the Security Council, composed of Putin's most powerful and closest associates, is an "important event", adding that the content will be marked "highly confidential".

Moscow has been considering responding to Ukraine's repeated requests, as Zelensky has been urging its allies for months to use Western missile systems, including the US long-range ATACMS and the UK's Storm Shadows, to strike deep into Russian territory, thereby limiting or preventing the possibility of attacks on Ukrainian territory. Putin said that in this case the West would face Russia directly and that Russia would be forced to take "appropriate decisions".

In the event of an attack on Russia by a non-nuclear-armed country with the cooperation or support of a nuclear power, the attack would be treated as their joint attack on Russia, Putin proposed an update of the doctrine. It also includes a situation where another state, using conventional weapons, seriously threatens Russian sovereignty.

He apparently pointed to Ukraine, which has no nuclear weapons but receives military support from nuclear-armed countries, AFP reports. The doctrine change would also apply in the event of an attack on Belarus, Russia's close ally, Putin said.

"We will consider such a possibility when we receive reliable information about the mass launching of aerial and space attack weapons and their crossing our national borders", Putin said.

Russia is the world's largest nuclear power. Together with the United States, they control 88 percent of the world's nuclear warheads. Moscow is currently renewing its nuclear doctrine, which sets out the circumstances under which Russia may use nuclear weapons.

The breaking of the global nuclear agreement, which had been in principle established after the fall of the Soviet Union, also led to the breakup of control treaties that sought to thwart the nuclear arms race at the time.

The Kremlin has already said that all discussions on the renewal of the U.S.-Russia Nuclear Arms Control Treaty, New Start, due in 2026, would also take into account European nuclear potential, which he meant the arsenals of the United Kingdom and France.

"We have not yet received an answer from the Americans to this question, but of course an agreement is needed and negotiations should start as soon as possible", Peskov said when asked about the possible replacement of the new Start contract.
2024-09-25.english_title: We will not accept a forced peace agreement. Moscow: Russia cannot be forced into peace.

Po polomu na volitvah v nemški deželni parlament odstopilo vodstvo Zelenih

Stranka na volitvah v dveh vzhodnih nemških deželah ni presegla petodstotnega volilnega praga

Vodstvo nemških Zelenih, vključno s sopredsedujočima stranki, je po neuspehu na deželnih volitvah napovedalo odstop. Do odstopa prihaja leto dni pred naslednjimi zveznimi volitvami v Nemčiji.

"Potreben je nov zagon," je dejal Omid Nouripour, ki je novico o odstopu objavil na novinarski konferenci skupaj s sopredsedujočo Ricardo Lang.

Po besedah Nouripourja stranka trpi za "najhujšo krizo v desetletju", potem ko ta mesec na volitvah v dveh vzhodnih nemških deželah ni presegla petodstotnega volilnega praga in je ostala zunaj parlamenta.

"Čas je, da damo usodo naše stranke v nove roke," je še dejal in pozval stranko, naj izvoli novo vodstvo. Tega naj bi izbrali na kongresu stranke sredi novembra.

Lang pa je dejala, da stranka "potrebuje nove obraze, da jo popeljejo iz krize" pred volitvami prihodnje leto, poroča nemška tiskovna agencija DPA.

Zeleni, ki so ob socialdemokratih in liberalcih del vladajoče koalicije kanclerja Olafa Scholza, na nedavnih volitvah v Turingiji in Brandenburgu niso dobili dovolj glasov za vstop v deželni parlament, na Saškem pa jim je to uspelo le za las.

Zunanja ministrica Annalena Baerbock, ki je skupaj z ministrom za gospodarstvo Robertom Habeckom najvidnejša članica vlade iz vrst Zelenih, je dejala, da mora stranka ponovno pridobiti zaupanje javnosti. Stranka mora po njenem mnenju najti načine, kako prepričati ljudi, da so "spremembe dobre in pomembne" za boj proti podnebnim spremembam ter "za močno Evropo, za pravičnost v tej državi in za mir v Evropi".

Habeck pa je napovedani odstop obeh sopredsedujočih označil za "veliko služenje stranki", njun korak pa kaže na "veliko moč in odgovornost".
2024-09-25.title: Po polomu na volitvah v nemški deželni parlament odstopilo vodstvo Zelenih

After a defeat in the German parliamentary elections, the Green leadership resigned

The party in the elections in the two East German states did not exceed the voting threshold of 5%

The leadership of the German Greens, including the co-chair party, announced its resignation following a failed regional election. The resignation comes a year before the next federal election in Germany.

"A new start is needed", said Omid Nouripour, who announced the news of the resignation at a press conference with co-chair Ricardo Lang.

According to Nouripour, the party is suffering from "the worst crisis in a decade" after it failed to cross the 5% electoral threshold in the two East German states this month and remained outside parliament.

"It is time to put the fate of our clients in new hands", he said, urging the client to elect new leadership. This is the one who was supposed to be elected at the party congress in mid-November.

Lang said the party "needs new faces to pull it out of the crisis" before next year's election, reports German news agency DPA.

The Greens, who are part of the ruling coalition of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democrats and Liberals, in the recent elections in Thuringia and Brandenburg did not get enough votes to enter the provincial parliament, but in Saxony they did so only by their hair.

Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock, who together with Minister of Economy Robert Habeck is the most prominent member of the Green Party, said the party must regain public confidence. The Party must find ways to convince people that "change is good and important" for combating climate change and "for a strong Europe, for justice in this country and for peace in Europe".

Mr Habeck called the announcement of the two co-chairs' resignation "a great service to the client" and their move indicated "great power and responsibility".
2024-09-25.english_title: After a defeat in the German parliamentary elections, the Green leadership resigned

2024-09-25.content:
Pred kavarno v Kölnu odjeknila eksplozija

V mestu Köln na zahodu Nemčije je odjeknila eksplozija, v kateri je bila poškodovana kavarna. Gre za zadnjo v vrsti skrivnostnih eksplozij, za katere oblasti menijo, da bi bile lahko povezane s spori med rivalskimi mamilarskimi tolpami.

Po podatkih nemške policije so ob okoli 2.45 po srednjeevropskem času tamkajšnji prebivalci slišali eksplozijo v okrožju Pesch. Kmalu zatem pa je zagorelo v kavarni v pritličju stanovanjske stavbe. Gasilci so pred gašenjem požara za krajši čas iz stavbe evakuirali približno 20 ljudi. Dve osebi sta bili lažje poškodovani, je poročal DPA.

Kot je sporočil tiskovni predstavnik policije, poteka preiskava incidenta in njegovih morebitnih povezav z nedavnim nizom eksplozij v mestu. Prejšnji teden sta denimo v nekaj dneh v Kölnu odjeknili dve eksploziji, ena pred trgovino z oblačili, druga pa pred nočnim klubom. Oblasti menijo, da bi bile eksplozije lahko povezane s spori med rivalskimi mamilarskimi tolpami.

"Očitno so v tem okolju neplačani računi, ki se še vedno poravnavajo," je prejšnji teden izjavil vodja kölnskega kriminalističnega oddelka Michael Esser in dodal, da se s primeri ukvarja več kot 60 preiskovalcev. Kölnski tožilec Ulrich Bremer pa je pojasnil, da se eden od teh "neplačanih računov" nanaša na izginotje približno 300 kilogramov konoplje.
2024-09-25.title: Pred kavarno v Kölnu odjeknila eksplozija
2024-09-25.english_content:
Explosion outside a coffee shop in Cologne

In the western German city of Cologne, an explosion damaged a coffee shop. It's the latest in a series of mysterious explosions that authorities believe could be linked to rival drug gangs.

According to German police, about 2:45 a.m. local residents heard the explosion in the Pesch district. Soon after, it burned down in a coffee shop on the ground floor of an apartment building. Firefighters evacuated about 20 people from the building before extinguishing the fire. Two people were more likely to be injured, the DPA reported.

According to a police spokesman, an investigation into the incident and its possible links to a recent series of explosions in the city is underway. For example, last week, two explosions were detonated in Cologne in a few days, one outside a clothing store and the other outside a nightclub. Authorities believe the explosions could be linked to a dispute between rival drug gangs.

"It is clear that there are unpaid bills still settled in this environment", said Michael Esser, head of the Cologne Criminal Division, last week, adding that more than 60 investigators are involved in the cases. Cologne Prosecutor Ulrich Bremer explained that one of these "unpaid bills" involved the disappearance of some 300 kilograms of hemp.
2024-09-25.english_title: Explosion outside a coffee shop in Cologne

2024-09-25.content:
EU napovedal zmanjšanje zaščite volka. Sprememba ne bo vplivala na upravljanje volka v Sloveniji.

Slovenija naj bi se pri odločanju vzdržala

V Bruslju so potrdili, da bodo države članice EU-ja podprle zmanjšanje zaščite volka, ki ga je decembra predlagala Evropska komisija. Sprememba ne bo vplivala na upravljanje volka v Sloveniji, so zapisali na pristojnem ministrstvu.

Status zaščite volka izhaja iz mednarodne bernske konvencije o varstvu prostoživečega evropskega rastlinstva in živalstva ter naravnih habitatov, katere pogodbenice so tudi EU in njegove članice. Po konvenciji je bil status zaščite določen na podlagi razpoložljivih znanstvenih podatkov iz leta 1979.

Evropska komisija je septembra lani napovedala zbiranje novih podatkov, na podlagi katerih se je decembra odločila, da predlaga spremembo statusa zaščite volka iz strogo zaščitenega v zaščitenega.

V sredo so predstavniki držav članic s t. i. kvalificirano večino podprli zmanjšanje zaščite, so potrdili na Evropski komisiji. Slovenija predlogu Evropske komisije za spremembo statusa ni nasprotovala, glasovanja se je vzdržala.

Na komisiji so odločitev Sveta EU-ja, ki jo bodo v četrtek predvidoma uradno potrdili ministri, pristojni za konkurenčnost, pozdravili.

"Po našem mnenju bo prilagoditev statusa zaščite pomemben korak pri naslovitvi izzivov, ki jih predstavljajo naraščajoče populacije volkov, in ohranjanja vrst hkrati," je povedal njen tiskovni predstavnik Adalbert Jahnz.

Pojasnil je, da bo po uradni odločitvi Sveta EU-ja komisija stalnemu odboru bernske konvencije, ki se bo naslednjič sestal v začetku decembra, podala predlog za spremembo statusa zaščite volka. Sprememba konvencije je namreč predpogoj za spremembo zakonodaje EU-ja. Če bo stalni odbor potrdil spremembo konvencije, bo nato komisija predlagala tudi spremembo statusa v evropski direktivi o habitatih.

Več kot 300 organizacij za zaščito okolja in živali, med njimi tudi več slovenskih, je sicer pretekli teden ob 45. obletnici bernske konvencije pozvalo članice, naj zavrnejo predlog Evropske komisije o znižanju zaščite volkov. Države članice bi morale zaščito volkov okrepiti, ne pa oslabiti, so prepričane organizacije.

Sprememba bernske konvencije ne bo vplivala na slovenskega volka

Volk v Sloveniji v okviru bernske konvencije ni zavarovan, tako da sprememba varstvenega statusa ne bo imela vpliva na upravljanje volka v okviru bernske konvencije na ozemlju Slovenije, so za STA pojasnili na ministrstvu za naravne vire in prostor. 

"Danes potrjeni sklep Sveta EU-ja oz. dokončna potrditev spremembe varstvenega statusa volka na stalnem odboru bernske konvencije predvidoma decembra letos nima oz. ne bo imel vpliva na upravljanje volka v okviru bernske konvencije na ozemlju Slovenije," so navedli na ministrstvu.

Pojasnili so, da je volk od začetka veljavnosti bernske konvencije leta 1982 uvrščen na prilogo II, ki govori o strogo zavarovanih živalskih vrstah, vendar je Slovenija ob ratifikaciji bernske konvencije leta 1999 dala pridržek do varstva volka. "S pridržkom je Slovenija izrazila nasprotovanje kakršni koli zaščiti volka, kar pomeni, da volk v Sloveniji v okviru bernske konvencije ni zavarovan," so navedli.

Sklep Sveta EU-ja o vložitvi predlogov za spremembo prilog II in III bernske konvencije v zvezi z volkom tako po pojasnilih ministrstva za naravne vire in prostor nima vpliva na upravljanje volka v okviru bernske konvencije na ozemlju Slovenije. "Zato predlogu Slovenija ni nasprotovala in se je vzdržala glasovanja," so stališče Slovenije pojasnili na ministrstvu.

So pa v povezavi statusom zaščite volka pri nas razložili, da je Slovenija zavezana k izpolnjevanju zahteve direktive o habitatih, v okviru katere je volk uvrščen na prilogo IV, na kateri so vrste v interesu skupnosti, ki jih je treba strogo varovati. Slovenija je omenjeno habitatno direktivo v svoj pravni red prenesla z uredbo o zavarovanih prostoživečih rastlinskih in živalskih vrstah.

Ta tako določa tudi pravila varovanja volka. Kot so prav danes v odziv glede odvzema volkov iz narave z odstrelom na območju Jelovice in Pokljuke spomnili na ministrstvu za naravne vire in prostor, je glede na varstveni status volka poseg v populacijo dopusten, vendar morajo biti v skladu z omenjeno uredbo izpolnjeni trije pogoji, in sicer da ni druge zadovoljive možnosti, da ta ravnanja ne škodujejo ohranitvi ugodnega stanja populacije in da gre za enega od razlogov, navedenih v uredbi, denimo preprečitev resne škode.

V slovenskih gozdovih se giblje 117 volkov

Za Slovenijo je glede na zadnje poročilo Zavoda za gozdove Slovenije (ZGS) o spremljanju stanja ohranjenosti volka v Sloveniji ocena, da je bilo v sezoni 2022/2023 v Sloveniji 117 volkov, kar predstavlja oceno povprečnega števila volkov, ki je v danem trenutku v državi. V sezoni 2022/2023 so sicer na območju Slovenije potrdili prisotnost 17 volčjih tropov in enega tropa križancev med volkom in domačim psom.

Večletna dinamika kaže, da je populacija volka pri nas od leta 2010, odkar izvajajo genetski monitoring, stalno naraščala do sezone 2019/2020. Med letoma 2010 in 2020 se je populacija povečala za približno trikrat. Se pa glede na rezultate monitoringa v sezoni 2022/2023 opaža ustavitev rasti populacije.

"To kaže na stabilizacijo populacije v trenutnih prostorskih okvirih, tudi v Alpah, seveda pa to ne pomeni, da se v prihodnjih letih volk ne bo razširil tudi na druga območja države, kjer danes še ni stalno prisoten, kar utegne sprožiti ponoven cikel populacijske rasti. Na podlagi vseh podatkov lahko varstveno stanje opredelimo kot ugodno," je med drugim zapisano v omenjenem poročilu ZGS-ja. Objavljeno je bilo oktobra 2023.
2024-09-25.title: EU napovedal zmanjšanje zaščite volka. Sprememba ne bo vplivala na upravljanje volka v Sloveniji.
2024-09-25.english_content:
The EU has announced a reduction in wolf protection. The change will not affect the management of wolves in Slovenia.

Slovenia should abstain from the decision

In Brussels, they confirmed that EU Member States will support the reduction in wolf protection proposed by the European Commission in December. The change will not affect the management of wolves in Slovenia, they wrote to the competent ministry.

The status of wolf protection is derived from the Berne Convention on the protection of wildlife in Europe and natural habitats, to which the EU and its Member States are also parties. The Convention established the status of protection on the basis of the available scientific data from 1979.

Last September, the European Commission announced the collection of new data, which led it to propose in December a change in wolf protection status from strictly protected to protected.

On Wednesday, representatives of the Member States supported the reduction of protection by a qualified majority, they confirmed at the European Commission. Slovenia did not oppose the European Commission's proposal to amend its status, abstaining from voting.

The Commission welcomed the EU Council's decision, which is expected to be formally endorsed by the Ministers responsible for Competitiveness on Thursday.

"We believe that the adaptation of the protection status will be an important step in addressing the challenges posed by the increasing wolf population and preserving the species at the same time", said Adalbert Jahnz, its spokesman.

He explained that, following an official decision of the EU Council, the Commission will submit a proposal to the Standing Committee of the Berne Convention, which will meet next early December, to amend the wolf protection status. The amendment of the Convention is a prerequisite for the amendment of EU legislation. If the Standing Committee approves the amendment to the Convention, the Commission will then also propose an amendment to the status of the European Habitats Directive.

More than 300 environmental and animal protection organisations, including several Slovenian ones, called on Member States last week to reject the European Commission's proposal to reduce wolf protection. Member States should strengthen wolf protection rather than weaken it, the organisations are convinced.

The amendment to the Berne Convention will not affect the Slovenian wolf

The wolf in Slovenia is not protected under the Berne Convention, so the change in the protection status will not affect the management of the Berne Convention wolf in the territory of Slovenia, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Space explained to STA.

"Today's confirmed decision of the EU Council or final confirmation of the change of the wolf protection status at the Standing Committee on the Berne Convention is not expected to affect or have any impact on the management of wolves under the Berne Convention in the territory of Slovenia", the ministry said.

They explained that since the entry into force of the Berne Convention in 1982, the wolf has been included in Annex II, which deals with strictly protected animal species, but Slovenia made reservations to the protection of the wolf when ratifying the Berne Convention in 1999. 'Slovenia has expressed its opposition with reservations to any wolf protection, which means that wolves are not protected in Slovenia under the Berne Convention,' they stated.

The EU Council Decision on the submission of proposals for amendments to Annexes II and III to the Berne Convention as regards wolves, as explained by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Space, has no effect on the management of wolves under the Berne Convention in the territory of Slovenia. 'Therefore Slovenia did not oppose the proposal and abstained from voting,' the Slovenian position was explained at the Ministry.

However, in connection with the status of protection of wolves, it has been explained to us that Slovenia is obliged to comply with the requirements of the Habitats Directive, under which wolves are listed in Annex IV, and which are species of Community interest which must be strictly protected. Slovenia has transposed that Habitats Directive into its legal order by means of a regulation on protected wildlife species of plants and animals.

It also sets out the rules for protecting wolves. As was just recalled today in the response to the withdrawal of wolves from the wild by shooting in the Jelovica and Pokljuka areas to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Space, due to the conservation status of wolves, intervention in the population is permissible, but three conditions must be fulfilled in accordance with that Regulation, namely that there is no other satisfactory possibility that such action does not harm the maintenance of the favourable status of the population and that one of the reasons listed in the Regulation is to prevent serious damage.

117 wolves are moving in the Slovenian forests

For Slovenia, according to the latest report of the Forestry Authority of Slovenia (FSA) on the monitoring of the state of wolf conservation in Slovenia, it is estimated that there were 117 wolves in Slovenia in the 2022/2023 season, which is an estimate of the average number of wolves present in the country at the time. In the 2022/2023 season, 17 wolf trout and one cross trout were confirmed in the territory of Slovenia.

Multi-year dynamics show that the wolf population in our country has been steadily increasing since 2010 when genetic monitoring was carried out until the 2019/2020 season. Between 2010 and 2020, the population increased by about three times. However, the monitoring results for the 2022/23 season show a halt in population growth.

'This indicates that the population is stabilizing in the current geographical areas, including the Alps, but of course this does not mean that in the coming years wolves will not spread to other areas of the country where they are not present at all, which could trigger a new cycle of population growth. On the basis of all the data, the conservation status can be considered favourable', says the ZGS report. It was published in October 2023.
2024-09-25.english_title: The EU has announced a reduction in wolf protection. The change will not affect the management of wolves in Slovenia.

2024-09-25.author: G. V.
2024-09-25.content:
Uničujoče poplave nakazujejo podnebno prihodnost Evrope

V nedavnih poplavah v Srednji Evropi umrlo 24 ljudi

Zaradi podnebnih sprememb je dvakrat večja možnost za hude nalive, kot so nedavno prizadeli srednjo Evropo, kjer so sprožili uničujoče poplave, ugotavlja poročilo mednarodne skupine znanstvenikov.

Srednjo Evropo so ta mesece prizadele najhujše poplave v zadnjih najmanj dveh desetletjih in zahtevale 24 smrtnih žrtev. Narasle vode so za seboj pustile poškodovane zgradbe in porušene mostovi, medtem ko so bile ulice poplavljenih mest polne blata in uničene imovine. Oblasti ocenjujejo, da bo končna škoda znašala več milijard evrov.

Poročilo mednarodne skupine znanstvenikov World Weather Attribution, ki preučuje učinke podnebnih sprememb na ekstremne vremenske dogodke, je ugotovilo, da so bili štirje dnevi padavin med nevihto Boris najhujši od začetka meritev v srednji Evropi.

Po njihovih ugotovitvah bodo v prihodnosti taki nalivi vsaj dvakrat bolj verjetni in še za sedem odstotkov močnejši.

"Te poplave so znova izpostavile uničujoče posledice globalnega segrevanja, ki ga povzročajo fosilna goriva," je v izjavi dejala raziskovalka na Grantham Institute Imperial College London in soavtorica študije Joyce Kimutai.

"Dokler nafte, plina in premoga ne bomo zamenjali z obnovljivo energijo, bodo neurja, kot je Boris, sprožila še močnejše padavine in povzročila poplave, ki uničujejo gospodarstvo," je opozorila.

Nenavadna kombinacija nad Evropo

V poročilu piše, da je bila kombinacija vremenskih vzorcev, ki je povzročila nevihto – vključno s hladnim zrakom nad Alpami in zelo toplim zrakom nad Sredozemljem ter Črnim morjem – nenavadna, vseeno pa so podnebne spremembe povzročile, da so takšne nevihte močnejše in verjetnejše.

Glede na ugotovitve poročila naj bi se taka nevihta pojavila v povprečju približno enkrat na 100 do 300 let v današnjem podnebju z 1,3 stopinje Celzija višjimi temperaturami od predindustrijskih ravni.

Bodo pa takšne nevihte prinesle vsaj pet odstotkov več dežja in se bodo pojavljale približno 50 odstotkov pogosteje kot zdaj, če se bodo temperature dvignile za 2 stopinji Celzija v primerjavi s predindustrijsko ravnjo, kar naj bi se zgodilo do sredine stoletja.
2024-09-25.title: Uničujoče poplave nakazujejo podnebno prihodnost Evrope
2024-09-25.english_content:
Destructive floods are a sign of Europe's climate future

In recent floods in Central Europe, 24 people died

Climate change is twice as likely to cause severe flooding as the recent devastating floods in Central Europe, notes an international group of scientists.

Central Europe has been hit by the worst floods in at least two decades in recent months, claiming 24 lives. The rising waters left damaged buildings and bridges, while the streets of flooded cities were filled with mud and property destroyed. Authorities estimate that the final damage will be in the billions of euros.

A report by the World Weather Attribution, an international group of scientists studying the effects of climate change on extreme weather events, found that four days of rain during Hurricane Boris were the worst since the start of measurements in Central Europe.

They found that in the future, such irrigation would be at least twice as likely and seven percent more powerful.

"These floods have again exposed the devastating effects of fossil-fuel global warming", said researcher at Grantham Institute Imperial College London and co-author Joyce Kimutai.

"Until we replace oil, gas and coal with renewable energy, storms like Boris will trigger even stronger rainfall and cause floods that destroy the economy", she warned.

Unusual combination over Europe

The report says that the combination of weather patterns that caused the storm  ⁇  including cold air over the Alps and very warm air over the Mediterranean and the Black Sea  ⁇  was unusual, but climate change has made such storms stronger and more likely.

According to the findings of the report, such a storm is expected to occur on average approximately once every 100 to 300 years in today's climate at 1.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels.

But such storms will bring at least five percent more rain and will occur about 50 percent more often than they do now if temperatures rise by 2 degrees Celsius from pre-industrial levels, which is expected to happen by the middle of the century.
2024-09-25.english_title: Destructive floods are a sign of Europe's climate future

2024-09-25.author: G. V.
2024-09-25.content:
Na Hrvaškem mimo vrhunec poplavnega vala Donave

Na 70 območjih na Madžarskem še vedno potekajo protipoplavne operacije

Hrvaško je ponoči dosegel vrhunec poplavnega vala Donave. Vodostaj reke se ni povzpel do rekordnih vrednosti, v naslednjih urah pa pričakujejo stagnacijo.

Donava in nekatere druge reke so v preteklih dneh narasle po poplavah, ki jih je povzročil ciklon Boris, ter prizadele dele srednje in vzhodne Evrope.

Tomislav Novosel iz podjetja za upravljanje vodnih virov Hrvatske vode je davi za radio hrvaške javne radiotelevizije HRT povedal, da je vrhunec poplavnega vala Hrvaško dosegel ob 2. uri. Na meji med Madžarsko in Hrvaško, pri kraju Batina na skrajnem vzhodu države, so na Donavi izmerili 708 centimetrov visoki vodostaj.

Novosel je izrazil prepričanje, da vodostaj zagotovo ne bo dosegel osmih metrov, in dodal, da v naslednjih urah pričakujejo stagnacijo, nato pa blago upadanje.

Protipoplavno zaščito na Donavi so dvignili na več kot 775 centimetrov, kolikor je leta 2013 znašal eden najvišjih vodostajev te reke na Hrvaškem.

Vrhunec poplavnega vala Donave je pred tem dosegel tudi Madžarsko, reka pa že upada, je danes po poročanju madžarske tiskovne agencije MTI sporočil predstavnik madžarskega notranjega ministrstva.

Čeprav se gladina vode znižuje, na 70 območjih na Madžarskem še vedno potekajo protipoplavne operacije. Opozorila pred poplavami bodo veljala do sobote popoldne.
2024-09-25.title: Na Hrvaškem mimo vrhunec poplavnega vala Donave
2024-09-25.english_content:
In Croatia, past the peak of the Danube flood

Anti-ship operations are still underway in 70 areas of Hungary

Croatia reached the peak of the Danube flood wave at night. The river's water level has not reached record levels, and they expect to stagnate in the next few hours.

The Danube and some other rivers have risen in recent days after flooding caused by Cyclone Boris and affected parts of central and eastern Europe.

Tomislav Novosel from the water resources management company Hrvatska voda told the Croatian public broadcaster HRT radio that the peak of the flood wave in Croatia reached at 2 am. At the border between Hungary and Croatia, at the site of Batin in the far east of the country, a 708-centimeter-high waterfall was measured on the Danube.

Novosel expressed his belief that the waterfall would certainly not reach eight metres, adding that stagnation and then a slight fall were expected in the following hours.

The flood protection on the Danube has been increased to more than 775 centimetres, up from one of the highest floods of this river in Croatia in 2013.

The peak of the Danube flood wave has reached Hungary before, and the river is already falling, a representative of the Hungarian Ministry of Interior said today, according to the Hungarian press agency MTI.

Despite the decline in water levels, flood control operations are still underway in 70 areas of Hungary. Flood warnings will be in effect until Saturday afternoon.
2024-09-25.english_title: In Croatia, past the peak of the Danube flood

2024-09-25.author: G. V.
2024-09-25.content:
Ryan Routh obtožen poskusa atentata na Trumpa

V pismu namigoval na poskus atentata

Moški, ki naj bi sredi meseca na igrišču za golf na Floridi uperil puško proti republikanskemu predsedniškemu kandidatu Donaldu Trumpu, je obtožen poskusa atentata. Če bo obsojen, mu grozi dosmrtni zapor.

Generalni državni tožilec Merrick Garland je v torek poudaril, da nasilje, usmerjeno proti javnim uslužbencem, ogroža vse, za kar se zavzemajo ZDA. "Ministrstvo za pravosodje ne bo dopuščalo nasilja, ki posega v samo srce ameriške demokracije. Tiste, ki ga izvajajo, bomo poiskali in poklicali na odgovornost. To se mora končati," je dejal.

Po navedbah v sodnih spisih je agent ameriške tajne službe 15. septembra "opazil nekaj, kar je bilo videti kot puška, ki je štrlela iz grmovja", medtem ko je Trump igral golf. Agenti FBI-ja so začeli streljati, moški, 58-letni Ryan Routh, pa je pobegnil, vendar so ga prijeli na avtocesti.

Tožilci so v zadnjih dneh odkrili dokaze, ki po njihovem mnenju kažejo na načrt za umor Trumpa. Moški naj bi več mesecev pred incidentom neznanemu človeku napisal pismo, v katerem je namigoval na "poskus atentata na Donalda Trumpa".

Po navedbah tožilstva je Routh preživel en mesec na južni Floridi, podatki iz mobilnih telefonov pa kažejo, da se je zadrževal v bližini igrišča za golf in Trumpove rezidence v Mar-a-Lagu. Našli so tudi na roko napisani seznam datumov in krajev, kjer je Trump govoril ali kjer naj bi se pojavil.

Proti Routhu sta bili v povezavi z incidentom že vloženi dve obtožnici, ki se nanašata na orožje, zaradi česar mu grozi do 20 let zapora. Odrejeno mu je bilo, da ostane v priporu na jugu Floride, kjer naj bi počakal na sojenje. Za poskus atentata je v ZDA zagrožena kazen dosmrtnega zapora.

Routh se še ni izrekel o krivdi. Njegovi odvetniki so neuspešno zahtevali njegovo izpustitev proti varščini.

Trump je bil tarča poskusa atentata že julija na predvolilnem dogodku v Pensilvaniji. Tedaj je bil ranjen v desni uhelj, napadalca pa so ustrelile varnostne sile. V napadu je umrl en človek, dva pa sta bila ranjena.

Domnevne iranske grožnje z atentatom

Trumpa je ameriška obveščevalna služba obvestila o domnevnih grožnjah z atentatom iz Irana, je sporočila Trumpova volilna kampanja. Trump, ki je v zadnjih treh mesecih preživel dva poskusa atentata, pa je izjavil, da je Iran "velika grožnja" za njegovo življenje.

Ekipa Trumpove volilne kampanje je v torek sporočila, da je urad direktorja nacionalne obveščevalne agencije nekdanjega predsednika opozoril na "resnične in specifične grožnje iz Irana z atentatom v prizadevanju za destabilizacijo in sejanje kaosa v ZDA".

Kot so še sporočili, so obveščevalci ugotovili, da so se iranske grožnje "v zadnjih nekaj mesecih povečale" in da si uslužbenci obveščevalnih agencij prizadevajo zaščititi Trumpa in zagotoviti, da to ne bi vplivalo na volitve.

Kampanja ob tem ni pojasnila omenjenih trditev in sprva ni bilo jasno, ali so bile grožnje, ki jih omenja, nove ali so o njih že poročali.

Trump je na družbeni platformi Truth Social podkrepil te navedbe. "Velike grožnje mojemu življenju prihajajo iz Irana. Celotna ameriška vojska opazuje in čaka," je zapisal.

"Iran je že izvedel poteze, ki se niso obnesle, vendar bo poskusil znova ... Obkrožen sem z več možmi, pištolami in orožjem, kot sem jih kdaj koli videl," je dejal Trump, ki je deležen okrepljenega varovanja ameriške tajne službe po dveh poskusih atentatov nanj.

Iran se na omenjene trditve ni odzval, je pa Teheran že pred tem zavrnil obtožbe, da poskuša ubiti Donalda Trumpa.

Nekaj dni po prvem poskusu atentata so ameriški mediji poročali, da so oblasti prejele obveščevalne podatke o domnevni iranski zaroti proti Trumpu, zaradi česar so okrepili njegovo varovanje.

Ameriške obveščevalne agencije so Iran obtožile tudi hekerskega vdora v interno komunikacijo Trumpove kampanje, češ da želi Teheran vplivati na letošnje predsedniške volitve v ZDA.
2024-09-25.title: Ryan Routh obtožen poskusa atentata na Trumpa
2024-09-25.english_content:
Ryan Routh charged with attempted assassination of Trump

In the letter, he hinted at an assassination attempt.

A man who allegedly fired a rifle at Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on a Florida golf course in the middle of the month has been charged with attempted murder. If convicted, he faces life in prison.

Attorney General Merrick Garland said Tuesday that violence directed at public officials threatens everything the United States is committed to. "The Department of Justice will not tolerate violence that touches the very heart of American democracy. We'll find those who do it and call it in. This has to end", he said.

According to court documents, on September 15, a U.S. Secret Service agent "observed what looked like a rifle coming out of the bushes" while Trump was playing golf. FBI agents started shooting, and a man, 58-year-old Ryan Routh, escaped, but was caught on the highway.

Prosecutors have uncovered evidence in recent days that they believe may have been a plot to assassinate Trump. The man reportedly wrote a letter to an unknown man several months before the incident, hinting at "an attempted assassination of Donald Trump".

According to the prosecutor's office, Routh spent a month in South Florida, and cell phone records show he was staying near the golf course and Trump residence in Mar-a-Lague. They also found a handwritten list of dates and places where Trump spoke or where he was supposed to appear.

Two weapons charges have already been filed against Ruth in connection with the incident, which threatens him with up to 20 years in prison. He was ordered to remain in custody in South Florida, where he was to await trial. The United States has a life sentence for attempted murder.

Routh hasn't pleaded guilty yet. His lawyers have unsuccessfully sought his release on bail.

Trump was the target of an assassination attempt in July at a popular event in Pennsylvania. He was wounded in the right angle, and the assailant was shot by security forces. One person was killed and two were wounded in the attack.

Iran's alleged assassination threats

Trump has been notified by US intelligence of alleged assassination threats from Iran, Trump's election campaign reported. Trump, who has survived two assassination attempts in the past three months, said Iran was a "great threat" to his life.

Trump's campaign team said Tuesday that the former president's office of the director of national intelligence warned of "real and specific threats from Iran of assassination in an effort to destabilize and sow chaos in the United States".

The intelligence community said the Iranian threats had "increased in the last few months" and that intelligence officials were working to protect Trump and ensure that this would not affect the election.

The campaign did not clarify the allegations and it was not initially clear whether the threats it mentioned were new or had already been reported.

Trump has confirmed these claims on the social platform Truth Social. "The greatest threat to my life comes from Iran. The entire U.S. military is watching and waiting", he wrote.

"Iran has already made moves that have failed, but it will try again... I am surrounded by more men, guns and weapons than I have ever seen", said Trump, who has been given enhanced security by the US Secret Service after two assassination attempts on him.

Iran has not responded to the allegations, but Tehran has previously denied allegations of attempting to kill Donald Trump.

A few days after the first assassination attempt, U.S. media reported that authorities had received intelligence about an alleged Iranian plot against Trump, which has strengthened his security.

U.S. intelligence agencies have also accused Iran of hacking into Trump's campaign's internal communications, saying Tehran wants to influence this year's U.S. presidential election.
2024-09-25.english_title: Ryan Routh charged with attempted assassination of Trump

2024-09-25.content:
Magna na avstrijskem Štajerskem zaradi težav v panogi odpušča: delo bo izgubilo 200 ljudi

Obrat Magna Powertrain v Lannachu je bil predviden kot osrednje Magnino vozlišče za e-mobilnost

Družba Magna Steyr je zaradi težav v panogi napovedala, da bo odpustila 200 zaposlenih v obratu na avstrijskem Štajerskem, kjer izdelujejo pogone za električna vozila. Če se položaj ne bo izboljšal, utegne biti ogroženih do 2500 delovnih mest.

Obrat Magna Powertrain s sedežem v kraju Lannach na avstrijskem Štajerskem, kjer že leta izdelujejo menjalnike in štirikolesne pogone, je bil predviden kot osrednje Magnino vozlišče za e-mobilnost. V njem naj bi med drugim izdelovali motorje za električne avtomobile ameriškega proizvajalca Fisker, ki pa je pred nekaj meseci v ZDA razglasil bankrot.

Trenutno v Magni Powertrain izdelujejo zgolj elektromotorje za električne avtomobile razreda G znamke Mercedes-Benz, ki jih proizvaja sestrsko podjetje Magna Steyr v Gradcu. Vendar novih naročil ni na vidiku, zato je vodstvo pred nekaj dnevi sporočilo, da so prisiljeni zmanjšati število delovnih mest za 200.

Kriza v obratu Magna Powertrain, ki je po informacijah avstrijske televizije ORF še pred dvema letoma zaposloval 2950 delavcev, se je po poročanju avstrijskih medijev napovedovala že nekaj časa. Menedžerjem in inženirjem so tako že lani svetovali, naj si poiščejo službo kje drugje.

Magna pa nima težav le s svojim obratom v Lannachu. Že spomladi je namreč sporočila, da bodo zaprli tovarno v Roitzschu pri Bitterfeldu v nemški zvezni deželi Saška-Anhalt, v kateri izdelujejo menjalnike s štirikolesnim pogonom za luksuzne avtomobile z notranjim zgorevanjem. Tam je brez dela ostalo 250 zaposlenih.

Magna ima v Evropi še več težav. Britanski Jaguar bo letos v tovarni Magna Steyr v Gradcu opustil proizvodnjo dveh modelov, in sicer kompaktnega športnega terenca E-Pace z motorjem z notranjim zgorevanjem in njegovega električnega dvojnika I-Pace. Vnovič naj bi jo zagnal šele leta 2027. Poleg tega je britanski proizvajalec Ineos za nedoločen čas odložil začetek proizvodnje električnega terenskega vozila fusilier, ki naj bi bila zaupana Magni Steyr.

V Gradcu Magna Steyr trenutno zaposluje 7000 delavcev, medtem ko jih je bilo še lani jeseni 8000. Vendar se je od tistih, ki so iz podjetja odšli, le okoli 200 ljudi prijavilo na uradu za zaposlovanje. Nekateri so se preusmerili v druge poklice, je poročal časnik Kleine Zeitung ter dodal, da ni zanemarljivo tudi število odpuščenih delavcev iz Slovenije, ki pa se ne odraža v štajerski brezposelnosti.
2024-09-25.title: Magna na avstrijskem Štajerskem zaradi težav v panogi odpušča: delo bo izgubilo 200 ljudi
2024-09-25.english_content:
Magna in Styria, Austria, fires 200 people due to industrial problems

The rotation of the Magna Powertrain in Lannach was envisaged as Magna's central e-mobility hub

Magna Steyr has announced that it will lay off 200 employees at its plant in Styria, Austria, where it produces electric vehicle engines, due to problems in the industry. If the situation does not improve, up to 2500 jobs could be at risk.

The Magna Powertrain plant, located in the town of Lannach in Stajersk, Austria, where the transmission and four-wheel drive have been manufactured for years, was intended as a central Magna hub for e-mobility. It was supposed to manufacture engines for electric cars from the US manufacturer Fisker, which declared bankruptcy a few months ago in the US.

At present, Magna Powertrain only manufactures electric motors for Mercedes-Benz G-Class electric cars, which are produced by its sister company Magna Steyr in Graz. But new jobs are not in sight, so management announced a few days ago that they were forced to cut jobs by 200.

The crisis at Magna Powertrain, which employed 2,950 workers two years ago, according to Austrian television ORF, has been reported in the Austrian media for some time. So last year, managers and engineers were advised to look elsewhere for work.

Magna's only got problems with its plant in Lannach. In the spring, it announced that a plant in Roitzsch near Bitterfeld in the German state of Saxony-Anhalt would be closed, where it manufactured four-wheel drive transmissions for luxury cars with internal combustion. There are 250 unemployed workers left there.

Magna has more problems in Europe. The British Jaguar will cease production of two models this year at Magna Steyr's factory in Graz, namely the compact E-Pace sports car with an internal combustion engine and its electric I-Pace. It's not supposed to be restarted until 2027. In addition, the British manufacturer Ineos postponed indefinitely the start of production of the electric field vehicle fusilier, which was to be entrusted to Magni Steyr.

The Magna Steyr Workshop currently employs 7000 workers, up from 8000 last autumn. However, of those who left the company, only about 200 applied for employment. Some have switched to other professions, reported the newspaper Kleine Zeitung, adding that the number of dismissed workers in Slovenia is not negligible, but that it is not reflected in the unemployment rate.
2024-09-25.english_title: Magna in Styria, Austria, fires 200 people due to industrial problems

2024-09-25.content:
Ruska vojska naj bi zasedla dve vasi na vzhodu Ukrajine in vstopila v mesto Vugledar

"Vugledar je odigral svojo vlogo pri obrambi fronte na vzhodu"

Ruska vojska je sporočila, da je zasedla vasi Gostre in Grigorivka v Doneški oblasti. Ob tem silovito napadajo mesto Vugledar, ki leži na poti do strateško pomembnega mesta Pokrovsk in ki so ga do zdaj ukrajinske sile uspešno branile pred ruskimi napadi.

V ruskih nočnih zračnih napadih v Zaporoški oblasti je bil po navedbah guvernerja Ivana Fedorova ubit 55-letni moški, sedem oseb je bilo ranjenih. Ruske sile so skupaj izstrelile 32 brezpilotnih letal in osem raket. Večino brezpilotnikov in polovico raket so sestrelili, je po poročanju nemške tiskovne agencije AFP sporočila ukrajinska vojska.

Ruske sile hkrati poročajo o napredovanju kopenske ofenzive. Zasedle so še dve vasi na vzhodu Ukrajine, in sicer Gostre, ki leži 30 kilometrov zahodno od mesta Doneck, in Grigorivko v bližini mesta Časiv Jar.

Ruska vojska naj bi vstopila v Vugledar

Čeprav je skušal Kijev z vdorom ukrajinskih sil v rusko obmejno oblast Kursk odvrniti pozornost ruskih sil z bojišča na vzhodu Ukrajine, pa mu s tem ni uspelo ustaviti prodiranja ruske vojske. Od avgusta so namreč ruske sile na vzhodu Ukrajine napredovale najhitreje v zadnjih dveh letih vojne in zasedle več naselij, od koder se je morala ukrajinska vojska umakniti.

Ruske sile trenutno prodirajo proti zahodu na ključnih točkah vzdolž približno 150 kilometrov dolge fronte v Donecku, pri čemer je ključna tarča logistično središče Pokrovsk. Prejšnji teden je ruska vojska zavzela mesto Ukrajnsk, kar je potrdil tudi guverner Donecka Denis Pušlin.

Najhujši boji potekajo za mesto Vugledar, ki leži 80 kilometrov južno od Pokrovska. "Ruske enote so vstopile v Vugledar – napad na mesto se je začel," je sporočil v Ukrajini rojeni proruski vojaški bloger Jurij Podoljaka, napad pa je potrdilo tudi več drugih proruskih vojnih blogerjev.

Po navedbah britanskih vojaških obveščevalcev je zelo verjetno, da ruske sile mesto oblegajo s treh strani, poroča francoska tiskovna agencija AFP in dodaja, da generalštab ukrajinske vojske ob njihovem poizvedovanju razmer v mestu ni komentiral.

Rusko obrambno ministrstvo je sporočilo, da so ruske sile porazile ukrajinsko vojsko v več naseljih, vključno z Vugledarjem, več podrobnosti o mestu pa ni navedlo.

Ukrajinska vojska v svojih poročilih ni omenjala Vugledarja, a je priznala, da na tem območju potekajo spopadi.

Generalštab ukrajinskih oboroženih sil je v poročilu v torek pozno zvečer sporočil, da so ruske čete izvedle osem napadov okoli Vugledarja in dveh bližnjih vasi. "Do zdaj so naše sile odbile polovico napadov. Štirje še potekajo," so zapisali v večernem v poročilu.

"Vugledar izpolnil svojo vlogo"

Vodja Centra ukrajinskega varnostnega sveta za boj proti dezinformacijam Andrij Kovalenko je dejal, da si je Rusija pri napredovanju njenih sil na tem območju pomagala z uporabo vodenih zračnih bomb.

"Vugledar je bilo včasih lahko braniti, saj leži visoko. Toda z aktivacijo vodenih zračnih bomb na fronti ga je sovražniku uspelo uničiti in se premakniti na bok," je pojasnil Kovalenko. "Vodene zračne bombe in letalstvo so edine stvari, ki sovražnikovi pehoti omogočajo premikanje."

Ruski predsednik Vladimir Putin je že večkrat dejal, da je glavni taktični cilj Rusije zavzeti celoten Donbas v jugovzhodni Ukrajini, ki jo sestavljata Doneck in Lugansk. Rusija trenutno nadzoruje slabo petino Ukrajine, vključno s približno 80 odstotki ozemlja Donbasa.

"Mislim, da je postopen umik s tamkajšnjih položajev glede na trenutni razvoj dogodkov neizogiben," je v torek dejal ukrajinski vojaški analitik Oleksandr Musienko in dodal, da je Vugledar izpolnil svojo vlogo pri obrambi vzhodne fronte.

Ukrajinska vojska obstreljevala Belgorod

Ukrajinske sile so medtem zračne napade usmerile v mesto Belgorod na zahodu Rusije. V obstreljevanju je bilo ranjenih pet ljudi, štiri so hospitalizirali, je na omrežju Telegram sporočil guverner omenjene oblasti Vjačeslav Gladkov. Po njegovih besedah je obsežen napad poškodoval stolpnico, 75 stanovanjskih zgradb, več deset vozil ter vodovodno in plinsko napeljavo.

Po mnenju opazovalcev je ukrajinsko obstreljevanje Belgoroda odgovor na torkov ruski zračni napad na približno 70 kilometrov oddaljeni Harkov, v katerem je umrlo več ljudi.

Po Gladkovih besedah so ukrajinske sile ponoči obstreljevale še štiri vasi v Belgorodski oblasti, pri čemer naj bi nastala gmotna škoda, poroča DPA.
2024-09-25.title: Ruska vojska naj bi zasedla dve vasi na vzhodu Ukrajine in vstopila v mesto Vugledar
2024-09-25.english_content:
Russian troops are supposed to occupy two villages in eastern Ukraine and enter the city of Vugledar

"The Vigilant played his part in defending the eastern front".

The Russian army has announced that it has occupied the villages of Gostra and Grigorivka in Donetsk. In the meantime, the city of Vugledar, which lies on the road to the strategically important city of Pokrovsk, has been successfully defended by Ukrainian forces from Russian attacks.

In the Russian night airstrikes on the Zaporozhye authorities, according to the Governor Ivan Fedorov, a 55-year-old man was killed, seven people were injured. Russian forces have launched a total of 32 drones and eight missiles. Most of the drones and half of the missiles were shot down, the Ukrainian military reported to the German news agency AFP.

At the same time, Russian forces are reporting on the progress of the ground offensive. Two other villages were founded in eastern Ukraine, Gostra, 30 kilometers west of Donetsk, and Grigorivko, near Chasiv Jar.

Russian troops are supposed to enter Vugledar.

Although Kiev tried to divert Russian forces from the battlefields in eastern Ukraine by invading Ukrainian forces into the Russian border region of Kursk, he failed to stop Russian military infiltrations. Since August, Russian forces in eastern Ukraine have advanced the fastest in the last two years of the war and occupied several settlements from which Ukrainian troops had to withdraw.

Russian forces are currently penetrating westward at key points along the approximately 150-kilometer-long Donetsk front, with the key target being the Pokrovsk logistics hub. Last week, the Russian military took the city of Ukrainian, as confirmed by Donetsk Governor Denis Pushlin.

The worst battles are fought for the town of Vugledar, located 80 kilometers south of Pokrovsk. "Russian units have entered Vugledar  ⁇  attack on the city has begun", reported Yuri Podoljak, a Ukrainian-born pro-Russian military blogger, and several other pro-Russian war bloggers have confirmed the attack.

According to British military intelligence, it is highly likely that Russian forces are besieging the city on three sides, reports AFP, adding that the Ukrainian army headquarters did not comment on their investigation of the situation in the city.

The Russian Defense Ministry reported that Russian forces had defeated the Ukrainian army in several settlements, including Vugledar, but did not give further details about the town.

The Ukrainian military did not mention Vugledar in its reports, but admitted that fighting was taking place in the area.

The headquarters of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported in a report late Tuesday evening that Russian troops had carried out eight raids around Vugledar and two nearby villages. "So far, our forces have repelled half of the attacks. Four more are underway", the evening report said.

"The Vigilant has fulfilled his role"

The head of the Ukrainian Security Council's Center for Combating Misinformation Andriy Kovalenko said that Russia had helped its forces in the area by using guided bombs.

"The mirror was sometimes defensible, as it lies high. But with the activation of guided aerial bombs on the front, the enemy managed to destroy it and move to the side", Kovalenko explained. "Water bombs and air power are the only things that allow the enemy's infantry to move".

Russian President Vladimir Putin has repeatedly stated that Russia's main tactical objective is to capture the entire Donbas in southeastern Ukraine, comprising Donetsk and Lugansk. Russia currently controls a small fifth of Ukraine, including about 80 percent of Donbass.

"I think a gradual withdrawal from the positions there is inevitable given the current developments", Ukrainian military analyst Oleksandr Musienko said on Tuesday, adding that Vugledar had fulfilled its role in defending the Eastern Front.

The Ukrainian army has shot down Belgorod.

Meanwhile, Ukrainian forces have launched airstrikes on the western Russian city of Belgorod. Five people were wounded in the shooting, four were hospitalized, the governor of the said authority, Vyacheslav Gladkov, said on the Telegram network. He said the massive attack damaged a tower, 75 residential buildings, dozens of vehicles, and pipelines and gas lines.

According to observers, the Ukrainian shelling of Belgorod was a response to a Turkish Russian airstrike on Harkov, some 70 kilometers away, in which several people were killed.

According to Hungko, Ukrainian forces shot down four other villages in Belgorod province at night, causing material damage, reports DPA.
2024-09-25.english_title: Russian troops are supposed to occupy two villages in eastern Ukraine and enter the city of Vugledar

2024-09-25.content:
Kitajska v Tihem oceanu preizkusila medcelinsko balistično raketo

Peking pospešeno kopiči jedrsko orožje

Kitajska je poskusno izstrelila medcelinsko balistično raketo, ki je padla v Tihi ocean, pri čemer je šlo po navedbah kitajskega obrambnega ministrstva za rutinski preizkus, ki ni bil usmerjen proti nobeni državi ali cilju.

Po navedbah kitajskega obrambnega ministrstva je imela raketa navidezno bojno glavo in je pristala na predvidenem območju.

"Gre za rutinsko akcijo v letnem načrtu usposabljanja, o kateri so bile vnaprej obveščene ustrezne države," so pojasnili na kitajskem obrambnem ministrstvu in dodali, da je preizkus v skladu z mednarodnim pravom in mednarodno prakso. V izjavi niso navedli niti poti, po kateri je raketa letela, niti natančnega kraja v Tihem oceanu, kamor je padla.

Z izstrelitvijo balistične rakete so "učinkovito preizkusili delovanje orožja in opreme ter stopnjo usposobljenosti vojakov in dosegli pričakovani cilj," je poročala kitajska državna medijska agencija Šinhua.

Kot poroča Reuters, je bilo to prvič, da je Kitajska javno priznala preizkus medcelinske balistične rakete.

Politični analitik Ankit Panda je za francosko tiskovno agencijo AFP povedal, da je Kitajska takšne preizkuse običajno izvajala v svojem zračnem prostoru. "To je izjemno nenavadno in verjetno prvič v desetletjih, da smo videli takšen preizkus," je dejal in ocenil, da Kitajska verjetno posodablja svoje jedrsko orožje.

Na poskusno izstrelitev, o katerih Kitajska zelo redko obvešča javnost, so se že odzvali v avstralski, japonski in novozelandski vladi.

V Avstraliji izražajo zaskrbljenost in od Kitajske zahtevajo pojasnilo. "Avstralija je zaskrbljena zaradi dejanj destabilizacije, ki v regiji povečujejo tveganje napačnih presoj, zato se o izstrelitvi že posvetuje z regionalnimi partnerji," je povedal tiskovni predstavnik ministrstva za zunanje zadeve.

Tudi v Tokiu izražajo zaskrbljenost, ker Kitajska povečuje obrambni proračun in hitro krepi jedrske in raketne zmogljivosti, vključno z medcelinskimi balističnimi izstrelki, je novinarjem povedal tiskovni predstavnik japonske vlade Yoshimasa Hayashi. "Kitajski vojaški trend zaradi pomanjkanja preglednosti resno skrbi tako Japonsko kot mednarodno skupnost," je dejal.

Novozelandske oblasti so kitajsko testiranje označile za nezaželen in zaskrbljujoč dogodek v sicer mirni regiji. "Regionalni voditelji so jasno izrazili pričakovanje, da imamo mirno, stabilno, uspešno in varno regijo," je dejal tiskovni predstavnik zunanjega ministrstva in dodal, da Nova Zelandija ta pričakovanje odločno podpira.

Leta 2030 že tisoč jedrskih konic

Peking je v zadnjih letih pospešil razvoj jedrskega orožja, Pentagon pa je oktobra lani opozoril, da Kitajska razvija svoj arzenal hitreje, kot so ZDA predvidevale.

Kitajska je imela maja lani več kot 500 operativnih jedrskih bojnih glav, do leta 2030 pa jih bo verjetno imela več kot tisoč, je navedlo ameriško obrambno ministrstvo, ki je prepričano, da bo velik del tega orožja na višjih ravneh pripravljenosti.

Nekateri analitiki trdijo, da hitrost kitajskega kopičenja jedrskega orožja presega verodostojno minimalno odvračanje.

Kitajske raketne sile, ki imajo pod seboj nadzor nad konvencionalnimi in jedrskimi raketami, so zadolžene za posodobitev jedrskih sil, da si lahko bolje zoperstavili izboljšani ameriški protiraketni obrambi, okrepili zmogljivosti nadzora in utrdili zavezništva.
2024-09-25.title: Kitajska v Tihem oceanu preizkusila medcelinsko balistično raketo

China has tested an intercontinental ballistic missile in the Pacific Ocean

Beijing is accelerating its buildup of nuclear weapons.

China has tested a land-based intercontinental ballistic missile that was dropped in the Pacific Ocean, according to the Chinese Ministry of Defence, for a routine test that was not aimed at any country or target.

According to the Chinese Ministry of Defence, the missile was supposed to have a warhead and landed in the intended area.

'This is a routine action in the annual training plan that has been notified in advance to the relevant countries,' the Chinese Ministry of Defence explained, adding that the test is in accordance with international law and international practice. The statement did not specify the route the missile took or the exact location in the Pacific Ocean where it crashed.

The ballistic missile launch "effectively tested the functioning of weapons and equipment and the level of military proficiency and achieved the expected target", reported China's state-run Xinhua news agency.

According to Reuters, this was the first time China had publicly acknowledged a test of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

Political analyst Ankit Panda told AFP that China used to conduct such tests in its airspace. "It's extremely unusual and probably the first time in decades that we've seen such a test", he said, estimating that China is likely to upgrade its nuclear weapons.

The test launches, which are rarely reported to the public by China, have already been met with a response from the Australian, Japanese and New Zealand governments.

In Australia, they are expressing concern and demanding an explanation from China. "Australia is concerned about destabilising acts that increase the risk of miscalculations in the region and is already consulting with regional partners on the launch", said a Foreign Ministry spokesman.

Concerns are also being expressed in Tokyo as China increases its defence budget and rapidly strengthens its nuclear and missile capabilities, including interceptor ballistic missiles, Japanese government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi told reporters. "The lack of transparency of the Chinese military trend is a serious concern for Japan and the international community alike", he said.

The New Zealand authorities have described the Chinese test as an unwanted and worrying event in a peaceful region. "Regional leaders have clearly expressed their expectation that we have a peaceful, stable, prosperous and secure region", said a Foreign Ministry spokesman, adding that New Zealand strongly supports this expectation.

By 2030, there will be a thousand nuclear warheads

Beijing has accelerated the development of nuclear weapons in recent years, and the Pentagon warned in October last year that China was developing its arsenal faster than the US had predicted.

China had more than 500 operational nuclear warheads last May, and by 2030 it is likely to have more than 1,000, the US Department of Defense said, believing much of the weapon will be at higher levels of readiness.

Some analysts claim that the speed at which China builds nuclear weapons exceeds the credible minimum deterrence.

The Chinese missile forces, which have control over conventional and nuclear missiles, are tasked with upgrading their nuclear forces to better counter the improved US missile defences, strengthen control capabilities and strengthen alliances.
2024-09-25.english_title: China has tested an intercontinental ballistic missile in the Pacific Ocean
