Bosta Šogun in The Bear upravičila vlogo favoritov na emmyjih?

Podelitev 76. emmyjev se bo začela 16. septembra ob 2. uri zjutraj po našem času

Pred nocojšnjo 76. podelitvijo emmyjev za televizijske presežke Netflix vodi s 107 nominacijami, sledijo FX, producent epopeje Šogun in komedije The Bear, pred HBO in Apple TV+. Bo Šogun prevzel zapuščino Nasledstva? Ali bo The Bear ponovil lanski uspeh?

V gledališču Peacock v Los Angelesu bo nocoj potekala 76. podelitev nagrad emmy za presežke televizijskih serij. Z največ nominacijami se tudi letos ponaša Netflix s 107 nominacijami, televizijska hiša FX pa ji je s 93 tesno za petami. FX je producent dveh najbolj izpostavljenih televizijskih serij z največ nominacijami: za najboljšo dramsko serijo se bo boril Šogun (Shogun) s skupno 25 nominacijami, za najboljšo komedijo pa je znova nominirana serija The Bear s kar 23 nominacijami. Po Netflixu in FX-u se je po številu nominacij prvič po 20 letih na tretje mesto z 91 uvrstila televizija HBO, sledi pa Apple TV+ z 72 nominacijami.

Že druga podelitev emmyjev v letu 2024 Podelitev bosta vodila komika, oče in sin, Eugene in Dan Levy, ki sta tudi sama že dobila emmyja za vlogi v komični seriji Schitt's Creek. Za Kanadčana, ki sta dobila nagrado v času karantene, je bila zamisel, da bi letos gostovala v živo v gledališču zadostna spodbuda, sta igralca sporočila medijem. Nagrade bodo med drugim podeljevali Christine Baranski, Kathy Bates, Gael García Bernal, Matt Bomer, Connie Britton, Nicola Coughlan, Billy Crystal, Viola Davis, Giancarlo Esposito, Colin Farrell, Lily Gladstone, Selena Gomez, Mindy Kaling, Jimmy Kimmel, Greta Lee, Diego Luna, Steve Martin, Maya Rudolph in Martin Sheen.

Tokratna podelitev emmyjev je že druga v tem letu, saj so 75. podelitev iz lanskega leta zaradi stavke scenaristov in igralcev premaknili na letošnji januar. Na 76. podelitvi bodo tako nagrajene oddaje, ki so bile predvajane med 1. junijem 2023 in 31. majem 2024. 

Razlog za prevlado FX-a iztek nagrajevanih nadaljevank zadnjih letMed nominacijami v dramskih kategorijah je bilo precej očitno, da najbolj nagrajevane nadaljevanke zadnjih let: Nasledstvo, Beli lotos in Zadnji med nami novih sezon trenutno nimajo (ali pa so se že iztekle). Tudi zato je najbrž ponudba mreže FX zavladala v kategorijah, kjer praviloma dominira velikan HBO. Šogun je med drugim nominiran za najboljšo dramsko serijo ter za najboljšo igralko (Anna Sawai) in igralca (Hiroyuki Sanada).

Dejansko je tekma za najboljšo dramsko serijo postala zanimiva ravno maja letos, ko so ustvarjalci Šoguna napovedali, da bodo – čeprav je zgodba o političnih spletkah na Japonskem 17. stoletja dosegla svoj naravni konec – razmislili o še kakšni sezoni. To pomeni, da je bila kritiško hvaljena serija prestavljena iz kategorije miniserij v uglednejši okvirček – med dramske serije, in karte so bile na novo premešane.

Napeto tudi med miniserijamiPo izteku Nasledstva in v predahu pred novim Belim lotosom stavijo na Deželo teme. Zaključena miniserija je t. i. spin-off franšize Pravi detektiv in je največkrat nominirana v kategorijah miniserij. Med devetnajstimi nominacijami je seveda tudi omemba Jodie Foster, ki je igrala zakrknjeno, odljudno detektivko v najhujši temi aljaške zime. Resen tekmec za Deželo teme je najverjetneje Fargo, ki je nominiran 15-krat in lahko mreži FX, če se vse uskladi, prinese trojno krono v vseh treh glavnih panogah. A tu je še en močan favorit, Netflixova psihološka drama Baby Reindeer, ki se je v zadnjih mesecih izkazala za svojevrsten kulturni fenomen.

Kali Reis iz Pravega detektiva in nedavna letošnja oskarjevska nominiranka Lily Gladstone (kriminalna serija Under the Bridge) sta prav tako pisali zgodovino: postali sta prvi staroselski igralki, nominirani za emmyja. Prav tako je prelomna nominacija za Navo Mau (nominirana je za stransko vlogo v miniseriji Baby Reindeer) – postala je prva transspolna latinskoameriška oseba z emmyjevsko nominacijo. 91-letna Carol Burnett (nominirana za Palm Royale) je najstarejša igralska nominiranka v komični kategoriji v zgodovini emmyjev.

Na podelitvi nagrad Creative Arts Emmy slavili Šogun in The BearŠogun je z nagradami v 14 kategorijah prevladal že na podelitvi Creative Arts Emmy oziroma emmyjev v tehničnih kategorijah, ki so jih letos podelili teden pred podelitvijo emmyjev. Na drugem mestu je serija The Bear osvojila "samo" sedem emmyjev, med drugim tudi z nagrado za Jamie Lee Curtis v gostujoči vlogi. Podelitev Creative Arts Emmy, ki se je odvijala dva večera, so zmontirali v eno dvoinpolurno oddajo in jo bodo nocoj objavili na pretočni platformi Hulu.
2024-09-15.title: Bosta Šogun in The Bear upravičila vlogo favoritov na emmyjih?

Will Shogun and the Bear justify the Emmy nomination?

The 76th Emmy Awards will begin on September 16th at 2:00 a.m. local time.

Before tonight's 76th Emmy Awards for Television Surplus, Netflix leads with 107 nominations, followed by FX, producer of the show Showtime and comedy The Bear, ahead of HBO and Apple TV+. Will the Shogun take over the legacy of the estate? Will The Bear repeat last year's success?

The 76th annual Emmy Awards for Outstanding Television Series are being held at the Peacock Theatre in Los Angeles tonight. Netflix is also the highest-rated show this year with 107 nominations, while FX is 93th. FX is the producer of two of the most nominated television series: Shogun for Best Drama Series with a total of 25 nominations, and The Bear for Best Comedy with 23 nominations. Following Netflix and FX, HBO was third in the list of nominees for the first time in 20 years with 91, followed by Apple TV+ with 72.

The second annual Emmy Awards in 2024 will be hosted by comedian, father and son Eugene and Dan Levy, who have also won the Emmy for their work on the sketch comedy series Schitt's Creek. For the Canadians who received the award during the quarantine, the idea of hosting a live theater this year was enough incentive, the actor told the media. The awards will be presented by Christine Baranski, Kathy Bates, Gael García Bernal, Matt Bomer, Connie Britton, Nicola Coughlan, Billy Crystal, Viola Davis, Giancarlo Esposito, Colin Farrell, Lily Gladstone, Selena Gomez, Mindy Kaling, Jimmy Kimmel, Greta Lee, Diego Luna, Steve Martin, Maya Rudolph and Martin Sheen, among others.

This time, the Emmys are the second this year, as last year's 75th annual awards were moved to January due to a strike by writers and actors. The 76th edition will be awarded to programmes that were broadcast between 1 June 2023 and 31 May 2024.

The reason for FX's dominance of award-winning series over the past few yearsAmong the drama nominations, it was quite obvious that the most awarded series of recent years: Legacy, The White Lotus and Last Among Us currently do not have (or have already) new seasons. That is also why FX's offerings have likely dominated in categories where the giant HBO is usually dominant. Shogun was nominated for Best Drama Series and Best Actress (Anna Sawai) and Best Actor (Hiroyuki Sanada), among others.

In fact, the competition for best drama series became interesting in May of this year when the creators of the shogunate announced that they would consider another season, even though the story of the political intrigues in 17th-century Japan had reached its natural conclusion. This means that the critically acclaimed series was moved from the miniseries category to the more prestigious frame  ⁇  between the drama series, and the cards were again mixed.

Tensions also arise between the miniseries After the end of the legacy and the arrival of the new White Lotus, the Dark Land is being betrayed. The concluded miniseries is a spin-off of the True Detective franchise and is nominated for the most miniseries. Of course, among the 19 nominees is Jodie Foster, who played a shy, secluded detective in the worst nightmare of the Alaskan winter. The real contender for the Dark Land is most likely Fargo, who has been nominated 15 times and can network FX if all goes well, bringing the triple crown to all three major industries. But here's another big favorite, Netflix's psychological drama Baby Reindeer, which has proven to be a cultural phenomenon in recent months.

Kali Reis of The Real Detective and recently this year's Oscar nominee Lily Gladstone (the crime series Under the Bridge) also made history by becoming the first ever female performer to be nominated for an Emmy. She also received a breakthrough nomination for Navo Mau (nominated for a supporting role in the miniseries Baby Reindeer)  ⁇  becoming the first transgender Latin American person to receive an Emmy nomination. 91-year-old Carol Burnett (nominated for Palm Royale) is the oldest actress to be nominated in the comedy category in the history of the Emmys.

The Creative Arts Emmy Awards celebrated Shogun and The Bear, and Shogun won 14 awards in the category of Creative Arts Emmys, and the Emmys in the technical categories were awarded a week before the Emmy Awards. In second place, The Bear won "only" seven Emmys, including the award for guest star Jamie Lee Curtis. The Creative Arts Emmy Awards, which ran for two nights, were combined into a two-and-a-half-hour show and will be broadcast on the streaming platform Hulu tonight.
2024-09-15.english_title: Will Shogun and the Bear justify the Emmy nomination?

Prvošolcem letos 24.000 slikanic Protideževne juhe Majde Koren in ilustratorke Ane Maraž

Pred 64. obletnico branja za bralno značko

Društvo Bralna značka bo znova zaznamovalo dan zlatih knjig, letos z darilno slikanico Protideževna juha Majde Koren z ilustracijami Ane Maraž, ki jo bodo v 24.000 izvodih razdelili prvošolcem. Posebna slovesnost bo v torek, 17. septembra, v Novi Gorici.

Bralna značka tradicionalno začenja bralno leto 17. septembra, s čimer počasti dan zlatih knjig, dan rojstva in smrti Franceta Bevka. V prizadevanjih, da bi imel vsak otrok vsaj majhno čisto svojo knjižnico in knjige, ki so kadar koli na dosegu rok, Društvo Bralna značka Slovenije – ZPMS ob tej priložnosti že 21 let prvošolcem namenja darilne slikanice. Na domače knjižne police in v šolske knjižnice bo, kot so zapisali v Bralni znački, tokrat potovala Protideževna juha Majde Koren, ki jo je ilustrirala Ana Maraž in je izšla v sodelovanju z založbo Sodobnost. S pomočjo sponzorjev in donatorjev bodo med letošnje učence razdelili 24.000 izvodov te slikanice.

Podelitve bodo potekale po vseh osnovnih šolah v Sloveniji, darilne slikanice pa bodo dobili tudi otroci na slovenskih šolah v Italiji, v slovenskem zamejskem prostoru v Avstriji, na Madžarskem, na Hrvaškem ter slovenski otroci, ki živijo drugod po Evropi in svetu.

Ko se iz radia nenadoma zasliši glas tete Kuhe ...Slikaniško besedilo je postavljeno v "piškavo poletje". "Recept za izboljšanje situacije ima zgolj teta Kuha, s katero bodo otroci pripravili protideževno juho; ta delikatesa namreč vsebuje sestavino, ki prežene dež in zopet prikliče sijoče poletno sonce," piše v opisu knjige. 

Uspeh slikanice je dosegla tudi ilustratorka slikanice Ana Maraž, ki je aprila letos svoje ilustracije iz Protideževne juhe razstavljala kar na dveh prizoriščih 61. Bolognskega knjižnega sejma otroške in mladinske literature. Njene slike so bile tako na skupinski razstavi slovenskih ilustratorjev, mednarodna žirija pa je njeno delo izbrala med 3520 ilustratorji iz 81 držav ter Ano Maraž uvrstila skupaj z 79 ilustratorji iz celega sveta na 58. ilustratorsko razstavo.

Ob podelitvi slikanic napovedujejo še posebno slovesnost, ki bo 17. septembra ob 10. uri na Osnovni šoli Milojke Štrukelj v Novi Gorici, kjer bo prvošolce nagovorila in jih povabila k branju ilustratorka Ana Maraž.

64. obletnica Bralne značke, imenitnega prostočasjaDanes že tradicionalni projekt, s katerim so odrasli številni, se je začel kot zamisel pisatelja Leopolda Suhodolčana in profesorja Stanka Kotnika. Prve, Prežihove značke, so bile podeljene maja 1961 na Koroškem. Takrat se je bralna značka začela s približno stotimi otroki, ki so se vključili v tekmovanje in po prebrani knjigi opravili izpit pred komisijo. Danes je to množično gibanje za spodbujanje branja brez izpitnega preverjanja z namenom spodbujanja branja najmlajših šolarjev. 

Gibanje od vsega začetka vodijo mentorji po šolah, od devetdesetih let dalje tudi po vrtcih in knjižnicah, v spodbujanje branja so vključeni knjižničarji, učitelji, mentorji branja in starši vseh tistih otrok, ki še ne berejo sami. Danes otroci tudi sami in v sodelovanju z učitelji, mentorji in starši izbirajo knjige, ki jih bodo prebrali, iz širokega seznama kakovostnih knjig, ki ga pripravijo v Društvu Bralna značka Slovenije.
2024-09-15.title: Prvošolcem letos 24.000 slikanic Protideževne juhe Majde Koren in ilustratorke Ane Maraž
2024-09-15.english_content:
This year's first class has 24,000 paintings of Anti-Defense soup by Majde Koren and illustrator Ana Maraz.

Before the 64th anniversary of the reading of the reading badge

The Reading Society will once again mark the Day of the Golden Book, this year with a gift painting of the Anti-Defense soup Majde Koren with illustrations by Ana Maraz, which will be distributed in 24,000 copies to primary school students. A special ceremony will be held on Tuesday, September 17th in New Gorica.

The reading badge traditionally begins the reading year on September 17th, honoring the Golden Book Day, the birthday and death of Franz Bevk. In an effort to ensure that every child has at least a small library and books that are always available, the Society for Reading of the Slovenian Label  ⁇  ZPMS has been giving gifted pictures to primary school students on this occasion for 21 years. On the home bookshelves and in the school libraries, as noted in the Reading badge, the Anti-Defense soup Majde Koren, illustrated by Ana Maraž and published in collaboration with the publication Modernity, will travel this time. With the help of sponsors and donors, 24,000 copies of this picture will be distributed among this year's students.

The presentations will be distributed to all primary schools in Slovenia and the children of Slovenian schools in Italy, the Slovenian school in Austria, Hungary, Croatia and Slovenian children living elsewhere in Europe and the world will also receive the gift pictures.

When the voice of Aunt Cook suddenly comes through the radio... The painting text is placed in "Summer of Writing". "The recipe for improvement is only for Aunt Cook, who will prepare the children's anti-rain soup; this delicacy contains an ingredient that drives off the rain and recalls the bright summer sun", says the book's description.

The painting was also a success for illustrator Ana Maraz, who exhibited her illustrations in the Anti-Divine Supper in April this year in just two scenes. The Bologna Book Fair for Children and Youth Literature. Her paintings were included in the group exhibition of Slovenian illustrators, and the international jury selected her work from among 3,520 illustrators from 81 countries and Ana Maraž, along with 79 illustrators from around the world, were included in the 58th Illustration Exhibition.

The distribution of the paintings is announced in particular at the ceremony on September 17 at 10 a.m. at the Milojka Štrukelj Elementary School in Novi Gorica, where the illustrator Ana Maraž will speak to the first-year students and invite them to read.

The 64th anniversary of the Reading Label, a traditional project already used by many adults, was conceived by the writer Leopold Suhodolčan and Professor Stank Kotnik. The first, the Prežih's stamps, were issued in May 1961 in Krakow. At that time, the reading mark began with about a hundred children entering the competition and passing the examination before the committee after reading the book. Today, it is a mass movement to encourage non-examination reading in order to encourage the reading of younger schoolchildren.

The movement has been led by mentors from the beginning in schools, from the 1990s onwards in kindergartens and libraries, and has been encouraged by librarians, teachers, reading mentors and parents of all children who do not yet read themselves. Today, children also choose books to read on their own and in collaboration with teachers, mentors and parents from a wide list of quality books prepared by the Slovenian Reading Association.
2024-09-15.english_title: This year's first class has 24,000 paintings of Anti-Defense soup by Majde Koren and illustrator Ana Maraz.

2024-09-15.author: Tina Kozin, Program Ars
2024-09-15.content:
Kako zveni književnost? Tako, da ima vsaka beseda pomen.

Tedenski pregled literarnih oddaj na Prvem in na Programu Ars

Izbor igranih literarnih oddaj Programa Ars v teh dneh med drugim zaznamujeta dan vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini in 500. obletnica rojstva velikega francoskega pesnika Pierra de Ronsarda.

Spominjamo se Elde Piščanec in Paula Austerja, izpostavljamo pa tudi prvi slovenski prevod pesnitve Lamija angleškega romantičnega pesnika Johna Keatsa.

"V treh dneh želim prebrati Iliado, / zato, moj Corydon, zapahni dver. / In rečem ti, da velik bo hudir, / če bi le s čim mi kdo kalil naslado."

1. septembra leta 1524 se je na gradiču Possonière rodil francoski pesnik Pierre de Ronsard, eden največjih lirikov celotne svetovne književnosti. Njegovi sodobniki so ga imenovali Princ pesnikov. V otroštvu je oglušel, zato se je moral odpovedati vojaški karieri. Veliko je bral ter se posvečal grški in rimski književnosti. S šestimi drugimi pesniki je ustanovil pesniško skupino Pléiade, ki je skušala jezikovno in tematsko prenoviti francosko poezijo. Pisal je eruditske ode, epiko in pretanjeno liriko, tako ljubezensko kot temeljno bivanjsko o minljivosti človeka. Ob petstoti obletnici rojstva Pierra de Ronsarda v Literarnem nokturnu poslušamo Sonete in odo v mojstrskem prevodu Janeza Menarta. Interpretira Aleš Valič.

"Pri teh knjigah mu je bil najbolj všeč njihov smisel za popolnost in gospodarnost. V dobri kriminalki ni nič odveč, vsak stavek, vsaka beseda ima pomen. In četudi ni pomembna, lahko postane pomembna – kar je enako. Svet iz knjige oživi in zakipi od možnosti, skrivnosti in protislovij."

Letos aprila je pri 77 letih umrl ameriški pisatelj Paul Auster, avtor izjemno priljubljenih del, kot so Newyorška trilogija, Orakeljska noč, Knjiga iluzij, Leviatan in Brooklynske norosti. V Literarnem večeru iz leta 2015 z naslovom Začenjati znova pa se avtor predloge za oddajo Urban Tarman sprašuje o pisateljevi véliki temi – torej o vnovičnih začetkih. Literarni deli Newyorška trilogija in Brooklynske norosti je poslovenil Miha Avanzo. Interpretirata Primož Pirnat in Brane Grubar, režija: Igor Likar.

"Dva vojaka skočita na nizke lestve in brizgata nafto skozi odprta okna pri malem kmetu Lozarju. Po zraku zadiši svežilno, prijetno. Steklo rezko zapoje, rdeče bombe se zde kakor paradižniki, ko lete po zraku skozi okna v hišo. Detonacije so zamolkle, dušene v tesnih prostorih. Ogenj sikne zdaj tu, zdaj tam, kot neznanec zvedavo pogleda skozi duri in šviga. Zdi se kakor čarodej, ki pleše po prostorih." 

Ob dnevu vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini, ko se spominjamo 15. septembra 1947 – tega dne je bila uveljavljena pariška mirovna pogodba z Italijo, ki je takratni Jugoslaviji in s tem tudi Sloveniji dodelila velik del Primorske –, smo v Izbrano prozo uvrstili odlomek novele Sodni dan na vasi. V njej je pisatelj Danilo Lokar opisal fašistično nasilje v Vipavski dolini, natančneje – požig vasi Ustje pri Ajdovščini, ki je zgodovinsko dejstvo. Pisatelj je napisal izjemno literarno umetnino in za zbirko prejel tudi Prešernovo nagrado. V utemeljitvi Prešernove nagrade je zapisano: "Lokarjeve novele so oblikovno skrbno zgrajene, v umetniškem izrazu zgoščene, oblikuje jih skrbna, kultivirana, lirično rahločutna govorica. Njegova proza pomembno dopolnjuje najboljšo tradicijo sodobnega slovenskega realizma." Interpretira: Aleš Valič.

"Krasna si, bistra hči planin, / brdka v prirodni si lepoti, / ko ti prozornih globočin / nevihte temne srd ne moti — / krasna si, hči planin!"

V Literarnem nokturnu pa bomo dan vrnitve Primorske k matični domovini zaznamovali s primorskim pesnikom Simonom Gregorčičem. Njegova hvalnica Soči, ki je po svoji naravi domovinska pesem, je nedvomno avtorjeva najbolj znana in najpogosteje recitirana pesem. Ob njej bomo poslušali še pesnikovo odo Kmetski hiši, ki poveličuje malega človeka – kmeta. Interpretira Ivana Percan Kodarin.

"Začnem s tem, kar mi najbolj po glavi gre: najela sem si novi atelje za dobo šestih mesecev. Predbacivam si pri tem mnogo in si stavim končno mučno vprašanje, ali se ne bo rogal ta lepi veliki luksurjozni atelje mojemu neznanju in slabim ničevim slikam?"

Elda Piščanec je bila ena izmed prvih slovenskih slikark, rojenih še v 19. stoletju, ki si je pridobila akademsko izobrazbo, in sicer na Kraljevi akademiji za lepe umetnosti v Firencah.

Rodila se je leta 1897 v Rojanu pri Trstu v meščanski družini. Slikanja se je učila pri Rihardu Jakopiču in Petru Žmitku. Pri 28 letih je odšla študirat slikarstvo na akademijo v Firence, ki jo je končala v štirih letih. V tem času se je tri mesece in pol izpopolnjevala v Parizu, kjer je obiskovala tudi delavnice cerkvene umetnosti. Po vrnitvi v Ljubljano je slikala portrete, cvetje, tihožitja in pokrajine v olju in drugih tehnikah. V tujini so jo cenili kot odlično grafičarko. Preizkušala se je tudi v kiparjenju. Njena življenjska pot je bila v marsičem pionirska, Elda Piščanec pa je zapustila vrsto osebnih in delovnih dnevnikov ter korespondenco s sorodniki, prijatelji, kolegi in cerkvenimi naročniki. Iz teh dnevnikov in pisem je Metka Pekle sestavila knjigo Segam po nebesnih zvezdah: zgodba slikarke Elde Piščanec (Mladinska knjiga, 2024). Za oddajo Spomini, pisma in potopisi je Tesa Drev Juh priredila odlomek iz knjige, ki opisuje obdobje, ko je študirala slikarstvo v Firencah, in v kateri se zrcali slikarkin način razmišljanja, temperament in čas, v katerem je živela in ustvarjala. Interpreta Gaja Filač in Primož Pirnat.

"V nek gaj odšel je na otoku Kreti, / ker je menda na tisti zemlji sveti / živela nimfa, ki pred njo klečali / kopit spodvitih so satiri"

John Keats je eden najpomembnejših angleških romantikov mlajše generacije, rojen še na koncu osemnajstega stoletja, leta 1795. Umrl je komaj petindvajsetleten, vendar je zapustil izjemen pesniški opus. V njem so ode, soneti, pripovedne pesnitve z antičnimi motivi. Taka je tudi pesnitev Lamija v 900 verzih, napisana leta 1819, objavljena leto pozneje. Lamije so bajeslovne pošasti, o katerih klasično izročilo govori različno, pogosto jih opisuje kot pol ženske, pol kače, vampirske zapeljivke samotnih popotnikov. V Keatsovi pesnitvi Lamija ni več zlovešča prikazen, ki zavaja čute, temveč milo, zaljubljeno dekle, ujeto v telo, ki ne ustreza njeni naravi. Tema pesnitve je nasprotje med romantično domišljijo in hladnim razumom, ki jemlje življenju vsako vrednost. Keatsove Lamije do zdaj še nismo imeli v slovenskem prevodu, nedavno pa jo je prevedel Matej Venier v jambskih enajstercih in zaporednih rimah a-a-b-b. V oddaji Literarni večer pesnitev interpretira Branko Jordan v režiji Klemna Markovčiča.

Weekly review of literary programmes on the First and the Ars Programme

The selection of the Ars programme's plays on these days marks the day of Primorsky's return to her homeland and the 500th anniversary of the birth of the great French poet Pierre de Ronsard.

We remember Elda Piskotek and Paul Auster, and we also highlight the first Slovenian translation of the poem Lami by English romantic poet John Keats.

"In three days I want to read the Iliad, therefore, my Corydon, smell the door. And I tell you, it will be a great evil if anyone ever uses anything to slash my head".

On September 1, 1524, the French poet Pierre de Ronsard, one of the greatest lyrical figures in world literature, was born in Possonière. His contemporaries called him the Prince of Poets. He was deaf as a child, and he had to give up his military career. He read and devoted himself to Greek and Roman literature. With six other poets, he formed the Pleiade group of poets, which sought to revitalize French poetry linguistically and thematically. He wrote erudite covers, epics and a satirical lyric, both a love-like and a deeply biographical account of man's passing. On the 500th anniversary of the birth of Pierre de Ronsard, we listen to the Sonnets in the Literary Nightclub and go in the master translation of John Menart. He's being interpreted by Aleš Valić.

"He liked the books best about their sense of perfection and economy. In a good criminal, nothing is superfluous. Every sentence, every word has meaning. And even if it's not important, it can become important  ⁇  which is the same thing. The world of the book is alive and filled with possibilities, mysteries and contradictions".

In April of this year, the American writer Paul Auster, author of the hugely popular New York trilogy, Night of the Oracle, The Book of Illusions, Leviathan, and Brooklyn Madness, died at the age of 77. In the 2015 Literary Evening, entitled Starting Again, the author of the Urban Tarman proposal questions the author's big theme  ⁇  about new beginnings. The literary works of the New York Trilogy and Brooklyn Madness were parted by Micah Avanza. Directed by Igor Likar.

"Two soldiers jump on the lowest stairs and squeeze oil through open windows in the small farming town of Lazarus. Breathe in fresh air, nice. The glass sings, the red bombs come out like tomatoes, flying through the windows of the house. The detonations were silenced, injected into tight spaces. The fire is burning here, now there, like a stranger's curious gaze through the doors and sweeps. He looks like a witch dancing through the rooms".

On the day of Primorska's return to her homeland, on 15 September 1947, the Paris Peace Treaty with Italy, which had given a large part of Primorska to Yugoslavia, was signed and Slovenia was granted a large part of it, and we included an excerpt from the novel Judgment Day in the Villages in the Selected Prose. In it, the writer Danilo Lokar described the fascist violence in the Vipava Valley, more precisely the burning of the village of Ustje near Ajdovščina, which is a historical fact. The author has written an outstanding literary work and has received the Prešern Prize for his collection. The Prešern Prize's justification states: "The novels of Lakar are carefully constructed in style, in artistic expression compacted, shaped by careful, cultivated, lyrically light-hearted rhetoric. His prose significantly complements the best tradition of modern Slovenian realism". Interpreted by Aleš Valić.

"You are beautiful, bright daughter of mountains, you are a hill in natural beauty, when you are not disturbed by the clear depths of the storm of dark rage.

And in the Literary Night, we will mark the day of Primorsk's return to her native land with the Primorsk poet Simon Gregorčić. His praise Sochi, which is by its nature a national anthem, is undoubtedly the author's best-known and most frequently recited poem. We'll hear a poet singing at the Kmetski house, praising the little man, the farmer. He is played by Ivan Percan Kodarin.

"I'll start with what I think best: I rented a new studio for six months. I think about it a lot and I ask myself the ultimate painful question, "Will this beautiful big luxury studio not be cursed by my ignorance and the poorly painted nothingness?"

Elda Piščanec was one of the first Slovenian painters born in the 19th century to receive an academic education at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Florence.

She was born in 1897 in Rojan near Trst in a village family. She studied painting with Richard Jakopic and Peter Smythe. At the age of 28, she went to study painting at the Academy of Florence, which she completed in four years. During this time, she completed three and a half months in Paris, where she also attended workshops of church art. After returning to Ljubljana, she painted portraits, flowers, still lifes and landscapes in oil and other techniques. She was highly regarded abroad as an excellent graphic designer. She also tried her hand at sculpture. Her life path was pioneering in many ways, and Elda the Chicken left behind a series of personal and work diaries and correspondence with relatives, friends, colleagues, and church subscribers. From these diaries and letters, the Hellfire Ball compiled the book Segam po nebeskih hvězd: the story of the painter Elda Piščanec (Young People's Book, 2024). To present the Memory, Letters and Subtitles, Tesa Drev Juh organized an excerpt from a book describing the period when she studied painting in Florence, reflecting the painter's way of thinking, temperament and time in which she lived and created. Interpreted by Guy Fielc and Primoz Pirnat.

"He went to a village on the island of Crete, because there were supposedly inhabited holy land nymphs who worshiped her and were satyrs".

John Keats is one of the most important English younger romanticists, born at the end of the 18th century, in 1795. He died at the young age of 25, but he left behind an extraordinary poetic oeuvre. It contains covers, sonnets, narrative poems with ancient motifs. Similarly, Lamy's 900-line poem, written in 1819, was published a year later. The Mountains are fairy tale monsters that the classical tradition speaks of differently, often described as half-women, half-snake, vampire seducers of lonely travelers. In Keats' poem, Lami is no longer an abusive representation of a deceiving senses, but a sweet, in love girl trapped in a body that doesn't fit her nature. The theme of the poem is the contrast between romantic imagination and cold reason, which takes life for granted. Keats's Lamas had not yet been translated into Slovenian, but it was recently translated into Jamaican and English by Matej Venier. On the show Literary Night, the song is performed by Branko Jordan, directed by Klemn Markovčić.

Kino Šiška v ritmih sodobnega soula dua freekind. in Tschimya praznuje 15 let delovanja

Kot kinodvorana je z eno večletno prekinitvijo obratoval od leta 1964 do leta 2001

Kino Šiška praznuje 15 let kot kulturni center s koncertoma priljubljenega dua freekind. in soul pevca Tschimya. Nekoč kinodvorana z največjim filmskim platnom v Jugoslaviji zdaj gosti 300 različnih kulturnih dogodkov letno z več kot 100.000 obiskovalci.

V Kinu Šiška v petek praznujejo 15. obletnico delovanja javnega zavoda s koncertom dveh uspešnih glasbenih skupin, s hrvaško-slovensko zasedbo freekind. in domačim pop-soul pevcem Tschimyem. 

Kot kinodvorana obratoval od leta 1964 do leta 2001Kino Šiška je sprva sestavljal del Hotela Ilirija, kinodvorano pa so do konca zgradili in opremili Kinematografi Ljubljana. V kinu so od leta 1964 do konca 80. let predvajali filme, nato pa je zmanjševanje obiska pripeljalo do tega, da so ga zaprli in oddajali samo še za razne prireditve ter predavanja. Kino so nato spet usposobili leta 1994. K vnovičnemu zaprtju naj bi botroval "pobeg" množic v takrat novi Kolosej. Kinodvorana, ki je imela nekoč največje platno v državi, se je dokončno poslovila leta 2001, a do uradnega odprtja in prenove prostorov je minilo kar nekaj let, da je znova zaživelo kot kulturno središče. Vmes so od oktobra 2002 do 2007 v njegovih prostorih nastajali umetniški projekti, odvijale so se plesne in gledališke ustvarjalne delavnice, obnovitvene vaje za predstave skupin in posameznikov ter plesne akcije pod vodstvom Gorana Bogdanovskega. 

Kako je kino Šiška postal Kino Šiška, si lahko preberete na spletni strani javnega zavoda.

Avgusta leta 2009 so prvi na prenovljeni oder Kina Šiška stopili Pankrti, v septembru pa so nastopili še Laibach, Juno Reactor, festival FV (s skupinami Heavy Trash, Bambi Molesters in Nero Burns), potekala pa je tudi modna revija znamke Oktober in minifestival glasbenih sil s prostora nekdanje Jugoslavije (Damir Avdić, Lollobridgida, Petrol ...). 15 let pozneje ima Center urbane kulture Kina Šiška letno več kot 300 dogodkov z več kot 100.000 obiskovalci in se ponaša z uveljavljenimi blagovnimi znamkami, kot so festival Ment Ljubljana, galerija DobraVaga, festival sodobnega plesa CoFestival in mednarodni festival stripa Tinta. 

15 praznovanj kasneje: letos v ritmih sodobnega soula freekind. imata po treh letih delovanja za sabo že več kot 100 nastopov doma in po svetu. Pianistko in vokalistko Saro Ester Gredelj ter bobnarko Nino Korošak Serčič druži ljubezen do RnB, hip-hop in soul glasbe. Po izidu prvega dolgometražnega albuma Since Always And Forever je sledila turneja po Angliji, ki sta jo izvedli s pomočjo projekta Kulturni evro, nastopili pa sta še na številnih festivalih po Evropi, kot so Mostly Jazz Funk & Soul v Birminghamu, Exit v Srbiji in Sziget na Madžarskem. Prejeli sta prestižno nagrado MME (Music Moves Europe) Award in se kot avtorici podpisali pod pesmi na albumu Layover pevca V-ja, sicer člana ene najbolj znanih južnokorejskih k-pop skupin BTS. Njune pesmi so postale stalnica tujih radijskih postaj, kot so FM4, Radio Eins, Flux fm in Cosmo.

Dvojni koncert bo s svojimi pop-soulovskimi pesmimi odprl Tschimy, ki je svojo glasbeno pot začel v hip hop kolektivu Spejs in kot basist v jazzovski zasedbi Lube duše ter prodorni glas afriškega zbora Sankofa. Od leta 2020 se domači javnosti prvenstveno predstavlja kot samostojni glasbeni ustvarjalec. Kot pevec, multiinštrumentalist in producent ustvarja spalnično glasbo na visokem tehničnem nivoju, za celotno zvočno podobo svojih izdelkov pa vselej poskrbi kar sam. Od izida njegovega zadnjega albuma Princ nastopa tudi z živim bendom.

The cinema of Shichik in the rhythms of modern soul duo freekind and Tschimya celebrates 15 years of operation

As a cinema, it operated on a one-year break from 1964 to 2001

The Shichika Cinema is celebrating 15 years as a cultural center with concerts by the popular duo freekind and soul singer Tschimya. Once the largest cinema in Yugoslavia, it now hosts 300 different cultural events each year, with over 100,000 visitors.

In the Shishka Cinema on Friday, they celebrate the 15th anniversary of the establishment of the public institution with a concert of two successful musical groups, with the Croatian-Slovak freekind. and the local pop-soul singer Tschimy.

As a cinema office it operated from 1964 to 2001Kino Šiška was originally part of the Hotel Ilirija, and the cinema was built and equipped by the Ljubljana Cinematografi until the end. The cinema was used from 1964 until the late 1980's, when the decline in attendance led to its closure and its use for various events and lectures. The cinema was then re-established in 1994. To the new closure he was to lead the "escape" crowds to the then new Colosseum. The cinema, once the largest in the country, finally broke away in 2001, but it took several years before the official opening and renovation of the premises brought it back to life as a cultural center. Between October 2002 and 2007, artistic projects were held in its premises, dance and theatre creative workshops, revival exercises for group and individual performances and dance events led by Goran Bogdanovsky.

How the cinema of Siska became the cinema of Siska can be read on the website of the public institution.

In August 2009, the first stage of the renovated Cinema of Shiška was occupied by Pankrti, and in September, Laibach, Juno Reactor, FV (with the bands Heavy Trash, Bambi Molesters and Nero Burns) and the fashion magazine Oktober and a mini-festival of musical forces from the former Yugoslavia (Damir Avdić, Lollobridgida, Petrol ...). 15 years later, the China Shiška Urban Culture Centre hosts more than 300 events annually with over 100,000 visitors and boasts established brands such as the Ment Ljubljana festival, DobraVaga gallery, the CoFestival contemporary dance festival and the International Tinta comic book festival.

15 celebrations later: this year in the rhythm of modern soul freekind. After three years of operation, they have performed more than 100 shows at home and around the world. Pianist and vocalist Sara Ester Gredelj and drummer Nino Korošak Serčić share a love of RnB, hip-hop and soul music. The release of their first full-length album Since Always And Forever was followed by a tour of England, which was supported by the Kulturní euro project, and they performed at numerous festivals around Europe, such as Mostly Jazz Funk & Soul in Birmingham, Exit in Serbia and Sziget in Hungary. They received the prestigious MME (Music Moves Europe) Award and signed as authors to the song on the album Layover by vocalist V, a member of one of the most famous South Korean k-pop groups BTS. Their songs have become a staple of foreign radio stations such as FM4, Radio Eins, Flux fm and Cosmo.

The double album will be opened by Tschimy, who began his musical journey in the hip hop collective Spejs and as bassist in the jazz band Soul Lobe and the breakthrough voice of the African choir Sankof. As of 2020, he is primarily presenting himself to the local public as an independent music creator. As a singer, multi-instrumentalist and producer, he creates high-tech bedroom music, and always takes care of the overall sound quality of his products. Since the release of his last album, Prince has been performing with a live band.

S projekcijo v Kinodvoru se Muca Copatarica seli v slovenska kina

Animirani film Muca Copatarica, ki slavi 65-letnico pravljice, je z ljubljansko premiero v Kinodvoru zaživel v domačih kinematografih.

V Kinodvoru je bila na sporedu ljubljanska premiera animirane različice kultne slovenske pravljice Muca Copatarica, s čimer film prihaja v redno distribucijo po dvoranah Art kino mreže Slovenije. Ogledati si ga bo mogoče samostojno ali v sklopu programov Muca Copatarica in prijatelji ter Muca Copatarica in druge zgodbe.

Eden od najbolj priljubljenih likov slovenske otroške literature Muca Copatarica avtorice Ele Peroci in ilustratorke Ančke Gošnik Godec je ob 65-letnici dobil še animirano različico v kratkem filmu v režiji Roka Predina. Film so predpremierno prikazali 5. junija, na dan, ko je ilustratorka legendarne otroške pravljice praznovala 97. rojstni dan. Ob projekciji je letošnja prejemnica nagrade za življenjsko delo Riharda Jakopiča dejala, da so jo "strašno počastili za rojstni dan".

Režiser Predin je tedaj povedal, da je pravljica klasika, zato so v animaciji uporabili ilustracije Ančke Gošnik Godec iz legendarne slikanice Muca Copatarica. Kot je pojasnil, so bili pri produkciji previdni, da pravljici niso stopali na prste, podobi nič odvzeli in produkciji dodali nič nepotrebnega. Spremenili so le tisto, kar je za animirani film potrebno.

Muci Copatarici je glas v animiranem filmu posodila igralka Silva Čušin. Scenarij je napisal Andrej Predin, avtor glasbe je Daniel Pemberton, pod oblikovanje zvoka se podpisuje Barnaby Templar - Fonic. Film je nastal v produkciji hiše Stara Gara, producent je Miha Černec, izvršna producentka pa Mihaela Trupi. Koproducent je Radiotelevizija Slovenija, film pa sta finančno podprla Slovenski filmski center in Mestna občina Maribor. Zgodba je prvič izšla leta 1957 in do danes doživela več kot 30 ponatisov.

V Kinodvoru bodo v okviru programa Prvič v kino ter v sklopu programa Muca Copatarica in druge zgodbe ponudili še tri kratke animirane filme: Hribci – Zajtrk Marjana Mančka iz leta 1993, Koyaa – Vesele vilice Kolje Saksida (2019) in Egon Klobuk Igorja Šinkovca (2011), je mogoče razbrati iz napovedi Kinodvora.

2024-09-14.english_content:
With a screening at the Cinema Muca Copatarica moves to Slovenian cinema

The animated film Muca Copatarica, which celebrates the 65th anniversary of the fairy tale, was first shown at the Ljubljana Film Centre in domestic cinemas.

The film was released in the cinema in Ljubljana on the occasion of the premiere of the animated version of the cult Slovenian fairy tale Muca Copatarica, which makes the film available for regular distribution in the Art cinema halls of the Slovenian network. It will be available to watch alone or as part of the programs Muca Copatarica and Friends and Muca Copatarica and other stories.

One of the most popular characters of Slovenian children's literature Muca Copatarica by the author Ele Peroci and illustrator Ančka Gošnik Godec received an animated version in a short film directed by Roka Predina at the age of 65. The film was previewed on June 5, the day the legendary children's story illustrator celebrated her 97th birthday. During the screening, this year's lifetime achievement award winner Richard Jakopic said that she was "horribly honored on her birthday".

Director Predin then said that the story is a classic, so they used illustrations of Anca Gošnik Godec from the legendary Muca Copatarica painting in the animation. As he explained, they were careful in producing the stories not to get on their toes, taking away the images and adding anything unnecessary to the production. They've only changed what's needed for an animated film.

The voice of the Copatarica Muci was lent to the animated film by actress Silva Chushin. The screenplay was written by Andrei Predin, the music was composed by Daniel Pemberton, and the soundtrack was composed by Barnaby Templar - Fonic. The film was produced by the Old Gar house, produced by Miha Černoc, and executive produced by Michael Trupi. The film was co-produced by Radiotelevizija Slovenije and financed by the Slovenian Film Centre and the Municipality of Maribor. The story first appeared in 1957 and has since been reprinted over 30 times.

The first three animated short films will be shown in the Cinema House, as well as in the Muca Copatarica and Other Stories program: The Hribci  ⁇  Brunch of Marian Manc from 1993, Koyaa  ⁇  Vesele vilice Kolje Saksida (2019) and Egon Klobuk Igorja Šinkovca (2011), which can be read from the projection of the Cinema House.
2024-09-14.english_title: With a screening at the Cinema Muca Copatarica moves to Slovenian cinema

Svet pretresla novica o smrti vzpenjajoče se 29-letne balerine Michaele DePrince

Kot sirota iz Sierre Leone se je povzpela do baletne zvezde

Temnopolta balerina Michaela DePrince, ki je nastopala z Beyoncé, je umrla pri 29 letih. Kot sirota, ki se je vzdignila do statusa mednarodne plesne zvezde, je bila mnogim v navdih. Vzrok smrti ni znan, družina je sporočila le, da je bila smrt nenadna.

Balerina Michaela Mabinty DePrince, vzpenjajoča plesna zvezda ne le na področju baleta, ampak plesa in umetnosti nasploh, je umrla v 29. letu starosti. Novico o njeni smrti je sporočil njen tiskovni predstavnik na družabnem omrežju, njena družina pa je v izjavi sporočila, da je bila "nepozaben navdih za vse, ki so jo poznali ali slišali njeno zgodbo". 

DePrince se je rodila leta 1995 v Kenemi v Sierri Leone in bila pri treh letih poslana v sirotišnico, potem ko sta ji oba starša umrla med državljansko vojno. V preteklosti je govorila o tem, da so jo v sirotišnici imeli za "hudičevega otroka", saj je imela vitiligo, bolezen, pri kateri deli kože izgubijo pigmentacijo. DePrince se je kljub temu povzpela do številnih nagrad v svetu mednarodnega plesa, a se je tudi kot temnopolta balerina s težavo prebijala do vidnejših vlog. "Govorili so ji, da svet ni pripravljen na temnopolte balerine ali da v temnopolte balerine ni vredno vlagati. A DePrince je ostala odločna, osredotočena in začela delati velike korake," je na družbenih omrežjih zapisala ameriška balerina Misty Copeland.
2024-09-14.title: Svet pretresla novica o smrti vzpenjajoče se 29-letne balerine Michaele DePrince
2024-09-14.english_content:
The world was shocked by the news of the death of rising ballerina Michaela DePrince, 29.

As an orphan from Sierra Leone, she rose to the rank of ballet star

The black ballerina Michael DePrince, who performed with Beyoncé, died at the age of 29. As an orphan who rose to the status of an international dance star, she was an inspiration to many. The cause of death is unknown. The family only reported that the death was sudden.

Ballerina Michael Mabinty DePrince, a rising dance star not only in ballet but in dance and the arts in general, has died at the age of 29. Her death was announced by her social media spokesperson, and her family said in a statement that she was "an unforgettable inspiration to all who knew her or heard her story".

DePrince was born in 1995 in Kenema, Sierra Leone, and was sent to an orphanage at age three after both her parents died during the civil war. In the past, she spoke of being considered an "evil child" in an orphanage because she had vitiligo, a skin condition in which parts of the skin lose pigmentation. Despite her many awards in the international dance world, DePrince struggled to make it to the big screen as a ballerina. "They told her that the world wasn't ready for a black ballerina or that it wasn't worth investing in a black ballerina. But DePrince remained determined, focused, and took big steps", social media commenter Misty Copeland wrote.
2024-09-14.english_title: The world was shocked by the news of the death of rising ballerina Michaela DePrince, 29.

Miljenko Jergović

Po mojem mnenju človek ni v stanju, da razmišlja o prihodnosti. Gibljemo se kot raki, naprej se pomikamo obrnjeni nazaj, v preteklost. Človek je bitje preteklosti. Sem to, česar se spominjam. Sem svoja preteklost.

Sarajevčan, pisatelj, pesnik, kolumnist, publicist in esejist Miljenko Jergović že več kot 30 let živi v Zagrebu. V literarno orbito ga je izstrelil Sarajevski Marlboro. Spisal je več kot 30 del, polovica je na voljo tudi v slovenščini, jeziku, ki ga hrvaško-bosanski pisatelj razume, saj ima tudi slovenske korenine. "Tehtno in obenem pozorno upodablja nemiren čas še bolj nemirnega prostora ter tako tudi nas v tem času in prostoru" – piše v obrazložitvi nagrade vilenica za leto 2024, ki je jo mojstru peresa letos za življenjsko delo podelilo Društvo slovenskih pisateljev.

2024-09-14.english_content:
My dear Jergović

In my opinion, man is incapable of thinking about the future. We move like a cancer, moving forward, backwards, backwards. Man is a thing of the past. I'm what I remember. I'm my own past.

Sarajevo-based writer, poet, columnist, publicist and essayist Miljenko Jergović has lived in Zagreb for more than 30 years. It was launched into literary orbit by the Sarajevo Marlboro. He wrote more than 30 works, half of which are also available in Slovenian, a language that the Croat-Bosnian writer understands, as he also has Slovenian roots. "It is a heavy and at the same time attentive illustration of the restless time of even more restless space and also of us in this time and space", says the explanation for the 2024 Elephant Prize, awarded to the master of the pen this year for life's work by the Society of Slovenian Writers.

Desetletje kreativnega ustvarjanja v odrski intimi

10. sezono Intimnega odra je odprla predstava Roka Kravanje in pregledna razstava v nastajanju

Intimni oder GT22 v Mariboru, v katerem KUD Moment spodbuja žanrsko raznolikost z lastno in gostujočo produkcijo, praznuje 10. obletnico. Letos uvajajo gledališki abonma, jubilej pa bodo zaznamovali tudi z mednarodnim festivalom Prestopi maja 2025.

Intimni oder GT22, edini neodvisni, nevladni oder uprizoritvene umetnosti v Mariboru, letos praznuje 10. obletnico delovanja. Jubilejno sezono je Kulturno-umetniško društvo Moment odprlo z odprtjem razstave Pregled slovenske odrske fotografije: 10 let Intimnega odra in mariborsko premiero solo performansa Roka Kravanje Slovenska transverzala. Letos prvič uvajajo abonma Intimni, deseto obletnico pa bodo med drugim zaznamovali z mednarodnim festivalom neodvisnih uprizoritvenih umetnosti Prestopi/Crossings maja prihodnje leto.

Kot sporočajo iz KUD-a Moment, je nekoč v prostorih Intimnega odra obratoval nočni klub, nato so ga skupaj s prijatelji, starši, znanci in splošno zainteresiranimi posamezniki ter z veliko prostovoljnega dela in entuziazma korenito spremenili, preuredili v uprizoritveni umetnosti prijaznejši prostor. Namesto separejev so zdaj praktikabli, ki tvorijo tribuno za občinstvo, v nekdanjem VIP-prostoru je zdaj zaodrje. Na Intimnem odru GT22 je bilo v 10 letih odigranih 46 premier, največ gledalcev je bilo leta 2019 na predstavi Heroj 2.0 – Predstava vseh predstav, ko jih je prostor sprejel 72. Med avtorji, ki so delali in nastopali na Intimnem odru, so Mare Bulc, Matija Solce, Nik Škrlec, Ahmed Tobasi, Nataša Živković, Barbara Matijević, Damir Avdić, Bert & Nasi, Gregor Zorc,  Minca Lorenci, Maruša Majer, Filip Šebšajevič, Barbara Kukovec, Anže Zevnik, Katarina Stegnar, Mladen Dolar, Dario Varga, Blaž Šef, Bojana Kunst, Marko Radmilović, Filip Dobranić, Damjana Černe, Renata Salecl in drugi. Prva produkcija je bila leta 2014 produkcija Inkubatorja Moment – predhodnika Momentovega programskega delovanja in financiranja, predstava z naslovom Za 4 stenami 014, prva koprodukcija pa je bila Lovci na srečo (z Marušo Majer, Zalo Ano Štiglic in Rokom Kravanjo). Prva gostovalna predstava je bila predstava Vie Negative Tonight I celebrate (Uroš Kaurin).

Slovenska transverzala: meditativna terapija pred izzivi vsakdanaRok Kravanja je svojo najnovejšo predstavo Slovenska transverzala osmišljal skoraj dve leti in predstava, ki je nastala v koprodukciji z Vio Negativo, je organski podaljšek dveh kreativnih laboratorijev. V solo performansu nas Kravanja popelje v čas svojega odraščanja, ko sta bila z očetom izkušena planinca. "To je tudi moje osebno romanje v planine in predelovanje nekih vsebin, ki so se zgodile meni v profesionalnem in osebnem življenju," je za TV Slovenija povedal Kravanja, ki v na videz idilični podobi planinstva prikaže način spopadanja s temačnejšimi družinskimi skrivnostmi. 

Deseto sezono Intimnega odra je odprla tudi fotografska razstava v nastajanju Pregled slovenske odrske fotografije: 10 let Intimnega odra, ki bo zaključena maja prihodnje leto na mednarodnem festivalu Prestopi/Crossings, ko bodo v razstavo vključili še pregled scenografije. Rdeča nit razstave so predstave, ki so gostovale na Intimnem odru, razstavljene pa so fotografije Nade Žgank, Mihe Frasa, Mihe Sagadina, Gregorja Salobirja in Andreja Firma, ki so pomembno dokumentirali mariborsko gledališko dogajanje.

Desetletje ustvarjanja intimnosti V desetletju se je na Intimnem odru zgodilo 46 premier, pri njih so med drugim gostovali Ahmed Tobasi, Bert & Nasi, Matija Solce, Damir Avdić, Nik Škrlec, Minca Lorenci, Maruša Majer, Anže Zevnik, Katarina Stegnar, Mladen Dolar, Dario Varga, Blaž Šef, Bojana Kunst in še veliko drugih odmevnih imen. "V desetih letih se je tudi izoblikovala skupnost, ki soustvarja, podpira in razvija neodvisno kulturo," je ob tem dodal programski vodja Momenta Uroš Kaurin.

Moment, društvo za razvoj sodobnih uprizoritvenih umetnosti, si z lastno produkcijo in gostujočimi predstavami na Intimnem odru prizadeva za žanrsko raznolikost od gledališča predmetov, glasbeno-plesnih predstav, lutk za odrasle do pripovednega gledališča. "Razvijamo neodvisno uprizoritveno umetnost. Neodvisno v smislu, da na nas nihče ne pritiska: vi boste ustvarjali program na tak in tak način, za te in te ljudi. Mi smo tega osvobojeni, seveda omejeni s financami, ampak osvobojeni nekega diktata in znotraj teh okvirjev potem skušamo narediti in ustvariti najboljše, kar znamo," je v izjavi za TV Slovenija povedal Zoran Petrovič, producent in član programa ekipe Moment. 

Novosti letošnje sezoneV novi sezoni Moment prireja še tri premiere. Prva, lutkovna predstava Dobro jutro, travnik v koprodukciji z Lutkovnim gledališčem Maribor, je na 35. Poletnem lutkovnem pristanu v Mariboru že prejela nagrado otroške žirije. Po Slovenski transverzali bo druga premiera oktobra, in sicer predstava Death & Sound mlade hrvaške režiserke Tončice Knez v zasedbi Luke Piletiča, Roka Kravanje in Tilna Kožamelja, ki skozi smrt raziskuje življenje. Predstavo uvrščajo v stil gledališča predmetov in napovedujejo, da bo "zelo vizualna, z veliko močnih senčnih podob in bo gledalca povabila v negotov prostor med življenjem in smrtjo".

Večje praznovanje pripravljajo maja prihodnje leto, ko znova organizirajo mednarodni festival neodvisnih uprizoritvenih umetnosti Prestopi/Crossings. Njegov program bodo sestavljali umetniki iz Romunije, Italije, Velike Britanije, Francije, Bolgarije in Hrvaške, pripravljajo pa tudi izobraževalni program. Na njem se bo zvrstila tudi zadnja premiera sezone, predstava Tonight v izvedbi Bertranda Lesce in Nasija Voutsasa. Nadaljevanje predhodnih dveh performansov The End in The Beginning "bo nadrealistični komični vpogled v nocojšnjost", še napovedujejo v Momentu.
2024-09-14.title: Desetletje kreativnega ustvarjanja v odrski intimi
2024-09-14.english_content:
Decades of creative intimacy

The 10th season of Intimate Stage opened with the show Hand of Sitting and a transparent exhibition in the making.

The intimate stage GT22 in Maribor, where KUD Moment promotes genre diversity with its own and guest productions, is celebrating its 10th anniversary. The theatre subscription is being introduced this year and the anniversary will also be marked with the international festival Stop May 2025.

The GT22 intimate stage, the only independent, non-governmental performing arts stage in Maribor, is celebrating its 10th anniversary this year. The Cultural and Artistic Society Moment opened the jubilee season with the opening of the exhibition Review of Slovenian section photography: 10 years of intimate scene and the maritime premiere of the solo performance of the Hand of the Slave Slave. This year, they are launching their Intimni subscription for the first time, and their tenth anniversary will be marked by the international festival of independent visual arts Prestopi/Crossings in May next year.

As KUD Moment reports, the premises of the Intimate Arena once housed a nightclub, then, together with friends, parents, acquaintances and general interest individuals, they radically changed it, transforming it into a more artistically friendly space with a lot of volunteer work and enthusiasm. Instead of the separe, the practicables now form a public podium, the former VIP space is now a backdrop. The GT22 has had 46 premieres on the Intimate Stage in 10 years, with the highest viewership in 2019 being at the Hero 2.0 show. The authors who worked and performed on the Intimate Stage include Mare Bulc, Matija Solca, Nik Škrlec, Ahmed Tobasi, Nataša Živković, Barbara Matijević, Damir Avdić, Bert & Nasi, Gregor Zorc, Minca Lorenci, Maruša Majer, Filip Šebšajević, Barbara Kukovec, Anže Zevnik, Katarina Stegnar, Mladen Dolar, Dario Varga, Blaž Šef, Bojana Kunst, Marko Radmilović, Filip Dobranić, Damjana Černe, Renata Salecl and others. The first production was a 2014 production of Moment's programming and funding predecessor, Moment's Moment Incubator, a show titled For 4 Walls 014, and the first co-production was Hunters of Fortune (with Marusha Meyer, Zalo Ano Štiglic and Rok Kravanja). The first hosted show was Vie Negative Tonight I celebrate.

The latest performance of the Slovenian transversal was conceived by Kravan's hand for almost two years and the performance, co-produced with Vio Negativo, is an organic extension of two creative laboratories. In a solo performance, the Cowboys take us back to their childhood, when they were experienced mountain climbers with their father. "It's also my personal quest for mountains and the processing of some of the content that has happened to me in my professional and personal life", Kravan told TV Slovenia, who in the seemingly idyllic form of mountaineering shows how to deal with darker family secrets.

The tenth season of the Intimate Stage was also opened by the photographic exhibition in the collection Review of Slovenian Scenes Photography: 10 Years of Intimate Stage, which will be completed in May next year at the international festival Prestopi/Crossings, with a review of the scenography included in the exhibition. The red thread of the exhibition is the performances that were hosted on the Intimate Stage, and the photographs of Nada Žgank, Miha Frasa, Miha Sagadina, Gregor Salobir and Andrej Firma, which have significantly documented the Maribor theatre event, are exhibited.

In the decade, 46 premieres took place on the Intimate Stage, including Ahmed Tobasi, Bert & Nasi, Matija Solce, Damir Avdić, Nik Škrlec, Minca Lorenci, Maruša Majer, Anže Zevnik, Katarina Stegnar, Mladen Dolar, Dario Varga, Blaž Šef, Bojana Kunst and many other notable names. "In ten years, a community has also developed that co-creates, supports and develops an independent culture", added Uroš Kaurin, program director at Momenta.

Moment, a society for the development of contemporary performing arts, works with its own production and guest performances on the intimate stage to promote a diversity of genres from theatre to objects, musical and dance performances, adult dolls to narrative theatre. "We are developing an independent performing arts. It's independent in the sense that no one is pressuring us: you're going to create a program one way or another, for these people and these people. We are free from this, of course limited by funding, but free from some dictate and within these frameworks we try to do and create the best we know", Zoran Petrović, producer and member of the Moment team, told TV Slovenia in a statement.

This season's news. The new season of Moment is set to premiere three more times. The first puppet show, Good Morning, a grasshopper co-produced with Maribor Puppet Theatre, has already won the Children's Jury Award at the 35th Maribor Summer Puppet Show. The second film, following the Slovenian transcript, will be released in October, and will feature the performance of the young Croatian director Tončica Knez in Death & Sound, starring Luke Piletić, Roka Kravanje and Tilna Kožamel, who explores life through death. They classify the show as a theater of objects and predict that it will be "very visual, with many powerful shadows, and will invite the viewer into an uncertain space between life and death".

They are preparing for a bigger celebration in May next year, when they reorganise the international festival of independent performing arts Prestopi/Crossings. The programme will be made up of artists from Romania, Italy, the UK, France, Bulgaria and Croatia, and an educational programme will be prepared. It will also be the final season premiere of the Tonight Show with Bertrand Lesca and Nancy Voutsas. The continuation of the previous two performances of The End and The Beginning "will be a surreal comedic look at nightlife", reports Moment.

Križarjenje po koordinatah našega življenja: nova razstava Zmaga Lenardiča v Galeriji ZDSLU

Ali si umetnost, ki ne izziva odprtih družbenih vprašanj, sploh še lahko privoščimo?

Umetnik Zmago Lenardič, prejemnik Župančičeve in Jakopičeve nagrade, na novi razstavi Koordinate raziskuje sodobno nelagodje v družbi. Razstava v Galeriji ZDSLU, ki presega stilne omejitve, bo na ogled do 28. septembra.

V Galeriji Zveze društev slovenskih likovnih umetnikov v Ljubljani (ZDSLU) svoja dela razstavlja nagrajeni umetnik Zmago Lenardič. Kot je zapisal Marko Košan, kustos razstave Koordinate, umetnik brez ideoloških predsodkov in vnaprej motiviranih moralnih sodb križari po koordinatah našega življenja. Na razstavi prevladujejo dela v mešanih tehnikah, opazna pa je prisotnost akrila in plastike.

Po Košanovih besedah je bil poleg močne in inventivne generacije kiparjev, ki se je v okvirih slovenske likovne scene ob koncu 80. in na začetku 90. let preteklega stoletja dejavno uprla rigidni modernistični paradigmi in se sproščeno priklonila pluralizmu likovnih praks v smislu preseganja stilskih omejitev, Lenardič eden redkih slikarjev, ki je v tistem trenutku konceptualno dosledno in z vključevanjem t. i. novih medijev na izviren način razmišljal o generičnem bistvu empiričnega in semiološkega kodeksa umetniškega nagovora ter radikalno razklenil zapovedano dvodimenzionalnost slikovne površine.

Dela, ki spominjajo na ulične grafite"Lenardičeve šablonsko izrezane in sestavljene figuralne kompozicije z izpostavljenimi konturami in črno-belo emblematično prezenco sicer spominjajo na ulične grafite, urbane prenašalce vsakovrstnih angažiranih sporočil v spektaklu sodobne potrošniške kulture, a so naposled vendarle nekakšne tableaux, ki odražajo situacije splošnega nelagodja v družbi," je še zapisal Košan. 

"Lenardič je tako formalno kot vsebinsko na izviren način prečistil rigidne nazore, kakršni so stoletja, vključno s predpostavkami, ki jih je izumljal modernizem, narekovali načela umetniškega ustvarjanja in poslanstva. Izmed vseh, ki jih je tako ali drugače odvrgel, pa je zadržal enega: umetnik je zanj še vedno katalizator življenja, zato se mora spopadati z brezkompromisnim razkrivanjem sprevrženih ali perfidno prikritih anomalij v sodobnem svetu in odigrati vlogo občutljivega ter izpostavljenega tipala prebujenske kolektivne vesti človeštva."

Od leta 2003 je zaposlen na ljubljanski Akademiji za likovno umetnost in oblikovanjeLenardič se je rodil leta 1959 v Ljubljani. Na Filozofski fakulteti v Ljubljani je študiral filozofijo in sociologijo ter nato še slikarstvo na Akademiji za likovno umetnost v Ljubljani. Deloval je kot član eksperimentalnega gledališča Glej ter kot soustanovitelj društva Galerija GT. Prejel je več nagrad, predstavljal Slovenijo v mednarodnem prostoru na simpozijih in kulturnih prestolnicah ter umetniških rezidencah, predvsem pa ustvarjal umetniška dela, ki se izmikajo obstoječim in znanim paradigmatskim vzorcem domače likovne scene. Leta 2004 mu je Mestna občina Ljubljana podelila Župančičevo nagrado za izjemne dosežke v kulturi, leta 2012 pa je prejel Jakopičevo nagrado.

Razstava v Galeriji ZDSLU je nastala v sodelovanju s Koroško galerijo likovnih umetnosti. Odprta bo do 28. septembra.

2024-09-14.english_content:
Cruising the Coordinates of Our Lives: A new exhibition of the Victory of Lenard in the ZDSLU Gallery

Is there any art that does not raise open social questions that we can afford?

The artist Zmago Lenardić, winner of the Župančić and Jakopic's prizes, explores the modern discomfort in society in the new exhibition Coordinate. The exhibition at the ZDSLU Gallery, which is beyond the confines of style, will be on view until September 28.

In the Galleria della Federazione delle Società di Artisti Slovenesi di Ljubljana (ZDSLU), the award-winning artist Zmago Lenardić is exhibiting his works. As Marco Koshan, curator of the Coordinate exhibition, wrote, an artist without ideological prejudice and pre-motivated moral judgments, crosses the coordinates of our lives. The exhibition is dominated by mixed-use works, but the presence of acrylic and plastic is noticeable.

In addition to the strong and inventive generation of sculptors who actively resisted the rigid modernist paradigm in the context of the Slovenian art scene in the late 1980s and early 1990s and freely leaned towards the pluralism of artistic practices in terms of transcending stylistic limitations, Lenardić was one of the few painters who at that time was conceptually consistent and, with the inclusion of so-called new media, thought in an original way about the generic essence of the empirical and semi-logical code of artistic discourse and radically unfolded the commanded two-dimensionality of the painting surface.

"Lenardic's patterned and composite figurative compositions with exposed contours and black and white emblematic design, while reminiscent of street graffiti, are urban conveyors of all kinds of engaged messages in the spectacle of modern consumer culture, but ultimately are some kind of tableaux that reflect situations of general discomfort in society", Košan wrote.

"Lenardic purged rigid views, both formal and substantive, in an original way, such that for centuries, including the assumptions invented by modernism, the principles of artistic creation and mission were dictated. But of all those he has rejected one thing or another, he has retained one: the artist is still a catalyst for life for him, and he must confront the uncompromising exposition of the perverted or perfidiously hidden anomalies of the modern world and play the role of a sensitive and exposed type of awakening of humanity's collective conscience".

Since 2003 he has been employed at the Academy of Fine Arts and Design in Ljubljana. He studied philosophy and sociology at the Faculty of Philosophy in Ljubljana and then painting at the Academy of Fine Arts in Ljubljana. He was a member of the experimental theatre Glai and co-founder of the Galeria GT. He has received several awards, represented Slovenia in the international arena at symposia and cultural capitals and art residences, and above all created works of art that evade the existing and well-known paradigmatic patterns of the local art scene. In 2004, the Municipality of Ljubljana awarded him the Župančiče Award for outstanding achievements in culture, and in 2012 he received the Jakopiče Award.

The exhibition at the ZDSLU Gallery was created in cooperation with the Koroko Gallery of Fine Arts. It'll be open until September 28.
2024-09-14.english_title: Cruising the Coordinates of Our Lives: A new exhibition of the Victory of Lenard in the ZDSLU Gallery

Kdo je mama, ko si vzame trenutek zase: gledališka raziskava odnosa med materjo in otrokom

Prva predstava kolektiva Reaktor pod produkcijskim okriljem gledališča Glej

Kolektiv Reaktor je v Gledališču Glej premierno predstavil predstavo Krik: Mama, ki raziskuje materinstvo in družinske travme. Predstava presega stereotipe in raziskuje globlje vezi med materjo in otrokom skozi življenje.

Ponovitve avtorske predstave Krik: mama kolektiva Reaktor v gledališču Glej bodo po petkovi premieri še v soboto in nedeljo, 14. in 15. septembra, ob 20.00.

Kolektiv Reaktor ustvarja avtorske predstave, v katerih se glasno loteva družbenih tabujev. Po tematiki spolnih zlorab otrok in slabi medsebojni komunikaciji so včeraj v gledališču Glej premierno uprizorili tretjo predstavo iz opusa Krik – Mama.

"Predstava Mama se ukvarja ne samo z družino, ampak z najožjo celico, s katero pridemo v stik, čim se rodimo oziroma še preden se rodimo, že v maternici. To je prvi odnos, v katerega vstopamo, zato nas je zanimalo raziskovanje točno tega odnosa skozi gledališče in poiskati njegove zamolčanosti," je dejala Katja Markič, članica kolektiva Reaktor.

Temo materinstva so izbrali, ker opažajo, da se v družbi, še posebno v njihovi generaciji, vse bolj razmišlja o družinskih oziroma podedovanih travmah. "Pogosto najprej nagovorimo mame kot prve krivke za travme, ki smo jih imeli, predvsem pa se v družbi gleda na materinstvo in na mamo kot osebo, ki bo ravnokar rodila, ki menja plenice, ki je razpeta med družino in kariero. Mi mislimo, da je za materinstvom še nekaj več kot teh nekaj prvih let," pove Urša Majcen, prav tako članica kolektiva.

Predstava tako odpre širši pogled na to, kar družba stereotipno dojema kot materinstvo. "S svojimi starši imamo odnos še globoko v odraslost. Tudi ko razmišljamo, ali bi stopili na njeno mesto, imamo odnos z mamo, ko jo dojamemo kot osebo in ne kot človeka, ki te je vzgojil," zaključi Majcen. 

Pod avtorstvo in estetsko zasnovo predstave se podpisujejo Urša Majcen, Katja Markič, Nina Valič, Lara Wolf, Jure Žavbi, pod režijo Katja Markič, pod dramaturgijo Urša Majcen, pod glasbo in zvok Ana Jerina in pod oblikovanje luči Domen Lušin. V predstavi igrajo Nina Valič, Lara Wolf in Jure Žavbi.
2024-09-14.title: Kdo je mama, ko si vzame trenutek zase: gledališka raziskava odnosa med materjo in otrokom
2024-09-14.english_content:
Who is a mother when she takes a moment for herself: a theatrical study of the mother-child relationship

The first performance of the collective Reactor under the production wing of the theatre

The Reactors collective premiered the play "Cry: Mom, exploring motherhood and family trauma" at the Glai Theatre. The play transcends stereotypes and explores the deeper bond between mother and child throughout life.

The re-enactment of the original play "Cry: Mother of the Reactors" at the Glai will be released on Friday and Sunday, September 14 and 15, at 8 p.m.

The Reactor collective creates author's plays that speak out against social taboos. The third performance of the opus, "Crying Mama", was premiered yesterday at the Glai Theatre, following the theme of child sexual abuse and poor communication.

"The Mother Show is concerned not only with the family but also with the delicate cell we come into contact with as soon as we are born or even before we are born, already in the womb. This is the first relationship we're entering, so we're interested in exploring that relationship through the theatre and finding its hiddenness", said Katja Markić, a member of the Reaktor collective.

They chose the subject of motherhood because they see that society, especially their generation, is increasingly concerned with family or inherited trauma. "We often talk to mothers first as the first to blame for the trauma we've had, but most of all, in society, they look at motherhood and on motherhood as a newborn who changes diapers that are torn between family and career. We think there is more to motherhood than these first few years", says Urša Majcen, also a member of the collective.

The show thus opens up a broader view of what society stereotypically perceives as motherhood. "We have a deep relationship with our parents as adults. Even when we think about taking her place, we have a relationship with her when we see her as a person and not the person who raised you", concludes Majcen.

The authorship and aesthetic design of the play are by Urša Majcen, Katja Markič, Nina Valič, Lara Wolf, Jura Žavbi, directed by Katja Markič, the playwright Urša Majcen, the music and soundtrack by Ana Jerina and the lighting design by Domen Lushin. The show stars Nina Valić, Lara Wolf and Jura Frog.
2024-09-14.english_title: Who is a mother when she takes a moment for herself: a theatrical study of the mother-child relationship

Beetlejuice Beetlejuice

Film je na sporedih kinematografih od 4. septembra, tudi v Sloveniji

Se še spomnite nemarnega, nadležnega, maničnega, v črtasto črno-belo obleko odetega duha Betelgeusa, ki je konec 80. let v odlični interpretaciji Michaela Keatona s svojimi neokusnimi potegavščinami razgrajal po idilični soseski ameriškega mesteca?

Čeprav je nadaljevanje scenaristično šibkejše, pa je s svojo igrivo estetiko vendarle dostojen naslednik kultne uspešnice.

Tistega Betelgeusa, ki je silil najstniško darkerico Lydio, da skoči z njim v zakonski jarem in ga tako spravi med žive? Fantazijska komedija iz leta 1988 je med zvezde izstrelila takrat 16-letno Winono Ryder in mojstra filmske magije Tima Burtona ter zacementirala njegov ekscentrični slog, utemeljen na dramatičnih grozljivih prizoriščih, grotesknih likih, barvitih kostumih, izkrivljenih proporcih ter očarljivi mešanici nedolžnosti in grozljivosti. Beetlejuice je z leti prerastel v kult, zdaj pa si lahko na velikih platnih ogledate njegovo nadaljevanje.

Dobrih 35 let pozneje je Lydia zagrenjena, nevrotična voditeljica pogovorne oddaje, v kateri komunicira z dušami umrlih. Skupaj z mačeho, odtujeno hčerko in lakomnim partnerjem se po dolgih letih vrne v hišo duhov, da bi pokopala očeta in pomagala pospraviti nekdanji dom. Seveda ne mine dolgo, preden sreča Betelgeusa in se znova odpravi v Spodnji svet – tokrat zato, da bi rešila hčerko pred usodno napako.

Izvirnik je imel odlično zastavljeno in presenetljivo sporočilno zgodbo, ki jo je Burton ob pomoči svoje divje vizualne domišljije prekvasil v duhovito morbiden bombonček za vse generacije, njegovo nadaljevanje pa je scenaristično precej bolj anarhično, preobloženo z veliko količino stranskih zgodb in gegov, ki odvračajo pozornost od osnovne pripovedne niti, spletene okrog dejstva, da se je odrasla Lydia hudo izneverila otroški različici sebe in zagrešila podobne napake kot njeni starši. 

Čeprav je nadaljevanje scenaristično šibkejše, pa je s svojo igrivo estetiko vendarle dostojen naslednik kultne uspešnice. Privlačnost Burtonovih filmov  je predvsem to, da niso polikani do zadnje podrobnosti in da se izogibajo računalniško generiranim posebnim učinkom. Vizualije so namerno grobe in neizoblikovane, z oprijemljivo naredi sam patino, ki jim vdihne dušo in grozljivo naredi domače, skorajda prisrčno. Burton pa se filmski zgodovini, iz katere se napaja, pokloni tudi s sekvenco animacije stop motion in imitacijo črno-bele italijanske grozljivke.

Za konec je treba še omeniti, da se nadaljevanje kar precej opira na svojega predhodnika, to pa utegne biti težavno, saj njegovo ciljno občinstvo danes najbrž ni enako tistemu, ki ga je pred več kot tremi desetletji vzelo za svojega.

Iz oddaje Gremo v kino.
2024-09-14.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
2024-09-14.english_content:
Beetlejuice Beetlejuice

The film is on the cinemas since 4 September, also in Slovenia

Remember the careless, annoying, manic, striped-black-and-white dressed in the spirit of Betelgeuse who, in the late 1980s, in the excellent interpretation of Michael Keaton, with his tasteless tricks, tore apart the idyllic neighborhood of a small American town?

Although the sequel is more screenplay-weak, it is a worthy successor to the cult classic with its playful aesthetic.

The Betelgeuse who forced teenage darker girl Lydia to jump with him into a marriage pit and bring him back to life? The 1988 fantasy comedy starred then 16-year-old Winona Ryder and master of film magic Tim Burton, cementing his eccentric style based on dramatic horror scenes, grotesque characters, colorful costumes, distorted proportions, and charming blends of innocence and horror. Beetlejuice has grown into a cult over the years, and now you can watch its sequel on the big screen.

Well, 35 years later, Lydia is a hotheaded, neurotic talk show host who communicates with the souls of the dead. With her stepmother, estranged daughter, and long-suffering partner, she returns to the house of the spirits to bury her father and help clean up the former home. Of course, it wasn't long before he met Betelgeus and went back to the Underworld, this time to save his daughter from a fateful mistake.

The source had a well-crafted and surprising message story that Burton, with the help of his wild visual imagination, brushed into a funny morbid candy for all generations, and his sequel is scenarically much more anarchic, overlapping with a lot of side stories and gags that distract from the basic narrative thread, woven around the fact that adult Lydia had severely disappointed her childhood version of herself and made similar mistakes as her parents.

Although the sequel is more screenplay-weak, it is a worthy successor to the cult classic with its playful aesthetic. The attraction of Burton films is that they are not painted to the last detail and avoid computer-generated special effects. The visuals are deliberately rough and unformed, with the accommodating making itself a duck that breaks their soul and creepily makes homey, almost hearty. Burton also admires the film history of which he is inspired by a sequence of stop motion animation and a black and white Italian horror film.

Finally, it should be noted that the series is based on its predecessor, which can be difficult, since its target audience today is probably not the same as it was more than three decades ago.

We're going to the movies.
