Očitki nepravilnosti na ministrstvu za kulturo: SDS zahteva nujno sejo odbora DZ-ja

Ob zahtevi za sklic seje v SDS-u predlagajo v sprejem tudi več sklepov

SDS-ova poslanska skupina zahteva sklic nujne seje odbora državnega zbora za kulturo, v ospredju katere bi bil domnevni mobing in nezakonito delovanje na ministrstvu za kulturo, kjer naj bi po njihovem vladala svojevrstna diktatura nevladnikov.

Poslanska skupina opozicijske Slovenske demokratske stranke (SDS) je svojo zahtevo naslovila na predsednico odbora državnega zbora (DZ) za kulturo Saro Žibrat, ki prihaja iz vrst Svobode.

Zahtevo za sklic nujne seje so med drugim podprli s podatki, da se je na ministrstvu za kulturo v slabih dveh letih na novo zaposlilo 74 posameznikov, hkrati pa je 44 javnim uslužbencem prenehalo delovno razmerje. Po navedbah SDS-a pa naj bi na ministrstvu tudi vladala svojevrstna diktatura nevladnikov, ena ključnih figur v tej zgodbi naj bi po njihovem bil vodja sektorja za umetnost Rok Avbar.

Opozicijska poslanska skupina se v svoji zahtevi za sklic nujne seje sklicuje tudi na nedavno objavo računskega sodišča. To je namreč ugotovilo, da je ministrstvo za kulturo denarni del Prešernove nagrade v znesku 8346 evrov Svetlani Makarovič izplačalo v nasprotju s tretjim odstavkom 2. člena zakona o javnih financah. Računsko sodišče je ugotovilo tudi, da ministrstvo pred izplačilom ni dovolj skrbno preverilo vseh pravnih dejstev in okoliščin primera v zvezi s prenehanjem obveznosti iz podeljene nagrade.

V SDS-u predlagajo v sprejem tudi naslednje sklepe: odbor DZ-ja za kulturo naj pozove ministrico za kulturo Asto Vrečko in vodstvo ministrstva, da naj prepreči in ustavi nezakonite pritiske na zaposlene, da zagotovi zaposlenim pravice, ki izhajajo iz zakona o delovnih razmerjih, ter da ustrezno ukrepa proti vodji sektorja za umetnost Avbarju. Predlagajo tudi sklep, da odbor DZ-ja na Asto Vrečko naslovi poziv za sprejetje odgovornosti za ugotovljene nepravilnosti iz revizijskega poročila računskega sodišča in da naj razmisli o odstopu z ministrskega mesta.
2024-09-13.title: Očitki nepravilnosti na ministrstvu za kulturo: SDS zahteva nujno sejo odbora DZ-ja
2024-09-13.english_content:
Signs of irregularities at the Ministry of Culture: SDS requests an emergency meeting of the ZO Committee

They also propose to adopt several resolutions following the request for a meeting of the SDS

The SDS parliamentary group is calling for an emergency meeting of the State Council Committee on Culture, which would be led by alleged mobbing and illegal activity at the Ministry of Culture, where they are supposed to be ruled by a kind of non-governmental dictatorship.

The opposition Slovenian Democratic Party (SDS) parliamentary group has addressed its request to the chairperson of the State Council's (DZ) Culture Committee, Sara Žibrat, who comes from the Svoboda group.

The request for the summons of the emergency meeting was supported, inter alia, by the fact that 74 persons were recruited at the Ministry of Culture in the past two years and 44 civil servants were laid off. According to SDS, the ministry is also supposed to be ruled by a kind of non-governmental dictatorship, one of the key figures in this story is said to be the head of the art sector Rok Avbar.

The opposition group also refers to a recent publication by the Court of Auditors in its request to convene an emergency meeting. It found that the Ministry of Culture paid the financial part of the Prešern Prize of EUR 8346 to Svetlana Makarović, contrary to the third paragraph of Article 2 of the Public Finance Act. The Court also found that the Ministry had not sufficiently carefully verified all the legal facts and circumstances of the case concerning the termination of the obligation under the award before the payment.

The SDS also proposes the following decisions: the Culture Committee of the DZ should call on the Ministry of Culture, Asto Bagčko and the Ministry's leadership to prevent and stop unlawful pressures on employees, to ensure that employees enjoy the rights under the Employment Relations Act, and to take appropriate action against the head of the arts sector, Avbar. They also propose that the Asto Bagek Committee of the SA should be called upon to accept responsibility for the findings of irregularities in the Court's audit report and to consider resigning.
2024-09-13.english_title: Signs of irregularities at the Ministry of Culture: SDS requests an emergency meeting of the ZO Committee

2024-09-13.author: P. G.
2024-09-13.content:
Škofja Loka bogatejša za AKC Nama, namenjen neodvisni produkciji in ustvarjanju

Drevi prvi dogodek pod streho AKC-ja Nama v Škofji Loki

V nekdanji škofjeloški veleblagovnici Nama po novem domuje alternativni kulturni center, pri vzpostavitvi katerega je moči združilo več društev in posameznikov, ki bodo skrbeli za stalen program koncertov, razstav, razprav in drugih dogodkov.

Alternativni kulturni center (AKC) Nama bo prvi dogodek gostil drevi ob 20. uri, na katerem bodo nastopili Tomaž Hostnik in zasedba U$IŁ. V prihodnjih dneh med drugim sledijo odprtje razstave Zunipera/Dva dežnika, eden izmed dogodkov v okviru Klubskega maratona Radia Študent, večer poezije, jam session, filmski in pripovedovalski večer ter predavanje o Palestini.

Po besedah predstavnikov širše iniciative za novi AKC Nama so v Škofji Loki že dolgo potrebovali manjše kulturno prizorišče, ki bi bilo namenjeno kvalitetni neodvisni produkciji in ustvarjanju. Govora je torej o kulturi, ki ne sodi niti na komercialna niti študentska prizorišča. Škofja Loka pa prav tako potrebuje prostor srečevanja in združevanja družbeno angažiranih in kritičnih posameznikov.

V zaključni fazi pridobivanja gradbenega dovoljenjaV Škofji Loki so namreč že dolgo opažali manko prizorišč za alternativno kulturo in tudi manko središča, oporišča oziroma zatočišča za tiste, ki niso sprijaznjeni z družbeno realnostjo, je pojasnil organizator dogodkov Tine Hafner. "Prisiljeni smo se bili seliti po različnih prizoriščih ali se dobivati po različnih barih," je dejal in dodal, da so se pred dvema letoma lotili iskanja ustreznega prostora, a dolgo niso imeli sreče. 

Pri tej pridobitvi prostora jim je pomagala škofjeloška občina, ki je društvu Alternator, povezanim s še nekaterimi društvi in somišljeniki, dala v začasen brezplačen najem opuščene prostore v prvem nadstropju nekdanje veleblagovnice Nama. V objektu sicer delujejo še trgovina, Radio Sora in mladinski oddelek škofjeloške knjižnice.

Špela Justin, direktorica uprave Občine Škofja Loka, je povedala, da na občini radi spodbujajo bogato in raznoliko kulturno dogajanje, zato prazne prostore, ki so v lasti občine, dajejo v brezplačno uporabo društvom, ki delujejo v javnem interesu. AKC Nama bo lahko v teh prostorih deloval, dokler ne bo občina začela v njih urejati novih prostorov za Knjižnico Ivana Tavčarja Škofja Loka.

Trenutno je v zaključni fazi pridobivanja gradbenega dovoljenja, ki ga na občini pričakujejo do konca tega leta. Sledil bo razpis za izvajalca del, hkrati pa si bo občina prizadevala za projekt ureditve novih prostorov knjižnice pridobiti nepovratna sredstva in tako zapreti finančno konstrukcijo.

Po besedah predstavnice širše iniciative za AKC Nama Mojce Selak tako še ni jasno, koliko časa bodo lahko uporabljali prostore za alternativni center. Računajo pa, da bodo z rednim, kakovostnim programom in obiskovalci občino prepričali, da je takšen center v Škofji Loki potreben in da bo lahko v nekih drugih prostorih nadaljeval svoje delo tudi v prihodnje.

Nasploh manko tovrstnih prostorov za organsko druženjeV širši iniciativi za AKC Nama k sodelovanju vabijo vse, ki bi želeli prispevati k programu in sooblikovati ta prostor. Odprtje AKC-ja Nama je pozdravil tudi glasbenik, publicist in aktivist Miha Blažič – N'Toko, ki poudarja, da v Sloveniji primanjkuje tovrstnih prostorov za organsko druženje, kjer bi lahko ljudi različnih generacij iz različnih okolij ustvarjali nove izrazne oblike. V komercialnih in strogo formalnih prostorih ni takšnega spontanega izražanja in pogovora med ljudmi, ki je lahko tudi zametek družbenih gibanj, je še dodal Blažič.
2024-09-13.title: Škofja Loka bogatejša za AKC Nama, namenjen neodvisni produkciji in ustvarjanju
2024-09-13.english_content:
Bishop Lok Bogatjeri for AKC Nama, dedicated to independent production and creation

Trees first event under the roof of AKC Nama in Škofja Loki

The former bishop's supermarket Nama is now home to an alternative cultural centre, which has been established by a group of companies and individuals who will be responsible for a permanent programme of concerts, exhibitions, discussions and other events.

The Alternative Cultural Centre (AKC) Nam will host the first event for the trees at 20:00, which will feature Tomaž Hostnik and the U$IŁ crew. The coming days will include the opening of the Zuniper/Two Umbrellas exhibition, one of the events of the Radio Student Club Marathon, a poetry evening, a jam session, a film and storytelling evening and a lecture on Palestine.

According to the representatives of the wider initiative for the new AKC Nama, a smaller cultural venue in Škofje Loki has long been needed to provide quality independent production and creation. So it's a culture that doesn't belong to the commercial or student scene. Bishop Loka also needs a place to meet and unite socially engaged and critical individuals.

In the final stage of obtaining a building permit, the Bishop of Loki has long been aware of the lack of alternative culture venues and of centres, bases or shelters for those who are not familiar with social realities, explained event organiser Tine Hafner. "We were forced to move around different venues or get together at different bars", he said, adding that two years ago they were trying to find suitable space, but they were not lucky for long.

In this acquisition, the Bishop's Office helped them, and the Alternator, which was affiliated with other societies and associations, leased the abandoned premises of the former large retail store Nama on the first floor temporarily free of charge. The building also houses a shop, Radio Sora and the youth section of the Bishop's Library.

Justin Spella, the director of the Municipality of Bishop Loka, said that the municipality likes to promote a rich and diverse cultural event, so the vacant premises owned by the municipality are given to the public interest companies for free use. The AKC Nama will be able to operate in these premises until the municipality starts to arrange new premises for the Ivan Tavčár Škof Lok Library.

The municipality is currently in the final stages of obtaining a building permit, which is expected by the end of this year. The tender for the project will be followed by the tender, while the municipality will endeavour to obtain grants for the project to arrange new library premises and thus close the financial structure.

According to the representative of the wider initiative for the AKC Nama Mojce Selak, it is not yet clear how long the space for the alternative centre will be available. They hope that a regular, high-quality program and visitors will convince the municipality that such a centre in Škofja Loki is needed and that it will be able to continue its work in other premises in the future.

The wider AKC Nam initiative invites all those wishing to contribute to the programme and to co-design the space to participate. The opening of the AKC Nama was also welcomed by musician, publicist and activist Miha Blažič  ⁇  N'Toko, who stresses that Slovenia lacks such spaces for organic association where people of different generations from different backgrounds could create new forms of expression. In commercial and strictly formal spaces, there is no such spontaneous expression and conversation between people, which can also be a disruption to social movements, Blažič added.
2024-09-13.english_title: Bishop Lok Bogatjeri for AKC Nama, dedicated to independent production and creation

2024-09-13.content:
V novomeškem Kulturnem centru Janeza Trdine razstava Kiki Klimt

Samostojna razstava slovenske umetnice in raziskovalke

V galeriji Kocka Kulturnega centra Janeza Trdine je med 13. septembrom in 4. oktobrom na ogled razstava Kiki Klimt z naslovom Vizualna analiza mita Psihe in Erosa skozi Heglovo dialektiko.

Kot je ob razstavi zapisala Zigi Omerzel, za vsako umetničino posamezno sliko stoji natančna shema kompozicije in barv, ki temelji na pitagorejski geometriji, kemiji, matematiki in njenih lastnih spoznanjih. "Pristop je prilagojen vsaki seriji slik, vedno pa sledi quadriviliumu, temelju lepih umetnosti v stari Grčiji," je dodala.

Pri umetničinem slikanju je proces priprave mnogokrat bolj dolgotrajen kot samo slikanje in nič manj pomemben, tehnika slikanja pa ni nič manj vestno premišljena in izpiljena kot ves predhodni proces, ugotavlja Zigi Omerzel. In dodaja: "Klimt tako kot Hegel, ki v Fenomenologiji duha prehaja od posameznega k občemu, s projektom išče tisto obče mita. Vsaka serija slik predstavlja en korak v dialektičnem procesu; začne se s tezo, ki ji nasprotuje antiteza, kolumnirata pa v sintezi, ki odpre pot za naslednjo tezo. Serije dialektiki ne sledijo le konceptualno, temveč tudi vizualno."

Kiki Klimt je slovenska umetnica in raziskovalka. Je profesorica na različnih univerzah in šolah. Posveča se razumevanju vizualnega jezika, filozofiji, mitologiji in psihologiji.
2024-09-13.title: V novomeškem Kulturnem centru Janeza Trdine razstava Kiki Klimt
2024-09-13.english_content:
The exhibition Kiki Klimt at the John Hardin Cultural Center in New Mexico

Independent exhibition of Slovenian artists and researchers

The exhibition Kiki Klimt, entitled Visual Analysis of the Myth of Psyche and Eros through Hegel's Dialectics, is on view at the Kock Gallery of the John Trdine Cultural Center between September 13 and October 4.

As Zigi Omerzel wrote at the exhibition, each painting is a precise scheme of composition and colour based on Pythagorean geometry, chemistry, mathematics and her own insights. "The approach is tailored to each series of paintings, but always follows the quadrivilium, the foundation of fine art in ancient Greece", she added.

In artistic painting, the preparation process is often more time-consuming than just painting and is no less important, and the technique of painting is no less consciously thought out and executed than the entire previous process, notes Zigi Omerzel. He adds: "The climate, like Hegel's, which in the phenomenology of the spirit moves from individual to community, is a project to find that common myth. Each series of images represents a single step in a dialectical process; it begins with a thesis opposed by the antithesis and columns in a synthesis that paves the way for the next thesis. The series of dialects follows not only conceptually but also visually".

Kiki Klimt is a Slovenian artist and explorer. She's a professor at various universities and schools. It is dedicated to understanding visual language, philosophy, mythology and psychology.
2024-09-13.english_title: The exhibition Kiki Klimt at the John Hardin Cultural Center in New Mexico

ZgodoVikend v Parku vojaške zgodovine s številnimi prilagoditvami za ranljive skupine

ZgodoVikend je največji vojaškozgodovinski dogodek na nacionalni ravni

V Parku vojaške zgodovine Pivka se odvija tridnevni tradicionalni ZgodoVikend. Ob podpori ministrstva za kulturo so letos ogled muzejskih razstav in zbirk prilagodili tudi ranljivim skupinam.

Tradicionalno je prvo dejanje festivala Vestirnga ali nabor z bogato okrašenimi vozovi – gre za ohranjanje žive dediščine. Veliko dogodkov pripravljajo tudi jutri, glavnina pa bo na vrsti v nedeljo s predstavitvami dela gasilcev, Slovenske vojske in Policije.

Tokratni ZgodoVikend traja od 13. do 15. septembra. Natančen program najdete tukaj.

Kot je za Radio Slovenija poročala Sabrina Mulec, se v Parku vojaške zgodovine zavedajo, kako pomembno je, da je ogled dostopen tudi ranljivim skupinam. Po besedah direktorja Janka Boštjančiča so na tem področju naredili velike premike. "Za gibalno ovirane osebe smo omogočili virtualen ogled notranjosti podmornice, notranjosti policijskega čolna in utrdbe na Primožu. Gre za del ponudbe Parka vojaške zgodovine, ki sicer gibalno oviranim ni dostopen ali pa je zelo težko dostopen. Zato bomo tudi do konca leta omogočili še virtualen ogled notranjosti dveh oklepnih vozil," je za Radio Slovenija povedal direktor parka.

"Za potrebe oseb s težavami z vidom smo pripravili miniature naših nosilnih eksponatov v merilu 1:14, ki jih lahko primejo v roke, se z dotikom potem seznanijo s podrobnostmi predstavljenih vozil. Za slabovidne smo tudi dodatno osvetlili razstavo o Enigmi in razstavo Pot v samostojnost, kot glavni razstavi v Parku vojaške zgodovine," je dodal Boštjančič.

Posebno skrb so posvetili tudi gluhim in naglušnim ter s pomočjo Sama Dolanca vodenje prevedli v slovenski znakovni jezik. Obiskovalci imajo tako po direktorjevih besedah možnost, da "na osmih lokacijah s pametnim telefonom poskenirajo QR-kodo, ki jih popelje do videovodnika v znakovnem jeziku. Posnet imamo tudi že videovodnik v mednarodni kretnji, ki bo obiskovalcem na voljo do konca leta."

Dolanc je ob prevodu soproge in tolmačke Maruše Dolanc glede tega povedal: "Za nas gluhe te prilagoditve s snemanjem v glasovni jezik na osmih točkah še zmeraj ne pomenijo polne prilagoditve, še zmeraj ne dobimo vseh informacij. Še zmeraj potrebujemo zraven vodiča, da nam poglobljeno razloži. A vendarle gre za razlago osnov, kar veliko prispeva gluhi skupnosti. Znakovni jezik je res drugačen od slovenskega govornega jezika, tako da zgolj branje nekih vsebin ni dovolj. Veliko gluhih tega potem ne bi razumelo v popolnosti, zato je potrebna prilagoditev v znakovni jezik, saj je to naš materni jezik." Slovenščina je tako pravzaprav njihov drugi jezik.

EarlyVicend in the Park of Military History with many adaptations for vulnerable groups

The weekend is the largest military event in history at national level.

The Bear Park of Military History is hosting a three-day traditional Easter Weekend. With the support of the Ministry of Culture, this year's museum exhibitions and collections have also been adapted to target vulnerable groups.

Traditionally, the first act of the Vestirnga Festival or the richly decorated chariot set is to preserve a living heritage. Many events are planned for tomorrow, and the main event will be held on Sunday with presentations of firefighters, the Slovenian army and police.

This year's Easter Weekend runs from September 13 to 15. You can find the exact program here.

As reported by Sabrina Mulec to Radio Slovenia, the Park of Military History is aware of the importance of making the tour accessible to vulnerable groups. According to Director Jank Boštjančić, major progress has been made in this area. "We have provided a virtual view of the interior of the submarine, the interior of the police boat and the fortress at Primož for persons with disabilities. It's part of the Military History Park's offer, which is either inaccessible to the disabled or very difficult to access. Therefore, we will also make it possible to see the interior of two armored vehicles in a virtual way by the end of the year", the park's director told Radio Slovenia.

"For the needs of visually impaired persons, we have prepared miniatures of our wearable display devices at a 1:14 scale, which they can take in their hands and then touch to learn the details of the vehicles presented. For the visually impaired, we also added light to the Enigma exhibition and the Path to Independence exhibition, as the main exhibition in the Park of Military History", added Boštjančić.

They also paid special attention to the deaf and hard of hearing and, with the help of Sam Dolanc, translated the text into Slovenian Sign Language. According to the director, visitors can "scanning QR codes in eight locations using a smartphone that leads them to the sign language video guide. We also have an international video guide that will be available to visitors by the end of the year".

In this regard, Dolanc said while translating his wife and interpreter Marusha Dolanc: "For the deaf, these adjustments to the eight-point voice recording still do not mean full adjustments, we still do not get all the information. We still need a guide to explain it in depth. But it's still an explanation of the basics, which is a big contribution to the deaf community. Sign language is indeed different from Slovenian spoken language, so reading some content is not enough. Many deaf people would not understand this perfectly, so we need to adapt to sign language, as it is our mother tongue". Slovene is their second language.

Gledališče Koper v novi sezoni tudi z deloma Yasmine Reza in Elene Ferrante

Na koprskem odru v sezoni 2024/25 tri premiere in glasbeno-gledališki projekt

Gledališče Koper je za sezono 2024/25 napovedalo tri premiere. Prva bo Tri verzije življenja v režiji Nine Šorak, sledili bosta koprodukcija Naša familija v režiji Marjana Nećaka in igra po romanu Elene Ferrante Dnevi zavrženosti v režiji Tijane Zinajić.

Predstava po besedilu slavne francoske dramaturginje, igralke, romanopiske in scenaristke Yasmine Reza bo na sporedu oktobra. Dogajanje njene drame Tri verzije je postavljeno v stanovanje v 14. pariškem okrožju. Medtem ko Henri in Sonia spravljata spat svojega sinčka in žolčno razpravljata o meji, do katere je še vzgojno ustreči zahtevam otrok, zvonec na vratih naznani obisk Huberta, Henrijevega mentorja in nadrejenega sodelavca na univerzi, ter njegove žene Ines, čeprav sta Henri in Sonia prepričana, da sta ju na obisk povabila šele naslednji dan.

Opisani prizor je predstavljen v treh različicah, na kar aludira že naslov igre. Razmerje moči med protagonisti v prizorih strukturno ohranja bolj ali manj enako, spreminja pa očišče pogleda ter značajske in psihološke značilnosti likov, so zapisali v koprskem gledališču. Predstavo po tem besedilu so v režiji Borisa Cavazze v sezoni 2002/2003 uprizorili v ljubljanski Drami.

Koprodukcijski muzikal še na koprskem odruSledil bo družinski muzikal Naša familija, ki je nastal v koprodukciji koprskega gledališča, Slovenskega stalnega gledališča Trst in Italijanske drame HNK Ivana pl. Zajca ter je konec avgusta doživel krstno uprizoritev na primorskem Mednarodnem otroškem festivalu Pri svetilniku. Besedilo in songe za muzikal v režiji makedonsko-slovenskega skladatelja Marjana Nećaka je prispevala Saša Eržen. Dogajanje je postavljeno v mladinski dom v stari vili, kjer živi sedem najstniških sirot, skupaj z njimi pa tudi domski vzgojitelj Marko. Na drugem koncu mesta, v novi vili, živita premožni poslovnež Luka Dicaprio in njegova žena Laura. Teme, ki jih ta predstava naslavlja, so odraščanje, družina, tehnologije, interes kapitala in moč skupnosti.

Sodobna izobraženka preizprašuje svojo identitetoNaslednje leto bodo februarja odprli s premiero predstave po romanu Dnevi zavrženosti italijanske avtorice, ki ustvarja pod imenom Elena Ferrante. Delo o ženski, ki jo zapusti mož, preizprašuje identiteto sodobne izobraženke, zaznamovane s svojim spolom, družbeno vlogo in materinstvom, opisuje njene duševne stiske in boje, hkrati pa opisuje tudi odziv družbe, prijateljev in znancev na položaj pravkar ločene in nemočne ženske, so o vsebini napovedane predstave zapisali v koprskem gledališču. Za dramatizacijo bo poskrbela Urška Taufer.

Kot so še sporočili iz Gledališča Koper, bodo maja 2025 gostili glasbeno-gledališki večer dramskega igralca Roka Matka, ki ga bo režiral Jaka Ivanc. Matku se bodo na odru pridružili njegovi igralski kolegi in glasbeni gostje, med njimi tudi Tinkara Kovač.

"Svet, ki ga uprizarjamo, je naš svet, igralec je le okno, čez katero pogledamo vase, pesnik je naš glas, ki poje o nas, glasbenik je struna, ki vibrira nas. Mogoče se ne prepoznamo vedno takoj, ker gledalec mora snov tudi predelati in o njej razmisliti. Ni naključje, da Sigmund Freud umetnike imenuje 'naši dragoceni zavezniki'," je v svojem nagovoru ob novi sezoni med drugim zapisala direktorica koprskega gledališča Katja Pegan.

2024-09-13.english_content:
The Copper Theatre in the new season also featuring Yasmine Reza and Elena Ferrante

Three premieres and a music-theatre project on the Copper stage in the 2024/25 season

The Koper Theatre has announced three premieres for the 2024/25 season. The first three versions of life will be directed by Nine Shoraks, followed by a co-production of Our Family directed by Marjan Nečak and a play based on Elena Ferrante's novel Days of Disappearance directed by Tijana Zinajić.

The play, written by the famous French playwright, actress, novelist and screenwriter Yasmine Reza, will be released in October. The setting of her play Three Versions is set in an apartment in the 14th arrondissement of Paris. As Henri and Sonia put their son to bed and bitterly discussed the boundary that still educates the child, a bell rings at the door announcing a visit by Hubert, Henry's mentor and senior fellow at the university, and his wives, Ines, although Henri and Sonia are convinced that they did not invite them to visit until the next day.

The scene described is presented in three versions, as the title of the game already mentions. The power ratio between the protagonists in the scenes is structurally more or less the same, but it changes the pure view and the characteristic and psychological characteristics of the characters, they wrote in the Copper Theatre. The play was adapted into a 2002/2003 drama by Boris Cavazza.

The musical will be followed by the family musical Our Family, which was co-produced by the Cypriot Theatre, the Slovenian Stage Theatre Trst and the Italian drama HNK Ivan pl. The lyrics and soundtrack for the musical were composed by the Macedonian-Slovenian composer Marjan Nećak. The story is set in a youth home in an old mansion, where seven teenage orphans live, along with their home-schooled mentor Mark. On the other side of town, in a new mansion, live a wealthy businessman, Luka Dicaprio, and his wife, Laura. The themes of this show are growing up, family, technology, capital interests and community power.

A modern educator questions her identity. A play based on the novel 'Days of Dismissal' by Italian author Elena Ferrante will open in February next year. The work about a woman abandoned by her husband questions the identity of a modern educated woman, marked by her gender, social role and motherhood, describes her mental distress and struggles, and at the same time describes the reaction of society, friends and acquaintances to the position of a newly separated and helpless woman. The drama will be directed by Urska Taufer.

As reported by the Koper Theatre, the musical and theatre evening will be hosted by actor Roka Matka in May 2025, directed by Jaka Ivanc. The mother will be joined on stage by his fellow actors and musical guests, including Tinkara Kovac.

"The world we are playing is our world, the player is just a window through which we look inward, the poet is our voice, singing about us, the musician is the string that vibrates us. We may not always recognize ourselves immediately, for the viewer must also process and reflect on the material. It is no coincidence that Sigmund Freud calls artists 'our precious allies,'" wrote the director of the Copper Theatre, Katja Pegan, in her new season speech.
2024-09-13.english_title: The Copper Theatre in the new season also featuring Yasmine Reza and Elena Ferrante

Cankarjev dom obiskali kriminalisti, ki so prišli po podatke in dokumentacijo

Pred izbiro novega generalnega direktorja največje slovenske kulturne ustanove

Domnevne nepravilnosti v Cankarjevem domu (CD) so pod drobnogled vzeli kriminalisti Nacionalnega preiskovalnega urada, ki vodi predkazenski postopek, v katerem preverja več sklopov očitanih nepravilnosti. Kriminalisti so dopoldne tudi obiskali CD.

Kot poroča portal 24ur, so po njihovih zanesljivih informacijah kriminalisti danes v dopoldanskih urah obiskali CD, v največjo slovensko kulturno ustanovo pa naj bi prišli po podatke in dokumentacijo. 

Očitki netransparentnega delovanja javnega zavodaV zadnjem času se je pojavilo več očitkov o netransparentnem delovanju tega javnega zavoda, ki ga kot generalna direktorica vodi Uršula Cetinski. Oktobra se ji izteče drugi petletni mandat, za nov mandat pa naj bi imela podporo tako strokovnega sveta kot sveta zavoda. Generalnega direktorja sicer imenuje kulturna ministrica Asta Vrečko, ki pa ni zavezana k upoštevanju svetov zavoda in lahko vladi v potrditev predlaga tudi katerega drugega kandidata.

Med očitki so sporne prakse, do katerih naj bi prihajalo pri oddajanju prostorov CD v najem, ki naj bi jih oddajali v zameno za donirane knjige. Kot smo poročali v teh dneh, so na POP TV v povezavi s tem želeli dostop do dokumentacije, do katere so prišli šele po posredovanju informacijske pooblaščenke, ki je vodstvu CD zagrozila z denarno kaznijo. A so zneske na pogodbah počrnili, saj da je cenik za oddajo prostorov poslovna skrivnost. 

Pri tem so se sklicevali na ministrstvo za kulturo, ki pa je za 24ur glede poslovne skrivnosti cenika sporočilo: "Uporabnina za oddajo nepremičnega premoženja države se določi s cenikom, ki ga sprejme predstojnik upravljavca, to je v konkretnem primeru generalna direktorica. Če je upravljavec oseba javnega prava, k aktu poda predhodno soglasje ministrstvo, pristojno za področje, na katerem deluje oseba javnega prava. Cenik se objavi na javnem mestu in na spletni strani upravljavca."

Sporna naj bi bila tudi vloga Brede Pečovnik, skrbnice pogodb za gostinske storitve v CD, ki velja za desno roko generalne direktorice. Njena družina ima v lasti večji vinograd, podjetje, ki v CD skrbi za gostinsko ponudbo, pa naj bi na vseh tamkajšnjih dogodkih – tudi tistih, ki jih v okviru javne službe plačuje kulturno ministrstvo – streglo vina kmetije Pečovnik.

V CD so v preteklih dneh sicer zavrnili te očitke in pojasnili, da se po "preverjenih informacijah vino kmetije Pečovnik ne streže na nobenem dogodku CD". A kot danes poroča portal 24ur, po njihovih zanesljivih informacijah družina Pečovnik "namreč svoja vina prodaja dvema vinskima kletema (njihova imena hranimo v uredništvu), ti dve kleti pa ga preprodajata naprej podjetju, ki v CD skrbi za gostinsko ponudbo".

Odziv CD: delujemo "zakonito, transparentno, poslovno in programsko uspešno"Iz CD so v odzivu na današnje poročanje portala 24ur zapisali, da nadzorna telesa nikoli niso odkrila nobenega kršenja zakonodaje v tej ustanovi. Glede očitkov skrivanja dokumentacije so sporočili, da so POP TV-ju, ki jo je zahteval, "pravočasno razkrili, tisto, kar pa zaradi pravilnika, ki ščiti delovanje ustanove v duhu dobrega gospodarja, in ne sme biti razkrita, pa smo razkrili ministrstvu za kulturo, kamor smo dokumentacijo in interpretacije poslali v vpogled."

Glede vprašanja javne objave cenika kongresnega delovanja CD pa so zapisali, da so naročili neodvisno pravno mnenje. "Kajti objava bi zatresla stabilnost institucije v celoti. Izsledke bomo posredovali ustanovitelju. Obžalujemo, da nerazumno dolg postopek izbire generalnega direktorja poskuša načeti stabilnost zavoda, hkrati pa smo ponosni, da je organizacija tako čvrsta, da lahko tudi v nenormalnih okoliščinah delujemo v skladu s poslanstvom," so še dodali v CD.

2024-09-13.english_content:
The Canker's home was visited by criminals who came to collect data and documentation

Prior to the election of the new Director General of the largest Slovenian cultural institution

The alleged irregularities at the Cankarys Home (CD) have been taken to the fore by the National Bureau of Investigation, which conducts a pre-trial procedure that checks several sets of alleged irregularities. The forensics also visited the CD this morning.

According to the 24h news portal, the criminals were supposed to visit the CD in the early hours of this morning and to visit the biggest Slovenian cultural institution to get the data and documentation.

The public institution has recently been subject to several complaints about its lack of transparency, led by its Director-General, Ursula Cetinski. Her second five-year term expires in October and she is expected to have the support of both the expert and the Institute councils for the new term. The Director-General is appointed by the Minister of Culture, Asta Vrečko, who is not bound by the Board of Directors and may also propose to the Government any other candidate for confirmation.

The complaints include the disputed practices alleged to have been made in the rental of CD premises to be given in exchange for the books donated. As we reported in recent days, POP TV requested access to documentation in this regard, which they had only obtained after the information officer had threatened the CD's management with a financial fine. But they've blacklisted the amounts on the contracts, because the price of the lease is a trade secret.

They referred to the Ministry of Culture, which issued a 24-hour notice on the price of the commercial secret: 'The cost of transferring the State's real estate is determined by the price agreed by the head of the manager, in the specific case the Director-General. Where the controller is a public law person, the act shall be subject to the prior consent of the Ministry responsible for the area in which the public law person operates. The price shall be published in a public place and on the website of the operator.'

The role of Breda Pečovnik, the custodian of the hotel contracts in the CD, which is the right hand of the Director-General, is also disputed. Her family owns larger vineyards, and the company responsible for the hospitality offer in the CD is expected to present at all events there  ⁇  including those paid for by the Ministry of Culture  ⁇  the wine cellar of the Pečovnik farm.

However, the CD had previously rejected these complaints and explained that "according to verified information, the Pečovnik wine farm does not serve the CD at any event". But as 24h reports today, according to their reliable information, the Pečovnik family "sells its wines to two wine cellars (their names are kept in the editorial office) and these two cellars sell it to the company that manages the catering offer in CD".

The CD's response: we operate 'legally, transparently, commercially and programmatically successful'The CD, in response to today's report by the 24h portal, noted that the supervisory bodies have never detected any breaches of legislation at this institution. Regarding the complaints of concealment of the documentation, it was reported that POP TV, which requested it, had "been revealed in a timely manner, but what, by virtue of the rules protecting the operation of the establishment in the spirit of a good master, and must not be disclosed, we have disclosed to the Ministry of Culture, to which we have sent the documentation and interpretations for inspection".

As regards the issue of the public release of the CD's congressional performance price, they noted that they had requested an independent legal opinion. "Because a publication would undermine the stability of the institution as a whole. We'll pass on the results to the founder. We regret that the unreasonably lengthy process of selecting the Director-General is trying to establish the stability of the institution, but we are proud that the organisation is so robust that we can act in accordance with its mission even in abnormal circumstances,' the CD added.
2024-09-13.english_title: The Canker's home was visited by criminals who came to collect data and documentation

Proračun ministrstva za kulturo v prihodnjem letu višji za skoraj 37 milijonov evrov

Vlada je sprejela predlog državnih proračunov za prihodnji dve leti

Ministrstvo za kulturo bo v letu 2025 razpolagalo s proračunskimi sredstvi v višini 271,7 milijona evrov. Glede na napoved bodo skoraj za polovico povečali sredstva za slovenski film, vlagali bodo v ljubiteljsko kulturo, knjigo, javne zavode in razpise.

Kot so sporočili z ministrstva, bo integralni proračun za kulturo višji za 23,8 milijona evrov glede na leto 2024 in za 36,8 milijona evrov višji od prvotno sprejetega proračuna za leto 2025. V celotni znesek 271,7 milijona evrov niso vključena sredstva za protipoplavno sanacijo ter za projekte in vsebine, ki se izvajajo iz evropskih kohezijskih sredstev ter načrta za okrevanje in odpornost.

Sodobni ples in samozaposleni deležni posebne pozornostiNa ministrstvu so ocenili, da bodo višja sredstva omogočala dosego ciljev, ki so si jih zastavili v resoluciji o nacionalnem programu za kulturo (NPK). Sredstva bodo namenjena predvsem krepitvi področij knjige, filma in medijev. Nadalje bodo namenjena javnim zavodom, projektom nevladnih organizacij, ljubiteljski kulturi, naložbam v kulturi ter obnovi kulturne dediščine. Posebna pozornost bo namenjena razvoju sodobnega plesa in podpori dela samozaposlenih v kulturi.

Film, mediji in Evropska prestolnica kultureS proračunom za prihodnje leto bodo povečali sredstva za slovenski film na 14,4 milijona evrov, kar je 4,75 milijona več, kot je na razpolago letos. Za milijon evrov bodo povečali sredstva za medije. Več bo tudi sredstev za Evropsko prestolnico kulture (EPK) 2025, in sicer za 1,5 milijona evrov, s čimer bo v celoti za EPK v prihodnjem letu na voljo pet milijonov evrov.

Knjiga in ljubiteljska kulturaZa Javno agencijo za knjigo (JAK) RS bo na razpolago 1,16 milijona evrov več sredstev, in sicer skupaj 6,9 milijona evrov. Javnemu skladu RS za kulturne dejavnosti (JSKD) pa bo ministrstvo povišalo sredstva za skoraj pol milijona evrov. Skupaj bo ljubiteljska kultura imela na voljo 5,55 milijona evrov.

"Kultura je eden najpomembnejših stebrov družbe, a je bila pred našim mandatom dolga leta sistemsko in finančno zanemarjena. Naš koalicijski cilj je krepitev kulture kot osrednje družbene vrednote in to odraža tudi proračun," je po seji vlade povedala ministrica za kulturo Asta Vrečko.
2024-09-26.title: Proračun ministrstva za kulturo v prihodnjem letu višji za skoraj 37 milijonov evrov
2024-09-26.english_content:
Ministry of Culture budget for next year up by almost 37 million euros

The Government has adopted a proposal for national budgets for the next two years

The Ministry of Culture will have a budget of EUR 271,7 million in 2025. According to the announcement, they will increase the funding for Slovenian films by almost half, investing in love culture, books, public events and bids.

The Commission has also concluded that the Commission will not be able to provide any information on the implementation of the programme. The total amount of EUR 271,7 million excludes the anti-flow remediation and the projects and contents implemented from European Cohesion Funds and the recovery and resilience plan.

The Ministry assessed that higher funding would enable the objectives set out in the resolution on the National Programme for Culture (NPK) to be achieved. The funds will be used mainly to strengthen the fields of books, film and media. The Commission will also consider the possibility of a new programme to be implemented in the future. Particular attention will be paid to the development of contemporary dance and to supporting the self-employed work in culture.

Film, media and the European Capital of Culture will increase the budget for next year for Slovenian cinema to €14.4 million, an increase of €4.75 million on this year's budget. They're going to raise the media for a million euros. The European Capital of Culture (ECC) 2025 will also receive an additional EUR 1,5 million, with a total of EUR 5 million available to the ECC next year.

The public book agency (JAK) of the Republic of Poland will have €1.16 million more, totalling €6.9 million. The Ministry will increase the funding of the RS Public Fund for Cultural Activities (JSKD) by almost half a million euros. Together, the love culture will have a budget of 5.55 million euros.

"Culture is one of the most important pillars of society, but it was systematically and financially neglected for many years before our mandate. Our coalition objective is to strengthen culture as a core social value and this is reflected in the budget", said Culture Minister Asta Sacka after the cabinet meeting.

Prizadevanja za rešitev kulturne dediščine Gaze tudi s pomočjo švicarskega sklada

Približno 900 tisoč evrov vreden sklad švicarske fundacije Aliph

Palestinci so začeli varovati svojo kulturno dediščino, zahvaljujoč skladu za nujne primere, ki ga je namenila švicarska fundacija Aliph. Podpora vključuje preselitev artefaktov, preglede škode na objektih in usposabljanje za krepitev varovanja dediščine.

Po podatkih palestinskega ministrstva za zdravje je bilo od začetka spopadov oktobra lani ubitih več kot 40.000 Palestincev, večina prebivalstva Gaze pa je bila pregnana s svojih domov. Svetovna banka je marca letos v vmesnem poročilu o oceni škode navedla, da je "pomembna dediščina Gaze" utrpela za dobrih 286 milijonov evrov škode. Glede na poročilo, sestavljeno v sodelovanju z Združenimi narodi in Evropsko unijo, je bilo med 7. oktobrom lani in 26. januarjem letos poškodovanih 63 odstotkov vseh območij dediščine, 31 odstotkov pa uničenih. A te številke naj bi od marca bistveno poskočile, navaja Art News.

Približno 900 tisoč evrov vreden švicarski skladStrokovnjaki ob omenjeni finančni podpori v vrednosti približno 900 tisoč evrov na terenu v Gazi preseljujejo dragocene artefakte, dokumentirajo škodo na zgodovinskih lokacijah in nudijo usposabljanje zainteresiranim posameznikom, da bi pomagali pri prizadevanjih za zaščito kulturne in zgodovinske dediščine. Fundacija Aliph se na splošno osredotoča na zaščito kulturne dediščine na konfliktnih in pokonfliktnih območjih.

Med izraelskim obstreljevanjem je bil med drugim poškodovan muzej kulture v mestu Al Karara v Gazi. Njegov ustanovitelj Mohamad Abu Lehia je dejal, da je zanje skrb za tamkajšnjo kulturno dediščino "tako nacionalna kot humanitarna naloga. Zgodovina in dediščina Gaze sta dediščina človeštva in sveta. Vsak trenutek razmišljamo o svoji dediščini." Več kot 2000 predmetov iz muzejske zbirke je bilo premeščenih med nedavnimi reševalnimi prizadevanji združenja za kulturo in umetnost Mayasem v sodelovanju s Palestinskim muzejem na Zahodnem bregu. Med njimi so bile arheološke najdbe, kot so raznolika keramika, nagrobniki in kipi ter tudi izdelki palestinske tradicionalne obrti. Združenju Mayasem je sicer leta 2021 ustanovila njegova žena Najla Abulehia. 

A reševalna prizadevanja so zaradi nečloveških razmer v Gazi izjemno zahtevna. Po besedah direktorja muzeja so morali sodelavci združenja med drugim na veliko iskati vsakdanje predmete, kot so škatle in drugi nujni pripomočki za selitev in shranjevanje dragocenosti. Rešeni predmeti so "strokovno in primerno" zapakirani in pripravljeni "za preselitev v primeru vdora okupacijske vojske na to območje", so navedli v združenju, ki to delo izvaja tudi na drugih nerazkritih lokacijah v Gazi.

Pod motom Varovanje dediščine za izgradnjo miruFundacija Aliph je za Art Newspaper potrdila, da se nujna dokumentacija za oceno škode izvaja na trojici pomembnih kulturnih lokacij v mestu Gaza: Veliki mošeji v Gazi, znani tudi kot Velika mošeja Omari, iz sedmega stoletja, ki so jo uničili izraelski letalski napadi decembra lani, palača Al Saka in zgodovinsko dvorišče Dar-Farah. Delo poteka v sodelovanju s centrom Rivak za arhitekturno ohranjanje na Zahodnem bregu in v sodelovanju z mednarodnimi organizacijami, kot je Unesco.

"Glede na izjemen odziv strokovnjakov za dediščino, ki delujejo v Gazi, na Zahodnem bregu in na mednarodni ravni ter mednarodno in palestinsko skrb za zaščito kulturne dediščine, je to nekaj, kar je treba storiti zdaj. To je pomembna prednostna naloga za številne ljudi v regiji in tukaj smo, da jih podpremo pri tem prizadevanju," je sporočila Sandra Bialystok iz fundacije Aliph.

Poudarila je še, da ta prizadevanja niso ovira za prizadevanja za humanitarno pomoč. Po njenih besedah je zaščita kulturne dediščine ključni del "sestavljanke za vzpostavitev miru (...) To je naš moto, varovanje dediščine za izgradnjo miru; je sestavni del izgradnje miru. Še naprej bomo tukaj, dokler se nas bo potrebovalo, tudi ko se bo vojna končala – upam, da kmalu – in v prihodnje."

Ključno usposabljanje ljudi na terenuVodja projektov pri Aliphu Gala-Alexa Amagat je dejala, da je ključni poudarek na usposabljanju ljudi na terenu. Po njenih besedah je spletno usposabljanje, namenjeno predvsem posameznikom na Zahodnem bregu, pritegnilo 20 udeležencev iz Gaze. "Nekateri so prehodili kilometre, da bi dostopali do spletne povezave in se pridružili seji," je še dejala in dodala, da jo je njihova predanost "prevzela".

Arheolog iz Gaze Fadel Al Utol, ki pomaga združenju Mayasem pri usposabljanjih, je sporočil, da najmanj 15 ljudi sodeluje pri osebnih srečanjih kljub zahtevnim okoliščinam. "To je življenje v Gazi; premagamo težave. Vse podpornike pozivam, da še naprej podpirate mlade pri ohranjanju kulturne dediščine, da se bosta upanje in ljubezen do življenja nadaljevala, skupaj z ohranjanjem starin," je pozval.
2024-09-26.title: Prizadevanja za rešitev kulturne dediščine Gaze tudi s pomočjo švicarskega sklada
2024-09-26.english_content:
Rescue activities for the cultural heritage of Gaza, including through the Swiss Fund

The Swiss Aliph Foundation fund, worth approximately 900,000 euros

The Palestinians have begun to protect their cultural heritage thanks to the Emergency Fund set up by the Swiss Aliph Foundation. Support shall include the relocation of artefacts, the examination of damage to the premises and training to strengthen the protection of heritage.

According to the Palestinian Health Ministry, more than 40,000 Palestinians have been killed since the conflict began in October last year, and most of Gaza's population has been displaced from their homes. The World Bank said in its interim damage assessment report in March that the "significant heritage of Gaza" suffered a good 286 million euros in damage. According to a report prepared in cooperation with the United Nations and the European Union, 63 percent of all heritage sites were damaged and 31 percent destroyed between October 7 and January 26 this year. But these numbers are expected to jump significantly from March, reports Art News.

The Swiss Fund, worth approximately EUR 900,000, provides the financial support of approximately EUR 900,000 to experts in the field in Gaza, documenting damage to historic sites and providing training to interested individuals to assist in the efforts to protect cultural and historic heritage. The Aliph Foundation is generally focused on the protection of cultural heritage in conflict and post-conflict areas.

The Israeli shelling damaged the cultural museum in the Gaza city of Al Karara. Its founder, Mohamad Abu Lehia, said that their care for the cultural heritage of the region is "as national as it is humanitarian. The history and heritage of Gaza are the heritage of humanity and the world. Every moment we think about our heritage. "More than 2,000 items from the museum's collection were moved during the recent rescue efforts of the Mayan Association for Culture and the Arts in collaboration with the Palestinian Museum in the West Bank. Among them were archaeological finds such as various pottery, tombs and statues, as well as products of traditional Palestinian crafts. The association mayasem was founded in 2021 by his wife, Naila Abulehia.

But rescue efforts are extremely demanding because of the inhuman situation in Gaza. According to the director, the association's staff had to search extensively for everyday items, such as boxes and other essential items for moving and storing valuables. The rescued items are 'professionally and appropriately' packed and prepared 'for relocation in the event of an invasion by the occupying forces into the area,' the association said, adding that the work is also being carried out at other undisclosed locations in Gaza.

Under the theme of Protecting Heritage for Peacebuilding, the Aliph Foundation confirmed to Art Newspaper that the necessary documentation for damage assessment is being carried out at three important cultural sites in Gaza City: the Great Mosque in Gaza, also known as the Great Mosque of Omari, from the seventh century, which was destroyed by Israeli airstrikes in December last year, the Al-Sak Palace and the historic Dar-Farah Palace. The work is being carried out in cooperation with the Rivak Centre for Architectural Conservation on the West Bank and in cooperation with international organisations such as UNESCO.

"Given the outstanding response of heritage experts working in Gaza, the West Bank and internationally, and international and Palestinian concern for the protection of cultural heritage, this is something that needs to be done now. This is an important priority for many people in the region and we are here to support them in this endeavour", said Sandra Bialystok of the Aliph Foundation.

It also stressed that these efforts did not hamper efforts to provide humanitarian assistance. She said that protecting cultural heritage is a key part of "the establishment of peace (...) That's our motto, preserving our heritage for peacebuilding; it's an integral part of peacebuilding. We will continue here as long as we are needed, even after the war is over, I hope soon, and in the future".

Key training of people in the fieldThe project manager at Aliphu Gala-Alexa Amagat said that training of people in the field was a key focus. According to her, the online training, aimed primarily at individuals in the West Bank, attracted 20 participants from Gaza. "Some have walked miles to get online and join the sessions", she said, adding that their dedication "has taken over".

The Gaza archaeologist Fadel Al Utol, who helps the Mayan Association train, reported that at least 15 people were attending the meetings in person despite the difficult circumstances. "This is life in Gaza; we are overcoming the problems. I call on all supporters to continue to support young people in preserving their cultural heritage, so that hope and love of life will continue, along with preserving the old ones,' he called on.
2024-09-26.english_title: Rescue activities for the cultural heritage of Gaza, including through the Swiss Fund

2024-09-26.content:
Radijska igra o Gustavu Mahlerju tudi z mačkom Sigmundom, ki v igro uvaja samoironijo

Premiera nove radijske igre o avstrijskem skladatelju Gustavu Mahlerju

Skladatelj Gustav Mahler je krajši čas živel in delal tudi v Ljubljani. V Arsovem Uredništvu igranega programa so po besedilu in Marka Elsnerja Grošlja in v režiji Igorja Likarja ustvarili novo radijsko igro o tem skladateljskem velikanu.

Gustav Mahler je med septembrom 1881 in aprilom 1882 dirigiral v Deželnem gledališču.  Leta 1882 je v njem izvedel svojo prvo opero, Verdijevega Trubadurja, eno izmed desetih v tem času. Kot pianist je nastopil na koncertu Filharmonične družbe, predhodnice današnje Slovenske filharmonije. Njegova prva dela so bili različni glasbeni poskusi, pozneje je ustvaril več pesniških ciklov, ves preostali glasbeni opus pa je vseboval le dva glasbena žanra: glasbene pesnitve in simfonije. Leto pred smrtjo je bila izvedena Osma pod njegovo dirigentsko palico, Deveta je bila že napisana, vendar še neizvedena. Prav Deseta, zadnja in nedokončana, spodbuja najresnejša eksistencialna vprašanja, kot so ljubezen, smrt, izdaja in bistvo umetnosti. 

Avtor besedila radijske igre, ki je za naš radio napisal že več del, Marko Elsner Grošelj vpeljuje lik mačka Sigmunda, ki ustvarja samoironično podobo Mahlerjevega sveta. Opira se na znana dejstva, vendar ustvari živo in poetično misel, s tem pa seže globlje v Mahlerjevo življenje in ustvarjanje.

Premiera igre Mahler bo na sporedu v četrtek, 26. septembra, ob 22.05 na programu Ars. Na spletni strani programa Ars in na spletni platformi RTV 365 pa bo še mesec dni na voljo za poslušanje.

O odločitvi za pisanje o Mahlerju pravi: "Nobena osebnost, noben lik se mi ni zdel tako izjemen za radiofonijo kot prav Mahler, ne samo zaradi svoje delno ali pogojno romantične oziroma razviharjene, disonatne glasbe, pač pa tudi zaradi vseh dogodkov, ki so vplivali na moj izbor. Ena izmed vzporednic je film o skladatelju, ki ga je ustvaril režiser Ken Russell in je močno razburkal mojo domišljijo, nato film Smrt v Benetkah s proslulim Adagiettom iz Pete simfonije, vse znane in manj znane dokumentarne in knjižne zgodbe njegovega življenja z Almo Schindler, izguba hčera in neutolažljiva prizadetost, obdobje secesije, prelom stoletja in tisočletja … Nato moj sprehod po Hribarjevem nabrežju, kjer stojim pred Mahlerjevim kipom in se sprašujem o tistem skrivnem glasbilu, ki ga je kipar dal v roke skladatelju, kot da še zmeraj piše Deseto nedokončano, ki je naslov pesmi iz moje prve pesniške zbirke, in se je s tem tudi začela moja obsesija, moja očaranost z Mahlerjevo glasbo."

V svojem bogatem ustvarjalnem opusu režiser igre Igor Likar, tudi slovenski pesnik, dramaturg, scenarist in publicist, ki je te dni dopolnil enainsedemdeset let, ostaja najbolj zapisan radijskemu mediju, še posebej pa se je posvetil radijski igri. Od leta 1979 je deloval kot režiser v Uredništvu igranega programa, kjer je režiral skoraj dvesto dramskih besedil, dokumentarnih iger in eksperimentalnih zvočnih del, priredil šestinštirideset besedil in jih napisal štiriindvajset. Je pretanjen opazovalec in poslušalec sveta, ki do temeljev raziskuje in razmišlja o smislu, o vzrokih in namenu človekove eksistence. Radiotelevizija Slovenija ga je prav letos nagradila za življenjsko delo. Prav zadnja v njegovem opusu je tokratna radijska igra Mahler, ki ga je vsebinsko izzvala in navdihnila, že zaradi glasbe pa je odprla tudi možnosti za raziskovanje in ustvarjanje zvočnega sveta. 

Grošelj si je "zamislil zvočni prostor, kjer se zgodi igra o skladatelju, nekakšno zvočno kuliso morskega dna ali akvarija izmišljenih podob in konkretnih zvokov stvarnega okolja na eni strani, in zvokov v moji glavi – predstavi likov na drugi strani. Iz te kombinacije sem črpal navdih, kot je Mahler izkoristil razpon čustev v orkestrski predlogi z vsemi sredstvi."

Zato ni čudno, da je bila taka besedilna predloga navdihujoč poligon za občutljivega ustvarjalca zvočnih pokrajin, kot je Igor Likar. Radijska ekipa v studiu, ki sta jo sestavljala še tonski mojster Matjaž Miklič in glasbena oblikovalka Darja Hlavka Godina, razmišlja: "Že ob branju besedila sem popolnoma na novo dojela Mahlerjevo življenje in glasbo. Ob ustvarjanju radijske igre z Igorjem Likarjem, Matjažem Mikličem, Vilmo Štritof (dramaturginjo), Ano Krauthaker (asistentko režije) in vso igralsko ekipo so se mi razprle nove, dotlej neznane možnosti, globine in lepote radiofonskega ustvarjanja."

Lik Mahlerja je interpretiral Branko Šturbej, njegovo ženo Almo Nataša Barbara Gračner, mačka Sigmunda Lotos Vincenc Šparovec, druge vloge pa so odigrali še Boris Ostan, Gašper Rojc, Gregor Gruden, Zoja Miklič, Matej Puc in Zvone Hribar.
2024-09-26.title: Radijska igra o Gustavu Mahlerju tudi z mačkom Sigmundom, ki v igro uvaja samoironijo
2024-09-26.english_content:
A radio play about Gustav Mahler also featuring a cat named Sigmund, who introduces self-irony into the game.

The premiere of a new radio play about the Austrian composer Gustav Mahler

The composer Gustav Mahler also lived and worked in Ljubljana for a short time. The Ars's Playing Program Directorate has created a new radio play about this composer-giant, written by Mark Elsner Gross, and directed by Igor Likar.

Gustav Mahler conducted at the Land Theatre between September 1881 and April 1882. In 1882 he performed his first opera, Verdi's Trubadur, one of ten at the time. As a pianist, he performed at the Philharmonic Society's concert, the predecessor of the present-day Slovenian Philharmonic. His early works were various musical experiments, later he created several cycle of poems, and the rest of his musical opus contained only two musical genres: musical poetry and symphonies. The year before his death, the Eighth was performed under his conductor's staff, the Ninth was already written, but not yet performed. The Tenth, the last and unfinished, promotes the most serious questions of existence, such as love, death, betrayal, and the essence of art.

The author of the radio play, who has written for our radio for several years, Marko Elsner Grossel introduces the character of the cat Sigmund, creating a self-ironic image of Mahler's world. It is based on known facts, but it creates a vivid and poetic thought, and thus it reaches deeper into Mahler's life and creation.

Mahler's game is set to premiere on Thursday, September 26th at 10:05 p.m. on Ars. The Ars website and RTV 365 platform will be available for one month.

Regarding his decision to write about Mahler, he says: "No personality, no character seemed to me as outstanding to the radio as Mahler himself, not only because of his partially or conditionally romantic or developed, dissonant music, but also because of all the events that influenced my choice. One of the parallels is a film about a composer created by director Ken Russell and which greatly shattered my imagination, followed by Death in Venice with the famous Adagietta from the Fifth Symphony, all the well-known and lesser-known documentary and literary stories of his life with Alma Schindler, the loss of his daughter and irreparable injury, the period of the secession, the turning point of the century and the millennium... Then my walk along the Hribar coast, standing in front of the Mahler statue, wondering about that secret musical piece that the sculptor had put in the hands of the composer, as if he were still writing the Unfinished Tenth, the title of a poem from my first collection of poems, and that started my obsession, my fascination with Mahler's music".

In his rich creative output, Igor Likar, a Slovenian poet, playwright, screenwriter and publicist, who turned 71 in his lifetime, remains the most recorded radio media, and has dedicated himself in particular to the radio game. Since 1979, he has been working as a director in the Drama Programme Directorate, where he has directed almost two hundred dramatic scripts, documentary plays and experimental soundtracks, arranged forty-six scripts and written twenty-four. He is a keen observer and listener of the world, who investigates and ponders the meaning, causes, and purpose of human existence to the fullest. This year, Radiotelevision of Slovenia awarded him a lifetime achievement award. The last of his opus is this time the radio play Mahler, which challenged and inspired him with content, and which opened up opportunities for exploration and creation of the sound world.

The frog "imagined a sound space where a play about a composer takes place, some kind of sound stage of the seabed or an aquarium of fictional images and concrete sounds of the real world on one side, and the sounds in my head  ⁇  present characters on the other. I drew inspiration from this combination, as Mahler used the range of emotions in his orchestral proposal with all his means".

It is no wonder, then, that such a text proposal was an inspiring platform for a sensitive sound landscape maker like Igor Likar. The studio's radio team, composed of the master of tones Matjaz Miklič and the music designer Darj Glavk Godin, thinks: "By reading the lyrics, I completely re-experienced Mahler's life and music. Creating a radio play with Igor Likar, Matjaz Miklic, Wilma Stritof (playwright), Ano Krauthaker (assistant director) and the entire cast opened up to me new, previously unknown possibilities, depths, and beauty of radio creation".

The character of Mahler was played by Branko Šturbej, his wife Alma Nataša Barbara Gračner, the cat of Sigmund Lotos Vincenc Šparovec, and other roles were played by Boris Ostan, Gasper Rojc, Gregor Gruden, Zoja Miklič, Matej Puc and Zvon Hribar.
2024-09-26.english_title: A radio play about Gustav Mahler also featuring a cat named Sigmund, who introduces self-irony into the game.

Dušan Merc odstopil z mesta predsednika Društva slovenskih pisateljev

Tretji zaporedni predsednik društva, ki je predčasno odstopil s položaja

Dušan Merc je odstopil z mesta predsednika Društva slovenskih pisateljev, ki ga je vodil od maja 2019. Na čelu društva je nasledil Aksinjo Kermauner in Iva Svetino, ki sta oba odstopila pred koncem mandata. 

Člani Društva slovenskih pisateljev (DSP) so Dušana Merca leta 2020 izglasovali za predsednika, s čimer je postal že tretji predsednik društva v letu dni, bil pa je tudi edini kandidat za ta položaj. Nov triletni mandat je dobil še decembra 2023. 

Pisatelj in učitelj Dušan Merc (1952), znan tudi kot dolgoletni ravnatelj ljubljanske OŠ Prule, je ob odstopu z mesta predsednika DSP-ja za Radio Slovenija povedal: "Mandat si bom zapomnil kot član društva in kot tisti, ki je pet let bil predsednik. Nisem prispeval k novim oblikam delovanja društva." Dodal je, da zapušča društvo kot "urejeno in finančno dobro stoječe". Ob tem ni navedel razlogov za svoj odstop.

Sicer je junija 2018 pesnik, dramatik, esejist in prevajalec Ivo Svetina predčasno odstopil z mesta predsednika društva, za kar se je odločil zaradi več razlogov, med drugim tudi osebnih. Septembra istega leta ga je nasledila mladinska pisateljica, pesnica in pedagoginja Aksinja Kermauner, ki je po pol leta prav tako odstopila. Kot razlog je navedla nestrinjanje z odnosom, ki ga država izkazuje do DSP-ja. Hkrati z njo so sodelovanje prekinile štiri administrativne in strokovne sodelavke.
2024-09-26.title: Dušan Merc odstopil z mesta predsednika Društva slovenskih pisateljev

Dušan Merc resigns as President of the Slovenian Writers' Association

Third consecutive President of the Society, who resigned early

Dušan Merc resigned as President of the Slovenian Writers' Association, which he had led since May 2019. The company was headed by Aksina Kermauner and Iva Svetina, who both resigned before the end of their terms. The following is the list of the countries of the European Union:

Members of the Society of Slovenian Writers (DSP) voted for Dušana Merca as president in 2020, making him the third president of the society in a year and the only candidate for the position. He was given a new three-year term in December 2023.

Writer and teacher Dušan Merc (1952), also known as the longtime director of the Ljubljana OŠ Prula, said for Radio Slovenia when he resigned as chairman of the DSP: "I will remember my mandate as a member of the society and as the one who was president for five years. I did not contribute to the new ways of working of the society. "I'm not He added that he was leaving the company as "organized and financially sound". In this respect, he did not state the reasons for his resignation.

In June 2018, the poet, playwright, essayist and translator Ivo Svetina resigned from his post as president of the society prematurely, for a number of reasons, including personal ones. In September of that year, he was succeeded by the young writer, poet and educator Aksinja Kermauner, who resigned after six months. It cited as a reason the non-compliance with the State's attitude towards the MRLs. Four administrative and professional staff have also ceased to cooperate.

Oddaja Opus z Beličem iz Münchenskih filharmonikov in Zalaznikom iz Dunajskih simfonikov

Flavtist Martin Belič in violončelist Primož Zalaznik v drevišnji oddaji na TV SLO 1

Slovenci imamo veliko nadarjenih glasbenih umetnikov, ki so člani različnih orkestrov, tako simfoničnih kot komornih, največ jih je v Avstriji in Nemčiji, kjer je glasbena kultura na izjemno visoki ravni.

Še posebej so seveda gmotno podprti orkestri, ki spadajo v sam vrh na Dunaju, v Münchnu in Berlinu.

Že pred leti smo za Opus obiskali Dunajsko državno opero in se pogovarjali s stalno članico – mezzosopranistko Moniko Bohinec in članoma Dunajskih filharmonikov – violinistko Petro Kovačič in kontrabasistom Iztokom Hrastnikom.

Ob gostovanju znamenitih Berlinskih filharmonikov v Ljubljani smo imeli priložnost slišati kar tri slovenske glasbenike, ki so člani tega svetovno znanega orkestra – to so hornist Andrej Žust in dva klarinetista – Matic Kuder in Andraž Golob, ki je uspešno opravil avdicijo za solobasklarinetista v tem orkestru. 

26. 9. ob 22:50 na TV SLO 1Ponovitev27. 9. ob 14:30 na TV SLO 1 Na ogled tudi na spletni platformi RTV 365

Na srečo imajo ti glasbeniki stalne stike z domovino, zato jih lahko slišimo in vidimo tudi na naših koncertnih odrih. Tako smo npr. na 70. festivalu Ljubljana slišali zasedbo Disonance.si, ki jo sestavljajo sami slovenski glasbeniki, povezal pa jih je hornist Andrej Žust.

Ob 60-letnici Programa Ars na Radiu Slovenija so lani v okviru Komornega studia Radia Slovenija v Slovenski filharmoniji gostili  Godalni sekstet Ars, v katerem igrajo izvrstni slovenski glasbeni umetniki, ki večinoma živijo in ustvarjajo v tujini.

Junija letos sta na zadnjem koncertu Kromatike Simfoničnega orkestra RTV Slovenija v sezoni 23/24 skupaj nastopila brat in sestra – soloviolončelistka Simfonikov RTV Slovenija Maruša Bogataj in violinist Matjaž Bogataj v zahtevnem Brahmsovem Koncertu za violino, violončelo in orkester. Matjaž Bogataj, ki je vodja drugih violin v simfoničnem orkestru Bavarske državne opere v Münchnu, je bil pred kratkim predstavljen tudi v Opusu.

Münchenski filharmoniki veljajo za pomemben orkester s tradicijo, saj ga je že kmalu po ustanovitvi vodil sam Gustav Mahler in z njim izvedel svoji 4. in 8. simfonijo, mladi Furtwängler je s tem orkestrom doživel dirigentski debi, pozneje sta ga med drugim vodila Lorin Maazel in Valerij Gergijev. 

Član tega orkestra je že od leta 2007 slovenski flavtist Martin Belič, ki se kljub lepi karieri v tujini rad vrača v domovino, kot solist občasno koncertira z obema našima osrednjima simfoničnima orkestroma in v komornih zasedbah, poleti pa vodi mojstrski seminar v Slovenski Bistrici na GŠ, kjer je začel svojo glasbeno pot. 

Redno deluje kot gost v bavarskem opernem orkestru, radijskem orkestru iz Kölna, v pihalnem orkestru Univerze Mozarteum Salzburg, v münchenskem Salon orkestru Tibor Jonas, münchenskem Bach orkestru in kot soloflavtist pri Würtenbergischen Kammerorchester ter Münchenskem radijskem orkestru.

Martin Belič že vrsto let kot glasbeni pedagog prenaša svoje znanje in izkušnje na mladi rod prek mednarodnih seminarjev, kjer je bil sprva asistent Michaela Martina Koflerja, zadnja leta pa pri nas samostojno vodi mojstrske seminarje, je pa tudi docent na glasbeni akademiji Leopold Mozart v Augsburgu.

V Opusu boste spoznali pot Martina Beliča od GŠ Slovenska Bistrica, prek Gallusovega sklada, katerega varovanec je postal, študija na Mozarteumu pri Ireni Grafenauer in Michaelu Martinu Koflerju do Münchenskih filharmonikov.

Slišali boste tudi nekaj glasbenih odlomkov, od prvega večjega solističnega koncerta, ko je leta 2008 s Simfoničnim orkestrom SNG Maribor izvajal Koncert za flavto in orkester Carla Nielsena do muziciranja z Münchenskimi filharmoniki. 

Leta 2009 je s Simfoničnim orkestrom RTV Slovenija posnel zgoščenko s Koncertom za flavto in orkester Carla Nielsena. Pri založbi RTV Slovenija je izšla tudi njegova druga zgoščenka z deli Theobalda Böhma, ki jo je posnel s pianistom Ivanom Ferčičem. 

Ob tem velja spomniti, da je Belič leta 2011 zmagal na tekmovanju Theobalda Böhma v Münchnu, že nekaj let pa je član žirije na tem tekmovanju, imenovanem po skladatelju in izumitelju prstnega sistema sodobne koncertne flavte.

Violončelist Primož Zalaznik je odraščal v glasbeni družini ob kar štirih sestrah violinistkah, od katerih so tri končale glasbeno akademijo.

Po diplomi in specializaciji na Akademiji za glasbo v Ljubljani pri prof. Milošu Mlejniku se je izpopolnjeval v Kölnu, Essnu in na Dunaju. Bil je sedem let namestnik soloviolončelista v Simfoničnem orkestru RTV Slovenija, splet okoliščin pa ga je privedel do avdicij na Dunaju, tako je bil tri leta član Dunajskih filharmonikov, a želel si je delovno mesto za nedoločen čas, to mu je pozneje uspelo v Dunajskih simfonikih.

Primož Zalaznik iz dosedanjih izkušenj pri Simfonikih RTV ter pozneje pri dveh uglednih orkestrih na Dunaju lahko prav gotovo pove razlike in predvsem določene prednosti glasbenega korpusa, v katerem uživa, za dušo pa seveda še vedno nastopa v različnih komornih zasedbah. Med drugim muzicira v ad hoc godalnih kvartetih in sekstetih, s katerimi izvaja tudi glasbo slovenskih skladateljev, sicer pa je stalni član komornega ansambla Dunajskih simfonikov, občasno pa sodeluje kot substitut v Dunajskih filharmonikih in drugih orkestrih. 

Spoznali bomo, kako znajo Dunajski simfoniki kot mestni orkester z zelo raznolikim repertoarjem poskrbeti za svoje člane in jim kot svoji številčni glasbeni družini omogočiti čim boljše počutje, pa najsi gre za koncertiranje v obeh osrednjih dvoranah – Konzerthausu in Musikvereinu ali na turnejah.

V oddaji se bodo prepletale pripovedi obeh glasbenikov z glasbenimi odlomki.
2024-09-26.title: Oddaja Opus z Beličem iz Münchenskih filharmonikov in Zalaznikom iz Dunajskih simfonikov

Opus with White from the Munich Philharmonic and the Viennese Symphony Orchestra

Flavist Martin White and celloist Primoz Zapiak in the TV show Treehouse 1

We Slovenians have many talented musicians who are members of various orchestras, both symphonic and chamber, the most of them in Austria and Germany, where the music culture is at an extremely high level.

Of course, the most substantially supported orchestras are those at the top in Vienna, Munich and Berlin.

Years ago, for Opus, we visited the Vienna State Opera and spoke with the permanent member of the Vienna Philharmonic, the violinist Petro Kovacic, and the double bassist, the East Oak.

During the visit of the famous Berlin Philharmonic in Ljubljana, we had the opportunity to hear three Slovenian musicians who are members of this world-famous orchestra. They are the horn player Andrej Žust and two clarinetists Matic Kuder and Andraž Golob, who successfully auditioned for solo clarinetist in this orchestra.

The first is the "Show of the World" on the TV channel SLO 1

Fortunately, these musicians have a permanent connection to their homeland, so we can hear and see them on our concert stages. For example, at the 70th Ljubljana Festival, we heard the Disonance.si orchestra, composed by Slovenian musicians themselves, and joined by horn player Andrej Žust.

On the 60th anniversary of the Ars programme on Radio Slovenia, the Swedish Philharmonic hosted the Godalni sextet Ars last year, as part of the Commercial Studio of Radio Slovenia in Slovenia.

In June this year, the last concert of the Kromatika of the RTV Slovenia Symphony Orchestra in season 23/24 was performed together by the brother and sister of the soloist of the RTV Slovenia Symphony, Marusha Bogataj, and the violinist Matjaž Bogataj in the demanding Brahms Concerto for violin, cello and orchestra. Matjaz Bogataj, conductor of the other violins in the symphony orchestra of the Bavarian State Opera in Munich, was recently also featured in the Opus.

The Munich Philharmonic is considered an important orchestra with a tradition, as soon after its founding it was conducted by Gustav Mahler himself and performed his 4th and 8th symphonies with it, the young Furtwängler made his conducting debut with this orchestra, later led by Lorin Maazel and Valerie Gergiev, among others.

A member of this orchestra since 2007, the Slovenian flute player Martin Belič, who despite his fine career abroad, loves to return to his homeland, as a soloist occasionally performs with both our central symphony orchestras and chamber ensembles, and in the summer conducts a master seminar in Slovenian Bistrica at GŠ, where he began his musical journey.

He is a regular guest of the Bavarian Opera Orchestra, the Cologne Radio Orchestra, the Musée d'Orsay of the University of Salzburg, the Munich Salon Tibor Jonas Orchestra, the Munich Bach Orchestra and as a soloist with the Würtenbergischen Kammerorchester and the Munich Radio Orchestra.

Martin Belič has been teaching music for many years, passing on his knowledge and experience to young people through international seminars, where he was first an assistant to Michael Martin Kofler, and in recent years has been conducting master seminars independently at the Academy of Music Leopold Mozart in Augsburg.

In Opus you will learn about Martin Belić's journey from the GŠ Slovensk Bistrica, through the Gallus Fund, whose patron he became, to study at the Mozarteum under Irene Grafenauer and Michael Martin Kofler to the Munich Philharmonic.

You will also hear a few musical excerpts, from the first major solo concert in 2008, when he performed the Concerto for Flute and the Carl Nielsen Orchestra with the SNG Maribor Symphony Orchestra to his music with the Munich Philharmonic.

In 2009, he recorded a concert with the RTV Slovenia Symphony Orchestra with the Carl Nielsen Flute Concert and Orchestra. His second CD, Theobalda Böhm, recorded with pianist Ivan Ferčić, was also released by RTV Slovenia.

In this regard, it should be recalled that in 2011 Belic won the Theobald Böhm Competition in Munich and has been a member of the jury for several years in this competition, named after the composer and inventor of the finger system of the modern concert flute.

Violinist Primož Zalaznik grew up in a musical family with four violinist sisters, three of whom graduated from the Academy of Music.

After graduating and specialising at the Academy of Music in Ljubljana, prof. Milos Mlejnik was trained in Cologne, Essen and Vienna. He was deputy soloist of the RTV Slovenia Symphony Orchestra for seven years, and the combination of circumstances led him to audition in Vienna, so he was a member of the Vienna Philharmonic for three years, but he wanted a job indefinitely, which he later succeeded in the Vienna Symphony.

Primoz Zapiznik, from his experience with the RTV Symphonies and later with two prestigious orchestras in Vienna, can certainly tell the difference and above all certain advantages of the music corps he enjoys, but still performs in various chamber ensembles for his soul. Among other things, he performs in ad hoc gonale quartets and sixties, with which he also performs music by Slovenian composers, while he is a permanent member of the chamber ensemble of the Vienna Symphony, and occasionally participates as a substitute in the Vienna Philharmonic and other orchestras.

We will learn how the Vienna Symphony Orchestra, as a city orchestra with a very diverse repertoire, can take care of its members and make their musical family feel as comfortable as possible, whether it is to perform in the two main halls  ⁇  Konzerthaus and Musikverein or on tour.

The show will intertwine the stories of the two musicians with musical pieces.
