Sovretova nagrada Ani Barič Moder za najboljši prevod literarnega dela

Nominirani so bili še Klarisa Jovanović, Jedrt Maležič, Mateja Seliškar Kenda in Peter Svetina

Društvo slovenskih književnih prevajalcev je Sovretovo nagrado letos namenila Ani Barič Moder za "bogato metajezikoven" prevod 4. in 5. dela knjige Patrick Melrose Edwarda St Aubyna, ki je izšla lani pri Mladinski knjigi.

Sovretovo nagrado, najstarejšo in najvidnejšo stanovsko nagrado so podelili na sedežu prevajalskega društva, v pisateljski vili na Tomšičevi. Ob tej priložnosti je potekal tudi pogovor z nominiranci Klariso Jovanović, Jedrt Maležič, Matejo Seliškar Kenda in Petrom Svetino, ki sta ga povezovali novinarka in francistka Nina Gostiša ter prevajalka in Sovretova nagrajenka Marjanca Mihelič.

Društvo slovenskih književnih prevajalcev je Sovretovo nagrado 2024 za vrhunske prevode leposlovja iz tujih jezikov v slovenščino podelilo prevajalki iz angleškega in francoskega jezika Ani Barič Moder za prevod dela Patrick Melrose 4. in 5. del (Materino mleko in Končno) Edwarda St Aubyna, ki je izšel lani pri Mladinski knjigi. "Ana Barič Moder je s prevodom zadnjih dveh romanov serije Patrick Melrose opravila veliko delo, se uspešno spopadla s tekstom, ki morda na prvi pogled ne deluje pretirano zapleteno – gre pač za sodobno besedilo, ki ni pretirano terminološko specifično –, a skriva v sebi zato le še toliko več pasti, ki se jim je morala prevajalka izogniti ter jih po drugi strani enako grenkosladke ali zgolj grenke ali zgolj sladke nastaviti slovenskemu bralcu," so zapisali v utemeljitvi.

Barič Moder uspešno nadaljuje prevode pokojnega Uroša KalčičaAna Barič Moder (1979), prevajalka iz francoščine in angleščine, je leta 2012 za prevod Modrih cvetk Raymonda Queneauja že prejela nagrado Radojke Vrančič za mlado prevajalko, prejela pa je tudi Nodierovo nagrado za Priročnik za izgnance Veliborja Čolića, poznamo pa jo tudi po prevodih za otroke, med drugim dela Roalda Dahla. Zadnja dva dela znamenite serije Patrick Melrose je "podedovala" po prezgodaj umrlem predhodniku Urošu Kalčiču, prav tako Sovretovem nagrajencu, zato "breme pričakovanj ob tem gotovo ni bilo lahko, a prevajalka se je izkazala za več kot doraslo nalogi in je uspešno stopila v velike čevlje starejšega kolega."

"Prevod se bere, kot bi šlo za izvirno slovensko delo"St Aubyn je v romaneskni seriji Patrick Melrose izkazal "veselje do besedotvorja, do besednih iger in raznovrstnih samonanašalnih postopkov," kar predstavlja za marsikaterega prevajalca precejšnjo težavo. "Oba romana o Patricku Melrosu, ki ju je poslovenila nagrajenka, sta bogato metajezikovna, pripovedovalec in liki v njiju se nenehno posvečajo besedam, ki jih uporabljajo, o besedah in izrazih se pogovarjajo, jih analizirajo in postavljajo v nove lege ter se z njimi igrajo."

A nagrajenki je uspelo ohraniti besedne igre in celotne metajezikovne ravni v prevodu brez, da bi utrpela komunikativna plat besedila, ki je v primeru del Patrick Melrose polna humorna in samoironije. "Prevajalka tako drži ravnotežje med visoko intelektualnostjo besedila, ki se nenehno zaveda samega sebe, in njegovo lahkotnostjo, stilistično eleganco. Ana Barič Moder besedne igre ipd. ohranja, kjer je to le mogoče, in tekst mestoma korenito preuredi, da funkcionirajo na približno enak način kot v izvirniku, po drugi strani pa se, zavedajoč se, da učinek tovrstnih izraznih sredstev v prevodu (skoraj) nikoli ne more biti povsem enak kot v izvirniku, ne boji zgrabiti ludistične priložnosti, kadar se ponudi, in tako dobimo mesta, ki se v prevodu – kot se redko, a včasih vendarle zgodi – berejo bolje kot v originalu."

"V rokah manj veščega prevajalca bi prevod gotovo deloval papirnato"V utemeljitvi so izpostavili še, da prevajalki uspeva ohranjati naraven jezik s številnimi postopki, recimo "s spretno občasno uporabo pogovornega namesto knjižnega jezika, pri čemer so neknjižne besede brezšivno vpletene v preostanek teksta in ne kličejo po pozornosti – kadar ni ta seveda zaslužena iz kakega drugega razloga –, kot tudi z uporabo prevajalskih rešitev, ki niso vedno tiste najbolj enostavne in najbolj pričakovane, temveč si kdaj pa kdaj dopustijo več svobode in kakšno mesto nekoliko bolj obarvajo, oživijo ali konkretizirajo ter tako kompenzirajo neizogibno izgubo kolorita na kakšnem drugem mestu."

Čeprav dela romaneskne serije ne delujeta zapleteno, je gre za sodobno besedilo, ki skriva marsikaj. "Čeprav sta četrti in peti roman sage o Patricku Melrosu slogovno precej enotna oziroma enovita, je morala prevajalka pri svojem delu vendarle preigrati nemalo jezikovnih registrov – od brzostrelnih jedko-humornih dialogov in otroškega govora prek opisov halucinatornih pokrajin in časov do pravniškega žargona in filozofske razprave –, kar je v vsakem primeru storila uspešno, gladko in, kjer je bilo to relevantno, terminološko natančno."

Kdo izbira nagrajenca?Nominirance je izbrala petčlanska strokovna komisija Društva slovenskih književnih prevajalcev (DSKP) v sestavi Nina Gostiša, Marjanca Mihelič, Veronika Simoniti, Katja Zakrajšek in Jernej Županič kot predsednik. Nagrado sta lavreatki oz. lavreatu izročila predsednik komisije za nagrade in priznanja pri DSKP-ju Županič in predsednica DSKP-ja Tanja Petrič. 

Lani je Sovretovo nagrado, ki jo podeljujejo od leta 1963, prejel Jernej Županič za prevod dela Moby Dick ali Kit Hermana Melvilla, ki je izšlo pri Beletrini.

The Ani Barich Moder Award for the best translation of a literary work

The nominations were also made by Klarisa Jovanović, Jedrt Maležič, Matej Seliškar Kenda and Peter Svetina.

The Society of Slovenian Literary Translators has this year nominated Ani Barič Moder for the "rich meta-linguistic" translation of the 4th and 5th parts of Patrick Melrose Edward St Aubyn's book, which was published last year in the Juvenile Book.

The Sovret Prize, the oldest and most prominent residential prize, was awarded at the headquarters of the translation society, in the writer's mansion in Tomšiceva. On this occasion, he also spoke with the nominees Klarisa Jovanović, Jedrt Maležič, Matejo Seliškar Kenda and Petrom Svetino, who were joined by journalist and French journalist Nina Gostiša and by the translator and Sovret Prize winner Marjanca Mihelić.

The Society of Slovenian Literary Translators has awarded the Sovret Prize 2024 for the best translation of poetry from foreign languages into Slovenian to the English and French translator Ani Barič Moder for the translation of Patrick Melrose's 4th and 5th volumes (Mother's Milk and Final) by Edward St Aubyn, published last year in the Young People's Book. "Ana Barič Moder has done a lot of work with the translation of the last two novels in the Patrick Melrose series, successfully coping with a text that may not seem too complex at first glance  ⁇  it is just a modern text that is not too terminologically specific  ⁇ , but hides within itself only so much more traps that the translator had to avoid and set them on the other hand equally grinko-sweet or just bitter or just sweet to the Slovenian reader", they wrote in the statement.

Barič Moder successfully continues the translation of the late Uroš KalčičAna Barič Moder (1979), translator from French and English, has already received the Radojka Vrančič Award for Young Translator in 2012 for the translation of Blue Flowers by Raymond Queneau, and has also received the Nodier Award for the Handbook for Exilers by Velibor Čolić, but we also know her for her translations for children, among others the work of Roald Dahl. The last two parts of the famous series were "inherited" by Patrick Melrose after the premature death of his predecessor, Uroš Kalčić, who was also the Sovret's recipient, so "the burden of expectations on this was certainly not easy, but the translator proved to be more than fit for the task and successfully stepped into the big shoes of an older colleague".

"The translation reads like an original Slovenian work" St. Aubyn in his novel series Patrick Melrose showed "a delight in word-making, word games and various self-translating procedures", which is a considerable problem for many translators. "Both the novels about Patrick Melrose, which were greeted by the winner, are metaphysical in nature, and the narrator and characters are constantly devoted to the words they use, talking about the words and phrases, analyzing and placing them in new games and playing with them".

But the rewards managed to preserve the wordplay and the entire meta-linguistic level of the translation without suffering the communicative layer of the text, which in the case of Patrick Melrose's piece is full of humor and self-irony. "The translator thus balances the high intellectual nature of the text, which is constantly self-aware, with its lightness, stylistic elegance. Ana Barič Moder keeps word games etc. wherever possible, and the text is radically rearranged to function in approximately the same way as in the original, while on the other hand, realizing that the effect of such means of expression in translation (almost) can never be exactly the same as in the original, she is not afraid to seize ludicrous opportunities when offered, and thus we get places that are rarely read in the translation  ⁇  but sometimes nevertheless happen  ⁇  read better than in the original".

"In the hands of a less skilled translator, the translation would certainly work on paper" The reasoning also states that translators manage to maintain natural language through a number of procedures, such as "by skillfully using occasional spoken rather than literary language, by seamlessly incorporating non-literary words into the rest of the text and not calling for attention  ⁇  when it is not, of course, deserved for any other reason  ⁇  as well as by using translation solutions that are not the simplest and most expected, but sometimes allow themselves more freedom and which place slightly more colorful, revive or concretise, thereby compensating for the inevitable loss of color in another place".

Although the works in the Romantic series are not as complex as they seem, they are modern texts that hide a lot. "Although the fourth and fifth novels of the saga of Patrick Melrose are quite uniform in style, the translator has nevertheless had to play through a number of language registers in her work, from quick-paced food-humorous dialogues and childish speech through descriptions of hallucinatory landscapes and times to legal jargon and philosophical debate, which she has in any case done successfully, smoothly and, where relevant, terminologically accurately".

Who chooses the winner? The five-member expert committee of the Slovenian Society of Literary Translators (DSKP) composed of Nina Gostiša, Marijanca Mihelić, Veronika Simoniti, Katja Zakrajšek and Jernej Županić was elected as the chairman. The award was presented by the Chairman of the DSKP Awards and Recognition Commission, Mr. Zupanić, and the Chairman of the DSKP, Mr. Tanja Petrić.

Last year, the Sovret Prize, which has been awarded since 1963, was awarded to Jernej Czępanic for his translation of Moby Dick or Kit Herman Melville, which was published at the Beltrina.

Dnevi evropske kulturne dediščine – ker je dediščina nekaj, kar ohranja in izmenjuje naše zgodbe

Slovesni začetek Dnevov evropske kulturne dediščine in Tedna kulturne dediščine na Kostanjevici nad Novo Gorico

Pozni poletni meseci so tradicionalno čas, ko se v skupinski evropski akciji povežejo različne institucije, da bi opozorile na pomen kulturne dediščine. Dnevi evropske kulturne dediščine v Sloveniji prinašajo več kot 400 dogodkov.

Prizorišče, ki letos gosti otvoritveno dogajanje Dnevov evropske kulturne dediščine (DEKD), je bil Frančiškanski samostan na Kostanjevici nad Novo Gorico. Razloga za to sta vsaj dva – ker je bil pred nedavnim razglašen za kulturni spomenik državnega pomena, pa tudi ker bo prihodnje leto odigral pomembno vlogo v programu EPK-ja.

Namen skupne akcije evropskih držav pod okriljem Sveta Evrope in Evropske komisije dolge tradicije je v javnosti spodbuditi zanimanje javnosti za varstvo kulturne in naravne dediščine, ji predstaviti bogastvo in kulturno raznolikost Evrope ter obenem spodbuditi k njenemu varovanju in obnovi.

Dediščina kulturnih poti, mreženja in povezavPri nas dogodek poteka pod okriljem Zavoda za varstvo kulturne dediščine Slovenije (ZVKDS), ki se ob tem poveže s posamezniki in organizacijami – letos so skupaj pripravili program, ki obsega več kot 400 dogodkov. Ti se bodo v naslednjih dveh tednih med (dogajanje bo trajalo do 12. oktobra) zvrstili v 150 krajih po Sloveniji, Italiji in na Madžarskem. Z njimi so se v letu 70. obletnice evropske kulturne konvencije in 75-letnice obstoja Sveta Evrope pridružili skupni evropski temi Dediščina kulturnih poti, mreženja in povezav.

V središču teme je misel, da nam lahko kulturna dediščina v snovni in nesnovni obliki veliko pove o tem, kako so bili narodi, skupnosti in države dolgo povezani in kako so še vedno povezani s skupnimi vrednotami, skupnimi praksami ter željo po ohranjanju in izmenjavi zgodb. S tem so povezane tudi snovne in nesnovne kulturne dediščine, ki sestavljajo našo individualno in kolektivno zgodovino ter identiteto.

Duh dnevov in tedna tako rekoč živi čez celo letoKot vsako leto se bodo tudi letos zvrstili razstave, predavanja, predstavitve, posveti, delavnice, prikazi dediščine in podobno. Po besedah koordinatorke dnevov na državni ravni Nataše Gorenc prireditev ni le dejavnost enega tedna, temveč zajema skorajda celoletno pripravo in aktivnosti večine organizatorjev dogodkov. "Duh dnevov in tedna tako rekoč živi čez celo leto, saj smo na ZVKDS-ju v zvezi s tem projektom osnovali kar nekaj ne le promocijskih, temveč tudi izobraževalnih aktivnosti," pravi.

Pri oblikovanju programa sodelujejo muzeji, galerije, knjižnice, arhivi, vrtci, osnovne in srednje šole ter posamezniki, ki delujejo v mladinskih klubih, turističnih organizacijah, zvezah kulturnih organizacij in nevladnih organizacijah oziroma društvih. Letos je k programu pristopilo skoraj 500 organizacij, sama prireditev pa navadno pritegne kakšnih 50.000 obiskovalcev.Izšla je tudi programska knjižica, ki po regijah predstavlja vse dogodke, ki se bodo zvrstili v tej akciji, dosegljiva pa je na spletni strani ZVKDS-ja.

Na uradni slovesnosti ob odprtju DEKD-ja sta prisotne med drugim nagovorila državni sekretar na ministrstvu za kulturo Marko Rusjan in Jernej Hudolin, generalni direktor Zavoda za varstvo kulturne dediščine Slovenije (ZVKDS). DEKD je zadnjih nekaj let združen s Tednom kulturne dediščine – koordinatorka tega je Milena Antonić. Častna pokroviteljica obeh dogodkov pa je Nataša Pirc Musar.

Kulturne poti, ki tkejo vidne in nevidne veziPo Hudolinovih besedah je posebej pomembno, da kulturne poti ''povezujejo kraje preko meja in tkejo vidne in nevidne vezi med narodi in ustvarjalci preteklih obdobij in današnjega časa.'' Novogoriški župan se je zahvalil vsem, ki so se trudili, da je Frančiškanski samostan Kostanjevica, pred kratkim postal spomenik državnega pomena, je za Radio Slovenija poročala Karin Zorn Čebokli. Kot je izpostavil župan, ta samostan ki ''skriva obilo zakladov.''

Kulturna dediščina se ne ohranja sama, je na slovesnosti poudaril Rusjan: ''Ampak k temu pripomorejo predvsem strokovni delavci, ki s svojim znanjem skrbijo, da tako samostan kot ostalo kulturno dediščino ohranjamo za prihodnje rodove, in tudi gradimo nove stvari za prihodnje rodove.''

Soprog predsednice države, ki je častna pokroviteljica dnevov evropske kulturne dediščine, Aleš Musar, je dejal, da od ZVKDS-a in odločevalcev, ki 'imajo v rokah njegovo usodo, pričakujemo, da bodo znali zavod krepiti kot moderno, neodvisno in strokovno ustanovo, ki je center zbiranja znanja na tem področju.'' V govoru se je dotaknil tudi prihajajočega EPK-ja: ''Pričakovanja imamo v Sloveniji vsi velika. Za razliko od Maribora pred 12 leti bo tokrat potrebno pokazati veliko, ne le na absolutni lestvici, ampak tudi v primerjavi s sosednjo Gorico v Italiji. Priložnosti je veliko.'' Dodal je, da bomo uspešnost Nove Gorice kot prestolnice kulture presojali po njenem prispevku v zakladnico slovenske kulturne dediščine.

Celodnevni program za odprtje DEKD-jaZa odprtje letošnjega DEKD-ja so sicer pripravili celodneven program. Dopoldne je bilo namenjeno učencem osnovnih šol, ki so obiskali kulturne ustanove, kot je SNG Nova Gorica, in se seznanili z dediščino, skupaj s preostalimi udeleženci pa so med drugim lahko spoznavali tudi poezijo Mateja Bora, poti pesnice Ljubke Šorli in pisateljice Goriške ter podobno.

Po podatkih ZVKDS-ja se v tem okviru zvrsti kakšnih 70.000 dogodkov, ki jih obišče več kot 30 milijonov obiskovalcev. Po Evropi se DEKD-ji prirejajo od avgusta do oktobra, vsi so označeni z logotipom DEKD-ja, prireditvena mesta pa z zastavo DEKD-ja. V tem času se odpirajo tudi vrata spomenikov, ki so za širšo javnost sicer zaprti.

Povezovanje različnih kulturnih prostorovV Sloveniji je DEKD že od začetka tematsko zasnovan, med cilji, ki jih ob tej akciji zasledujejo na ZVKDS-ju, pa je tudi povezovanje slovenskega kulturnega prostora onkraj države ter vključevanje etničnih skupnosti, ki živijo v Sloveniji. Teden kulturne dediščine, ki poteka sočasno, je medtem nacionalni medresorski projekt. Z njim nagovarjajo zlasti vrtce ter osnovne in srednje šole, kjer z različnimi aktivnostmi spodbujajo k večji vključenosti vsebin s področja ohranjanja kulturne in naravne dediščine v vzgojno-izobraževalne procese.
2024-09-25.title: Dnevi evropske kulturne dediščine – ker je dediščina nekaj, kar ohranja in izmenjuje naše zgodbe

European Heritage Days  ⁇  because heritage is something that preserves and exchanges our stories

The European Heritage Days and the Costa Rica Cultural Heritage Week are officially opened

The late summer months are traditionally a time when different institutions come together in a European Joint Action to draw attention to the importance of cultural heritage. The European Heritage Days in Slovenia are attended by more than 400 events.

The venue for the opening of the European Heritage Days (ECTD) this year was the Franciscan Monastery in Kostanjevic, Novgorod. The reasons for this are at least two  ⁇  as it was recently declared a Monument of Cultural Importance and as it will play an important role in the programme of the EPC next year.

The aim of the joint action of the European countries, under the auspices of the Council of Europe and the European Commission, which has a long tradition, is to stimulate public interest in the protection of cultural and natural heritage, to introduce Europe's richness and cultural diversity, and to encourage its protection and restoration.

Heritage of Cultural Paths, Networks and ConnectionsThe event is organised by the Slovenian Cultural Heritage Foundation (SVKDS), which works with individuals and organisations. These will be rolled out over the next two weeks (during until 12 October) in 150 locations across Slovenia, Italy and Hungary. They joined the common European theme Heritage of Cultural Paths, Networks and Connections in the year of the 70th anniversary of the European Cultural Convention and the 75th anniversary of the Council of Europe.

At the heart of the theme, he thought that cultural heritage in tangible and intangible forms can tell us a lot about how nations, communities and countries have long been and still are connected by common values, common practices and a desire to preserve and share stories. This is also linked to the tangible and intangible cultural heritage that make up our individual and collective history and identity.

The spirit of days and weeks is so to speak a year-round event, as every year there will be exhibitions, lectures, presentations, dedications, workshops, heritage shows and the like. According to the coordinator of the national day, Nataša Gorenc, the event is not just a week-long activity, but covers almost a year's preparation and activities of most event organisers. "The spirit of days and weeks so to speak lives throughout the year, as we have established a number of not only promotional but also educational activities in connection with this project at ZVKDS", he says.

The programme is designed with the participation of museums, galleries, libraries, archives, kindergartens, primary and secondary schools and individuals working in youth clubs, tourism organisations, associations of cultural organisations and NGOs or associations. This year, nearly 500 organizations attended the program, and the event itself usually attracts some 50,000 visitors. A programme booklet, which presents all the events that will be organised in this action by region, is also available on the ZVKDS website.

The official opening ceremony of the DEKD was attended by, inter alia, the State Secretary at the Ministry of Culture Marko Rusjan and Jernej Hudolin, Director General of the Slovenian Institute for the Protection of Cultural Heritage (ZVKDS). The DEKD has been associated with Cultural Heritage Week for the past few years. And the honorary patron of both events is Natasha Pirc Musar.

Cultural pathways that weave visible and invisible links According to Hudolin, it is particularly important that cultural pathways 'connect places across borders and weave visible and invisible links between peoples and creators of past and present times.' The Mayor of Novogorye thanked all those who worked to make the Franciscan Monastery of Kostanjevica a monument of national importance, Karin Zorn Čebokli told Radio Slovenia. As the mayor put it, this monastery 'hides a wealth of treasures.'

The cultural heritage is not preserved by itself, the Russian emphasised at the ceremony: 'But it is mainly contributed by professional workers who, with their knowledge, ensure that both the monastery and the rest of the cultural heritage are preserved for future generations, and that new things are built for future generations.'

The President's wife, the honourable patron of European Heritage Days, Aleš Musar, said that the CSCE and the decision-makers who 'have its destiny in their hands, we expect them to be able to strengthen the institute as a modern, independent and professional institution that is a centre for knowledge gathering in this field.' He also touched on the forthcoming EPC: 'We all have high expectations in Slovenia. Unlike Maribor 12 years ago, this time it will take a lot to show, not only on an absolute scale, but also in comparison to neighbouring Gorico in Italy. There are many opportunities.' He added that the success of Nova Gorica as a cultural capital will be judged on its contribution to the treasury of Slovenian cultural heritage.

The whole day programme for the opening of the Decade was prepared for the opening of this year's Decade. The afternoon was intended for primary school students who visited cultural institutions such as SNG Nova Gorica and got to know the heritage, and together with the rest of the participants they were able to get to know the poetry of Matej Bora, the paths of the poem Ljubka Šorla and the writer Goriška and the like.

According to the ZVKDS, the event will feature some 70,000 events, which will attract more than 30 million visitors. Throughout Europe, DEKDs are organised from August to October, all of them bearing the DEKD logo and the venues bearing the DEKD flag. At this time, the doors of the monuments are also opened, although they are closed to the general public.

The integration of different cultural spaces in Slovenia has been thematically designed since the beginning of the DECD, and the objectives pursued by the DECD in this action include the integration of Slovenian cultural spaces outside the country and the integration of ethnic communities living in Slovenia. The week of cultural heritage, which runs concurrently, is a national mid-year project. It is particularly used by preschools and primary and secondary schools, where they promote, through various activities, the greater inclusion of content in the field of cultural and natural heritage preservation in educational processes.
2024-09-25.english_title: European Heritage Days  ⁇  because heritage is something that preserves and exchanges our stories

Ljubljana spet polna lutk: nekatere nam kažejo svet, kot si ga želimo, druge svet, kakršen je

Čas je za 17. bienalni festival Lutke

Ljubljana gosti okrog 300 lutkovnih ustvarjalcev iz 14 držav, ki bodo v naslednjih dneh kulturni program mesta obogatili s številnimi lutkovnimi predstavami. Čas je za mednarodni bienalni festival sodobne lutkovne umetnosti Lutke, ki bo trajal do sobote.

V tem času bodo na različnih prizoriščih po mestu uprizarjali svoja dela, ki segajo od klasičnih lutkarskih oblik do sodobne uporabe tega medija.

Na festivalu pričakujejo več kot 50 festivalskih selektorjev in vodij gledališč. Gre za rekordno število selektorjev mednarodnih festivalov, umetniških vodij in direktorjev tujih gledališč, ki bo po napovedih obiskalo letošnji festival, kar po besedah Uroša Korenčana, direktorja Lutkovnega gledališča Ljubljana (LGL), ki je glavni organizator bienala, potrjuje, da so se Lutke v zadnjih nekaj letih učvrstile v mednarodnem okolju.

Letošnji program sta poleg Korenčana zasnovala še programski vodja LGL-ja Mare Bulc in dramaturg Benjamin Zajc. Izbrali so tako predstave za otroke in mlade kot za odrasle. Prve kažejo svet, kot si ga zamišljamo in želimo, bodo svet takšen, kakršen je, pravi Zajc. Predstave bodo po njegovih besedah "potovale" od zelo klasične animacije in klasičnih lutkovnih tehnik do popolne dekonstrukcije tega, kaj je lutka danes kot objekt, ki zaživi na odru in nato popelje v gledališče podob.

Festival ena redkih priložnosti, na kateri je mogoče videti vrhunske svetovne otroške predstave v Ljubljani, ki jih je na Lutkah tudi največ, pravi Bulc. Temu so dodali še predfestivalsko dogajanje, ki bo potekalo med 22. in 24. septembrom. Vanj so združili delavnice, razstavo, strokovno srečanje z namenom lutkarskega mreženja in predstave partnerskih gledališč.

LGL se namreč v zadnjih letih uspešno prijavlja na evropske razpise, kar prinaša tudi določene obveznosti, zato so tovrstne predstave združili v poseben sklop. V tem delu so v sodelovanju z dvema projektoma Ustvarjalne Evrope v Ljubljano povabili uprizoritve prijateljskih gledališč iz Italije, Španije, Češke, Japonske, Nemčije in Walesa.

Na več prizoriščih po mestuFestival, ki je poleg evropskih sredstev podprt pri Mestni občini Ljubljana in ministrstvu za kulturo, bo potekal na več prizoriščih, med drugim v Cankarjevem domu, saj matično gledališče s svojim odrom po Korenčanovih besedah ne more omogočiti večjih predstav. V letošnjem letu bosta sodelovala tudi Gledališče Glej in Stara mestna elektrarna.

Začenja se s Hišo za lutkeFestival danes odpira koprodukcijska predstava Hiša za lutke po besedilu Henrika Ibsena Nora ali Hiša lutk. Po zasnovi priznane norveške režiserke Yngvild Aspeli jo bodo izvedli v Cankarjevem domu. Med nastopajočimi je tudi Maja Kunšič, ki pravi, da skoraj solo predstava uporablja lutke človeške velikosti in veliko vizualij, ki podpirajo zgodbo in notranja stanja protagonistke.

LGL bo na festivalu med drugim sodelovalo s predstavo Šolski zvezek po romanu Agote Kristof, ki je hkrati režijski debi Mie Skrbinac. Nastala je kot magistrska predstava študija igre z lutko znotraj programa Biteatra, v katerem so določena sredstva namenjena mladim gledališkim ustvarjalcem. Letošnji dogodek bo sklenila Oslovska maša francoskega vizualnega umetnika Olivierja de Sagazana.

Ljubljana is full of dolls again: some show us the world as we want it, others the world as it is

It's time for the 17th Biennial Puppet Festival.

Ljubljana is host to around 300 puppet creators from 14 countries who will enrich the city's cultural programme with numerous puppet shows in the coming days. It's time for the International Biennial Festival of Contemporary Puppet Art, which will run until Saturday.

During this time, they will be performing their works in various venues throughout the city, ranging from classic doll shapes to the modern use of the medium.

More than 50 festival selectors and theatre directors are expected to attend the festival. The number of international festival selectors, artistic directors and directors of foreign theatres is expected to attend this year's festival, which according to Uroš Korenčan, director of the Puppet Theatre Ljubljana (LGL), which is the main organiser of the biennial, confirms that Puppies have become established in the international environment over the past few years.

This year's programme was designed by LGL's programme director Mare Bulc and playwright Benjamin Zajc. They chose plays for children and young people as well as adults. The first to show the world as we imagine and want it to be, says Rabbit. He said the shows would "go from very classic animation and classic puppetry techniques to a complete deconstruction of what a puppet is today as an object that comes alive on stage and then takes the pictures to the theater.

The festival is one of the few occasions where you can see the world's top children's shows in Ljubljana, which is also the largest in Lutkah, says Bulc. The pre-festival event will be held from September 22 to 24. It has been the setting for workshops, exhibitions, a professional meeting for puppet networking and theatrical performances of partner theatres.

LGL has been successfully applying for European tenders in recent years, which also entails certain obligations, and they have therefore combined such tenders into a special package. In this work, in collaboration with two Creative Europe projects, the theatres of friendly theatres from Italy, Spain, the Czech Republic, Japan, Germany and Wales were invited to Ljubljana.

The Festival, which is supported by the City of Ljubljana and the Ministry of Culture, in addition to European funding, will take place in several venues, including the Cankary House, as the mother theatre, with its stage, cannot, in Korenčan's words, allow for larger performances. This year, the Play Theatre and the Old Town Power Plant will also participate.

The House of Dolls Festival is opening today with the co-production of the House of Dolls by Henrik Ibsen Nora or House of Dolls. Designed by renowned Norwegian director Yngvild Aspel, it will be performed at the Cankar House. Among the performers is Maja Kunšić, who says that the almost solo performance uses human-sized dolls and lots of visuals to support the story and the inner state of the protagonist.

LGL will be participating in the festival, among other things, with the performance of the School Book based on the novel by Agatha Christie, which is also the directorial debut of Mie Skrbinac. It was conceived as a master's performance of the study of play with dolls within the programme Biteatra, which provides funds for young creators. This year's event will be hosted by the Oslo Mass of the French visual artist Olivier de Sagazana.
2024-09-25.english_title: Ljubljana is full of dolls again: some show us the world as we want it, others the world as it is

Nagrada Darka Bratine letos v roke francoskega cineasta Nicolasa Philiberta

Kinoatelje podeljuje nagrado v sklopu Poklona vizije, ki bo potekala od 8. do 13. oktobra

Nagrado Darka Bratine, ki jo Kinoatelje podeljuje v spomin na ustanovitelja, sociologa in filmskega kritika, letos prejme francoski režiser Nicolas Philibert, znan po opusu dokumentarnih filmov, med katerimi je svet nazadnje osvojil film Adamant.

Nagrado mu Kinoatelje podeljuje za filmski opus, v katerem zadnja štiri desetletja dokumentira osrednje paradigme, ki poganjajo sodobni svet: pohlep in moč ter norost in njeno drugo plat, lucidnost. Medtem ko s svojo nevsiljivo kamero bedi v psihiatričnih bolnišnicah, snema orangutane za stekli živalskih vrtov ali se pogovarja z izprijenimi direktorji vodilnih multinacionalk, Philiber kaže svet natančno takšen, kot smo mu ga zapustili trenutek pred tem. Ustanove, v katerih se znajde, odražajo ujetost sodobne družbe, razpirajo stanje stvari in razkrivajo najnežnejše in najtemnejše podrobnosti človekovega vedenja, še beremo v utemeljitvi.

"Nekateri filmski ustvarjalci začutijo svet, še preden ga pogledajo skozi oko kamere. Ga razkrivajo, namesto da bi ga zgolj prikazovali. Ga osvetljujejo, ne uprizarjajo. Ne snemajo zgolj življenja, temveč si prizadevajo, da bi preprosto oživili to, kar obstaja. In temu dali smisel. Vse našteto počne Nicolas Philibert," je o nagrajencu razmišljala Patricija Maličev, programska kuratorka festivala Poklon viziji.

Kaj prinaša festival Poklon viziji?Nagrado bodo režiserju podelili v sklopu festivala Poklon viziji, ki bo med 8. in 13. oktobrom potekal v Gorici in Novi Gorici. Ob 25-letnici nagrade Darka Bratine po besedah organizatorjev postaja več kot le poklon filmskim ustvarjalcem – odpira prostor za refleksijo o filmu kot sili, ki odpira skrite plasti resničnosti.

Letos mineva 25 let, odkar so začeli podeljevati nagrado, ob jubileju pa bodo zapuščino Darka Bratine zaznamovali tudi s posebnima projekcijama. Prikazali bodo film ET(h)NOS: Anche noi. Tudi mi v režiji Borisa Palčiča, ki daje glas istrskemu pisatelju Fulviu Tomizzi in Bratini ter raziskuje njun vpliv na čezmejni prostor. Na programu je tudi projekcija filma Kino Volta Martina Turka.

V sekciji Vizionarji bodo v duhu širitve programa, ki se odvija ob snovanju Evropske prestolnice kulture (EPK) GO! 2025, v ta prostor pripeljali še več prodornih avtorjev in avtoric. Prikazali bodo filme Mož, ki ni mogel molčati režiserja Nebojše Slijepčevića in direktorja fotografije Gregorja Božiča, Odrešitev za začetnike režiserke Sonje Prosenc in direktorja fotografije Mitje Lična ter Povojna režiserke Birgitte Staermose.

V partnerstvu s festivalom Ceau, Cinema! iz Temišvara bodo letos sekcijo Ekskurzija posvetili Romuniji. Predstavili bodo izbor romunskih kratkih filmov, v gosteh bosta režiserki Andreea Chiper in Teona Galgotiu.

Predstavniki Istrske filmske komisije iz Pulja se bodo na festivalu predstavili s kratkometražnim programom mladih avtorjev iz Istre. Kinotečni pogled bo združil dela dveh nekonvencionalnih filmskih ustvarjalcev. Sekcija pod vodstvom Žige Brdnika bo posvečena slovenskemu cineastu Jožetu Pogačniku, Milena Lazić bo kot kuratorka počastila Cecilio Mangini, prvo italijansko režiserko dokumentarnih filmov.

V sekciji Prvi poleti bodo predstavili več kot 50 kratkometražcev iz svetovne produkcije – sekcija je namenjena svežim in inovativnim kratkim filmom najrazličnejših žanrov. Mednarodna žirija bo v uradnem tekmovalnem programu izbirala najboljši kratki film, prikazali pa bodo tudi kratkometražce študentov z Akademije umetnosti z Univerze v Novi Gorici, DAMS-a z Univerze v Vidmu, Akademije za gledališče, radio, film in televizijo v Ljubljani in Akademije dramskih umetnosti iz Zagreba ter filmska dela iz nekaterih srednjih šol.

Festival, ki je del programa Evropske prestolnice kulture (EPK) GO! 2025, se bo razširil tudi v Ljubljano – projekcije bodo v Cankarjevem domu in Slovenski kinoteki, Špetru in Trstu.

2024-09-25.english_content:
This year's Darck Bratine Award goes to French filmmaker Nicolas Philibert.

Filmmakers are awarding prizes as part of the Vision Prize, which will take place from 8 to 13 October.

The Darck Bratine Prize, awarded by the CinemaAuteurs in memory of the founder, sociologist and film critic, is awarded this year to French director Nicolas Philibert, known for his documentary filmography, among which the film Adamant was the last to win the world title.

He is being honored by the Cinéaste for his film opus, which documents the central paradigms that have driven the modern world over the past four decades: greed and power and madness and its other side, lucidity. While using his non-violent camera to torture in psychiatric hospitals, film orangutans for the ranch of zoos, or talk to the top executives of leading multinationals, Philiber shows the world exactly as we left it a moment ago. The institutions in which it is found reflect the captivity of modern society, unfold the state of things, and reveal the most subtle and darkest details of human behavior, we read in the justification.

"Some filmmakers feel the world before they even look through the camera's eyes. They expose it, not just show it. They're lighting it up, not teasing it. They do not just record life, but they try to simply bring what exists to life. And they gave it meaning. All of this is done by Nicolas Philibert", thought of the winner Patricia Maličev, program curator of the Vision Gift Festival.

What does the Gift of Vision Festival bring? The award will be presented to the director as part of the Vision Gift Festival, which will take place in Gorica and Novi Gorica from 8 to 13 October. The 25th anniversary of the Darck Bratina Awards, according to the organizers, is more than a gift to filmmakers  ⁇  opens up a space for reflection on film as a force that opens up hidden layers of reality.

This year marks 25 years since the awarding of the prize, and the anniversary will also mark the legacy of Darko Bratina with special screenings. They're going to show the movie ET: I'm also directed by Boris Palčić, who voices the Istrian writers Fulvia Tomizza and Bratina and explores their influence on cross-border space. The program also features a screening of Kino Volta Martin Turk.

The Visionaries section will be in the spirit of the expansion programme taking place at the launch of the European Capital of Culture (ECC) GO! By 2025, more breakthrough authors and authors have been brought to this space. The film will feature the director Nebojša Slijepčević and the director of photography Gregor Christmas, the director Sonja Prosenc's Rescue for Beginners and the director of photography Mitja Lična and the director of war, Birgitte Staermose.

In partnership with the Ceau, Cinema! festival in Timișoara, the Excursions section will be dedicated to Romania this year. They'll be presenting a selection of Romanian short films, with guests directing Andrea Chiper and Teon Galgotti.

The representatives of the Istrian Film Commission from Pullum will present a short programme of young authors from Istria. The cinema view will bring together the work of two unconventional filmmakers. The section, led by Zig Brdnik, will be dedicated to Slovenian filmmaker Jožec Pogačnik, Milena Lazić will be curating the first Italian documentary film director Cecilio Mangini.

The First Summer section will feature more than 50 short films from around the world  ⁇  The section is dedicated to fresh and innovative short films from a wide variety of genres. The international jury will select the best short film in the official competition programme, and will also show short films by students from the Academy of Arts of the University of New Goria, DAMS of the University of Vidma, the Academy of Theatre, Radio, Film and Television of Ljubljana and the Academy of Dramatic Arts of Zagreb, as well as film work from some secondary schools.

The festival, which is part of the European Capital of Culture (ECC) programme GO! 2025, will also be expanded to Ljubljana  ⁇  projections will be held at the Cankarye House and the Slovenian Cinematheque, Spetra and Trst.

Igor Krivokapič: A, Simfonija v besedi

Ljubljana: Sanje, 2024

Roman Igorja Krivokapiča A, Simfonija v besedi je napisan v prvi osebi ednine in v pretekliku, tu in tam pa tudi v sedanjiku in celo predpretekliku.

Nekatere besede in besedne zveze so natisnjene v ležečem tisku, kar nekaj je zapisov z velikimi črkami. Pripovedovalec Izidor, za prijateljski krog Izi, razgrinja svojo življenjsko zgodbo od najstništva do študentskih let. Razkriva dogajanje v družini, razmerja med družinskimi člani, zlasti nekoliko zapleten odnos s sestro dvojčico, in ohranjanje skrivnosti o očetovstvu njenega otroka. Roman se začne z navajanjem precej grenkih modrosti in spoznanj ter trdno odločenostjo, da bo protagonist kljub vsemu ostal nepremagan in močan. Prepričan je, da življenje mora imeti smisel.

"So minevanja in prehajanja, so stalnice pa spremenljivke; so vprašanja, odgovori in večne neznanke; sta strpnost in razočaranje. Sta podlost in poštenost, je neznanje …"

Roman se nadaljuje kot Izidorjevo nadvse duhovito opisovanje pubertete, mladostniškega iskanja in razbrzdanosti. Humor ima več registrov – od šaljivosti, nagajivosti in igrivosti pa vse do cinizma in obešenjaštva.

Sčasoma pa Izidor opisovanje vsakodnevnih dogodkov prekinja z zgodbami drugih protagonistov, na primer Strica in njegove izkušnje s postreščki ali dekliške trojice, v kateri je prijateljsko udeležena tudi njegova sestra dvojčica Alenka. V pripoved vpleta svoje sanje, dvoumno pravljico, sanjarjenje, pijančevanje in drobce družbene kritike. Nepričakovano pa se mu zgodi, da se zaljubi in tedaj se osebnostno spremeni in preoblikuje v novega, zrelega človeka. Središče njegovega življenja postane Katja, ves zamaknjen občuduje njene lepe značajske lastnosti in nekoliko fantovski videz. Tudi sicer je pisatelj pri opisovanju zunanjosti kar precej nazoren, rad piše o kulinariki, dobrem vinu, igri taroka ter raznovrstnih telesnih potrebah.

Izidor je razgledan mladenič in poznavalec različnih področij, od glasbe, literature in filmov pa vse do slikarstva in filozofije. Ljubezenski par se poglobljeno pogovarja o bivanjskih temah in glasbi. Zgodi se, da se pri tem ne more ubraniti solz. Ljubezen je iskrena in brez temnih senc, tako rekoč popolna in idealna, toda pride dan, ko idilo prekine strašen dogodek. Zgodi se prelomnica, ki v celoti spremeni Izidorjevo življenje. Prvoosebni pripovedovalec tedaj postane vsevedni pripovedovalec in na široko pojasnjuje okoliščine, ki so privedle do tragičnega dogodka. Pomudi se pri orisu novih posameznic in posameznikov, prijateljev ali sorodnikov, ki so tako ali drugače vpleteni v nepričakovani dogodek.

Igor Krivokapič je domiseln, natančen in prepričljiv opisovalec dogajanja, zunanje pojavnosti in doživljanja literarnih likov. Začetna lahkotnost se čedalje bolj preveša v psihološko razčlenjevanje in poglabljanje v duševnost, presenetljivo ravnanje in nepričakovano odzivanje. Avtor se vživlja v moralne dileme in zaplete, iz katerih ni videti izhoda. Njegov protagonist je strpen in razumevajoč, hkrati pa zaradi izgube tudi nekoliko naiven, saj je prepričan, da je mogoče zlepiti in obnoviti prijateljev zakon, ki se je zaradi nezvestobe razrušil in izničil. Prizadeta ženska pravi, da se je "počutila kot pokošena, obglavljena, razžaljena, do skrajnosti ponižana, potlačena, onečaščena, zavrnjena, sebi sovražna, obupana!!!!"

Ena od posebnosti Krivokapičeve knjige je jezikovna svoboda. Avtor se je odločil za pisanje v pogovornem nedoločniku in prepustil nenavadni rabi ločil, zlasti podpičja, dvopičja in klicaja ter še drugim jezikovnim svoboščinam. Tudi v izražanju na različnih jezikovnih ravneh, med njimi knjižno pogojnih in vulgarnih, se ne omejuje. Rad uporablja starinske izraze, na primer: ako, akoprav, čin, nego, bojda, kali in podobne, hkrati pa svoj obsežni roman dopolnjuje z opombami, v katerih pojasnjuje, kaj pomenijo nekatere manj znane ali narečne besede in podatki.

Poglavitni življenjski občutji ali vrednoti v obsežnem romanu A, Simfonija v besedi sta dobrotljivost in ljubezen. Skoraj vse osebe so dobre in dobronamerne ter pripravljene druga drugi pomagati, se vživljati v različne življenjske položaje in jih reševati. Ne omejujejo pa se, kadar se predajajo čutnosti. Sčasoma se morajo ženske in moški zaradi posledic, ki jih taka svoboda prenese, odločiti, kako bodo nadaljevali življenje. Kadar si kar tako vzamejo tisto, kar si poželijo, s tem ranijo ljudi okoli sebe, celo koga od bližnjih.

Igor Krivokapič je pisatelj s silno ustvarjalno močjo. Opravil je zares veliko delo. Na 755 straneh je predstavil dobro napisano zgodbo, že kar epopejo, ter ponudil jezikovno pisanost, razvejano besedišče in vznemirljivo branje. Komisije, ki bodo odločale o podeljevanju nagrad, si bodo zaradi obsežnosti romana, ki bi ga lahko imeli tudi za avtofikcijo, morale vzeti veliko časa.

Na zadnji platnici je občudovanje avtorjevega pisanja izrazila igralka Nataša Barbara Gračner; voditeljica in napovedovalka televizijskih oddaj Nada Vodušek pa v spremni besedi piše, da roman lahko beremo kot hvalnico mladosti in pričevanje o odraščanju, hvalnico z vsem izkustvom, tako lepim kot krutim, prežeto z neizmerno ljubeznijo in razumevanjem. Razkriva tudi avtorjevo izpoved, da je bil roman zasnovan že leta 1991 kot neposreden odziv na silovit čustveni pretres, ki je pisatelja osebnostno spremenil za vse življenje.

"Zdaj, po skoraj stotih zloženih skladbah, med katerimi je tudi šest orjaških simfonij, sem se končno počutil dovolj zrelega, izvedenega, izkušenega, samozavestnega in s popolnoma razčiščenimi pojmi, da ob upoštevanju načela skladnje glasbene simfonije v celini dokončam orjaško prozno delo."

V zapisu O avtorju pisatelj Igor Krivokapič napoveduje, da bo romanu A dodal še B, ki bo že v zasnovi drugačno delo, pravzaprav trdo pripovedništvo, na koncu pa bo napisal še roman z naslovom C. V bližnji prihodnosti bo tako sklenil obsežno trilogijo na tri tisoč straneh. Z grozo namreč spoznava, kako zgodbe iz teh knjig čedalje bolj postajajo naš vsakdan.

Iz oddaje S knjižnega trga.
2024-09-25.title: Igor Krivokapič: A, Simfonija v besedi
2024-09-25.english_content:
Igor Falkhead: A, Symphony in the Word

The dream, 2024

Igor Falkhead's novel A, Symphony in the Word is written in the first person singular and in the past, here and there, in the present and even in the antecedent.

Some words and phrases are printed in a sheet of paper, which is a large-scale record. The narrator Izidor, for the friendly circle of Izis, unfolds his life story from adolescence to his student years. It reveals the family, the relationships between family members, especially the somewhat complicated relationship with the twin sister, and the secrecy about her child's paternity. The novel begins with a statement of rather bitter wisdom and knowledge and a firm determination that the protagonist will remain invincible and strong despite all. He's convinced that life must have meaning.

"There are passes and passes, and there are constants and variables; there are questions and answers and eternal unknowns; there is tolerance and disappointment. "There is meanness and honesty, ignorance"...

The novel continues as Izidor's humorous portrayal of puberty, youthful searching and agility. Humor has multiple registers  ⁇  from ridiculousness, flattery and playfulness to cynicism and hanging.

In time, however, Izidor breaks off his daily story with the stories of other protagonists, such as Uncle and his experiences with the catering or the girl trio, in which his twin sister, Alenka, also participates. The story involves his dream, a double-header, dreaming, drunkenness and a little bit of social criticism. But suddenly he falls in love, and then his personality changes and he becomes a new, mature person. The center of his life becomes Katya, all but admired by her beautiful characteristics and somewhat boyish looks. The writer is also quite pictorial in his description of the outdoors, and he likes to write about cooking, fine wine, tarot play, and various physical needs.

Izidor is a young man with a keen interest in all kinds of subjects, from music, literature and film to painting and philosophy. A couple of lovers have a deep conversation about home topics and music. It happens that there's no tear guard. Love is sincere and without dark shadows, so to speak perfect and perfect, but the day comes when the affair ends with a terrible event. A turning point is coming that will completely change Izidor's life. The first-person narrator then becomes an all-knowing narrator, explaining extensively the circumstances that led to the tragic event. Help to identify new individuals and individuals, friends or relatives, who are involved in an unexpected event in one way or another.

Igor Krivokapič is a imaginative, accurate and convincing narrator of the events, external appearances and experiences of literary characters. The initial lightness is increasingly transmuted into psychological division and deepening into mental, surprising behavior and unexpected response. The author is immersed in moral dilemmas and complexities from which there is no way out. His protagonist is patient and understanding, but also a little naive about losing, convinced that it is possible to repair and restore a friend's marriage that was broken and destroyed by infidelity. The victim says that she "felt defeated, beheaded, saddened, to the point of being humiliated, oppressed, disgraced, rejected, self-loathing, desperate!!!!"

One of the peculiarities of the Falsehood book is freedom of speech. The author chose to write in a conversational indefinite and abandoned the unusual use of clauses, especially the pen, the double, and the consonant, and other language freedoms. It is also limited to the different levels of expression, including literary terms and vulgar ones. He likes to use ancient expressions, such as if, acopre, rank, neg, boyd, kali, and the like, while also completing his extensive novel with notes explaining the meaning of some lesser-known or accurate words and data.

The main life feelings or values in the extensive novel A, Symphony in the Word are kindness and love. Almost all people are good and well-meaning and willing to help, adapt to, and save each other in different life situations. But they don't limit themselves to giving in to their feelings. In time, women and men, in view of the consequences of such freedom, will have to decide how to move on. When they take what they want, they hurt people around them, even those around them.

Igor Krivokapic is a writer with a strong creative power. He did a lot of work. In 755 pages, he presented a well-written story, an epic, and offered language writing, developed vocabulary, and exciting reading. The Commission's decision to award the prize will take a long time, given the size of the novel, which could be considered autobiographical.

On the back cover, the author's writing is admired by actress Natasha Barbara Gračner; and the host and presenter of television shows Nada Vodušek writes in the accompanying words that the novel can be read as a praise of youth and a testimony of growing up, a praise of all experience, both beautiful and cruel, overflowing with immeasurable love and understanding. It also reveals the author's statement that the novel was conceived as early as 1991 as a direct response to a violent emotional shock that changed the author's personality for life.

"Now, after nearly a hundred compositions, including six giant symphonies, I finally feel mature, accomplished, experienced, confident, and with perfectly refined concepts, to finish a giantly flexible work, following the principle of composing the symphony throughout the continent".

In his book On the Author, author Igor Krivokapič predicts that he will add another B to novel A, which will be a different work in design, in fact a hard narrative, and eventually write a novel titled C. In the near future, he will conclude a vast trilogy of 3,000 pages. It is a thrill to see how the stories in these books become more and more common in our daily lives.

From the book market show.

V Kopru razstava o protifašizmu na Primorskem med svetovnima vojnama

V Pokrajinskem muzeju v Kopru je do 9. oktobra na ogled razstava z naslovom Slovenci med prvimi protifašisti v Evropi, ki je bila prvič predstavljena januarja v Evropskem parlamentu.

Na 12 panojih je predstavljen prerez odporniškega delovanja na Primorskem v obdobju 1920–1941, od požiga Narodnega doma v Trstu do začetka druge svetovne vojne.

Pobudnik razstave je društvo TIGR Primorske. Kot je na današnjem odprtju v Kopru povedal njegov predsednik Gorazd Humar, so želeli, da je pripravljena po vseh merilih zgodovinske stroke, zato so se povezali z Narodno in študijsko knjižnico iz Trsta.

"Razstava prikazuje nastanek in razvoj prve protifašistične organizacije v Evropi, to je bil TIGR s svojo tržaško vejo z imenom Borba. Prikazano je delovanje protifašističnega odpora od leta 1920 do 1941, po vseh segmentih," je pojasnil Humar, ki je skupaj z zgodovinarjem Milanom Pahorjem avtor razstavnih besedil.

Na posameznih panojih so med drugim predstavljeni požig tržaškega Narodnega doma, Gentilejeva šolska reforma iz leta 1923, ki je izključila slovenski jezik iz šol v Italiji, prvi tržaški proces z ustrelitvijo štirih protifašistov na bazoviški gmajni, razvoj množičnega uporniškega gibanja, protifašistično delovanje na kulturnem in umetniškem področju ter drugi tržaški proces z ustrelitvijo petih upornikov na Opčinah. Predstavljeno obdobje se konča leta 1941, ko je velika večina tigrovcev odšla v partizane, je pojasnil Humar. Ob besedilih in slikah je razstavljenih tudi več predmetov.

Po besedah vodje območne enote društva TIGR Primorske za slovensko Istro Jadranke Šturm Kocjan je razstava pomembna tudi za senzibilizacijo mlajše generacije, da bo znala prepoznati elemente fašizma.

Danes odprta razstava je dobra dopolnitev razstavi o slikarju Tonetu Kralju, ki je v Pokrajinskem muzeju Koper na ogled do 15. decembra, je ob odprtju današnje razstave dejal direktor Pokrajinskega muzeja Koper Marko Bonin.

Razstava Slovenci med prvimi protifašisti v Evropi je bila že predstavljena v Bruslju, Gorici, Mariboru, Lipici in na Cerju, čez nekaj dni jo bodo odprli še v Šempetru, letos načrtujejo tudi postavitev v Muzeju vojaške zgodovine v Pivki, je še napovedal Humar.

An exhibition on anti-fascism in Primorsky during the World Wars in Copenhagen

The exhibition entitled "Slovenes among the first anti-fascists in Europe" is on view until 9 October at the Museum of the Countryside in Copenhagen.

The 12 panels show a cross-section of the resistance action in Primorsk during the period 1920 ⁇ 1941, from the burning of the National House in Trst to the beginning of World War II.

The initiative of the exhibition is the TIGR Primorsk Society. As its president Gorazd Humar said at the opening ceremony in Copenhagen today, they wanted it to be prepared according to all the criteria of historical art, so they connected with the National and Study Library of Trst.

"The exhibition shows the emergence and development of the first anti-fascist organisation in Europe, TIGR, with its market branch called the Borba. The anti-fascist resistance from 1920 to 1941 is shown in all segments", explained Humar, who, together with historian Milan Pahor, authored the exhibition texts.

The individual panels depict the burning of the National House of the market, the Gentile school reform of 1923, which excluded Slovenian from schools in Italy, the first market process with the shooting of four anti-fascists at the bazaar, the development of a mass resistance movement, anti-fascist activity in the cultural and artistic field, and the second market process with the shooting of five rebels in the municipalities. The period pictured ends in 1941, when the vast majority of tigers have gone partisan, Humar explained. Along with the words and pictures, several objects are also displayed.

According to the head of the TIGR Primorska regional unit for Istro Jadranka Šturm Kocjan, the exhibition is also important for the sensitization of the younger generation to recognize elements of fascism.

The exhibition is a good addition to the exhibition on the painter Tonet Kral, which is on view at the Koper Museum in the Province until December 15, said the director of the Koper Museum in the Province, Marko Bonin, at the opening of today's exhibition.

The exhibition of the Slovenes among the first anti-fascists in Europe has already been presented in Brussels, Gorica, Maribor, Lipica and Cerje, in a few days it will be opened in Sempet, this year they also plan to exhibit it in the Museum of Military History in Pivka, said Humar.

Nova priredba Viharnega vrha: Heathcliff in Caty bosta Jacob Elordi in Margot Robbie

Novo ekranizacijo klasičnega romana bo režirala Emerald Fennell

Margot Robbie in Jacob Elordi bosta žrtvi usodne ljubezni v yorkshirski močvari. Novo ekranizacijo Viharnega vrha, literarne klasike Emily Brontë, bo režirala oskarjevka Emerald Fennell.

Režiserka, ki je znana po prvencu Obetavna mladenka in lanski uspešnici Saltburn, je projekt napovedala na svojih profilih na družbenih omrežjih (s slavnim citatom "Bodi z menoj večno. Privzemi kakršno koli obliko. Poženi me v norost"), filmski blog Deadline pa zdaj poroča, da sta se projektu pridružila tudi dva zvezdnika.

Margot Robbie, ki je lani poleti v kinematografih kraljevala z uspešnico Barbie, je kot producentka podpisana pod oba zgoraj omenjena filma Emerald Fennell (in bo tudi pod Viharni vrh), Elordi pa je znan predvsem po vlogi v črnohumorni satiri Saltburn.

Bodo zvesti 19. stoletju ali pa zgodbo posodobili?Za zdaj še ni znano, kako bo režiserka pristopila k ljubezenskemu romanu, ki velja za enega od stebrov britanske romantične književnosti 19. stoletja, vemo pa, da bo film ne samo režirala, ampak tudi producirala in zanj napisala scenarij. Snemati bodo začeli v prihodnjem letu.

Roman je doživel že celo vrsto ekranizacij, prvič leta 1939 (z Laurenceom Olivierom) in nazadnje leta 2011, ko je silno razpoloženjsko, impresionistično različico režirala Andrea Arnold. Leta 1992 sta nesrečna ljubimca upodobila Ralph Fiennes in Juliette Binoche.

Viharni vrh (Wuthering Heights) je zgodba o Catherine Earnshaw, muhasti mladenki, ki je razpeta med strastno ljubezen do sirote Heathcliffa in obet družbenega statusa, ki bi ji ga prinesla poroka z Edgarjem Lintonom. Obe družini prebivata v negostoljubnem yorkshirskem močvirju. Heathcliff velja za enega od antologijskih romantičnih junakov evropske književnosti; od svoje ljubezni do Cathy zblazni, po smrti ljubljene pa ga preganja njen duh.

Navdih za zloglasni "prizor z grobom"?Filmski kritiki so še pred vestjo o novem Viharnem vrhu opazili, da Emerald Fennell veliko dolguje gotskemu žanru v književnosti in natančneje, sestram Brontë. V filmu Saltburn je bil denimo najbolj markanten prizor, v katerem Elordijev lik grob ljubljene osebe onečasti na način, ki spominja na Heathcliffovo blaznost.

"Preplitka" režiserka za klasičen roman?Predvsem v Veliki Britaniji so do klasike precej zaščitniški in posledično nenavdušeni nad kastingom in avtorsko ekipo novega filma. "Je kdo sploh prebral knjigo, preden je bilo to odločeno," je pripomnila filmska kritičarka za The Independent, Clarisse Loughrey. Nekateri so namreč poudarili, da je Catherine v knjigi na začetku še najstnica, Heathcliff pa je opisan kot moški "temne polti". "Bel Heathcliff in 34-letna Cathy, oba pa sta videti, kot da spadata na Instagram. Obsedena sem," je pripomnila kritičarka Gavia Baker-Whitelaw. "Emerald Fennell se je spet posrečilo [slabšalno]."

"Boleče očitno je, da Fennell ni mar za teme v Viharnem vrhu," meni Colliderjeva urednica Maggie Boccella. "Rada bi samo posnela dramo o trpečih ljubimcih z imeni, ki bodo spravila zadnje plati na kinosedeže. Kot da ta plitkost ni bila dovolj očitna v njenih prejšnjih dveh filmih."

Heathcliff and Caty will be Jacob Elordi and Margot Robbie.

A new screen adaptation of the classic novel will be directed by Emerald Fennell.

Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi will be the victims of a fateful love in the Yorkshire Swamp. The new film adaptation of The Wind's Summit, the literary classic Emily Brontë, will be directed by Oscar-winning Emerald Fennell.

The director, known for her promising younger sister and last year's hit Saltburn, announced the project on her social media profiles (with the famous quote "Be with me forever. Take any form you want. "Turn Me Crazy", and the movie blog Deadline now reports that two other stars have joined the project.

Margot Robbie, who reigned in theaters last summer with the smash hit Barbie, is signed as a producer to both of the above-mentioned Emerald Fennell films (and will also be under the title Storm Top), and Elordi is best known for her role in the black-humored satire Saltburn.

Will they be faithful to the 19th century or will they update the story? It is not yet known how the director will approach the romance novel, considered one of the pillars of 19th-century British romance literature, but we know that she will not only direct the film but also produce and write the script. They're gonna start shooting next year.

The novel has already seen a number of screenings, first in 1939 (with Laurence Olivier) and most recently in 2011, when a strongly-motivated, impressionistic version was directed by Andrea Arnold. In 1992, an unfortunate lover was adopted by Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche.

Wuthering Heights is the story of Catherine Earnshaw, a moody young woman torn between her passionate love for Heathcliff's orphan and the hope of the social status that her marriage to Edgar Linton would bring. Both families live in the unfriendly Yorkshire Swamp. Heathcliff is considered one of the anthologies of romantic heroes of European literature; he is driven mad by his love for Cathy, and after the death of his beloved, he is haunted by her spirit.

Inspired by the infamous "ghost with the grave"? Before the news of the new Storm Peak, film critics noted that Emerald Fennell owed much to the Gothic genre of literature and, more specifically, the Brontë sisters. One of the most striking scenes in Saltburn was that Elordi's character, the grave of a loved one, was defiled in a way that resembled Heathcliff's madness.

A "Trip" director for a classic novel? In Britain, in particular, they are quite conservative towards the classics and consequently unenthusiastic about the cast and crew of the new film. "Did anyone even read a book before it was decided", noted The Independent film critic Clarisse Loughrey. Some have pointed out that Catherine is a teenager at the beginning of the book, and Heathcliff is described as a "dark-skinned" man. "White Heathcliff and 34-year-old Cathy, and they both look like they're falling for Instagram. I'm obsessed", said critic Gavia Baker-Whitelaw. "Emerald Fennell has been lucky again [badly]".

"It is painful to see that Fennell is not interested in the dark at Storm's Peak", says Maggie Boccella, editor of Collider. "I'd just like to make a drama about suffering lovers with names that will make the final paycheck on the big screen. It was as if that shallowness was not evident enough in her previous two films".

2024-09-24.content:
Arsova lastovka končala v naročju Aleša Bergerja

Žirijo je prepričala zgodba o partiji pokra Trije asi

Zmagovalno delo letošnjega Arsovega natečaja za najboljšo kratko zgodbo je Trije asi, pripoved o noči pokra in treh kvartopircih, ki polagajo vse višje stave. Njen avtor je Aleš Berger, tudi sicer uveljavljen pisatelj in cenjen prevajalec.

Žirija 33. anonimnega natečaja za kratko zgodbo 3. programa Radia Slovenija – programa Ars, ki so jo sestavljali Vlado Motnikar, Breda Biščak in Nada Grošelj, je v utemeljitvi zapisala, da v besedilu Trije asi "en sam prizor /…/ natančno slika dogajalni čas, prostor in osebe, drobni detajli v ozadju pa odsevajo našo polpreteklost in morda celo družbeno sedanjost. /…/ Suveren pripovedovalski glas pa prefinjeno slika posamezne značaje, spremlja dinamiko odnosov in spretno stopnjuje opazovalčevo pozornost."

Aleš Berger je uveljavljen pisatelj in prevajalec iz francoščine in španščine, nekdaj radijec, urednik in gledališki kritik, avtor številnih knjig poezije in proze, esejev, študij, tudi drame. Razmerje med prevajanjem in avtorskim pisanjem je Berger pred leti v oddaji Naši umetniki pred mikrofonom opisal takole: "Nekateri pravijo, da je vsak prevajalec na neki način nerealiziran ali nezadoščen pisatelj. Mogoče je v mojem primeru to res, vendar v nekem trenutku se mi je zdelo, da bi lahko ob prevajanju poskusil še kaj povedati po svoje – da ne bi le gledal v knjigo, kaj so zapisali drugi. To seveda potegne veliko za seboj: kaj povedati, kako po svoje povedati, koliko se razkriti in kaj s tem doseči … Povsem drugačni so izzivi, čeprav tako prevajalec kot pisatelj delata z besedami. Mnogo primerov je v naši literarni zgodovini, ko sta bila ta dva avtorja združena na bolj ali manj produktiven način."

Prešernov nagrajenec na anonimnem literarnem natečajuBergerjeve produktivnost in odlike potrjujejo nagrade. Prejel je najpomembnejšo Prešernovo nagrado za življenjski opus, sledijo pa še nagrade Prešernovega sklada, Sovretova, Rožančeva in Schwentnerjeva nagrada. Berger je v devetdesetih že dvakrat prepričal tudi žirijo Arsovega natečaja, in sicer leta 1999 in leto pred tem, ko si je prvo nagrado delil. Zdaj gre torej za njegovo tretjo zmago na natečaju 3. programa Radia Slovenija.

Žirija izbirala med skoraj tisoč zgodbamiNa 33. natečaj za najboljšo kratko zgodbo, ki ga vsako leto razpiše uredništvo za kulturo programa Ars, je letos prispelo 980 zgodb. "Pri skoraj tisoč kratkih zgodbah je težko govoriti o skupnih značilnostih, pa vendar so po količini izstopale osebne zgodbe, predelave zagatnih usod, na primer težkega otroštva, pa predelave odnosov, razrešenih ali nerazrešenih spominov ipd. Veliko je bilo odzivov na naše politične razmere, na naraščajoče napetosti v svetu, na podnebne spremembe. Vse se najde med temi skoraj tisoč zgodbami, iskali pa smo literarno vrednost, ne tematske," prispele zgodbe komentira predsednik žirije Vlado Motnikar. Ob njem sta bili v žiriji še Breda Biščak in Nada Grošelj. Z literarno vrednostjo so jih prepričale štiri zgodbe, tri so uvrstili v ožji izbor, eno pa izbrali za Arsovo lastovko.

Tri zgodbe iz ožjega izbora so napisali Samo Roš, Tomaž Kalin in Jure Japelj. Kot uverturo v slavnostno prireditev, podelitev glavne nagrade in razkritje avtorja smo lahko njihove zgodbe slišali od sobote do ponedeljka v radijski oddaji Literarni nokturno ob 23.00 na programu Ars in ob 23.05 na Prvem programu Radia Slovenija.

21. 9. – Silhueta, avtor Samo Roš22. 9. – Jutro v Alepu, avtor Tomaž Kalin23. 9. – Izklesana osamljenost, avtor Jure Japelj

Že nekaj časa je znan tudi naslov zmagovalne zgodbe Trije asi in znano je, s čim je avtor prepričal žirijo. V utemeljitvi je med drugim zapisala takole: "Avtorjevi subtilni namigi občasno celo nakažejo odgovore na vprašanja, ki se nam morajo porajati ob branju ali poslušanju zgodbe in se razrešijo v sklepu, vendar lahko te namige sproti prepozna le izkušeno oko oziroma uho."

Večerna podelitev nagrade, ki jo je povezovala Mateja Perpar, je potekala ob improvizacijah saksofonista Lenarta Krečiča in glasbeni zasnovi glasbene oblikovalke Darje Hlavke Godina. Na slavnostnem dogodku je zmagovalno zgodbo interpretiral dramski igralec Branko Jordan, dogodek je režiral Klemen Markovčič, s prejemnikom lastovke pa se je pogovarjal Matej Juh.

Na natečaj prispelo 600 zgodb več kot laniLani je na razpis prispelo precej manj zgodb, skupno 345, nagrado lastovka pa je za zgodbo Jablana prejela Tatjana Plevnik. Jablana je besedilo z družinsko motiviko, pripoveduje pa o zlorabi otroka v toksičnem okolju.

Če ste zamudili dogodek v dvorani Alme Karlin ali neposredni avdio- ali videoprenos, sta posnetka na voljo na spletni strani Programa Ars in v arhivu RTV 365.

2024-09-24.english_content:
Ars's estate ended up in the arms of Alec Berger.

The jury was convinced by the story of the Three Axis poker game.

The winning work of this year's Ars Contest for the Best Short Story is Three Axes, a tale of a night of poker and three quarterbacks who place ever higher bets. It is written by Aleš Berger, a well-known writer and a respected translator.

The jury of the 33rd anonymous short story competition of the 3rd programme of the Radio Slovenia  ⁇  Ars programme, composed by Vlado Motnikar, Breda Biščak and Nada Groselj, wrote in the reasoning that in the text of the Trije asi "one scene /.../ accurately depicts the time, place and person taking place, while the minute details in the background reflect our semi-past and perhaps even our social present. /.../ A sovereign narrative voice, however, provides a refined picture of each character, tracking the dynamics of relationships, and skillfully stimulating the observer's attention".

Aleš Berger is a well-known writer and translator from French and Spanish, formerly a radio personality, editor and theatre critic, author of numerous books of poetry and prose, essays, studies, even plays. Berger described the relationship between translation and author writing years ago on Our Artists on the Mic: "Some say that every translator is somehow an unrealized or unsatisfied writer. Maybe in my case, this is true, but at some point, it seemed to me that I could try to say something else in my own way when translating, rather than just looking at the book and what others have written. Of course, this involves a lot: what to say, how to say it, how much to reveal and what to achieve. The challenges are quite different, although both the translator and the writer deal with the words. There are many instances in our literary history when these two authors have been combined in a more or less productive way".

Prešern's winner of the anonymous literary competitionBerger's productivity and excellence confirm the awards. He received the most important Prešern Prize for a lifetime's work, followed by the Prešern Prize, the Sovretov, the Rožanče and the Schwentner Prize. Berger also convinced the jury of the Ars race twice in the 1990s, in 1999 and the year before he shared his first prize. So now it's his third win on Radio Slovenia's third competition.

The jury selected from nearly a thousand stories. The 33rd annual Best Short Story competition, organised by the Ars programme's Culture Editor, received 980 stories this year. "Although it is difficult to talk about the common features of nearly a thousand short stories, there have been many who have excelled in personal stories, reworkings of difficult childhood fates, reworkings of relationships, resolved or unresolved memories, etc. There's been a lot of reaction to our political situation, to the growing tensions in the world, to climate change. All of these stories are found among the nearly a thousand, but we were looking for literary value, not thematic", commented the story's president Vlado Motnikar. He was joined by Brad the Wrinkle and Hope the Frog. They were convinced of their literary value by four stories, three of which were selected for the narrowest selection, and one of which was chosen for Ars's estate.

Three narrowly selected stories were written by Samo Roš, Tomasz Kalin and Jura Japelj. As an overture to the ceremony, the awarding of the main prize and the disclosure of the author, we were able to hear their stories from Saturday to Monday in the literary radio show Literarna nocturna at 11 p.m. on the Ars programme and at 11 p.m. on the First programme of Radio Slovenia.

21 9 Silhouette, by Samos Rosh 22 9 A Morning in Aleppo, by Tomáš Kalin 23 9

The title of the Triple A victory story has been known for some time and it is known how the author persuaded the jury. In her reasoning, she wrote: "The subtle hints of the author sometimes even indicate answers to questions that must be asked when reading or listening to a story and resolved in a conclusion, but these hints can only be recognized by the experienced eye or ear".

The evening award ceremony, hosted by Mateja Perpar, was held with improvisations by saxophonist Lenart Krečić and musical designs by music designer Darja Hlavka Godina. The event was interpreted by the winning story actor Branko Jordan, the event was directed by Klemen Markovčić, and the property's recipient was interviewed by Matej Juh.

More than 600 stories entered the contest than last year, with a total of 345 coming in, and Tatjana Plevnik won the property prize for Jablan's story. The apples are family-motivated, and they tell the story of child abuse in a toxic environment.

If you missed an event in Alma Karlin's auditorium or a live audio or video transmission, the footage can be found on the Ars Programme website and in the RTV 365 archive.

Umrl je Fredric Jameson, marksistični literarni teoretik in mislec postmoderne

Umrl je ameriški teoretik Fredric Jameson. Eden največjih marksističnih mislecev je s svojim delom v zadnjih 50 letih veliko prispeval k sodobnemu razumevanju kulture, politike in estetike; ključna je bila njegova analiza postmoderne. Star je bil 90 let.

Romani so sredstvo, s katerim se lahko lotimo nemogočega podviga zgodovinjenja sedanjega trenutka.

Leta 1934 v Clevelandu rojeni Jameson je po diplomi na kolidžu Haverford študiral še v Aix-en-Provence, Münchnu in Berlinu. Leta 1959 je doktoriral na univerzi Yale pri nemškem literarnem zgodovinarju Erichu Auerbachu.

Od leta 1985 je bil profesor na univerzi Duke v Severni Karolini, predtem je poučeval na Harvardu, Yalu in U. C. Santa Cruz. Slovel je kot karizmatičen predavatelj, nikoli pa si ni prizadeval postati javni intelektualec. "Čeprav ni bil javnosti nikoli znan tako kot njegova literarnoteoretska sopotnika, Slavoj Žižek in Harold Bloom, je bilo njegovo delo enako vplivno kot njuno, če ne bolj," so v nekrolog ob Jamesonovi smrti zapisali v New York Timesu.

Umetniško delo ne nastane v vakuumuNa začetku svoje akademske kariere se je profiliral predvsem kot literarni kritik, pozneje, z začetkom 80. let preteklega stoletja, pa je svoja razmišljanja vse intenzivneje usmerjal tudi k sodobni družbi. Oblikoval je tezo o nujnosti obravnave kulturnih in estetskih del v povezavi z zgodovinskimi okoliščinami, v katerih so ta nastala. Naloga kritika na področju umetnosti tako postane razkrivanje ukoreninjenosti posameznega umetniškega dela v politične in ekonomske danosti ter odkrivanje, zakaj je bila ta ukoreninjenost prikrita.

V mnogih pogledih je bil Jameson tako tradicionalist kot radikalec. Njegova proza je gosta in zahtevna, polna referenc. Kot literarni kritik se je posvečal predvsem evropski književnosti 19. in 20. stoletja – Flaubertu, Mallarmeju, Joyceu, Mannu. Njegove obravnave Balzaca in Philipa K. Dicka, Sartra in kibernetskega panka, Prousta in poparta so polne navdušenja in skepse ter strastnega angažmaja. Z enako intelektualno rigoroznostjo je pristopal k najrazličnejšim temam, od nemške opere do znanstvenofantastičnih filmov in arhitekture luksuznih hotelov. 

Leta 1984 je izšel njegov pionirski esej z naslovom Postmodernizem, kulturna logika poznega kapitalizma. Sprva je bil objavljen kot samostojni članek v reviji New Left Review, pozneje, leta 1991, pa je Jameson pod tem naslovom zbral več esejev in jih izdal v knjigi. Delo je leta 2001 izšlo tudi v slovenskem prevodu pri Društvu za teoretsko psihoanalizo.

Obiskal tudi LjubljanoV slovenskem prevodu sta dostopni še njegovi deli Kulturni obrat: izbrani spisi o postmoderni, 1983–1998, ki je leta 2012 izšlo pri Studii Humanitatis, in Filmska kartiranja, ki je leta 2011 izšlo pri Slovenski kinoteki. Ob predstavitvi knjige je Jameson na povabilo Slovenske kinoteke gostoval v Ljubljani.

2024-09-24.english_content:
Fredric Jameson, a Marxist literary theorist and postmodern thinker, died.

The American theorist Fredric Jameson has died. One of the greatest Marxist thinkers, he contributed much to the modern understanding of culture, politics and aesthetics with his work over the last 50 years; his analysis of postmodernism was key. He was 90 years old.

Novels are a means of dealing with the impossible challenge of present-day history.

Born in 1934 in Cleveland, Jameson graduated from Haverford College and went on to study in Aix-en-Provence, Munich, and Berlin. In 1959, he received his doctorate from Yale University from the German literary historian Erich Auerbach.

He has been a professor at Duke University in North Carolina since 1985, and has previously taught at Harvard, Yale, and UC Santa Cruz. He was a charismatic lecturer, but he never sought to become a public intellectual. "Although he was never as well known to the public as his literary counterparts, The Glorious Blowjob and Harold Bloom, his work was as influential as theirs, if not more so", wrote Jameson's obituary in the New York Times at the time of his death.

He began his academic career as a literary critic, but later, at the beginning of the 1980s, he also focused his thinking more and more on contemporary society. He developed a thesis on the need to treat cultural and aesthetic works in relation to the historical circumstances in which they arose. The task of art criticism thus becomes to reveal the rootedness of a particular work of art in a political and economic context and to discover why this rootedness has been hidden.

In many ways, Jameson was both a traditionalist and a radical. His prose is a guest and demanding, full of references. As a literary critic, he devoted himself primarily to 19th and 20th century European literature  ⁇  Flaubert, Mallarmé, Joyce, Manna. His treatment of Balzac and Philip K. Dick, Sartre and the cyber-banking, Proust and his supporters are full of enthusiasm and skepticism and passionate engagement. With equal intellectual rigor, he approached a wide variety of subjects, from German opera to science fiction films and the architecture of luxury hotels.

In 1984, his pioneering essay entitled Postmodernism, the Cultural Logic of Late Capitalism, was published. It was first published as a standalone article in the New Left Review, and later, in 1991, Jameson collected several essays under this title and published them in a book. The work was also published in a Slovenian translation in 2001 by the Society for Theoretical Psychoanalysis.

He also visited Ljubljana. His works, The Cultural Center, are also available in Slovenian translation: selected postmodernist works, 1983 ⁇ 1998, published in 2012 by the Estudi Humanitatis, and Film mapping, published in 2011 by the Slovenian Cinémo. At the presentation of the book, Jameson was a guest at the invitation of the Slovenian cinema in Ljubljana.
