Izštekani prinašajo novo poslastico: nastop štirih velikanov slovenske popularne glasbe

“Muziki smo dali možnost, da se nekaj zgodi. Da nas nekam pripelje"

Severa Gjurin, Dejan Lapanja, Vasko Atanasovski in Rudi Bučar združujejo moči v Koncertu Štirih, ki bo radijsko premiero na Valu 202 doživel 23. septembra ob 20. uri. Nastop na Izštekanih bo stkan iz repertoarja vseh in izveden na zelo poseben način.

Zgodilo se je pred dobrim letom in pol. Po prireditvi v portoroškem Avditoriju so se v zaodrju znašli pevka in avtorica Severa Gjurin, multiinstrumentalist, glasbeni producent in kantavtor Dejan Lapanja, pihalec in skladatelj Vasko Atanasovski ter vsestranski Rudi Bučar. Koncert Štirih so do zdaj na odru odigrali le dvakrat. Čast tretjega nastopa in medijske premiere je pripadla Izštekanim na Valu 202 – tega bo mogoče spremljati 23. septembra ob 20. uri na radiu, pa tudi prek spletnega videoprenosa.

“Severa si je izposodila mojo kitaro. Ko sem se čez čas vrnil, je še vedno igrala. Počasi smo se nakapljali in začelo se je dogajati," se spominja Bučar. Čeprav je Lapanjo najprej premamila zakuska, tam ni poznal nikogar, zato se je po njegovih besedah hitro pobral nazaj v garderobo. "Tam sem našel te ljudi, ki so veselo rajali in prepevali. Sprva mi ni bilo nič jasno. No, bili so moji ljudje in pridružil sem se," je povedal Dejan.

“Mislim, da sem Rudijevo pesem Ti igrala kakšnih dvajset minut. Potem je Vasko potegnil saksofon in vzniknilo je vprašanje, katero gremo pa zdaj? Začeli smo izbirati pesmi drug drugega, kot bi se v trenutku stkale nekakšne avtorske vezi," je dogajanje, ki se je končalo nekaj ur pozneje, povzela Severa. 

"Zvok je bogat in hkrati jasen"

“Ni mi dalo miru ... kaj pa, če bi res," so bile misli Rudija, ki je naredil naslednji korak in dal pobudo – vsi so bili za, šli so na kosilo in se dogovorili. Tako je nastal Koncert Štirih. V njem so združene pesmi iz repertoarja vseh, odigrane z dvema, včasih tremi kitarami, saksofonom ali flavto, odpete z večglasji in predvsem izvedene z neverjetnim občutkom.

“Ni ostalo pri 'jam sessionu', veliko smo vadili, da smo pesmim dali dovršeno obliko,” so povedali in dodali, da je ta oblika precej drugačna od tiste, ki so je vajeni. “Zasedba je precej edinstvena in naše skladbe pridejo ven na nov način. Zvok je bogat in hkrati jasen," je opisal Vasko in dodal, da se verjetno nihče ne bi spomnil, da lahko to naredijo, če se ne bi zgodilo spontano.

“Muziki smo dali možnost, da se nekaj zgodi. Da nas nekam pripelje,” je dodal Rudi. Severa je še pristavila: "Če ne pristopiš svobodno, nikamor zares ne prideš. Zanimivo je, da tudi svoje skladbe v tej postavitvi dojemam čisto drugače." Po njenem mnenju so vaje lahkotne, igrive, prevevata jih tankočutnost in nekakšna avtohtonost. "To smo mi," je sklenila.
2024-09-21.title: Izštekani prinašajo novo poslastico: nastop štirih velikanov slovenske popularne glasbe
2024-09-21.english_content:
The exquisite new delicacy: performance by four giants of Slovenian popular music

We gave music a chance to make something happen. To lead us somewhere"

North Gjurin, Dejan Lapanja, Vasko Atanasovski and Rudi Bučar are joining forces in the Four Concert, which will be broadcast on the 202nd Street Radio on 23 September at 20h. The performance at the Outcasts will be taken from everyone's repertoire and performed in a very special way.

It was a good year and a half ago. After the event in the Auditorio in Puerto Rico, the singer and songwriter Sever Gjurin, multi-instrumentalist, music producer and singer Dejan Lapanja, pianist and composer Vasko Atanasovski and versatile Rudi Bučar were in the background. The Four have only played twice on stage so far. The third performance and media premiere was held at the Iztečenim on the Valu 202  ⁇ . It will be broadcast on 23 September at 8pm on radio and via online video.

She borrowed my guitar from the North. When I came back, she was still playing. We slowly crammed in and it started happening", recalls Bučar. Although Lapanjo first passed the test, he knew no one there, so he quickly went back to the dressing room, he said. "I found these people there, cheerfully shouting and singing. I didn't understand at first. Well, they were my people and I joined in", Dejan said.

I think I played Rudy's song "You" for about 20 minutes. Then Vasko pulled the saxophone and the question arose, which way do we go now? We started to pick each other's songs as if we were instantly creating a creative bond", the event concluded a few hours later, North recalled.

"The sound is rich and clear at the same time"

"It didn't give me peace... but what if it did", was Rudi's thought, who took the next step and took the initiative. That's how the Fourth of July was born. It combines songs from everyone's repertoire, played with two, sometimes three guitars, saxophone, or flute, with multiple vocals and, above all, with an incredible feeling.

"We didn't have much time left in the jam session, we practiced a lot to give the songs a complete form", they said, adding that this form was quite different from the ones they were used to. The band is quite unique and our songs come out in a new way. The sound is rich and clear at the same time", Vasko described, adding that probably no one would have thought they could do it if it hadn't happened spontaneously.

We gave music a chance to make something happen. To get us somewhere, he added to Rudi. The North also said: "If you don't walk freely, you're not really going anywhere. Interestingly, I feel completely differently about my own music in this setting". She thinks the exercises are light, playful, carried on by a certain sensitivity and some indigenousness. "That's us", she concluded.
2024-09-21.english_title: The exquisite new delicacy: performance by four giants of Slovenian popular music

2024-09-21.author: Ž. E. Č.
2024-09-21.content:
Prva operacija nosorogove zlomljene noge je bila pravi uspeh

Štiri tedne je morala nositi mavec, po tednih okrevanja se je znova pridružila čredi

V Angliji si je mlada nosoroginja zlomila nogo. Da bi ji pomagali, so jo operirali, ekipa 10 veterinarjev pa je prvič na svetu izvedla tovrsten poseg. Pri prelomni operaciji so uporabili znanje o operacijah na konjih. Amara je lepo okrevala.

Samica belega nosoroga Amara, ki se je skotila leta 2022 in prebiva v britanskem safariparku Knowsley v Merseysidu, je na začetku tega leta začela šepati na desno sprednjo nogo. Rentgenski posnetki pa so potrdili, da ima zlomljeno kost, natančneje podlahtnico. Da bi nosoroginji pomagali, so jo operirali, veterinarji pa so prvič na svetu izvedli tovrsten poseg.

Ker je bilo o nosorogih, ki so bili poškodovani na ta način, zelo malo informacij, so si kirurgi pri obravnavi Amare pomagali z znanjem o operacijah na konjih. Ekipa 10 veterinarjev je peturni poseg s pomočjo podpornega osebja opravila na njenem domu. Tam so, medtem ko je bila Amara pod anestezijo, opravili prelomno operacijo, ki je vključevala tudi njeno "zapestje".

"Vedeli smo, da lahko postavimo kamero v njen sklep, a ker ta postopek še ni bil izveden, nismo vedeli, koliko prostora bomo imeli za operacijo in koliko prizadetega območja bomo lahko videli," je pojasnil višji predavatelj kirurgije konj na Univerzi v Liverpoolu David Stack in poudaril, da Amarina operacija "ni bila podobna ničemur, kar so doživeli do zdaj".

Po medicinskem izzivu so nosoroginji za podporo noge celotno okončino dali v mavec, da pa bi zmanjšali njeno gibanje, je morala ostati v ogradi. Oskrbniki živali v safariju Knowsley so ji zagotovili udoben prostor – tla so prekrili z gumijastimi podlogami in slamo, poskrbeli so za veliko blata, obenem pa tudi za to, da je bila lahko prisotna njena mama Meru, poroča BBC.

"Njeno okrevanje se nadaljuje in ga podrobno spremljamo"

"Nismo bili prepričani, ali bo mavec dovolj močen in kako se bo Amara spopadla s takšno omejitvijo svojega uda," je dejal Stack in dodal, da so, glede na to, da so zabredli v neznane vode, le upali, da bo situacijo bolnica dobro sprejela in se bo ne glede na vse lahko premikala naokoli, predvsem pa se dvignila iz ležečega položaja.

Sčasoma se je Amara, ki so ji mavec odstranili maja, na veselje vseh spet postavila na noge, se odpravila ven iz majhne ograde in znova uživa v življenju na prostem. "Amara se je 27 tednov po zlomu noge končno lahko pridružila svoji čredi. Njeno okrevanje se nadaljuje in ga podrobno spremljamo," je dejala Lindsay Banks iz safariparka.

Da bi pomagala pri nadaljnjem celjenju, je kirurška ekipa v njen prizadeti sklep vbrizgala tudi s trombociti bogato plazmo, raztopino, pridobljeno iz njene krvi. "Zdravljenje Amare je bilo resnično prelomno veterinarsko potovanje, ki je vključevalo številne stvari, ki smo jih izvedli prvič," je še povedal Stack in dodal, da bodo postopke zdaj dokumentirali. To bo pomagalo, če se bo kdo v prihodnosti srečal s podobnim scenarijem. "Čeprav močno upamo, da zapiski ne bodo nikoli potrebni," je še pristavil.

2024-09-21.english_content:
The first operation on the rhinos' broken leg was a real success.

For four weeks, she wore a waistband, and after weeks of recovery, she rejoined the flock.

In England, a young rhino broke her leg. To help her, they operated on her, and a team of 10 veterinarians performed the first such operation in the world. They used knowledge of horse operations in the groundbreaking operation. Amara's recovering well.

The female white rhino Amara, who flew in 2022 and lives in the British safari park Knowsley in Merseyside, began whispering to her right front leg earlier this year. But X-rays confirmed that he has a broken bone, more specifically a pelvic floor. To help the rhinoceros, they operated on it, and veterinarians performed the first such procedure in the world.

Since there was little information about the rhinos that were injured in this way, surgeons helped Amara with their knowledge of horse surgery. A team of 10 veterinarians performed a five-hour intervention with the help of support staff at her home. While Amara was under anesthesia, they performed a groundbreaking operation that included her "recovery".

"We knew we could put a camera in her locker, but since this procedure had not yet been performed, we did not know how much room we would have for the operation and how many affected areas we would be able to see", explained David Stack, a senior lecturer in horse surgery at the University of Liverpool, noting that Amara's operation "was nothing like anything they had ever experienced".

After a medical challenge, the rhinos were given the entire limb to support their legs, but to reduce their movement, they had to stay in the fence. Animal suppliers at Knowsley Safari provided her with a comfortable place  ⁇  covered the floor with rubber floors and straw, provided plenty of mud, and also made sure that her mother, Meru, could be present, reports the BBC.

"Her recovery is continuing and is being closely monitored"

"We were not sure if the wafer would be strong enough and how Amara would cope with such a limitation of her waistline", Stack said, adding that, having been stuck in unknown waters, they only hoped that the patient would take the situation well and be able to move around no matter what, but above all, to rise from a lying position.

In time, Amara, who had her ointment removed in May, was able to restore herself to her feet, to the delight of all, and to get out of the small fence and enjoy life outdoors again. "Amar has finally been able to join her flock after 27 weeks of breaking her leg. Her recovery is continuing and we're monitoring her in detail", said Lindsay Banks of the safari park.

To help her heal further, the surgical team injected a plasma solution derived from her blood into her affected joint. "The treatment of Amara was a truly groundbreaking veterinary journey that involved many things we did for the first time", Stack said, adding that procedures would now be documented. It will help if anyone in the future encounters a similar scenario. "Although we strongly hope that the records will never be needed", he added.
